review_title: Been to ALL NYC's steakhouses and Club A is still the best
review: Food is fantastic, staff is great, owner Bruno with family is very, very friendly. Must have been here 20 times over the years and their food is still the best. Had Restaurant Week yesterday ($60): sallad, Filet Mignon with potato puree and Tiramisu. All top notch as usual and their homemade steaksauce is fantastic Have been to pretty much all steakhouses in NYC: Keens, Benjamin, Club A, Delmonicos, Del Frisco, Sparks, BLT Steak/Prime, Quality Meats, Strip House, Wolfgang, Smith & Wollensky, Capital Grille, Frankie And Johnnie and a few more I don't remember and Club A is still Number 1

Steak was absolutely delicious here and great portion size too. Staff were really friendly as soon as we walked in and showed us to our table even though we were half an hour early for our reservation.  We also had our picture taken and a signed card from the owner to take home as a memento along with a generous complimentary dessert too.  Loved the food, wine and atmosphere here and very deserving of the no.1 NY spot on tripadvisor!

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: The food and service was remarkable. Every bite was memorable. Highly recommended. Can’t wait to return sometime in the near future.

review_title: What a great place for great food.
review: What can I say about our dinner experience. My wife and I were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary and I wanted it to be special. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a very friendly and professional staff. Our table was very convenient and were served by extremely nice wait staff. The wine was terrific, the food (salmon for my wife and a steak for myself) was exceptional, and the timing couldn’t have been better. In celebration of our anniversary, the waiter brought out a plate of complimentary dessert with “Happy Anniversary” written on the perimeter. Everything was delicious and we were fortunate enough to meet the owner’s son who was very nice welcoming us to the restaurant and congratulating us on our anniversary. I conveyed our pleasure with our visit and hope to visit again. He even assisted us in hailing a cab for our trip downtown in time for our theater stay. Definitely a great place for dinner.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: We have had dinner tonight at this amazing steak house, and I cannot wait to wright a review.  At fisrt, the place sends a message of being vibrant and cosy, with musiciens playing soft jazz and blues. As our experience started, service was precise and extremely attentive; the waiter was caring without excess but in a very simple and polite manner. Nothing different to expect from a restaurant one could say, however, experiences in NYC have not always showed the same. The quality of our dinner has been outstanding: we shared a starter - a crab cake- was extremely fresh and generous. The entree - a porterhouse for two- was perfectly served, at the right temperature, which is not easy when requesting beef to be bleu! Throughout our dinner, the presence and the eye of the owner - Mr Bruno Selimaj - never stopped being there, himself taking personal care of all guests well-being.  This is our seventh trip to NYC, without having being able to travel here in the past two years because of COVID, but Club A is an address we will keep in our minds for our next visit: a restaurant you must experience!

review_title: Amazing piece of meat and service!
review: The best steak I have ever eaten, period! The filet is 10 oz and was so tender and flavorful that I was in steak heaven. The Club A is a dining experience that you have to try if you are in the mood for a steak. The staff will treat you like family and Bruno the owner will come by your table to chat and check to make sure everything is to your liking. This is the second time I have eaten there and both times did not disappoint. I highly recommend this steak house as you will truly have a magical experience.
Amazing family owned place where they make you feel special! Been here 2 years ago and had to come back! Great steak, great service, lovely atmosphere. 5/5

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This was chosen by my son as part of a treat for my wife and I 60th birthday. There was an excellent choice of steaks, mine was a Petite Fillet which was done to perfection and my son had a Bone in Ribeye which looked enormous. Creamed Spinach and Mac and Cheese were also ordered by our party which were also excellent. Also a good selection of wine and beers which were all served by polite and attentive staff.

The pasta options were all delicious. We tried the Wild Boar, Eggplant and a Seafood pasta and all were very good. The Chicken Milanese with fingerling potatoes was also very good capped off with one tiramisu. All in all a good family Italian night and reasonably priced for NYC.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: One of our favorite places in New York. Always delicious. Always busy. Always friendly. this night was great as usual. The Gamberi Caprese - very interesting. Bucatini Cachio Pepe - sublime. Spaghetti Neri Lobster - a feast for the palate and the eyes. The Verdure Grigliate and Patae Limone rounded out the fare. looking forward to out next adventure at Piccola Cucina.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: The best Pasta alla Norma I have ever had in my life! I'm from Sicily, living in NY now, I'm very picky with food... and I'm in love with Piccola Cucina Estiatorio. Emanuele and all the team are great, very professional and always with a warm smile that makes you feel at home. Sicilian wine list with some gems (drink local, always) the food is amazing, fresh, tasty, perfectly cooked and also the Tiramisù and Cannoli alla ricotta as a dessert are perfect to complete your "Italian escape" in NYC. Can't wait to go back! ps: Team, the phrase on the wall "cucinare è un atto d'amore" is not from Carlo Cracco but its from "Enzo Bianchi" from the beautiful book "il pane di ieri". Ciao!

review_title: Great fresh Italian food and service; small
review: We ate here on a Thursday night at opening (5:30). Nice and quiet for the first half hour until the restaurant got more crowded. Host did a great job spacing customers apart as much as possible until it got busier. Service was fantastic and very attentive without hovering. Each course was served promptly but did not feel rushed. Burrata cheese with cherry tomato and arugula appetizer was the freshest cheese I've had a restaurant - seasoned perfectly with lovely presentation. I had the squid ink spaghetti with scampi langoustine and squash blossoms - the pasta was fresh and cooked perfectly with a velvety smooth and rich sauce. Definitely one of the best pasta dishes I've had! Dessert was very good - cannoli had perfectly crisp and flavorful shells with a delectable filling. The custard in the tiramisu and creme brulee was smooth, rich, and flavorful. I would highly recommend this restaurant - try to come early because it is cramped and when it fills up, you have no elbow room. Cost is a bit pricey, but not bad for quality of food and service and location!!

Visited this restaurant for our last night in NYC (it was a Monday) having read the reviews and expecting the very best Italian food.  Can’t help feeling a bit disappointed with our experience to be perfectly honest because it really didn’t live up to the reviews and I think maybe we were really unlucky.  We had made a reservation and when we turned up at the restaurant there was a couple just in front of us who had arrived without a reservation. Without asking us first, the guy on the door showed them straight to a table and when he then came back to welcome us, we then had to wait for about 10 minutes while he found a table (clearly he hadn’t checked the reservations before seating the other couple and/or had given our table away).  No apology, pretty inattentive service - having experienced amazing customer service in NYC, this guy definitely wasn’t someone I’d have put in charge of arrivals!  When we were seated, there was barely any room at the tiny tables. The restaurant was very busy so consequently it was incredibly noisy and while I know this contributes to atmosphere, it was impossible to have a quiet conversation (not least because the other tables were so so close!).  Food was good, but honestly I wasn’t blown away - I’ve definitely had better Italian food elsewhere in NYC and in Glasgow and London.  We had the duetto bruschetta to start with burrata, porcini and truffle and guacamole and lobster. It was nice, although the truffle was overpowering and I personally am not particularly convinced by the pairing of guacamole and lobster.  Then we had the Bucantini cacio e pepe with truffle and a special ravioli dish with seafood sauce and mussels.  Cacio e Pepe is my all time favourite Italian dish. I’m afraid I wasn’t blown away by this one. The pasta was a little more than al dente and the truffle sauce overpowered the simple cacio e pepe sauce too much.  The ravioli was filled with spinach and ricotta accompanying a very rich seafood sauce, it was nice but again a little heavy.  We had a very nice bottle of Primitivo, that was probably the highlight.  Generally the service wasn’t great - probably because it was so busy, but still. Twice in the hour we were there birthdays were announced with music so loud it could burst your ear drums - a tradition I don’t mind so much because it’s nice to make a fuss of someone on their bday but the music went on for so long, long after people had lost interest!  I don’t like writing negative reviews because it is so difficult running and maintaining restaurants profitably and so all the positives should be celebrated. But this place is so highly rated I just wanted to provide some balance for travellers particularly because this wasn’t the outstanding quiet dinner I was expecting.

Very nice Italian (Sicilian) restaurant. Atmosphere is very nice and relaxing with music that goes up time to time. Service is very good and friendly. Excellent food, just portions a bit too big. Reasonable prices.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Family Vacationer
review_title: Superb small Italian restaurant with amazing food and atmosphere.
review: I was asked to out to dine at this restaurant with 6 Italian's (4 of them from New York) so I thought that it was always going to be a fabulous meal and a good evening and it totally lived up to those expectations. This restaurant, like the name suggests, is a small kitchen, (with the 4 chef's busy within, which you can see clearly from the dining area). Whilst small they cram in a lot of guests, which ordinarily if in any other restaurant you would probably think ("This is too cramped") BUT at this restaurant it totally works and just adds to the amazing Italian party atmosphere that this place has, it really was fabulous and fun. The food was some of the best Italian I have ever eaten... The meatballs with mushroom and truffle to start was just divine and the ricotta ravioli with mushroom and pieces of sausage was also a dish that I didn't want to end. Prices are not too bad either with a feast of a dinner with a bottle of wine costing US$420 for 7 people. I finished sharing a traditional Sicilian dessert called a 'Cassata' with my friend (who is of Sicilian origins) and it was absolutely delicious... The perfect end to a perfect Italian evening in downtown Manhattan. I highly recommend this gem of a restaurant.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: This was a return visit and the anticipation was well-deserved. Every dish was a gastronomic experience to cherish. The Duetto Sandwich is hard to share but worth every morsel. Ravioli Funghi Salsiccia to die for. Cacio Pepe is a traditional Appulian dish done perfectly. Pachheri Seafood excellent. Patate Limoni and Verdure Grigliate great accompaniments. It is very noisy, but mostly from people talking and having a good time. Spontaneous dancing broke during our meal - just like dining in a local resto in southern Italy.

Once again we tried the Cucina the night before and were excited to try this place because of the seafood dishes. The waiter was friendly and once again from Sicily. Refreshing to go to an ITalian restaurant with actual Italians working there. The wine recommendation was spot on for the meals we were having that night. The bread to start was amazing. The special that was lobster and bucatini I believe was great. The cavatelli dish I had with fennel was great.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: We first went to their restaurant on Spring Street, which is very small & extremely noisy, so noisy we left and went around the corner to their, mainly, fish restaurant. I had the spagetti Nero with Langoustines and zucchini flowers. The sauce was lacking in flavour and was very peppery. They must have run out of zucchini flowers (already at 1:30pm) because there were none. My wife had the wild boar meatballs with porcini mushrooms and truffles. Both meals were okay, but not top notch Italian/Sicilian. They have very few Sicilian wines, and a lot of Tuscan / Piedmontese, which is probably understandable in the US. Sicily does have a lot of great wine producers so perhaps they aren't available here. They did have one Planeta rose, which is good, but for a popular choice Plumbago would be good. Work needs to be done in the kitchen & on the wine list, then perhaps they will live up to the name they created.

Much like its sister restaurant around the corner, this place is also an authentic Sicilian restaurant. A bit bigger than its sister but still crowded with a happy atmosphere. A loud music played in the background and everybody are happy. The food is fresh and tasteful and prices are very reasonable. Service was excellent. As pescatarians, we had many food choices. A vegetarian can also find starters and mains he or she can have. Great place, highly recommended.

Great food and service. Front of restaurant open to street creating nice ambiance. Truly authentic food from Sicily seafood great. Small place so apparently owner had 3 similar small places in soho. We went to one on Thompson.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review: We did have a reservation but there were plenty of seats at the bar so, you guessed it, we sat there. It was an excellent experience from the start. We were greeted by two friendly bartenders who started out being attentive and engaging and ended that way too! Standouts were Escargot Bread, Duck confit and Espresso martini
Huge variety of dishes, great food, very friendly service even when the house was full, we enjoyed the terrace, recommendable place

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Had a great meal at Boucherie West Village - first time from London in 3 years! Excellent food as always - NY Strip steak is amazing. Excellent service from Iryna especially as it was our daughter’s birthday. Excellent once again - we will be back.

review_title: Very good, but that wine list !
review: Service started very slow and inattentive. +/- 15 mins for water/bread/WAITER ! :O  Once we seemed to have the attention of our team, service was excellent.  I had the French onion soup, which as others have reported is very good, very authentic and on the large size for an appetizer.  We ordered the chateaubriand medium rare, allowing that the ends would be closer to medium. It came out a little under where we would have liked it, but it was acceptable and very, very good. The veggies served with it were also nice, but for some reason the bone marrow didn’t hit the spot(normally I love it).  Now to the elephant in the room … THE WINE LIST ! I mean ?!$&@%*^}{!!!  I think there was less than 5% under $100. And some of those $100 bottles were $20 retail and who knows what the restaurant pays. I know we have inflation, but the wine list has ENORMOUS 4-5x markups (or more).  Food 9/10 Service 8/10 (slow start)

review_title: Like Having A Meal in Paris
review: Lunch with a friend in December at Boucherie West Village is reminiscent of sitting in a Parisian restaurant. Festively decked out for the Christmas holidays, Boucherie was unbelievably busy on this Friday afternoon.  In order to dine in a New York City restaurant (12/21), one must show proof of a covid vaccination and we were lucky to also have a reservation for lunch, as the place became crowded quickly. There are 3 levels - the bottom level is the busiest since it is near the bar and kitchen. The 2nd level is smaller and intimate and the top level is reserved for larger parties.  We sat on the 2nd level and it was easy to have a conversation amid the hubub of the other patrons. Our waiter was very attentive and able to answer any & all questions. There was a separate waiter who took care of our water and wine needs.  My friend and I took advantage of the Prix Fixe menu by ordering the french onion soup, mussels, ravioli with mushrooms and chicken paillard. The only dish that was not enjoyable was the chicken - it was very dry and lacked taste. The onion soup was to die for, as were the mussels and the ravioli melted in my mouth.  We also had French white wine and dessert. The ambiance was festive and very Parisian. Will definitely return.

Host staff were either incompetent or stupid. Was offered a seat at the bar only to be shooed away by another group claiming the seat. Humiliating service. Decided quit would not enjoy dinner if I had to fight for it, so I went to Jeffrey’s Grocery down the street, which is what I recommend you do too. No need to accept abuse from anyone.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: When you enter this trattoria, you feel like you are transported to the Mediterranean in the ❤️ of Greenwich Village. Classic Italian dishes with a focus on house-made pastas, hand-stretched pizzas and more. I had their flavorful "Polipo Alla Grilla" which consisted of tasty grilled octopus, pureed cannellini beans, crushed potatoes and olives/capers.  Save room for dessert. Their dark chocolate panna cotta with fresh berries was heavenly. Service was friendly and efficient.

We visited this restaurant during restaurant week. For $45 the 3 course meal was excellent. Tortellini in brodo was a wonderful starter, followed by superbly cooked chicken breast and thigh. A chocolate sphere with a nut filled filling and chocolate sauce was a gem. A must to revisit

user_tags: Foodie;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Excellent Italian food! Was looking for a reasonable place to dine with the family. This place has great food and ambiance. We were technically seated outside but the part connected to the main establishment. There was a second outdoor section not connected, but heated and fully enclosed as well. Fear not the outside reservation in winter or inclement weather. I had the carbonara pasta and my kids had a pizza. Chocolate sphere for dessert. All delicious.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: What can I say that hasn’t already been said, this place is incredible! The service is fabulous, the food is fresh, delicious and perfectly portioned. I can’t wait to come back on my next trip!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Shopping Fanatic;Beach Goer
review: Well, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the service was ok (between first course and the second we had to wait 40 minutes!) By the time our pasta finally arrived we were starving… and to our disappointment it was not good. Maybe we had such high expectations because it has become such a trendy place and the person who took us there wanted to go.  We have traveled to New York from abroad several times and having been to many other Italian restaurants much much better, we now know that this is one that we won’t be coming back to. Sorry.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: The food, especially anything with crab was delicious and fresh-tasting. The crab cakes were the highlight.

After excellent service at the Tommy Bahama store, we were recommended to go upstairs to the restaurant. The food and service is excellent. The drinks are exciting and a pleasure to enjoy. We will be back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Not your typical restaurant. An oasis of fun and calm, very laid back. Comfortable seating, live music at night... a solo singer doing the old rock classics. The menu never seems to change, but a good mix of items. We loved the soups... both the taco and crab... order a cup... the bowl didn't seem like much more. Loved the avocado, the coconut shrimp, the chicken entree. Wine by the glass reasonable for NYC. Service was excellent.

We went on a Friday evening and could not have been happier. The atmosphere is light and casual, the service excellent and the food very good and hot when served. We had the mahi mahi and rib eye and the pineapple creme brulee for desert. Even though this is a chain I highly recommend it.

Great time had by all four! The Prosecco is 27$!!! We went on the Saturday night and then the Monday lunchtime, the only thing was the waiter got a full glass of water down me Soaked to the core!!! Thankfully I had a black dress on! The desserts are to die for!!!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We ate here as my friend loves the Chain and the food. It was all new to me. We shopped then ate. The whole tropical theme I loved and the music added to the ambience. We ordered cocktails and coconut shrimp to start. I had the crusted sanibel chicken with a red pepper and cheese sauce followed by key lime pie. My friend had the Tommy waygu burger. The food was simply delicious and the service attentive. The location is great too. Would love to return one day.

review_title: Great Shrimp in Fun, Busy Restaurant
review: We ate at the Las Vegas restaurant a few weeks previously, and were keen to see if the New York branch of this island themed restaurant was a good. It was packed at lunchtime and is clearly popular with workers and tourists alike. We browsed the store whilst we waited for our table. Couldn't wait to order the coconut shrimp appetizer, which we'd seen but not tried before. We also ordered the fish tacos again. Service was very good, both at reception and at the table. Coconut shrimp was amazing - no wonder it's the signature dish. The fish in the tacos was very good, but sadly let down by the dressing, which was so wet it made the taco disintegrate very quickly. The plantain side, served with the dish, is delicious. Overall a very good meal and I would happily dine here again - with a reservation next time!

review_title: Wonderful dinner, nice location and setting
review: Had a fantastic meal in this very convenient and beautiful restaurant right on 5th avenue, located above a Tommy Bahama retail store. Impeccable, attentive service from the waitstaff who frequently asking if we needed anything and refilled our water glasses as we needed it. Very nice plump coconut shrimps for appetizer and very much enjoyed the halibut special with quinoa and one of the margarita special drinks while my wife enjoyed a well prepared filet with garlic potatoes and greens. The warm bread with a cinamon and ginger butter spread was a nice touch. Offered a nice selection of delicious looking desserts but at that point were too full to partake. A gifted singer entertained us with music selection from the 60's through 80's. Nice evening spent after a long day hiking around the city. After leaving the restaurant, bought a few items from the retail clothing store located downstairs.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: I really didn't know what to expect from this restaurant as I only knew the brand from its clothes (which are great!). However the food was really tasty, great portions and welcoming service. I would recommend leaving room for desserts as these are great!! Beer draft selection & Cocktails very interesting and tasty also

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: A friend and I had a great meal and dining experience at this spot on 5th. We each had the lobster roll and some drinks. The service was very good. We enjoyed it and will return

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We like the food here. Service can be erratic. On this visit the front of the restaurant was sectioned off for a private holiday party. Needless to say they were enjoying their cocktails and were very loud. This impacted our leisurely dining experience in a negative way. I believe when restaurants decide to take large parties that will impact the "regular" diner, they should accommodate the other patrons in some way... a drink, dessert, something to acknowledge the inconvenience... not just think it's ok.  Our coconut shrimp, crab cakes, salads, and the taco soup were very good. Chicken and Tuna entrees were enjoyed by all. The cold mashed potatoes served with the chicken were happily replaced.  Wines and drinks were very good.  Not our best meal here but still like the restaurant. Service needs improvement and ask about parties that may be booked... I guess it will calm down after the holidays but still beware.

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Family Vacationer
review: This is a great bar near Times Square, with excellent cocktails (Dark & Stormies with real Bermuda Rum and Ginger Beer) and a relaxed vibe. Live music was good, without being overbearing and the staff were helpful. Didn't try the food, but it looked good and the place was crammed on a Wednesday night, mostly with locals by the look of it, so it must be good.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Everytime we go to New York, we have to go to the Tommy Bahama restaurant, corner 5th Avenue and 45th Str.  So far on this trip we have been twice. The drawcard is their Crab Bisque. We love it, and if we are hungry, then we will eat something else.  This wonderful treat wouldn't be complete without a great cocktail menu. We certainly tried to work our way through the menu.  Lastly, the musician was superb. We didn't get his name, but he made the evening.

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The atmosphere is warm and tropical so a perfect place to eat when you want to escape the hustle and bustle of NYC. The food is light and delicious. I always get the Ahi Tuna tacos, even though they never fill me up. The staff is very friendly

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: What is better than sitting in a bar, thinking you are in paradise, and sipping a key lime pie martini? Nothing! This place is always so great. The staff in both the restaurant and store were amazing! Great bar scene too, very fun bartenders!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: I happened to be in new york during restaurant week and decided try out this restaurant. I went for the 3 course meal - a soup, fish tacos with grilled plantains and a dessert. I have no idea why they decided to pair the plantains in coconut and fish tacos as it certainly did not pair well and would have been better served separately. Food quality was great and portions were large in my opinion.

We popped up here after receiving a voucher from the Tommy Bahama store. After some great shopping, we decided to take advantage of the offer and take an overdue break. We both had drinks, and apps. The atmosphere was welcoming and layed back. The service was a tad slow considering it wasn't at a meal time, but decent. The food was great! We plan to return for an actual meal next visit to the city.

We were going to pick up a few items for my husband at the Tommy Bahama store on Fifth Avenue, and as we needed to stop for lunch, we decided to eat at their second floor restaurant. What a pleasant surprise! I had the blackened fish tacos and yummy Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough, New Zealand, and my husband had the tuna poke appetizer and a grilled chicken and mango salad. He kept commenting how unique and delicious the lemony dressing was. The salad was a large entree sized portion, which you don't always find when you order salad for lunch in Manhattan.  The decor is fun and as you'd expect if someone named Tommy Bahama lived there. The bathrooms were gorgeous, which is always a pleasant surprise in New York City restaurants.  Our server, Jared, was fabulous. Friendly, efficient, and very knowledgable about the dishes (my husband has food restrictions). He is an asset to their team!

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We went for lunch. The food was fresh and delicious. The portions are small and the prices are on the high side, but you are paying for the Tommy Bahama name and atmosphere. Plenty of space between the tables, bright summer colors and plenty of light so you get that tropical feel. The location is good but since it is on top of their store, it is not an easy place to find.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Good Chow, Service a Little Off
review: Like the food here... enjoyed coconut shrimp, taco soup, one of their special salads, chicken entree, ribs... all very good. Didn't seem to be enough servers as service was slow... apps came quick and then maddening wait for entrees. Been here before and service was much better, seemed like they were a bit short staffed. Nice atmosphere, unique for NYC. RECOMMENDED

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I used only the bar area on the ground floor. I visited here at around 17:30 on Friday afternoon and the bar was already crowded. The bar had a good atmosphere and most of the guests seemed business man & woman who had just finished the job. If you have time before the dinner, I recommend coming here to chat with friends.

After walking around NYC for a few hours we went for a quick bite to eat at Tommy Bahamas - Love their Tuna Tacos, they are fantastic!!! As always the food and cocktails are outstanding, but this evening the service was very slow and they were out of sodas - come on out of sodas at 9.30 p.m. on a hot summer day? That is not good enough. There was live music, however people were reliefed when he stopped...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Great Laid Back Ambiance and Nice Chow
review: This is an unusual spot for Manhattan. Really nice ambiance, table spacing good, live music, excellent service... and really good food. Definitely feel like you're in an island setting, on vacation or something. We liked everything we had... duo (guac, cheese) with chips, coconut shrimp, taco soup. Love their chicken dish, the ribs, mahi mahi. Don't miss the key lime pie. Great bartender here as well.

We loved this island influence menu and energetic waitstaff, mainly our waitress Kaylah. We started with the crab cakes and then has the fish & chips with yucca fries and ahi tuna burger with fries. Great flavor and generous portions for lunch. Tried the painkiller #2 with pineapple and coconut flavors which packed a punch ! It was very busy with the business crowd so make s reservation for lunch . Finished with butterscotch pudding with ganache .. We will be back !

The creme brulee with pineapple is the best! Friendly and efficient staff. The Manager Christopher speak french as well, makes it easier to order. Easy to find on the corner of W 45 St and 5th Avenue.

We were thrilled to walk down 5th ave and see Tommy Bahama's restaurant. We've been to the Wailea location twice and absolutely loved it. The food was not as good as the Maui location but we did enjoy it. We had the coconut shrimp and the Ahi tacos and both were good. The drinks were outstanding we had the pineapple martini and the Bahama mama. I was disappointed that I had to ask the waiter to bring us our drinks after the food was delivered.

review_title: Not busy, but will be when people discover it!
review: The blackened ahi tuna salad was hands down the best of its sort I have ever had, and the chocolate cake thing I had afterward was so large and so rich I had to take half of it home. It came with a glass of champagne (I don't drink so I gave it to the waiter). It was not very busy, but it was lunch, on a Monday, that was MLK day, so it may have just been that, and tables started to fill up oddly early afternoon (like 1:30 or 2:00?).

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: What a wonderful oasis after walking Rockefeller Center and Central Park ~ just wanted to stop in for a drink and warm up a bit.... couldn't have picked a better place. The restaurant is above the store so i'm sure many folks have missed it. The best Key Lime martini ever....... I felt like i was in the Keys! hostess and bartender were the best! Let us plug our dying phones in behind the bar and even found a IPhone 6 charger for one of us! We will most certainly be back!!!

Ate here Sunday night after being to Motown the Musical on Broadway.  While the waitress was really nice, my steak when it arrived was stone cold, as was the potatoes. It was replaced promptly with a new one, and was delivered by the Manager. Also a snack was provided while I waited.  Any establishment can have an off day, I get that,mite how the error is repaired that counts, and the guys here reacted positively.  Nice menu, and good staff.

user_tags: Foodie;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: La Grande Boucherie truly transports you to Paris. It offers an upscale dining experience and is a must try. It is especially great for a date night . The food was of such high quality. We thoroughly enjoyed everything. The French onion soup was amazing. The stand out dish for me was the Beef Bourguignon. The meat was so tender and sauce was divine. It was an amazing experience with amazing service. Would totally go back.

Let me preface this by saying we were visiting from the uk but we have a house in France where we live quite a bit of the year so we might be setting the bar quite high in terms of french food - and I’ve certainly been to worse french restaurants in france!  Indeed, we had a nice experience tonight but it wasn’t “great”. That said, they must be doing something right given it’s TA ranking (which is why we chose it, coupled to its proximity to our Central Park hotel) plus how busy it was  The positives for me were:  Ambience and service - lively and attentive respectively  My french onion soup entree was very good - but OTT on the Gruyère but very rich and deep tasting  The fries and mash potato accompaniments were excellent  Why I personally am only giving an average score though is…  My moules marinere were a bit anaemic  My sons filet mignon was medium rare but super charred on the outside - for 61 bucks (expensive by UK and french standards but the norm in NYC clearly), it could have been better)  My wife’s salad chèvre chaud was ok - in france the goats cheese would typically have been grilled on the bread and the dressing was overwhelmingly tart  The wine list was average and exorbitant - we ordered a 76 dollar Sauvignon blanc (one of the cheaper ones) it was ok but warm - I asked for a ice bucket but it was only the last glass that got close to an adequate temperature  Long story short, nice setting, attentive friendly service, ok food

review_title: Adrian @ La Grand Boucheire 6 1/2 Street…. This is for you!
review: Birthday Brunch is a big deal so my husband found our spot 6.1/2 St new the Hard Rock Hotel…  Adrian was especially gracious to host our table with the elegance deserved. Breakfast selection was top notch. At the end of our French experience, Adrian presented me with a signed hard copy book of the history of the restaurant and a beautiful dessert!  I was speechless surprised of the genuine nature of our server and now friend …. Adrian. Thanks to the host, hostesses and staff for a perfect birthday brunch.  ☺️

Walking into this place is like being transported from Midtown straight into Paris or Brussels. Amazing decorations (and absolutely huge in size) and a very extensive menu. Reasonably priced wine list and nice food. Overall, a real find.

review_title: French lunch in the middle of Union Square
review: Inspired on a real french bistro, this NY restaurant is a very nice option when visiting the Union Square area. Their menu is completely French inspired and they execute it quite well.

user_tags: History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: Fantastic, disappointed we can't get delivery to the UK!!!!
review: We went out of our way to visit Bleeker Street Pizza following reviews and we weren't disappointed. The slices were fantastic, the prices are reasonable.  Limited seating but it's size and family ownership, along with the pizzas, are what makes this please a must visit either if you are in Greenwich or, in our case, Battery Park!
Fantastic NYC pizza! My highlight of the pizza was the crust, perfectly done and a nice taste of wood fried crust. Several slice options, reasonable priced, and good service. Highly recommend!
Their pizza is amazing - Nonna's recipe cheese pizza is a must, it is everything you imagine a slice of New York pizza to be. Get a slice and then walk around Greenwich Village.

Had a Nonna Maria & Buffalo chicken slices. Nonna Maria (tomato sauce + mozzarella + parmesan + basil) was the best one by far. Really loved the crispy crust. Place was cramped, but we still got to seat. Staff members were courteous and efficient. Safe bet.

review_title: One of the best slices ever.
review: Stopped in to try the pizza slices, very good value and amazing taste. Try the nonna maria slice- so tasty!

We went looking for this pizza place due to Trip Advisor ratings and was not disappointed. We were met by Greg who gave us a really warm welcome and a recommendation to try the Nonna Maria pizza which was fabulous, fresh and tasty. Washed down by a glass of red wine in a soda cup don't expect frills just good food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: Came by here after visiting the Friends building. I’ve had the best pizza in Italy but this was on par, just brilliant and so cheap. Just go here, you’re welcome!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Walked in here by pure chance. Was so happy that we did too! Loved each slice of pizza that we had. Highly recommend it.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We ate take out from here on 4 September and 9 September 2019. Generous sized slices at around $3.50 to $4.00. We both felt this was the best pizza we'd ever tasted. The Nonna Maria is suberb.
Bleecker Street Pizza is the real deal. Awesome New York style slices. The Nonna Maria pizza is my favorite pizza ever. Special thanks to Greg for the birthday slice and great conversation!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Really good italian pizza! Tasty, crispy and yummy! The owner is italian. The staff is friendly and helpful. The place is clean and cozy!

My review is based on a take out pizza I picked up. Visited here based on recommendations from friends. Warmly greeted and provided a menu plus a glass of water. Made my order from choices of red and white pizza and calzone. The Salsiccia pizza was excellent. Neapolitan style pizza with a tasty crust. For certain I will return. The pizza came very quickly.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: ...what a Pizza. Being Italian I love pizza but it is not always easy to find good ones abroad. This one is really a great pizza and if you have not problem in spending a little bit more than for a regular one go for it.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: I have to agree with the majority of the reviews about SottoCasa, the pizza is delicious. My husband said it's the best pizza he's ever had and I would say it's definitely one of the best I've had too! The restaurant is cosy, with a good atmosphere. Great value for money, we ordered 2 pizzas and 2 drinks which came to just over $45. I would definitely recommend and revisit when we are back in New York.

We visited this little cozy place while we were in NY last week. Pizza was delicious, specialy Tartuffino. Matteo was very polite and professional abd took really good care of us. Very simple but authentic and warm hearted place in such a big crazy city like NY. Well done

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: The best Neapolitan Pizza in Brooklyn
review: These guys have done their homework, imported the oven and flour and have dedicated themselves to the art of Neapolitan pizza-making. Simple and perfect! Crispy, chewy crust, slightly wet center, fresh tomato sauce and cheese. You can't go wrong at Sottacasa. The wine list is short but affordable with a number of drinkable options. The backyard space is terrific on a warm night and the whole place seems to glow with warmth on cold evenings. Highly recommended after ten plus visits..

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I’m from Italy (really) and I really like good tasty but not to heavy pizza. Now this is the place! In addition outstanding service, familiar but not extravagant, warm, cordial with cosy and very nicely decorated ambient, ideal for both couples or for family gatherings. Service is perfect and all areas of the restaurant are clean and tidy. You can see that is properly run and always under the control of the owners who wore me welcome you at any occasion.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We went for dinner to SottoCasa because we were looking for a restaurant to have a quick meal, not too far from our hotel, on the first night of our holiday in NYC. We couldn't help but go back every night for the whole holiday. The food is just amazing: tasty, fresh, well presented. The team is friendly and happy to accomodate all requests. I don't recall having pizza as good outside of Italy, and rarely in Italy as well.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Met up with my cousin for dinner one night at this spot. In a basement. Super friendly staff and really good pizza. I would eat here again.

This was our first night in Harlem and we just wanted something easy (i.e. no cooking). Looking online showed this as a good place to eat but by the time came to going out, we were too tired so decided on takeaway instead. As we were walking balk from the liquor store, we called in to ask abouy delivery and had a very friendly encounter - delivery would take an hour but we could collect them in 20 mins !! Perfect.  9 pizzas ordered and collected at the 20 min mark and they were all excellent. The calzone (in particular) was wonderful and the spicy Italian sausage simply excellent. There was very little left at the end of the meal.  Price wise, not the cheapest BUT this is not normal takeaway quality.  Would we go back - yes (probably on Thursday evening) Would we recommend to others - absolutely yes!

review_title: Some of the best pizza outside of Italy
review: The Neapolitan pizza was great with a variety of topping offerings. Our server was from Italy too. The Italian wine selections brought me back to my visit to Italy.
The food, cocktails and location are fantastic. The best tuna I have ever had in my life! If you are in NU you have to try this place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Trendy French Restaurant on the Upper West Side
review: Great French restaurant on the UWS. Great food, great service and a great atmosphere. Comprehensive menu and wine list. We sat at the bar where we could chat with the (knowledgable) barman, who makes a mean Negroni. Enjoyed a spicy steak tartare followed by the skate which was divine. Can't recommend it too highly!!
Really friendly service. The garlic knots were very cheesy and nice. The pizza slices were massive and all delicious.

Best pizza I tried on our NYC trip! We flew from California all the way to NY to try this pizza haha. It was a pleasure meeting the man behind the magic - Frank! He was so nice and welcoming. I had a slice of sicilian cheese pizza but got lucky that some other people ordered the famed double pizza! We got a good shot of it; can't wait to go back again.  Thanks Frank !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Nice dael close to our hotel.
review: East Village Pizza is more of a delivery place but the small dining area offers a great street view. The pizza was good and the service was fast.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: Such a great friend-recommendation place to grab a quick dinner!
review: Best taco i've had in NYC hands down. Service was super fast and efficient. Hold onto your receipt from the upfront pay, you'll need it for the line. This is a pay-first and then build your taco with the line chef as you move down the line. Will absolutely go back.
Worth the wait. The long line was no lie to the great dinner. The prices are right and the flavors are great. We will definitely return during our next visit to NY.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Stopped in for a quick lunch.  Service was friendly and fast.  Very casual spot—order at a counter and then eat standing up at another counter. A quick lunch kind of spot.  Simple menu of casual Mexican—tacos, quesadillas (which are really more tacos here), etc.  Food was tasty. Nothing especially original, but solid street tacos that packed a good flavor punch.  Would definitely return!

review_title: Just soooo simple and soooo good!
review: Maybe the best food in Times Square?! Two tacos was plenty of food for dinner and it was like $12! There are no chairs here, just standing bars. The atmosphere is fun and the tacos are absolutely fantastic!

review_title: Add to your short-list of must-haves while in NY.
review: This goes on my must-do list whenever I am in NYC. Excellent tacos/quesadillas and excellent operation. You may think you have tried tacos, but this is a place of taco mastery. I have had tacos in Mexico. Los Tacos is very similar to Mexican taco stands but with fresher ingredients and NYC’s tougher standards. The staff inspired confidence with efficiency and authenticity. Try the cactus tacos but their standards are what people come for.

The food is exceptional and the prices are so low it’s kind of embarrassing. Great food but also amazing vibe and energy seeing all the food prepared fresh. Definitely lived up to the hype, a must try for anyone in New York!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Omg…the tacos are so addicting and flavorful. The pictures do not do them justice. We had steak tacos and wanted more immediately. Came back the next day for chicken and steak both. They do get a line outside but it moves fast. Counters inside that you stand at to eat. Our only dilemma is now we are obsessed and have no way to get them since we were just visiting. We will never pass up a visit here if we ever find ourselves in NY again. Thank you!!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: I could eat here every day
review: I’ve been eating here for years and have always had great food and a great experience, but thought it required a special mention because of how good it was just a few days ago. On Saturday I stopped in during a very busy lunch service and when I saw the line out the door I thought “this is going to take forever”, but no. The line moves fast and I had just been handed my ticket at the counter when one of the guys who makes the tacos was waving to me to signal he was ready. I think I was out of there in 5-10 minutes. Their operation is an incredibly well oiled machine that I wish more places could learn from. I also read just recently that they even make their own masa for the tortillas, which is amazing. I knew they made the tortillas in house, you can see them making them behind the counter, but to even make their own masa is next level. May this place always exist and always be this great.

The menu is on the wall. I was here 3 years ago. The prices went up, but still a great value. There are no tables or chairs. Stand up only with a high top. You place your order and pay. Prior you can choose Mexican sodas. Then take your slip and give it to the person making your taco. They top the tacos with onions, cilantro, salsa and guacamole sauce. You can get your own limes. I got the pork adobado (carne al pastor). Yes they use a trompo-that adds the extra crunch and flavor. This is also garnished with a pineapple strip. I suggest not to get the salsa. This way your flavor comes from the meat. My wife got carne asada. 3 tacos each were plenty to fill us up. $4.50. Carne asada was $4.75. We also had Horchata. Some of the best I ever had. I was spoiled with Mexican food because I lived in Dallas for 10 years. I had a few employees come to NYC and I suggested they go here. All said it was the best tacos they ever had.( Nothing like in Miami). These tacos are so good, I drove my daughter up from Florida to Boston, we seriously thought about driving into Manhattan for these tacos(would have if not for the parking issues)

My husband heard about this place from a co-worker that insisted we try this place. Wow, what a great experience!!! Best taco’s my family and I have ever had. I tried a chicken & beef taco. We’ve traveled to Mexico but these taco’s were even better. The place was packed but it was a very well run, clean fast food establishment that provided great service. All employees were extremely patient and polite while they answered my daughters questions about the food. My family and I were very impressed. If you’re in the area, Los Tacos is worth a visit. You will not be disappointed. Thank you Los Tacos for a lunch I won’t ever forget! If I ever get back to NYC, I will definitely return.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We visited this location of Los tacos no. 1 while wandering in the evening around times Square. There is a decent choice of food items and some cool drinks as well, so we tried a bunch of them. The food, as in the other locations we have been to, was simply amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Pity though that there was a huge fan blowing air straight onto our necks, and that made eating in an already crowded shop unpleasant. We ate very quickly and left. If you plan a visit, try to go in off-peak hours to enjoy your experience to the fullest.

It was probably the cheapest dinner we enjoyed in the city, but by far not the worst. We were looking for a quit snack just before Broadway and ended up at Los Tacos No.1 after having conducted a quick Tripadvisor research. Very authentic Tacos and Quesadillas. No the coziest of places, but the food is awesome and addicting!

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review_title: Tasty Tacos but too busy and hectic
review: So busy and hectic, menu quite confusing and we felt very rushed when ordering at the counter. We tried to enquire about the types of tacos as we wanted crispy taco’s that the lady behind the counter said ok but when they were ready, they were soft tortilla wraps. We honestly weren’t sure what we ordered but they both tasted amazing. Good for a quick bite on the go but not filling at all so you would need a few if looking for a substantial meal. I really enjoyed the food as it had loads of flavor but was disappointed that there was no seating and that we felt very rushed. I understand they want to get the queue down but need to take a bit more time listening to their customers and what they are after. Based on the taco’s alone I would go back if I am ever in NY again but think I would have to work out the menu and decide what I want prior to going so there is no confusion.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Times square food is expensive and not very good. We found this place to be a good value, and good food, relative to the other options in the area. It's a bit chaotic and hectic, so not the type of place to go if you want to sit down and rest. But tasty if you are on the move.

The carne asada taco with everything is perfect! Seasoned just right. I should have stopped at one , but had to have another. The line was long but moved quickly. Only negative is that tables, mostly standing, are shared by multiple restaurants. You have to play the vulture game and nab one as someone is taking the last bite of their lunch.

There can be a bit of a queue at Los Tacos 1 which is a good sign. I tried the tacos and the quesadillas and whereas the tacos were delicious, the quesadillas were incredible. Definitely worth the wait

We saw the long line on Saturday night and made a point to go back and try their tacos on Sunday. They did not disappoint. You order and pay and they you tell the cooks what you want on your tacos. I had one chicken and one pork with everything. They had a lot of meat, a good amount of spice without it being too much and very tasty. I liked the pork one better. I have to go back and try a steak one now. It is an order and standup and eat it place. So don’t plan on seating down for a meal. I would go back any time.

user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: Just as the review says: they are OK. Definitely wouldn’t wait in line again for these, honestly. We got one of each taco & a carne asada quesadilla. They all tasted similar. Extra sauces out of the bowls were bland & the guac was also bland.

We stopped by a few times, and the line was out of the door. We finally came back one time and there was no line. We wanted to try the tacos, so we all ordered a different taco. They were really good tacos, and I am glad we decided to wait until there was no line, as we were unsure exactly how this restaurant works. It was nice that it wasn't busy for our first time here. Would definitely come back again if in NYC.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Best tacos I ‘ve Had in years outside Mexico! We tried almost everything because we visited the place three times while we were in NYC. I would say that tacos adobada and quesadillas were my favorite! I definitely recommend the place! Fantastic place and feel!

review_title: Incredible. Should be a 5* but dropped due to all the flies
review: The food was absolutely outstanding by far the best tacos I’ve ever eaten.  The only thing that stopped me enjoying was the ridiculous amount of flies everywhere and constantly trying to land on my food/ drink/ napkins and even on me.  Also our server said the chips was only enough for one person but you can definitely share.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Came here before a Broadway show and there was quite a long line outside. Once inside though, service was really quick and the food made to order, delicious and fresh. The vibe was fun and excellent soundtrack. In fact it was so good we came here a second time during our NYC trip on a quieter day. I have to say though, the food was slightly better the first time as it was a busier time and piping hot.

I love Mexican food so a quick search while in new York and Los tacos pops up so thought we'd give it a go. The menu is short and to the point and the service is fast, it's a bit like street food but served inside. As for the food they are really good taco's and reasonably priced, I say reasonably because unlike the rest of the places we ate in NY the portion sizes are normal, so you're more than likely going to want to order 2 or 3 dishes if you're after a meal.  Great place to stop buy for something quick and tasty, done expect to spend more than 15-30 mins in here!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: My husband and I wanted to grab a quick dinner after a show. We decided to give this place a try and it was worth it. I got the chicken and pulled pork taco. They were both delicious and the corn tortilla was GF which was a bonus!  The atmosphere is very lively, bordering on chaos and too noisy. So be ready for that. There is loud Spanish music blaring in the background while people are chatting and chefs yelling out orders. There are no tables and chairs. Instead, there are multiple standing counters for people to eat while standing up.  End Result: I would definitely revisit when I'm in the mood for a quick meal.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Thrifty Traveler
review: I ordered 3 chicken tacos and spent every bite trying to remember if I had ever had a taco that tasted this good and the conclusion was that I have not. We ate here before seeing Frozen and I kept daydreaming about going back after the show and eating 3 more. I wish I had. I won't ever come to NYC again without eating here.  You order at the cash register and they make it in front of you. It all happens fast. No seats, but you can stand at one of several counters. I could use a taco now.
Wow this was spectacular good. My whole family loved the food. Dont miss this place while in New York.

Just wow! These tacos are as authentic as they could possibly be. For Cinco de Mayo I had to have tacos, and this little place just off Times Square was perfect. Very quick, reasonably priced and so so tasty. They prepare all orders fresh in front of you.
The dirty in the title doesn't reflect the venue. It's for the no frills, you get what you see. Good food-simple. Visited twice during our stay, some of the best guac I've had.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We came in for pizza and although it was pricy, it was quite delicious. My son and husband enjoyed a café americana and a late and I loved the lemoncello. Our server Marianna was friendly and attentive. We had a wonderful time.

user_tags: Vegetarian;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: The best pizza we had in New York and just as good as the pizzas we have had when visiting Italy. We both had a small pizza but that was plenty big enough for us. Great pizzas and great desserts too. Definitely worth visiting.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Family Vacationer
review: Perfect! The pizza was absolutely perfect! The ingredients were fresh and delicious. We ordered a Rustica pizza and a Margarita pizza. Well done!! This is a cash only restaurant. Also, it is super tight seating.

Want real Italian pizza? Numero 28 is the place. Small, authentic Italian style. Remember to book a table - its a small and popular place. I could write many nice words - but choose to just recommend it. Visit, eat, enjoy. You will not be dissapointed!

New York missed a place like this! This pizza is best. Finally a pizza place with no garlic in the sauce, real mozzarella cheese, the dough is terrific, crusty but not dry, brick oven makes the difference but I’m sure the Brazilian pizza man makes his best. I should not mention the waiter, unfortunately i forgot her name, she was so beautiful as well as professional. The location is great to, just by the Village.. lots of students all around and a very friendly atmosphere. I’ll be back

Went here with a friend for dinner. The menu is somewhat limited. I got a Caprese Salad to start. It was ok. Tomatoes weren’t the greatest mozzarella was ok.  My friend got cannelloni which was ok nothing to write home about. I got a meat lasagna with béchamel sauce , also nothing to write home about.  Overall the service was excellent. Food eh nothing bad about it but it was just average. Atmosphere is like a NYC pizzeria.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: My boyfriend and I were looking for a good, sit-down pizza dinner and I chose this place based on the reviews here. It did not disappoint! I tried a lovely small pie with artichoke hearts, mushrooms, fresh green olives, and ham - and it was AMAZING. I’m sure there are plenty of delicious pizza places to choose from in NYC but this one is definitely worth a try.

This is a quaint little spot in the Village. We saw a show at the Blue Note & were hungry for pizza afterwards. After walking around a bit, we stumbled on this place and I am sure happy we did! The place is small so be warned. We sat at a table at the back of the restaurant which is ok since a few other places we went to had an hour wait. This was a Friday night so you can imagine the neighborhood was bustling at 10:30. We ordered the 18” rustica pizza which was absolutely delicious. It’s a thin crust brick oven pizza that had fresh mozzarella, peppers, basil, and sausage. I definitely recommend this place for their pizza. I would come back another time to try their other dishes since their pasta dishes smelled & looked good at the tables around us.

As a European used to having amazing pizza from Italy, it is hard to find such a meal to my taste in the United States, their pizza being much thicker, fatter and so on. We found Numero 28 just walking by our neighborhood and it quickly became our go to pizza place. With authentic (enough) Napoli pies, they offer a variety of toppings, gluten free and vegan options and offer 3 sizes. Their delivery is also on point and never disappointed. Easily the best pizza I have tasted in New York yet.

review_title: Very good, not the best in NYC
review: Overall, very good Neapolitan pizza. Slightly expensive. Crust was on the bland side and did not have that certain flavor when 00 flour is utilized. Slightly disappointed with seating. Went early and did not have a reservation. Plenty of tables available and was given worst outside table available.

review_title: Great !!!! This is how it is supposed to be
review: It is very difficult to find very good pizza in USA, Numero 28 Pizzeria is excellent!!!! and then stop at Grom just in front for an excellent ice cream!!!!!! Finalmente 2 posti dove mangiare bene, speriamo che si diffonda una migliore cultura del cibo anche grazie a pochi posti come questi.

We decided to visit Numero 28 after reading good reviews and were full with expectation. Unfortunately, we were let down as the food provided, we deemed, was exceedingly average.  We arrived and instantly were put off by the overly loud music. This quietened down significantly as the evening progressed but it was impossible to hear the waitress when our orders were being taken. On top of that, our table wobbled and there was no wedge provided to help stabilise it. Being one of my pet hates, I bit my lip and just rode it out for the evening.  Secondly, the calamari starter was particularly greasy and the portion was far too big a size for just an appetiser. There was no indication on the menu that this portion could have easily have suited four people, let alone a couple.  The main next: a rustica pizza. Again, quite greasy and far too cheesy. The tomato, instead of being layered into the pizza with the cheese, was just dolloped on to each slice. It just wasn’t particularly impressive given that a lot of prior reviewers have claimed this restaurant boasts “the best pizza in NYC.”  My girlfriend’s gnocchi dish was reasonable but by no means awesome.  It’s a shame, given the high praise this establishment is given. My final and biggest complaint is that this restaurant DOES NOT accept card payments! We actually only overheard this information being passed on to other customers at a neighbouring table and were not informed of this upon arrival. We had no cash. So, we were directed to the RESTROOMS where an ATM is located - huh? How ridiculous. (This ATM also charges to $2.99 to allow you to withdraw cash!)  It is probably with no surprise you may hear we did not tip despite the staff hinting that we did. And, all in all, the experience and food was relatively forgettable.

Went with family to the pizza place. Strongly recommend making reservations in advance. The pizzas are fresh and served hot. They don't accept credit cards but have ATM on the premises so you can withdraw money to pay.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker
review: We watched football match, was a lot of emotion. They have really good pizzas!!! Service was nice! But the most important thing is that you can watch the EURO 2016 championship match, AMERICAN BOYS DOES NOT INTEREST TO SPORT IN EU! My boyfriend was happy

review_title: Quiet Neighborhood Pizza and Italian Fare
review: A good size indoor restaurant with an outdoor patio, this is a favorite in the neighborhood of Turtle Bay, Manhattan. Very good pizza, good service, and Italian dishes. Nice vibe. Good for lunch or dinner. And plenty of bars down 2nd ave -- some with live entertainment -- should you want a night out afterwards.

This place is in Little Italy and it belongs there. I've been lucky enough to have some incredible pizza in different places in Italy, and this place definitely holds its own with them. It's very small- I booked a few weeks in advance and you'd have to. Our table was really small, but it was nice to be next to the pizza oven and see everything which was going on. The menu was so good we struggled to choose between toppings, so we had one of the massive pizzas with three different toppings. All were excellent, but the truffle one blew me away. The bottle of red we had was tasty and affordable. Our bill was about 90-100 dollars for two (but then we had the huge pizza which is supposed to be for four people!). Overall, if I was ever to go back to New York, I would definitely be coming here again.

review_title: Go and enjoy a great meal
review: Nice italian place to go. The Pizza was great, and also the Pasta. Great taste, the pizza was made in a brick oven ... awesome !!!
Excellent location in Greenwich Village with great outdoor seating on a nice night. Great pizza and I enjoyed a pasta plate as well. Cash only and place is always packed, That says a lot.

I went for dinner at Numero 28 after finding out it was the best rated pizzeria on Tripadvisor. my waiter, Guiseppe, was very nice and friendly. I ordered the Numero 28 and it was simply excellent. I'd like to say that I am a huge pizza fan and this was definitely one of the best I have ever eaten.

The the pizza here is the closest you can get to having pizza in Italy specifically in Rome. The stuffed focaccia pizza was also very good. I would definitely return to this place. We went with a group of 6 children, they all loved the food as well!

I love this place it's my number 1 meal in NYC so far. Staff are really lovely. We shared the 29 inch pizza and got to choose 3 toppings. We had the numero 28 mushrooms and ham, rustico and Gulliano all delicious! And what's ore we shared a slice of homemade cheesecake that was amazing! Thanks so much if we are in NYC again we will be visiting.

We had found this place here on trip advisor as we were coming the New York on holiday and my birthday, I love pizza so thought what a great place to go. I wasn't disappointed!! It was easy to book on line. On arriving we were sat on a table by the door which was fine as there are two doors do it wasn't that cold. We were then offered a table further inside. When we went in it was right by the fire for the pizza!! We knew we was ordering the 29 inch pizza so ordered half and half. One half was pepperoni and ricotta and the other five cheese. We ordered a bottle of wine which was very nice. We were a little worried as the table we were on was small and the size of the pizzas going past wee huge bit when it was delivered it fitted on the edge but the board it came on was so sturdy we did t need to worry. The pizza was delicious and tasty!! It exceeded our expectations. The service was really lovely as well. This is a quant little place that delivers on service and pizza!!!

review_title: good, but not what i expected
review: Brick oven-yes. fresh and good toppings-yes. Excellent service-yes. If you want ny style pizza, this is not it. We will head to Bleecker street next to compare....

What a lovely experience! The lovely lady running the front of house is an absolute delight and makes you feel like she is welcoming you to her home and hosting you for tea. The food was amazing and lots of local homely options. The flavours were outstanding. The restaurant itself is lovely and cosy - there are no sea views from there if you're after that but we went at night so it didn't matter! Definitely recommend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Very popular local restaurant. Book your table!
review: We ate dinner here. It’s a cozy restaurant in Firostefani and an alternative to the caldera view restaurants because it relies on ambience and food more than caldera views. Certainly a very welcoming and helpful host and this place is rightly popular. We had booked in advance and that was a good job because there were many ad hoc visitors who had to be turned away as it was fully booked. The food is very homely and of a good standard. I am not sure where many reviewers below have dined but I would not consider the food rates as highly as many have described. Obviously tastes vary. We found it a very pleasant alternative though to many other places we visited in Santorini and it certainly comes at a significantly lower cost than pretty much anywhere with the view out over the caldera. Well worth a visit . But don’t forget to book, they are very helpful

review_title: The best restaurant we visited in Fira
review: We passed this small restaurant on our walk from our hotel to Fira centre. Although small it was always full so we thought we better try it out. Wow – what a surprise! The food was absolutely superb and, overall, the best fish dish we had during our stay in Santorini. Okay, you won’t get superb views of the Caldera as it is situated on the road down to Fira from Oia. However, the ambience, quality of dishes and friendly owner made up for the lack of view. There are only approximately twelve tables in this small restaurant so booking always advisable. The fish we had was freshly caught that morning and prepared to order. If you love fish we thoroughly recommend this restaurant; dishes reasonably priced as well. Various meat and local dishes were also on the menu. Note: only open in the evening.

review_title: Real Greek food in a small charming family operated restaurant!
review: We ate here because of TA reviews and were not dissapointed! This is a small family-run restaurant. He cooks, she serves. They both do a great job! We lovede it so much we came back 2 days later!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We went here by chance and were lucky to get the last table, there were many after us asking but we're denied. Tip, if you like to eat later there are better chance to get a table without reservation. The owners see working one ont the kitchen and one waiting tables. It is a friendly atmosphere so we're well taken care of. I had a really hot pepper and a sole file all well prepared and cooked and Tasted good. All and all I think the ratings are maybe on the high side but it is quite good.

review_title: Best food and what a charectuer Irine is 😍
review: Came here in 2011 and came back twice last week! Absolutely mouthwatering food! The slovaki lamb was the best meal I had in Santorini! The haloumi starter was incredible! Also the pork! Nothing will dissapoint you here.  100% book in advance! Whist we were there so many people had to be turned away. The wine was fab also. Thanks Irene love Claire and Mum xxxx

review_title: Husband and Wife team serving delicious, flavorful meals
review: 3 words - MAKE A RESERVATION. It was off-peak season when my husband and I went and we got a reservation through our hotel. Boy am I glad we did because we saw about 10 couples get turned down for not having one. Almost every table was marked "reserved" when we arrived at opening.  There is a good reason for the reservations because the food is so delicious, so flavorful, and home cooked right behind the counter by the husband of the husband/wife team. The wife serves the food and takes the orders and she is SO friendly (unless you dont have a reservation).  They have a good wine selection and the menu is significantly large. I was feeling a little under the weather when we got there so I got a soup - oh my gosh - it was just a simple mushroom soup but we soaked up every last drop with the bread and she came over and hugged us because she saw me soaking up the last bit of liquid and laughed at us. But it was that good. We also got the tomato balls, a must for being in Greece, and they were served with tzatziki, SO GOOD. My husband complimented that for a fried food it was so light. We also got the beer chicken and a seabass - both were amazing, we finished basically everything. They also give a complimentary dessert (assuming they rotate). Ours was some phyllo dough with some cream maybe (not really sure) but so good. The wife also takes a picture of every table and puts it on her facebook site, which I think is pretty cool.  We wanted to go back a second time in our 3 dinners we had in Santorini, but then figured we should try something else....regreted not going back. Absolute must - please go you will not be disappointed.

review_title: Our go-to for first night in Zermatt!
review: We've been coming to Zermatt for over a decade. This is our tradition, to got to Brown Cow for our first night since day 1. This year the hotel we are in does not offer dinner so we went a few times. Always busy. Great happy fun staff, which is not always common in Switz. Cool vibes.  Live the Goulash Soup and wife love, loves the fries. Wife wants them to bring back the Minestrone Soup for next year!  Love this place!
Family owned cafe with nice and cheerful Serbian owner. Offers typical German food and Serbian. Nice to spend the evening at home a like diner

Had a late lunch in this quite tiny place. Very charming environment, with a pleasant service even if we were not in the normal lunch hours (arrived at 3PM). The food was excellent, I took the Cordon Bleu which was very good. The wildgoulasch from the suggestion was also excellent. Definitely a place to go back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: What a spectacular meal this was! Our server Miguel truly went above and beyond to ensure that we had the best dining experience ever! The chef, Filipe "El Padrino" Marques was a true legend! He came by our table before every course to ensure we had the best pairing of food and wine based on our dietary needs!  The Octopus croquettes appetizer was really good, and we loved the bread and the butter and ricotta cheese. We then shared the razor clams with rice, and this dish was super fresh, and delicious. My wife also loved their sushi rice dessert. We can't thank Filipe and Miguel enough for such a tremendous dining experience!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We loved their meat: they really know how to cook it. Nice service. The waiters and the chef, they are very nice. Really worth a visit.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Re'Tasco is so far away from the city centre that the owner told us that he always worries about no-shows when he gets bookings from tourists.  Well, we showed up, and we had a blast. The steak is incredible - this coming from someone who usually avoids steak (and beef in general), but the starter of cockles in garlicky broth was - if anything - even better.  They were a bit shorts on waiters, but the ones they had were great, and we got good advice on the wine selection too.

I Love Steak and this place is Amazing! Carnivore Heaven ❤️  Super friendly service, love the relaxed atmosphere and oldies jazz music in the background. Thank you Miguel for being so attentive and thank you to the chef who suggested this special cut of steak for me.  Although I came solo I decided to try a signature dish for 2 called the Chuleton. It’s a special cut of beef that only comes from older cows that have more inter-muscular marble = and marbling means flavor.  Im coming back…!!

A friend and myself came here for dinner, we were met with a friendly lady and shown to a table, even though we had no reservation.  We sat outside and the views of the fountains were the best I've ever seen. The service was impeccable, I'm gluten intolerant and the waited (Ronnie) was so helpful. Letting me know what I could eat ect. All the staff who spoke to us had a general interest in us.  The food however is the main show stopper here!! Amazing!! Can't say it enough, the steak was cooked to perfection, creamy mash and the mushrooms I could smell before they were on my plate.  I can't wait to come back for another meal.
Very delicious starter and burger. Thank you to Elsa for serving. The price is moderate, here is Dubai Mall. You can drop here for a meal.

My wife and I had a wonderful meal here last night. We booked our table online via Google which is simple. The service was excellent. Very welcoming and friendly. We ordered a steak to share between the two of us, but there was enough to feed 3 or 4. It was huge, perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. The side order of grilled vegetables and fries was very tasty also.  Compared to UK prices, it was extremely good value. Probably about half what we'd have to pay at home.  The area is really cool as well. Loads going on with lots of bars, restaurants, and theatres. It's so nice we're heading back there tonight to try another restaurant.  I thoroughly recommend it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Not the best parilla there is but not bad neither
review: Staff is great, wine is good and there is a good vibe in this Palermo branch of chain La Dorita. The meat could have been better though....

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker
review: Good parilla, great price and super service! Definitely highly recommended, especially if you are able to eat a lot :D

The restaurant is very nice. It has tables outside near the street, is has very attentive service, who is quite friendly and customer focused. They even tried a cocktail that we wished for even though it was not in the menu. Food and drinks are very good and the atmosphere is perfect. Nothing more to say other than that I can recommend it!
