We also had never experienced a "Closed-Door dining experience" where the address of the restaurant is provided to you with your reservation confirmation and you arrive at the address, which is an unmarked door- you ring the bell- give your name- and you are granted entrance into a very special dinner! Luis explained everything we were going to eat... He told us about the 5 wines that would be paired with the 5 courses- he then showed us the FABULOUS pieces of Argentine beef-did I mention that we each got 32 ounces of this mouth watering steak? We had 12 people at our dinner. We were the only people who didn't speak Spanish-it didn't matter one bit! Luis told the two of us everything in English and the people we shared our meal with made us feel welcomed-we all laughed and talked for almost 4 hours! The food was incredible and the company was better! If you are in Buenos Aires, I highly recommend that you grab a reservation for this dinner so you can experience Luis's hospitality first hand!

review_title: Most incredible dining experience in 25 years!
review: When the tour company booked us for dinner at Steaks by Luis in Buenos Aires, I had no idea it would be this incredible. We arrived at the restaurant just before 8 pm - a locked door with no signage or indication of what was to follow. We were handed a glass of sparkling white wine and met our fellow diners and set out on a gastronomic journey over the next three hours. A five course meal with exquisite wine pairings from, where else, but Mendoza. There is only one sitting, with a maximum of 8 guests all sharing stories and great food cooked, or grilled, to perfection. This was a dining experience, not just a meal.

review_title: HOLIDAY VERSION OF DINNER IS DELICIOUS BUT NOT INTIMATE
review: We attended the dinner in mid-December when the experience shifted from a "house" environment to a larger facility which could accommodate more people (to support the holiday demand). We don't know what the "house" is like except through reviews, but the "holiday" version is in a first floor restaurant-like commercial space that did not convey "house." It was modern, clean and well lit for sure, but it holds 25 people so that's quite a crowd. On our particular night, half of the crowd was a group that already knew each other so they sat together on one half of the long communal table. They didn't really mingle as, well, they didn't have to. So there was less over-all mingling than we were hoping for. That said, the non-group people around us were delightful, engaged and pleasantly interactive (folks were from all over the world). The food itself, however, was AMAZING, the best or near best meal of our 12 day trip to Argentina. Luis is a bit soft spoken but he gives a nice introduction about the elements of a "proper asado" before he fires up the grills and then another member of his team, a highly fluent (in english) young man who is well versed not only in food but politics and culture, acts as host and service captain. Every course is outstanding. The wine pairings well chosen, and the pours generous. Luis circulates a bit as things progress, which is nice. By 11pm when the dinner ended, the lack of intimacy had softed a bit due to the otherwise happy experience. If you are travelling during the winter holidays, check the website or inqure to see if they are doing this larger group thing again. Don't for an instant hesitate based on food/wine/service alone.
The menu was varied and the food was delicious. The steak was the best I had in Argentina and wine glasses were refilled fairly regularly. An enjoyable evening and a great dinner.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Not the experience we expected -- is it (becoming) a tourist trap
review: We booked the week before over the internet, nice site and nice treatment, so high expectations. They just mover location in BsAs. We checked the outside out before and found the place (not so easy). Arriving in time as required explicitly, many foreigners waiting, seemed a bit a cruiseship tour of overspending retired world travelers, not the hip and young people we like to be with... anyway. There was a power breakdown at the start... and not a real nice process to find a place to sit, instructions chaotic. Anyway we paid 200 USD for an experience but were quite disappointed. A minimal sald, some starters of low quality and undescribed and some cheese to be shared and a so-so quality steak (very low on our list of previous experiences in the USA or Colombia or Brasil or France). Dessert also average. Overall very disappointing to us. Fortunately the rest of our holidays really compensated for this bad start in a former garage without windows. Not recommended, though friendly people (who make an awful lot of US dollars instead of pesos).
Luis is a very nice guy and has definitely created a great concept for a restaurant in BA. The meat and the wine are of great quality and the mood created is really nice. I really recommend it!

I always read the reviews of others and often dismiss some of the highs and lows. The whole experience was excellent. The venue was gorgeous, well set out. Luis, Diego and their team are all charming and attentive to your needs. It was a fun group we shared our experience with, all genuinely friendly with plenty of conversation and laughs. Plenty of good quality food to keep your bellies happy. The meats were all cooked to perfection, as you would expect. Dessert was also delicious. The wines were also stunning - we fell in love with Malbec when we were in Argentina 7 years ago. So glad we came here for the experience. Would highly recommend!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: High quality food and wine - Price too high - Complex experience
review: Part of the "experience" is sitting at dinner in a family style, all around a big table (even if strangers), chatting , eating high quality food and drinking good selected wines. The host, speking english, took care of anyone of us, trying to unify the group and explaining the Argentine asado, its many rituals and traditions, in a closed-door setting. If you're lucky and your neighbors pleasant, you can make friends and enjoy the dinner. Frankly speaking, having to relate is a little bit forced. However you can move around the restaurant, the terrace, the grill. The 5-course Asado includes a traditional picada, salad, achuras, steak, dessert. As already said, food quality was high, even if not the best we had in BuenosAires. In the meantime, the price is very high. So the quality/price ratio was not so good.

I came here with my husband for his birthday dinner as he was really excited to try the asado. I am a vegetarian and came here knowing it would not be as exciting for me as him. However, I was a bit disappointed in what I got. My main course was a risotto, which I found strange. Why not grilled vegetables instead? I would have loved to have something grilled as well. My husband said his steak was just ok and not as good as he thought, he came with very high expectations. That being said, our host was fantastic and very knowledgable! He went out of his way to make sure everyone was having a good time and well taken care of. We also enjoyed getting to talk to people in the family style sitting at dinner. We sat next to a lovely couple. Would recommend for those wanting an asado experience.

We were simply told to make a reservation here so didn't know what to expect, which made the experience even greater for us. Lovely location and set up, lovely staff, Luis is super friendly. My one fault that didn't give the night an 'excellent' rating was that the steak wasn't as juicy and succulent as others I've had which was disappointing for us. But a great night nonetheless :)

review_title: A Unique Dining Experience - come ready to eat!
review: We found via tripadvisor and showed up. It's an assuming black apartment door that leads up to a beautiful loft  Caters to tourists - but the group was 24 people from Australia, Brazil, US, Canada and Europe  5 course meal of amazing meats each paired with Wine - with great staff and an intimate / closed door feel. I've never had such a cool and unique dining experience in another country!  Luis is onsite and he and his staff make it feel like a big family dinner.  Would HIGHLY recommend. Go hungry - there is SO much food!

All the reviews rave about this place, and our son booked us in here 6 months ago knowing we were visiting BA. So glad he did, as bookings well in advance are advisable to avoid disappointment! The whole meal was amazing and the Steak, cooked by Luis himself, was to die for. Each of the 5 courses is paired with a great wine and is the perfect compliment. They allow 1kg of meat per guest, so make sure you arrive hungry! Luis and his fantastic staff make the night one to remember forever!

review_title: Totally different and fun experience in Buenos Aires
review: A friend recommend that we do a "puerta cerrada" (closed door) dinner in Buenos Aires, so I booked this through Viator. We absolutely loved it, and it was one of the highlights of our trip. We had some of the most amazing food I have ever had in my life here, and we dined with other Americans and Europeans too. Luis and the other hosts were really nice, and the loft itself and the view are great. This is such a different experience and a must-do in Argentina. As others have described, it is a five-course meal with wine for every course. Save your appetites for this! I highly recommend this experience.

We had a wonderful evening with good food, wine & people. Chef Luis served a huge piece of bife the chorizo which was tasty but not the best steak we had in Argentina. The host were very friendly, entertaining and did great service. We felt as we would have a typicial asado at argentinian friends home. Would recommend this place to experience a good asado!

review_title: The best steaks in south America
review: We had a fabulous evening here. The steaks were the best we ate in a month in south america and the location, company and food was first rate. We walked here from our hotel in palermo soho and the area is safe to walk at night.

I'm really glad we opted to try Steaks by Luis. We made the reservation about a month in advance of our trip to Buenos Aires, which was a stopover on the way to Ushuaia and our Antarctic expedition. As many reviewers have already mentioned, it's one of those "closed-door" restaurants that is in a fashionable loft and only takes place a few times a week. No sign - just a staff member outside to assure you you've found the place! My boyfriend and I actually walked from our hotel to the restaurant (we needed the exercise to help burn off the calories) - about 4.5 miles (7.25 KM)! We made just in time and were welcomed in to find appetizers (cheeses and cured meats) and a sparkling wine. We had some time to mingle and meet the hosts and to view the meats that would be grilled up for our other courses - deliciously beautiful! At a certain time (a little after 9 p.m., I guess) we were instructed to take our seats. We sat down across from an American couple who - it turns out - were heading out on the same Antarctic expedition we were booked on and had posted on a TA forum thread we started! And the couple to my right (from China) were also on the same ship! I would say that pretty much all 20 or so guests were either from English-speaking countries or spoke English so, while you probably won't meet many locals at SbL, you will have plenty of people to talk to! In fact, as in our case, you never know who you might meet! I actually loved the communal dining aspect - it made the time spent at dinner that much more enjoyable.  The food was amazing. We had a salad with cheese and apples along with a nice wine for the second course. The third course was the most interesting: a mixed grill of identifiable sausages and other meats, plus a few that were *mysteries* to some of the diners. They want you to try before you judge because many people avoid certain parts of the cow/pig on principle. Haha. Some of it I liked, some of it I didn't; everyone had an opinion, but most people were game to try all of it. Plus, they served a grilled provolone cheese that was amazing.  The steaks - the main course - were large (12 ounces); I couldn't even finish mine! It came with a side of garlic mashed potatoes that were scrumptious. But I made sure to leave room for the dulce de leche cheesecake, which was both beautiful and heavenly to the palette. Mmmm, mmm! Did I mention we had wine with all these courses? And it just kept magically refilling?  All in all, this is an experience you won't regret and I think it is actually a really great value for the attention and service (and food) that you get. It is a 3+ hour meal during which you will never be bored!

You arrive at a nondescript black door, with a number etched in the glass above. You think this could not possibly be a fine dining venue. Guests are quickly ushered in and up an equally unimpressive concrete staircase, into the dining area. Guests (all tourists from across the globe) meet and mingle over champagne and canapés before being introduced to the wonderful array of fresh meats that will be served later on. Seated around a long, wooden table, diners quickly find that, apart from the food, this is a very social experience and conversations soon develop, whilst course after course of the finest meats, salad and finally dessert are served, each paired with an excellent wine. Pricey, a bit touristy, but, over all, a great experience.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Great food and wine. Really great. Sommelier Diego was fantastic at explaining and remembering everyone's name! Luis was on had to discuss the food, wine and anything else. Got to meet great people from all over the world. Highly recommend!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: This was our first closed door or 'puerta cerrada' experience and we were blown away.  The evening consists of a 5 course meal, each paired with wines but for me personally the highlight of course was the main course - the steak! In general the Argentinians know how when it comes to steaks but Luis just took it up a notch.  Luis and his team was great - making everyone feel at home and comfortable and Luis was even so kind to let guests turn the steaks and interact whilst preparing the food.  Everything was delicious and the setting beautiful in this 'secret loft' in Buenos Aires. It was one of our highlights whilst visiting Buenos Aires and can definitely recommend this wonderful experience.

You have to make reservations ahead for this restaurant. Its very personal dining. It was 6 couples in total when we went. The meal was delicious and so we're the wine pairings. Luis himself is great. It was a good dining experience.

Having recently moved to Buenos Aires we wanted to experience Argentina asado straight away, and this was an easy way to introduce us to this amazing part of Argentine culture. The loft is a beautiful location with a huge table for all the guests. We were welcomed with bubbles on arrival and from then on the table overflowed with food and wine. We were absolutely stuffed by the end of the night - and for a very affordable price. The wine also kept coming - a little dangerous! :-) We learned a lot about asado that night and we've been able to use that knowledge ourselves when we go out to other restaurants in Buenos Aires.

We had an absolutely amazing experience sharing Argentine wine, traditional asada, and stories with people from around the globe during our night with Steaks by Luis. The event runs three times a week in a space that is typically reserved for a wine club. Although our group had about 20 people in it, it served to be a very intimate experience. The night began with a toast and traditional appetizers while mingling with other guests and staff. We continued by a nice presentation of the food and an introduction to the evening by the staff. Next, we sat down for a wonderful dinner - each part of which was superb. My boyfriend's favorite part of the evening was being able to head outside on the balcony with Luis, who showed him grilling techniques and talked about his experience with gastronomy. The food, wine, and company were all wonderful, and we loved being able to meet people during such an enjoyable experience - we have even kept in contact with a few! The staff was absolutely fantastic. Luis was happy to share his knowledge, Pierre was knowledgable and very interesting to talk with, and the rest of the staff was superb as well. A definite highlight of our trip!

Had a great meal at Steaks by Luis. We were joined by five other diners at a communal table and the food, ambiance and service were great.  Upon arrival you're presented with a class of champagne and offered a selection of bread, cheese and meats. Once everyone arrived, you're brought into the dining room facing the open kitchen and windows that look out onto a terrace where Luis is preparing the wood grill. Before the first course, the fresh cuts of meat and cheese are presented and explained.  Each of the four courses are paired with a local wine which is generously (and continuously), poured. There was so much food and the delicious steaks were so huge that no one was able to finish everything beyond the salad course. I found the $75 per person price more than reasonable given the quality and quantity of both the food and wine.  Steaks by Luis is a closed door restaurant so you must make reservations in advance. Our email inquiry made on the website was responded to promptly.  It's easy to see why Steaks by Luis is one of the highest rated restaurants in Buenos Aires. Luis and his staff take great pride in what they do and it shows in every way.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: I had a great time. met great people. The food was really good. My only complaint might be that it was TOO much food.

This is -I believe- the Nbr 3 Restaurant within a total of about 5000 in Buenos Aires. Drink, 1st and 2nd course, wine, dessert, coffee and a plus: $ 26.00 per person and excellent service as well. UN BE LIE VA BLE !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review: The St. Regis Restaurant was a treat. Great presentation and selection of foods that would satisfy most palates for breakfast. We ate there four mornings and the staff was excellent. Lunch on the day we arrived was also very satisfying. We ate dinner at the St Regis one evening and found it to have a lot of interesting food that tended toward Michelin. Unique reconstructed food. Not had norm. Worth a try. The view of the city shows the energy of Buenos Aires.

This restaurant was very quiet when we visited - we were warmly welcomed and offerred a seat overlooking the city - it was just getting dark so it was great to watch the changing sky and traffic flow. The service as first rate. Nothing was too much trouble. The food was superb - all three courses. This was our last night in BA and we had eaten some steak prior to this but were left disappointed by them - the steak here was the opposite - a fillet steak which was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. My husband is not one for taking photos of food but on this occassion the presentation was just amazing. Don't recognise the experiences posted by other reviewers recently.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: After a very quick and slightly terrifying Uber ride, we needed a drink and bloody quick please. We were not disappointed and were taken to a table overlooking the Main Street. As it was only 7.30pm (Argentinian’s don’t eat until 8 or 9pm) we had the place too ourselves. Leonel our attendant spoke good English so ordering was a breeze. Food and wine are so cheap and of such quality it really only comes down to what your taste buds are up for. Small glasses of Sav were the only disappointment, come on Sheraton catch up to other local restaurants who give you a proper size glass of wine. Anyway the MOW tucked into the biggest chargrilled octopus tentacle I have ever seen and I settled for the braised rabbit, both excellent and of large proportions. Just had to have an excellent red from the Cafayete region, much better than Mendoza reds. Mains were rabbit done in pastry and aged steak accompanied with sweetbreads, hmm not really me...Dessert was a grilled banana in its skin with a caramel sauce and a parfait, bloody delicious. Any way service slowed down as more people arrived and the staff were stretched, however they made up for it by providing an excellent champagne FOC. Well done Leonel.

review_title: Terrible experience with very ordinary food
review: We dined here for the Christmas eve lunch event which was quite a costly experience, even for Argentinian standards. The food was inedible in parts and acceptable canteen style food at best which just didn't match the arrogant and often unfriendly wait staff. Besides one very charming, eager young waiter who was happily training his English while working on our Spanish at the same time, there were quite a few older "supervisor" type staff members around who mostly did nothing but chit chatting to each other. The meal had wine included and we had even double confirmed in writing that indeed all wine is included but alas, in the end one of these supervisors had nothing else to do but tell us upon leaving that "only half a bottle per person was included and you drank two bottles in total". Then he pretended to be super generous by telling us "But that's okay, for you I will take it off the bill" clearly fishing for big fat tip. Well- not for that "my friend", we left without tipping a single cent on purpose while we had originally intended to leave some money. All in all, extremely disappointing experience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This is a restaurant in the Park Hotel. Service is very good and it has huge windows giving view to downtown Buenos Aires that are quite beautiful. Food is very good.
Excellent service during dinner time, nice window-views of the downtown city centre. Enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Nice breakfast buffet with great pastries. Scrambled eggs were a little watery, but still good. Lots of choices to appeal to a variety of tastes. Very good coffee.

Out hotel concierge recommended this restaurant and we weren't disapointed. The service was excellent, and the steak was amazing. It seemed that the waiter went out of his way to see that we enjoyed the experience. I would recommend this restaurant to one and all.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: We decided to get an Argentinean steak and could not have chosen a better place. Both of our steaks were cooked to perfection and we topped them off with papa frites a la provenzal. We were both able to buy a half bottle of our chosen wine and the meal was finished with a complimentary limoncello. The service staff were excellent and most helpful.
On an 11 day trip I tried many parillas. Food and service were very good and I was able to walk here from my hotel near the Oblisque. Prices reasonable.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review_title: THERE YOU CAN TASTE REAL ARGENTENIAN MEAT!
review: The restaurant ,although located in a very touristic area of Buenos Aires has avery good quality of foood,Try bife de lomo or bife de choriso but be aware of the portion(grams)because they are usually very big,so you can share

This is our 3rd location in New Zealand and we finally found a restaurant that appreciates flavorful dishes. This is a tapas style restaurant. We ordered the lamb montaditos, calamari and chorizo, and the daily salad. The lamb set atop some mint and bread with the heavenly smoked paprika was crazy good. The calamari, chorizo and potatoes had a wonderful flavor also. Also was looking for a nice green salad - like a Greek salad with olives, roasted tomatoes, cokes- perfectly satisfying.  Staff was very busy yet never ignored the customer's needs. Highly recommend! Maybe we'll revisit when we go to Christchurch!

Drove past this location and it sounded great, jumped on the website to see what they offered and realised it was one thing! It is lamb should and scalloped potatoes, you can add sides, if needed. It was really yummy and fell off the bones. We ordered 1 box which was enough for 3 people easily, we added 1 side. They don’t currently deliver but you can pre order and pick up quite easily, whole process was very simple

review_title: OMG, best slow cooked lamb shoulder EVER and they deliver in Queenstown
review: I cannot say how amazing this lamb shoulder was, falls off the bone, super well seasoned lamb and veggies, amazing dinner for 4 that I would recommend to ANYONE wanting to try some slow cooked lamb  We ordered 1 Lamb + 2 Cold slaw salads (to cut the fat) + 4 rolls (to soak up the juices and sauce) which was a perfect portion to normal adults. All inclusive, 77$ NZD (well worth the amount for the quality for 4 adults)  I could talk about how great the meal was but wouldn’t want to waste your time, just go get it  And as the web site for Queenstown doesn’t say it, THEY DELIVER so dont even bother driving there, just call in and get this gem of a slow cooked lamb amazing meal delivered to you

review_title: Great readymade and delivered wholesome meal
review: Lamb and potatoes- it’s that simple. We’ve had it several times over the last couple of visits and it’s a great dinner solution for when you’ve been skiing and want a night in.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Incredible. If you like lamb you can't miss Pedro's. There's one option on the menu, a large leg of lamb, with potatoes, to go. $50. We shared it between four of us with a side of coleslaw and some of their freshly baked bread. The lamb fell off the bone and was perfectly spiced / seasoned. Happy, happy...

This place was recommended highly by other trip advisor writers, so we tried it and we were not disappointed. It fed 2 people for 2 nights. We also noted that there is construction next door therefore parking is harder than usual. Order online or on the phone and go pick it up. They have seedy rolls to die for.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: When the menu only has one offering, it must be good!
review: This place only offers superbly tender lamb shoulder with sliced potatoes and roasted with light seasoning for under 50$. You can add some bread or coleslaw.  We tried this the first night we spent in Queenstown. We had it take-away as we want to have dinner in our own accommodation. Serving is enough for 3 persons, lamb is roasted well and the potatoes are perfect.  Highly recommend this place.

I had this last time, all by myself. It lasted me for 3 meals, dinner, breakfast and then dinner again while I was staying at my hotel. I went with the wife and friends this time and had to get them to try it. We ordered a delivery to the hotel for this which cost an extra $8. Well worth it if you don't have a vehicle and don't want to walk to get it. The delivery was spot on time. The lamb was still as tender and melt in you mouth as i'd remembered. Everyone loved it. It served 4 of us nicely. I will definitely be ordering this again next time I am in Queenstown.

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review_title: When in NZ, must eat lamb!
review: Delicious lamb and potatoes dinner that easily fed 2 adults and 2 kids for nearly 2 full meals! Tender and fall off the bone meat. We walked across the street to the grocery store to buy rolls and salad to supplement the meal as well. Makes a uniquely NZ takeaway meal!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review: Although $50 NZ sounded like a big price for roasted lamb dinner with scalloped potatoes, it actually served four adults. We also bought 4 rolls to sop up the yummy gravy and a side of coke slaw. Total of $63NZ was cheap dinner for 4 in Queenstown. Really tender lamb that fell off the bone and tasty potatoes. A real find. They have shops in Auckland and Christchurch too.

One tray is perfect for two people with some leftovers for a yummy lunch. The lamb is fantastic. It seems quite expensive but when you look at the quality of the food and the amount that you get it is actually really good value. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;60+ Traveler
review: Our party of four had a takeaway dinner one night from this business. After ringing to place our order, we were able to pick it up almost immediately. The slow cooked meat melted in your mouth and the potatoes were delicious. Maybe a little more potato is warranted for four people. We thought that, last time we were in Queenstown a few years ago. We did order a salad to go with it and although tasty, was nothing like the salad in the photos online. We would use this venue again. Not a large menu, but a tasty one.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: In Queenstown we ordered this lamb as we read it was very good. It is!!!  Three out of our 5 was into lamb so one of their shoulders with potatos and a side of salad was plenty for us. Delivered still quite hot.  The lamb was very good- juicy, tasty, not over cooked. Much better then some of the restaurants we had tried. The potatoes and salad was also good.  Well recommended for any one who likes lamb.

Very simple, one dish - Lamb and Potato. I am not really a potato girl, but the Lamb was pull apart succulent, juicy & tasty. A great idea to purchase and then accompany with your own extra’s. A Big serve / Leg of Lamb for $50 we did not think we would consume all in one sitting but we managed to in the end. Happy we called in and experience this iconic place.

If you love a good piece of lamb, then try here. Absolutely divine. As soon as you walk through the doors, your senses are smothered with a beautiful lamb scented smell. Word of warning, they only do one size, large shoulder roast (with potatoes and gravy). This is enough for two adults or a family. I bought one for myself as I was travelling solo (yay, no wife and kids). It gave me dinner, breakfast and a snack after snowboarding the next day. The flavours were lovely and worked well together. The gravy and potatoes were nice and the lamb was pull apart, melt in your mouth. Do yourself a favour and try this with your friends and family. The site is about a 10 minute stroll from Central Queenstown (Fergburger as a reference) so its easy to get to. A really nice lamb dinner.
Our first dinner in Queenstown after an 18 hour flight! Wonderful tender roasted lamb falling off the bone with lovely roasted potatoes! Best meal after a long flight!

Lamb and scalloped potato was amazing! Staying at a BnB made this the best choice when the weather poured down raining. Like having mums home cooking! Best decision when you want good quality take out... yum

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review_title: spotted this place while checking out the food store
review: Say the place, walked over, left with dinner. The lamb dinner for $47 or so dollars and a salad was great deal. Walked it back to our hotel and had more than enough food for dinner as well as sandwiches for the next day.

Firstly!! IT IS A TAKEAWAY AND HAS NO MSG IN IT, OK!! Just superb lamb with potatoes and a wonderful light sauce. Takeaways do not get better than this nor does lamb, absolutely fantastic tasty delicious Lamb. All for a great price and delivered free! Do it, you will not be disappointed.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We are from England and the UK prides itself of its rearing of good quality Lamb. Both of us love Lamb and were looking forward to trying New Zealand Lamb. And we were not disappointed for we had many lamb meals on our tour of New Zealand and Pedro’s was the best Lamb meal by far.  The whole slow baked lamb shoulder is seasoned with rosemary & garlic and served with a side of scalloped potatoes. Its advertised as a meal to share BUT it takes a big appetite to shift half your share. It’s a fair old walk from the town so take care as it is a busy road but well worth the effort.

Their lamb is steamed and melts out of the bone. you dont need a knife its soft. Have had many lambs all over the world and this is SPECIAL. The potato tastes delicious with the lamb as well. This place is an Epic - MUST DO

user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Lamb shoulder and boulangere potatoes - take it or leave it. What a marvellous business model!  Meal costs $45 and the meat will easily serve 3 (could stretch to 4 but then you’ll be light on spuds). We had ours delivered to our motel room for an $8 supplement (credit card accepted with phone order), which not only saved me the effort of finding them but also meant the food was with us sooner than I could have got it myself! Full marks for service.  The lamb was incredibly tender although not as flavoursome as that offered by a certain Gourmet restaurant in Wanaka, but had we not eaten there I too would give this five stars [as a take-away].

Their slow cooked lamb shoulder is that tender it just falls off the bone and melts in your mouth, so yummy. Accompanied by seasoned scalloped potatoes the $45 meal deal advertised for 2 has enough meat and potatoes to easily feed 3 people. Based on what other takeaways and restaurants charge in this town this represents a good value. Give it a try you won't be disappointed.

Ordered the standard Lamb Shoulder & potatoes for 2 people and it was huge. Lamb was melt in the mouth with a tasty sauce and even better that we had some for left overs.  If you were a family with small children you could get away with ordering for 2 and just getting some extra potatoes or bread.  Do one dish and do it well is definitely what they're doing at Pedros.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: We Drove over from Millbrook in Arrowtown - DELICIOUS!!
review: This lamb with potatoes is one of the best meals in NZ. We brought it back to our apartment and had a feast! It is juicy and tender and is plain good. There were four of us and we shared two meals. It was plenty. Go try good old home cooking!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: For $45 you get a shoulder of lamb falling off the bone with plenty of roasted slices of potato. There is very limited seating so take away is what everyone seems to do. You can get a very nice fresh salad with dressing and bread rolls to make it a tasty meal. It was much more than the two of us could eat. Recommend

review_title: Fantastic food, amazing value for money
review: $45 for succulent lamb and beautifully cooked scalloped potatoes to feed two good appetites for two meals. There's only one thing on the menu; lamb and potatoes. But Pedro's knows that it's doing! Both are packaged into a foil packed baking tray- easy to heat up at home. The lamb was falling off the bone and the potatoes were crisp on top and had soaked up some of that wonderful jus. Amazing meal to have at home. Pedros have upped the standard for takeaways.

review_title: Great home delivery after an active day
review: We had 3 trays of lamb and potatoes (plus a salad to make us feel better about all that meat and spuds) home delivered after a days skiing.  The whole meal was very good - delicious lamb soft and flavoursome (some might say a little on the salty side).  Highly recommend - seems like a great way to feed a group after an active day.

review_title: Super Lamb and super price of $45 also they deliver for $8
review: Pros: Great value, great food, big portions, friendly folk cons: website doesn't say delivery so you can get it delivered for $8 which is worth it.  1 is enough for 2 people. Seriously. We are hungry guys and massively over ordered but have been enjoying the lamb for a couple of extra days.

We learned about Pedro's House of Lamb from fellow travelers we re-encountered while on a walking tour of Arrowton and so stopped by there on our return to Queenstown. We were very impressed by the offering and by the people. Pedro's provides a slow roasted lamb shoulder together with cooked, sliced potatoes, which we call scalloped potatoes at home. We had choices to make: we could consume our order at the picnic tables outside the store; or we could have our order delivered to our accommodation for an additional $8 or we could pre-order and pick up (takeaway?) the meal package at a prearranged time. We opted for the last choice. We had time therefore to explore the Skyline Gondola prior to our return and mealtime. When we returned, our order was not yet ready so we had time to go across the street to the grocery and acquire "happy hour" and salad fixings. Returning to our "home," we dined. The meat literally fell off the bone. It was moist, tender, and delicious. The potatoes were fully cooked but firm and not mushy. It was sufficiently abundant to feed 4 hungry adults. Costing $45, it was tremendous value. We later discovered another Pedro's in Christchurch when we arrived there and so surmise that it is a chain operation.

We arranged for slow baked shoulders of lamb to be delivered to our accommodation in Queenstown. Price for delivery was $8 with 5-10 minute window frame for delivery time.  We ordered and paid earlier in the day. Takeaway is situated on Gorge Road, almost opposite the New World shop.  Delivery was on time. We ordered three shoulders of lamb enhanced with rosemary and accompanied by potatoes (not roasted but sliced baked with the lamb).  There were smallish loaves of bread to accompany the meal available from Pedro's.  Good family sized meal for mum, dad and two. Staff showed us the meal size when we went to order.

review_title: The best place to eat in Queenstown! #Fact
review: The staff are outstanding- always putting a smile on my daughters with outstanding service, kindness , hospitality and genuine fun interaction. Thank you Benny, Sam and Kalos! The food is delivered not long after ordering. It is delicious having ordered two pizzas, curly chips and drinks, always with leftovers to take home and enjoy the next day. I have now taken my family there twice on our holidays in Queenstown having first discovered it in September/ October school holidays 2021. Highly recommended for families, couples, friends... Highly recommended for everyone in other words.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Found this restaurant on First Table so decided to book it, we were not disappointed great food at a good price. The service was excellent and food delivered quickly. We decided to share 2 sides and a pizza all excellent. We went at 5PM only people there but within half an hour alot of tables in use, great to see. Would we go again..... definitely
Need hangover food? Their $10 lunch menu has you covered! Pizza, loaded fries and more Free pool and big screen for sport This is where the Kiwi Crawl starts

Wonderful ambiance and awesome service. Went with my Wife and young son. Amnah she was wonderful, suggested instead of three pizzas we have two pizzas which one was a half and half as three would be too much. Amnah was spot on as we didnt finish the two we had. Garlic bread was devine and curly fries yummy. The Cocktail Amnah also made for my wife was 10 out of 10 she said. Those who like to relax over a game of pool this is available as well. My son loved how the restaurant is underground. Would definitely recommend this establishment.

Amazing $10 deals for lunch. The Margarita Pizza was amazing, service was solid and the chef kept us happy. Much appreciated relaxing lunch after our Nevis Swing ... honestly we also really need a couple of adult beverages.
The Pizza was quite tasty and very good. We really liked it. The price range was a bit costly for us. The service was amazing.

My wife and I decided to come here for dinner based on the TripAdvisor reviews. We were served by Alia who was friendly and took our orders promptly. Pizzas were okay but not like your traditional Italian restaurant type. I would have much preferred the traditional wood fired type pizzas. Nevertheless atmosphere was good and staff were polite and friendly.
We came thru here on a crawl, it was a good time. Good drinks, friendly folks, nice venue. As part of the crawl, they served us pizza, it was pretty good too!

This place is really cool, you go down into a nice warm space that smells delicious, the service team are very friendly and quick to greet and seat you. The pizza is fresh and has lots of flavour and a nice wine list to wash it down. Would definitely come back

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: This is an excellent place to have dinner!! We looked at the line for Fergburger and decided to eat at the London instead. So happy we did! I had a pizza, which was really good, but my friend had the Mac & Cheese. Kind of wish I'd had the Mac & Cheese after I saw it... lol! Regardless, the food was excellent and they have a decent beer list. We had a coupon for the house beers, which persuaded us to have seconds! The service here is also very fast, friendly and more similar to North American service than typical NZ food service.
Absolutely delicious tacos and nachos. Crispy tortilla chips with heaps of flavour. We had the beef tacos. Could have eaten 5 of them! We will be back.

review_title: Taco Fail... I hope they just had a bad day!
review: Ok. I'm very spoiled living in LA. TexMex and Tacos are the best outside of Mexico there imo. When to Taco Medic for a quick lunch. Ordred the bowl. There were 3 people in front of me still I had to wait almost 30 minutes to get my food. I ordered a bowl which by now means looked like any other "bowl" I've had the last couple of years. This was a paper box with cabbage in the bottom and lots of dressing/sauce (?) and a few pieces of over salted fish on top. They seemed stressed out and there was all sorts of chaos with drinks not being restocked, the chef setting his timer for 2 hours instead of 2 minutes... I wanted to love this place based on all great reviews but I was terribly disappointed. Didn't even finish my meal.

Checked out the new shop in Frankton at Queenstown Central. Such a welcoming and friendly team, the chef checked how we enjoyed our tacos after. Fantastic as always. Love the new koura with prawns and my partner loved the new Shepherd with lamb :) can't wait to go back!

We had the fish and beef tacos and they were great. We ordered 2 more after we finished our first order. The ingredients are fresh and made right in front of you. We sat at the bar in front of the grill. The staff is very friendly too.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: Tasty as and fresh ingredients....good value for Queenstown!
review: We ordered takeout stockman and bushman tacos (beef/pork) from this hole in the wall and were happy with the tasty flavours and fresh ingredients....good value in overpriced Queenstown!

We walked to the place and ordered. All of the selections looked good so we had a battered fish taco and pork and chicken tacos. The beers are 9$NZD so we passed those up. It was pretty cold and rainy out the nite we came so we did not eat at the tables outside.
found this place last year when we visited Queenstown and made sure to return here again this year. Fresh, delicious tacos that will satisfy your cravings.... Must try!

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: A hidden gem worth hunting for
review: Yep.. we used google to find this place. Small shop in a lane Focused menu of 8 tacos. Including Vegan and Veg. Beer choice of Corona. Tequila shot or Margarita. Loved the Chicken. Beef was good Flavoured sodas refreshing Actually in Searle Lane

review_title: Great hole in the wall spot with fantastic street tacos
review: We popped in here for a taco fix and beers and could not have been happier. The tacos were large and excellent. Each was unique and tasty. Make sure to try a few of the custom made sauces that they have to top things off. A must stop!!

Best tacos I've had. Very basic outlet, you can eat in at the bar or out at communal tables so great vibe. About 8 tacos on the menu, all perfected. Totally delicious and worth wandering off the beaten track to find.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We ate there twice in a row since they keep their kitchen gluten free. Loved sampling the different tacos and all ingredients tasted fresh and carefully prepared. Very casual seating.
While the tacos here are quite tasty, we both walked away still hungry after spending $51 for 2 tacos each, a beer and a margarita.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Stumbled upon this hole in the wall taco shop while wandering around Queenstown, what a gem! Awesome tacos, I had to 2 different fish tacos and the nachos with black beans on. All very tasty. Margaritas were also fab but my partner didn't like the cola they served. Limited seating but you just have to all squeeze up and share. Definitely worth a visit!

We came here for dinner and we were not disappointed! We had two beef tacos that were fabulous and the guacamole and salsa. Very tasty just a smallish serve. The frozen margaritas were also wonderful. A cheap and cheerful dinner. Small space with a long bar and a few outside tables - So don’t expect too much flash!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Our first port of call in Queenstown, having seen great reviews on here. Not disappointed. Great tacos, pleasant and efficient service, very tasty. Salad was fresh and crisp, both of my fish choices were super. There is a reason for the excellent reviews!

Being a lover of Tex Mex food, I did pay this place a visit on a recent trip. My family tried the Fish and Fried Chicken Taco's. All were fantastic. Check the website for prices and menu. We ordered "Take away" and only waited 5 minutes before the 6 Taco order was ready. Great spicey sauces too!

Last year, the person I was travelling with wouldn't have a Taco, so this year I made sure I came back to try Taco Medic... It didn't disappoint...  Had the beef and pork tacos. Dont know why some of the reviews on here say they are small, they are well ample and up to spec on what you would expect for a taco anywhere.  Well flavoured, easy to eat. Love the atmosphere of the small bar/small food joint scene and this place is small and rocking.  The banter from the staff was epic as well. Overall a great experience.

Quick. Range of fillings. The tacos are made in corn tortillas and are not stodgy. Price wise - around $8 a taco with a saving of around $1 per additional taco that you order. Service was fast, friendly and efficient. Once the tacos arrived there was a choice of three sauces - the hot one was reasonably spicy, which is unusual for NZ. Highly recommend it.

Tricky to find & we wanted to eat here after reading the great reviews. But thanks to Google maps we arrived. Friendly staff both nights. First time we had chicken tacos second visit vege nachos with guacamole. Wow great flavours & nachos could easily be shared with 2 or 3 people. Highly recommend & will be back next time we are in Queenstown. Thanks

Taco Medic is located down one of the many laneways in Queenstown. The guys at the shop are super friendly and serve up delicious fresh tacos straight from the grill. The pulled pork and the battered fish tacos were our favourites!
We ordered the bushman and the stockman.both excellent. We both liked the stockman the best. Nachos very good but nothing spectacular.

Absolutely delicious food and service. From the moment we walked in, we felt like we were back in Italy. I had Spaghetti Bolognese and my husband had Spaghetti Vongole. Simple food and bursting with flavour. We will definitely be back!

review_title: Better places to eat in Queenstown
review: We booked this restaurant due to reviews on Tripadvisor and were unfortunately disappointed with our meal. It is a very busy Italian restaurant and bookings are essential but I think it is trading now on past excellence. The restaurant is on the small side and we were crammed into a small table for 2 right at the back of the restaurant. Given menus and told specials and then took a while to come back for our drink order. We gave our food order at the same time. Our shared entree arrived fairly quickly and before we had finished it, our mains arrived. I commented that we had not completed our entree - no reaction and main meals pushed onto the table. Our entree was dough balls which were ok - really bread rolls with olive oil. For mains we had spaghetti carbonara and zucchini fusilli. The pasta is said to be home made and it was nice but the sauces served with both meals was lacking and the meals were not very hot. It felt like we were expected to eat up and get out as soon as possible so they could fill the seats again. Better places to eat in Queenstown.

Absolutely loved it. Came here with a group of mates. Staff were friendly, food delicious and the atmosphere noisy and vibrant. If you want a quiet romantic dinner, this isn’t the place. Will eat here again.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review: Another special meal! We really were craving authentic pasta and were lucky to score a reservation. Terrific food and great service from start to finish. Many places we’ve been to seem to thrive on chaos, but this place seemed very well run and the manager was completely cool. My husband and I shared the Caprese salad, and then we each had a pasta dish. Finished off the dinner with dessert and coffee.  You def need a reservation, but the meal is worth the advanced planning.

This place is a ripper. Really recommend booking in advance as we sat in the front window area and watched countless walkup people turned away due to capacity. Bella Cucina is only a small restaurant with the kitchen/pizza oven centre to the room. The menu changes almost daily to some extent, and is not extensive but covers you for choice nicely. Don't load up on bread first (the garlic bread is a pizza size) as the main dishes are plentiful servings. Gnocchi was terrific. Dessert of tiramisu was excellent. The staff member at reception and serving tables was so calm, unflustered and efficient, always with a smile despite the constant queue of people out the door. Would definitely recommend and return.

chose to visit here knowing that the pizza and pasta were housemade and therefore no GF options available. however there were plenty of other options and i had a divine squid dish. great range of italian wines and the smells from the pizza oven were sensational!!!

A little bit of Italy right here in Queenstown! The food was very authentic - homemade pasta and gnocchi- what more can you ask for? Panna cotta to die for, that’s what! The service was excellent and would highly recommend if you’re in Queenstown.

review_title: Tastes as good as it smells on entry
review: Delicious aromas greeted us as we walked in, and the food was as delicious as it smelt. A huge pizza oven looks great as you enter. The restaurant is very cosy and the staff very friendly and very efficient. Weis our server, was attentive and warm. Very bubbly. The Pappardelle frutti do mare and Bruschetta were our favourites

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Although Queenstown was a lot quieter without the tourists than I am used to, I found Bella Cucina to be overflowing with people, attesting to the excellent cuisine served there. The menu changes regularly to make the best use of fresh ingredients, and the service by Laurie was impeccable. She was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and the wine matching options, and the food we sampled based on her recommendation was without fault. In particular, the prosciutto was mouth watering and the panna cotta a delight!
We love this restaurant. Food and service was great. Everything fresh and delicious. The waitress Laure went above and beyond.

The food and atmosphere here is wonderful. We shared some olives to start followed by a very delicious risotto and heavenly prawn pizza. To finish we had a tiramisu which we really enjoyed. Exceeded expectations and we will definitely be back next time we are in Queenstown.

We were impressed at the genuine Italian looking and tasting food here. Having been to Italy several times, this restaurant was trying hard to match the genuine experience. Relatively limited menu but would certainly recommend this restaurant. Make sure you book ahead though as we saw several turned away at the door.
Amazing experience, food was outstanding and service top quality for Queenstown. We had Shane serving us who was extremely knowledgeable and made us feel so welcoming for such a big group

review_title: Had promise then slow let down
review: Wow to originality of ostrich dish . Big tick . Quail good . What let this place down ? Tuna too small , scallop dish average . Venison tick . Salmon and snapper. Overcooked and gnocchi not sure what it was supposed to be. Has potential but no where near other places here . Staff need a friendly reminder that rudeness and arrogance is not acceptable when people ask questions .

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The Bunker Restaurant is set in moody dark space. The welcoming smile from Emma was lovely on arrival as was the cocktail bar service from Claudio which was warm and jovial followed by waiting service from Emma, Penny and Adam with professionalism and a smile. Thanks also to the kitchen crew who made the delicious degustation dinner.

review_title: Fantastic food provided with care and love
review: Really enjoyed a beautiful dinner at the Bunker last night with my wife and friends. The food was beautifully prepared and served with care and love. The ambiance in the restaurant was lovely and there was a very uncrushed feel to the whole evening.
The service was excellent. The food range was varied. The quality of the dishes was excellent. The atmosphere is cosy and warm. The adult non alcoholic beverage range was limited and needs attention.

We went for the full 8 courses, we arrived on time and were offered either to sit at the bar or to head to the table and start. This was a great way to start the meal as it set the scene for it being about us and not rushed.  The waiter loves his job and was excellent at explaining each dish and all of the components.  Each dish appeared to one up the one before all with great balance and flair.  The non-alcoholic drinks menu is good and they are happy to make up a mocktail to your taste on the night  Overall a great atmosphere with awesome food and great service

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Was recommended by a friend to visit The Bunker and it didn’t disappoint. Bar staff were fantastic and made us feel at home straight away. Vibe is great (although a few ‘snooty’ people obviously frequent this place after work!). We sat at the bar, watched the bar staff work their magic with cocktails and chatted to various other visitors. Ordered an assortment of cocktails and generally had a very pleasant evening!! Lovely fire and intimate setting. Would def go back Note that we were in the upstairs part (I think that there is a restaurant bar downstairs as well..)

Incredible, from service to food I couldn’t recommend this place enough. Classic old school dinning with a modern twist, along with beautiful New Zealand food couldn’t fault it. Thanks to the team at bunker for making the night.

Best lamb I’ve ever tasted very nice restaurant and you would usually have to make a reservation to get into it but we were here during the Coronavirus panic so got in easily. The duck liver parfait was perfect to share between 3 people. When the world goes back to normal I hope this place opens again.

We have been to the Bunker with my family to enjoy some delicious food. We didn't know how delicious it was going to be.. We took the degustation menu with the matching wines and it was the best choice ever! Everything was well explained by Geo, our amazing waiter. It definetly the place to go when you're in Queenstown. Everything was perfect : bar, restaurant, service until the end of the night. Thank you for having us!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Highlight for our final honeymoon meal in NZ
review: Booked online (easily) based on a friend’s recommendation. Decided to do a la carte rather than the degustation menu as we preferred the choices. Both of us really enjoyed each of the three courses and the service. Cocktails and beer selection great too! The Belgian waiter was particularly helpful. We consider the prices good for the quality of food. Just under $300 for 2 of us including drinks. The only thing that was not great was that every other table seemed to get a recap of the contents of each dish when brought to the table; on all 3 courses for us this didn’t happen.

We were visiting Queenstown for hubbys significant birthday and needed a dining experience that we could remember for all the right reasons! We chose the Bunker based on the menu and the cozy atmosphere and for the extensive cocktail list. It was easy to make a booking online which is essential as the restaurant is small . The cocktail bar is upstairs and has a large fireplace which on this night had a roaring fire. The bar has comfortable seating with leather deep buttoned couches. We had a MaiTai and a Toblerone which were delicious. service was good. The restaurant is downstairs through a secret door! The wait staff were very good. As stated the restaurant is small maybe 10 tables. We were seated at the back of the room with one other table behind us. The young lady on that table kept up a running commentary and we could hear everything she said! We didn't hear her partner at all so can only surmise she was talking loudly. For starters we had the Duck liver parfait which was really good and the Southern Ocean scallops which were also excellent but for $28 would have expected more than just 2 smallish scallops. There should have been at least 4 for that price. For mains we had the beef and the pork belly with pork loin. All competently prepared with flavoursome jus but the pork had no crackle. What!! pork belly with no crackle it's the best part!! We had 2 glasses of wine. 1 pinot gris and 1 Shiraz. We were too full for dessert. Had this been a memorable meal??? Probably for the wrong reason of the 2 scallops!! It was certainly good and in a tourist town like Queenstown they do appear to take pride in the food and their business. For a special night out it is worth it.

Great cozy restaurant for an intimate meal. Our starter was delicious. For my main I had the fish and it was a little dry and not much flavor, in my opinion, so I was a bit disappointed. The desert was good. Not the best meal I’ve had but a great night.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review_title: Probably the best restaurant in town
review: This is a small, cozy, warm and friendly restarurant that serves some of the more sophisticated and elaborate food in town. The bar is on the econd floor, while the restaurant occupies the ground floor. A warm fireplace welcomes you, along with friendly and efficient wait staff. The menu offers a number of excellent appetizers, salads and main dishes along with choice desserts and an excellent selection of wines. Service is careful, attentive and effective.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: One of the few restaurant we encountered in Queenstown with all Kiwi waiters. Very cosy wood lined downstairs dining room with open fire place and subdued lighting. Was perfect for a cosy date night. Food was great and wine selection by the glass excellent.

A small restaurant hidden away in Queenstown Fine dining with great service. Meals are good size. You will not leave hungry Finish the night off with a final drink in the bar upstairs. Love this place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review: As per the title of this review the food and service were fantastic. I personally didn't love the space which was quite dark and cramped so I feel this would be more of a winter dining destination (as it is cosy) than a summer one. We would have liked to check out the bar too but did not manage to do that on this occasion. I think, when we dined here previously (many years ago) that we had our meal on the upper level where the bar now is. I was keen to try some cocktails and was told that not all cocktails made in the bar were available in the restaurant and I wasn't sure why but that's ok. I did have 2 very nice cocktails whilst there (pink diamond and a dessert cocktail as I had no room for dessert after the amazing entree and main). Both myself and my husband had the Paua entree which was sublime and we then had mains as follows: Hubby had the beef which was divine and I had the duck which was exquisite. I can't recall the exact side dishes we had but we had 2 and they complemented our mains beautifully. Wine: the wine list was good but not amazing and somewhere as 'exclusive' as The Bunker should have a better selection IMHO.
Great atmosphere in the bar at night, started off on wines then single malts. Very much enjoyed our hour or two here.

Things were about to go downhill very quickly when we arrived for our reservation and there had been a mix up and they had booked us in for the following Saturday. We had the proof on our phone that it was indeed their error. The great thing is that they handled this issue professionally and without fuss. We were taken upstairs to the cocktail bar for drinks and to wait while they shuffled things around to accommodate us. We were so relieved as we had been looking forward to coming here for ages. Finally we were seated in the restaurant and had a lovely evening with lots of delicious food. We especially enjoyed the starters - the scallops and the hare. The hare unfortunately had a couple of rogue bones but it still tasted amazing. For dessert we shared a beautiful fondant and they also gave us the petit fours seeing as the first attempt at our fondant had apparently collapsed. The Bunker is a wonderful restaurant and they know customer service.....any place can have issues but it is how they handle those issues which demonstrates the quality of their service.

This bar I have been to every year when visiting Queenstown.  They have a huge array of drink options and also many cocktails to try. They do a delicious Espresso Martini.  The vibe is cool and laid back and one of our favourite spots is the outside lounge area around the pit fire.

We were lucky to be invited to a birthday dinner of 12 work friends in the intimate private dining room. From the moment of arrival to the final farewell, it was a night to remember. The blazing fire, the attentive staff and the welcome drinks were just the start we needed. The selection of wines is outstanding and the bespoke meals are great combination of the best ingredients and artistic skills of the chef. The cocktails and whisky to finish the evening just added to the festivities.

Casually walked in early with no booking had to return in a hour after a bit more shopping to get one of only 8 tables. Friendly service had a bit of wait to get drinks and order in and eventually meals but well worth the wait. Diners could chose the degustation option with or without matching wines , we chose to order separate, For starters my wife had the tuna with crayfish rolls in a broth while I had the Scallops, which turned out to be the best flavoured dish & most popular by customer choice. For mains I had the duck while my wife had the Venison which was the better of the 2 & other diners at a nearby table also agreed. We did not order dessert as we had a reasonably large & late lunch. I am gluten free but chef has plenty of options, also a non drinker, great mocktail options also available. A little noisy with the small room size but cosy & warm with the inside wood fire. Still would return again, would rate 4.5 due to slightly slow service but gave them a 5 star as only option available.

review_title: Fantastic experience that should be on your list when you visit Queenstown!
review: My wife and I were lucky enough to first experience The Bunker on a trip to Queenstown back in 2002. We were quite surprised that after such a long time the restaurant was still making memories for locals and tourists alike.  This is not a restaurant that you decide to drop in on at the last minute. It's often booked out well in advance and sports around 7 or so tables for a very intimate dining experience with friends or loved ones. In fact, we booked over a month in advance to make sure they could seat our party of 5.  Plan to take your time and this is one location that it pays to trust the kitchen, as they have a fantastic degustation menu, featuring ingredients from the South Island of New Zealand. Matching New Zealand wines are also on offer and in my opinion you're missing a fabulous experience if you choose to à la carte.  We started the evening with cocktails followed by a dish titled "Amuse" - described as a daily creation or local delicacy. On this day, we were served a starter of Cervena Venison. It came cooked perfectly with 3 beautiful contrasting sauces.  The next dish was a choice from the Southern Ocean or Marlborough region, scallops or wild boar respectively. I chose the boar - Mille Peuille of apple, parsnip remoulade with a well matched Amisfield Pinot Gris from Central Otago.  The next course hailed from the West Coast or Bannockburn - Conit of baby abalone, or Seared Loin of hare and braised leg. The hare was served with confit kumura (New Zealand native sweet potato), sour cherries, kawakawa jus and a Surveyor Thompson Pinot Noir from Central Otago.  A nice little citrus sorbet followed as a palate cleanser.  The Main course was either a Centrol Otago Alpine Merino lamb backstrap and braised neck, or Nelson sourced seared pink snapper. The Merino Lamb was spectacular, served with baby vegetables, pea sponge, thyme jus and a Church Road Reserve Merlot/Cabernet blend from the Hawkes Bay.  Dessert was a classic New Zealand kiwi fruit pavola with local fruit and mascarpone with a Brancott Letter Series Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough.  Lastly, we were treated to a local cheese selection with figs, nuts and a Cloudy Bay Late Harvest Riesling from Marlborough once again.  The wait staff were fantastic. Every course was described in detail and the quality of service was second to none.  Treat yourself to an experience and make sure The Bunker is on your list when you next visit Queenstown.  Highly Recommended.

review_title: Food was good but service was poor
review: We dined at this Thai Restaurant when visiting Queenstown.  Nice venue and our table overlooked the street below.  I ordered a shared Seafood Tom Yum , Coconut Prawns and a Tiger Beer.  I waiting some time and my drink hadn’t arrived so I followed it up. She had forgotten??  Our Tom Yum arrived and it was large and very good. The Coconut Prawns we ordered had not arrived and this was also followed up. She said this wasn’t ordered? My wife and I heard the order made.  So the order taking left a lot to be desired.  We finished off with fried banana and ice cream which was a huge serve.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: An excellent Thai meal right in the heart of downtown Queenstown CBD. Nice setting and pleasant decor. I had Chicken Pad See Ew and I must say excellent quality. Very reasonable price of $22. Definitely recommended

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Upstairs restaurant offering Thai food of a sort. We were a group and ordered 2 starter/platter dishes. The platters arrived and the basis of the platter was “chips” - fried potatoes!!!! There were some mini pancake rolls, some soggy samosas and salad and carrots. $28 per platter. We should have left at that point or rejected the platters but as a group we decided to stay. The main courses came out and in essence.....was not a Thai meal - just Asian cooking. The sweet and sour pork was literally hardly any chicken - just a large quantity of pineapple in a sauce. Utterly disappointing and not a place to return to for a “Thai” meal.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker;Family Vacationer
review: We had a really good meal hear. It is not a huge restaurant, which is how we like it, but I would book ahead.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Thrifty Traveler
review: This place could do so much better if it was to concentrate on just Thai food. I guess lack of business means they have to vary away which is a shame as they serve good Thai food.No sure if the current. 30% covid discount is legit as $26 for a green curry seems a bit steep. Owners in some ways is perhaps over it and lacks the same charm it previously had..

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: Delicious Thai fare and reasonable by Queenstown standards!
review: We ordered the Hor-Mok Seafood (Blue Cod, Prawn & Squid) as takeaway on the recommendation of The Lonely Planet and so pleased we did.....it was a generous serve with delicious seafood and particularly tender squid and reasonable by Queenstown overpriced standards! The dish went perfectly with our Chard Farm gewurtztraminer that we had bought cellar door.....a must do visit too! Back to the restaurant.....the service was pleasant and friendly.....would definitely return and have the same dish :)

review_title: Takeaway Deal with Good Taste and Good Price
review: We did try $12 Box-TO GO deal for Green Curry Chicken on Rice and Sweet and Sour Pork on Rice. I confirmed that 2 orders will good selection with good taste.  Taste are not 100% Thai Taste but this will be very acceptable for non-Thai customers for sure.  Restaurant is located in the heart of downtown.  Highly recommended

Dined here with family on 9 Oct after reading previous reviews. Our experience was average and we’ve eaten Thai food in lots of different places. Lots of fried food which we’re averse. Tastes and flavours weren’t anything special but portion sizes were very generous; meals were nice and hot. We had a large family next to us that had farmed their children onto a table beside us and the youngest sat there for our whole meal playing a tablet game with the volume turned right up and no-one was remotely worried about it - neither the family or the restaurant staff. That was a little annoying having the tablet music playing. Would have been nice if staff had asked them to turn down the volume. Overall experience was less than optimal. Wouldn’t eat here again, mainly because the food wasn’t anything special, which surprised us based on other reviews. We ordered two of the specials including pork belly and it was pretty oily.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover;Thrifty Traveler
review: Only had the Tom Yum soup with shrimp here but it was delicious. The servers were very sweet too. If I had more time in Queenstown I would have tried their Pad Thai, which is supposed to be really good

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Outstanding food, lovely pad thai and a spectacular curry for me plus really well constructed options for the kids. So many GF/Vegan options anyway and great service. Wins the family vote for the best meal of the week.

The menu did not indicate many vegetarian dishes, but I asked for Pad Thai without meat and it was made with tofu and extra vegetables and was very good. I didn't particularly like the selection of starters. The vegetarian starter included fried spring rolls, which are unusual in a Thai restaurant (they usually have the type with rice paper that are not fried), and deep fried, battered vegetables, which in my view defeat the purpose of eating vegetables. I did not order wine, but my friends did not care for the wine selections--surprising since it is not difficult to find good wine in New Zealand. The wait staff was good-natured, but not at all knowledgeable about wine.

Came here based on the reviews and wasn’t disappointed. Decided to order starters first and main course later and turned out to be a wise decision. Firstly because some people had their main course delivered before they had finished their starters and secondly we realised how big the portions were so after sharing coconut prawns and fish cakes to start we ordered a penang curry to share but needed 2 portions of rice. Was all absolutely delicious and more than enough for 2. Highly recommend.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Beach Goer
review: I LOVED the thai food here. Staff were very friendly and patient with my family group with young children. Meals were so yummy, and reasonably priced. Would recommend to all!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We dropped in for dinner without a booking and they kindly accommodated us. Friendly greeting and shown to a table. There is plenty to chose from on the menu, and very reasonable in price. Wine bottle range was from $32, ave around $45 range. The list was not extensive, but covered off on all areas. We chose to just order entree first, to somewhat control the speed and our experience. Again friendly service, and the food was wonderful. An enjoyable evening. 4.5 Cheers

user_tags: Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Had a really nice meal here about 4pm when they’d just opened. The staff were extremely friendly and very attentive and service was quick. Sat outside on the balcony in the sun eating good food. Would recommend

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Very nice food and excellent friendly service
review: We arrived at this Thai after a very busy day and just as they were opening for dinner at 4 as we’d skipped lunch. We were the only ones there and they gave us the option of indoor or outdoor balcony seating. We sat on the balcony and enjoyed a nice sunny Queenstown afternoon. The service was very attentive and the food we had was nice and flavoursome. I’d recommend the Chicken Pad Thai for sure. Prices were fairly typical for Queenstown. Not too expensive but not inexpensive either.

Wide range of drinks and food including cocktails on the menu. Of note was the lemon, ginger honey tea which was very refreshing - not from a bag!  The food menu has a range of specials ( including blue cod) alongside the usual suspects - curries and noodle dishes. The service was very proficient with each member of staff having a specific role. The food did not take very long at all. Portion wise - satay chicken was 4 skewers and the mini vegetable rolls and tempura was more than enough for two. The mains were a reasonable size and are good value for money. My partner had his usual of yellow curry and you could taste the base ingredients and there were chillies in it, not a common sight in NZ. Both dishes had a good tingle to them and you don't have to ask for a spice level, instead cooked to the level as per the dish.  We didn't book and got a table immediately. They also do take away and have a special $10 menu.  Overall, tasty, good menu and excellent staff.
Nice Thai restaurant overlooking the lake with an excellent selection of dishes a companied by good service and reasonable price.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Varied menu and very tasty food indeed. Staff were attentive, restaurant was clean, organised and service was quick. Food really tasty and even took what I couldn't finish home with me in a box. Would recommend if you want something different to make a change from steak and burgers

Only way to eat here is to share the plates. Four of us thought it was all delicious. The beer list is good but the wine list, whilst solid is not extensive. It’s really the food you come for. Would definitely eat here again.

A very busy little side street restaurant. Bookings in advance essential due to popularity and size of restaurant. We chose the "chef's choice" offer of 7 courses and each was fresh, tasty and diverse. Staff were efficient and helpful.

This great little restaurant was easy to book and we even managed to change our timing via their on line agent with no fuss. Warm welcome and outstanding food. Particularly loved the seared scallops and pork gyuzo.
My family and I dined here a couple of days ago and really enjoyed the authenticity of the venue and the great food. We spent a month (pre lock down) in Japan and this place took us right back.

When we visit Queenstown, we always visit Tanoshi. The food is so delicious, the atmosphere is awesome and the service is great. The Aburi Salmon is a stand out for us - we love it. We enjoy taking our time, ordering izakaya style and chilling with some beers and sake. We did a sake tasting as well which was really good. We will keep heading back.

Love coming here. Always busy and always great. Book ahead if you’ve got time as you’d hate to miss out on great food and great sake. Lovely cold Kirin on tap and a good little wine list. If you’re not sure about which sake to order the staff are happy to help with advice and even tastings. Also a great selection of Japanese whiskies

This place is small and off one of the back alleys; all the people working there are Japanese. The menu is not extensive but the food is flavoursome and authentic. Had a big pipping hot bowl of pork belly ramen noddles which were very tasty. Plus beef teppanaki which was lovely. They sometime run out of noddles so get there early and before they close af 3pm. Open again at 5pm.

7 of us ate here recently. Situated down a grotty lane we were a bit sceptical as to what we would get. The food was ok though, a nice selection of food items, portion size was a bit small and the rice was so expensive for the amount served that we complained and the cost was waived, which was not what we expected or wanted. In all a reasonable meal, but there are probably better options in Queenstown.
We had our lunch here and enjoyed it very much, like we are having it in Japan. The food is good and price is reasonable. Staff is very helpful too.
