Small and tucked away you may miss it , do yourself a favour and eat here, the food is great, and the staff are friendly with great quick service.
A tasty option for dinner when in QT. A little difficult to find, but once you are there the food is fresh and the service excellent.

review_title: Tasty and well priced, but you may have to wait...
review: Tanoshi doesn't take bookings alas so we tried our luck on a Sunday night... 45 minute wait alas! There are literally only about 6 tables inside so no wonder it's busy. All good, they took our number and called us when the table was ready. The food is perfect for sharing, super tasty and great variety. The ribs were incredible!! I've only given it 4 stars because at times service wasn't great... We never got the green tea we ordered and it took a lot to flag down a waiter for more food (despite the place being almost empty by the time we got in). I'd still highly recommend it as a spot to eat though!

We had dinner Good Friday Booked a table online fee weeks prior to visiting queenstown! Small and cosy restaurant great service and atmosphere! So many locals recommended the restaurant Simple wine list and great food Good with kids totally recommend this restaurant happy to return!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: Very popular and very tiny so it pays to book in advance. We didn’t but managed to get the last of two outside tables with a glorious view of cow lane, lol. There were heaters going so it wasn’t that cold and comfortable enough. It was kinda tappa like so I left very satisfied by the delicious food but still a little hungry. It was the only Japanese I’ve been to that didn’t have Asashi beer but had a just as nice other beer so no loss. Very polite and friendly staff so would go back but order more food next time.

Came here last time in Queenstown (April 2019) and also gave it 5 stars. Nothing has changed. The bar has a really good feel and the staff all look like they love their jobs, very efficient and friendly. We had a couple of drinks each and a fabulous platter. Convenient location. Will probably go there again before we leave. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED..
Like so many hospitality venues in NZ, Post COVID, they are short staffed. Good cocktails and a good wine list. The snacks we had were very good

Had a few nights in Queenstown recently. Our son recommended this bar, and he and his wife had twins (7 weeks early) the morning of our visit. I was a bit excited and anxious, and couldn’t help telling the lovely lady at the bar. She gave us a glass of Brancott Estate each, with congratulations. All the staff were great. We had a few more drinks and a wonderful platter. Great atmosphere. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Popped by one aft for a couple of cocktails. Very interesting cocktail menu. Husband and I had two each but had to prevent each other ordering any more before we got carried away! All our cocktails were very well made and absolutely delicious. Very high standard overall, and we know our cocktails. Staff friendly and food sounded good, however we were full from lunch so couldn't try any.

Loved this place...we went here a few times over our holiday and the mulled wine and cocktails are amazing.  We only had snacks here but they were also good (I think they’re made by neighbouring restaurants) but fast and tasty anyway.  Staff were really friendly and service was fast.

Amazing little tapas bar. Great warm toddies and the BEST live music. We went to their Sunday sesh. The guys playing were fantastic. We did go in on Saturday but too crowded for us. Great service. Highly recommend the Sunday sesh.

review_title: Awesome little bar with a great atmosphere
review: We loved this bar in Queenstown. It has everything you could want! Awesome cocktails (Grey Goose Cosmo was amazing!!), great platters of food, awesome view of the mountains and lake, really friendly staff and even good music! We stopped in here several nights on our week's trip to Queenstown and the staff even remembered us (which is amazing given the amount of people that they see each day!). It was popular with the 18-25 crowd as well as those of us 40+  Totally recommend this bar for a visit if you're in town!

review_title: Great cosy vibe at this small lakeside bar
review: Stopped in for a few drinks before dinner.  While it is small the staff were friendly and it had a good vibe.  Music was excellent for our group who loved the throwback playlist (80’s and 90’s).  Fairly limited beer on tap was a bit of a surprise, but that’s being nit picky.
Great cocktails, outside space right beside the lake. Lovely atmosphere and table service. Lovely treat

review_title: Voucher brought us in and no regrets
review: We came here because of a Grabone voucher for platter and wine, and we were not disappointed. A small hip bar on the lakefront, but roomy enough to get a seat and table. Platter was generous in size and very tasty with the local cheeses and meats. Staff were friendly. Came as a couple but could easily have come with children earlier in evening as there was a relaxed atmosphere.

Little Blackwood is a gem of a bar. They a great wine and beer selection and the cocktails look awesome too. The staff are always lovely and friendly and the live music gives it an awesome atmosphere!
Stopped in for a quick pre dinner drink. Great wine list, friendly service and cool view of the harbor. Have previously had pizzas here too and remember them being pretty good. Great drinking spot.

review_title: Did somebody say meat & cheese boards!?
review: This little bar has such a cool vibe, great views of the lake, live music, and excellent meat & cheese boards! Great place to go chill with friends, grab a few ciders and take in the amazing view of the lake.

review_title: Great location for a drink and a snack
review: Right on the lake looking back over Queenstown onto the mountains. Indoor and outdoor seating, a quant bar with great service, good food and a wide selection of drinks.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Second attempt to eat here…seated at the bar. It’s a steakhouse so I got to order that. Rib eye steak medium, side orders are: fries and a salad. Steak was cooked medium as requested but shame they still put some sorta sauce and onions on it after I ordered it plain. (Sauce hides steak flavor) Salad was quite good. Loses a star for sauce on steak.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: Exceeded our high expectations, a meat eaters dream, good food, served with a smile, great atmosphere, highly recommend

Close to the wharf, this bar and restaurant serve liquor and food with the firewood flame to stay warm. We had the fish and chips served piping hot to the table. Quite a happening restaurant in Queenstown.

Great steak! If you love meet, and lots of sides and sauces to go with it, this is the place for you!  It’s a large „warehouse“ style room with plenty of space (but I do advise to book, it seemed full even on a Monday) and right in the centre near the lake, the menu offers plenty of choice for all tastes. Big gin and whiskey offering too, generous portions, fast and efficient service.  Well worth it…but not especially „Cheap“…..

user_tags: History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Bid slow to attend table. Not too busy for a Saturday. Sitting eating you do not see anything South African, only walking up the stairs. Burger nice flame grilled almost like Steers. Food tastefully.

We were staying in Queenstown and had lunch at this venue at Steamers Wharf.  The view from our table was great towards the lake.  Service was attentive and friendly from our male servers.  I had the Sirloin with creamy peppercorn sauce and my wife had the Lamb Skewers. We shared a eye fillet salad.  All of our meals were excellent.

Went here with friends for dinner on first night of golf trip & was not disappointed Everyone was satisfied with what they got & I personally had the mixed grill which if you have a big appetite like me you would not be disappointed with Would highly recommend

We placed a reservation and this restaurant simply exceeds our expectation. The lasy at the front desk delightfully greeted us upon coming and offered a seat as we waited for our time. The table was neatly prepared and we had our lovely personal assitant who took our order and served our food. Her name was Lanie. (Sorry im not sure of the spelling). She was very pleasant and charming with our daughter. The food took 15-20 minutes but it was worth it. The photo doesnt give much justice as it is looking way better on that night. Lol. The size was just right and it was cooked to perfection. The price is reasonable and worth it.

user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We had spotted a menu board for Flame in a nearby arcade, thought it looked good and expected the restaurant to be there, but it wasn't. Eventually we found it and the entrance, not easy with all the roadworks in the centre of town at present. That was the only ropey bit of our visit.  We were seated in the garden area which has lovely ambience with hanging plants and great views out of all the windows. Service was good considering they were busy (Labour Day).  I had the lamb skewer - wow what a dish with the lamb chunks hanging from a skewer suspended over the plate. I got the waitress to remove the chunks and the hanging mechanism as I knew I would have an accident with it! The lamb was absolutely delicious, so tender. I would definitely have that again. Our son had the eye fillet and his was also really really good. My husband had the mussels as a main course - the mussels were small but lots of them and he rated it excellent. Unfortunately the Flambe baked Alaska was off the menu, so I had the Butterscotch Date Pudding which was really good, our son had the interesting chocolate sphere which he enjoyed, and my husband a good Irish coffee.  Of course being a public holiday there was a 15% surcharge on everything, but we had gone anticipating it. We all agreed we would definitely go back there again for a special meal.
Had a beautiful 3 course meal. The service and staff were great, A must is to try the Mozambique Prawns and Flaming Baked Alaska.

What a fantastic place to eat! Especially if you love steak or ribs (half rack so there was room for dessert). We had both and they were delicious. My husband is fussy about his medium rare steak and this was cooked beautifully. We also had the Aromatic chicken and the way that was presented was amazing. The bombe Alaska was pretty special not to mention deliciously decadent. A great drinks menu as well - fabulous! The wait staff were so friendly - wait staff can either make or break your meal, regardless of how good or bad the food was, and the team here were great - super helpful with the menu, happy to have a quick chat and a joke. If you want a special dining experience, put Flame on your list!
Our second time at this restaurant and would totally recommend. Booking essential. I had the fillet steak and it was mouth watering.

Visited here with a group of teenage boys - no one was hungry afterwards! Ribs and steaks both very good, garlic sizzling mushrooms divine. Fairly pricey menu but on par with other similar establishments around the area.

The ribs are absolutely awesome, we’d had a late breakfast so just wanted to share a full rack to see how the ribs rated and wow they did not disappoint, the waitress was great , very present in her job and quick to check everything was acceptable, we highly recommend this place

Great first night of a five night stay in Queenstown. A South African themed steak and meat restaurant with a varied menu. I had the lamb which was delicious. Good range of beers and wine with a nice ambience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Casual lunch/brunch place on the lake. Playing good music! Enjoyed able and relaxing. Mozzarella salad, focaccia, sangria - all were good.

review_title: Hands down the best fish I had in QT!
review: Went here for an early dinner and got a table outside on the dock. Beautiful lake views. Service was prompt and attentive. Unfortunately the kitchen didn't respond to my request to get the hollandaise sauce on the side though. The salmon was super tasty and cooked to perfection with a fresh addition of Fennel and radish as sides. I paired it with the pea/broccoli/mint/feta side. Equally delish. All in all a very nice dinner experience.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review_title: Do not miss this terrific dining experience!
review: We’ve been in NZ for 10 days and this was one of our top 3 meals: outstanding food coupled with superb service.  Believe them when they say a large plate is good for sharing. We shared a dozen oysters (small plate) and then my husband and I each got a large plate because we like different things. The chicken thigh is def shareable. It came with a veggie medley of fresh peas and chopped zucchini with a lovely mint flavor. DH had the whole baked sole, probably not too much for one person. We did get the peas/broccoli/baby spinach side - very nice substitute for a salad and also shareable.  But the best part was the Pavlova - especially shareable and just to die for.  Public was really busy but our server - actually the entire staff - never missed a beat.  This place is a must if you are in Queenstown.

I went on my own for dinner, but should of taken a second person, they have beautiful tapas for sharing as well as you could order a main dish. The pork belly was so tender and tasty. As well as my other dishes.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Hard to give a not so good review in these challenging times but Public Kitchen and Bar has dropped a few notches. Have dined here a dozen times over the past 3-4 years but a combination of significantly increased prices with declining food quality is a negative for sure. Calamari overcooked and of lesser quality, short rib with pasta quite average. Will try again in a few months.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review: I have recently been in Queenstown with my husband and another couple after walking the Routeburn Track. Having been once before a few years ago with a really diverse group who I thought would be impossible to collectively please (they all loved it) I was keen to revisit Public K&B. On finding they were still open and still receiving great reviews it was a no-brainer and off we went. The atmosphere, food and service were all fabulous...I highly recommend this waterfront restaurant and bar....a great night out guaranteed....bookings recommended even though QTN currently quieter than usual.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Fabulous locations and food (lots of vegan options)
review: We ordered most of the Vegan options on the menu and shared them between 3 adults. Probably over ordered! However it was great to taste many dishes and they were all delicious. Friendly service and delicious food, really great to have so many vegetarian and vegan options.

There are few things nicer to do than sit in the sun on the edge of a lake and drink coffee watching planes emerge from behind mountains and climb into a clear blue sky, seeing jet boats giving their passengers thrills with splashy turns, lapping up the warmth of a summer sun with a soundtrack of 60s blues music rumbling in the background. Public Kitchen and Bar on the edge of Queenstown’s wharf area did that. The coffee was good too.

Located within the Steamer Wharf next to the water in Queenstown, Public Kitchen and Bar offers a visually appealing spot for ambiance , food and drinks. Unfortunately, no bread was served before or with the meal. My Cider Roasted Pork Belly with caramelized pears was very good, but my spouse's Twice-Cooked Beef Short Ribs were dry and overcooked. I disliked the additional cost for the Carrot and Parsnips side of vegetables. It took a little time for our mains to arrive when it wasn’t busy. Good selection of beer and wine. Service was cheery. You can eat inside or out.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review: A popular spot on the boardwalk with views of the lake featuring local fare including seafood, veggie risotto and meat. Bar prices can add up quickly so double check what you are paying for when you order

review_title: We walked the town and found this joint....
review: Reasons we loved this place.... 1. Food....all designed to share, we ordered 4 dishes for 2 and was plenty, was great quality, and very filling (note the food comes out as it’s done, don’t blow up if it doesn’t all come at same time!)  2. Beer, good tap beers, was shame no Pilsner but the pale ale was good  3. View.....outside, by the lake, can’t buy that view  4. Playlist... if you are a 50 something the songs all took us back to our mis-spent 20’s  5. Callum.....our waiter....what a legend. Friendly, funny, entertaining, helped us around the menu, made our evening memorable! Restaurants need more Callum’s !!  Highly recommended!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Location is great; food, not so much
review: Location is great; view is great. Food and drink is just so-so; meal portions are somewhat small for the price (location, location, location). Service was fine. Go with reasonable recommendations.

Managed to get a late lunch straight from the airport. It was a lovely day with sunshine and the outdoor seating area is ideal. It is located by the lake, just in front of Crowne Plaza hotel.  The Salmon was fantastic and the burgers pretty good. Plenty of drinks to choose from and one could spend an afternoon just hanging out there. Service was prompt and attentive. Would definitely come again.

review_title: Delicious, the menu tells the exact dish, excellent salmon! YUM!
review: Fun location, excellent food, the description on the menu is the exact dish, great service, nice vibe. I ate there with my two teenagers and they loved it too!

We dined here for an early dinner and the lovely staff seated us out of the way (we had two kids with us!) and provided crayons for the kids. The wine I chose wasn't to my liking so the staff kindly swapped it over for me, no dramas at all. Such a great asset to the restaurant to have such understanding, helpful staff. They don't have a kids menu and sides are extra so it can get quite expensive. Food is excellent, full of flavour and really delicious. One of our sides was some chips and found the serving quite small however everything was very tasty and the service was great so I would recommend.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Both of us had a fish dish. Fish cooked very well both ways we had it served. Very good portion size. Menu explained well by server. Nice surrounds inside eating area. Able to see the water whilst dining. Wait staff attentive. Lost marks for the pavlova, looked impressive but hard to cut through base and eat the hard bits.

Service was terrible: inattentive, disorganised, slow.  Food was appalling:  - Cauliflower was burnt yet still uncooked in the middle - Pork loin was over cooked so it was dry and tough and chewy - The duck roasted crispy potatoes were not crispy but instead floury and stale - Beef cheeks were off and the smell was putrid. We returned it. The chef even said it smelled bad - so why send it out to your customers. Absolutely pathetic

My wife and I had midday lunch here. The menu is extensive, and they can cater for Gluten free. This is in a great spot and you can sit either inside or outside to take in the lake view; which is good when the weather is fine. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We would visit again.

I visited this restaurant as a result of a recommendation on Google. It was very busy for a Tuesday morning. Ordered bubble n squeak which was delicious but one poached egg was rock hard and one was soft. Asked a waitress for pepper but it never came. The food was delicious despite the above. The restaurant has a bizarre wait in Q to order which makes the entry very congested.  Had an almond latte which are hard to find in NZ and it was spot in.  Overall very good just missed on a couple of small things.

Had a post-parkrun coffee here followed by brunch. Great place! The menu is varied and the food was very well cooked and generous. The service was speedy and friendly and the courtyard is a lovely place to soak up some sunshine and relax.

We watched a Yankees game during the hot first week in July, caught a subway back to the Lower East Side and passed this local restaurant that had a sign saying happy hour sangria. We decided to cool off with this cold and yummy sangria and tried some of their tapas which was also top notch. The waiter fluently spoke both English and Spanish, but I don’t think this is unusual here. We enjoyed our visit and would recommend. Happy hour is from 4-7 and is much cheaper than later in the day. It was still pricey, but worth it.

We have been here three times - twice for tapas and drinks at the bar in the evening and once for brunch. Happy hour is good value and the food is delicious. The staff are very friendly and upbeat. Love the decor and spaciousness. Generous wine servings! Brunch was probably forgettable and they were almost empty while other restaurants nearby were overflowing so perhaps they need to rethink the brunch offerings.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: Nice place for a paella - Good service as well
review: We stepped in after an afternoon of shopping. The atmosphere is nice, not too noisy. Staff is friendly and the tapas and paella are good. Just a place that you can trust and where you get good food at the New York price. It's freshly prepared, good size portions and good wine menu.

It's all been said before but having tried all the top "Tripadvisor" scorers, Gia Mas just takes the top spot for me. Restaurant business is a hospitality business and hospitality is what you get along with excellent service food and wine despite the house wine arriving cheesey carafes only surpassed by the purple glasses. My tip, don't cram into the sea side or beach, try the taverna side with the extra space, the view is just as good, and secondly don't miss the after dinner " amuse bouche" particularly if it's the chocolate mouse.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Definitely must eat here if you are around Kamari Beach
review: Having spent days in Kamari beach with all great choices to eat seafood, I was recommended by a local to eat in Gia Mas. And it was not disappointing! We had shrimp spaghetti and pork gyros.. and they are totally yummy! The staffs are so nice too and the foods are really in good price. They also have sunbed to use.. looks comfy !

We had a couple of dinners at Goa Mas this week .. superb local cuisine cooked with heart and a wonderful friendly and engaging service. Deserves it’s high rating. For an enjoyable night, At a reasonable price, highly recommended. Do try the Little Boat, the feta with honey, succulent lamb shank and tasty lamb chops .. with a carafe of nice house red wine to wash it all down. Looking forward to a return visit soon.

review_title: One of our favourite restaurants in Kamari
review: This was one of our favourites this visit and during our 2016 trip (when it was called Sea Side). The staff were really great, friendly and attentive. We visited twice and the food we had was excellent; Stuffed Aubergine, Grilled Sea Bream, Grilled Swordfish, Taramasalata, Fried Calamari, and Greek Salad. The Grilled Sea Bream we had a lot this holiday and I'm pretty sure here did it best!

review_title: Don’t waste your NYC dining experience here
review: One star. The only reason for one is for the ambiance - the decor is very nice, especially on the outside area. Outside of that, our service was abysmal. Not one time did our server ask how our food was, if we wanted another drink, if we would like to see a dessert menu, or if he could get us anything else. If he would have asked any of these questions we would have told him that the octopus appetizer we ordered was beyond bland. - no salt, no seasoning and the so called grilled octopus had no char and tasted like it had been sitting in muck for so long that the skin was slimy and fatty, like we were just chewing on gelatin - inedible. Our entree, which was just the simple burger, was fine, and that's all. Cooked perfectly, thankfully, but again not much to it. The frites that came as the side were hard as rocks from being over cooked. The wine, cab for me, Pinot for my husband were bitter and tart and we would have liked to have sent them back, but for the server never saying a word to us for the entire meal - he didn't even bring us our food or drinks. We cannot understand how this restaurant has any good reviews.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Tried the main restaurant and was busy so managed to get a table for lunch on Sunday via opentable.  It’s a much smaller place- degree of French rusticness.  There was a lunch menu but opted for the Foie Gras- was good.  Has a Cote de rhone red.  Service was good.
Nice little restaurant .We were there for lunch 2 of us including me enjoyed our meals 2 were not satisfied with the food. I agreed their meals were sub par.could have been an off day

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;60+ Traveler;Luxury Traveler
review: One of the best values I have ever had in NYC. Delicious pate and salads for starters, Two of my friends had the lamb dish. It was cooked perfectly and was really flavorful. Nice vegetables on the side. Not a big portion of lamb, but just right when you are having another course or two. I would go back once a week for the linguini with shrimp and crab. Don't let the squid ink scare you off. My friend had the steak frites which was ridiculously tender and tasty.  Excellent waiter who gave us good advice on wine and even gave us an extra scoop of pistachio gelato to share. Reasonable prices. This was my favorite meal of the trip.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Really friendly service, relaxed atmosphere, and good quality food at this charming neighbourhood restaurant. A great place for a slow lunch and some people watching over a couple of glasses of wine.

Small, loud and tightly seated restaurant - things that I normally don't enjoy and tolerate - but here. This restaurant I love ! Great neighbourhood in Greenwich - enjoy the traditional fare. Great service, food and the place will bring a smile. Rates high on the romantic scale. See you there next time !

review_title: Charming atmosphere, excellent location good food
review: We recently had dinner here, enjoying the service and atmosphere -- both were wonderful. We ordered the moules aux frites and the pappardelle as entrees and both were delicious. Oddly, however, the pappardelle entree was quite small -- and I'm a small woman -- it just looked like a side dish rather than a main course. For that reason, I'm giving the restaurant 4 stars -- otherwise, everything was very good and I would recommend it.

My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful breakfast here. The food was fresh, and very nicely presented. Fabulous service. I loved the quiet romantic ambiance of the restaurant and people watching out the large windows.

We were looking for a French place for breakfast and found this on TripAdvisor. It’s nestled in one of the cozy corners on Christopher Street. We tried the Waffle with berries, Duck Hash & Salmon. All of them were good. Would definitely like to try their bigger and better version- La Boucherie next time.

This affordable French Boucherie is a Top 10 TripAdvisor gem. We got seats at the bar during “Green Hour” with $10 drinks and low priced wine. Then ordered the lamb which was fantastic! Great service Fun vibe. Give it a go!

As in France, dining out at La Petite Boucherie is a serious business, with choices to be savoured and flavours anticipated. The prices are also quite serious - perhaps a little on the high side. But even if I might have expected to pay a bit less, I would have been very happy to enjoy this meal anywhere in the South of France. The pan-seared sea bass was particularly good.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I say Paris in NY, but to be honest I never had such a good dinner in Paris as I did in Petite Boucherie. Like the name already says, the place is small and reservations are required. But this place will not let you down.  A small but nice menu, a nice wine list and above all great service and great food. Everything we had was great but the braised ribs were just divine.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local
review: What a great surprise! French restaurant operated by French people. Great service and wonderful food!!!

We visited during the 3rd birthday celebration. The shop was beautifully decorated and festive. We went upstairs to the cafe so that we could order food not just treats. It is lovely with an open airy design. Service could be better, I noticed at least four tables being served water at the tmsame time as we were. We had to ask for water and it took at least 5 minute while the other tables had been seated before us. We ordered the Tokyo set which included fried chicken, salad, green tea latte and a matcha and passion fruit dessert. We also had a lobster roll and cronut (pineapple lemongrass). The chicken was well cooked and well seasoned in typically Japanese style it was chicken thighs, salad was fresh and lightly dressed but also only baby lettuces, the cronut was nice but I don’t get the obsession. Finally the matcha and passion fruit dessert was good, but the layer on top with ganach and white chocolate was too sweet, leave it off and it was perfect. All in all a good place to get a treat, but the cafe is over priced.
Great value fixed price lunch $37 for three courses, lovely food great wine fantastic service, well recommended on trip advisor

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: The room is, I suppose, hip. Which means it's crowded, noisy and semi-shabby. The tables are too close and the banquettes are extremely uncomfortable. Cold wind blows in from the door because there is no vestibule.  Food was good, not great. Good list of French wines.  We started with charcuterie and cheese plate. About on par with Boar's Head cold cuts and supermarket cheese-counter cheese. Nothing special, nothing especially French and pricey at $31.  I ordered the lamb. After 30 minutes of waiting, the waiter came back and said "we're out of lamb." Huh? After 30 minutes? Anyway, I ordered the cheeseburger which was made with short-rib meat and was tasty. But nothing French about it at all.  We then ordered dessert: Tarte tatin (apple pie of the south of France), classically served with vanilla ice cream. The waiter came back, this time after 15 minutes, and said they're out of vanilla ice cream. Again, Huh? He offered to serve it with chocolate ice cream. Well, both the pie and the ice cream were fine.  So... OK food but not special. Inept service. Unappealing, loud room. Expensive for what it is.  We won't be back.  The next day we went a fabulous Fench Bistro called Le Parisien in the East 30's. This is what Dominique should aspire to be.
Had an amazing evening with friends, great service, great atmosphere, have been here already 10 times and I just keep coming back. I guess I’ll just make this place a habit!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: My son, two friends and I enjoyed Sunday evening dinner in an intimate space with great meals, wine and service. We shared each other's entrees and all were outstanding: duck breast with couscous, roast chicken with potato puree and vegetables, and veal steak with chantarelle mushrooms and roasted corn. We enjoyed a flavorful sauvignon blanc (the wine list is heavily skewed French, naturally) to go with our meal, which was topped off by a perfect creme brulee. Service was efficient without being obtrusive. Some window walls open to give a nice, airy feeling to the room. We were very pleased with our experience there and will go back.
What a nice little find on the upper east packed with locals and many Asians which is always a good indicator. We had ramen, bao and katsu curry all of which was good.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Excellent Ramen in Upper East Side
review: We visited this noodle shop after a long day at the Met. Being ramen lovers, we have high expectations for our ramen, and we weren't disappointed. We're hard to please, after having some incredible ramens around the world. Although this shop makes primarily beef-based broths, they also have chicken broths, which we prefer.  They have a good Sake menu too, and a bar dedicated to this wonderful spirit.  They have bench seating, so be prepared to share your table.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Beach Goer
review: Went here for lunch today. Got there at 12 noon when it opened. By the time I left 30 minutes later it was getting busy. Seated immediately, given menu, water. Had the Spicy Beef Ramen. Lunch special gives you an appetizer also. Went with the fried chicken, which is chicken white meat, fried. Served with spicy dipping sauce, Good. The Ramen was good, not great. It had a spicy broth with ground beef and lots of noodles. Again....nothing bad about it, just not as good as I've had at other ramen places on the upper east side. Came to $13
Tasty ramen in the Upper East Side !!! Friendly service, cheap price (20 bucks each included the tip for a very big and delicious plate with a beer)..will go here again probably !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Nature Lover;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: Great ramen option in the UES
review: Great experience. Friendly and helpful staff. Ramen was great. Huge bowl of soup on a cold February day was extremely satisfying. Appetizers (wings and shrimp toast) were also very good. Prices great as well. I would high recommend it to anyone.

We are staying in the San Carlos hotel and thought we'd try this restaurant for ease but also noticed the excellent reviews on here. We didn't book but they squeezed us in on a Saturday evening at 7pm. Service was quick and efficient and food was amazing. We both had starters but in hindsight, we didn't need it. I had spinach chat which was huge! Then the Goan fish curry was amazing. We had a rice and naan bread between us and couldn't even finish it all. Service was good and it had a lively atmosphere. Would definitely recommend for a good curry.
Terrific food, unbelievably good service. Much better than the neighboring curry Hill restaurants. Will certainly return.

Loved the atmosphere and the food at Spice Symphony. Great atmosphere. Lively, but not so loud your can't have a nice conversation. Nisar did a great job showing us some fun things on the menu we might have missed.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Excellent food in a nice setting
review: The food was excellent, fresh and tasty. Service was outstanding. Santosh made sure we were well attended to. The decor is tastefully done.

Exquisite authentic Indian food and service. Our party could not have been treated better. Wonderful service from Nisar. He was extremely patient and offered fabulous menu suggestions. Being plant based, we went with his Baghare Baingan and Aloo Gobi. Both were excellent. Spices were adjusted to our liking. Tandoori Archari for an appetizer was amazing as well. So appreciative they were able to seat us w/o a reservation. Looking forward to returning.

review_title: Spoiled for life - best steaks ever!!
review: Due to a change of plans, we had to find a restaurant for my dad's birthday in NY on that night, after some research I booked a table online and was very happy to still get a table. The waiters were nice and attentive and gave us the time we needed to explain my non-english-speaking parents the menu. Then the waiter came with a plate with the different kinds of meat and they all just looked amazing. We took 2 x the filet steak and 2 x the Ribeye, we wanted to take side dishes per person, but the waiter advised us, to only go with two side dishes - which was a very good advise, because the steaks were quite big, we couldn't even finish the side dishes. And the meat - let me tell you - it was amazing! it was perfectly grilled, it was tender, juicy and so tasty! They also have a broad selection of wines, which vary in price ranges - we took a bottle of a Malbec for around 30USD I think, which was absolutely worth it. The evening was an outstanding experience, food and service wise. We ended up going to K Rico another time during our 5 days in New York and we would fly to New York again, just to eat the steaks!

review_title: the best food, atmosphere and service
review: the best pasta dishes. great atmosphere, lively with music, but great for couples. amazing service. one of the best places to eat in New York. small and cosy.

We visited as a party of 10 pre marathon. It is a tiny place and was jam packed so be prepared for a squeeze around the table. We opted for mains only as the portions are a good size and no one was disappointed. Lovely, hearty pasta dishes and super quick service. The only reason I’m not giving a 5 rating is that we did feel quite rushed towards the end of the meal. There was a queue developing outside so I get that they needed our table back but it would’ve been nice not to have to rush our final drinks.

Amazing pasta dishes, all fresh ingredients and with a reasonable price tag.  Writing this review to confirm they do do take out! We were staying in an Airbnb nearby and due to jet lag couldn't face waiting for a table so popped out to see what I could get. 15mins later I was back with 2 large portions of delicious pasta. Wish we had more time in NYC to go and eat in but at least we know we dodnt miss out completely.

review_title: Upscale food in a relaxed setting
review: Went because TA said it had good seafood. It does! Best piece of fish we've had in years. The chef (Loi) came out and chatted then went back and did some fine cooking. Excellent service without a trace of the snootieness often found in NYC. The best if the five places we tried.

We decided to try something different on our last trip to New York and opted for Jungsik. We opted for the signature tasting with premium wines and we were not disappointed! Each course was flavorful with premium ingredient and original presentation. Service was friendly, attentive and efficient. The wine pairing although expensive really helped bring an additional dimension to the food with the sommelier walking us through each pairing in details.  Overall we had a wonderful night at Jungsik and even though it's not as well known as some of the other high-end restaurants in New York, we highly recommend you give it a shot!

review_title: Wow!, you don't need to love Korean food to be blown away by this place
review: The food is simply off the charts! It's definitely a must stop for foodies with a menu full of creativity and a chef that is determined to showcase her skills. Her training as a pastry chef cannot be hidden, but all of the food was impressive. The food is artistic, colorful, and prefectly prepared. The service is also impeccable.  There is a reason the octopus stays on the menu. It's amongst the best preparation for octopus that I've ever had.  A clear winner for this Michelin 2 star.

Eight exquisite dishes of extraordinary Korean food. In an elegant, pleasant and with an accurate and extraordinary attention we dined in this restaurant savoring exquisite dishes of Korean. An excellent attention from the sommelier led us to choose the best drinks to accompany each dish on the menu.

As the meal started with a number of small bites, I feared the impression would be more on the presentation than the taste. However, my fears were unwarranted. Each dish outdid the precious, excellent cooking. Rarely do you see Asian influence as refined. This is a strong tasting menu you will want to try again and again.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: In between average and very good.
review: We were greeted and our coats were taken for us before showing us to our table. I keep going back and forth on my feelings about our dinner at Jungsik. On one hand the service was incredibly slow to start. Our greeting, drink order, and food order took a good amount of time. From the time we sat down to the time we left we were at Jungsik for 3 hours.  We decided to drink cocktails along with dinner and the cocktails were well crafted. For dinner we chose the Signature Tasting Menu. The meal started with an amuse bouche which represented Korean side dishes. These small bites were a beautiful start to dinner. We enjoyed a variety the flavors, textures, and scents.  Our 1st course was the OSETRA CAVIAR. The caviar was a good dish although not memorable. The 2nd dish was FOIE GRAS MANDOO (not dairy free so I decided to risk it with a lactaid pill). The Mandoo and the Japanese Wagyu were delicious but the star was the broth. The broth was scrumptious and satisfying. 3rd course was OCTOPUS. With it's perfect combination of crunchy exterior and tender inside this dish was outstanding. Our 4th dish was BLACK COD. Black Cod isn't usually my favorite but I found that this dish wasn't overly sweet so I enjoyed it. 5th dish was TUNA KIM BAP. This was probably the most inventive dish. The Kim Bap was rolled into a small cigar and was a wonderful taste and crunch. The 6th dish was GALBI. This dish confused me honestly. I still am not sure whether or not this was supposed to be served cold or not but it definitely was. I found it rather off putting and would have said something but there wasn't staff nearby. Next came OMIJA which means "five flavors", which are sweetness, sourness, bitterness, saltiness, and pungency. Enjoyable. The 8th dish was the start of dessert. My husband was given a Baby Banana which was actually a small pastry. Unfortunately, it didn't wow him. He felt the focus was more on the presentation that actual flavor. I was given Pears along with Pear Sorbet.  As a person with a dairy allergy, there are two desserts which always disappoint me from a fine dining establishments; fruit or sorbets. Other restaurants with the same amount of notification have stepped up and presented pastries and/or composed dishes to me. In addition to this I have to ask, where was the Korean influence? I basically ended up with pears tossed with cinnamon and sugar. The 9th course was the ROASTED CHESTNUT. Greg was presented with a bowl of roasted chestnuts (for show) and a chestnut truffle to eat. Unfortunately, Greg felt it was truly lacking any chestnut flavor. I was given a different sorbet (not thrilled again). To end the meal we were given a small bowl of petit fours. Luckily these were a combination of sweet flavors and textures that saved the ending of our dinner.  We enjoyed most of dinner but in comparison to other like restaurants we agreed we wouldn't return.

review_title: Slick yet easy-going, delicious and welcoming
review: This Korean / fusion restaurant is quite a gem. Their set menus are well blended. The choice of wine and cocktails is ambrosia. And the service is outstanding.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Not sure what my expectation for Korean was/is (bi bim bap?) but this wasn't it. I would have guessed French after trying their tasting menu. Everything was tasty, the service was solicitous and pleasant. The interior feels like any one of a thousand fancy, hotel restaurants - although Jungsik is in an otherwise cool downtown space. The food is outrageously expensive. If you read my reviews I seem to keep stepping in this same puddle. Anyway - if cost is no object and you want style and elegance - this is your spot. If you're looking cool, cutting edge and funky. Not gonna do it.

review_title: What a waste of time and money
review: Jungsik was truly the worst Michelin starred restaurant I have ever been. We have started our night with dry greetings from the sommelier "We do not serve Korean drinks here sir, this is more of a French restaurant rather than Korean and our food is delicate". After tasting the seasonal menu I can confirm that it is bland not delicate. Tasteless, concept less, unimaginative food served in enormous portions. The big chunk of cod was murdered in a pepper sauce, the large layers of fat inside both pieces of lambs were probably there on purpose but definitely unappetising. Wine pairings with neither kicks nor soul. Mediocre deserts. Petit fours was only three. An unmemorable night you would want to forget, after digesting the amount in the credit card statement.

We really enjoyed out meal at Jungsik. The amuse bouche contained five small bites that were really, really good. We particularly enjoyed the cone of sea urchin and smoked salmon roe and the foie gras mousse. The octopus was absolute perfection - by far the most tender I've ever had. Also, the tuna kim bap was terrific. Finally, the banana dessert and surprise dessert were wonderful.  The only negative was that there could have been another course or two. The courses are small and we left wanting just a little more to be truly satisfied.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Approachable, Delicious Korean Fusion Fine Dining
review: I was so curious to try this restaurant -- Michelin two-starred Korean fine dining? And I don't mean that as an insult -- I'm Korean and love Korean food. But I generally think of plentiful comfort food in a plainly decorated mom and pop restaurant, not haute cuisine. The service was accommodating and helpful. We were there for my husband's birthday, and they presented us with personalized menus that wished him a happy birthday.  We started with an amuse bouche/banchan that included steak tartare, fried oyster, foie gras, and raw fish wrapped in thinly sliced Korean radish. This was unlike any banchan I'd ever had! Although this could have been served at any fine French restaurant, the Korean flavors and influence really came through, especially with the fish. Although recommended that we have 5 dishes each off the regular menu (we opted not to do the tasting menu), we only ordered 3 each, which filled us up. We had the sea urchin for two, bossam (pork belly with dwenjang rice), gom tang (wagyu and pine mushroom soup), crispy red snapper, black cod, and dessert. They also brought another dish for my husband's birthday. If you're afraid of spicy Korean flavors, nothing here was too spicy (or spicy at all), but the Korean flavors were evident in all the dishes. It was really the perfect combination of Korean and French. I highly recommend it!

Modern and elegant restaurant in TriBeCa. The chef's 8 course menu won't disappoint you. In fact, each course will most likely pleasantly surprise you. I like Korean food. This added a different twist to it. But, well worth it.

A special occasion prompted me to dine at Jung Sik and my friend and I were not disappointed. From the perfectly designed room, with fine architectural details, to every morsel on the tasting menu, we were delighted by this experience. The chef was very accommodating in respecting dietary restrictions (I'm pescatarian). I now love sea urchin and black cod, which were served in refreshing ways. Red mullet, octopus, mushrooms with truffles and caviar were all absolutely delectable. A remarkable blackberry sorbet was the culminating event in a long series of courses, and paired well with a double espresso. The servers were a diverse and professional crew, responsive and attentive. A splendid meal all around. Highly recommended. Go early to avoid the loud chatter of later hours.

review_title: Top flight Korean with that Michelin flair
review: The food was phenomenal, and the service was excellent. Some of the descriptions of the food, spices, and inspirations for the dishes were a little unfamiliar coming from a Korean influence, but the food definitely gives a sense of place. Each dish was flawless, although the Mackerel dish was a little too fishy for our taste. (Our mistake for never having had Mackerel before.) The Octopus was delicious; tender and perfect. The Bossam (pork belly rice) was beautifully porky without being greasy. The Sea Bream was delicate and flavorful. I would recommend the Galbi (pork ribs), but you can also have them on W 32nd probably just as good but not on such a pretty plate. The desserts were works of art that were as tasty as they were beautiful. The Jang Dok were little kimchi pots made of ganache which was a nice way for the chef to tell his story. Likewise for the Harubang, by far the prettiest plate. I wish there was a little bit more light so we could have enjoyed the beauty of these plates. Wine list is excellent. The service was spot-on and polished, although a little reserved. We were able to warm up our servers a little by asking some questions and they showed some personality.

review_title: Amazing Contemporary Korean Tasting Menu worth the price..
review: I visited Jungsik with my son to celebrate his birthday and it was the right choice. We had an amazing dinner that we will remember for a long time worthy to be celected for an important event.  We went with the tasting menu. I have to mention that the menu is quite rich and many dishes so go hungary since you should not miss any part of it.  The menu starts with amuse bouche with 5-6 items each very tasty giving you a good sense of what to come. It is then followed by fried oysters, octopus and crispy red snapper, then a Korean soup Songee followed by a wonderful Wagyu Tanderloin then a pallette cleanser sorbet then deserts ...  The atmosphere is very pristine, cleanly decorated and very kind and knowledgable service who explain the subtleties of each dish.  It is quite expensive but worth it since it is an experience you will never forget ..

We were looking for a Korean dinner and ended up here. Make no mistake, this is no Korean BBQ with beer but a real posh fine dining restaurant. You will use at least 100USD per person if eating here but then again, it is very classy. Service was good and dishes were very inventive.

After three nights of great eating in NYC (Nobu, Beauty & Essex and Baltazars), we wanted something a little more understated, less crowded and not so noisy...  As soon as we entered, I was signed in relief that I had made the effort to dress up and wear a nice jacket as would feel out of place without one. Although say that, didn't feel like it was stuffy or snobby in any way - just classy.  The tasting menu + accompanying wine seems to be the go-to choice, however we decided to choose our own appetiser, entree and main and am glad we did. I had the mushroom, steak tartare and halibut and all of them were excellent - and rich. My wife had the tuna, salmon salad and snapper and once again, excellent - but rich. Don't get me wrong, we love rich food but maybe the last three nights were catching up with us.  We had a beautiful riesling and couldn't have been happier and shared desert bing the potato tart - which was my least favourite dish. It was a little tasteless, but then, after three rich dishes, probably a good thing.  Service was excellent. Table space excellent. Prices were in line with fine dinning and not over the top. Great time. Would definitely go back and its reputation is well deserved.  See you next time...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Located in a non descriptor neighborhood near the Holland Tunnel, this is one of those new age-y places, very upscale, filled with pretty people, serving tiny bits of food on pieces of slate, oddly shaped dishes and bowls, etc. The wait staff is condescending but very efficient...even pretty. The food presentation is outstanding. Each dish is a picture of balance and color. In the tasting menu of countless tiny courses...all of which combined could fit into a medium sandwich with lots of extra bread left over...costs something like $160 without wine or beverage. Some of the morsels are delicious and you can even swallow them like you would a vitamin pill. some of the morsels are very mediocre. Some are served with "vegetables" which consist of two edamame peas and two slices of carrot so thin you can see through them (smaller than a dime). For those of us who like Korean food, a Korean "meal", this is a travesty. To those of us who are pretentious or want the avant grade experience, it's OK. The bathrooms also have those really expensive digital toilets that blow hot water up your bum, followed by hot air, etc. In summary, rated poor because the food quality not worth the price.

what to say more than this is by far the best restaurant i've been in new york and that mean better than Jean-George and Daniel. The food is out of this world and the staff is completely attentive to any need. We ask for no additional salt and to be seated next to each other and they were no hesitation. We took the 10 services and it worth any penny i can't wait to go back and try other things, all the plates they were carrying look soooo good.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Words cannot do this resturant justice!
review: We went here to celebrate my cousins anniversary and my birthday. I have no idea what I expected but this went so far beyong my expectations.  The resturant is small but beautiful. I don't think there is a bad location to be seated. Our water was awesome. He helped us navigate the wine list which was really a book the size of a novel. He narrowed it down to three for us and then we picked. It was great and went well with our menu.  Also, the menu came out personalized wishing us a happy anniversary and birthday! A small touch that goes a long way. At the end they gave them to us in a folder to take home.  We did the tasting menu. Which is quite deceptive. Each course is not only beautiful but sooooo good. The only course that I didn't absoultey love was the one with the poached egg, kim chee and pork belly. Each course was better than the next. What is deceptive is although the portions seem small you will be incredibly full long before you are done. Make sure to pace yourself. Because the steak course is so good that I was actually sad when I couldn't finish it! It was so tender you could cut it with a plastic fork!  The dessert course is actually three. All three were wonderful and nothing alike so worth having at least some of each.  One tip: We normally eat late. This was a long meal (over three hours). I would reccomend coming a little on the earlier side (5:30/6) since you will still be there quite a while for the tasting menu.  Bottom line: All four of us LOVED it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Restaurant couldn’t keep it cool on this humid July day. Food was delicious and service is outstanding! Pad Thai is spot on and other dishes are prepared quickly too keep the lunch crowd moving.

Visited pure Thai cookhouse on Thursday evening with family while on a city break in New York and it didn’t disappoint at all. There was around a half an hour wait so we grabbed a drink and then returned, ready to see what was on offer! The menu is incredibly authentic and their little restaurant has such a great atmosphere. The food was delicious too and the staff all very attentive. Highly recommend to anyone visiting New York City!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: This restaurant is so incredibly small and authentic, it will become your immediate favorite! Seriously, the wait was long (but that's our fault), the seating is limited (but it's so intimate), and the food is amazing--absolutely amazing. Definitely eat here if you're craving the best Thai food in NYC!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local
review: In a lovely setting in Trifecta, this restaurant is a great choice for those who want high-end dining but not the tiny-plates style that leave you hungry and wallet depleted. In fact, the opposite is the case here. The very reasonable $75 prix fixe allows a wide choice of first and second plates, with tradition and experimentation side-by-side. For a group of hearty eaters, don't have a big lunch in advance--we were quite full after the two courses and multiple amuse-bouches, before the very good dessert selections. No complaints here about the pace of service, it was attentive, warm and friendly and not rushed. Definitely would return.
Spice Symphony is a very enjoyable Indian restaurant. Nice ambiance and decor, good friendly service and very tasty food. Good vegetarian & vegan options. Recommended.

We ate here for lunch on a cold winter day and we enjoyed every bite. The service was tremendous and attentive. The portions were large and we were very full. We began with cheese kulcha. When I ordered the chicken vindaloo, the waiter said you know that's the spiciest thing on the menu and I replied, great I'll still have it. It was spicy, but so good. My husband ate tikka masala and it was equally delicious. The two dishes made a great combo of spice and mellow.

Small but very warm place, just in the middle of the Financial District. I ordered a ramen and salmon bowl both were pretty awesome and generously served. Sapporo draft is excellent too. Prices are absolutely reasonable and fair.

One of the worst steaks I had in a long time The presentation was promising but the ny strip was chewy beyond my wildest imagination I’m hoping it was my bad luck Or they don’t deserve the spot on trip advisor

review_title: Upscale steak restaurant with excellent food.
review: It was recommended to us and we really liked it. The steaks and the samon were excellent, very nice atmosphere. Service was very friendly, quick and and proffesional. Prices are high but Food worth the money.

review_title: Seriously you have to try this place
review: Well I have been to New York many times and eaten in many steak houses, this one was just up the street from my hotel so I thought why not. WOW 35 day dry aged steak, dried on site in full view my bone in rib eye was one of the most tender and flavoursome steaks I have had. Seriously you have to try this place if you are in the midtown area it near 5th and 35th street.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Service was rather slow, decent burgers
review: Stopped here for dinner. Service was a bit of mess - we ordered two beers, but initially got only one. Told the waiter, he acknowledged this and then just walked around the place as if he had forgotten what we just said - 10 minutes passed until he got back with the second beer... We had ordered sweet potato fries, but got classic fries. The burgers were good, nothing spectacular, and the South of the Burger completely fell apart following the first bite. Prices are good and the place has a nice vibe to it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Perfect place for a family lunch. Great meat quality of the burgers. We take 5 miniburgers with fries . It was great! perfect value for money. The service was TOP, George was so Kind, help and follow us in perfect way.
We had a lovely evening in town and went of course to Bill’s Burger. Bashy was our lovely waitress and she took care of our group fantastic.

review_title: Go for the Burger - Stay for the Shakes!
review: Located in the Marriott Downtown hotel, Bills Burger is just the thing for a bar based meal. This is a typical restaurant / sports bar set up with lots of TVs showing sports channels.  Although,they serve mostly burgers (which are good!), they're are a few other choices - I enjoyed the boneless wings! The outstanding thing for me is the shakes - gorgeous.  The only downside I think is the service, which is patchy both in speed and attitude. Since I was (am) staying at the hotel, I have visited three times in the last week and the food has been consistently great, and the service consistently sub-par.

Bill’s claims that they are among the top 10 best burger places in Manhattan. And I think they are right. The heart attack Chili & Cheese Fries is just stunning!  Great selection of beer and super friendly staff! Everything is fresh and served in a heartbeat!  Visit!

This place is phenomenal. A funky exterior leads you to an inviting, cozy, upscale interior. We were greeted by Antonio who was charming, witty, and knowledgeable. He made recommendations that were spot on. We had the arancini appetizer, the red onion gelato salad, spaghetti a la vongele (clams), and a Bronzino special. We were given a complimentary pistachio tiramisu that was light, fluffy, crunchy, and delicious. Everything was wonderful, and every server was attentive and friendly and professional. We will definitely be back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Was visiting NYC on my birthday and wanted an authentic Italian restaurant dining experience. Traveling with my wife and 7 other friends so I didn't want to risk anything less than a top-notch eatery. Checked TA and searched restaurants in the area we were staying. IL PUNTO showed up at the top of the list. After reading many of the reviews, I decided to give it a try and made a reservation through OpenTable.  Was thoroughly impressed from the time I stepped inside. (Don't let the appearance of the exterior cause you any concern.) The place is small but well-managed. Several tables were full (7:00pm) and our reserved table was ready and waiting. The owner/manager greeted us and promptly seated us. From that point on, service was excellent. The menu (authentic Italian) was full of fantastic choices and made it difficult to pick an entrée. On the server's suggestion, I tried the cauliflower soup appetizer. It was exceptional. My main course, ravioli with lobster meat was a good choice, too.  Overall, the group enjoyed the meal with numerous complements on the food.  If you're in the Manhattan (Hell's Kitchen) area of NYC an want "real" Italian, stop at IL PUNTO for dinner (only open evenings). I don't think you'll be disappointed.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: My first experience in Sicilian cuisine was frankly very good, all the food was excellent with a particular emphasis on the shrimp salad with red onion ice cream, which in fact is the delicious dressing and the pistacchio tiramisu dessert, which is out of this world ! Good atmosphere and helpful hosts make up for an excellent choice for dinner in NYC.

I was here today to celebrate my past 50th birthday and I was really fully satisfied. An excellent kitchen with real Italian plates with a particular menu on the Sicilian Region and Southern Italy kitchen. A very good variety of wines. Staff very efficient and friendly. A special mention and thank to the General Manager Andrea and Alfredo.
Loved this place and the food was truet amazing! Freshly made, delicious octopus salad and outstanding lobster ravioli. Service excellent and loved our table by the window.

We were staying in a nearby hotel and used our TripAdvisor community to find a good restaurant. As usual, the reviews were spot on. This was a gem that deserves it's high rank. We had well made cocktails, and were served some complimentary soup before our appetizers came. Both our meals were delicious, and the service was spot on. There's a lovely ambiance to the place that was only marred by the fool at the next table talking on his cell phone, but definitely a nice date night place. One of our best meals of the trip, and I'm a fussy Italian cook. Not inexpensive but worth the splurge.

Only in NYC for two nights and chose this restaurant based on Trip Advisor reviews...it definitely did not disappoint! The food was fantastic...the staff was very attentive ...loved the cozy neighborhood atmosphere! Top notch restaurant!

review_title: A great quant restaurant in NYC
review: For one of our company events, we rented out the restaurant starting at 3pm, and then had appetizers served as we held our meeting (and drinks). At the conclusion of the meeting, we moved to dinner. The service staff was excellent, always stopping by and seeing how we're doing. The food was great as well as the presentation of the food. And the restaurant was clean and had a great feel to it. There were two sides to the restaurant, and even though we rented out part of it, the other side was still able to sit about 10-12 tables. It's also at a great "and active" location so you can get a true feeling on NYC as you enjoy your dinner.

We walked in and sat at the bar for dinner. A small bar with the restaurant menu served. Great food and nice wine and full bar. Try the gnocchi it won’t disappoint. The bartender mixes a mean gin martini.

We chose this restaurant on route to an improv show... We weren't disappointed. The service was super. Water glasses were filled all the time, as well as the delicious bread. We both had prix fixe dinners. We started with some ham and melon. I had the veal chop - which was huge. Very tasty. My daughter had some pasta, which she seemed to enjoy. We ended with a chocolate lava cake - which was terrific,  The place was quite pleasant and we were very happy we came...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: A Very Nice Family Owned Italian Restaurant
review: We had a very nice dinner at this restaurant recently. The restaurant is long and narrow and seems to have 2 long and narrow dining rooms, with a bar in each one. All of the food that we ordered was delicious and the portions were generous. The wine pours were also nice and were brought to the table in small bottles that were filled to the brim and were then poured into the wineglass. I liked this because every glass was poured the same amount. The only downside was that the restaurant was really loud, making it difficult to talk to your dinner companions. Service was very attentive and all of the staff seemed to care about your dining experience. Dining there was not cheap, especially with drinks, but was a very nice evening.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: Ate there twice on my 4 day visit!
review: Yes, there are so many places to eat in the area, but we were exhausted and had eaten at Il Punto a couple of nights before. After eating at a not so great place the night before, we wanted to know we were going to be served a wonderful meal. Extensive wine list, delicious complimentary cold tomato soup appetizer, wonderful Burrata, delicious salads, fabulous entrees. Had tortellini, cod, and one of their pasta dishes. Fabulous! The service was also outstanding. I’ll visit again next January when I’m in town. Highly recommend!
I enjoyed this place, it is small but very good. I had the Timblay & it was very good. The primitivo wine was great as well

We had dinner on a busy Thursday night in December. Our entrees were awesome; fresh grilled fish and with tasty veggies, cooked to perfection.  Despite the busy hour our meals were served promptly. Service is excellent. Il Punto is decorated in a festive holiday theme, which only adds to the charming atmosphere.  While there’s tons of good restaurants in the Theatre District, Il Punto is the equal to any of them and a good location close to Penn Station. Put it on your list !

user_tags: History Buff;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Did not live up to the reviews
review: We chose this restaurant because it seemed well reviewed. There were 3 of us and we all thought the food average, service was average and event the wine was average. Maybe we caught them on an off night but it shows that not everybody has the same experience.

review_title: It was a late night dinner
review: I had an appointment after a meeting that finished at 8:00 pm and my guest expressed an interest in pasta. I consulted TripAdvisor when I don't have a personal recommendation.  This was a very good choice. We were seated quickly when we arrived (which was 15 minutes late due to the previous event running late). The restaurant was clean and bright. our tabke was "ready to go". I ordered the chicken special, which was very good. My colleague was pleased with the lobster ravioli.  I was most happy with the dessert; Tiramisu. It was great and topped off the meal well.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Even though the restaurant was very crowded with a large party, the staff was very attentive throughout our dinner. Basically, there was no rush for us to finish our dinner and drinks. Service was very quick and efficient.The food was delicious and the drinks were strong and tasty. We had the Paccheri Al Ragu and Lune D’Aragosta. Magnificent!! I would definitely recommend this restaurant on your next visit to the Big Apple.

Went to NYC to see a show yesterday and saw all the amazing reviews on TR and knew I had to try it and so happy I did! The hostess was very friendly and helped our waiter, who sometimes, appeared to disappear or maybe he had too many tables. The Bread that they served was warm and delish. We had an appetizer of the Caprese which was ok BUT needs more flavor....The absolute STAR of the meal was the mushroom risotto, it was OUT OF THIS WORLD amazing, seasoned wonderfully - portions HUGE - one of the best meals I have had in a long time!! I will be back to try the desserts and other menu options soon!

The last time I was in NYC we ate here twice because it was so good. The wine list is comprehensive and food wise there is something for everyone to choose from. So lucky to have come across this little gem!

I’ve been to Italy several times, and this was still the best italian meal I’ve ever had - no wonder when the owner and the chef are both Italians and a lot of the guests as well. Everything about this place was absolutely fantastic. All we ate and drank was perfect, but the tortellini was especially memorable - it melts in your mouth! The staff was also very friendly and professional, and our waiter Idar was excellent at answering our questions and very observant about our needs. I can’t recommend this place enough and would love to come back very soon.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: The one thing that really stands out in Il Punto is the service. The wait staff was always aware of you, and made you feel special! The food was great. We were a party of two and had the two-course sampler and one main course. The arugula salad and smoked salmon was fantastic. Excellent!! It was followed by a shrimp pasta dish that was very nice and had complex flavors. I had the vegetarian risotto which was good, but maybe too heavy. Its not the chef's fault, its risotto. Everything was topped with a lava cake dessert which was delicious. Dinner was great!.

We ate here on Thursday evening after seeing the reviews on TripAdvisor, and we weren't disappointed. The service was fantastic and the food was great. I had the Carciofini Ripieni (artichokes hearts stuffed with garlic, cheese and breadcrumbs and served with fresh tomato sauce, and it was fantastic- as was the rest of the dinner. We will definitely go back again.

review_title: I would love to go back..........
review: We had an excellent meal here just before our Broadway play (Wicked). This is fine dining! But we appreciated the fact that they were very accommodating for our 10-Year-Old's as well as the adults. Our starter was calamari, which was excellent, along with the homemade tomato bread and breadsticks (popular with the kids). He had Cioppino, which was good; and the boys got Ziti with meat sauce and plain buttered noodles (I told you they were accommodating!); but it was my lobster raviolis with pink champagne sauce that stole the show. Excellent wine, excellent service, excellent food = very fine dining. (Or as the boys are telling me, very fancy!).

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Great Dinner with Friends after Auto Show @ Javits Center
review: We were looking for a nice restaurant to go to for dinner after our visit to the Javits Center and we were pleasantly surprised with this very nice place. A few blocks from the Javits Center it was an oasis in the neighborhood. Very good service from the moment we walked in to the last goodbye at the door, they couldn't have been nicer.  The food was Great, we shared 2 appetizers and we each had a main and the presentation for each dish was wonderfull, the flavors were pleasant and a bit different, but all were great.  All in all we had a fine time.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;60+ Traveler
review: Simone is the maitre d the evening we were there.I am Italian speaking as it is my origins and Simone is from the Puglia region ...where honestly food is a premium priority.If you do not eat well in Puglia...then you just had to be the unluckiest traveler in the world.So with that in mind I ordered mussels(marinara type) and I was thinking of Puglia.The mussels were good but of course nothing compared to what you get in Puglia.I ordered a seafood black ink pasta dish and it also was not bad but again very far from what you get in Puglia...probably because the chef or cook is not a Pugliese. Nonetheless Simone was a wonderful host, service was excellent,aperitif drinks were nicely and generously prepared and desserts were very good as was the espresso.So all in all we will return and try hard not to compare it to the food we get served in Puglia....

review_title: Family style southern italian restaurant. Good service, decent prices, good food, all the ingredients.
review: Good place to go on a Sunday late afternoon for that pasta course followed by a nicely prepared chicken marsala and a glass of chianti Unfortunately, like a lot of these places, most of the produce, fish, meat is from non sustainable sources. But that's unfortunately endemic in the NYC restaurant scene. Vegetarians can get a good meal here, but vegans beware of hidden ingredients.

We dined here on Friday night and enjoyed a great experience. Excellent food, service and wine. The staff are very attentive and even allowed me to use my limited Italian without laughing at me. It was about $230 for 3 courses and wine but we left feeling like it was certainly worth it A nice restaurant for a special occasion and my wife loved the veal Marsala. Make sure you have a limoncello with dessert.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;Family Vacationer
review: We love Italian food for comfort food, and would eat it most meals...and Il Punto didn't disappoint. With homemade pastas, friendly wait staff, and a nice wine selection, this restaurant will certainly be one we will come back to. There were five of us, and we each selected something different to try. Everyone loved their selection...from Lobster Ravioli to their version of Lasagna, it was a perfect meal for a cold winter's night. It does get fairly crowded so reservations are highly recommended. And it is fairly intimate table seatings, so probably not the best choice for large groups.

My friend and I hadn't seen each other for about 5 years, we met in NYC, I traveled from Canada and she traveled from Korea. We wanted a nice spot for a long leisurely dinner our hotel recommended Il Punto..... The food was great, the service was very good and the atmosphere was perfect. The complimentary cold tomato soup was a lovely surprise, the variety of bread in the bread basket was above and beyond what most restaurants offer, the wine list offered many reasonably priced wines and our waiter recommended a great pairing to go with our meal. There was no rush or sense of urgency for us to finish our meal and move on. I would highly recommend this spot for a romantic date, special occasion or catching up with an old friend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Our group of eight had a great dinner at Il Punto. This is a nice little restaurant with a big taste. Our waitress, Isabella, did a wonderful job taking care of your table. Her support staff made sure we were taken care of too. We all loved our meals and home made desserts. The pasta was also home made and fresh. The wine selection was extensive. Il Punto has a bar to eat at, but not an area to hang out and drink. Enjoy.

Tried Il Punto based on TA Reviews - lucky to get a table for two. Had a very good (pushing excellent) meal served by Isabella and her colleagues. Entrees of Carciofini ripieni and Caprese followed by Paccher al ragu and Vitello al Marsala. Just one dessert a lovely Panna Cotta. All washed down with two glasses of Pinot Grigio, San Pellegrino and one Cappuccino and a Limoncello. Total with tip an expensive $200 - but worth every cent! Just missed out on excellent because we did feel a bit rushed as they obviously like to turn tables quickly at the weekend.

We hadn't planned to eat here but after we had a problem at another restaurant nearby we found this on TripAdvisor and promptly walked there in our Louboutins - the walk was worth it - very authentic feel when you walk in - with the staff being very attentive. Good food and wine and was reasonably priced for good food. Would recommend for good Italian food!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Nice italian restaurant with very attentive people. We made the reservation online, and choose the menu that includes an appetizer, main course and dessert. It was great. When the main course was delayed, the were sorry and served more wine as a courtesy. I recommend them.

We made a reservation on Open Table for dinner. When we walked it there was a line up of people waiting to be seated that did not have reservations and I was told I had to wait on line. Not really a big deal I guess. The service was fairly good but not great. My husband wanted another beer with dinner and the waiter didn’t come over until after we finished eating ( the waiter didn’t deliver the food ) . We each had a burger and fries and I had a milkshake. The food was delicious. We also liked the relaxed atmosphere. They had big TVs so it’s a nice place watch a game too.

user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We went in for a quick snack just before going to the TOTR.
