We hadn’t booked but allowed a walk in  Pleasant staff  Given a glass of water prior to placing an order  Ordered loaded fries and Nachos  Great range of beers on tap available along with soft drinks  Food came out quick and portions were big.  Constantly asked if everything was ok and it was.  Didn’t finish all the nachos as too much for 2 of us.  Next time here will go for the burgers etc as looked nice  Great set up and service

review_title: Good late night snacks and drinks
review: Came here a couple of times during my trip to New York at late nights as it’s straight across from the jewel hotel. Got the wings one night which were great and the rest of time just had a beer. It’s $9 a pint but your in the middle of Manhattan, sport is on tv all the time and it’s a nice place to sit. I’d recommend it
Bills Bar and Burger s a popular spot for fast tasty food. Nice bar And good service. The wings are spicy and the menu vast.

We were staying close-by and noticed Bill’s Bar and Burger, so we tried it. Place is nicely decorated and staff is pleasant. Seating was separated, which was good. We ordered cheese burger and fries. The burger was good but fries not so. Of for some just right really good fries, - not these. It was not a bad place for dinner, nor was it outstanding. In a pinch - try it.

My wife and I stopped in for lunch on a busy Thursday and were taken right to a table. Our server, Brian, was extremely friendly, attentive and many sure that everything came out perfect. We split the sliders and a Caesar salad, which was the perfect amount of food for us.  While we didn’t have any of their milkshakes, they did look good! We hope to come back and give those a try next time!

user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Shopping Fanatic;Beach Goer
review: Fantastic! Amazing service,great atmosphere, fun food and drink options. Our server Johnatan was incredible. Friendly, knowledgeable and thorough.
This is a great restaurant if you are looking for a nice burger with quick service in a great location.

Last year we visited the area and ended up at another well known burger shack. Later that day we stumbled upon Bill's. It looked so appealing and smelled heavenly from the sidewalk. I made a mental note & planned on visiting on our next trip to NYC for the holidays. Fast forward 1 year and here we are at Bill's Bar & Burger!  Upon arrival, we walked inside and found the place pretty packed. We were asked IF we had made reservations and the answer was "no". So, we were expecting the worst. However, we were told to head on down the steps and meet the hostess at the bottom of the stairs to be seated. At the bottom, no one was waiting for us. So we approached the hostess stand and got in line there. We explained that we had been sent down from upstairs. After a few minutes we were seated at a HIGH top and given menus. I was a little concerned about the HIGH seats since we had 2 small children in our party, but there were no other seats available at the time. A waiter was around and said he would be with us shortly. We waited and waited and waited. Finally, we see the waiter ask someone else to wait on us. It seemed like chaos.  We ordered 2 burgers and a basket of the sweet potato waffle fries. We also ordered a kids hotdog, which is a foot long! It came with a side of regular french fries and a kids beverage for $10. A regular burger runs around $13 and does NOT come with any sides. Add bacon for an upcharge.  It took about 35 minutes from the time we walked through the door to the time our food was arriving at the table. Everything looked amazing. Burgers were plump, juicy and oh so flavorful. Delish! Bacon was amazing. Regular fries were very tasty, crispy on the outside yet fluffy on the inside. Sweet potato waffle fries were disappointing. They had great flavor but were thin and turned out oh so crunchy and crispy. We asked for a new basket that was not overcooked. Well, we ended up with a second batch of crunchy fries.  Overall, we had a really good meal at Bills Burger & Bar. The burgers were really good. The kids enjoyed the hot dog & so did we since we had to help eat the foot long dogs. Regular fries were good, although they are probably frozen and not fresh cut. Sweet potato waffle fries were a miss. Prices were a tad high, but we expect that in NYC near Rockefeller Center. Dining room area was OK. It felt cramped and I was NOT crazy about the high top tables (for kids or adults). Downstairs seating felt like a basement, where as the upstairs was little more airy with a bar-pub overtone. Restrooms were clean, but one of the toilets kept leaking water on the floor. Staff was friendly. Service is a tad on the SLOW side. So, do not go if in a hurry. I would recommend. I will be back, but next time I will make reservations in hopes of getting a booth or regular table instead.  Bottom Line: Excellent burgers. Well worth a visit if in the area. Would recommend and will most likely be back next Christmas!

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;Thrifty Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: Recently helped lead a student trip to NYC and were looking for lunch in the Rockefeller Center area. Stumbled upon Bill's and glad we did. It's not always easy to get seated as a group of 16 but Bill's is two floors with plenty of space and they seated us right away in the middle of lunch rush. By the time we left it was close to full so glad we showed up when we did. Most of us went the burger route. I had the chili which is thick and served with tortilla chips for dipping. Everyone enjoyed their meal, the prices were reasonable, and the service was friendly and made sure drinks stayed full.

My husband and I stayed at the Raddison and needed some food later in the evening. We ordered a patty melt, chicken wings, soup and sweet potato waffle fries! EVERYTHING was hot and delicious! But there’s were the best sweet potato fries I’ve tasted in a long while!!! The customer service was superior as well.

Our derive from waitress was top notch! Burgers were delicious and service was fast. We chose this place for reviews on their gluten free options (supposedly dedicated fryer and gluten free buns) my son has celiac and ate all of his kids cheese burger without complaint. My only issue was when we ordered milkshakes. The one was recommended by the waitress and I asked if it was mint or mint with cookies for the GF kid. She said it was just mint, we’ll when it came to the table (food runner) it had cookies as a garnish and cookies in the shake (think mint chocolate cookies and cream. I know. Yummy!). I was concerned and she said “I checked chef said it’s gluten free” so the kid ate a cookie and started annihilating the shake. About halfway into it our waitress comes back profusely apologizing and said wait. It’s not gluten free. I double checked and chef said “there might be some gluten in the cookies” so she checked the box for the cookies and they were definitely not GF. I don’t blame her, and was very happy she rechecked and questioned the kitchen and came back to us. I was upset at the cook or chef who should understand the difference between “a little bit of gluten in the cookies” and gluten free. When it’s a medical issue and a dietary restriction not due to a fad or a lifestyle choice it’s a serious matter. The kiddo got a replacement shake and we made it through the night without any major repercussions from the glutening. I do recommend this place still, my burger was A+ just be diligent if you have any dietary issues.
Burges were great split the 5 slider option. Plenty of food. Only complaint was the onion rings were really onion crumbs.

review_title: A burger joint with a twist
review: Bill’s Bar and Burgers A burger joint with a twist The burgers at Bill’s are delicious but the thing that sets them apart is the Fat Cat, a burger that comes on an English muffin. What a genius idea! The bun won’t get soggy. And after walking around Midtown and Times Square for days and seeing $20-$25 burgers listed on all of the menus, it was refreshing to find a $13 burger at Rockefeller Center.

review_title: Best food i have have had in ages anywhere in the world
review: Fabulous staff - it's like being in Cheers, where everyone knows your name. My name and preferences were remembered after the first visit. The food was fantastic. The kids loved the souffle; my wifi loved the stuffed pepper. I stuck with the hanger steak as it was sensational. All the side dishes are smashing' just get them all BUT order double or triple onion and potatoes.

We feel compelled to leave a review for AKAR Restaurant in Ubud here. It’s quite new and I’m unsure if it’s overly mainstream, yet! It is hand-on-heart the best food I’ve ever tasted in my life. Packed with flavour.  We only found it by googling “best dinner in UBUD”  We tried so, so many places in Ubud, including Twist, Elys Kitchen, and many more — all amazing, by the way. However, we went to AKAR & our minds were blown. A notch above everywhere we’ve been at home and in Bali.  The atmosphere is unbeatable. The service is surreal, even for bali standards (already a high standard). The food - phenomenal.  The dark chocolate soufflé is out of this world, as is the warm brownies.  Ps: no, this is not “cheap & cheerful”, but it’s also not too far at the “fine dining” end of the spectrum either…. portions are good sized. It is truly a must.  Cocktails also unreal.  If you come to UBUD and don’t try this place, you’ve missed out (and Twist)  Finally - no, I’m not on commission ha ha. I am just on my honeymoon and had some of the best food ever & best service ever.  Special shout out to Kwai and Rian, our two servers they went completely above and beyond  Cheers!!

Made a booking at short notice, unfortunately I left the restaurant totally underwhelmed. Whilst I can’t really offer total criticism of the meal, I found most of the dishes to be bland. The Lamb Rogan curry tasted as though it was made with gravy...not a curry. I’ve eaten in many Indian restaurants in the world and there have only been a few that I would not return to, this is now one of them. The service was good and I’m sorry I can’t offer any praise for the $150 meal for two, with a bottle of wine and a gin/tonic. A final positive the naan bread was good!  I would not recommend or return...unless you like bland Indian food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;History Buff;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Indian taste near the times square
review: Tasty indian food so close to times sqare. We stayed in hotel paramount and walked everyday to utsav for our lunchs एंड dinners. We enjoyed bhate ka bhurta chhole tikki khir gulab jamun rasmalai tanduri roti and rumali roti. Buffey is as good as alakarte. Enjoy it when ever your tastebuds demands indian taste

review_title: Fabulous Indian food in the heart of New York
review: We visited for dinner one evening in New York while n holiday and had a great meal. We chose a vegetable biryani, dhal and baigan barga and it was all delicious! Friendly staff and nice decor too.
Utsav is very reminiscent of the very ubiquitous “indian” restaurants found in UK. Good food, average service, and quite reasonable prices (at least for New York). The location is good.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Went there with a friend. Had a few drinks on the ground level and then headed to the restaurant on the first level. Were very promptly seated and orders were also taken swiftly. Ordering samosa was not my plan but my friend recommended it. I didn’t regret- it was very yummy though but small in size. The main course was dal makhani, saag paneer and laccha parathas. All were good though dal was something which could’ve been better. Overall good place worth visiting again.

review_title: Reached in search of a vegetarian place in NY!
review: One of my colleagues was n search of vegetarian food in NY and we ended up reaching here (bough I did not have vegitarian food !).  Overall the food is good, ambience in nice, and location is of course great - easily accesssible from Manhattan.  Little pricey, but I guess that is true for all NY restouraants.

I have to admit based on the location, website and price point we were expecting a "wow." It looks like the restaurant is under Michelin consideration and they need to step it up. Lovely decor and presentation, but the food somehow just doesn't live up to expectations. We have traveled to India and are frequent diners at the small places in Edison, NJ (little India) -- places where you get wow (but definitely NOT atmosphere cheap). Utsav is very convenient to theaters, and has a prix fixe menu. We did a combo of small plates, entrees and dessert. The small plates were both excellent -- traditional samosas and a quinoa potato patty. The mains less so. The menu has a combination of traditional and different, and my husband's Baingan Bharta (eggplant) was enjoyable. I had the Shrimp Goa, which was supposed to come in a coconut sauce. It was basically Shrimp Tikka Masala, and it was overcooked. I mean to the point of tough. I've had that issue in Indian places before, but that is a rookie mistake to be sure. Short on time I did not send it back, but also did not love it. The dessert was again quite good, a traditional kheer but with coconut sorbet in the middle. The entire meal cost $150 for 3 people (tax and tip included -- no alcohol). In Edison it's usually about $65 and we have tons left over. I highly doubt we will be back.

review_title: Lovely ambience, Great taste, Good Location and Excellent Service
review: This is a cosy place in time square vicinity. The staff are lovely and very accommodating. Service was great from moment we walked in. Good introduction to the drinks and food menu and recommendations. Lovely candle light theme. The starters we got Tandoori Aloo which was very well presented and delicious and our highlight from other starters, for mains we ordered Paneer chilli relleno which was our star dish from other mains. Finally Gajar Halwo with vanilla ice cream for dessert which was mouthwateringly delicious. We had a great evening and would always recommend to anyone who would wish to dine indian cuisine in New York Times square.

Stopped in for the lunch buffet because this was right down the street from our hotel. The food was nothing special but the service was very friendly. I would have liked to have seen many more options for such a pricey buffet. What they did have there was lacking in flavor and it was difficult to tell which dishes were vegetarian.

This is an OK Indian in NYC. A city notorious for having some hideous Indian Food. The Service was slow and food was bland until we had the Chicken Biriyani which salvaged the eatery for us. Nice Wine list on the plus side.

Four of us went for a meal. The service was excellent as was the food. The prices were much as expected. We found a lovely wine at a good price but weren't able to get a second bottle - we had to choose one at over double the orifice.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Came here with an old work colleague for lunch on a Wednesday. We arrived at 12:15 and there was no wait and plenty of tables. It became very crowded by 12:45. The buffet had a nice variety of food, lots of hot dishes with written explanations of the content which was very helpful.  Buffet style is nice so you can try a little of everything and go back for your favorite items.

review_title: Loved Utsav, its a true classy Indian Restaurant
review: Arrived on a busy night with no reservation. Hostess found us a table for two no problem. Welcoming atmosphere, nice décor and good buzz about the restaurant. Attentive and friendly service, excellent menu choice. A decent but not too long a time to wait for something that was being freshly cooked / prepared. And when the food arrived it was excellent, one of the best meals we had in New York, cant fault it

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: One of the best most authentic Indian dinners I've had in yeard
review: I've never made it to India. I tend to hold my authentic Indian dining experience against meals I've had in London. This place was delicious and as far as I can tell, the real deal. Went out as a group of friends, and we were truly the minority given the number of tables occupied by people obviously from India. So to me, that's always a sign of an authentic ethnic restaurant outside the actual country it is trying to represent.  As you enter the restaurant, there's a very small (6 person maybe) bar in a street level lobby. Then you go up a flight of stairs to the restaurant. The layout is spacious, open, and has windows at each end of the room which makes the space seem even larger.  The food was fantastic! The wait staff was the only reason I didn't give 5 dots. They were 'very good' too, but not always friendly (we had three different waiters). And although they have a liquor license, we weren't offered the wine list or drinks. We had to ask. Which may be cultural, I don't know. But it was a bit odd.  I will be back. And I will tell anyone I know who's traveling to the Times Square area who like Indian food to be sure to check this place out!
Was great, service was a bit slow and also the interior wasn't nice, very noise and cold sp to say, just had a dinner, relatively expensive

This restaurant was around the block from my hotel and I Love Indian so we went for Sunday buffet.  Everything was outstanding. Normally on a buffet one or two items are not that good but every item on the buffet was outstanding. There were more vegetarian items which pleased me because I eat more vegetarian when eating Indian. The had lamb and chicken which were both excellent. I had the lamb and my friend had the chicken.  I loved the mixed vegetables and the mushroom mattar. The chickpeas were excellent too. Like I said everything was good.  This is one of the best Indian buffets I have ever had. I would definitely go back when in NYC.  Well done!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Great place for a quick, fresh, flavorful lunch!
review: Stopped here for lunch during a recent PLI conference. I was looking for someplace close, quick, quiet, flavorful and relatively healthy. Utsav checked all of the boxes. It was a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. The lunch buffet had many fresh and flavorful selections. The service was prompt and friendly. The buffet was not inexpensive, but it was worth it not to have to hunt for another place to eat or to have to rush through lunch. I would gladly return the next time I am in NYC.

Had dinner here at the restaurant with our friends. The restaurant located just beside Time Square and is of large size offers Indian dishes. We order daal, Chicken Angara, Butter Chicken, Malai curry and Gulati Kabab. Each dishes were tasty except for kabab, as the taste wasn't i was expecting. The staff is very attentive and professional

review_title: Average with not so good service
review: We did the lunch buffet. The food was decent. We ordered drink and garlic naan. They both never came. The check took forever to get. It wasn't a busy day.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: This is a two level restaurant with the bar area on the ground level and the dining area on the second. There is an elevator for those who may not be able to climb the stairs. The dinning level is large and handsomely done. The restaurant is in the theater district, making it perfect for either pre or post theater.  Everyone is friendly and professional from the hosts to the servers. There is an extensive Indian menu with both vegetarian and meat dishes. At dinner there is a $38 "Prix Fixe" menu with very nice selections. Servings are generous and filling.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: One of the few upscale Indian restaurants in Times Square Area
review: It's tucked in on 47th between 6&7 Ave, and is a little hidden, but if you're as hungry as I was you'll easily find it :-)  Really enjoyed this place, from the décor to the attentive service to the incredible tasty food The food quality and customer service were impeccable.  All of the wait staff do a good job of making you feel like you are the center of their collective attention even though it takes longer-than-average wait to find a place to sit.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Tasty but cold food and poor service
review: This place looked very smart and we were amazed to see it so quiet. However the service was not great, e.g. we asked to order scallops and were simply told "no". Upon questioning we found out that they had no scallops. (thats just one example of the poor communication). We ordered several items that were not in stock. Despite that fact that there were only about 4 other tables occupied (at 7pm on a busy Sunday) it took almost an hour for food to be served. When the food eventually came it WAS very tasty, but several of the meals were cold or only luke warm at best. Overall high priced poorly served and poorly presented food that admittedly would have been a winner with better service and served hot and in a timely manner

Craving for Indian food after 3 days of burgers we stumbled upon this gem of a place. The ambience looks pricey but prices are very reasonable. Food is fresh and taste awesome. The chicken tandoori , lamb dishes are 1 of the best. Nothing taste like its been thawed from the freezer. Food is also very gentle on the stomach and very well cooked. Top marks for the chef. The waiters need to be more humble in their approach and a smile and less seriousness definately will add more spice to this superb restaurent. Thank You for your "home cooked meals ".

its good with its location right across the street from time square .. its well decorated . the food is good with its special snack options and the cocktails are simply too good but with all this nice it is also very very SLOW in its service .

Me and my boyfriend visited Utsav last night for our last night in New York and it was great. The food was very reasonably priced and the staff were friendly. It had a really chilled and laid back atmosphere which was a really nice contrast to the normal hustle and bustle of Times Square.

Four of us had dinner after seeing a Broadway show. My daughter's friend, who works in the area recommended the restaurant and we were not disappointed. We ordered from the regular menu, rather than the price fixe menu. We had assorted dishes, such as Paneek Paneer, Sea Bass and veggie dishes. We ordered Garlic Naan and Jasmine Rice, which were extra. The food was very tasty. The sea bass was very small for the high price charged, but it was also very tasty. Living in New Jersey we found the prices very high, but knowing that we were in NY, it was expected. The restaurant is nicely decorated and is located in a courtyard between 46th and 47th Streets. The bar is on the ground floor and the dining area on the second floor.

Visited with my girlfriend after a long day of sightseeing an shopping. We chose this place due to the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We had the 3 course set menu which was great value. Bill was around $100 with tip for 3 courses and drinks.  Curry I very flavourful but not very hot, starters and appetisers were very nice. A traditional Indian ice cream for desert which was a bit strange at first but very nice. Would recommend for a nice Curry in NY, good central location as well, near Rockefeller Center.

review_title: Absolutely terrible service - but decent food.
review: As someone that loves authentic Indian food and who has been to India over 40 times, I was looking forward to eating at Utsav. From the check-in with the hostess (who was very abrasive and curt) to when we got to the table, the service was absolutely horrendous. Waited 20 min for our order to be taken. 45 min until our first course arrived. The samosas were very tasty indeed, the squash soup was tasteless and the colic cauliflower was surprisingly tasty (that from colleague who dislikes cauliflower). Main course: the briani was ok; the lamb ragon josh was not curried enough(I asked for very spicy); the naan was bad enough that a true blooded Indian would not have touched it. The masala was ok but not curried enough; the vindaloo was good (but that is coming from a Texan who is used to Mac n cheese).  After we finished the main course we waited 25 min for the waiter to take away the dishes (after we called over the hostess). Another 20 min to order desert.  Desert was very lackluster, vanilla ice cream.  Overall decent food with the worst possible service.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Bit costly but good taste and ambience
review: Biggest of plus is the location of this restaurant . It's stone throwaway distance from time square . You can walk thru the Times Square and be here for your lunch or dinner . We happen to be there fully tired and hungry ... Hopped in to the restaurant ... It was bit crowded owning to long weekend ... But then gave the order ... Had to wait a long for the food to arrive ... No complimentary stuffs during wait time ... Food quantity was less ... Parathas weren't as good as we expected ... Biryanis felt like pulao... But the curries were good ... I loved the goat curry ... Overall ok ok ... Not bad ... But you may feel bit let down when you get the bill ... It was costly

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This is a large Indian restaurant, It is on the first floor I believe above a theatre. Décor is average whilst we found the service to be good, food was very good with prices to match. Was nice to see it was busy.
Lunch buffet was awesome with choices of from starters till main course. Didn't find any variety in desert. But food was very delicious. Quite a good place, Must visit restaurant for Indian food.

It was near to the place we stayed. First we tried at Bombay masala. Since the ambeince of restaurant mentioned was very Indian we tried utsav. First time it was disappointing. Bhindi fry was ordered as one of the side dish. See photo. Yes, it is friieeed. We wanted the naan to be crispy, it was blackish crispy. May be first time problem? So we tried one more time. Even second time also disappointed. We ordered Aalu palak but were served with panner palak, though they admitted the mistake by compensating with a desert, we politely refused. This is my experience. My choice at Times Square will be Banares.

We booked to go here on a whim on Christmas Day. The restaurant is huge, it was busy but not full occupancy. Reassuringly we thought, it was extremely popular with the Indian community so we were anticipating an enjoyable dining experience. Unfortunately this was not the case. My chosen starter wasn't noted as being hot and spicy, but for my palate it was and it spoilt what could have been a nice starter. The portion size of the first course was huge, and could have warranted for being half the size. Our choice of mains, although different I thought tasted very much the same. The chicken was a little chewy and we just couldn't get excited about it. The service was also just ok, not very personal and not very engaging.  We've eaten all over the world on our travels, so I fully understand how Indian food can differ. But, let's just say, if we go back to NYC we'll be swerving Utsav.

The concierge at Hotel Edison recommended this restaurant, which is easily walked to from Times Square, when we asked for good, authentic Indian restaurants in New York City. As we approached the restaurant my lovely wife noted that it looked somewhat intimate and quaint. Apparently we thought the bar area was the restaurant, and were soon escorted up to the spacious dining room. We were seated at a window and offered menus. The service was great, but the food fell short of expectations, and was very pricey. Our neighbor makes samosas and shares them with the neighborhood, and we expected the same authenticity at Ustav. Unfortunately, the flavors and textures were not there. I ordered the butternut squash soup, which was delicious, but the chicken tikka masala did nothing for me, nor did the kulfi, which I found to be almost too frozen to cut into and more a savory dish than a dessert. The prices were quite high and we did not leave with a good taste in our mouths, literally and figuratively. Next time we will try one of the smaller (and hopefully less expensive) restaurants.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We went here for office get together lunch & I had a good experience. The food is good and comparable to what we find back in good restaurants back home in India. There was variety & both veg & non-veg food was good. For main course, it was a buffet. The ambiance was good & the staff was courteous. Overall, good Indian treat in New York

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: When you find an Indian Restaurant in New York where 90% of the clientele are from the Sub-Continent, you know that they must be doing it right. That was the case on a Saturday night when we visited. Don't expect gushing US style wait staff. The staff, from the greeter to the head waiter were the essence of Indian good manners and correct service. You could have been in the Taj Palace in Mumbai. Pleasant and respectful at all times. The menu is extensive with both traditional and unexpected dishes. We had the crab cakes and bhel puri as appetizers, and Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Xacutti as entrees. All were excellent. Accompanied by a mixed bread basket. The Kingfisher Lager was good too! At 9:30 new groups of diners were still arriving and the majority were either Indian or of Indian decent. That must be a recommendation. We were impressed and enjoyed the meal immensely.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Foodie;Like a Local
review: After seeing the play 'India Ink' next door at the Roundabout Theatre, I was in the mood for some Indian food. I arrived at 10:30 and they close at 11 pm, so the young man suggested I have my quick meal in the bar lobby on the ground floor. The service was fast and pleasant, the food was fantastic, I just wish he was playing relaxing Indian music instead of loud Katy Perry. I will go back again, but I will sit upstairs where hopefully the music doesn't conflict with digestion. I had the delightful round eggplant dish - yum!

Had been looking forward to visiting here as was recommended by friends who had visited many years ago. Initially looks deserted as restaurant is upstairs. Poor lighting, dips aren't replenished and didn't find waiters attentive as had to keep calling over whenever we wanted anything despite it not being busy. Fire alarm went off several times however no explanation to diners. Food was nice except think bhel puri had gone off a little. Won't be going back anytime soon

We had lunch at this restaurant on Sunday July 6th.  When we had visited this restaurant, several years back, we were pleasantly surprised by the ambiance and quality of food. So when we arrived in NYC this 4th of July weekend, Utsav was the 1st restaurant that came to mind for Indian food. I made a reservation to make sure we had a place.  We arrived with a lot of anticipation, but were utterly disappointed, by the time we left.  The restaurant started us of on the wrong foot, by stacking up unclean plates. Every plate we picked up (from the stack of plates provided) had food particles stuck to the bottom. Either their dishwasher was spoilt, or whoever was washing the dishes, did a shoddy job. I had to pick through at least 10 plates (supposedly clean) before getting hold of a “somewhat clean plate”.  At the Appetizer counter, there was a man preparing chat. I asked him for a helping, and was told that they will bring it to our table. By the time we left, no one had bothered to get us the chat.  The food quality was well below average, and not commensurate of a restaurant charging over $20/person for the buffet. There were very few items, both for the vegetarian and the non-vegetarian palate. The food tasted like “production line” preparation. There were two desert dishes that were clearly below par.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good Indian food. Utsav has clearly lost its edge.
So good! We had the Lox Sandwich and totally enjoyed it! They had a queue, but it went really fast! Good food and good service!

Had some breakfast with a small group of friends. Workers were funny and entertaining ! Glad to have this place as my first NYC Bagel experience.  I got an everything bagel with cream cheese and an iced coffee. Good selection, good value and great tasting !

My new favorite. Had a plain bagel with extra cream cheese with a cafe au lait, was delicious perfection. Not sure why I'd never heard of them before. The location is perfect if staying next door at the Park South hotel. Had a little wait, not it was worth it. Always looked busy and I understand why. Excellent way to start the day.

review_title: An NYC hole-in-the-wall with great bagels and fresh baked goods
review: The bagels were fresh and delicious, and we heard other people talking about how much they enjoyed the other baked goods. It was a mix of tourists and regulars stopping in. Nothing dramatic, just a good, quick breakfast.
Really enjoyed our meal here. Steak was delicious. Biggest baked potato I’ve ever seen. Lots of different dips and owner was really nice. Introduced himself and had a chat

user_tags: Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Family celebrating my son moving to NY and wanted a special dinner. TripAdvisor did not disappoint me. I knew K Rico was expensive but I wanted the best. Hubby had the 18oz bone-in sirloin and son and I shared a Churrasco steak and shrimp salad. Of course, we had to keep sampling the Sirloin. Best steak I've ever had. I can't wait to go back and try the aged Tomahawk. Near end of our meal we had a chance to meet the brothers of K Rico and discovered we've traveled to many of the same places. Before we left, hubby had a flight of Japanese Whiskey (just in) and I enjoyed a Pisco Sour; we both enjoyed our after dinner conversation and drinks. Thank you K Rico for a most enjoyable evening.

review_title: A wide array of tasty meat choices
review: Yes, they sure know how to select, prepare and serve good meat ! This is what they are praised for and they deserve it. Plus, the staff does a great job. That was enough to spend a very pleasant family dinner. Note : the desserts are common and one level down, compared to the meats... Last but not least : the prices are high (40+ for a large piece of meat), but customers don't seem to consider them deterrent...

We went at lunch, experience is amazing. Very small and imtimate, tables are on top of each other, but that adds to the experience. Lunch is an incredible value, most of full menu options available for only $11, wow. The Sicilian Meatballs are amazing. Staff is all Sicilian, feel like you are there as they are all speaking native. If you want amazing hand made pasta, do go here, do not even think about showing up without a reservation. If you are looking for a quiet, say romantic setting this is not it. However the intimacy adds to the experience.

We visited as a party of 10 pre marathon. It is a tiny place and was jam packed so be prepared for a squeeze around the table. We opted for mains only as the portions are a good size and no one was disappointed. Lovely, hearty pasta dishes and super quick service. The only reason I’m not giving a 5 rating is that we did feel quite rushed towards the end of the meal. There was a queue developing outside so I get that they needed our table back but it would’ve been nice not to have to rush our final drinks.
We had a delicious meal here with homemade pasta and a homely atmosphere. The restaurant is super small and mega busy so pre booking in advance is a must! So glad we went - fantastic food!

So we brought back family and friends to this restaurant. We had enjoyed it on the recommendation of our concierge and wanted to bring back others. It was great! The star again was the grilled octopus but also great fish and vegetarian options. Greek dips and hummus were fantastic and wonderful service. Highlight was the chef visiting our table. Highly recommend

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Family Vacationer
review: Wow, so impressed with not just the food, service but the owner herself! My brother-in-law planned a surprise 50th birthday celebration for my sister and Maria Loi was just wonderful to setup a back area table and be in on the surprise. The appetizers were all top-notch! The grilled octopus was tender and delicious and who knew that their tomatoes in the village salad would be so fresh and tasty! All of their spreads were so yummy and also loved their grilled halloumi. Wine selections were excellent and all paired wonderfully with our meal. They accommodated us by doing more 'family-style' with the main courses so we all shared and sampled. The branzino was delicate and light, lamb shank with orzo was tender and rich, and the eggplant was so delicious, it tasted like high-end shepherd's pie! We all had a sampling of their desserts with a flour less chocolate cake which was surprisingly delicate and chocolatey at the same time; a walnut cake that was so moist with honey and I can honestly say that the baklava was the best I've had!

The food, the service, the ambiance, and even the rest room do not match the prices in this W58 Greek restaurant.  You can easily find equal or superior offerings at many of the Greek restaurants (and even diners) around Manhattan and Astoria, Queens, for far less money.

This place is terrific! It's Greek cuisine but it's terrific for fish. We had the Greek spreads as appetizers along with the best grilled octopus we have ever had. I had Branzini and my wife had stuffed eggplant. Both dishes were terrific. But I have to give a real nod to service. Our waiter brought 3 bottles of wine for us to try. We selected our favorite and he opened the wine list to subtly confirm the price and selection with me. The concierge at the Essex House recommended this place and we give it rave reviews

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;60+ Traveler;Thrifty Traveler
review: This place has it all: friendly waitstaff, fabulous pizza,plus wonderful salads and appetizers. Each of us got our own pizza (which only produced 3 leftover slices) a greens salad, and an artichoke appetizer. Although there were some big groups in the restaurant, it's laid out beautifully, so it is NOT noisy. I loved seeing the pizzas being made and then baked in the wood burning oven.

I am a huge pizza lover and this was really good. My gf had been wanting to come for years and we finally made it. The place is small and we got there on a Friday night around 6, but managed to come just in time. The kitchen is open to the diners so you hear the hustle and bustle. Our waitress was very nice. We got the meatballs and soppressata for appetizers. The meatballs were delicious and my gf said they were just as good as her grandmas homemade Sicilian meatballs and that's saying something! The pizza had olives and sausage on it. The crust was nice and thin, but if there's one complaint it would be the crust was a little burnt in spots. Other than that a delicious dinner!

Best pizza in NYC! Crust is light and tasty; fior di latte mozzarella, sweet and creamy; sauce just sweet enough; cooked to perfection. Restaurant is small and tight, but definitely worth the visit if you want outstanding Neapolitan pizza. No need for toppings, just get the margherita with the fior di latte mozzarella.

How on earth can you charge 21 dollars for a Margherita? I am italian and I know how much pizza costs to make. I also know that outside Italy pizza can be very "posh" but this is robbing people. Never again

review_title: Almost as good as pizza from Napoli
review: Had the margherita pizza and it reminded me of the pizza I had in Naples. Fresh tomato, basil and tasty mozzarella. Crust was a little chewy, but flavorful. Pizza s are "12 and on the expensive side. Consider a margherita pizza in southern Italy is around $4, the pizza at motorino is $15. Overall, true italian pizza, but on the expensive side.

The hubs and I brought our two teenage boys here for some lunch, and, although we waited quite a while to score a table, it was SO worth it. We went Margheritas all around, and they did not disappoint.

Having myself lived in Italy and consumed a fair amount of pizzas, I can honestly say that this is a true Neapolitan style pizza - and a great one indeed. I will be coming back, I can only recommend this place.

This place smells so good as you walk by, that you just have to stop and have a bite. The restaurant is really, really small, seriously. If you have a part of 5 or more, like I did, be ready to wait for an hour or more, especially at dinner time. So keep that in mind. What I saw was a lot of take outs, which is something that I will do next time, instead of dining in and waiting forever. They just don't have the space, and they don't take reservations or call aheads. Other than that, the staff and hostess were great and friendly. The pizza is done right inside brick oven. I believe one pizza would feed two, but if you're really hungry, then just stick with one all for yourself. The price is decent, compared to other NYC restaurants.

East Village place offers good pizza up until midnight. Dough base is good and thin, marinara is delicious and the pepperoni was also excellent. Definitely not cheap, 12" pizza is 16$ and up, but value is very good for the money.

Yummmmm. Had the special last night. Buffalo mozzarella and other cheeses I can't remember. Excellent flavour. Split it with a friend while my bf had a meaty pizza to himself. Great fast friendly service. My water glass was never empty. Very popular place. Was packed by 8 pm.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: If you don't like Brussel sprouts now, you will when you leave Motorino. Order the Brussels sprout and Pancetta Pizza. You will be blown away.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: maybe the best pizza of new york
review: i am 100% italian and i have some italian friends in new york, for us this is the best pizza in the city, well made, soft and with a lot of ingridients,try the "stracciatella"
We are here on Saturday night. The location is great and a great vibe. The staff are wonderful. We both ordered pizza. Not the best pizza but ok.

What an amazing little gem is this. Away from all the New York noise is this small little Italian place. The place was empty but vibrant. They had an open kitchen which was awesome. Over the radio were some classic American tunes and the waitress spoiled us with attention. I had the prosciutto pizza... Outstanding! When it got a bit darker outside they dimmed the lights, lit the candles and turned up the music.... it could have been the red wine, or the heat from the oven, but I felt a wave of warmth coming over me.... something that said "I'm feeling pretty relaxed now". This place is on my list next time I'm in the Big Apple.
Very small spot but the best pizza I ever had in restaurant. Visited with friends to try this special pizza . Ordered sprouts pizza and regular .. I can eat at this spot everyday ..... A++

review_title: We called, they delivered outstanding pizza - what's not to like?
review: On a recommendation we called Motorino for pizza. We had been directed towards the sopressata piccante. So that's what we ordered, along with a cremini mushroom pizza. The food was delivered to our door in double quick time and the pies were excellent and authentic.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: We were recommended Motorino by friends and we were happy they did. Good food, nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Will it blow your mind?? Probably not, you will however leave with a contented smile.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Pinnacle of a grand pizza tour
review: Luzzo's, Arturo's, John's on Bleecker ...  They're all great but Motorino in the East Village wins my heart.  Short wait times even on a Friday night, simple furnishings, then pizza to knock your socks off. The Brussels sprouts number has the town talking and you'll quickly taste why.  Cheap red wine in tumblers tasted pretty good too.  And the bill was far smaller than expected for such a headline pizza parlour.

review_title: LOVE the pizza. So far my favorite in NYC.
review: I'm a huge fan of thin crust NYC pizza and this is my favorite place I've been to. I say this with the caveat that I don't make it to Brooklyn often so I'm sure there's better out there, but this is pretty damn good and I always leave happy. Personal pies go for about $15 each and they have lots of options for toppings. It's a small restaurant so I'm not sure if it can accommodate a huge group, but for couples or friends it's a really great lunch spot. Highly recommend.
If u like authentic Italian style pizza this is the place..in the village..only 30 places ..they don t take reservations it was perfect and not expensive...I m going back!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: After reading many of the good reviews we decided to get a take out pizza.  We chose the Cremini Mushroom, which cost $18.50  When the box arrived we were a bit shocked at the tiny size of it but thought that it will surely taste great.  Unfortunately it didn't. 4 slices ( I thought pizzas meant to be huge in the USA) and tasted of nothing.  Very disappointed and would not return.

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Well... If you order your pizza and eat at home, probable the pizza will be very good. But don't eat it at the restaurant. The place is a mass of people!! Too crowded! Too much noise! You have to call out all the time! Noooo! If you and a very good pizza and a nice and more calm place, go to Luzzo's!!!!! 100 times better!!!
Amazing base, fresh good quality ingredients, I loved the Brussel Sprout Pizza, with FIOR DI LATTE / GARLIC / PECORINO / SMOKED PANCETTA / E.V. OLIVE OIL

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Amazing pizza! Very small place, but very authentic food. One of the best Pizzas you can get in this city.

Visited again, and took family this time. Enjoyed the brussel-sprout pizza and meatball pizza. The former is my favorite, and the latter was a special that day - with freshly made meatballs and sauce. Both were excellent. Although the server told us that the pizza's were "individual size" - do not be fooled - these easily feed two. The four of us didn't even finish the two pies. The place does a high volume of deliveries - which leads me to believe they have a very large following of repeat customers.  One negative is that the tables are kind of small.

review_title: Best Pizza I've Had Outside of Italy
review: I'll admit, I'm a sucker for brick oven pizza. And this place doesn't disappoint. The restaurant itself is small and the menu is on the pricey side. But man, the pizza is good. I ordered the meatball pizza and it was out of this world. Three of us ordered two pizzas, an appetizer, and all had a coke and the bill came to $67 with tip. So definitely not cheap. But I promise you'll love the pizza.

review_title: Quaint Cafe. Delicious Pizza. Perfect Crust.
review: I really enjoyed this restaurant. Small, intimate restaurant. Amazing pizza. I shared a pizza (4 large slices to a pizza). It was a seasonal special with fresh cherry tomatoes, parsley, red onion, olives, and mozzarella. Very tasty.
Serious taste in this 40 seat thai resturant. Cannot go wrong. Fun vibrant atmosphere for a small place too!
We dropped in for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it. I had pad thai and my son had pork + crab with raman noodles that was awesome and full of flavor, highly recommended. Good service too.
Great food and excellent service and very small restaurant. It almost tastes like Thailand. Its different than fast food in NY.

Recommended to us by a guide on a earlier food tour this was a great find. Ideal spot if you are attending a Broadway show later as we were. Wonderful fresh tasting Thai meal - main and starter each with a beer for about $70 including tip - a steel! Point to note - spicy so go mild if you are not a chilli fan

review_title: Firt time dining at Pure Thai
review: Four of us really enjoyed Pure Thai entrees. Dry Ratchaburi, Soup Sukhothai and the Pad Kee Moa w/chicken. The service was very good all the way around. Seating, server and delivery of our food. We especially enjoyed the drinks Hibiscus and Thai Ice Coffee. The desert topped off our mean Punkin Custard. The restaurant is small, so be prepared to share a table with others at lunch time when it's busy. We will be back to try other entrees, next time in area. Thank you.

We kept walking by Pure Thai and there was always a line so when I read the reviews I knew we had to try it out. It FAR exceeded even our expectations. We went on a Friday around 6 and the wait for a table for 2 was only about 15 minutes. The place is really tiny, which only adds to the whole experience. I ordered the shrimp pad thai, that was delicious and not too spicy. I was surprised by how reasonable the prices were too. I definitely recommend checking out this great spot in Hells Kitchen.
The place is really small, so you will have to wait a bit to be seated. However the food is good and serving is super fast, worth a visit.

My husband and I were there last year (2014) in December during the week. It was wonderful : a quite romantic evening with excellent service and delicious food. However we went there last Friday Dec 4th and it was a mad house : had to wait in the small bar area even tho we had reservations, the noise so loud none of us could hear? The duck was the best ever!! and they offered after dinner drinks to accommodate Just be sure to go on a week night

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: With a lovely candlelit dining room and a varied prix fix dinner, this is an excellent choice for fine dining. As an appetizer, my husband had a unique single ravioli with an egg yolk inside, which he declared outstanding. My husband's char was fabulous, my scallops a bit less so but still very good. Wonderful desserts and an excellent wine list. Pricy, but worth it.
Everything was perfect from beginning to the end! Food was delicious, and the Apple tart is best I have ever eaten! Eat here next time you're in NYC!

Celebrated New Year's Eve at Scalini Fedeli and it was a very enjoyable night. The staff were very attentive, Maitre'd kept close watch on all that was happening. The food was a set menu for the night and it was beautifully cooked. Decorations were put up everywhere, plenty of champagne available at a reasonable cost. Well worth going.

This is an outstanding restaurant. I understand the high ratings over the years. The work coming from the kitchen are masterpieces. Chef does an amazing job of bringing flavors together. He is big on adding an orange tint to items, very different! They did nice presentation for my wife's birthday, this is appreciative. Also the service is outstanding, nothing spared yet is not over the top. Would highly recommend this establishment. Also $70 for 3 courses of this quality is very good compared to some other similar offerings in the city.

My wife and I visited here last week and it was an amazing evening. The food and service were both impeccable and although not cheap, the fixed price menu had plenty of options and many options took my fancy.  This place is very romantic so dress up and have a brilliant night out.
A great restaurant with excellent service, good food and a nice selection of wines. The menu is impressive and the wine list extensive though not inexpensive.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: My husband and I chose this restaurant as we have enjoyed "Sirena Restaurant" in Long Branch NJ owned by the Cetrulo brothers and consider it a favorite. Scalini Fedeli was all that we hoped for and more as a place to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. Quiet and charming ambience, helpful and knowledgeable staff and amazing food made this an evening we will long remember. $70 prix fix dinner offers ample choices. The food is beautifully prepared and presented - starting with wonderful bread choices, an amazing mini- ravioli amuse bouche right to the incredible desserts we felt we were in a foodies' paradise. We are sure that anything we might have ordered would have been top notch but I have to mention the chicken liver ravioli, duck breast, diver scallops, apple tarte and chocolate dessert. Wines by the glass were excellent and the waiter guided us in making a choice. We look forward to returning for another sparkling NYC dining experience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Shopping Fanatic
review: Well, we finally got to eat here and we enjoyed it all! The food, the service and the ambiance were perfecto! Our waiter Noah (Noe) was wonderful and his recommendations were right on with the wine and the food. Not being rushed to finish your meal in NYC is always an issue. NOT HERE. The dining room was full and no one was rushed at all. When my husband request a little cheese and some proscuitto it appeared even though it was not on the menu! The foccia bread was amazing, we had to ask them to take it away so we had room for food. Great wine list! The my salmon was cooked perfectly and our dessert was eaten even though we had no room. Had to walk it off to the parking garage:)
Spice Symphony is a very enjoyable Indian restaurant. Nice ambiance and decor, good friendly service and very tasty food. Good vegetarian & vegan options. Recommended.

How refreshing to find this intimate restaurant in busy Manhattan. We got there at 6 pm on a Saturday evening- the first to arrive. We didn’t have reservations. By the time we left at 7 pm, the place was full! My daughter and I ordered several appetizers including spring rolls, samosas, raita, and garlic naan then split an entree— chicken vindaloo. Everything was so tasty and spicy! Our server was great and honored us with two other items— a complimentary sample appetizer and dessert! With two glasses of wine, our bill was $56–what a deal to get such authentic Indian food in New York City. Friendly service here —can’t wait to come back!

Ate here on last night of our holiday after recommendation from a friend. Excellent service. Happy to advise in food if you wish. My daughter Found her cocktail a little strong so they made her another. Unusual but tasty starters - spinach fritters could have perhaps had slightly less sauce but were delicious. Mains were also good. Extra rice as required and a very good naan bread. Probably not a place to sit and spend a whole evening but for a quick curry and beer it is excellent. Would recommend

review_title: Authentic halal indian food - short walk from Empire State building
review: Small and cost restaurant serving authentic indian cuisine. We had lamb rogan josh, chicken biryani and naan for mains and were really impressed! Spicy and flavoursome and good amounts of tender meat! Mango kulfi for dessert tasted as sweet as a honey mango! Impressed with prices too. A 10 minute stroll from Empire State building which we went to after our meal. Most importantly this is 100% halal which has been easier to find than expected!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;History Buff;Nature Lover
review: This was an excellent place for a meal, clean not noisy and reallky nice food, It is a mix of Indian and Chinese food, but it is very well done. They cater well for vegetarians, and are prepared to cook things that are not on the menu.

I happen to stumble across this restaurant when I was in the neighborhood. I looked up a good ramen place on tripadvisor and found this place and thought what the heck, I'll try it. The place is small but I was able to get a seat pretty easily. The service is fast and food is wonderful. I would highly recommend this place if you want really good ramen!

I hosted a dinner for clients in the private room at Royal 35. I reached out to the restaurant initially because if their TripAdvisor status and it was relatively close to our clients’ office. I went in the day before and met with one of the partners, Alfredo, and we selected wines for the dinner. Alfred and his team were extraordinarily accommodating. Our waiter, Remi, took care of us like we were royalty. I wish I could post a video of when the seafood towers were brought out. The display was amazing and the seafood was absolutely delicious. Everyone loved their steaks and the sides were also excellent. We did a sampling of desserts and there was absolutely nothing left. Just an overall great experience!

It was our last night in New York and we have been away from home Sydney Australia, for 3 weeks. As a meat loving family we were all craving a good steak. I found this little treasure on Google Maps. It was close tonour hotel and looked pretty good. We arrived after a long day of holidaying and looked a fright. I had no idea it was more fine dining than just a steakhouse . It really didn't matter because the staff didn't judge us on our appearance. They were extremely attentive and shared jokes with us. We got the porter house steak for 4, 2 of the 4 of us are very big eaters, so it made sense to do it this way The other 2 got the fillet steak and the fish. We devoured the steak in record time as it was cooked perfectly, medium rare, just how we like it. The sides are separate, so you just get the steak and you pivk the sides. We had the German potatoes, mash and string beans. I can not thank the staff enough for making this a night to remember. If you are ever in New York you need to come here.

I never would have picked this place on my own, so I'm glad I was part of a party who's guest of honor wanted to go. Fantastic dinner, melt in our mouth steak, great sides, great sized portions, service was excellent. Can't wait to go back.

Excellent food, prompt and attentive service in a great environment.  We had the Surf n Turf with onion rings, fries, asparagus and creamed spinach.  The lobster would have benefited from a garlic butter but otherwise couldn’t fault the food or the service.  We will definitely be returning when next in NYC.

Very relaxed atmosphere, simple menu, great wine list. Traditional setting with super service we went for a steak and were not disappointed. We ordered a fillet which was a very generous size and two of us had a porterhouse. We were concerned not to have a steak with a rare centre and our waiter brought it out on a sizzling plate and then sliced and cooked the red meat on the sides of the plate to make it just right. Perfect and totally delicious. The owner had a chat with us on our way out to ask about our food which was a personal touch to our evening. This is a definite place to visit in New York.

review_title: Upscale steak restaurant with excellent food.
review: It was recommended to us and we really liked it. The steaks and the samon were excellent, very nice atmosphere. Service was very friendly, quick and and proffesional. Prices are high but Food worth the money.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Luckily, our hotel checked our reservation. The reservation we made 3 weeks before was not booked. Well, we got still a table. It was not a great one. Small and upstairs in a small floor without any charm.  The food was ok. But for a steakhouse with such reviews and in this prize range is okay not good enough. I got a filet mignot, good quality but not well prepared. In addition we waited too long for each course. The waitors were very kind and attentive.  To summerize, we would not recommand this steakhouse. To bad for our Christmas meal.
Realy frendly and professional service. Fille Minion was so well done thats its really smell in my mouth. Good sortiment of wines and most inportant price level is desent. Will come back this place

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local
review: When you only have 3 nights in NYC, you want your choices to be really good. I choose Patsy's based on other Trip Advisor reviews, and its long history. My wife and I were seated in the back of the restaurant right up against the dessert tray! We both started with a Manhattan.Turned out to be the best thing of the night. Shared a caesar salad that had this "Sweet" strange dressing.Not a hint of an anchovy. Our waiter recommended a pasta(I can't remember the name) that was watery, not much flavor. We each had a glass of the Super Tuscan wine that didn't have much going for it either. I guess our photo, won't be up on the wall....

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Went here for my wife's 50th birthday recently. The place was packed but the staff from the moment we arrived were fantastic, very welcoming. The food, oh my God it was divine, every mouthful was absolutely delicious, we even made space for the amazing dessert, Tiramisu for my wife & chocolate Ganache cake for me, it was so good. The waiters were very attentive & efficient 7 the whole evening was excellent. Thank you to Lisa for sorting the reservation.

Place was tight, and was full even an hour before dinner time. Nice dumplings - already worth a gourmand’s visit. Special Entrees were interesting, cheap fish cooked well the Chinese way, deep fried bartered squid with garlic, very nice to the bite, and wok sautéed beef with veggies that had a very appetising tangy taste.  Good price for what you get, worth the difficulty in language and the tight fit.
We were here a few years ago and it was so good, we made a special trip via taxi to go back. The food was excellent, yet again and it was worth every bit of travel to get there!

review_title: Great Chinese cuisine in the heart of Chinatown
review: It looked a popular restaurant as it was busy however we were able just to walk in for a table. Extensive menu with many options for regular favourites of Chinese food with a page of specials. We opted for dumpling and pan fried noodles. We found one order was enough for two ladies. Chinese tea offered on arrival at the table but beer & wine are also available. It was quite buzzy atmosphere and very reasonably priced.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We ate here on our first night in NYC . The place is small but we did not need to book . The service was excellent, the waitress explained every dish we enquired about. The food was excellent and well priced .

This tiny restaurant is worth seeking out for delicious food & excellent service at a great price. As soon as we arrived we were greeted with hot cups of tea which we really appreciated on a cold day. And our waitress Sherry kept refilling them. We ordered a dim sum appetizer- watercress & shrimp dumplings, Shanghai lo mein, pork chops with noodles in soup and ice cream for dessert all for around $30. We enjoyed every bite. In looking around everyone seemed to be ordering dim sum plus several other dishes and everything looked delicious! I wish this restaurant was in Phoenix!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Just a block off Canal Street, Shanghai Asian Cuisine offers one of the best culinary experiences in Chinatown. I'm so glad we decided to try it after reading some of the reviews here in TrypAdvisor. We loved it. The service was fast; the dishes arrived soon and the food was sublimely tasty. We shared everything. We were sad we couldn't eat more. I can't wait to go back. Bring cash because they do not accept credit cards. Not expensive. Food can compete with any Chinese restaurant in the city.

My kids and I were staying in Chinatown looking for great Xiao Long Bao (soup dumplings) so we stopped at Shanghai Asian Cuisine. Terrific dumplings and terrific prices. We ordered 1 order per person and some fried rice. Food was tasty and cheap. Cash only!

We arrived at this restaurant for an early dinner, close to 5:00 pm, and the small dining area was practically deserted. This gave us plenty of time to drink tea and pursue the quick lengthy menu. We ended up ordering from the chef's specialties and were not disappointed. Cash only, reasonably priced, highly recommended.
Not really anything negative to say here. The food was fantastic and well priced. Noodles were amazing and the dumplings even better. Staff were polite and attentive. Would visit again!

We went here because of tripadvisor and when we arrived every table was crowded already, early in the evening, but we only waited 10 minutes for ours. The dumplings were to die for, as was the lo mein and sweet and sour chicken (perfectly crispy and not soggy at all). The service was quick and we enjoyed every bite. Great located in Chinatown. Prices were very good, especially for NYC. Not sure we ate a cheaper meail, expect for on a street wagon. They only take cash. Don't miss it.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: opened till 9pm i think it is one of a few shop opened in that street. cash only - tea served.

This was my first time ever having these dumplings. My friend took me there for lunch it was very busy. We ordered the dumplings as a appetizer. When the waiter brought them out he give instructions on how to eat them they are filled with pork vegetables.and broth. You pick them up with your soup spoon and bite a hole in them and suck out this delicious soup and then eat the pork.dumpling. So heavenly. Wished I would've order them for a entree. The servers were very impatient when taking our order but all the food was good.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review_title: Dim Sum and traditional Chinese Food, great quality, great service
review: We visited the small restaurant in Soho NYC. Excellent quality, fast service and wonderful taste. Cash only. Seats/tables are a bit small but the menu and the food presentation is great.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: very good and traditional Chinese food
review: when you are in Chinatown you obviously have to eat Chinese. The food here is really really good and traditional, you get tea instead of water (which we appreciated very much since it was very cold outside!). Prices are not very high, but be aware you can only pay cash! There is a citibank around the corner in case you don't have any like we did....

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;Nature Lover
review: The food was good but not spectacular, the service was very fast, the restaurant interior was adequate. The price was reasonable. The best dish we had was General Tso chicken.

review_title: Superb Chinese Food in New York's Chinatown
review: In NY for a week, we resolved to eat Chinese food in Chinatown at least once. We went to SAC based on a number of reviews we'd read - including here on TripAdvisor. On arrival (we hadn't booked) we were asked to wait 20 minutes - and, standing outside in Chinatown we asked some departing American diners whether it was worth waiting. They assured us that it was.  They were right.  We ate the sizzling steak, which was tasty and succulent - not to mention sizzling. We had the house lobster which was quite pricey but again was worth the cost and effort of eating. the salt and pepper prawns were to die for and the Lo Mein (chicken) was pretty good - if not as spectacular as the other dishes.  The service was great - the food came unbelievably fast and the waiters were friendly and welcoming.  Heartily recommend this one.

We decided to go here for lunch on a Saturday after reading all the positive reviews and we were not disappointed! They were busy but moved quickly and we had to wait about 5 minutes for a table. We reviewed the menu outside so we were ready by the time we sat. There are tables on left and right and we were happy where we sat on the left. You get free tea which was very good. We had the Steamed Tiny Buns w/Crab & Pork (basically a soup dumpling), Steamed Pork Dumplings, Shanghai Fried Rice and Vegetable Pan-Fried Noodles. The dumplings, any kind, are the way to go! So, so good! The steamed tiny buns were fun to try to eat without breaking them before getting it to your mouth. Next time we'll get 4 or 5 kinds and split them. The fried rice and pan-fried noodles we both very good and filling; but the dumplings are much more exciting. Very reasonably priced and good service. Very tiny but clean bathroom in the back.

review_title: Bland food at New York prices
review: We have had some very good Chinese food on our vacation to NYC, but this was not one of them. The food was bland and dry -- and cost us $45 for two for lunch. No thanks. Won't be back...

review_title: Great food, great value, tight quarters
review: We almost walked in to the fancier place next door (to the right). A patron leaving Shanghai Asian told us "it's very good," and we believed her. Even more so after our food was served. A very varied menu, lots for anyone. The four of us had three appetizers and three entrees, more than enough food. Just about $60 before tip. Food was well prepared, very tasty and served quickly. The only complaint is the tight quarters. Especially the tables along the right side as you enter are awfully close together -- a few normal sized adults at adjacent tables, and... uncomfortably tight. Try to sit on the left side!

review_title: Great food, great service, worth every penny
review: My wife and I wanted Chinese food in NYC so we ventured all the way downtown to Shanghai Asian Cuisine based upon the TripAdvisor reviews. We weren't disappointed. The majority of the clientele were Asian, which is frequently a good sign. The servers/waitresses were friendly and very helpful. The complementary jasmine tea was welcome. The food came quickly and was of excellent quality, full of fresh vegetables and tender meats, with tasty sauces. The quantities were huge, and we ordered too much food, which was boxed up for us to take with us. The cost was very friendly too. Highly recommended. Worth a trek across town. The lucky staff even get to eat their own food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: This is where the local goes - we miss this restaurant
review: We were very lucky to be able to find this restaurant. There are many Shanghai cuisine restaurants in China town and I can 100% guarantee that this is the best one by far. We found this restaurant on last Tue (by luck) and since then, we kept returning to this restaurant on the next 2 days before flying back to London on Friday. We just loved their foods! During our visits, we ordered many different types of foods like dumplings, chicken, pork, noodles, fish...etc. and they were all absolutely delicious! (please see my photos for your references) The foods were cooked to traditional Shanghai style and were faultless. I also noticed that most of the customers were local Chinese and it showed "this restaurant is where the local goes". The price was reasonable as well. We ordered about 5 - 6 dishes each time and it costed around $30-37 (including tea and soy bean milk) - which was cheaper than a number of restaurants in China Town. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to try the real Shanghai cuisines. We really miss this place as we still haven't found a Shanghai restaurant as good as this one in London.

The food was very good. Service was also excellent. A few of the waitstaff were very fluent in English. They were accommodating when we asked to change tables for a better view. The Jasmine tea served to all guests was excellent. Our order was prepared and served in a timely fashion. Seating was comfortable and we were well taken care of. I would recommend this establishment to anyone seeking an authentic, well prepared meal at reasonable prices.
Cash only. Fortunately, you won't need much cash to have a great meal. Try the pancakes, soup dumplings and pork dumplings. Plus, unlimited hot tea.

user_tags: Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Nightlife Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Easy to find thank you trip advisor! Walked in, filled with locals, got to sit at a round table in the back with 2 men who were regulars. How lucky! They helped us navigate the menu and we ended up with the Best Chinese lunch EVER!! Tiny buns aka dumplings with soup inside have spoiled us! The noodles, the Kung pao everything even the tea was the best in New York. And the lovely gentleman sitting with us said he had just returned from Hong Kong and said even there the tiny buns were not as good. High praise!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Good and fast service, delicious food, a big variety of dishes, good prices! they have two restaurants in china town, very close one-another.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: Service with warmth and amazing food
review: Super food and super service ...Juli you made our visit memorable. The salmon roll was gorgeous and the ambience also but the service made this dinner awesome.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We decided to have dinner here with friends. Nice outside space, right on the beachside with Finns dance music as the backdrop. You enter through the beach club, with a long walk through a crowd of very drunk revellers. Not very VIP? The food was pretty good, quite a few items were sold out. The food is overpriced for the quality. Service was also ok. As a fine dining experience, this is not the place to come.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: View, service, food selection is great. Very relaxing rice padding and nature. Staffs are very attentive and helpful. Thank you!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Tasty food in front of mesmerizing view of Ubud rice terrace
review: Padi restaurant is an excellent all day dining restaurant inside Puri Sebali resort in Ubud. We love the breakfast here especially the special balinese yellow rice mixed with fried noodle and shredded chicken. Dinner here is never boring because of the variety foods, bbq party , live music and traditional balinese dance. The wow factor is the emerlard green panomaric view of rice terrace. Probably the best view in Ubud Bali.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: The VIP day beds, the food, the service, the drinks... Everything was on point.
review: What can I say about Finns Beach other then, if you want to be treated like a real VIP, then there is only one place you need to go... FINNS VIP BEACH CLUB  The day beds, the food, the service, the drinks... Everything was on point.  It is a staple in your Bali adventures itinerary.  Key call outs Gustu during the day at the day bed and Mila in the evening at the VIP Restaurant are assets to Finns Beach Club.  My wife and I really felt like VIPs and for all day drinking, eating and VIP day bed, and we still had credit. So they allowed us to order takeaway, which was super convenient.  Great service team, see you next year!

So when you arrive you pick where you want to be seated and what type of seating , lounge in pool , on edge , hammock etc. You prepay a minimum spend for the seat. Then you order food and drinks. Area very nice and staff were excellent. Location great . Food was good and drinks were cold  Make sure you allow enough time to hit your minimum spend.

We visited here in October 2022. The selection of international and traditional dishes was great, I had the soup to start, and the rendang curry for mains, for mains my hubby had steak and we shared a bottle of wine. I have to say it was one of the best meals I've had in Ubud and would highly recommend! It was dark when we arrived so, unfortunately, the view was limited but if you were to go in the day it would be quite something!

Hosted our 15 person dinner party for my sisters wedding on the top floor. Great space with high ceilings and bar. Phenomenal food, service and atmosphere. Tailored the evening to fit with our party - delayed courses as we were having too much fun dancing to the band. Every course was a win not just from a taste but also visual perspective. Thanks so much for helping make the evening special for us all! We also ate here daily during our stay and didn’t have a bad meal. Excellent!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Doesn’t get much better than this! ❤️
review: This was the highlight of our stay at Kayon Jungle Resort. The entire staff were so nice, warm and helpful and they treated us like family.  Every dish we tried was cooked to perfection. The food was so delicious with good size portions and the prices were very reasonable for being at a resort.  The restaurant itself is designed beautifully with bamboo and has a very exotic atmosphere with an fresh air open concept. They have fire dancers perform every Thursday night and they have traditional Balinese musicians playing on Friday nights. Both shows are free for all guest and they were spectacular.  This is one restaurant everyone deserves to experience at least once when I’m Ubud.  I Comfortably & Highly Recommend! ❤️

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Nature Lover;Luxury Traveler
review: We stayed at The Kayon and after eating dinner here on the first night, we were so impressed with the food quality and service that we ate most of our meals here! The menu is large and everything we ate, whether western, Indian or Indonesian was so delicious and presented beautifully! The staff were very attentive and friendly, we enjoyed having conversations with them each day. We recommend this restaurant to anyone staying in Ubud.

review_title: Breathtaking setting, great service and well presented food
review: We had the Romantic candlelit dinner at the restaurant. What a surprise it was! Elaborate decor and 5 courses served with style.

Our stay included several meals , starting with the magnificat breakfast . Unbelievable selection with attentive and very kind servers who wanted no mistakes . Dinners were similar - BBQ night was excellent. No complaints - nothing but compliments to the Team

review_title: Idyllic little oasis in the middle of Canggu
review: I spent one of my best afternoons so far in Bali here! I felt so welcome with the incredibly kind and hospitable staff. I was looking for a place to relax for a bit and ended up not wanting to leave! The pool, jungle, tranquility and delicious food made me wish I could come here more often.
