Hope to see you again soon, thank you for having me ♥️

review_title: Great hospitality with delicious food and drinks
review: Delectable food and cocktails. Great hospitality from Putri! She is always ready to serve us and assist us with our needs. Chilling by the infinity pool with drinks and snacks.

review_title: Amazing experience & 5 star service ! Highly recommend
review: Such a beautiful restaurant overlooking the pool. We enjoyed daily breakfast to start another day in paradise. Beyond the location and the variety of breakfast options, including many vegan dishes the staff can’t do enough to please and help. Putri was just stunning. So friendly caring, always with a smile and greeted us by name every day. The service has been 5 star. I warmly recommend staying at Theanna villas and enjoying this restaurant every day The highlight has been the floating breakfast this morning in our villa pool. Wow . This is a must when visiting Theanna Villas in Canguu. Thank you beautiful Putri.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: Delicious food with fresh product and amazing staff!
review: Going for breakfast at the Loop pool bar and restaurant of the Theanna eco villa and resort it’s always something exciting! They have a zero waste concept where they have fresh ingredients everyday and the meals are prepared at the moment! The Morning Sunshine smoothie with fruits and granola is Amazing!! Also the Indonesian food it’s delicious! The cherry on the cake is the presence of the amazing staff and make you feel welcome and are always available with a smile to help out! Service is impeccable and they always very attentive and happy to help! Definitely a place we will come back!

Highly recommend a visit to this oasis. The best time would be for a morning trip to the pool.  The staff are friendly and welcoming.  The restaurant has a 100K min spend. To sit by the pool on a lounger there is a 150K min spend.  The bathrooms are very clean and tidy.  The meals are reasonably priced and decent sizes.  The pool areas is relaxing and peaceful surrounded by nature, blue colours and the sound of birds / a waterfall.  I ordered a tuna steak on ciabatta. Unfortunately the ciabatta was about a day old & the tuna was very dry. Given the bread wasn’t fresh, it make me slightly concerned the fish might not be either. But nevertheless it was a good value meal for 82K. It also came with fries which was unexpected (the menu didn’t say this). Unfortunately the fries hadn’t been cooked long enough and were still that processed harder raw potato in the middle. The fries would be yummier with salt.  I ordered a fruit salad which had a great variety of fruit including banana, strawberries, rock melon, water melon, and delish tasty apple!! It came with yougert, (granola on the top to my surprise) and lime. The bailenese honey was nice and lime flavoured (not too sweet!). The fruit salad could be improved with more lime, dragon fruit included  It would be nice if the menu ultilised the cheaper local sourced ingredients more - ie. the salmon steak at 210K Could be switched to a seared tuna loin at an affordable price around 15K.  It would also be nice if diary free nut milks were available for the coffee.  I would also suggest lowering the price of the fresh young coconut (even at top beach clubs they don’t seem to reach the 50K mark).  I would also suggest the option of adding sides to the breakfasts - especially a side of avo.  The menu could cater better to vegetarians and vegans or healthy eaters by allowing “a make your own” with sides option.  Overall, really impressed with the local and great taste decor. Will be coming back and will recommend to others.  Thanks heaps for a lovely treat of a morning :)

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Serene Pool Bar in the middle of Canggu
review: A nice little hidden gem in the middle of Canggu, I found this Loop Pool Bar from IG. The pool was an infinity hanging pool overlooking lush greenery and river that's just instagrammably perfect and serene-looking!  The food were great as well, me and my girlfriends had the Nasi Goreng Kampung and it tastes authentic!  This place was nice, quiet and serene. Just what we were looking for, for a nice lazy Sunday afternoon...lounging on sunbeds, soaking the sun while reading a good book and listen to the nicely picked beach lounge music blasted from the speakers, while casually taking a plunge in the pool on a hot day. The definition of laid back chill Bali vibe!  Will definitely visit this place again next time I get the chance to visit Canggu!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nightlife Seeker
review: Agus, Desi and Putri will help you perfectly in your choice of a nice Indonesian meal. Good service and a nice price.

review_title: Super good food and excellent customer service
review: Ordered aged beef sirloin, risotto, and cheesecake. the beef is super delicious beyond expectation. And also the cheesecake. All the staffs are very friendly and accomodating. Esp Dewa Ayu, a shout out given to her top notch hospitality.
I loved this place, lovely fit out, lovely food and lovely service. The staff are so friendly and helpful. My new favourite.

Fantastic food - from starters through to dessert, delicious drinks (Negroni) and fantastic service. We were served by Agus and he was extremely attentive from the moment we arrived. Recommend checking Chope for vouchers, we got 29% off our bill, no strings attached.

One of the best meat/steak experiences I’ve had in any country. Great steaks with amazing meat choices, great wine and the service from Timmy was brilliant. This guy knows the menu and helped steer us into a superb meal. If in Bali and you aren’t a vegetarian then you just have to spend the money and enjoy the experience. It’s not cheap and a night out for two will cost you about $250 to $300 AUD but we’ll worth every cent.

review_title: Rare location to eat, best steak ever!
review: Both of us had 30 day aged steaks with 4 sides of vegetables and sauces plus a bottle of Yarra valley (Victorian) cab sav which complimented a sensationally rich meal. Expensive by Balinese standards but outstanding in every way. Outstanding kitchen, service, management, ambiance and set up. Service was top notch and dessert were large but first class as well. Overall an outstanding experience and a new experience for us after may visits to Bali. If you can afford at least $100AUD a head to get the best steak ever, it’s worth the effort. Highly recommend.

My wife and I really enjoyed the experience of dining at Boy n Cow. We began our meal with Beef Sliders and they were amazing. My wife decided on the chicken breast as her main course and kept saying how delicious it was. My striploin steak was full of flavour and the wedges were so crispy and tasty.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Absolute Pleasure. Places like these redefine the word : Happiness & Foodgasms.
review: Excellent Food. The menu options are elaborate and the food is absolutely finger licking good. Our server - Yoga was a complete delight. He handled us with an extended smile. Very polite and totally accommodating. Coming to the food : We had an opportunity to taste the Beef Slider - Just Wow. I tried my first Grilled Octopus which was truly amazing. The mashed potatoes which came along with Chicken breast was exceptional. We licked the plate clean for the Chimichuri sauce that came with the Steak. Skinned Salmon was also prepared delicately and we loved it.  It's a MUST visit place. We will definitely come back for more.

review_title: what we like and did not like
review: right after a 1-hour yoga session, we had a great breakfast by the sea. the service strives to be excellent but some junior staff does not really know how to serve properly. the view and atmosphere are amazing. the quality of the coffee could be improved for that price. overall excellent experience

The restaurant was amazing. As we stayed at the property, we want to try its restaurant. The location is just over the river so the ambience was very great and calm. The food was also tasty. We had Buntut Soup and Udang Sambal Plecing which we recommend to order. The staff were very attentive, kind and helpful. Pak Juni was regulerly checking around our table to make sure everything was good. They also had a bali dance performance when we were there. It was very good dining experience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Family Vacationer
review: Excellent dinner and wonderful service by Ryan! We’ve had an amazing stay at The W, and everyone has made our time here unforgettable. We can’t wait to return!

review_title: Best fine dining restaurant in Seminyak
review: Talk about a variety of fine dining meals.. the menu for snack/appetizer, mains and dessert were AMAZING!! We were back every night to try a different meal to find our favourite dishes. The food was so delicious and tasty. They come out small but were so filling. Also the steak was well cooked and prepared. A huge thank you to the staff and for going above and beyond for each guest. Never a dry glass, that being water or alcohol. It was so hot one night and the inside area was fully booked so we had to sit outside. My hubby was so hot and struggling that they brought out a portable air conditioning unit for him to cool down. Now that is service - never had that type of service before.

We had steak and fish on 2 different nights, and both nights were amazing. The staff arranged for items off menu that really surprised us in a good way, and the hightlight was the steak - done just right - medium - with really good char on the outside, but still juicy on the inside. They also have an awesome kids menu, which truly made for a good experience for me since we have a young child with us.

We decided to splash out roughly £300 for brunch for two people. It's worth pointing out we are from the UK but live in the home of brunch - Dubai.  From my perspective the food was amazing expect the BBQ which was a bit average. My wife on the other hand is vegitarian and we were a bit disappointed with the vegitarian spread and the fact there was no veggie Christmas dinner option.  The desert room was lovely and when the froyo machine broke the staff got me some ice cream which was not on the menu.  That brings me to the staff. They were amazing, in particular Adi who was serving us.  Drinks were a limited selection but well served.  The only complaint I had (apart from being overpriced!!) was the heat. There was no AC and there were not enough static fans. Many people outside had their day ruined and those inside could not enjoy the band outside.
The steak and bbq restaurant for W hotels worldwide. Good quality with the great W service and friendliness

Had the pleasure of breakfast here and it was amazing. The service at the W is exceptional and the breakfast crew certainly keep the standard maintained. AK was a delight as he made suggestions from the a la carte breakfast menu which complemented the buffet. Along with the vitamin shot/nutrient juice, the “decent coffee” which is hard to find in Bali, and the range of pastries to complement the protein, FIRE needs to be experienced at least once if you go to the W.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Delicious Dinner with the best service!!
review: From the first moment you arrive at Fire, everything is so elegant and over the top. Every plate presentations is excellent and the taste....... I wish I can go every night.  I had the Pork tomahawk and since Bali is know for pork, OMG!!! Presentations is out of this world and it even comes with your own selection of carving knife, the server opens in front of you a box full of knives so you can choose which one will be your weapon, I had the Butcher!!! LOL  You must eat here!!!!

Went for dinner whilst staying in the area, had the ribs, pork tomahawk and Truffle fries, all dishes were delicious and served very quickly, only downside we found is that food comes out separately, not an issue as we were sharing each dish but can see it would not be for everyone  Would highly recommend and we would revisit, especially to order the 4 margaritas which are required for the staff to perform their "shake it" dance which is fantastic!
Food quality is ok. Young service team trying too hard to please tourist. Lack sincerity. Return: NO

What a tasty food ..Yummy, portion not too big but enough lah...Order Mujair Nyat2, Rosemary Chicken breast & Pais Bentuyung (the best for me)...Also Ms Yunda the one who serve us is very polite & humble...Keep the work & stay healthy...
The food was really nice here, but I particularly want to mention the service here which was the best we had in Ubud. Lovely people with good food and the price was reasonable too.
Excellent food, service, and cocktails. Try the bebek. Juicy meat and crunchy skin. The Ayan Timbungan is also a winner. Shout out to Ariyani for the great service and recommendations here in ubud.

We visited here in October 2022 the food was excellent as were the staff, very tentative and the signer was very good too! It wasn't the cheapest of meals but we were both very happy with the food and would go back in a heartbeat!

Great Italian food, pizza’s are incredibly thin and eggplant entree is superb. Enjoyed the wine, very attentive service maybe just bordering on overwhelming at times. Great night out and reasonably priced.
Excellent. Highly recommend. Great pasta. Service was very good. Authentic Italian food. Looking fwd to next visit.

Best meal in Ball. Excellent carbonara. Carbonara is a simple dish that often disappoints. Tonight it was exceptionally well cooked and so tasty. Home made Limoncello finished a great meal. Definitely will return

Fresh ingredients. Great choices for an extensive menu. Went to this restaurant on our last night in Bali. Read reviews and were excited to try. We were not disappointed. My husband and I shared the tomato bruschetta. Very fresh and displayed wonderfully. My husband chose the lamb ragout with gnocchi and I had the tortellini. Both were well presented and yum. The chef came out to our table to say hello and twisted our arms for dessert. My husband had the pannacotta. I had the chocolate fondant. Omg! It was to die for! Would say best I have ever had. Will definitely be back and recommend to anyone.

Casa Blanca is a spacious, modern restaurant. We shared the fritto misto and found that it was a tasty and good sized appetiser. For mains we chose the Gnocchi Lamb Ragu. The gnocchi was home made and very light and much better than the store bought version. My lasagne looked as good as it tasted and delicious. Again it was filling without being heavy. Their cocktails and mocktails were great. The service was first class. We both agreed that we would definitely return on our next trip to Bali. Casa Blance fully deserves its high ranking on TripAdvisor.

We had an amazing experience! Was looking for a good pizza in Seminyak, and this one answered all my questions. Good and friendly service as well, pleasant live music, not too loud to the point where we can’t carry on conversations. Everything was good. Ended with a nice tiramisu, shared and approved by everyone on the table. Will come back for more.

review_title: Excellent Restaurant in the heart of Seminyak
review: Delicious Italian food and cosy atmosphere in this beautiful restaurant in the heart of Seminyak. Highly recommended!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: Some of the best linguine I ever had. Lovely atmosphere and great service. Would totally recommend!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: An absolutely fabulous restaurant with delicious food and very caring staff. With good priced cocktails in happy hours.

Small restaurant just off the main strip and did not disappoint. The chicken sate was genuinely one of the best things I’ve ever eaten. The signature Rendang was also excellent (albeit a tad dry) but I really couldn’t stop thinking about the sate. Would go back just to eat this! Great service. Be sure to make a booking as there are very limited tables inside.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover;Eco-tourist
review: Made a reservation and was seated immd. But if not, you can order a drink and have it while waiting indoors.  Had the sate and rendang, sauce was nice but both were a bit dry. Oxtail soup was herby and comforting, pretty good!  A tad noisy. They have high chair and utensils for kids (but don't think they have a kids menu)

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: Authentic Indonesian cuisine in a Warm ambience
review: Visited on 22nd December after visiting the flea market nearby. A cool respite in a cosy enclave with a well curated menu. Authentic tasteful cuisine
We stayed at the hotel for a week and loved every meal we had at Seminyak Kitchen. The service was exceptional as well. There is a varied menu with all dishes cooked perfectly.

Had breakfast here during our 5 day stay and the food was great but the service was EXCELLENT! Top notch! Special shout out to Pebri who helped us every single morning with a smile on her face. She remembered our coffee orders every day and provided us with superb service. She is an asset and a gem and we look forward to seeing her the next time we come

Seminyak kitchen is located in Courtyard by Marriott Bali hotel in Seminyak area. I like this restaurant for breakfast. The food menu features many of International dishes, including egg benedict, nasi goreng seminyak, and delectable desserts in sleek modern dining place. The staffs are friendly and helpful to assist you what to choose. Many food variance such as international food, indian, steak and grill food. Over all, Seminyak kitchen is a good place to eat with family and friends. Selamat makan!

We spent 4 days at the Courtyard Seminyak in March of 2021 and had an exceptional time. Breakfasts at The Kitchen were wonderful, with a wide variety of fresh hot food available quickly and efficiently. Seating allowed for either inside or outside preferences. The Staff was a thing of beauty, completing assigned tasks with efficiency, friendliness and always a smile. We cannot recommend The Kitchen highly enough...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: As good as the reviews say!
review: We made the short walk here from Hotel Indigo to enjoy lunch. The food selection and quality were as good as expected. The service was exceptional ... we were very well taken care of by Wili. Thank you! We will be back!
Best Chinese restaurant in Nusa dua! Xiao long bao was amazing and especially the service was incredible. We will be back very soon!
Really loved the whole experience. Special thanks to Ferdy and Hendra. Great food and excellent service. Do visit if you’re in Nusa Dua! Thank you all.

My daughter and I are visiting from Canada. We had dinner at Prego last night.  Our meal and server were nothing short of terrific. We will definitely return before the end of our visit.  Out server, Avdiana (sorry if I’ve spelled that wrong) was an absolute gem!

We were so glad to be able to come back to Bali and also Prego at the Westin Nusa Dua. We got served by the lovely Yuli for our lunch. She made us instantly feel like family and was so interactive with us in helping us make our lunch choices. Food was super quick to arrive and nothing could be faulted. Pepperoni Pizza has an amazing base and the toppings perfectly proportioned. We highly recommend Prego and hope to be back soon to enjoy a buffet.

We have had a few meals at Prego restaurant during our holiday at the Westin Nusa Dua and they have all been wonderful especially the Sunday brunch. The meals have been made even more pleasurable by the attentive, efficient and fantastic staff…especially Hendra, Yuli and Tari. Thank you for your great food, wine and service.

review_title: One of my fave places to eat in Ubud
review: Love this place, First discovered it in June last year but this is my first review, So, as soon as I’ve come back to Ubud this week I’ve gone straight here for some of my fave food. One of my fave things to order is the masala dosa, This dish doesn’t disappoint and is always made to perfection. Flavours and presentation 10/10. I also had the dragonfruit smoothie bowl for breakfast yesterday and it looked and tasted so good, went down well with my turmeric latte. The staff are always friendly here and the prices are really good, It also has a beautiful cool breeze always coming through, so nice after the heat outside, I love this place and always come back.
The food was delicious and the staff was super nice and attentive. The only down side was the internet connection quality. But in terms of restaurant, i totally recommend it.
Very nice place. Amazing food. I try Sashuka and it was awesome. Price is moderate. The staff are very friendly. Thank you so much.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: Lovely restaurant with great atmosphere and amazingly Ayurvedic principles brought into the food. We came twice and already had a few different dishes here that were sooo good. Highly recommend the potato dosa, the nasi campur, the green mung dhal and honestly all the desserts in the menu. In our last time here we were served by Ketut and her beautiful smile.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Gorgeous restaurant, great setting, great food
review: A lot of thought has been given to the design of this menu. The food came out looking absolutely stunning.  We came without expectations as we were staying at Renaissance Hotel and needed dinner. We were blown away.  The staff are lovely, pleasant. Hervina the restaurant manager was accommodating to our needs.  We had the sea urchin and scallop for entree. Over ordered our mains by adding the skewer special. Full we still attempted a dessert as all the dishes came out beautiful and delicious.  The only dish I probably have a slight complain about is the Flexi Ganache (dessert) I felt to achieve the aesthetic, the ganache was too gelatinous. The mint, lemon, chocolate and meringue combination however was well done.  Recommended!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Beach Goer
review_title: Unique & tasty food with great ambience
review: A little hidden gem in seminyak area. I ordered wagyu steam and chicken coriander for the meal and it was delicious!! I also ordered the dessert chocolate terrine and it was heaven! The ambience really nice where you can find art in every corner. If you come to bali, I would recommend blue matcha kitchen art dining

Tucked inside Blue Karma's Nestling Hotel you might miss this if you didn't know it was here. It has a large menu with a huge variety of food. My husband loved the Nasi Goreng and I fell in love with the chickpea and feta burger. The staff are attentive and always available

We found this beautiful resort by chance and wandered in for breakfast. $15aus per person. Fruit juice, coffee/tea, cereal fruit, toast and spreads, fresh omelet and bacon, crepe, all inclusive. Great food and great staff.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The ambience is so perfect for couple. You can enjoy the the delicious foods with elegant music. The desserts are too good to be true. You should try chocolate mousse! I think the chocolate mousse is the best one in Ubud or even in Bali!

The most magnificent meals I've had in Bali - by far - and I've lived here over 10 years!! Every dish was unique and exquisite! Everything we had - starters, mains, breakfast lunch, dinner and dessert... Lobster egg, eggs benedict, quinoa salad, bouillabaisse, salmon, beef rendang, barramundi, betutu cannelloni, creme brulee and chocolate mousse - was extraordinary!! The delicious warm bread, home-made butter, fabulous homemade healthy drinks were simply incredible... I could go on and on. What a treat to spend a long weekend in Ubud and treat ourselves to The Kelusa - we will definitely be back!!!

The view during breakfast, while sitting out in the open was stunning, and the waiters were all very good at their job, and very cheerful and friendly, who after the first visit always addressed me as Mr Kevin, a great feeling for me, thank you. Not a huge menu, but there were enough choices for everyones taste.
Great food, friendly knowledgeable staff. Don’t overdo it on the tasty starters, as the Mains are huge and well worth leaving space for.

review_title: Fantastic food and service. make sure you try.
review: We went in here having read the reviews when we stayed in the area specifically before a flight out of Heathrow. The place is as good as everyone else says. We had fabulous small plates of food that were all delicious. The service was exceptional considering the place was busy. We were asked numerous times if everything was Ok, and it was. They really care about how you feel about the food, and are passionate about great service. The price is good too.
Absolutely fantastic meal, everything was delicious, flavourful and perfectly cooked. Attentive staff, quick service. Recommended!

Had wanted to come here for ages. The place has a lovely vibe and great decor. There is additional seating downstairs which is where we sat. We ordered a host of Indian tapas - all of which were decent but the chicken masala wings were my fave. Though i would say the food is alright, the service is absolutely outstanding! Such friendly waiting staff and they offer you a complimentary Bailey's or Brandy after your meal.

review_title: Fun, yum and I hope doesn’t hurt bum
review: Great food and great staff. They also gave us free rinks love it, we had the taster menu (bloody lovely) would recommend to a friend/ (I don’t know you) enemy. Cum 💦 here x

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Friendliest service and best value breakfast
review: The manager of this place obviously enjoys their work. Very friendly greeting and service and patient with foreign customers. The food and furnishing is standard, but plentiful. Don't let the location under the railway bridge put you off. You don't eat here for the scenery. It is well worth a visit for the best value breakfast I have come across in London.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Family Vacationer
review: Great place for breakfast! Very attentive staff, fast service, delicious food and reasonably priced. Best place to start the day, planning to come back.

On my visits to London I always stay in the City, and have now been to Devine a number of times for breakfast. Due to the travel restrictions, it's been about 2 years since my last trip, but last week I finally managed to get back to the old country. I was slightly nervous as to their survival but much to my relief, it was still there!  I went twice this time in three days, both times great service, great banter, great food - a proper breakfast with eggs, sausages, bacon and beans but you can have what you want.  It was much quieter than before but so was the City, hopefully as the world learns to live with C19 and the "new normal" things will pick up.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This place is a bit tucked out of the way! but the food is excellent! I've been coming here for over 15 years and its always been good quality reasonably priced food!

I go into Devines almost every day but yesterday I decided to try their scampi and chips ...it had loads of peas with it too ... They do loads of different meals to eat in or take away ..like lasagna and spaghetti Bolognese ... amazing .. Tim

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Great food. Fab service from Greta. Will come again Strongly recommend. Two course lunch great value at £9.50
Ate family dinner here as my son had it recommended to him. Staff were friendly & welcoming & veggie choice was amazing. Everything tasted really fresh. Will definitely eat here again.

user_tags: History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We pre-booked this restaurant 2 weeks before my 6 year old daughters birthday on New Years eve. The restaurant took the booking happily for 35 people. On the day of our booking the restaurant called to confirm the booking and amount of guests, this was fine. My partner called back to confirm we still needed seating fot 35 this is when the restaurant surprised us by stating we would have to buy 7 family platters, this surprised us. Their response was they were very busy and this is indeed the time to make money. This is appalled us how can someone do this 2 hours before our booking. The restaurant were unhelpful and customer service was not top of their priority it was money for so called 20 kitchen staff and the time of the year and being busy. So if they were not busy they would have happily honoured our reservation without an issue.  Thank you for spoiling my 6 year olds birthday and causing us a headache on New Years Eve in finding another venue.  I would not be coming back to this restaurant nor will my family members who have been going here for many years.  I would not recommend this restaurant for their customer service, if you want a spoilt event then this is the place for you.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Huge place. Huge plates. Great Turkish. Great chops. Fresh and v tasty. Open late, mixed crowd. Popular but you can always get a seat.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Luxury Traveler
review: This was my first visit to Devran after an Arsenal game. My friend was a cop in the local station so he knew the place well. The place was packed with Turks. Very few Brits. I ordered the mixed grill. The portions were massive. We struggled to finish the food. The room right at the back has 6 or 7 tables. Service is iffy here but the food more than compensates for the bad service. We ordered turkish tea at the end. It took more than 3 reminders and in excess of 30 mins to get the tea. I would recommend you get a table in the main seating area.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Lovely meal. Large portions and very filling. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good selection of food. Good value. Lovely atmosphere and child friendly. Large open window at front so nice to sit in on warm day.
Clean, great service, very fresh salads, nice family environment. Excellent lamb chops and ribs. Huge portions at reasonable prices.
I have eaten here on 20+ occasions over the last year. The food is always great and the staff are lovely. I would recommend both eating in and the take away, Can't fault it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: It was OK (damned by faint praise perhaps)
review: Had heard such great things about this place. Was treated to dinner on my birthday by my very generous and lovely step-daughter. The food was fine, there was quite a buzz there, and of course the staff brought a birthday cake to the table. The staff were fast, efficient, friendly and generally very nice. The food was OK, but I have to say not particularly memorable. This surprised me, given the reputation it seems to have. I wonder if any of the multitude of other Turkish restaurants in the area would have been superior. I won't know unless I try them!

Such a lovely welcome we received! We were greeted like long lost friends on our first visit. I had reserved a table for our group & pre-ordered our breakfasts as the six of us were heading home to several different areas. The food was absolutely delicious as were our coffees and teas. We won’t go anywhere else when we are back in London! Thank you both so very much!
Great food and great value - service exceptional. Eat there weekly for pre-work breakfast with my boss. The service is brilliant - polite and quick and they always remember what we have.

user_tags: Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We were staying in the Travelodge around the corner so went here. My Eggs Benedict was delicious (£9.50). The wife was equally impressed with her Eggs Deluxe. Breakfast sandwich’s are less than £5 if you fancy something lighter. I can honestly say one of the nicest breakfasts that I’ve ever had. Friendly service and good value.
We have just been here for breakfast after reading the reviews. It was lovely, great choice of breakfast, big mugs of coffee and amazing service. No hesitation recommending this place

We were fortunate enough to spend 3 nights in London and find this cafe a few minutes away. We ate all 3 breakfasts here and enjoyed each one. The Eggs Benedict were the best I’ve ever had and you must try their fresh squeezed orange juice. We also had paninis on the last full day. The café always had lots of locals which I think is a good sign. You want to eat with a locals eat. Prices were reasonable, the portion size was great, everything was fresh and tasty. Highest recommendation for this cafe.
Delicious food, great service and very reasonable prices. Would recommend the cooked breakfast with bubble and squeak.

Perfect place for breakfast. There is lots of choice and everything was very tasty. Full cooked breakfasts are around £8 and they have smaller options which are pretty big! E.g. my wife ordered toast with eggs and bacon for around £4. The drinks are large and well made. The staff are very nice as well.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Just a short walk from the City Travelodge and I heartily recommend you get your breakfasts at this cafe. Lovely and efficient staff serve up a fine menu including all the breakfast favourites. Top quality ingredients at very keen prices for London. So good I went all three mornings of my stay. Opens Sundays too which is a bonus. Easily in my top all time cafes.

review_title: Fantastic little cafe in an interesting area of London
review: I've lost count of how many visits we've made to this amazing little cafe since our first visit at the end of October last year. It's such a great find, we've really enjoyed the English breakfasts, potato hash dishes and omelette, and the coffee is amazing. The staff are so friendly and hardworking, and always smiling . We will carry on visiting even though we do live a good few miles away
Fantastic place for breakfast. Huge portions and Nora and her team are really lovely people who pride themselves on making everything fresh and welcoming all their guests

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: We were staying nearby last weekend and on reading the reviews thought we would give this cafe a visit. We had breakfast on Saturday morning -both ordering the English breakfast and then returned again on Sunday morning when I swapped to the English Potato hash. Both mornings we received excellent friendly service from our witnessed but Nora also made a point of coming out of the kitchen and chatting to us and making sure everything was ok. T The food was freshly cooked, plentiful and so tasty with a great menu where anyone can get food to eat -there are Turkish and mediterranean choices, healthy, vegan and vegetarians options. On Saturday one table were requesting changes to their breakfast because they eat only halal meat and on Sunday a Jewish gentleman asked for his breakfast to be cooked in a particular way, nothing was too much trouble. Absolutely no faults to be found. I even used the loo upstairs on Sunday and it was immaculately clean. If we lived nearby it would become a local.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Bargain café at Petticoat Lane Market
review: There’s nothing to beat a good old-fashioned Full English Breakfast. Here at Café Nora (formerly Café Thyme), there are nine fry-ups to choose from, ranging from £6.95 to £7.95, all cooked to order and served with tea or freshly ground coffee and toast or bread. The English Breakfast of two eggs, two rashers of bacon, sausage, hash browns, baked beans, mushroom, black pudding and grilled tomatoes is a firm favourite. There’s also a Mediterranean Set Breakfast and Vegan Brunch with vegan sausage and avocado. For the more adventurous, there is Eggs Benedict, omelettes, pastas, salads, pancakes, burgers, panini, jacket potatoes, sandwiches and filled baguettes. Something for everyone. Situated in East London’s popular Petticoat Lane Market, on Wentworth Street and near the corner of Middlesex Street, the café is run by Turkish chef Ebru Puleri and her female Turkish friends. It’s a friendly, warm place, with comfortable seating, and popular with local workers, neighbours, market traders, students and visitors to London. It is walking distance from Aldgate East Tube and Liverpool Street Station. Open daily from early morning to 3pm.
What lovely friendly and efficient service. Charming staff and great food- lamb cutlets especially. Very chilled and accommodating.

Three of us went here for Friday night dinner and it was an excellent evening.  For starters we had the vege bhajis and the momo dumplings. They were both served with a bit of show. The bhajis were better than the dumplings for my taste but it was all tasty.  For mains we had the lamb biriani, a chicken masala curry with onions and peppers and the chicken tandoori. The lamb and the curry were both fantastic, the tandoori was nice if not amazing.  Nans were all lovely and fresh, and the aloo gobi was good.  The service was fantastic, we had bottles of the Merlot and the Rioja both were fine.  This is the best Indian food we have had around here recently, and we will return I am sure.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker
review: Absolutely exquisite Great and varied vegan options. Highly recommend the calendar salad Outstanding service in tasteful surroundings

review_title: Still as good as the first time
review: This is the second time I have visited this restaurant but the first time was nearly 5 years ago. It was good then and it is even more great now. I feel like the standards are much higher and the service is amazing! The atmosphere is perfect too!

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. Very friendly staff who genuinely care if you are enjoying yourself and your food. Loved the theatre of presentation and the selection of drinks. Will most definitely be back. Thanks!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Best Indian food in the area
review: The food was wonderful- very tasty, good sized portions, some of the best Indian food I have tasted. Service was great. It isn’t cheap, but worth it for a special meal - we were 8 of us celebrating two birthdays.

Outstanding meal. We were there for a belated Valentine’s Day meal and absolutely loved the experience. Mitra was warm, friendly and professional and the food was nothing short of amazing. We had the Momo as a starter which tasted fabulous and I also enjoyed the Paneer Tikki as a main course. Will certainly be returning for other celebrations.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: A nice modern Indian restaurant with a wide variety of choice.
review: This was the second time we had been to the Bayleaf and we were let down, the food if anything was better than the first time.  I’m not a particular lover of Indian food as I do not like spicy meals but this restaurant exceeds its self with a wide variety of choices to meet everyone’s palate. I started with an excellent prawn dish and then had the butter chicken curry both of which were superb and well worth a visit.  I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone that is nearby I would add that the staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful. He will not be disappointed.
Pooped in for brunch. Fantastic, friendly service. I had the Bondi breakfast and my friend had the Shakshouka, both were tasty and well executed. Would definitely recommend!!
I had a great brunch with great food! My waiter was a nice guy with excellent service. Recommend for London visitors who are close by to Oxford street.
We’ve been eating here for years and the standard of service and food is, and always has been, outstanding. Abdul is an exceptional restaurateur and the chefs are supremely talented.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review_title: Delicious, fresh and very good with allergies
review: We order from here regularly, but we have also eaten in as well. We have to be careful with where and what we eat as two of us are celiac with dairy allergies and one of us is vegan with a gluten intolerance. If a restaurant is not careful, we are soon quite ill. Happily, this has never happened at Taste of Nawab - they are careful and considerate on top of the food being absolutely delicious! We are lucky to live locally, but if we did not, we would definitely travel to be able to enjoy their food! I am literally salivating as I write this!
We’ve been eating here for getting on for ten years and found it unfailingly great; wonderful food, superb service and very good value.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: The most perfect falafel ever and do try the pitta bread veg sandwich so gorgeous, the salad boxes also very tasteful as the tabbouleh is made on the day you do want to repeat.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review_title: The best Vegan and Palestinian food in town
review: Amazing food, this shop has the best taste food ever for Vegans and people like me that enjoys Mezze food. All so fresh and delicious super central to get to it.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: My partner and I ate here as a bit of a last minute thing as we were attending Banana Cabaret at The Bedford down the road. Managed to get a last minute booking on a Saturday, and we were not disappointed. One of the best Indian meals I've had outside India. Plae was busy and buzzing, lots of staff to tend to your very need. I had the non-veg Thali which was amazing and my partner had the fish curry, which was also excellent. Food came quickly, was hot and tasty and the prices were reasonable. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this experience and would definitely go back again next time we're in Balham.

A nice but pretty standard Indian restaurant similar to that found in most places . Food is ok but nothing different to the norm. Service is ok. Prices are ok. Nothing really to right home about . Pretty empty.
It is a simple Greek taverna serving good Greek food I particularly liked the lamb although it was slightly overcooked. The service attentive and good and all in all I would certainly go back.

user_tags: Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: Last minute booking which they very kindly accommodated us at short notice . Easy to find and an unusual set up in that the main restaurant and kitchen is adjacent each other ie another smaller quieter dining room which is accessible by going next door by exiting the restaurant and going in another doorway. Staff very accommodating and offer quiet dining ( next door) or in the main dining area which has a long table down one side seating large groups of probably 20 or more. Lovely atmosphere, can get loud and busy - basically typically Taverna. Great choice of food which is worth the wait as it’s served piping hot, freshly cooked and the staff whilst attentive do not rush you through courses. It’s possibly a little tired decoration wise, maybe even a few stains on the wall paper and some torn edges but if your happy with rustic environments and top quality food and service then this is the place for you. Good to see good choice of GF food and we overheard several times presumably the owner say to people “forget about the menu tell me what you like, or don’t like and I will sort it for you - I want you all to be happy’ Amazing - how many times do you hear that in a restaurant! It was a first time visit, definitely a place we would search out again should we return to Camden

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: The full flavour of the Mediterranean
review: A cozy, family restaurant just a few steps from Camden High Street that makes you feel you instantly landed on a sunny island in Greece. As you get in, you will be welcomed by the owner and his team who will nicely make sure that everything is ok along your meal: their service is kind, attentive and discreet: it is clear they want to make sure that you fully enjoy the experience. The food is just lovely. We had the combined platter for two: the starters (tzatziki, hummus and taramosalata) were served with warm soft bread (and we asked for more!); the meat was tender, tasty and perfectly cooked; the Greek salad was fresh and nicely seasoned. We left feeling a sense of having had a healthy dinner, great value for money and, as Italians, we recognized the full flavour of the Mediterranean! We will be back soon!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This place has been a Camden institution for many years, but despite having lived in North London all my life and loving Greek food, I'd never been here before. We finally made it on New Year's Eve and it was definitely worth the wait! We've visited Greece many times and this place is as good as anything we've experienced over there.  The decor is very simple and really feels like a typical taverna. We stuck to the basic dishes - hummus and tzatziki to start, and then Kleftiko and calves liver. Everything was truly delicious and excellent. Even the bread! The wine also was lovely. Service was great and the prices very reasonable for London.  We'll definitely be back. Highly recommended.

My wife and I have just visited. We went on the TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. We booked a table thankfully as the restaurant was very busy its possible we may have got a table without booking however I would advise booking. The service is very friendly and genuine. Plenty of choice on the menu and portions excellent and very tasty. We were seated in the main restaurant, however be aware there is another area next door, which possibly lacks atmophere!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Popped in for a pre theatre meal , and this totally restored my faith in really good and great value meals in London, the restaurant was very busy so booking is recommended but this in no way effected the service or quality of food. kleftiko was delicious , Lamb was beautifully cooked falling off the bone. And the stifado was as it should be large chunks of beef in a delicious sauce , The drinks were a very reasonably priced and there was a great selection. Could not fault any part of this meal.

review_title: Great tasty food and top service
review: 6 of us Popped in before a gig round the corner - owner was more than attentive, and service guys first rate. Food was REALLY tasty - had the mixed meat platter, and every piece of meat was full of different flavours. Highly recommended!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: This was my first time an d what a treat. Feels very much like being in Greece, the sun helped, the white walls, the friendly feel, the great food and very attentive service. Really enjoyed the food and will definitely be back when I want a friendly, relaxed lunch in north London. Thank you. It was a lovely lunch.

review_title: Best Greek food outside of Greece and better than most inside
review: Returned here for a meal after 6 years. I remembered how good it was Last time so had high expectations. I am pleased to say that they were met. A wonderful tasty meal, super friendly staff, great atmosphere, super clean. A absolute gem of a place. I traveled a four hour round trip just to eat here and well worth it. Will I return again you bet I will.
We visited this restaurant twice during our stay in London it was that good. The staff are very friendly. Food is amazing. I can’t wait to return.

review_title: Great food, great value and charming staff over decades.
review: I should have written a review years ago when Andy’s was at another location. It would be the same. The food is terrific and excellent value, the staff are charming. It may be years between visits yet you are greeted like old friends. It is great for anything, wonderful for birthdays, and fine for couples or large parties of any age. Simply the best.

This has to be one the best restaurants in London, fantastic customer service, great atmosphere and unbelievable fresh food. From the moment we were greeted at the door until we left, the service was first class and unbelievable value for money. We will definitely be returning in the near future.

What a fantastic restaurant, the service is friendly & attentive which generates a fantastic atmosphere in the dinning room & the is food is top notch. We plumped for the fish mezzo which started with an array of tasty dips & bread followed by Fresh white bait, calamari & Halloumi & then the main event Fresh sea bass, Salmon, Tuna steak, plump prawns & more calamari all cooked perfectly & served with a wonderful Greek salad. Probably the best value meal ever in the UK
Excellent food and excellent service taken Here by our son and girlfriend, suitable for all.Really friendly staff, would highly recommend.

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Good authentic Greek Food and Great Service
review: Our first visit. We ordered a meze which has various starters served with warm bread followed by kalmari, kebab and kleftico. The kleftico is cooked on the bone so the lamb drops off the bone. Was delicious. Petros and his team made it an authentic Greek experience. Great service by Ed too. Staff always checking our drinks and food topped up. Very happy all round and will definitely return. Ευχαριστώ πολu.

review_title: Great but... Where was my ketchup?!
review: We booked this place based on its top reviews. So good, that it's the highest rated mezze in London. We visited ok an early Saturday evening. The restaurant decor is simple yet transformational. The themed Greek music complimented this perfectly. Staff were friendly and seated us quickly. We opted for four sharing starters between the three of us: houmous, calamari, feta & spinach pastry and halloumi. We received free bread with these too. The pastries were delicious! The calamari was top quality, although would have benefitted from a tartare dip. The houmous and halloumi were ok. For mains, my partner and his mum had lamb, which they insisted was some of the best that they had ever tasted. I had chicken souvlaki, which was full of flavour. We received a big bowl of salad to share between us. There was plenty, although some more feta would have been great. We also shared some chips and rice between us. The chips were seasoned to perfection, but desperately required some sauce. I asked for ketchup on two occasions but unfortunately never received any. At the end, we asked for the bill twice, and eventually we received it, followed by some free shots. Overall, the experience was great. I recommend a visit if you are nearby. Next time though, please provide the condiments guys! :)

Visiting London from Devon for football on Saturday, my son and I visited this wonderful restaurant last Friday having discovered it whiist googling ‘good restaurants in Camden’ and we were not disappointed.  Having had numerous holidays to our Greek Islands cancelled we we were craving good Greek food and hospitality, Andy’s Taverna ticks all the boxes.  The staff were fabulous they can’t do enough for you having first confirmed my email for the booking, Georgina greeted us. The restaurant is in 2 sections the first very full but we were given a quiet table in the corner next door, it even had Greek music playing on the TV.  The Mythos beer went down so quickly we had to order 2 more however the jewel of this whole place is the food.  Two types of Dolmades, one vegetarian one meet plus a plate of Calimari arrived, fresh and delicious with bread. Then the main was Andy’s mixed Souvlaki (we forgot to order fried potato but within minutes the waiter had delivered them no problem) and I had probably the best Moussaka I have ever tasted absolutely delicious just like being in Greece! Every main course is served with a bottomless Greek salad but we could only manage one!  There’s was simply no room for dessert which was a pity but we will definitely return this was an amazing experience thank you everyone at Andy’s Taverna Camden.

This place is the real deal; fantastic food, fantastic service and great value. The owner and his wife were so nice and we enjoyed every dish - starters, kleftiko and several fish main courses. This how Cypriot restaurants in London used to be. Can't wait to go back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Excellent Greek food and a wonderful service. It was great to see Petro again and his friendly staff after the long lock down. It reminded us of holidays in the sun.

We stumbled on this place whilst walking in Camden. It is on a corner of a backstreet and easily missed. There are a few tables on the pavement but a view you will not have! It is a typical family run taverna as you would find in Greece. Simply furnished with a friendly owner and (I assume) partner plus a menu with all your favourites. Stuffed dolmades were a great starter and highly recommended. The prawn cocktail was served in large quantities with crisp and fresh salad. Sea bass on the bone was amazing as were the calamari being succulent and tender. We had rose wine by the glass but there is a wine list with Greek and European wines. As usual there was complimentary liquor after the meal as well as coffee. This is a place where the locals come and sit as well as those from further afield. Service of food was fast although when the restaurant filled up there was a delay for the bill. This is because there are problems finding staff due to Covid, Brexit and furlough and no doubt will be addressed. We will certainly return although I don't know whether they dance on tables in the evening. The bill for 2 was around £50 including service.
This restaurant has fantastic atmosphere, and delicious, authentic Greek food. One of my favourite restaurants in London.

review_title: I can understand why Andy's is in the top 10 restaurants in London. Loved it!!
review: We booked ahead through OpenTable and thank God we did as the restaurant was very full when we arrived, just one vacant table remaining reserved for us. Such a warm welcome by all the staff - as if we were family! Not familiar with Greek wines we asked Andy for a recommendation, he went to gather a few bottles from the bar and insisted on giving us a wine tasting session until we found a bottle we liked. We picked a lovely med-dry white. The food was fantastic, so tasty and fresh. Halloumi and king prawn starters followed by mixed kebab mains, fries and a Greek salad. We left so full! I'd definitely recommend Andy's to anyone visiting London/Camden for excellently priced tasty food, considering it's central London!

Really enjoyed our meal here. Starters were excellent and the wine good too. Staff and owner are really nice, however the highlight here is the kleftiko! We both had this and brought memories of holidays to Greece back to us. The lamb was wonderfully cooked and the chef clearly knows what he’s doing. If you in area definitely try this place. Efharisto!

My husband, myself and our daughter and fiance' had a lovely meal in this restaurant last night, our first meal out (but inside a restaurant) since last August. Restaurant is well spaced out inside, so plenty of space between tables, hand sanitiser on the wall upon entry, very clean, staff wear masks while serving and nearly all customers observed the mask wearing while moving between tables or using the toilets.  Two of us ordered the Meze and the other two ordered the set Mixed Grill option with the three dish cold starters and between the four of us we shared all dishes. The food was very fresh and tasty, one of the better Mezes that I have had in a Greek restaurant, not overwhelming in size and very good value. The Meze had the added bonus of Kleftico (a speciality dish - the lamb melted in your mouth), which is usually not the norm but a very pleasant addition.  Service in the most part was very good, we only had a little issue with the young waitress in that she did not give us a tap water when ordered and when asked for it, again it did not materialise until we asked one of the male waiters and then they immediately got it for us. Not sure if the young waitress could understand us, but this happened again when requesting more bread and the bill, she just went outside to serve someone else, but eventually both materialised. Other than that small issue the service was perfect. When the bill came the (owner I believe) gave us a complimentary shot of Amaretto each, which was a nice touch.  Will definitely be returning and would highly recommend this restaurant for a lovely meal out.

Had such a good night here with my friend thanks to bartender Robert - he looked after us all night and made us the best Pornstar Martinis. Great place to grab a cocktail on a Friday night, good music! Thank you TwoRuba 👍🏻

This is a nice relaxed area. Its never really busy. We had 2 cocktails , they were nice but overpriced. £13 for one £15 for the other and nearly £3 service charge. we had cocktails in other places which were just as nice for half the price.

Ruba never disappoints. They have one of the best service in town and that combined with a plush interior and a very relaxed atmosphere, this has to be one of the best places near London Bridge. We have been here often, in the past, and the standard of service has never deteriorated. They have a wide range of cocktails on offer, and would be going back soon. Definitely recommend it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Service was very slow even though there were only about 8 customers and 2 staff. Cocktails (Manhattan and Margarita) were low quality.

We hosted drinks for several friends few days ago and everybody really enjoyed their time. the cocktails were really good as well as the bar food. Staff is very friendly and the service was quick. We have been here a few times and always felt it was relatively under-appreciated. Probably because prices are slightly on the higher side. However they serve food from Jamie's next door which makes it even more amazing.
had a drink here late one night, they had stopped serving food but still served us. The decor is very stylish and comfortable, great lighting and atmosphere
Spot on location, right beside Tower Bridge. Very helpful, friendly waitress. Perfect bar to relax in, lovely surroundings. Good choice of drinks, in fact struggled to decide!
Simple and Classy. Nice pricey food but a perfect place to meet a business partner and have a quiet meeting in a nice atmosphere

Waited while our room was being cleaned. Limited beer selection, all bottles, no tap. Menu was limited...salads and sandwiches - approx $13. Beer and food were good, service was excellent. Nice little reprieve.

review_title: Overated High price ideal for poseurs and Hooray Henrys
review: Not really a great bar - its OK if you like posing and spending stupid amounts of money on overpriced drinks with pretty poorly trained staff.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Not bad to have a drink!
review: It is late and you are staying at the Hilton, good place to have tapas and a glass of wine, It is price and no atmosphere!

Went here for my birthday earlier in the year and the food and service were both sublime. The service was attentive and personal, without being intrusive, and the food was tasty, substantial and really high quality. As someone who has been vegan for years, having food like this, with the flavour and attention that was packed in, and shared in abundance, is a dream. And to make it even better, the price and the fact it is BYOB with no corkage, is unbelievable.  We couldn’t eat everything and so we were sent home with it as leftovers.  If I lived closer I’d be there more often. Please visit this amazing place!

It was so lovely to be back again last night! As always, the food was incredible and the welcome and service amazing. Thank you so much for another wonderful dinner (and lunchbox!), we can’t wait to see you again soon :)
I have often visited them. The options for vegetarian food is amazing. The service is with smiles and food is tasty. They also customize the dish to your need.

We had a meal at Amrutha to celebrate my daughters graduation and this meal was the icing on the cake. The food was excellent which a great selection to cater for everyone and as there were 3 vegans in the party this was the perfect restaurant and very reasonably priced too. For the whole duration our food was constantly replenished so nobody goes home hungry and when we had had enough we were given pots to take home what we wanted (which was everything btw). The service was excellent, personal and prompt. If you want to eat here, pre-book a table, they were having to turn people away.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: The food here was good and the service extremely friendly. However, I would have preferred there to be one dominant cuisine rather than the mix of dishes included here in the Grande set menu (from Indian to Thai). Also felt that there were too many salads, and the selection should have included noodles as well as rice. If you want alcohol, don't forget to bring your own since the restaurant doesn't have a licence. The lemon and lime cheesecake was to die for!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: First time here. Ordered to take away. Food was really delicious... a vegan place I will be returning to. We had the Green Curry box, Stir Fry box and some pakoras. The atmosphere is lively and friendly (from what I saw when I collected the food). Will eat in next time!

Tasty vegan dishes at very good prices however... food took tooooo long to be served and card payments are not accepted nor receipts given .... One must ask for them to be emailed and pay cash !!! Very unusual practice.  Would I use it again??? Possibly as my employees are vegan and totally in awe of this place :)

review_title: Not that this restaurant needs another 5* review...
review: ...but I'll add to it anyway!  My friend surprised me with a visit here for my birthday, me a vegetarian and her very much a carnivore. The food is incredible! So many amazing flavours and the chef has clearly put a lot of thought into how the dishes all go together.  Not only is it delicious, but it is greatvalue for money. £20pp gets you the grande selection - a tapas-style offering of nearly everything on the menu. It's more food than we could eat (and boy did we try!). Favourite dishes included the cashew cheeze, the homemade pakoras and the two curry dishes.  You get free top ups of any dish you want (we couldn't manage that) and they give you doggy bags to take away your left overs. The vegan brownie we had for dessert was TO DIE FOR. Oh how can it be so rich and crispy and gooey all at once, and accompanied by delicious vegan ice cream.  You bring your own booze but we also tried the delicious complimentary tea at the end. They were also kind enough to give us little pots of the tea mix to try at home!  The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, with everyone cooing when their selections arrived, and the staff were incredibly lovely and helpful.  This is a gem in Earlsfield and I'll definitely be back, bringing friends (veggies and non-veggies alike) so that we can feast again!!

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Step up from my last visit
review: I live 50 metres from this restaurant and was one of its first visitors 12 months ago. I gave 5 stars then and have been 1-2 times since.  It’s been at least 6 months since I was last here and don’t mind admitting I thought the #1 rating in London was a bit overinflated (reflecting the warmest service in London)...but wow!  The food choices are a step up from those early days (reflecting the owner’s increased staff resources from the early days when it was just him + 1).  This is a place worthy of travelling across London for - even if its success means I now need to book to make sure I get in!  Well done - proud you’re in #Earlsfield

Just love this place..only downside is that it is now so popular you have to book several days in advance, especially for Thurs, Friday and Saturday nights. We just don’t want it to change. The owner is so grounded I hope that won’t be the case and he deserves every success. We visited yet again last Friday and tried the new £20 buffet menu. The tofish we usually love wasn’t available but the owner gave us the most delicious plate of noodles to compensate. The new dishes of guacamole, gazpachio, cashew ‘cheese’ and mung beans did not disappoint. In fact I think this was the best meal we’ve ever had there. Warm welcomes, lovely service, superb food with sublime flavours... but sssssh... don’t want anyone else to discover it!!!! Sadly, too late!!!

We visited tonight, purely as a consequence of the great reviews on Tripadvisor. The passion of the owner and staff was palpable, the cost incredible and the food delightful. Bring your own wine is great and glasses readily arrived. I am not vegan, nor vegetarian but enjoyed every mouthful. We went for the £15 select buffet and it was a wow!. Plates of delicious food including rice, salads, sauces, morsels that I can't remember but were lovely. When you run out, the bowls are topped up and therein lies the danger - overeating. We were hoping to sample the 'tofish' but it wasn't on as the restaurant is experimenting with a new version. We were given a preview and was it superb - YES. Everything about Amrutha Lounge deserves accolades. We loved our evening there and will return fairly soon to experience great food, superb service, amazing value for money and an all round great time. It was heaving on a Tuesday night so get your reservation in.

It was challenging to get past the tout to the entrance which was daft as we had already decided to go in! Is a tout really necessary? The service was a little brusque and our bill was bought without asking us if we wanted anything else ( we did) . The menu was standard British curry fare that you get everywhere. The lamb passanda was nice, plenty of lamb and sauce and the saag paneer very tasty. The king prawn dish had a nice sauce but the prawns were very overcooked. The mango lassi was disappointing, very sweet and synthetic in taste.

Had afternoon tea, one of the activities we were looking forward to doing our two young girls (4 and 7) while in London. We did some research and selected the Lark Room at Grosvenor House hotel because of the kid-friendly tea.  They had a special menu in celebrations of the upcoming coronation which was nice. Selection of teas, plus hot chocolate or juice for the kids. Each kid got their own selection of sandwiches (cheese, butter and jam, banana, ham)scones, ice cream and sweets.  The kids also got a stuffed animal of “Grover” which was a nice touch.  Classy but not too stuffy. Perfect afternoon yea with kids. Asiduo our waiter was very attentive and made sure the kids left happy! Recommended

I had a wonderful afternoon tea at the Grosvenor with three members of my family to celebrate a birthday. We all loved it, we were seated by the window and we loved the relaxed feel in the room. The food was perfect and our waiter Saiful was so friendly, attentive yet professional. I hope to return soon.

We have been to many afernoon teas around London. This is by far the best we have been too. From the man on the door to our server Filipos it was all around a great afternoon. The food was so tasty and there were proper english sandwiches. Great choice of jams. My fav was the rose petal. We didnt feel hurried at all. There was live piano playing in the back around. We got to take home our left over cakes. They were packed up so well in little plastic containers, Other places should copy this as it meant our cakes got home safe and sound. We look forward to our next visit thank you.

This was a complete surprise and very enjoyable. Lovely setting with appropriate live music. Food was amazing - especially the fruit cake. Wonderful atmosphere. Staff were very friendly and knowledgable, but service was slow - hence not five star

review_title: Just beautiful in every way! Great afternoon tea!
review: Firt time here and WOW! The beautiful Park Room, the interiour, the location in a very expensive area of London - Well, it all made our first afternoon tea visit here just perfect.  We also had the pleasure of being guest of Mr. Saiful and his perfect attention and service and smile.  Great great experience and very nice champagne as well. Make sure to not miss out for this if you want to experience elegant afternoon tea while in London!

Fantastic experience from start to finish! Such a warm and friendly welcome from Valeria who made us feel relaxed straight away. Siri who looked after us at our table offered an excellent and faultless service from start to , nothing was too much! The afternoon tea itself was spectacular and excellent value for money. There was endless tea and sandwiches, with the most delicious scones Ive ever had, the selection of cakes was exceptional! Of you are planning on enjoying afternoon tea here make sure you arrive hungry! The Park Room itself is stunning such beautiful surroundings for an indulgent experience and we loved the added extra of the pianist playing in the background. Would definitely visit again for a special occasion.

Such a lovely relaxing afternoon spent at The Park Room from the yummy food loads of choice and variety of teas and the very friendly and attentive staff especially Altay who was very knowledgeable about choice of teas. A fabulous afternoon we will be back

review_title: Afternoon tea in the Park room
review: Afternoon tea was fantastic great food, tea, champagne and service.Attention to derail and Altay was a credit to the hotel. Good range of teas, finger and open sandwiches are perfect as was the Scones an cakes. Lovely surroundings with background piano playing the old favourites.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review_title: A special treat for our anniversary
review: We came for a champagne afternoon tea for our wedding anniversary. The ambience, service and food and drink definitely made the day very special and did not disappoint. Live piano music in the background, tables spaced out nicely to make you feel Covid safe and comfortable and beautifully presented. All staff wore masks. The food and selection of teas and jams were outstanding. Really recommend trying rose petal jam and wild cherry tea. Altay, our waiter, was very attentive and helpful.  If you want to pamper yourself or a loved one then this is the place to go.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: A lovely spot to while away the time, even if not for afternoon tea
review: While staying at the hotel recently, we were looking for lunch and decided to have a quick bite at the Park Room. We had only experienced them for afternoon tea before, so perusing their "all day dining" menu was a little different.  They have a good selection of salads and sandwiches, which can be augmented with a good selection of wines and champagnes.  Food is a subset of that on offer from the JW Steakhouse (also in the hotel), but served in the opulent style of the Park Room.  If you're looking for something slightly less than afternoon tea, this is an option. (Although afternoon tea at the Park Room is also excellent.)

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Excellent Afternoon Tea In a lovely environment and outstanding service.
review: Despite London having moved into the new Tier 2 (High) Covid-19 category, my wife and myself had Afternoon Tea earlier today in the Park Room at the Grosvenor House Hotel on Park Lane.  We arrived a little late but were given a warm welcome by both Andre and Herlyn who were not only expecting us (current bookings are understandably much lower than normal) but provided exceptional service throughout our visit. With only one other table taken, we were soon sitting at one of the nice window tables overlooking Hyde Park.  After taking our Tea (we both opted for English Breakfast) and Jam (Ginger & Rhubarb, Rose Petal and Strawberry) orders, it wasn’t long before our substantial Afternoon Tea (good range of delicious sandwiches, 4 lovely scones and some nice deserts) arrived. There was certainly plenty to eat and what was left was put into a doggy bag together with 2 slices of lemon drizzle cake.  Not only that, we had two pots of Ginger & Lemon Tea before departing by which time it was pleasing to see several other tables having been taken.  All in all, it was a most enjoyable experience - enhanced by both Andre & Herlyn who certainly went the extra mile as far as we were concerned!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review_title: Back for the Wines in a Beautiful Venue
review: Back for the Wines in a Beautiful Venue  We first discovered The Park Room at the JW Marriott Grosvenor House Park Lane Mayfair/London, when waiting for an event, with the Arizona Cardinals NFL Football team. They were in London for a game, and were using the JW Marriott as their base of operations. I then have returned several more times, and been impressed each time. In December, we were back to London, and on a totally leisure trip. We were staying just down Park Lane from the JW Marriott, and my wife asked if we could go to The Park Room for drinks. Well, that was a no-brainer - wines with my wife, with no meetings looming over her head, in a lovely space, just blocks from us. Off we went.  Now, there are three areas of The Park Room, and two are mostly attached, plus a lounge area, just around the corner, with a grand piano, which is more open to the reception area of the lobby. We were seated in the lounge area, near the piano, and I had the wine list in hand quickly. On this afternoon, the pianist was playing, and I think that this is only the second time, when he has been there - quite, quite good! Though the main dining room is gorgeous, one of the things that I like about the lounge area is that it has more of an open view of the attractive lobby - though no views out onto Park Lane, as that main dining area has.  We did the Henri de Villamont Clos Du Cromin Meursault ‘13, the Guillaume Vrignaud Fourchaume Chablis 1er Cru ‘15, and the Spelt “La Valentina” Montepulciano D’Abruzzo Riserva DOC ‘14. The wine service was great, but while the stemware was attractive (those are Park Room “signature glasses”), I was not that big a fan of the open bowl design - lovely to look at, but not my favorite for wines.  It’s now a tossup, whether I like the main dining room, or this little lounge area the better, but that might depend on whether the pianist is playing. We will be returning, as we have since making this discovery, a few years back.  Though this September visit was our first stay at the JW Marriott Grosvenor House Park Lane Mayfair/London, I had visited The Park Room twice before, once solo, and once with a friend, but this was the very first visit for my wife.  We had arrived from the States a bit too early to check into our room, in the hotel - but this was no surprise, as we had to take a flight out of LAX, rather than SFO, so knew we would be at least an hour - or two - early. That was not to be helped. We did the formalities, and told the reservations agent that we would just find some Champagne in the Park Room.  On this early Spring afternoon, it was as lovely, as I remembered it to be, with sunlight streaming through the windows, overlooking Park Lane, and Hyde Park. This is an elegant room, there is no denying, but it is also a very comfortable room, at least it was for us.  We were seated by the welcoming hostess, at a nice little 2-top, in the main dining area. While not against the windows, we still had a lovely view. From my previous experience, I believe that the dining area, at those windows, is most often used for Afternoon Tea, as it has much more of a salon feel, and look to it. We were in the main dining area, just behind that salon.  We had the wine list in hand, and settled in to relax, enjoy ourselves, and await our room assignment - knowing that we probably had at least an hour, or more.  We started with Perrier-Jouët Blanc de Blanc, and a glass of the Perrier-Jouët Blason Rosé. Both were served in lovely flutes.  We sipped, and relaxed, as we had been flying for quite some time, and when the Champagne was gone, moved on to Soellner Grüner Veltliner Fumburg ‘16 (a new wine to me), and the Henri de Villamont Meursault ‘15 (also a new producer - we were having fun now).  About half of the way through the still whites, our reservations agent arrived, and offered to show us to our suite, as soon as we had finished the wine. She made certain to give our server the room number, for the charges, which was a nice touch, as we did not need to bother with a credit card.  The afternoon had almost slipped by, and the wait was of no issue. We were in a lovely room, watching Hyde Park across the way, with excellent, and very friendly and attentive service, plus getting to explore some new wines. What a great way to start a holiday. I am so glad that my wife finally got to experience The Park Room, and now it was time to unpack, shower, and head back down to the lobby for dinner - with even more wine!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review_title: Lovely & Elegant With a Fun Wine List
review: Lovely & Elegant With a Fun Wine List  Though this September visit was our first stay at the JW Marriott Grosvenor House Park Lane Mayfair/London, I had visited The Park Room twice before, once solo, and once with a friend, but this was the very first visit for my wife. This is the best part of the hotel great service great food. If you like pasta with chicken and mushrooms with pink sauce ask Andre for the pasta, he ordered an amazing pasta for me one of the best to come along in London

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Luxury Traveler
