review: Beautiful modern dining room and comfortable seating. Food was not disappointing at all. Server is trying very hard to get us mention his name on review. Yet, his service didn't quite make it to be mentioned.

My friend and I were staying in the hotel and decided to go for cocktails in the Park Room!! It is a beautiful room with a lovely atmosphere!! I believe the server who was looking after us was called Altay and he was absolutely fantastic!! He kept checking our drinks were ok and also on our food when we decided to get dessert!! He was very friendly and kept us laughing and enjoying our evening!! The cocktails I had were absolutely delicious and I’d definitely be back for more!!

We had been gifted a voucher for afternoon tea with bottomless champagne at the Park Room, which turned out to be a delight. The tea room is easy to find as you enter the hotel and is a beautifully bright and open space with plenty of comfortable seating. The live pianist was a lovely touch. The check in process with the voucher was seamless and we had no trouble at all and were seated quickly. The tea selection was huge with many choices and we were able to easily find ones we liked, along with a selection of pastries and desserts. Everything was delicious but we particularly loved the scone assortment with our choice of jams. We felt very posh and fancy with our tea and champagne and our server was polite but not overly attentive. I would definitely recommend this afternoon tea. The experience was everything I wanted and I only wish we could have stayed longer!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This was our first visit to the Park Room as we took advantage of the offer which included unlimited champagne for one and a half hours. Our host, Monika provided excellent service and offered us alternatives as some of the party were not keen on salmon. They would also cater for any allergies we may have had.  The plates of sandwiches were topped up with whatever we requested and were beautiful as were the delightful scones. We could choose from a selection of jams to accompany the clotted cream. The cakes were divine and the champagne was always topped up.  With the piano playing in the background, it was a most wonderful way to spend a Saturday afternoon.

review_title: Supetb food as well as food and ambiance
review: The food was just superb. I had the duck and an onion dish, The service was kind and efficient. I really enjoyed the low key ambiance.It was also very reasonably priced.

review_title: Warm welcome and truly delicious food
review: First time visit. We were welcomed like old friends, charming and attentive staff and a spectacular meal. The host recommended the sardine on hot plate dish...it was both original and scrumptious. Copious curries with a stack of poppadoms and delicious chuneys. Reasonably priced wine selection plus of course Indian beer. We were stuffed and couldn't cope with dessert, but we thoroughly enjoyed the port offered by the host. A wonderful experience. On our must visit list.
We have visited many times over the years. The food and service is excellent. The prices are very reasonable too! We will keep coming back.

review_title: A taste of Bangladeshi spice in North London
review: We had another excellent meal at this very lovely, authentic family run restaurant. Excellent service and fantastic recommendations for traditional spicy Bangladeshi food. A great find for a nice meal out. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Beach Goer;Thrifty Traveler
review: Visited The Spice on Friday night as a group of 8. The food was delicious. We ordered from the set menu which was incredible value for money and not a price you would expect to eat for in London. We had poppadoms, a starter, a main, a naan bread, rice and soft drink all for less than £15. The portion sizes were massive we could’ve easily shared. Although maybe our bellies were a little full from the drinks we’d had earlier in the night. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. The restaurant had a lovely atmosphere. I would definitely recommend

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: My local indian....Great place to come back...
review: I been going for take away for few years....occasionally even to eat....But now is been renovated is a great new place...The food is always very good and service is brilliant...Great change make a place to go back with pleasure no just for take away...Well done!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: Excellent Indian restaurant close to Tufnell Park
review: Lived close by, and unfortunately I first tried it the last evening. By far the best indian food I got on this trip. There was a small hickup with the starter, I simply did not get it, and by I asked for it again, the main meal came, but I got a small beer as a compensation. Friendly staff. Even if I most likely will not live close to Tufnell Park on my next visit, I will take the tube, to visit the restaurant again, its very close to the station.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Do great to find an Indian restaurant with loads of non-meat options. Here, they are not sundries but main meals - just like in mostly vegetarian India! I'm not vegetarian but prefer no meat in my Indian food. In addition, 4 if is walking of the street on a Saturday night gut s warm welcome and attentive and informative service throughout. Wonderful.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Indian Moment which used to sit in the Northcote Road has been in Battersea Rise for a number of years now. I recall at weekend lunchtimes a buffet menu was available. But as we were the only diners this Saturday lunchtime I can understand why this is not currently an option. The sole waiter seemed surprised to see us and when pointing out no alcohol was served (you must bring your own bottle) was perhaps hoping we would leave. A chicken makhani was rather flooded in sauce. I chose a non-vegetarian thali and perhaps should not have been surprised that it contained no fewer than three meat dishes, a slightly cold chicken tikka, a chicken makhani and a lamb rogan gosh. These came with rice, fresh crispy Nan and a delightful raita with pomegranates on top. Perhaps at least one vegetable or dal would have been preferable to one of the meat dishes.
Delicious meat thali and great service. Surroundings very nice, great decor. Would come again. Thanks!

Such a gem but easy to miss walking past. Had a wonderful lunch here recently with a group. The mixed platter for lunch was fantastic and reasonably priced. All the food was absolutely delicious and excellent quality. Prices about average, nice modern decor. Service could have been a bit quicker especially as the restaurant wasn’t busy but very pleasant. Surely this has to be up there with the best Lebanese restaurants in London.
We ate here on a Saturday evening it was reasonably quiet. Efficient and friendly service, decent but not spectacular food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Our go to when we want great food and great service
review: We return often, and each time are welcomed warmly and treated to the best Lebanese food in London. We have visited with friends from the UK, Lebanon, Syria, South Africa, Oman, Dubai, Singapore, Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Bangladesh and Turkey, and they all rate the food and service as excellent.  This time was no different.  We ordered the Yakhneh Loubieh (Green bean in tomato sauce) vegetarian and the Yakhnet Bameh (okra in tomato sauce) vegetarian. Both can be prepared as vegan if you mention it. The food was piping hot and delicious.  The service, as ever, was warm and attentive.  We've already made our next reservation.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We were visiting London for the weekend and wanted to have Lebanese. There aren’t any good Lebanese where we live. We had mixed trio of hummous. The best one was the beetroot one.  For mains we got Kafta Kashkash. We went weren’t sure what to expect. It was kebabs with a spicy tomato, onion sauce. I liked it as it make the kebabs easier to eat with the rice. It’s as a good meal. I should have forgone the starters and it was lovely.  The dessert wasn’t great. Over powered with rose water. We wrongly thought it would be similar to the Mahalabia in a Lebanese restaurant in Marrakech. That’s as divine and made with Orange water. So much nicer.  I recommend this restaurant. It’s easier to find from Chanery lane tube station rather than Holborn. We would have taken a taxi but there was queue and we would have been late.
Popped in for lunch and had the baba ghanoush and farrouj meshwi. It was pure perfection. So tasty and succulent. Staff were friendly and attentive too, decently priced and even had a Lebanese beer!

Nicely laid out Lebanese restaurant, which looks as if it also serves the local Lebonese community. Seasonally decorated, and very pleasant owner and staff. Tried the parsley salad with lettuce and pomegranate seeds, which was delightful, coming with superlight, freshly made flatbreads. The mince skewer mains, and chargrilled fish were excellent, the potato and rice sides were great too, special praise due for the rice. Never saw the wine list, but got an inexpensive bottle of Lebanese white. Excellent service, great food, and super value. Thoroughly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: I booked a table for an early dinner, so that the restaurant would be quieter.  The staff, as always, gave me a warm welcome and offered me my choice of tables. I wanted a relaxed meal, while doing some reading, and the service was attentive and perfectly placed, so that I felt comfortable enough to take my time, but also so that I never waited for service.  I ordered the Taboulleh Twist, houmous Beiruty, Falafel and Yakhnet Batinjen Vegetarian, and enjoyed some Lebanese coffee with it. At the end, I had their refreshing Café Blanc with some baklava.  Every dish was amazing, and I would visit weekly if I could.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Chamisse is a staple in our London list. They always deliver great service and delicious food.  I took a friend - who knows Lebanese food well, and is involved in the restaurant industry - for dinner this week, and he was impressed with the quality and flavours.  We ordered a selection of the hot and cold mezze, and every dish was perfect.  Always happy to recommend Chamisse, and will no doubt be going back soon.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: We consistently come back to Chamisse, and we're often bringing friends back with us.  The food is always delicious and the service attentive. We've come here with friends from the UK, Oman, Syria, South Africa, and they've all enjoyed the food and said how good it was.  Thank you to the staff for always being welcoming and for giving us somewhere to always share great food with good friends.

Came here last Saturday for a birthday meal, staying nearby for a weekend in London. After a little trouble actually finding the restaurant (it isn’t well signed, only a name on the window) we enjoyed a lovely meal. Good service, lovely food, lots of choice. Friendly staff. Seemed very popular especially with takeaways.

A good selection of Middle Eastern dishes on the menu, and the portion size is good, you will not leave hungry. The service is friendly. It took a long time for the dishes to come out and one was missed but that was removed from the bill. Definitely caters for groups however the acoustics are terrible, it is so loud it is hard to hear anyone but the people next to you.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: We visit Chamisse every couple of weeks and have never been let down.  We brought a friend here for dinner on Saturday evening, and again, the staff at Chamisse were incredibly welcoming. They were happy to make recommendations from the menu and were knowledgeable about all the dishes.  The food was delivered quickly, and every dish was tasty.  We've been visiting Chamisse for around two years now and have found it to be consistently excellent.  Were very happy to recommend.

Chamisse is a Lebanese restaurant offering a large selection of classic dishes. The lists of hot and cold mezza (starters) are particularly extensive. Main courses are dominated by the grilled meats for which Lebanese cuisine is so famous, but there are also some stews and soups. Can’t wait to visit again.

We came here on friday night around 6.45 was a little busy. We ordered spicy potataoes was soft and not too overpowering. Falafels were nice and big with tahini sauce i enjoyed it Chicken shawarma was slightly undercooked came with rice salad and bread. Service was friendly the owner/staff welcomed us and greeted us with salam the islamic way.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: Best Lebanese to Date in London
review: Understated entrance belies a wonder of quality cuisine supported by knowledgeable and considerate staff. We arrived as a group of 3 and were looking for advice on the menu. The owner recommended we order a sharing menus of one main course and a selection around 5 starters. It was loads of food.  The dishes were freshly prepared and full of flavour. The best falafel I ever ate and gorgeous traditional dishes.  Visit it.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: A bit of a hidden gem
review: Here for a large group for a late Sunday birthday lunch.  Decent menu with loads of options, and extremely nice staff. The food just kept coming and coming and coming. Definitely a good choice and they could not have been more helpful in explaining what everything was.

Popped in for a quick meal before heading to theatre. Was warmly greeted and the service was good throughout meal. The food itself wasn’t as great as I had hoped. I had the lamb shawarma. The bread was dry and didn’t seem fresh. The lamb itself, though a little chewy was fine. Rice was bland. My husband had the mixed grill and I loved the roasted shallot that came with his.

What a nice surprise. Our expectations were not high , it was a little out of our way and the restaurant looked small an not busy. But inside it opens into a bigger room. From we were met with a smile and a nice table and saw the menue we were sold. They make a nice shared platter with appetisers, excellent tasty . The main courses were superb , and the Lebanese wines ..and you wouldn’t be ruined when you get the bill . The evening couldn’t be better.

review_title: A very god, dependable Lebanese meal
review: Having been brought up in Beirut in the 1950s, I regard a good Lebanese meal as the ultimate comfort food, the flavours of my childhood. So I was delighted when a friend suggested that a group of us should go to Chamisse this week. It is a very good restaurant, most of the team are Lebanese and the welcome is warm.  The setting is very simple, which is fine: the focus is always on the food. We chose to have a selection of mezzo and a selection of grills placed down the table so that the group of 20 could chat and eat contentedly without making choices. This is where Lebanese food it as its best, being shared by everybody with a little bit of this and more of that up and down the table. Small dishes flowed in (kebbeh, kellaj, fatayr, hummus, mfassack, tabbouleh, fattoush, loubieh bel zeit, labneh, moutabbel and more besides) and all tasted very good. My only comment was that some of the flavours were slightly blander than I like but they were very good. In particular the kebbeh was as good as I have tasted (deliciously moist in the middle and crunchy on the outside) and the labneh was wonderfully subtle. So definitely 4 plus for the food.  Very good service too. The team were there to look after us very well throughout, making sure the dishes moved along, that glasses were full and that everyone was enjoying themselves. Not intrusive but we did benefit from their attention throughout.  What more can I say - I look forward to returning.

review_title: A gem: authentic food, friendly staff, quick service, cheap - RECOMMENDED
review: Had dinner with family: a surprise of falafel & Mediterranean spicy recipes. I returned after some days to get some take away. I was asked to seat while food was quickly prepared. Chatting with owner about it. Got Falafel, spicy potatoes and a free offered black aubergine for nearly 10 £ Everything was perfect! I wish I had more occasions to come back.

review_title: Surprise visit last minute dot com
review: Last minute find! Checked reviews and wasn’t disappointed a gem in Bruce Grove, intimate friendly and very helpful staff. Food menu enough for most tastes😉

review_title: A great find, one of the best in London?
review: Recommended by a friend, just 5 minutes from Bruce Grove station, but not a direction we normally go. The staff were full of character and loved their products. The food, Burgers, wings, veggie, was some of the best I have had, 20 times better than McD etc. Its small and independent, will definitely visit again. If it was in central London it would be 4 times the size, and packed. A great find in the rough streets of Tottenham.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: I don't care who the chef is, or at least whose name is over the door, you simply never ever get any sense of passion, love or caring in the cooking of the food in an inernational hotel. When will we ever learn. This is a restaurant for those with a bucket list to tick off not a true love of food. It was nice enough but formulaic and 'mass produced'. God, the chefs must get bored of cooking Theos 'famous' dishes. We were guests of some friends so just let the evening unfold without any fuss but let me tell you, by the time the waiting staff have finished enthusing about their favourite dishes (the ones they have been told to push) there may as well not be a menu. The pace at which the waitrons poured the relatively expensive wine was outrageous. This was not great service this was rushed. Finally the restaurant is nondescript in the extreme, basically in the basement, and could be anywhere in the world.

review_title: TREAT Your self To the Regional tasting menus 👌out of this world 🌎
review: Excellent staff 🕺🏻💃sublime food👩‍🍳👨‍🍳 and perfect cocktails 🍸🥂it really doesn’t get much better than this 👌👌😘

review_title: Best kitchen and front of house team in London with out a doubt 👌👌👌👌👌
review: I’ve been eating in the top restaurants in London and Europe for coming on for 30 years and I have never come across a more well oiled Team than at Theo’s the core members and you all no who your are are very efficient,polite and extremely knowledgeable from being greeted like a family member to the perfect cocktails to the best wine pairings and definitely some of the best put together menus I’ve had the privilege of eating Thank you all for a lovely Christmas absolutely perfect x

Excellent food. We had the Sunday lunch with Prosecco. Self service antipasti which was so fresh and a great variety. So good we went up twice. The risotto was divine for the second course; so hot and fresh. My husband had Guinea fowl and I had lamb, again both so tasty. The Guinea fowl was on a crostini, so tasty and perfectly cooked. My lamb was served with ratatouille. We both finished off with the ice cream and iced espresso. They piped in chocolate, Happy Birthday for my husband, a nice touch. Our waiter George was very attentive and did a really good job. Our glasses were frequently topped up with Prosecco and glasses of water. Lovely fresh, rustic restaurant with a lovely ambiance. Live musician was also really good. Beautiful hotel with a bar for pre dinner drinks. Literally a couple of minutes walk from Hyde Park Corner tune station. Families dining there but well behaved children.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: The Italian regional cuisine menu is exceptional
review: We opted for the regional Italian menu - Sicilian. £65 a head including wine pairing. A bargain for this quality restaurant. The sommelier talked about each wine in detail - and he did know his wines. The food was exquisite. The service a little patchy but maybe because we had a trainee waitress.

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Totally exceeded all our expectations. The restaurant was very quiet due to the Queens Jubilee celebrations but for us this was a bonus. We thoroughly enjoyed talking to all the lovely waitresses Sama and Dorina who talked us through the menu. We were never rushed during any course. All four courses were fantastic plus the added bonus of the included Prosecco,Negroni and Aperol Spritz. We loved the Negroni ! I think this was terrific value. The icing on the cake for me was Theo Randall was there cooking. I didn’t expect that on such a quiet Sunday afternoon. What a lovely man and a joy to meet. I am really looking forward to returning to try the regional tasting menus or another weekend brunch.

review_title: Outstanding Italian food at its best 👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👨‍🍳
review: I’ve been eating here for several months now trying all the different regional menu’s that change each month taking you on a food journey around Italy without having to get on a plane. Just a shame you don’t get the suntan with it But you certainly get the best cocktails and the best value for money for the service,food and drink OUTSTANDING  The À la carte menu has an abundance of good choices they really get the taste buds going and the wine pairings really finish off the dishes to bring out the best . I don’t think you would find any high end restaurant in London that have a really really good core TEAM of people as they do here keep up the good work your all amazing.

A really nice lunch to celebrate my chums 60th birthday. The service was outstanding and food very good. My only criticism was that the pasta was a little over cooked. Guinea fowl was very nice and we had a great wine

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local
review: We had had the Saturday brunch offer and absolutely loved it!  £59 for 4 courses - with unlimited Prosecco, negroni or Aperol spritz.  All the food was excellent and the drinks were certainly free flowing. Nice atmosphere, great staff - a lovely way to spend a couple of hours.
From the moment I arrived at the hotel to my leaving the service I received was exceptional, the front of house team were outstanding, and the food, just wow, would highly recommend a visit.

review_title: Lovely experience, great food, excellent staff!
review: I went to this place for dinner on my birthday with my partner. Excellent environment, friendly, helpful and competent staff. We start with an aperitif and a couple of "cicchetti", the menu offers both a choice of tasting and an a la carte menu, we decided to order a la carte, tuna tartare (exquisite), cappelletti of veal and pappardelle with beef sauce (braised), both dishes fantastic to remember the Italian cuisine of the best traditions. Faraona ripiena, delicious, crispy on the surface with a melting filling. I believe that the quality of the dishes shows the competence and love of Theo Randall for the raw materials, the ingredients and the care and passion he puts into the preparations together with his excellent team. The dessert, ricotta cheesecake, was also very good, with a welcome addition of good wishes for me. Excellent wine list from which we chose a Nebbiolo delle Langhe by Ascheri 2019, very good. I had a perfect evening from all points of view. Thanks to Theo and his team!

Excellent food cooked by Theo and his amazing staff. This really is a gem in Park Lane, and superb value for money if you choose the regional tasting menu. It really is a culinary experience visiting the restaurant, with a wonderful vibe and ambience. Theo is such a personable and all round nice guy. Always welcoming to guests visiting the kitchen.  Cannot wait to return next year, thanks to all

review_title: Quality Italian food at this prestigious venue
review: It is many years since our last visit to Theo Randall - the place has been brightened up considerably since our last visit and although the low ceiling will always remain it is not so noiticeable.  The restaurant features a regional menu which at £50 including wine is excellent value for money - tonight's was from Emilia Romagna but our prefernce was from the wider A la Carte which is priced by the dish.  Starters of Minestrone and a Cheese souffle were both filling and delicious and mains of Pappardelle and Sea Bream very enjoyable. We finished with a shared Italian cheese course followed by a lovely soft chocolate cake.  The wine list is a lovely tour of Italian regions but there is a nice choice of wines by the glass enabling us to try a selection, the Jermann Pinot Grigio and Planeta Chardonnay both superb examples.  Service was friendly and efficient and we were much more impressed than on our previous visit.

This was like watching an opera / Orchestra the way the team at the front worked together lead by one of the best maitre d’s that I’ve seen all the staff gliding around the floor taking orders and bringing out the food and drink lead by a master of her craft As for the food WOW the pasta was like eating silk with the richest Ragu the best comfort food ever Thanks so much to Mr Theo Randall for taking the time out for a chat and signing a couple of his cook books for me it really made my birthday All I can say is I can’t wait to come back TOTALLY AMAZING ‍

Just terrific. Fine dining at its best. Well looked after by expert staff who are focused on making your pleasure their priority.  Food was really good - between the four of us we didn’t have anything we didn’t declare delicious. The pasta was outstanding.  Excellent wine list and knowledgeable staff. We were waited upon by Sebastian who was courteous, attentive and amusing.  Bonus visit to the kitchen finished the evening perfectly and we got to meet Theo.  You pay for quality but we had no complaints at the size of our bill - and we will definitely be back!

Had a wonderful evening at this great restaurant. Cannot praise the staff highly enough. From the moment we arrived until we left we were made to feel extremely special. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and made us feel at ease. For people that don’t very often do Fine Dining we had a few questions about our food and the accompanying wine which were all answered professionally. Our meals were outstanding. I can’t really explain it much clearer than that.. The atmosphere was perfect and the restaurant couldn’t have been any cleaner. The waitress was also good enough to let me keep one on my phone for the Italy v Spain match which went a little way to making the evening even more special..

review_title: Amazing night, fabulous food, superb experience
review: 2020 has been a terrible year for most, but we had a particular hard time with loss of both my parents so close together, so planning a day in London like we had was a welcome relief. It was my daughter's 21st birthday celebrations, and I have always wanted to go to Theo's restaurant as I am a huge fan of his and Saturday Kitchen on BBC1 so always enjoy his appearances on the show. The restaurant knew it was my daughters birthday as I had informed them, but we were not expecting the fuss that was made of us. We were put on one of the chef's tables (Matt Tebutt and his wife had the other which just made my night) and Theo greeted us, wished Lily a happy birthday. He had time for everyone in the restaurant, guests were in and out of the kitchen all evening. The waitress we had was just fabulous and we had an absolutely superb evening, one we will be talking about for years to come. We had the Sicily taster menu, 5 courses with wines that accompany the courses. every course was sublime. And at £50 a head, thoroughly affordable for the West End of London. Cannot wait to return, already planning my next visit. And I know I keep thanking him, but thank you Theo, and thank you to all the staff. You really have a great team

This was our first visit to Theo Raandall and we thoroughly enjoyed it. My partner had the Sicilian set menu with wine pairings and I ate from the a la carte. Both were equally delicious and the set menu was exceptional value. The staff were friendly and out waitress, Katherine, was excellent. All together a great experience.

This review is for my second return visit in January but TripAdvisor does not allow subsequent reviews until at least a month has passed which is a shame as I wanted this to go live immediatlely after our visit.  Background: although our previous visit was marred by a menu/billing mix up the food was clearly very good so I wanted to return to experience it to the full and with that in mind I contacted the restaurant to give them my direct feedback. Pawel acknowledged my complaint and was genuinely apologetic and confirmed that he would make amends on our next visit. As it happens I'm not in London that frequently but circumstances necessitated that I was there a few weeks later and therefore made a much anticipated booking.  In a nutshell, it was a top notch experience -Katie our waitress looked after us like we were VIP guests and it was nice to meet Pawel who gave us a warm welcome and also saw us to our table and last but not least Vanessa the Manageress who came over to say "hello". Vanessa was very personable and it was really enjoyable to chat with her.  The whole meal was excellent, my favourite is the slow cooked beef ragu in Chianti -a must try dish!  Sadly I have no immediate plans to return to London but Theo Randall will be on my to do list when I am next in town.....

review_title: One of the best value fine dining lunches in London
review: Fantastic value lunch (glass of prosecco, 3 courses and coffee for just £35)  Good selection of great tasting dishes.  Attentive service.  High quality tasteful furnishings.  Excellent combination of food, environment, service and atmosphere.  Would happily return and try more dishes from the menu.

I am certainly Italian in my love of food! Dinner begins with focaccia, cherry tomato bruschetta brought unbidden to the table @Theo.Randall @icparklane. The cocktails are rife with strong Italian alcohols like Campari and vermouth, typical cocktails are Negronis and Old Fashioned. We tried both and they are well-fitting with the restaurant. It is impossible to choose one from Primi pasta dishes without regret that you have therefore missed another. When it’s pasta time, go for Taglierini con Gamberetti e Carciofi – a rich, overwhelmingly savoury mix of the freshest pasta with brown shrimps and artichokes. I usually don’t do this but we left our wine choices to the clued-up sommelier who really knew his stuff. In a tastefully decorated open-plan dining room that has plenty of space between the tables, he and his team offer a wide-ranging Italian menu with something for even the trickiest of eaters. Superb evening... flawless service and impeccable attention to detail. Yet another memorable night!

I travelled to London from little village oooop nooorf called Manchester to attend a reunion in Mayfair and took the opportunity to meet up with my daughter who is currently living in London for dinner so wanted a quality restaurant but nothing stuffy.  I was checking out various venues and as it was going to be an early evening meeting I spotted that there was an excellent set menu offering at Theos so I immediately made an online booking to secure a table as it was for a Saturday -success, however, heads up, there's a booking system glitch!  On the evening there was confusion with the staff regarding the menu, initially we were given a la carte menus despite the booking stating it was for the set menu.  In the end is was sorted, to a degree, as we were presented with a set menu option, but, not the one I had booked which included half a bottle of wine per person, apparently that one was not recognised and ours only included a glass of prosecco each! I decided not to make a fuss but clearly I was not happy especially for this mix up to happen in such a reputable hotel/restaurant*  Upon returning home I contacted the restaurant and Pawel was very apologetic and acknowledged that there was a glitch on the booking system and that he would make amends for our next visit......  Anyway, back to to the food -it was all very good and the staff were attentive but needless to say the experience was tempered due to the menu saga along with having to pay an extra £40 (unnecessarily) for wine so I shall reserve final judgement and do a more detailed report when we have our return visit.  *I first frequented the London Intercon about 40 years ago.

review_title: Excellent food but a bit deserted
review: The food here is always of the highest standard. A little disappointed that we were not offered the set lunch menu. Apparently you have to write that in text on the electronic booking form. Nonetheless food good, wine a bit pricey but good. Dining room is nice if a little dark, and very few diners for lunch. I had an excellent seafood taglierini followed by a mushroom risotto. Both were superb. Still strongly recommend, but check carefully the various booking arrangements.

Went on the bookatable deal - 3 courses, bubbles, coffee and petite fours for £35. Amazing food, exceptionally good service the arrival, seating waitress. Thoroughly enjoyable evening and one I would repeat.

user_tags: Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Loved the antipasti selection so much so that we went twice! Pork belly was lovely. As there were three of us, we were able to select 2 main courses to share. The desert were lovely too. Even though we had to share main course and dessert the quantity is actually more than enough - we left quite full.  Whilst my friend had the bottomless Prosecco, I took the Apero Spritz which is divine. The only thing is that you needed to keep asking for a top-up.  We were served by the most friendly, jovial and polite waiter George, who looked after us very well. There was no request too much for George and he always served us with a beautiful smile. He has actually made our entire afternoon very enjoyable. Thank you George :).  All in all would recommend and would come back again for a cosy Italian brunch.
A somewhat limited but very nice food offering. The Ragu was especially good. The wine list is quite extensive. Not sure if I would step in if not staying here. But worth a visit anyway.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review: This was our first visit to a Theo Randall restaurant. We had booked for the Sunday brunch. Our group included small children but this was no problem. It took a little time for our free flow Prosecco to start and we were told that this was available for 90 minutes. About 20 minutes before that time was up we had empty glasses and because the restaurant had become busier but not full we seemed to be forgotten about, then suddenly we got our last glass! The buffet food with cold meats, cheeses and smoked salmon, eel and seafood was a good choice. You choose a main course which had two vegetarian options, fish and meat. Unfortunately one of our guests had been misheard and was served fish which he doesn't like! He had to have his main course of soufflé separately but everyone was apologetic. There was a pasta station but it was rather confusing as to what you did there to get any pasta cooked! Mains were nice and tasty and we were served some desserts but no plates and cutlery for ten minutes! Overall food is good but service a little disappointing. Restaurant itself is OK but no windows so all artificial light.

We had dinner here, the service and ambience was outstanding, the complimentary treat from the chef very generous and the quality of food excellent, they have an extensive wine list as well, most enjoyable fine dining experience

This is one of the restaurants at intercontinental park lane where i stayed and apparently from a celebrity chef. Came here for breakfast and it’s nice to be in a fancy restaurant rather than one of those mass market places. Very good quality and service

Wanted to have a lunch on a Saturday...and thought we would try here and were very happy we did. they have an excellent £49 brunch with unlimited Prosecco....for an hour and half of you sitting down. Which includes a help yourself buffet...including wonderful salamis and salads..with a pasta course (very very good) and a main which you can order when you’ve sat down....then the table gets a set dessert which again was lovely. Yes the atmosphere can be lacking when it’s quiet but the food makes up for that...oh and very good service too.

Great bar in the hotel for a pre-dinner drink, and the restaurant service and food was lovely. Ambience is a little less warm and friendly (not sure if it was just our table - at the back), but was lacking in atmosphere. We had a Book-A-Table tasting menu and was delicious. Wine pairing was a choice by the waiter/sommelier and was a lovely choice too.....

We took the opportunity of a deal to try this restaurant and weren’t disappointed. The offer was for 3 courses so the menu was slightly confusing as it included anti pasta, pasta, seconds and dessert. Having sorted this the minestrone soup was good but not outstanding. However the pasta ragu was memorable setting the main course up well. Sadly the sea bream didn’t deliver as it lacked real flavour despite being well cooked.

review_title: Very average experience with some highlights
review: As I was staying at the hotel and the restaurant has a Michelin star I asked my plans to eat here. I look for nice food good service and luxurious setting. I therefore like nice table linen abs so was disappointed there were no table clothes and to be honest the restaurant did not feel special. The service was nothing special adequate but not memorable. Did wise read limited for me as I don't eat food with alcohol in it although my waiter tried to persuade me to do so. The bread was lovely and the ravioli although not my first choice read the best I've tasted. My main of sea trout was nothing special at all and quite disappointing. I won't be risking bank even if starting at the hotel.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: My friends and I had a bottomless brunch booked here on a Saturday. The starter buffet is delicious with plenty of choices (cold meats, cheese, breads, lots of salads) and you can go as many times as you want. You choose the mains from the a la carte menu, I had the pigeon which was delicious, my friends lamb she was disappointed in. The desserts were a major let down they give you a plate to share between the table! The free flowing prosecco, was topped up on time. Overall for the money this is a good place for a nice catch up. We did feel rushed towards the end.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review_title: Good to have a Michelin star restaurant in the hotel
review: It was a wet and cold Monday evening in November and it was so nice to be able to come down from our room to a top class restaurant without having to face the elements outside. You could never accuse this venue of being cozy or intimate, it's too spacious for that but it's a very pleasant dining environment nevertheless. Our last visit had been on a Saturday night in May when we had been surprised at how many empty tables there were. This occasion a Monday night in November the reverse was true with most tables occupied, even early in the evening. Our service from Roald was excellent and we hope that he remembers his promise to ensure that we can have zucchini flowers stuffed with mozzarella on our next visit in January! Our food [ starters Italian cold meat platter and Burrata followed by lamb rack and lobster pasta] were very good although considering the price, I felt that bearing in mind the usual generosity of portions in this restaurant the lobster on my pasta was a bit thin on the ground. We look forward to returning once again at the end of January next year.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review_title: Tasty food at this family restaurant
review: A short walk from South End Green down Fleet Road, this was an inviting place to eat, and the staff were friendly and attentive. The dishes we tried were very fresh with plenty of flavour. I recommend the onion bhaji appetizer, which came with a small salad. We were on holiday in England, and did not try the branch off Marylebone High Street, run by the same Bangladeshi family. Strongly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: This is the third time we’ve eaten at the Rajdoot and we’ll continue coming back again and again. The service is impeccable, there’s a good list of drinks and the food is always incredible. Everything is cooked fresh and you can really tell. We ordered for four and there wasn’t a thing left by the end - everyone was very full and very happy! Plus management offered us a complimentary digestif so it was Tia Maria and Baileys all round before we left. Best king prawn pathia I’ve had in London, and I’ve tried many. Already can’t wait to return!

review_title: Raise a Glass to the Rajdoot!
review: We enjoyed our final meal of the holiday here at Rajdoot and were a little apprehensive as all meals so far over the weekend had been very good. I suppose we were just thinking that law of averages would mean at least one poor meal? How wrong we were as we enjoyed probably the best evening of our family break. From the moment we exited the taxi outside the staff were out to greet us, very friendly and made us all feel welcome. You can tell that they all care about their business as they couldn’t do enough for us and even offered us complimentary drinks at the end of the meal. There were all the traditional offerings and some nice specialities too. We had Jalfrezi , chicken saag, and a king prawn korma and I liked the option to have your chicken grilled / tandoori as a opposed to plain. Of course we had poppodums and chutney to start, who doesn’t? All washed down with ice cold Cobra beer. I think everyone was slightly jealous of my wife’s Chicken Saag, not only was it delicious but it came in the hit sizzling pot, which I always feels adds to the experience and I’d encourage them to serve the jalfrezi this way! I’m not sure if this is practical but it certainly makes the table go “ooooh” as the sizzling dish approaches. I also liked the fact that when I asked fir my naan bread well done it came nice and crispy just as ordered. Seating was covid friendly and waiters wore face masks so no issues with hygiene/ CV19 To finish off our fabulous evening the waiter allowed my son in law to take away his beautiful cobra glass that he’d been eyeing all evening, which I felt was a lovely touch and made Toms night! Thanks to all the staff at the Rajdoot and I would encourage you to try this place whilst in London. Highly recommended
A small restaurant serving authentic and delicious Indian food. Although it was not full in a raining lunch time day, atmosphere was very good. Also, very good service. Highly recommended!!!

My girlfriend and I visited here while staying in Central London for the weekend. I scoured through a lot of Indian restaurant reviews, recommendations etc online and finally settled on the Rajdoot. It was slightly out of the immediate area we were staying and despite a large selection of restaurants available that were closer to us, I took a chance and I'm so glad we did!  Upon arrival, the staff were very welcoming and friendly and continued to be throughout the duration of the evening.  The menu has a great selection of classic dishes and curries along with an ample choice of house specials. Both of us unable to choose, we asked the staff for recommendations and they sure did not let us down! Exceptional curries!  We were served the King Prawn Nobabi and the Bahari Lamb (would highly recommend both dishes). The lamb was incredibly tender and melt in the mouth and the sauces for both dishes were explosive in flavour and fragrant in aroma. We asked for our dishes to be made on the hotter side of the spice scale and they got it spot on.  The dishes are all freshly made to order and you can certainly taste that. Fresh, flavoursome and perfectly spiced to our liking. What more could you ask for?  The service throughout was efficient and non intrusive and we would not hesitate to come back here again next time we're even remotely close to the area.  The final bill was more than reasonable for what we had and we were even presented with a small digestif on the house, thank you!  Our meal was the highlight of our weekend and a perfect first night out since lockdown.  I hope more people get to try this little gem as they won't be disappointed.  Until next time.

As per previous reviews the food is exceptional. As we live in Dubai, with an abundance of fantastic Indian food, we usually find that British Indian food is not as good, however, in this case we would say it’s on par. The manager was delightful and made suggestions based on our preferences and he truly hit the mark. Both mains were from the Chefs Special and were delicious, Mon Mon Murug, and Bahari Lamb.

A great place to visit for a dining experience. Whether in a group or as a couple as we visited the show presented by the talented chefs are great, from the initial flames to the delivery of the food to your plate it is a very entertaining and pleasant experience. The food is great, a little on the expensive side, worth the extra in our opinion for the change from the mundane restaurant to the enjoyable entrainment of sitting around a teppanyaki station. Great place to visit.

review_title: Perfect for birthdays covering three generations
review: Grandparents, parents and grandshildren, all gathered around the sizzling hot plate. A wonderful entertaining lunch with food to appeal to all generations.  Very thoughtful and attentive about one member of the family with a severe nut allergy.  Excellent value and very good food freshly cooked in front of us with great flourishes of theatre. Huge fun  Very accommodating for children. The child menu is not condescending and exceptional value. Our grandchildren tasted and enjoyed new foods.  The setting may be a little tired... that happens when a place has been rightly popular for so long and it is difficult to fit in the time for a big refurb.

review_title: Disappointing visit compared to NY restaurant
review: Booked for a birthday lunch, but today’s visit just felt lacking overall. The carpets on the way in were a bit dirty, the tables are a few flights of stairs downstairs (not good for the less mobile) and the whole restaurant just felt tired and in need of some TLC.  The chef was very accommodating with some of our table guests and the food was cooked ok, but we rushed a bit because we just couldn’t get into the “theatre” of it and the food was just ok.  We’ve visited the NY restaurant and loved that. Not sure why today’s visit fell short but we’ve both ended up with a dodgy tummy so unlikely we’ll be coming back.  Bit of a shame, really.

Booked here on a Sunday early evening. I would imagine you would always need to book. Went to the Piccadilly restaurant in the past for a business lunch and enjoyed the spectacle so took wife and 14 year old son. If you don't like sharing you will need to book for 6-8 people I believe as there are 8 seats at each grill. There are quite a few grills close together, so it gets quite noisy. As long as you expect that it isn't an issue. Our fellow diners were fine, but I can imagine that wouldn't always be the case.... We had some sushi, wagyu, chateaubriand, scallops and lobster tail along with various vegetables with some rice. All of which were excellent and, needless to say, served piping hot. The chef cooks this all in front of you on the hot plate and does a little show with the various ingredients - onions become a chimney, spells out words with the rice, etc., Service was attentive and the staff were very pleasant. Not cheap, but well worth it as a treat. We will return.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Fun dining experience with the chef's cooking in front of you. Food was nice but the amount of oil that went over everything was off putting! The place was very hot and smoky and I'm sure we all left stinking of fried food! Drinks menu limited but ok. Service was fine.
Benihana never disappoints and is a great place to take your teens. Our chef was fantastic and performed loads of tricks, even repeating them for the teens to post on Instagram.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We’ve eaten at benihanas many times before in various locations and ALWAYS given it a 5* review but this time it barely rated 1* and so I thought that you should know  We booked for 1pm and arranged to meet our son and his wife. We weren’t allowed to sit and enjoy a drink however as we were rushed off to our table with a warning about how soon we would have to vacate the table. Not exactly welcoming  Eventually a waitress came and took a drinks order and gave us menus.  Long wait then she came and took our orders and a while later we finally got a drink. In the us where they live on tips this would never have happened  The chef was Spanish and very difficult to understand. In fact the other three in my party had to ask me what he was saying.  The display was almost non existent. Other benihanas have always put on a real show with food being flicked around, a few ingredients and utensils in the air etc  As for the food each part of the food was served individually so apart from the soup it was all pretty cold  A few selected comments  The fish was tasteless The chicken was dry The prawns were tasteless The rice was tasteless. This was REALLY surprising as we have always rated benihanas as having the best fried rice anywhere.  I’ve never seen egg fried rice cooked this way before. First cook the egg into a well cooked omelette making sure it’s tough. The add the rice. Everywhere else the egg is used to bind the rice  I would have asked for the 12.5% service charge to be replaced by a -12.5% lack of service charge but did not want to make a fuss as the staff seemed distant and just doing their job rather than making an effort to provide a high quality experience for their guests  Hopefully you will find this honest feedback useful in improving your uk offering

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: Ok as a one off experience
review: Decided to treat my son for his birthday. We have booked a table for the family of four. We were late more than 15 min and waited approx 10 mins in the lounge, so not too bad (the restaurant offers 15 min grace period). I won't be much mistaken if i say that from the time of our taking order to the moment the chief came up to our table, an hour has passed. We had starters, but these finished quickly. The chief was lovely, doing his job the best he could. Food was a ok, but i don't think worth the money. As my 12 years old son said: 'yes it was entertaining but there were other places that could fill your stomach much better'. As a food lover i am not satisfied. Are the 3 skinny slices of salmon and thimble of steamed rice worth £30 considering the fact they taste exactly like you would have prepared it yourself at home ? Not sure. Nothing spectacular about grilled chicken or the sea food either. So, Benihana is fair enough as a one off entertaining only experience, because without the food being cooked in front of you it does not have anything extraordinary to offer. And 16% service charge at the top of it ?? All the best to our lovely cook Diego.

review_title: Overpriced, not great quality, staff very nice
review: I came here not knowing what to expect. The staff were really nice and accommodating, chef was really funny. However, the food was completely over priced and frankly, some of it was not good at all I barely Touched it. The duck dish and chicken dumplings were horrible. The cod as a main was quite good but come on, £42 for cod?? Hence why 2 stars.

review_title: Fun evening with friends but not great food or service
review: Recently went here for a friends birthday as a large group of 12. We had been put into a private room away from the main area - which we were glad about as it was extremely loud in the main restaurant. The cocktails list is poor - most sound fairly unappetising and the only few we tried were not great & we wouldn't have ordered a 2nd. One had an ice cube in which was the size of the glass so was an utter rip off for what you receive. Once at the table, we asked for the wine list which was apparently non-existent as the waitress came back & read 7 wines from her notepad (not being able to tell us anything about any of them)! She explained they were between wine lists, however even if this is the case its fairly poor for any restaurant to not be able to manage this smoothly. We opted for the safe option of Prosecco and beers - after our 2nd bottle of Prosecco, none of the rest of the bottles were cold which the waitress seemed pretty embarrassed about. She also managed to spill half a glass over my friend when pouring it out. The food was ok, we ordered starters to share (the prawns were tasty) and each ordered a main with some vegetables to share too. At the point of mains, you are basically paying for the spectacle only as the portions are fairly small & food is fairly bland & overcooked. I had the seafood special & the salmon was the best thing since its such an oily fish it could take the extra cooking. The lobster was unfortunately a bit chewy. The egg fried rice was also very blend. Each person also got a pair of ramekins with a couple of sauces - these were not nice & didn't compliment the fish at all, one being overly mustardy - assumably to go with steak. For the entainment value, its a bit of fun with a group of friends but I wouldn't go here just for the food. It was also very expensive for what it is - our bill was over £120 per person by the end, which was without desserts & there were a few people driving. I would rather spend that sort of money knowing I'm going to get much better food & service. Unfortunately, we won't be returning and I wouldn't recommend to any food lovers thinking of going.

I’ve been to this branch quite a few times and each and every time it never fails me. We got here around 45minutes early, so we had some drinks from the bar and sat in the seating area until we were called. When our table was ready, we went to be seated. As usual the chefs were very entertaining, making us laugh and really interacting with us which was great! We had the set dinner menu, one was the salmon for approx £29.50 & the other was the chicken for approx £24.00. Both came with onion soup as a starter, a prawn selection, a bowl of white rice & some salad. The best part about the meal was watching the Teppanyaki style cooking right in front of you. We didn’t have dessert because we had no space for it but we did have 4 cocktails throughout. The bill came to £91 including the 12.5% discretionary tip. Oh and if it’s a birthday celebration or special occasion, let them know so they can put the personalised message on the big screen for you in the lounge areas! It’s always a nice surprise

review_title: Just as good as in the States
review: We ate lunch here a really enjoyed it. Our chef was outstanding and the food was delicious. It appears Benihana is the same around the world.Highly recommended,.

Average food with an extortionate price tag. Poor service. Plates were left at our table for about 30 mins after we finished. Our wine was left in an ice bucket away from our table and we had to get it ourselves they were taking so long. Is in need of update. The Tempura ice cream was nice, that's about it. The whole experience felt very cheap/tacky and overpriced. I will never go back.
Brilliant restaurant, went as a group of ten girls and it was a very sociable and enjoyable experience.

review_title: Pay for a show to your kids.
review: All in the title. We arrived, and on a Wednesday night, full of kids screaming in the entrance, playing in the decorations. Thanks to the uneducated parents for that. Most tables had kids. The food was good, even if a bit pricey, but we accepted for the entertainment of having a chef repeating on every tables the same show with the food.  Food was nice, but not screaming in japanese, I would have said more American. (yes, a steak with onions and mushrooms can still talk to me...)  I would say a "you will like it" but not a "you will go back". Even if the chef wrote "I love you" with the rice : he did not won my heart. ♥  ( ps : I asked my steak blue! Heaven!!)

We visited as 4 adults on a Saturday evening. The place was lively and busy, but we were guided to our (booked) table within a couple of minutes of sitting in the waiting area. Food was very good and an enjoyable experience.  Only thing we found odd was a couple of children's birthday party groups were there. A little expensive that I would have thought.

Negative: I found that the quality is not adequate to the price. The interior is outdated and extremely needs renovation. The service and the food were mediocre, nothing special. Positive: Children’s menu and the fun show that the Teppanyaki chief demonstrated.
We have always had a good experience here with the kids and would recommend . Informal fun dining experience
Had a great night at Benihana in a private room with Casper cooking and entertaining us. Thoroughly enjoyed it, great food although quite expensive
Good experience but over priced I wouldnt do it again but its worth ticking off the bucket list Novelty dinning for not novelty prices
Very nice and friendly place, great, attentive staff, delicious food. My only problem was that I smelled food when I left the place. A stronger ventilation would probably solve the problem.

review_title: For entertainment, not for the food
review: I have never been much of a fan of teppanaki food for the taste as it is inevitably bland and boring. Benihana is a legend in the teppanyaki cuisine and for what it is, it’s fine. This is a place for food theatre where people go with their kids / friends for a fun evening.  Service – the service is good at this Benihana. The reception was nice and efficient and the waitresses are nice, drinks and non-teppanaki items served quickly and they did a good job with special requests on the table. Chefs were fun, engaged the kids and put on a good show for everyone.  Food – Ordered the cod with miso and a side of scallops. The fish was good enough, but the miso was added as a sauce (vs glazed on top) which was disappointing. The unique black cod taste was lost on the grill and the luscious oiliness of the fish was lost. My son ordered beef and eat everything as it was served medium so soft to eat in bite size pieces so he liked it. I am not a fan of the food and only attended on the request of my son.  Value – teppanyaki is always expensive. My young son and I had 2 mains, 1 starter and a glass of wine and it cost us £90. Every time I pay the bill for a teppanyaki dinner, I vow never to come back and year after year the kids beg to come back for the show which obviously made the meal delicious to them.  Benhihana does the teppanyaki show well and kids and groups will enjoy the experience. It seems fully booked all the time so there is certainly an audience for it. But it is not good value for money, and the food is uninteresting and bland (even with their sauce options). If the kids have a great desire to go then we may consider going back, but never for any other reason.

I popped into Benihana kings road on a Monday evening to grab some dinner. It was half empty. I shared the lobster meal with my guest and it was just enough for a light dinner. It's one of those places you have to visit to see what it's about but the food was nothing special. It's over priced and I think the focus of the visit is on he chef preparing the food in front of you and not actually the quality of the food. Overpriced and my clothes smelt of food when I left the restaurant.

review_title: Good food, Good entertainment - but at a price
review: Had a deal via Groupon for half price. Very good tasty food, cooked and served in front of you with great pizzazz. However the drinks are expensive, and service is added on the original price, so it all mounts up. This branch is all underground so no natural light, I prefer the Piccadilly branch as it feels more airy, and has windows. Definitely go and enjoy the fun once, but be prepared to pay for good food and entertainment.

review_title: Good entertainment during your dining experience
review: Key feature of this Japanese restaurant is that they cook the food at your table. Tables generally have 8 seats (in 2x4x2 format with one long side reserved for the chef) which would be a bit tight for larger customers. However, the place was not busy so we got a table to ourselves! Plenty of good interaction with the chef (Tequila) during the cooking and lovely freshly cooked food straight to the plate in front of you. Service throughout was good. I'd say the prices are a bit high.

We visited the restaurant in Chelsea. The ambiance is energetic and you can immediately feel that it is a place for friends and groups rather than a romantic dinner with your partner. The show is funny and the food is well cooked but not exceptional because it's not elaborated. I suggest it for a different experience but not as usual place to go.

review_title: Wonderful evening with wonderful food - not just a standard restaurant but a real dining experience
review: I came as part of a large group to celebrate our friends birthday. We all congregated in the bar area until everyone had arrived and were then taken to our dining area. We were spread across 2 tables. The staff were so attentitive throughout - the chefs are such characters and really talented, its a proper "show" they put on. We were given a soup for starters - this is something I would never have ordered as I'm not always that adventurous with trying new dishes but I really enjoyed it. The food was gorgeous and trying the Wagu beef was a real experience, something I'd never tasted before but it was seriously mouth watering! We had such a good evening with lots of laughter and drinks flowing, I will definitely be back!

Visited this restaurant around 4/5 times over the past few years and I have never had a problem. The food, although expensive, is absolutely delicious! And with the chef cooking for you at your table, the food is also very fresh! Benihana also does great cocktails which is perfect if you're celebrating! I'm exciting to come back here again soon and I will continue to in the future.

I went for a friends birthday and I was EXTREMELY disappointed with the vegetarian options on the menu. Firstly, there was only two or maybe three options for vegetarians and the food that was served was extremely bland. There was no spice, no sauce, no flavour on any of the food that was served. Despite being a vegetarian I was served a dish that had prawn in and was told that it was vegetarian. I was extremely dissatisfied with the food and it was a rip off considering I was still hungry and actually ate again at home. The staff and chef however were extremely hospital and helpful, I could not fault the service but I would not go back for the food. If you are vegetarian, do not waste your time going here, I will not be going back.

Very impressive meal with great entertainment by the chef..... But the prices are a little bit silly. Turned out to be the most expensive meal I have ever had and I have eaten at two Michelin restaurants!

review_title: Good quality and entertaining but a little overpriced
review: There with friends and in search of sushi. We arrived and decided to order from the grill instead. While it was entertaining, I found the price to be a bit high.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Its an experience and our chef Luke was funny. He cooked with skill. The service was brilliant and prompt. However I feel the menu can be bettered to justify the price. Benihana is the perfect place for a special occasion.

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review_title: Good food, decent ambiance, great experience
review: The place is a bit pricey if you compare the quality and amount of food you are paying for but you need to remember that you are paying not only for the food but also the experience. We requested the lady who greated us to provide us with a good chef (good as in good entertainment value) and we totally enjoyed our experience. Seeing your food cook in front of you, chef making lively tricks and unique presentation on how the food is prepared really made my kids smile and enjoy there time. Again, if you are only looking for food to consume then yhis place is not for you as you will gind it pricey BUT if your looking for entertainment value, enjoying your food rather than juat eating this is the place to be. Just hope you have a good chef or an experience one which you can always politely ask. Then you are in for a truely unique dining experience.

review_title: A unique experience: entertainment + food = hefty price
review: I'd always wanted to go to Benihana and I finally decided to take my girlfriend. I was impressed, astonished and "wow-ed" by the cook doing his tricks. Once I settled down my huge "kid" smile, I thought to myself: "will it be the same tricks next time I come?" "do you enjoy it as much the next few times?".  But anyway I loved my "Benihana Delight" set menu. Everything about my experience was great.  Price: It is fairly expensive, your looking at least £30/person and you should really only go if you know you can afford to unleash the cash.  NB: -Wifi available through The Cloud -Reservation recommended -Groups of 8 is perfect as tables are for 8 -Service charge 12.5%  CONCLUSION: if you've never been, your a food enthusiast and not too posh, YOU NEED TO GO. I will go again for sure.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Trendsetter
review_title: very entertaining and goof food, but not very Japanese
review: I like this place very much. It is fun to see the chef preparing fresh dishes in front of you. The dishes are very good as well. The seats are comfortable and the staff friendly.  But don't go there if you want a taste of Japan. This is a Hollywood interpretation of Japanese food. That being said, it is still a great place for dinner.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: A tricky one to review. The food was really good without question but you do pay through the nose for it. The way to think about it is this; For just the food... Yes it is expensive. However for the experience, it is worth it. The interior, the 'exclusivity', the service... All is to a great standard. As you would expect the food is sensational.

Booked a birthday of 8 people at Benihana's Kings Road for 8pm. I arrived with others at 7.50pm checked in at the front of house and they don't me we were the first ones there and to wait in the long/bar area which we did. Ordered drinks and waited for the rest of our party to arrive. Everyone arrived but one person arrived by 8.10pm. Waiters come up and took our drinks order and we sat and waited. By 8.45pm we were wondering what was happening with the table so I asked the waitress and they said that they had given away our table as we weren't all here on time. Outraged I asked why no one had told us. Blank faced ignored the question and told me that we were all late and that's the policy. I then asked to speak to the manager who was just as clueless and rude. Not explaining why he had given away our table without informing us. Arriving early and being told to wait in the bar they knew we were waiting for the table yet still they ignored us. The manager said there's nothing he can do as there are no tables and we should wait. By 9.15pm we were still waiting and by then my party was frustrated, hungry and shocked at the service being received. No apology was given and no one seemed to care. We ended up leaving the restaurant and the whole birthday celebration was ruined. We had all travelled from out of London just to be ignored and treated like rubbish.  I would never return to this place again. Clearly it's popular because of the chefs performances when cooking the food but the service is terrible. No people skills. The manager hasn't got a clue what he is doing. Overall embarrassment.

I pre-booked this restaurant & notified them that it was my partners bday I'm advanced. When we arrived, his Happy Birthday message was on the massive plasma screen & the service we received was brilliant. Special thanks goes to Randie the chef who made us feel even more welcome. The bill for the 2 of us with approx 3 cocktails each came too £107.00.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: An amazing value for money menu with great food and extraordinary Teppanyaki chefs.a culinary experience at very reasonable price. Highly recommended
I got in late, got seated and served super quick by an excellent waiter and the food was very good indeed. It’s part of a less commendable hotel but I can’t fault Stefan or this restaurant.

Stephan was an attentive, knowledgeable and friendly member of the service team. He saw to us from the moment we arrived straight through to departure and gave excellent recommendations on both food and drinks. The food was incredible. Tbone steak and lobster meal with chips was 10/10 cooked to medium perfection (for me at least) and the cocktails were really delicious. However if you like strong cocktails you may want to ask for an extra shot. But other than that, this place was a good find, and hopefully you get to meet stephan who will add to your experience in a positive way.

Never been to one of this chain before so I was intrigued. It was excellent. The starter was a lobster roll which was superb. Then had a t bone steak. It was quite hard to cut but tasted so good with the amazing blue cheese sauce. Finished with a dessert of fudge and ice cream which was a huge and delicious portion. Was impressed and the bill was very reasonable for a steakhouse. Service was reasonable. Small restaurant adjoined to a hotel.

My fillet which was meant to be medium was definitely well done and the lobster claws were undercooked. When the waiter/waitress was informed she said that sometimes this happens when the claws are big??? Really what kind of an excuse is that. Come and get sick....

A fabulous lunch experience. We enjoyed the 6 course lunch tasting menu which is highly recommended. We chose not to do the wine pairing though and didn’t have the optional cheese course, but there was more than enough food.Service was very good from the welcome at the front door to when we left. Service is included and if you’re choosing not to have the wine paring, there’s a great wine list. We will definitely be going back.

review_title: Its In Our Top 5 (Or Maybe 3) Of All Time
review: You know you have experienced something special when you are still talking about individual dishes a week later. My wife and I had the pleasure of a 6 course tasting menu on a recent visit to London. Launceston Place had been on our bucket list for a few years.  The service was friendly and engaging.Each member of the team was very knowledgeable and took time to answer any questions we had. Every dish was a taste explosion and it was impossible to choose a favourite. The complex flavours were the result of many processes beyond the means of even the most dedicated foodie. All the food was perfectly seasoned, creatively plated and, hot (one of my gripes at so many fine dining establishments).  This is probably the first review I have written where it is impossible to choose a stand out dish. All were perfectly executed. It is obvious that the menu was design as a whole and not just 6 individual courses served one after another. Thank you Ben and the team for a memorable night.

In a very quiet location but easily reached by Tube this was our planned fine dining in London experience. We were warmly welcomed and then treated to an absolutely excellent dining experience, great food, beautifully cooked and presented with great accompanying wines. We've treated ourselves to a number of top end meals in the UK and abroad, this year, and this was definitely up there as one of the best. On a par with some multi Michelin starred restaurants. So pleased that we visited, mainly based on having a table available and good reviews. Hope to return.
The experience is very classy with good staff and an excellent taster menu. Enormous wine list if that’s your thing. Good time. Pricey but you pay for the whole atmosphere.

review_title: One of the best places your visit for exquisite food
review: This was a great evening with fantastic food and wine The play on the menu is really funny with the draughts The food was so so good. Pigeon being my fav of the evening My wife’s was the cod & caviar Our waiter mattia was just perfect from explaining the dishes and really making my wife and I feel at easy A truly great evening of food the place just oozes warmth and they make you feel very special. Michelin star here it comes Fact

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Very good tasting menu, outstanding staff
review: 9/10. An excellent way to spend a Saturday evening.  The food and menu for the most part was well thought out and executed. For the non-egg eater, the mushroom/truffle salad was light, refreshing and tasty.  The staff were outstanding. Thoroughly attentive, chatty and friendly, and the pacing of the meal was perfect.  Changes? The lamb main course was tiny. Throwing an extra lamb variant (maybe lamb three ways, not two) would avoid the noticeable disappointment when the dish arrives. Or through another piece of the loin on the plate.  The wine pairings were excellent especially the use of one of the Orin Swift varietals for the main course.

review_title: WOW amazing food, wine, staff and ambiance
review: don't think twice, just book and enjoy! We had the taster menu and wine to go with it; everything we had was lovely. The flavours, variety and presentation were first class.  I imagine I would choose most things on the tasting menu, but every single thing was so good. I cant say enough about our dinner, highly recommended and will go back.  The dining room is beautifully designed, not to close to others and great lighting. The staff were incredible. Obviously it is not cheap, but it's worth it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;60+ Traveler
review: Visited the restaurant for their tasting menu and I've experienced many many a chef's tasting--this is the first I've had where every bite was delicious, nicely portioned, and beautifully plated. The wait staff was professional and very helpful. I loved the simple design of the restaurant and that it was in a quiet residential area. The power was packed in the food, the thought and flavors that went into each course. I hope to visit again.

review_title: Incredible restaurant and deserves more accolades
review: What a beautiful restaurant. If this isn’t 2 Michelin star on the next review god knows why. Amazing service, incredible food and superb value lunch. 3 courses, amuses Bouche, delicious bread and butter and petit fours for £39 - you’d pay that for 3 courses in your local pub.

Booked as a birthday treat. Friendly staff who provide a great service. The food was good but some of the vegetarian dishes lacked flavour and the last dish which was based on the use of Leeks was burnt. Not sure if that was the intention, but it was bitter and not really edible. Expect more from a highly rated place as this.
This was our second visit to Launceston Place and it was amzing yet again. Highly recomend it for a special ocasion. We will be going back very soon.j

I had bought a three course lunch here as part of a Virgin Experience Voucher for my mum's Christmas present, and wanted to give a 5-star review as it was a really fabulous afternoon. The service was thoughtful and attentive and Francesco was a lovely waiter. I loved the special touches to the experience- the complimentary bread and butter, mini tacos and fudge were all delicious and an unexpectedly kind touch which I didn't expect given that we were paying with a voucher. Plus these extras helped to keep me full for the whole day! The chequerboard menu was fun and I was delighted with my food (as was my mother). I'd really recommend the celeriac starter - a delicious salty sweetness to it. And the carrot cake was soo good. Beautifully presented food and the perfect portion size for a lunch. I have eaten in quite a few 'fine dining' restaurants and Launceston Place stood out for me as an absolutely wonderful experience and excellent food. Plus, my mum, who has never eaten out somewhere like this, had her mind blown by it haha. We will be back!

Interestingly quirky laid out restaurant with delightful and friendly staff. The quirkiness continues with a board with multiple choices for designing your own menu. We chose the chef’s own taster menu, as is our normality and we trusted his choices. From the amuse bouche to the mint leaf tea, we were regained with superb dishes exquisite flavours and stunning presentation. Reading the history of the place, chef was bought in to seek to restore their Michelin star, from what we observed he is well on the road to that. The greatest surprise to us was the celeriac course. I must confess some hesitation as I don’t find it the most inspiring ingredient, but his take on it was brilliant with genuinely impressive flavours The trout was very gently and carefully presented with subtlety. The grouse was equally thoughtfully presented. One genuine stand out was the amazing yuzu dessert with a very playful presentation. It’s slightly disingenuous to pick out any favourites as that somehow suggests others are less worthy! We genuinely were hugely impressed with all aspects of this experience and we wish them in their journey back to the top
Great restaurants with an amazing atmosphere, the perfect place to celebrate a special moment. The wine list was great with a great variety. Absolutely recommended.

review_title: One of the very best meals I have had in London over the last 35 years
