The food truly blew us away as did matching wines - I have been to degustation a number of times but this was truly on another level! Chapeu!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This was our first visit to this restaurant and we both thoroughly enjoyed it. Very relaxed atmosphere. Chilled even. Lovely setting.  Staff were excellent. Very polite, personable and attentive.  We took one of the tasting menus with accompanying wine flight. There wasn't a single weak course. Each one was beautifully plated and well balanced flavours and textures.  I would definitely go back and I would not be surprised if they got a 2nd Michelin star.

review_title: Unbelievable for Hotel to have this great of a restaurant!
review: Had the Chef's table and the experience of the night was near perfection! The gorgeous hostess never let us push our own chairs in and the brilliant chefs never disappointed with the food! I always thought hotels were not allowed to have restaurants this good on their property but obviously that rule is out the door with this spot! Trust in what you like and order and this restaurant will not disappoint you.

This was probably my finest overall meal experience. Not only was the food and the service exceptional, but for some reason, we were lucky enough to be randomly seated at the Chef’s table where we could actually watch the food preparation in detail. We elected to go with the Chef’s tasting menu which they happily adjusted to accommodate some of my wife’s seafood aversions. Every dish was amazing. From the sommelier, to the waiters, to the chefs, not a single detail was overlooked in providing us a top notch dining experience. Bravo Pur'… Well done!

Housed in the swanky Park Hyatt Vendome, this restaurant is on the lobby level. They have 3 choices for dinner - 2 degustations and a la carte. I opted for the 6 course degustation. 3 amuse bousche came first and they were ok. The 1st course was white asparagus. Not a big fan, but it was ok. Seabass followed and it was good and well coordinated with all the other elements. Veal was the main and it was very good. A heavy melted cheese course followed. It was ok but too heavy and cheesy to finish. The strawberry and chocolate desserts finished the set and they were great. Petit fours were also too much for me by then  Service is very good as expected  Pur-fect

Wow what a dinner!  The 8 course tasting dinner was one of the best meals we have ever eaten and the service both in the restaurant and in the Hyatt generally was congenial and exceptional.  Some of the dishes were try's works of art that it was a struggle to disturb in order to eat them because they were so beautiful. Favourites include the Dublin Bay Prawns, turbot, lamb, cheeseboard and the chocolate.  Thank you for a memorable evening beyond all my expectations. Superbe!!

Just a fabulous experience, staff were outstanding and the good was even better. Some of the best dishes if had around the world. Cost 500 euro for 8 course set menu with matching wine. Great value and will go back when I'm back in Paris.

We visited Pur' for my wife's 30th birthday and decided to have the 'As time goes by' tasting menu.  The food and service was exquisite, more of what you'd expect from a 2 or 3 Michelin starred restaurant in the UK than what is only a 1 star in Paris.  At €125 this is good value compared to other restaurants of a similar standard in Paris.  The menu was excellent and each course was a delightful experience full of great flavours and textures.  The service was commendable and with only one sitting you have the table for the whole night. This is a restaurant for a special occasion and a wonderful experience that will will not forget.  Thanks to Jean-Francois and his team. It was a pleasure.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We had the single best bite of our trip in Paris here. It was a venison "hunter's pie" served as part of a venison two-ways main course. The other part was the most perfectly cooked piece of venison I have ever had, but the pie was life changing. I had never had venison served in a shredded bbq-esque presentation before, nor had I have had mashed potatoes with white chocolate. Now I wonder how I could have missed out on such a genius combination for so long. I will never see mashed potatoes the same way again.  Like the Park Hyatt hotel itself, where I stayed, there's really nothing to fault about my meal here. If anything, the amuse were just fine (but interesting and creative), and then the meal just kept building strength upon strength. The desserts were astoundingly good. The only negative I can think of is that I had way too much food (and wine), and almost fell asleep. But then the pre-dessert refresher did it's job at waking me up for the actual desserts that pushed our meal past midnight.  Many reviewers suggest another star will be awarded to Pur' in time, and it's not hard to see why. It really felt like a 1-star restaurant cooking above its level, and therefore it was almost a relative bargain, if you can call a E200pp+ meal that. And if you're staying at the Park Hyatt already, it is also crazy convenient to stumble back into bed!

I went with three other colleagues for a top notch dinner. The atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice and international. The selection of different tasting menus and A la Carte was very good. The service was fast and observant. The wine list was also very good 7,5 out of 10.
The staff is great and plentiful. The food was good but not the best meal we have ever had. Everything in Paris is expensive but this is off the chart.
Amazing! Atmosphere, food, service. I can't wait to visit again. Well worth the price tag. Would recommend for all to try....
great dining experience if you can afford it. the 6-course dinner is lovely. french cuisine at its best.

My husband invited me to Pur' to celebrate our first anniversary :) The whole experience was delightful from start to finish. We went for the 6-course dinner, which is very generous if you also count the beautiful amuse-bouche sent by the chef (we started with a foie gras lollipop which was divine!!). The bread and wine selection are exquisite, (a wine is associated with every dish), the service is outstanding and the food is mouthwatering. Every course was a beautiful surprise for our palates, and, for the cherry on the top, we met the chef before leaving and he gave us little cookies to take home and eat the next day. I will definitely be back on my next visit to Paris!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: The first general impression is the very quiet atmosphere of the Hyatt hotel lobby, a very charming, peacefull ambience when you just arrive from the chaotic traffic of Paris... We arrived a bit early, then we were invited to wait at the Hotel lounge, I recommend to go outside, there is a nice outside courtyard, we had a nice apperitif... The Pur restaurant was a great experience, we selected the 6 courses menu, I would recommend it, the 8 courses looks a bit too much, but that's only my opinion. We also selected the wine recommendation proposed in the menu.... There was a nice course after course experience and tasting... The service was perfect and very professional. We felt that it was going a bit too fast, we informed them and they adjusted. The kitchen is opened, you can see and feel the activity of the team, without disturbing the cosy atmosphere. The "Sommelier" was very professional, explaining in detail each wine and the relation with the meal. I really recommend the "Pur" , a nice gourmet experience in paris.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: If you are looking for an experience of a lifetime, do try 'Le Pur'! Not only for the fantastic atmosphere and the cosy environment (especially if you have the honor to be at the Table du Chef), but also for the highly professional service and of course the meal... It is a pure delight... You will enjoy a succession of delicious tastes from start to end, with 6,7,8 or more different courses, married with wines from the best vineyards on earth which are specially chosen for you to add the final touch! And, if you think this is already more than what you can ever dream of... There's more!! You will have pleasure to meet with the Chef Rouquette who has only one objective: ensure that you spend an unforgettable moment!

review_title: Fantastic.. if money is no object
review: The food and service were both superb and I cannot criticise the craft of the chef and the attention of the staff. But, this is very expensive - it will set you back €300 for dinner including wine for 2 people. Worth a visit if you can afford it.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: After 2 years out of France you are dreaming of a place where you can reassess your palate, enjoying a perfect service and go through this experience with a perfect wine pairing. I had some great expectations and i wasn't disappointed. The full menu was straight to the point...Hight quality products, seasoning, cooking, design, service and wine pairing. I will not describe all the courses...but I would just say that it was a pleasure to have some Asian twinkling... The fact to be in a open kitchen concept and in a rotunda restaurant give a very warm atmosphere to the place. J.Francois Rouquette is the "Chef d'Orchestre" and the symphony is perfectly achieved... I hope those lines will drive you to this fantastic place and that you will have the chance, as me, to see the stars in the eyes of your partner. Thanks to this great team.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review_title: same architect, same noisy cupola, disappointly bland though beautiful food, excellent service
review: At our recent stay in the Park Hyatt Milan we were prompted to try the Park Hyatt Paris near Place Vendome, which was designed by the same architect. Though I have some reservations about the materials and style of the Park Hyatt Milan, I wanted to check out the Paris location. Indeed the "look and feel" of the entry and lobby areas is quite similar, as is the building itself, a building with interior courtyard covered by a glass cupola. The contemporary clean look, the shiny pretty marble floors, are marred by what in my opinion is some pretty disquieting 'art-work' and decor (see pictures of the spooky light fixtures and creepy (in my opinion, alright) paintings). I'm thinking, with all the universally loved and beautiful and creative and glee-giving art out there, how could they have made these choices? What message are they trying to convey to us? "Watch out or the creepy light fixure men will descend upon you and scratch your eyes out?" I dunno.  To the restaurant; we were seated in the cupola area which happened to be packed at lunchtime. The entry to the kitchen is equipped with a long table upon which all that takes place can be viewed as reflections in surround mirrors on walls and ceiling, angled precisely for that purpose. We were offered a cocktail and when we expressed interest in a coupe of champagne, we were elegantly described the houses, vintage of choices, last but evidently not least was the hyatt labeled something or other famous-house made especially to celebrate the hotel's 10th anniversary. I asked, "it isn't $3000 a glass is it? " and was told, well it is more expensive than the other types but it isn't that much..." We would "laugh" about that later when we got the bill and saw that over half the amount was attributable to the €45ish per glass of champagne orders!  I had the raw scallops, beautifully presented, but taste-free, much to my increasing-with-each-bite dismay. There were the very tasty dried berry dotting the plate adding beautiful color, and the paper-thin sliced radish so thin it was translucent, and some other exotic plant which were the tastiest things on my plate. The St. Jacques were perhaps defrosted? Dunno. I forget what my husband had, and which I tasted too. I guess that sums that up.  Delicious bread products, as always, the hand-finished patty of butter (not to my liking though).  Great service, cool ambiance, but very loud as the cupola created an acoustic bubble.  Happily I did not hear any sound from noisy printers like one hears in the Milan Park Hyatt.  All in all, great atmosphere, great service, stick to the regular vintages of champagne unless you are on an expense account, and don't rely on the menu offerings to satisfy a need for very tasty cuisine.  Oh, and did I mention the artwork? Have a look. Maybe some people will enjoy these pieces, which are probably even famous and were probably very costly too. And beware of those light-fixure men; watch your eyes!

This restaurant was the highlight of our trip to Paris. The food was amazing, reasonably priced, service was impeccable and the ambiance was very romantic. A must visit for any couples going to Paris!

review_title: Great place, great food, a MUST GO in Paris!
review: Let me start with the dessert. Honestly, the Maitre can be relaxed now and lay back. I have to admit: one chocolate dessert on the menu and I will go for it. This one was exceptional. Great Praline mousse, nice chocolate sphere, nice crumble combination. It was death of chocolate, a very nice one. So let me begin with the starter. The champignons de bois had an excellent taste, an amazing texture. The salad topping was not mine, but all in a bite very good. The main course was an Argentine Entrecote, cooked to perfection. All these dishes are presented in a good manner at a nice location. The ambiance is great, following the theme of this restaurant. The host and the staff in general: keen, nice, helpful and attentive. Nothing to complain about and to be honest: we ate worse at Michelin Star restaurants. The location of the restaurant cannot be found without TripAdvisor. Hence, no mass tourism and no tourists who want to eat cheap and fast. We had a great evening and an absolutely fantastic dinner. This restaurant needs to be visited for sure!

The reviews do not do this place justice. While some restaurants deliver an excellent meal via discipline, the staff here at Au P'tit Curieux achieve the perfect meal through love. If you can get in, just go - its perfect.
Met with colleagues for dinner. The staff was incredible, the food was amazing and the wine selection/pairing was spot on on. They set aside a great wine for us. We had a great time!

Delightful neighborhood restaurant! Greeted and served by one of the owners who is very friendly and welcoming. The burratina was delicious as was the magret though one piece was quite tough. The wine list is very heavily tilted to Burgundy and small producers.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: It’s Easy To Be A Fan
review: We had dinner here on our first night in Paris and it was a wonderful, low-key affair. We were shown directly to our table in a strategic corner so we could see the entire place and everything everyone ordered. Everything was delicious and well-presented on the plate. The service really stood out, friendly without being cloying. The eclectic design of the room lends an informal atmosphere that makes for a comfortable dinner. Exhausted from our overnight trip, we opted for an early evening and the owner seemed concerned we had not thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Au P’tit Curieux, but we had. It was a wonderful neighborhood spot with a real flair for entertaining.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: A 25 minute taxi from the 1st Arr. in rush hour (but a 20- minute Metro back), led us to a charming neighborhood of young professionals who, by 8:45 had packed this gem of a restaurant. We were the first to arrive, and were treated so graciously by the young owner and his female assistant. Dinner was exceptional, each dish more interesting than the last. I would say don’t miss the “perfectly cooked eggs” (photographed here). It is true that by the time the place was packed, the owner and his assistant had challenges keeping up with every one of us as promptly, but it made us feel more like a genuine neighborhood experience, and we enjoyed watching everyone from our corner table. Thank you to everyone who reviewed this and helped us find this wonderful hidden gem. Highly recommended.

We had already been to quite many good places during our city break in Paris but Au P'tit Curieux turned out to be the crown jewel of this trip. Food just perfect (we had 3 courses of classical French cuisine); great wines that were recommended with expertise by the host; cosy, easy-going ambience. But the best of all: What a devoted and personal service. So glad we found this restaurant. We were really happy after this dinner!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Great meal this evening. Lovely menu - excellent flavour combinations. We had the egg, salmon, scallop and quail. Great wine list as well. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Overall a great evening

We went to this restaurant because of the amazing reviews and we were glad we did. The reviews don’t lie! The staff was very friendly from beginning to end, we felt very welcomed immediately. We had a reservation and the table was ready when we arrived. The food was fantastic. I ordered the salmon and was amazing. My husband ordered the steak and he said it was ok, a little under done, even though he asked medium well. I guess that’s the way the cook in Paris. But the real champion of the evening was the dessert. We shared a Creme brûlée. It was unbelievable. Best dessert ever! And the price wasn’t expensive. We had very mediocre dishes in Paris and we paid almost the same price. I strongly recommend this restaurant.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Our Best Meal in Paris, Ever
review: The whole night was made magical by the owner, service, food, and setting. Been to Paris a number of times. Never had a single meal that was spot on in every way. Walked in about 20 minutes early and the owner immediately knew our reservation. He seated the 4 of us at an odd table right up in front of the bar. We were unsure, but as the evening unfolded we learned this was exactly the spot to have. He could watch over us from the bar like a wonderful host. We also learned he custom made the table which worked out exceptionally well. He made the wine suggestions which were spot on. Every course was wonderful. I have never taken photos of my food, but there is first time for everything. We left feeling we were leaving someones home. A night to remember and he and the staff were gracious to our limited French, we even shared laughs about how bad we were in the language department.

I chose this restaurant because of the high ranking in TA (n°4 in Paris). The neighborhood is not all that good but I can't say I felt unsafe at any time on our way there and back by metro. The hospitality is very good: we got a warm welcome and all through the meal it stayed that way. After ordering some cocktails we had to wait for more than 1 hour before we got our menus! (after having asked for it). We then got some bread to cover the gap. The entry was presented beautifully on a plate but the mackerel was just smoked mackerel, nothing special. We ordered a beef medaillon for mains: the taste of mine was good and juicy but my wife's was actually bleu whereas it should have been medium rare. Also the temperature in the restaurant kept rising up till the point it was too hot to stil order dessert. We fled the restaurant. So a lower score to get the overall score back to a realistic level.

I would say that this score is exactly what I feel about experience in this restaurant. 5 courses served at very fast pace. Sea scalop dish come on time from the kitchen but served bit late, hence temperature was not good, it would be much better that it was served on time. Knife for meat dish was with wooden handle which is against HACCP standard. One of the service personnel had scent of cigarettes on his fingers (must say this was noticed when bill was presented, not during food service) All the rest was very good and food was really tasty. Reception was very professional, very good and clean rest room facility. Price wise this was on high end side. Still, I recommend this place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This was our first time at 114 Faubourg and we enjoyed everything enormously. The ambience is warm and relaxed, and the service we received was attentive and courteous at all times, from everyone. We took a la carte (rather than a tasting menu) - crab starters, monkfish for my wife and duck for me. All excellent, and my wife's avoidance of gluten and lactose was dealt with as no problem at all. Worth its star, and worth a visit. We'll go back.

review_title: After 3 weeks in Europe - it's at the top
review: We went for lunch with our 2 teens and the meal was phenomenal. The staff was awesome. We were not rushed in any way - in fact - we were there for about 3 hours. But start to finish, it was just an excellent meal, an excellent experience in total. It's pricey for sure, but in this case, what we received matched the price (which isn't always the case). We spent 3 weeks between France, Italy, and Switzerland and we all agree that 114 Faubourg is among the top 2 restaurants during our trip. And I'll go a step further and include it among the top restaurants in our State-side dining experiences (with the remaining best being in NYC). Truly a great restaurant and so happy we visited.

review_title: This is the restaurant we think of when we want to take guests
review: It is consistently excellent. It is fun. It is beautiful, It is not stuffy, yet elegant. It is historic. The dishes from the kitchen do not disappoint, but delight. My secret suggestion is to treat yourself first at LE BAR (same hotel as 114 at Le Bristol), then dinner and dessert at 114. It will be memorable.

A wonderful dining experience from start to finish. From the moment we were welcomed at the door to leaving we were completely taken care of. Foor was wonderful and so traditional French. Restaurant is a beautiful setting. Service exceptional.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Still very good but service off
review: We eat here once or twice a year during our annual stay in Paris and it is one of our favorites. Service this year felt remarkably different. In the past we always received a gluten-free menu for my celiac husband without asking (I specify in my booking that he needs a gluten-free meal). This year we had to ask for it. I ordered a cocktail and my husband an aperitif. Before we even received them, the waiter asked if we wanted to order our meal. I don't think I have ever had that happen in a Michelin-starred restaurant. It felt like dining in a cafe. We said we would prefer to have our drinks and then order. In prior years we always looked forward to the mignardise at the end of the meal. They would always tell my husband which things he could have and fill in with macarons if too many of the usual mignardise had gluten. This time we noticed we were the only table that didn't receive any. We asked the waiter and he said that my husband would not be able to eat them (not true - they included macarons). I asked why did I not get any. He said he assumed that I would not want any if my husband could not have any. That's like saying I would not eat bread at a meal if he couldn't have any. We asked for a manager and he apologized and we got our mignardise. I gave my husband ones that I knew were OK for him and they obviously were since he had no effect from them. The manager gave us his card and assured us that next time he would make sure we were properly taken care of. These are small things, and the cocktail and food and wine were excellent, but we have been here quite a number of times before and the the service was flawless and friendly in the past to the point where a waiter we had on an earlier visit would come over and say hello. Also, it does have a Michelin star and you should not have to worry about anything in such a restaurant. Hopefully this is an isolated incident and does not reflect their normal service.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Outstanding in every way including service
review: Normally for me it's the Parisian concept of table service that lets really good places down but it's not the case here. We had a delightful business dinner in a quiet corner of the restaurant, three beautifully prepared courses with wine and champagne. The only let down of the night was England losing to Croatia. Would love to come again, so long as someone else pays the bill. It is top class, and the prices reflect that.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local
review_title: breakfast at tiffanys. A jewel of a dining place.
review: Highly recommended - a one hat breakfast diner in the centre of paris. Fine food and service to match. Worth a visit. At le Bristol Hotel

My husband booked this restaurant as a birthday surprise for me and what an amazing treat it was. The staff couldn’t have been nicer and made us feel so welcomed. The food was fabulous, I’d definitely recommend the tasting menu, I can still taste the food now !

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Excellent Meal, Excellent Service, Perfect Evening
review: We came here for dinner on the night we landed in Paris. Our flight was supposed to arrive at 8:20pm, and their last order was at 10:15pm (be aware that even though they offer 10:30pm reservations on La Fourchette, they don't actually do that), so I initially canceled because I was worried we'd miss the reservation. They were exceedingly nice and understanding during the email exchange, and so when we arrived on time and realized we could still make it, we had our hotel call them, and they were able to accommodate us.  Particularly for a late night dinner, the meal was better than I could have expected. The servers were kind and didn't rush us at all even though we ordered the chef's menu. Particularly memorable was the artichoke soup which was divine, the best I'd ever had with bits of artichoke mixed in with the velvety smooth soup. My husband, who is usually a non-meat eater, said the lamb was one of the best he had tasted. If you come here, you must have the bread, even if you are trying to cut down on carbs. It's absolutely delicious. On this night, we had something that looked like parker rolls, but actually tasted like a nice focaccia, and a perfectly baked sourdough slice.  If you are a dessert lover like me, you will love the long list of some of the most scrumptious choices I've seen at a restaurant in a long time. The menu came with a caramel mille-feuille, which I enjoyed, but I also saw tantalizing plates of soufflés, berry tarts etc etc making its way toward other tables. I would love to come and just eat all of their desserts.  The restaurant was located inside the Bristol hotel, which is a former palace. The warm and unpretentious service combined with the amazing food even made me curious about staying here next time.  Pricewise, this is a one Michelin restaurant, so it's in the typical range of similarly rated establishments. Frankly, however, this was a better meal than two-Michelin places we've been to on out previous trip two months ago, so from that perspective we considered it to be, maybe not a bargain, but completely worth it.

Couldn't get a reservation at Epicure , Le Bristol and they counter offered a seat at this restaurant, which i took  This restaurant is quite casual so i thought the hotel guests have breakfast here but this is not the case. Evidently not an "IT" restaurant in paris. I was here 7 -830pm on a friday night and the place was only 20% full. I also felt overdressed wearing a suit with bow tie  Had the award winning duck pate and it was good. The pigeon was commendable too, and traditionally presented. I prefer the pigeon i had at Le Mesure a few days ago  Service was good but i had such a great time with the staff at Le Gabriel earlier during lunch this pales slightly
Great food and great atmosphere. Very friendly staff. Dishes that you don't see everywhere and exceptionist. Looking forward to my next visit

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review: The hotel Bristol in which you find both this brasserie and the 3-star Epicure is a hotel where everybody smiles at you and is extremely helpful. A rare sight in Paris! From the lady taking your coats to the waiters, everybody takes care of you and wants to make sure that you leave the place smiling. This is a very high class brasserie and it is on the expensive side, but worth the money. A carpaccio of scallops came nicely presented on a shell and seaweed which created a beautiful smell, as if you were on a beach. The riz-de-veau with young spinach and a taste of cinnamon was again a treat, as was the souffle as dessert. The guests were of all ages and origins. Compared with the price of the food, I found the wines very reasonably priced. Thanks for a great evening!

We had dinner here on our first evening at the hotel and having eaten here before we knew what to expect.  The staff were very careful as my wife is coeliac and pregnant, ensuring that the meals served were suitable.  Fantastic service and 1st class food.
Inside Le Bristol, Le 114 Faubourg is an elegant restaurant with a very good menu and an excellent wine list. Service is second to none.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Impeccable service and great kitchen. Ambiance is very good. It's important to make a reservation. Enjoy the evening

This is an experience of perfectionism. The location is breathtaking: classical grandeur hotel, with gloved and soft spoken personell taking care of you from the first second you enter the place (of course valet parking is part of the treatment).  Then Le Food: the chef menu for 114€ is a great tour de carte. Every dish is a colorful painting, with texture of fish and meat amazingly good. Special ingredients and French specialities abound. The partridge with Foie Gras is a signature dish, comparable to the unique lobster experience at Gleneagles Hotel, as a massage of your palate. The wines (not included) are expensive, but you should definitely go for it, and take the sommelier's advice.  Time flies here, but you'll remember every minute.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Very good food with excellent service
review: Great location in Paris (inside the Bristol hotel). Classic modern decor, brasserie style. Not very intimate (mainly small tables close to each others). Excellent service speaking proper English. The degustation menu at 114 euros w/o wines is an excellent option. Not the best value for money in the city but a nice place to spend a good evening in a Parisian Palace.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I have reviewed this restaurant in prior years and we always return each year. The reason I am reviewing again is the gluten-free bread. It is exceptional. My husband has celiac disease and if you do get GF bread at a restaurant, it is usually some blah toast. This stuff was good. Other than that, lovely atmosphere, great food (Michelin starred), great service.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: The were issues with my food, and we got to sent it back to the kitchen. The staff argued, but when the manager came and look, he didnt argue and took it back and sent it back to the kitchen. They managed to make it up and repair the mistakes. I appreciate they try to make up for the mistakes, if not of course its 1 star.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: We had a dinner at this restaurant included in our package at Le Bristol and were not disappointed. The restaurant is a counterpoint to the fine dining at Epicure. It is a busy place with a friendly relaxed atmosphere; in keeping with what we experienced at Le Bristol. A pleasant setting and waiting staff were polite and efficient. We were offered a good fixed menu with limited but quality offerings. Enjoyed the beef filet- well cooked and delicious. Entree and desert options were also good. A satisfactory wine selection. Prices were reasonable for what the place is- I would go back!

The 1 star food and the 5 star service is excellent here. We had dinner here while staying at the hotel. We chose the special "114 Faubourg menu" available only for dinner. For € 114 plus beverage cost you will have an amazing experience. Extra thanks to "Alicia" working there. Very polite, professional, and lovely person.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Luxury Traveler
review: This was my 60th birthday present to me 2nights at Le Bristol and dinner at 114 Faubourg. I was greeted and wished happy birthday taken to my table which was adorned with red rose petals ! I was left to digest menu and people watch as the restaurant became very busy.Service is slick,efficient and done with a minimum of fuss. I order pate and fish both dishes delicious and fish just melted in my mouth.I was suggested a lovely riesling by the sommelier and it was a perfect match. I am left to enjoy my meal and plates cleared in an instant.Order a beautiful sorbet for desert and much to my surprise the staff assemble and sing happy birthday to me followed by applause from diners which was a lovely touch. This is fine dining Bistro style but a delightful experience and highly recommended!

Our First taste of Fine dining in Paris! Simply Magical. The atmosphere is amazing! The wallpaper to die for! Situated in Hotel Bristol we went searching for the famous cats after dinner - they were hiding! The food was so special

review_title: Excellent food and Wine, let down a little on Gluten contamination.
review: The food and service was excellent. My wife had a seperate GF menu, limited options but very good choice overall. Wine list was great and cocktails very good.  The meal was let down as my wife was ill from some Gluten contaminated food at some point in the evening, after dinner chocolates, main meal or something. A real shame as we loved the restaurant.

The food quality is amazing, the menu is limited so if you are a vegetarian opt for the veg menu though that didn't look too appealing. The service was impeccable, definitely worth the experience of this fine dining.

review_title: Very good eating place in Hotel Le Bristol
review: It's our first dinner in Paris this trip. The place was almost full on both levels. We ate in the lower level where the open kitchen situated. All dishes ordered were impeccably prepared. However, they were too salty and the veal was too cooked to our medium rare order.

I can't say anything. But everything was excellent. My husband and I tried artichoke soup and green salad with old parmigiana as starter. Then we go both for yammy turkey. For desserts of course we went on chocolate soufflé and cognac ice cream.that was a wonderful dinner. Do to Le 114 Faubourg if you are in Paris. ❤️

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: If you want to have a magical lunch or diner, Le Bristol is the perfect place. The 2 restaurants are exceptional! The service is perfect as usual and the dinner just delicious :) I recommend it and we will definitely return!

review_title: Excellent service, great food and wine
review: As soon as we entered the attention to service was great, we had a lovely table upstairs, busy but not crowded, a good atmosphere. Quiet expensive but a great treat and memory. Waiters were very attentive but not an intrusion. All in all a great evening.

The restaurant was a dissappointment. The food was good, but not Michelin star level. The service was odd. We ordered wines to go with the dinner (gave sommallier the opportunity to pick up the right ones) and tought they will bring different ones with starter and main course. But they brought the main course wines in the beginning and we needed to ask more wine for main course. The service and flavour experience wasn't worth of money. Comparing to Restaurant Pur this Le 114 Faubourg wasn't the place to go.

review_title: Best dinner i have had in years
review: An outstanding evening in a wonderful restaurant. Before I get to the food it is worth saying that the seating, décor and staff are all really wonderful. Just such a rare treat to sit in an environment like this and be treated with such charm and understated professionalism. We had the oxtail ravioli and award winning game pate to start. Both superb. Followed by cod and scallops again both just dreamy. Chocolate Soufflé and the millefeuille as puddings. My wife was totally silenced by the soufflé and said not a word uttering weird sounds as she finished the dish in 7 minutes flat. Sublime she said. All complemented by a lovely Sancerre. Not a lot more to say other than this is the most deserved one star I have ever been in.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: A Michelin star restaurant in the wonderful Bristol Hotel Paris and a romantic location for fine dining in elegant and chic surroundings. However this is not a stuffy and overly formal dining experience but is contemporarily styled with some left of field options as well as some traditional old favorites. The amuse bouche of warm lobster was a stella beginning to a fabulous evening with lovely pink champagne and moving on to a delightful Provencal rosé. Dessert was heavenly as was the aged Calvados to finish of perfect evening. Staff were knowledgeable about each dish and very helpful, indeed they welcomed the opportunity to discuss the menu in detail. So price wise its one of those places where if you need to know how much it will cost you can't afford it. Price however should not be a barrier to enjoying a wonderful evening in delightful surroundings. After all what price can you put on a memory that you will never forget?

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: Great experience, good but not excellent food
review: We visited for lunch and at 2pm place was full. Restaurant ambience is alright but the tables are stacked too close together to become uncomfortable (you may end up facing person from the next table almost directly into the face and it may become quite awkward. For the Michelin-starred restaurant I was surprised that the n1 item in the list of mains was Le cheeseburger... And that there were people there who actually ordered it. I guess I expect more haute cuisine but tastes of course differ. We decided to go for fixed price menu. I had mushroom soup with duck foie gras ravioli and steak tartare. Both dishes were very good with soup little less so due to somewhat hard dough used to prepare ravioli. We also had 1/2 bottle of pouilly-fume which was delicious. My wife had duck Pte in a crust (delicious) and deep fried whiting which was ok but very simple, basically a fish and chips without batter and chips.  End of the lunch was coffee with chocolates provided on the side. We've also received small gift of another box of chocolate at departure. Service was fantastic throughout.  Overall very good experience but next time we will probably order from the main menu.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The 114 Faubourg was awarded a Michelin star in 2013. Chef Jean-Charles Cauquil achieved new levels of excellence in this very Parisian elegant decor. "Sautéed sweetbread and mushrooms in persillade, roast veal cooking juices" are superb as well as the selection of fish and the "Roasted red mullet, candied tomatoes with Colombo spices"...Excellent and attentive service, knowledgable sommelier and beautiful, relaxing dining room.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: This was my 2nd lunch here this year – lucky me. A fantastic restaurant!
review: This Michelin-starred restaurant in the Bristol Hotel has a genuinely lovely ambience without stuffiness or pretension. Service is wonderful, and the food absolutely delicious: King crab egg, ginger & lemon mayonnaise; flat baked monkfish tail, sautéed squid, peppermint peas (they were amazing) and shellfish sauce; Gariguette strawberries with mascarpone sorbet. Wines: Muscadet, Pierre Blanches, Domaine Luneau-Papin 2012 and Fronton, Cuvee Reservee, Domaine Le Roc 2005

review_title: Not Just the Best Meal in Paris, but Perhaps the Best Meal Overall
review: In part we returned to Paris this year just to be able to have another meal at Le 114 Faubourg. It is our kind of place, elegant, but simple; refined but approachable; truly great food but without pretense. Beginning with an amuse bouche that was ideal for the Paris heat wave we were experiencing, the rest of the meal flowed as though it was individually designed for us. We will have yo return next year so that we can experience this amazing restaurant again. (Or perhaps we should just move to Paris!)

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Having stayed at Le Bristol (and dined at 114) on a number of occasions, they introduced a vegetarian menu following some feedback during a previous stay. At Christmas, I’d seen significant improvements overall, providing some further feedback on the mains specifically (see previous review). With an unexpected return visit in March, I looked forward to my dining experience.  The amuse bouche of scrambled eggs black truffle and chives was excellent. The starter - a mesclun truffle salad - lacked finesse (noting I later discovered this had been updated on the main menu but not the vegetarian menu, which still had it as a signature dish in the ~ 40 euro mark when in fact it had been replaced by a basic lettuce leaf salad with a small amount of grated truffle). See photos. As per my previous visit, the mains were still uninspiring and frankly a lazy selection of basic vegetables – noting the morels were extremely salty. The mille-feuille dessert was very enjoyable.  Service was inattentive – 15 minute waits were frequent for clearing plates, asking for the sommelier to their arrival, etc.  On advising the Maître d' of my initial disappointment with the starter, and on providing feedback on the experience as a whole, he was very professional. And assured me the feedback would be noted.  As Hotel Le Bristol prides itself on being a level above most hotels, and commands a premium for such, I sincerely hope improvements are made.  Note – I appreciate France is not renowned for being vegetarian friendly, however as a restaurant attached to a premium hotel catering for largely international guests, expect better.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: This is a great restaurant - the food was excellent and the decor is impressive. Service was really good. We were there for a special birthday and the staff brought a dessert with a flame - very spectacular!

review_title: Exceptional food and service! And best Soufflé!
review: As a regular visitor to Paris, I decided to try this restaurant with our family who were visiting us in London.  From the moment we were greeted at the door to the moment we left the restaurant, we received fantastic service. Staff were so friendly!  The décor of the place is interesting. Some parts nice whilst others a tad on the tacky side but still a nice ambience.  The Scottish beef was amazing as was the chocolate soufflé. It was all perfection.  I was very impressed with this restaurant and I would definitely go back!

review_title: Unique brasserie experience! TOP service and quality
review: It was the second visit to the Bristol Hotel (unfortunately I could not stay there yet) as I tried Epicure two years ago.  Though first '114' experience and I must say that this was the most uncommun 1-star-restaurant we have ever been to!  When walking into the restaurant hostess greeted and guided us to a nice table (by the way: if you want to have a nice and tranquil dinner go for the upper level as they feature an 'open' kitchen on lower level which may be a bit noisy... )  The reason why 114 is awarded 1 star is an A-Level-Service and dishes of exceptional quality!  And we appreciated the fact that you do not feel to dine in a 'hotel-restaurant' because it has a separate entrance from the street.  The menu basically gives the choice of some nice meat and fish courses (salmon was over-the-top!!!) and so far it is the only michelin-starred restaurant serving a burger...  Well we are looking forward to being back soon :)  Greetings to the whole Team

This was our first 1 star of 3 in a long weekend in Paris this easter. Tried to get a table at Epicure this day but was fully booked. Tried 114 instead and not disappointed. Service incredible. Great Paris born Swede as our waiter for the evening. Never missing a beat with wine and water filling, epic quality. Meal I remember most was the guinea fowl. Just fantastically cooked, and I dreamed about it next day. I read people crying about expensive in here, but really it was not more than what you expect for this quality. This is on my "come back to" list. Go and enjoy.  Also have to say. People at the Bristol, epic service. Except the grumpy arrogant waiters at the cocktail bar. You fail so bad at what you are supposed to do.

My partner and I dined here for Valentines Day evening dinner. The booking process was seamless and very efficient. The welcome was exceptionally friendly and the set menu were very well put together. The ambience was intimidate and very chic. The food was great and the taste of each course great. We didn't win anything in the raffle but had a great evening. Each couple left with a rose and chocolates... Most certainly a perfect evening

review_title: Lovely food, nice surroundings, superb service.
review: The title of my review says it all really. Firstly, the food was lovely. My wife and I have pretty similar tastes so we both opted for the ravioli, then shared the wild chicken for two and then had the cheese instead of dessert. All were top quality with a special mention regarding the quality of the chicken; so different to a typical farmed bird. To drink we shared a fabulous bottle of Condrieu Blanc followed by a lovely glass of Burgundy with the cheese.  The surroundings were very pleasant. We sat upstairs. Our table was a little close to the one next door but luckily the rather loud couple left quite swiftly - we're usually the last ones to leave so we weren't in any rush.  What really stood out for us here was the quality of the service. We were looked after from the moment we walked in until our waiter escorted us personally out to our taxi after the meal. When the French get their act together like this they do it better than anyone else. Merci.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: if you want to have dinner at reasonable prices with french neighbors and the possibility to sit outside you are absolutely right here. We had a nice dinner and will definitely return.

review_title: Nice location and great service, but…
review: Nothing special with the food, but excellent service.  We were a party of 5 and had 5 different dishes. No one raved over their food. It was correctly prepared and presented but lacked any real yummm comment.  I appreciated how no matter which waiter was near the table, they all worked together to bring items to diners at all the tables, not just certain ones.  It was a pleasant experience but nothing to write home about.

We booked due to the reviews and it didn’t disappoint. Small restaurant with hands on serves who can help you with the menu. It’s clean, simple and most importantly the food is exceptional. I tried a variety of wine and it’s good to know the menu varies from week to week. Love at first bite. If you are reading this you need to book. Can’t wait to go back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Lovely food. Great pizza and amazing desserts!
review: I am hard to please, the food served here did! Pizza was very nice indeed, worth the price and its Paris after all. Selection is great, everyone will find a great choice. The slightly smaller Kids Pizza came in the shape of a rabbit face, very nicely done and our little one loved it.  We also had a mixed board to start. Which was excellent and very generous.  Desserts - absolutely top! Tiramisu one of the best ones I had, the Panna Cotta absolutely amazing.  Mind you, it’s a loud, crowded and casual place. Seatings very tight and you get close with your neighbours. So much so that the guests next to us offered a small slice of pizza from their fresh plate for us to try.  Service: Friendly and efficient. Just the way you want it!

First of all i have to say that the food was really good and tasty and the service was great. But the restaurant is really small!!!! And they have placed one table right next to the other. It is really difficult to feel comfortable. We had booked for 4 people and i thanked God that we were a family with 2 kids.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover
review: This is a cosy and friendly restaurant with excellent service! The food, truffles based raviolis were excellent. I enjoyed the thé gourmand with a selection of three desserts. I would happily come back at this restaurant.

Located in Quartier Latin this restaurant has one feature that all good restaurants in Paris have: small tables and limited space. However, it is great what they serve! We had antipasti and pizza. Both was great. Service was friendly and competent. For sure we will come back.

I can't believe this place was just downstairs to the right of our building. The service is top notch, friendly, and quick. I didn't eat there, I only went and ordered my pizzas and they were prepared in front of my eyes and ready in 10 minutes. The crust and ingredients were superbly delicious and fresh, The ambience was nice, it was always full. The drinks seemed to be good too. Highly recommended! Did I mention the prices? a pizza for 2 only ~15EU?
We booked and we're glad we did, by 8pm place was full. Authentic Italian food, we had starters, pizzas and a bottle of montepulicianno. John had a lemon hello. Good value. We'll be back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: We ordered a pizza quarto and got a pizza with the four individual toppings (mushroom, artichoke, ham, olives) concentrated in each quarter of the pizza. That was weird. We had to redistribute the toppings ourselves to get what we wanted.  The pizza was tasty but the dough was very thin and didn't hold up under the toppings. This a pizza that requires a knife and fork.  Why were we brought a basket of foccacia with the pizza instead of before, to munch on while we were waiting?  The caprese salad consisted of a lot of cut up cherry tomatoes and a big hunk of mozzarella cheese resting on a bed of arugula. It needed balsamic vinegar.  We went because it was so highly rated but I was unimpressed.  The servers are very pleasant. Perhaps they were understaffed the night we went because there were definitely not enough people handling the front of the house.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Boutary is an exceptional experience. The food and service are top notch. The caviar tasting is unique and the cocktail and wine menu a pleasant surprise. Tuck in for a lovely evening!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Luxury Traveler
review: The best of the best in the 6th. Service and cuisine a 10!!! Frederic welcomed us w caviar and champagne……and the evening got better and better. Could be our new favorite restaurant in Paris. Michelin star experience without the attitude and price tag. Bravo Boutary.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: We had a wonderful evening at Boutary. Very friendly and attentive staff and the carte blanche tasting menu was perfect. We will come back!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We went here because we were late to book some other restaurants while staying in Paris. So we did not expect much. But then we got all and even more. Small place with just the right decor and really excellent staff. We did not go for the caviar tasting menu that is a signature of this restaurant but got caviar with the second entree. Very good. But also all other dishes from the tasting menu were lovely balanced in taste and imaginative as well.

review_title: Rightfully one of the best Paris restaurant
review: Room is not clogged with tables, you will have your personal space. We visited Boutary for lunch and it was an excellent experience. (Check pics AngeloB971), buttersquash soup with lobster ravioli, caviar from their own Bulgarian farm, wild seabass, roasted duck leg with black garlic (in house made), desserts 2 to choose from; tangerine or chocolate, either way you can not miss. Very plesant and professional staff, moderate prices. Worth to visit while in Paris, dinner time reservation is a must.

We booed after reading the good reviews on TripAdvisor. We weren’t disappointed. The place is a bit old fashioned. The main place is not too big but it has additional space at the back and maybe upstairs. The gentleman who served us was very kind. He spoke with us from time to time and made us feel welcome. We took the tasting menu, which was excellent. We needed some adjustments with the food, which wasn’t a problem. The food and deserts were delicious. Together with a very nice bottle of Burgundy, we paid 240 Euros for two people. We will return!

There are two or maybe three very obvious critical success factors for an excellent restaurant:  1. Excellent food 2. Excellent service 3. Pleasant surroundings/atmosphere  And I am very pleased to say that the Boutary excels in both the food and service in what can be described as a warm and cosy surrounding. In fact, it has been quite some time since I have experienced such a high standard of service coupled with a an exceptional good meal.  Caviar is obviously well represented on the menu and if you like caviar, I can certainly recommend it as you will not be disappointed. The caviar is exceptional as either a taster or within the menu where it is an integral part of the meal.  For those that enjoy caviar, you will appreciate the difference between what is typically a more production style caviar to something that is far more refined and as such far more pleasurable for the pallet.  While the restaurant is not inexpensive for Paris, the price is certainly in line with both the exceptional food and service - well done !  Would I return ? Can't wait !
Everything is wonderful here. Second visit for us, even bigger group. Everyone loved it. See you next year :)

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review: Reading about this restaurant made me wanted to dine there , therefore we decided to go . A cheerful welcome was already a good sign . They seated us upstairs where we appreciated the decor all done around black red and white with an interesting illumination. The menu offers different choices from a degustation menu that involves also different wines from menu a la carte . We decided for a la carte and a bottle of Sancerre 2016 . But first We could not renounce to the temptation of tasting some beluga caviar which was excellent . The wine was excellent although it never reached the perfect temperature . My first course was bonito in tataki sauce which was delicious except for the chipped dish in which it was served . As a main course I choose a turbot with artichokes cooked in 3 ways, clams and a symphony of tastes that were exquisite . We were extremely pleased also with the perfect service and by meeting the creative chef .A place worth to return .

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Terrific Dinner in St Germain de Pres
review: Terrific set meal with wine pairings. Didn't realize they specialized in caviar -- and haven't like it before -- but one of the dishes in the meal had it and it was the first time I enjoyed it. Service was excellent and meal very enjoyable with a nice mix of dishes. Highly recommend.

review_title: Excellent food, friendly staff, beautiful decor
review: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at le boutary. We were both very impressed. I highly recommend this restaurant. It was pricey but so worth it.

Visited for my husband’s 50th birthday. Exquisite food, beautifully presented with excellent service. We went for the 5 course taster menu, and added the caviar to start (one Beluga, one not for comparison) with the premium paired wines. Worth splashing for the extras. Our waiter was so knowledgeable about the caviar, food and wine and made it a really special occasion for us. The whole experience was extraordinary, one of our most memorable ever meals. Go for the taster menu and wines and put your trust in the extraordinary kitchen and front-of-house staff, you won’t regret it.

What a fantastic restaurant, worthy of its place in the Michelin guide. Tucked away in the trendy Marais district of Paris, not too far from Notre Dame cathedral, surrounded by many independent shops and galleries, it is a small red fronted building which doesn’t look much from the outside. However, the food is nothing like the understated exterior. They offer either a 5 course tasting menu or a la Carter, and they seem to specialise in various types of caviar. The tasting menu was a real wow, specialising in classic French dishes with a a twist. Foie Gras with mussels, smoked potato with caviar, fresh pollock with cream sauce and fantastic duck with girolles and pumpkin. Dessert of pears with ginger was one of the best I’ve ever tasted. Service was impeccable - friendly, efficient and very knowledgable. If you in Paris, you should definitely make a trip to Boutary.
We were a large group (10) and we had a tasting menu with wine pairing. Everything was very good. We will come again.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Business dinner.... with new colleagues! Hard to find this place but....it’s amazing and gorgeous! The service, the welcoming...the way to present the food! I’ll come back here again soon!!!
I enjoyed most. This is the best place. I liked food and also the service was great. I highly recommend. The Dishes come out very perfectly and decorative.

review_title: Great restaurant with an interesting experience!
review: We took the 5 course taster menu and it definitely did not disappoint! Each plate that came out was more interesting than the first! Not only was the food presented beautifully but each dish came with a show! I would highly recommend this place if you enjoy trying new culinary delights and tasting delicious pairings of wine!

review_title: A great experience, believe the hype!
review: We visited a few weeks ago on a Sunday. The service was second to none and the portions were huge. This is Poni restaurants newer and brighter sister but they both have a unique offering and laid back crowd. I love how all the staff speak English, that’s a real bonus for me as I try to learn French. The food was brilliant and the menu is similar to Poni bare a couple of dishes. Would go back and higher recommend dining here on your next trip to Paris

We had a fantastic evening at this restaurant. The waiter is a real character, super helpful and fun although I couldn’t understand everything he said. I tried snails for the first time and really enjoyed them. I had lamb navarin for my main; the meat was so tender and the fresh spring vegetables were perfect. DH started with pickled octopus and had swordfish for his main; he enjoyed both. We both finished with apple tart which was just ok. It is a very small restaurant so make sure you book.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Went there as it was close to our hotel. The place was full but it is also very small so not a lot of room to fill aniway.  The waiter was friendly in a French kind of way, ok for us but can get annoying.  We were recommended some dishes and despite the quality of the ingredients, the flavors just didn't work out well together. The crab starter has a horrible gelatin and the fish eggs didn't taste anything. My main dish was ok (slow roasted meat) but the fish had a very strong sauce. The "light" deserted was e regular mango mousse, not good or bad.  At almost 50EUR a head I would expect much more for a neighborhood small restaurant. I personally had much better meals in Paris, with also well chosen ingredients and much better execution.  If you like strong dishes and are in the neighborhood there is no harm in trying, for us it wasn't a smart choice.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review: Close to Rue Daguerre (very food shops), the place is managed by a friendly couple. Small restaurant of about 20 seats that takes reservations. Short menu of good products well prepared. Generous portions at a reasonable price (lunch menu at 30 euros, for dinner count between 40 and 50)

review_title: A place to remind for future trips
review: Menu is surprisingly well presented and with a good choice. Wine properly suggested with dishes and Sancerre rouge was great. Good service and prices correct.

review_title: Fantastic food and worthy of the praise
review: I had to take my little boy with me as Daddy bailed. The staff were so accommodating!! And lovely to him. He watched his IPAD nicely as I sampled the delights. My battery died so they charged my phone and I missed getting a pic of the mains but the portion sizes are huge. May sure you so here or to the sister Resturant. Throughly impressed and can’t wait to go back.
the place was comfy and small the waiter was extremely kind, he answered our questions scine the menu in french and theodont have an english menu the food portions were very good

For some reason I expected to find asian dishes (like ramen and gyozas) but it is mostly a burger venue. But a great one, maybe best chicken burger ever, with great asian twist. Interesting options in the menu, might stop by here again....
The food was absolutely delicious. Not a dingle Thing we tried was not worth the money. It was a Really nice discovery. The staff was very friendly as well. Recommended.

We loved our experience at Baoli Bao. The burgers are so unique. The buns are great. Everything we tried was delicious. Please go here and explore the creativity of their menu. The service was quick and kind.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: OMG I don't know what to say. I've been here three times, twice with friends and tonight alone... this place is simply unbelievable. I don't usually eat pasta - in fact it's very rare - but I've done so 3 times in 2 months here. It is... absolutely... sublime. Every time I seem to get lucky and get a "today only" pasta dish (though the very nice waiter said this one might stay) - it leaves me crying - why remove such amazing dishes! The previous time they had these incredible twirly pasta I had never seen before - custom made for them apparently - which gently caressed the unbelievable tomato sauce... if tonight had not actually been better I don't know... I'd have to demand the old pasta back. And then there's the octopus... I had tried their salad before, amazing octopus salad, and today was surprised that there was a different octopus. Brocolli - which I hate - and greek yogurt, with grilled octopus. Hate brocolli? OMG no! It was incredible! The octopus too of course... OK I'm rambling. The place was sold out and they graciously let me sit anyway... the other three large tables were devouring the food. Do not pass this place up. I'm making sure I'm back in 2 weeks.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Nicely decorated restaurant with very friendly staff. The menu is small and offers only fresh ingredients, related to the season. Starters, pasta and desserts that all sounds delicious, at affordable prices. We had poulpe and arancini, gnocchi and ravioli accompanied by some good wine and we loved it. Make sure to reserve a table. We will definitely come back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review: Domenico’s is a nice change of pace restaurant in a cool neighborhood in Paris in the 9th district. The staff ensured we were sat early as we had a show to attend. The meal was good Italian food with the only slight negative being a limited menu. Pasta dishes were plentiful. The truffle pasta is highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local
review: This was a truly special meal. When coming to restaurant of this type, I would highly suggest just going with it. Take the meal as the chef intends the experience to be and make sure to absolutely add the wine pairings. The flavors of the perfectly chosen wines are essential to the full experience and appreciation of the complex flavors. We have had meals of this type several times but this was definitely one of the best. The intricacy of the preparation to pair multiple different types of ingredients (sometimes ones you would not think would go together) to get a specific flavor or texture is truly amazing. I can’t really cook much of anything so this of course is even more special for me – as I LOVE to eat great food. Only 20 seats in this compact and quaint place so make sure you book well in advance if you want this experience. The staff was wonderful and the evening was perfect – especially since it was our 25th anniversary.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Lovely restaurant to celebrate a special day
review: For my wife's 30th birthday we made a reservation at Aspic. It is a surprise menu with 5-7 courses I think, and you can choose if you want wine paring with the dishes or not. We went for it and didn't regret it. The food was delicious, and the combination of tastes was unbelievable. The wines went perfectly with everything. The staff was very nice, explaining every dish and even the chef came out sometimes to explain the dishes and talk to us. All in all, a lovely experience which we would definitely try again.

review_title: Cozy restaurant with fantastic tasting menu
review: Thoroughly enjoyed the tasting menu on a recent trip to Paris. Had a great meal with my wife and this was her favorite meal of the trip. They did very well with the wine pairings. And to top it off, the chef came by the table at the end of the meal to talk and thank us for coming at the end of the meal. Highly recommend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review: The best meal we had on this trip to Paris was at ASPIC. All four of us ate the tasting menu which was well balanced and beautifully crafted. The wine pairing was outstanding. The staff were friendly and informative. Highly recommended for anyone in Paris.

Simply wonderful. Don’t be put off by first impressions; the skill and passion that goes into each dish is amazing, the care that goes into in the sourcing of ingredients is obvious, and the wine pairing (it is absolutely worth taking this) is stunning.  We genuinely had one of the best meals that we have ever had in Paris, and have every intention of returning at our next trip.  Important you go with the flow; there is no menu - you just take what is placed in front of you (don’t worry- they ask about allergies etc first!) and expect to be surprised and delighted by the unexpected combinations and flavours. Nothing is quite what you expect. Some of the bigger dishes exude unusual flavours from unexpected combinations, and some of the single-mouthful courses are simply a delight.  Book now!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker
review_title: Absolutely fabulous food in small, friendly and cool setting!
review: Were here on a Saturday evening in May. Set menu including wine menu. Wonderful high quality food! Modern experimental yet down to earth in a very positive way. Room for around 20 people. Only set menus and quite fixed starting time. Really friendly and fun staff. Laid back yet with high attention to detail. Great value for money, the food was 69 euros/menu and the wine 38 euros/menu. Book well in advance!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I read the reviews and was still a bot skeptical, but count me as a believer. We had a lovely multi-course meal with wine pairings that was both creative and well-presented. Very warm and friendly service. Yes, you don't have a say here as to the food presented, but it is well worth the risk and detour. We intended to go to Montmartre anyway, and this is just a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Sacre Coeur. Heartily recommend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Our 2nd to last dinner in Paris and the best experience we've had on our entire trip.  At this small 10 table restaurant off the beaten path you have to: have reservations a month out and be somewhat adventurous because there is no menu whatsoever.  If you have any food allergies you tell them and from that point on, you're off on a fantastic trip. You have no idea what you are going to be served.  The menu changes by what is in season. All the dishes were out of the ordinary. The sauces, the presentation, the subtle flavors in each one were amazing and different.  I won't try to describe each dish but we had ingredients from exotic mushrooms to quail, from fish ( pollock ? ) to fresh grapes & tomato. It's a 7 course menu but we counted at least 9.  Expensive - yes - about 200 euro with the 4 wine tasting for both of us.  Every table was taken and we can see why.

After our first visit last year, we went back to this amazing restaurant this time with some friends, the service has improve greatly and the food keeps getting more surprising and innovative, i really think that a michelin star is due to this incredible place, unfortunately we won't be coming back next year but i hope to be back in 2020 and to see the evolution of a really talented chef.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: What a wonderful find. Great food, lovely people!
review: We had read some of the reviews and some were not so favorable so we went with a little trepidation. No need to be concerned at all and possibly in 6 weeks of travelling this was certainly one of the best experiences we had at a mid range price. Firstly the chef, the host and the server, were extremely warm and friendly people who could not do enough for you to make this a really exceptional experience. I can't possibly remember each course and they did come quickly although at the right time, other reviews said they felt rushed, this was not our experience at all and we found that each course was paced perfectly. I ate things I had never eaten before and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. As always there are a few things that could make the experience one notch higher. The restaurant is small and it was hot, we suggest LED bulbs and the owner did turn the lights down a little later in the evening. It is also a little noisy when you get that person who wants to tell everyone their news. Because the restaurant has hard surfaces, brick wall, high ceilings the noise bounces, so some soft sound absorbent panels hung from the ceiling horizontally might help with that. I hope this restaurant survives, it is a tough market but we thought they were doing everything right and I would definitely return next time I am in Paris.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: A great 25th anniversary dinner at #Aspic #paris. So much delicious seasonal food, but the warmth and hospitality are what made it for me! From the moment we walked in, they wanted nothing more than our absolute comfort! Paris, j'adore!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Delicious dinner in a relax environment
review: The very good reviews on Tripadvisor was at the basis for our visit. Booking in advance is a must which we did (1 month in advance is possible). The 7-course dinner is overall delicious. We would have preferred to have at the table a menu so that we know what we were eating. The price is very reasonable (65 €). We also took the acoompanying wines (35 €), which one can taste first and if not OK, you can have another wine. Overall, the wines were very nice. To summarise, this was a very good experience and for Paris standards, a very good value for money.

After several attempts we have succeded to make a reservation in this restaurant, which is in th 9th Arr of Paris in a small side road - not easy to find a parking. Reception was warm and we could chose our table - after seating we immediately got our starters. We chose the Chef's menu with all surprises and with a glass of wine to go with each plate - good choice. A lot of surprising tastes, which were very special and enjoyable. Service was very good. In any case, we promised to come back another day, which we certainly will.

Aspic was by far one of the best meals of my life and it was the perfect way to celebrate my boyfriend's 23rd birthday in Paris. Everything from the service, to the wine pairings, to the food was spectacular. It is so good that I am changing my travel plans in March to stop in Paris just so that I can go back to Aspic!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: Went for my wife's birthday, as one of many culinary experiences over 5 days and this was surely one of the best. Food was great, with the pollock and especially the quail being the highlights. On the downside, the fish carpaccio wasn't as exciting as the one we - incidentally - had at Ze Kitchen Galerie for lunch. Also, while it says the menu is 7 courses, it is worth noting the first course is really an amuse bouche, while the last just petit four. Wine selection was excellent and good value at €30. Service was good, although our waiter seemed to try too hard (i.e. hyping the courses and experience a bit too much) and did a bit of an embarrassing faux pas at the start of the meal - clearly not intended, but still not a great way for my wife to start her birthday dinner...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: The food is close to perfect in this restaurant no matter the taste or the layout of the setting. Even the choice of wine is fantastic. We are amazed by the quality of food, wine and service. Wonderful night for mid-autumn festival, indeed.

I visited this restaurant in june of this year Even though the sous chef had a problem they honor my reservation and the service was incredible this small place with limited seating (in my experience this has the advantage of more intimate meal and it forces the chef to make every dish special) the food is full of creativity and the tasting menu has the best quality price relation in paris. this is a well balanced menu and you don't end up hungry or excessively full.  The chef was super nice and when i wanted to know the name of and ingredient he tipped for me in my phone.  we tried to come back before leaving paris and it wasn't posible fully booked for the week so this restaurant is a new reason to comeback in 2018. i hope this restaurant continues to evolve and gain the recognition it deserves i can see a michelin star approaching

review_title: top food for a bargain price
review: ASPIC may not be at equal height with a real three star restaurant, but for this price I've eaten much worse in real one star restaurants. Also one of the few places in Paris we've found that actually offers a decent choice of premium gins, while in Belgium even the most modest 'brasserie' has a couple of gins to choose from. The maitre does an excellent job and the paired wines were excellent. We paid €100 each for a gin and tonic, the menu with paired wines and a cognac. That is great value for food this good.

If you are American (as am I), I advise you to just relax and enjoy. The chef prepares wonderful dishes - subtle flavors, beautiful presentations. The matre d' covers the entire (small) floor, but he knows what he is doing and pairs wine well. I do recommend going with the wine pairing. So just relax, enjoy the meal, it should take a while because it is wort it.

review_title: Great experience at a reasonable price
review: We made a reservation at Aspic solely based on the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed.  As others have mentioned this is a fixed menu only type of restaurants so you need to be flexible but what came out of the kitchen on the night we were there did not disappoint one bit. What was interesting is that unlike many of the other restaurants we went to during our trip to France, Aspic offered a wine pairing with the meal which was quite nice and added an extra layer to the experience.  Service was overall good but you need to go into this with the right expectation that this is a lean operation. As far as I could tell there was the chef in the kitchen and one waitress for about 12 tables. It didn't feel slow or anything but it wasn't "high touch" either.  Overall we were pleasantly surprised with the experience. When the check came in, we were even more surprised at how affordable this experience was. Given the quality and creativity, I don't think it's going to stay this way for long so you better go and enjoy it!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This was my favorite meal in Paris! The courses were perfectly sized and very well balanced. The restaurant was so beautiful inside as well!

review_title: Best Dining Experience we had in Paris, it really is a Little Gem!
review: Out of our 5 days we spent in Paris, this was the best meal/experience we had by far. It was such a great find by my boyfriend, who wanted to take me somewhere special for my birthday on January 4th and had booked it from trawling through TripAdvisor, not that he had to trawl far. This little restaurant is so quaint and delightful, it has so much charm, from the place itself to the waitresses and chef who all severed us at one point. A little music (or a tad louder) would have only added to the lovely ambiance. To start we had a gin cocktail as an aperitif whilst we perused over the wine menu. We were then given cured meat, bread and home made butter - this butter was to die for.
