We selected a bottle of wine (all great prices compared to other restaurants) and soon after our dishes began arriving one by one. I can't actually remember what was in every single one but I do know they were all delicious! The octopus was so tender, the fish lovely and light, the beef was so flavoursome, the little onion thing was amazingly tasty (how did you make an onion taste like that?), the dessert was nice but I would have preferred something a little lighter. I did get a candle in my dessert which was really sweet, my boyfriend couldn't remember mentioning that is was my birthday. We thoroughly enjoyed every last bite. The waitress was so lovely and friendly, we also figured out it was the chef who served us also which we loved. You could see their passion for food when they served us each dish and told us all the components.  I love tasting menus, they are my favourite, especially surprise ones! You are always watching and listening to see what the person opposite you is getting so you know what to expect. This is also amazingly great value for money, at only 49 euros each. Leave about 2-2.5 hours to enjoy the experience. An absolute dream, thank you so much Aspic for the best birthday! We went on to the Moulin Rouge afterwards, which is only 5 minutes away in a taxi.

Unknown to us but read reports & wow, did this restaurant meet expectations. Feel honoured to have visited as this place & chef will become famous. Of the 7 "surprise" courses my favourite was the slow cooked in orange, mackerel, skin torched, dried orange zest, plum chutney with mustard crisps - truly amazing. My husband's favourite was roasted merlu (described as like turbot so I thought it was plaice, not hake - in dark butter, tiny cockles, fried capers with broccoli purée- I could give you more but NO you too MUST visit. All courses are small so no over-facing but all customers on that evening, have the same menu so great for foodies not faddies! Thank you Chef, superb.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: One of our best meals in Paris
review: Our dinner at Aspic was one of our best meals in Paris. The space is intimate--probably holds about 30 guests--and has clean, simple lines. The only option is a pre-determined tasting menu, with the chef asking about any food allergies or dislikes when the reservation is secured. Our meal included 7 or 8 courses, with 3 of fish. The food was meticulously prepared and beautifully presented, but more importantly, many of the courses qualified as sublime. There were no misses. The price is beyond reasonable. They have an amazing selection of gins from France. We tried several G&Ts to start and loved the more floral one.

review_title: Wonderful Food Corner in Saint Quentin Market
review: Discovered this by chance and went for the veggie burger as the fast and affordable option, with a side of grenaille potatoes. The burger patty was made up of quinoa, bulgur and lentils, and literally oozed into a delicious sea of grain when cut into. Perfect balance with the sauce, cheese, salad and sesame bun. The potatoes where a luxury not needed, the complimentary cranberry walnut bread was more than enough. Friendly, helpful owner and staff, very good English spoken. Worth the detour!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Foodie;Like a Local
review: A very enjoyable and plentiful meal. I took a 3-course lunch menu. I chose mushroom veloute, fish with vegetables and a pear dessert. The mushroom soup was wonderful, really great flavour and beautiful presentation. The fish - very tender and nicely crisped. The fennel and other vegetables were a nice contrast to the soup. I was quite full before dessert but it was pretty and not too big, likewise a good balance of sweeter cooked fruit and fresh fruit, together with a black sesame crispy cookie. Delicious Japanese tea and nice decor. Friendly and efficient service. Also got to chat with the chef - lovely!

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Delicious and definitely a very good value.
review: As a rule of thumb, we don't comment on eateries, as it all depends on taste and expectations, but sometimes, we just can't stay put. If you are looking for a good value restaurant in this extremely busy area, Bistrot Kinzo is worth a visit. Dishes are just good, with a light hint of japanese touch. 3 course lunch at 29 euros. It's a steal. The Chef's enthusiasm is also something to be praised.

review_title: Excellent japanese twist on all dishes
review: Excellent restaurant in a quite street. Tables inside and outdoor. We took the menu degustation which was really excellent. The japanese touch on all dishes was so good. Very nice and polite service. We will surely come back. Good wine list too!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: A nice Italian restaurant with great service. I am not sure if you need a reservation, it is a small place, but we just went in there. Great food and wine list. The spagetti vongole was very good.

The food and the owner at this place was great. Had a good lasagne. However it was clear that the waitresses was inexperienced and made the meal a little confusing. Was offered a free limoncello after dinner.

Perfect break after two nights of French cuisine. My family and I found it on Trip Advisor and we’re not surprised it was among the top rated restaurants in Paris. The owners are Neapolitan and aim to please. The salads and tomatoes were fresh and delicious. The bruschetta was toasted to perfection. The buffala mozzarella was excellent. The linguini vongole was as good as in Naples. And the Montepulciano D’Abruzzo was among the best I’ve ever had for 32€. It was clearly a private selection. We would have loved to have dessert but were too full so had to settle for an amaro on the house. Grazie mille Terra Mia.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: After a long, rainy day of sightseeing, we wanted comfort food close to our hotel. This place was perfect. Marco made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in the door. We got seated right before a large party came in, so there was a fun atmosphere as we enjoyed our food and wine (we got a small bottle of the red wine of the month, which was just the right size to share for two). We started with the bruschetta di buffala, which was drizzled with a delicious olive oil. We each got a pasta dish and both were delicious. After our meal, we decided to linger over dessert and coffee. The homemade tiramisu came in three flavors— cafe, pistachio, and Nutella. We had a pistachio and a Nutella and enjoyed them with espresso. Marco offered us a limoncello after we finished, which was a nice finale to a wonderful dinner. We would highly recommend that you get there early or make a reservation — the place was very busy. I think you could choose anything from the menu and have a wonderful meal.
Excellent food and excellent service. Steak perfectly cooked. Dessert was perfect..... 100% recommended. Best meal in Siem Reap.

I think this is the best service I’ve ever had in any restaurant anywhere in the world, the steak was delicious, presentation was five star, the staff were wonderful, it’s not cheap at all, this is a very expensive restaurant for southeast Asia, once in a while you have to treat yourself

A lovely fresh, fine dining restaurant close to many hotels on the main drag. A decent sized menu with some premium cuts of steak on offer. The staff were formal, polite, attentive and the food was great! Price - very high for food and wine compared to other restaurants locally; but if you’re looking for something special then go for it, I’d not put you off!!
Our second time dining at this wonderful restaurant. A truly memorable experience from start to finish. Great food, amazing service - the staff are the best we have encountered during our travels.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Great Service, Average Food, Fantastic Juices!
review: We dined here for dinner on our first evening in Siem Reap. Unfortunately, the dish wrapped in bacon, the main course, was way overcooked. The meat was tough. Very tasty though. The juices were the most enjoyable part of the dining experience, oh, and the gluten-free coconut ice cream.  Overall, decent. Really bummed to have not had the outstanding experience that others had. Maybe we were just too early and the kitchen wasn't prepared. Bummer.

review_title: Excellent restaurant, nice interior, great service but totally overprized
review: The food was good, the service was perfect, plates looked great, interior was very nice, seats were comfortable, but because of the extreme pricing, I can't give more the 4* It's just to expensive compared to othere good restaurants in Siem Reap.

Where to have your Christmas dinner when you are alone in Siem Reap for business? Although I did not stay at Le Lotus Blanc Hotel, I decided to book my Christmas dinner at the Damrak Steakhouse as I had a good experience at this hotel. When I was looking for the bar some days earlier a lady staff member accompanied me all the way to the other building to show me where the bar was. Since that time I made it my favorite stop for the happy hour. The steakhouse is not what we call a steakhouse in Europe. In Europe a steakhouse is a popular restaurant serving beef but here it’s a fine dining place with very attentive and friendly staff. Fantastic refined food and good wines and a beautiful decor. They certainly made my evening. No doubt that they serve their good ranking on TripAdvisor

review_title: Outstanding food with service to match
review: Took my wife to this restaurant tonight as recommended by the hotel (Lotus Blanc) I must say we had the most amazing experience, the staff were all superb, particularly Kia, and the food (we had the connoisseur menu) was out of this world, it was accompanied by wine, which for the price was very good value. I Can’t recommend highly enough, don’t let the name steak house fool you, this restaurant caters for a range of customers and if you want a special treat, this is the place to go.  I would dress up a little to enjoy it more!! Francis & Jill, from Scotland
I wanted to treat myself to a nice dinner after a long day of travel and Damnak didn't disappoint. The food was absolutely delicious and the staff were so friendly and attentive. Thank you!

We had dinner in the hotel restaurant. We were excited and expectations where high. We had a set menu. As my daughter needs to eat gluten free (always a challenge here in Asia) we hoped for the best. It as great, really great. Things she couldn’t eat where taken out and there was Gluten-free bread.  The goose liver pate was great. Soft and tasteful. The lobster soup was light, the meat and fish cooked to perfection and deserts were a treat. This place can compete with the top restaurants in Europe (and I have been to many good places). According to my sister who lives in Siem Reap the best meal she had in town.  So if you want fine dining at top level. With real high quality food and service. This is the place to go.  Yes a bit more expensive but we all know quality has it price, and here it is worth it.
great restaurant fantastic service great food highly recommeded we choose the wine option which was a great chose as the wine was australian

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;60+ Traveler
review_title: Great steak house and awesome service
review: Warmly welcome by staff and manager . Your steak house here is your first joy.  From A-Z nice experience , so we really enjoy our wedding anniversary here.  However , if you looking for resent-able price here is not for you.  If you looking for fine dinning of steak house this restaurant is your first joy.  Thank you well done and ambience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We just wanted a quick bite after a busy morning and since this was next to our hotel, we decided to give it a try. Wow, a pleasant and delicious surprise. Small plates were perfectly what we wanted, but of course I order an extra because I'm hangry. Yummy all around

This restaurant has a nice garden atmosphere, complementing good food and positive staff.  The spring rolls I had were very tasty.  The only thing I'd note about this place is that the menu is quite limited. They focus on spring rolls, and I tried the ones I most wanted to try. So, less chance of a return visit than other places.  Reccomended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Loved this place!! You need to visit here
review: Off a little side street ... It felt like we had found a hidden gem! In contrast to pub street Wild is a beautiful leafy courtyard with festoon lights and a great atmosphere! Loved the tongue and cheek menu. Delightful cocktail names and the token option of chips. If you are worried about only having spring rolls as a food option ... Then think again! There are so many different options ... Cover the table, share and tuck in! We had ours with a jug of Pimm's ... Which was delightful! On top of this their sustainability and ethics are great! They support their staff, local community and the planet (see photos for a snippet). Highly recommended!

Lunch with my daughter after a morning of exploring temples. The ambience is zen garden. The staff are wonderful and the food was yummy. Mainly spring rolls, either fried or fresh. We especially liked the cheese and sundries tomato ones. We spent $14 for lunch for two including two beers and consider it very good value.

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: We took a chance to try and make a booking last minute and were lucky. Had an absolutely lovely evening, the food and cocktails were amazing in this little oasis of calm and tranquility in the busy city. Totally worth a stop whilst in Siem Reap.

review_title: What a gem of a restaurant!!
review: What a gem of a restaurant!! Lorraine and Rennaud were the loveliest and most kind owners! Rennaud clearly explained their menu and you could see the passion and love put into each item. It’s a great set up- there are lots of options, you can get fresh or fried. Be sure to order the beef and carmelized onion (drool worthy) and the taco one as well! Both had fabulous flavours and weren’t overly greasy or doughy. The fresh roll we opted for were mama Mia and the Greek getaway. Again both were fantastic- my husband said he’d return to Cambodia just to come back to Wild- that says something! Lastly, the hubby had the chocolate spring rolls. He said they were a grea treat. Take lorraines advice on how to eat them- they’re messy!! In addition to the fabulous food, we paired it with a jug of the refreshing Tamara beverage. One word...YUM! Beyond the food, the service was perfect- staff were very knowledgeable and the venue itself had a great ambiance. We loved the relaxed feel with the tropical vibe. Would return again!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: One of the best restaurants we’ve been!
review: OMG! Please come to Maui and open your restaurant! Loved everything about this place, amazing food and amazing drinks. Above all else, the owners and staff are super friendly and helpful! We’ll be back.
Loving the ambience of the place gave me ideas on how to do my garden out when I get back home in England thank you for the inspiration

review_title: Chilling in a laid back environment
review: Went to have a drink and a snack before dinner, but was taken by the tasty springrolls, the juicy drinks and the basically great vibe. Hence we ended up,staying for a couple of hours feeding springrolls. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: Great for drinks and finger food
review: Great atmosphere, tasty cocktails , friendly service , casual design, amazing spring rolls. But I wish the menu were bigger - it’s more like a tapas bar than a restaurant.

This place knows what it is - an Instagram dream - and they really work it. We arrived just as there were opening at 5 on the dot so were the first in. We watched and within 30 minutes the place was full of tourists like us - people couldn't walk past without being drawn in the front gates. They have a gorgeous garden which has been decorated with fairy lights and which has pallet tables where you feel like you are sat on the lawn. There is a tree house where they supply you with notepaper and pen so you can order and pass it down to the staff. There is the beautiful swinging egg chair and the Instagrammable wall mural.  Most places like this are all style and no substance. Wild however is both!  Their unique concept menu only has a few items of finger foods on offer - a selection of fresh or fried spring rolls and some sides. Each spring roll set comes come with a different dipping sauce to accompany them which enhances the flavours perfectly. The portions are quite generous, you only need order 2 sets of 3 for $3 each per person. I am a veggie and there were plenty of options for me which is always great. My husband is a meat eater and loved his choices too. The food was exceptional - you can really tell they thought about each item on the menu and made sure the flavours balanced and it tasted good.  Same story with the cocktails! Imaginative and tasty.  The French owners have done a fabulous job with everything from the decor to the food and the service. Couldn't fault our visit and can see why this place is so highly rated on Tripadvisor!

Bon et merci,  We had a very nice meal with our son who is working on an assignment in Siem Reap. This was high on his list to take us to. Great tasting Spring Rolls but there were also subtle variations on a popular theme to provide a good meal choice. Two portions of different rolls each plus a bowl of hummus provided a very good meal. Nice rose wine according to my wife was much appreciated after a busy day site seeing. It seems the hosts were the owners and made an effort to ensure all were having a good experience. Last orders 9,30 pm and it is advisable to book.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: Quirky original place, good food and amazing service
review: We really liked this cafe , such laid back place , friendly service and tasty food . Such a simple idea with amazing presentation. It had a choice of both vegetarian and non vegetarian options as well as deserts in spring roll version. Very nice concept !

review_title: Amazing food in a serene setting
review: WILD was one of the first restaurants I visited when I moved to Siem Reap. After the first I visited I was hooked. The spring rolls at WILD are delicious! Along with the traditional fillings they also offer a wide variety of savoury and sweet ones not to mention that their cocktails are amazing! The restaurant itself is a gorgeous place to spend time. The owners have kept the number of tables low for the amount of space they have and the result is well worth it. Be aware if you want to visit on the weekends however, this place is extremely popular and is usually fully booked! I would recommend WILD to anyone looking for a relaxed atmosphere and delicious food.

We visited Wild Creative Bar and Eatery as part of a food tour and stopped here for desert and final drink. What an amazing place. The food and drinks were fantastic and the ambiance perfect. The owners serve everyone with passion and energy and are an amazing couple. Get there early to avoid disappointment as it is small, but don’t miss out on the desert springrolls, they absolutely fantastic. Make time to get to this place. Allow enough time here to just “chill out”.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Best spring rolls I ate for a long time
review: We visited this beautiful bar which serves springrolls only for food. Finger food for share. It is located behind the night market. Better reserve a place. Spring rolls are fresh or fried. We ate fresh spring rolls with the filling of Sezar sald. And fried rolls with caramalized duck, taco and cheese and bazil filling. Cocktails are also very good. Enjoy

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Amazing hidden gem in Siem Reap
review: This place deserves its first place in Siem Reap. Lovely atmosphere, friendly owners and tasty cocktails and spring rolls. The owners developed a lovely concept and pleasant bar where you can have a chilled drink and a fantastic time. Would recommend and come again

review_title: Friendly, great drinks, off the beaten path
review: Great place to chill and have a few fun, tasty drinks. Comfortable and peaceful, wonderful atmosphere. Surprisingly delicious rolls! I saw people get turned away as the night went on, so either go early or make a reservation!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Fantastic friendly service with a relaxed vibe.
review: This place is a great find! With its large open green lawn at the entrance with sprawn with low table and seats, it automatically gave this lush eatery a really relaxed feel. Although there was a sign at the entrance which said they were at full capacity, with a couple of recommendations of places to eat near buy (we love this "support your neighbour concept btw") we thought we'd try our luck anyway. Luckily, a couple was just leaving and the lovely host sat us down straight away. WILD specialises in fresh and fried spring rolls and they were delicious! We washed it down with a jug of their (just as delicious) cocktail. We recommend the TAMARA - lemongrass infused gin with pomegranite liquor, lime and ginger ale. The service was welcoming, friendly and attentive. Loved it!

review_title: Fab cocktails in a nice garden setting
review: The cocktails at Wild are really fab. They don’t do dinner as such but have many different types of spring rolls. So, it’s like tapas. We ordered 5 lots of different spring rolls between the 2 of us and found that to be enough for dinner. We also tried 3 different cocktails, all of which were good. The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.

My family of 4 (two children under 10) visited this restaurant based on hotel recommendation. The food is amazing, the prices are great, and the staff are friendly. We loved it so much I think we ended up eating here 3 times on our trip. Good luck only coming once!

A “training” restaurant that excels in service, food quality, and atmosphere more than most professional restaurants. We had an incredible experience here and enjoyed our khmer curries a lot. And they were able to accommodate my wife, who has celiac disease and can’t eat gluten, by modifying her dish and making sure to avoid cross-contamination. Highly recommend!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We visited Haven twice in our 4 nights in Siem Reap. After our first visit I was determined to go again because not only was our meal delicious but I felt we were supporting such a great cause. It was totally moving to see some of the more experienced staff literally ‘teaching’ some of the newer members of the team how to serve; open wine; take an order etc. The atmosphere was outstanding too and Sara was on duty one night and Paul the other night so we had the opportunity to speak to both of them. What impressive people and what amazing opportunities they are giving young people in Cambodia. We were so impressed. We also loved the food especially the red Khmer curry and the satay. Speaking to Sara moved us greatly as she explained how Haven came to be. We are both teachers so really could see and understand the fundamental change Haven was offering these lovely young people. Thank you so much Haven for being there and so glad we could be a small part of it,

I cannot speak more highly of this restaurant — from its mission, to the service to the food — everything was top notch. Their mission is to train disadvantaged youth to work in the hospitality industry. They have a 16 month training program and support these youth throughout. Our servers were a mix of newer and experienced people. Everyone truly cared that you enjoy what you have, and the atmosphere. We had some outstanding food, including a tofu sate (the peanut sauce was to die for), the pumpkin soup (creamy and rich), the fish with mango salad and bananas in coconut milk (yum!). We ate in the courtyard which was quite charming. Reasonable prices. 5 stars!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We were suspicious of several Siem Reap restaurants with heavily western menus or a fancy website so were delighted to find Haven with a social purpose. The staff are really charming, the local dishes were delicious - but if you’re missing western food they have tasty options. We hadn’t booked and were lucky to get a table as the pretty garden was packed. The owner is charming and the banana in coconut milk is yummy.

Certainly the best food we have eaten in Siem Reap. The ethos of this training restaurant is exceptional, high standards that certainly reflect in the young staff. The food really was the best we have eaten in our 8 days in Siem Reap.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Good for the soul and tastes buds
review: What a great place to eat So polite, service with a real smile Food was excellent and service was speedy Requirements clearly understood and delivered effortlessly

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;60+ Traveler
review: Service was very good, good back up with language when needed. Food was very good a fusion menu with a great mix of flavors. Loved it

review_title: Delicious food, great venue - even better cause
review: It is like a little oasis by a plain street. I stat outside in the beautiful little garden. The food was delicious. My anyways positive experience was taken one step further, since this lovely restaurant does a lot to support adolescents by offering them an educational training (appreticeship) while providing everything they need. Go there!

This is another amazing social profit enterprise. They take in disadvantaged youth. They train, educate, coach and mentor young adults to be self-sustaining and employed in today’s world. They also run a 1st class restaurant with excellent food, ambience and incredible customer service. Thank You for what you do.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Good food and a good cause!
review: Haven provides training for at-risk youth. And they also serve some great Cambodian cuisine. We went with a group of about ten people. Service was great. Excellent curry and fried rice.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Fabulous in every way including the best G&t in town
review: We knew this was a popular restaurant but we had no idea just how popular. We arrived early and they kindly fitted us in on the agreement we finished by 7.30 and we were happy to oblige. The garden setting is lovely and we enjoyed warm hospitality and delicious food. We had vegetable tempura followed by the vegetable Khmer curry and vegan Amok and then chocolate sorbet and chocolate cake. All was simply gorgeous. We could eat here every night. So professional, so delicious, stunningly ng and the added bonus of helping such a worthy cause.

review_title: Eating (too much and too well) for a good cause
review: Wow. We were staying just down the block and after reading the reviews decided to take Haven in for an early dinner. The staff is wonderful. The food is over the top good. “That’s the best chicken satay I’ve ever had.” “The schnitzel is awesome,” and we’ve lived in Germany. “The curry is frickin great, why cant they have a ‘all you can eat menu?’” OK. That wasn’t actually said but I did think it. The deserts were awesome as well. And what the owners/directors are doing for young Cambodians is worthy of your patronage and a healthy tip.

review_title: Best meal we had in Siem Reap!
review: Beautiful people and staff, if you eat out in Siem Reap you must go here but make sure you book! The food is AMAZING and you are supporting a wonderful small enterprise which helps train young people in cooking and helps to give them a wonderful start to a career which if not for Haven, they may never have that chance...
The food was delish, the service was great. We liked the outdoor courtyard a lot. On top of all that, they have a social justice component. You probably need to take a tuk tuk to get there.

They take in disadvantaged youth - train them in life skills, work skills, hospitality management - being servers, cooks , chefs , managers etc. Then trainees are sent out to other hotels for internships and then after graduation they all find jobs in the local Siem Reap hospitality industry. A remarkable process. Train your staff well and they will look after your customers.

review_title: So good we came back... Twice!
review: My partner visited six years ago and raved about Haven, a place with such good food, family staff feel, and Western management, that he took me with him on our visit to Siem Reap. We returned two days later to try more yummy menu items and were sad to leave! Khmer Amok Vegan and Pumpkin burger were our favorites. Local ice coffee and passion fruit spritzer were divine, and served with metal straws, a small detail we appreciated. Paul and Sara were amazing hosts, one on each visit, and were willing to answer all our questions about their Swiss foundation that does amazing practical charity work, in the Swiss-German apprenticeship style. The staff were all extremely helpful and well trained (better than most service we have elsewhere!). Prices are reasonable. Location is tucked away in quiet street a ten minute walk from the Made in Cambodia market. The garden and indoor seating areas were both charming. Thanks again, Paul and Sara, and hopefully see you sooner than six years (in the same location!).

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Foodie;Like a Local
review: We enjoyed our dinner so much that we returned the next day. They have a lot of vegetarian options, my favourite being the pumpkin burger. The atmosphere is very nice, especially the outdoor area. During holidays and weekends I would suggest reserving a seat so you don't get stuck inside.
We went for the vegetarian and chicken amok after reading the reviews and we were not disappointed. It was delicious and tasty. I would recommend a visit for this dish alone.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Excellent! Magazine Worthy! Amazing! Bravo! Brilliant!
review: We had the best meal (gluten-free as well) in Siem Reap at Haven! The food was absolutely superb and the concept--training the locals to help themselves--is brilliant. The service was perfect and the food, oh my stars, the food! Magnificent!  If you're wondering where to dine while in Siem Reap, look no further and secure your reservation as soon as possible. We were so fortunate to have secured a table. Seriously, we speak so highly of this restaurant, even compared to the Embassy.  We had the fresh spring rolls and the pomelo salad, the outstanding beef loc lac, fish soup, and chicken Khmer curry. We had three traditional Cambodian desserts. The loc lac was amazing! Amazing! The Khmer curry was the absolute best of all the places we dined at in Siem Reap. Honestly and truthfully, so amazing. As a matter of fact, while we were fine dining at the Embassy, we were contemplating heading over to Haven after to scoop up a heartier meal. The desserts were delicious and like written online, were not sweet, swimming in coconut milk, and served hot. Everything was a winner and the chef was able to make the fried calamari gluten-free as well.  Danke Schoen for the best meal. So looking forward to dining at Haven on our next visit.  Notes: al fresco dining and not a mosquito in sight.  $65 USD

This restaurant is a dream and a Haven for dis-advantaged youth. Paul and his wife ( owners) started this project in order to provide youth with an opportunity to acquire life, work and employment skills. Youth go through an internship process for a number of months. When they graduate they are hired at local high-end restaurants as they have excellent hospitality skills, knowledge abilities. So, when in Siem Reap you will have to eat , so I ask that you dine at this restaurant support their cause.

A nice and quiet place to eat. Very friendly and helpful staff and excellent food. It's a little bit more expensive than other places, but worth every cent and at the end it is for a good reason. Do not forget to buy a cookbook for your friends at home.

Stopped in for a dinner with our 3 kids last night. Even though they were busy, they found our family a table and we were looked after by the wonderful Samui. The food we ordered was fresh and tasty. The seafood was a little chewy, but it was still good and edible. We enjoyed talking to Samui about her life and university studies. It gave our family an insight in to Khmer culture and way of living. The restaurant has a great vibe and is well priced. Would return if we are in Siem Reap again.

We visited twice during our stay and both were amazing. The food is delicious and really feels home cooked. So welcoming too and remembered we had been the night before even though it was so busy. Great drinks to go with it to. Just go and worth queueing as it goes down quickly.

There was a queue but it was Saturday night at 8. We waited about 15 mins for a table. The menus is extensive and we chose Khmer food and Asian. The chicken spring rolls and satay were lovely and then I had a Pork Amok and my husband had Hot holy basil beef. Both were beautifully presented and delicious. I tried a glass of red wine which was a good house one. I also had room for the banana rolls which were lovely. The staff were attentive and so friendly. A must if you are staying in Siem Reap.

We saw the excellent reviews and thought we would give it a try. Cute little place on a back street away from the hustle and bustle. Friendly young staff, simple menu of local and Thai dishes. We had satay and spring rolls, as everyone said how good they were! Followed by chicken in ginger and a Khmer red curry. All dishes were tasty, but the rice stood out! Not just plain steamed white rice but brown, it made a lovely change. The prices were slightly higher than other places but the ethos is good. I’m not sure if it’s better than the rest as all the food and restaurants we have been to offer great value and similar food. But a nice change

Wonderful food and lovely staff - even going out in the pouring rain to put covers down to stop rain coming into us. We had Mango salad. Fish Amok and banana and chocolate samosas. All of it was fantastic and would highly recommend it. Really fresh and tasty. Very reasonable too, given the quality of food. Lovely to talk to the staff too about Covid and their plans for the future. They look after their staff and shows in the quality of service they provide. Some of the best food we ate in Siem Reap

We came here for lunch on our first day and were a little underwhelmed given the great reviews on Tripadvisor. I had the fish amok which was very salty and my husband had the fresh vegetable rolls which were not very tasty. The meal cost us USD15 altogether with beers which isn’t a lot but you get much better quality food / value at Tevy’s.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: It was nothing else but pure luck that I found this place in some blog post and even though the directions weren't super clear, I managed to have dinner at Sambo shortly after I arrived to Siem Reap. I was bought at the very first second when I was greeted with a large smile. Food was nothing short but excellent. I proudly presented my findings to my travel mates and they also jumped on the bandwagon. We had dinner there almost every night we spent in Siem Reap, tried almost everything from the menu and all dishes turned out to be amazing.  I would return to Sambo without hesitation once I am back to Siem Reap.  the 8.20pm group from table 10. :)

We came in family (2 adults and 2 boys) and this restaurant is really our favorite. A small restaurant so charming, the boss is so lovely, and the quality of the food is "exceptional". A perfect balance of flavors and spices (I took the curry Massamane and my wife the vegetarian rice in a half pineapple ... we touched the paradise !). And the fresh juice for kids were so good ... all this quality for modest prices. SAMBO Khmer & Thai restaurant is an essential restaurant in Siem Reap, just go and test ! Be careful when you try to find the restaurant with PassApp application there is another Sambo restaurant that not exist. The good adress is just close to the night market.

I found this restaurant on TA / the reviews are very good and decided to try one of it’s Khmer stir fry dishes the menu is varied and has Khmer, Thai and some western food choices as well. The chicken stir fry was excellent - lots of fresh veggies and lots of really nice breast of chicken. The sauce was great, thanks - will be back again .

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We had a great lunch here, along with tasty shakes, with massive portion sizes in terms of the massaman curry, enough for two easily. The waitress was really sweet and attentive too.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: What a great experience and great food too. Service was superb and very friendly and accommodating. Tom Yum soup was great!  I’ve traveled Asia for the past 5 years and lived in Thailand for 3 years before moving to Vietnam. It’s hard to find good Thai food outside of Thailand.

review_title: My best meal in Siem Reap
review: A real gem with authentic Thai food with all it’s fresh and spicy flavours. The restaurant is owned and served by wonderful ladies, who make it a point to make a personal connection with the guests. This is not a fancy restaurant, but it’s quiet clean and remarkably good value for the quality of food they serve. Come here for a taste of authentic Thai food in this lovely city and you will be hooked. Please note that you should book ahead as it’s very popular, I had to go without on my second visit as it was full and reservations later that eve as well. The kitchen is small so the food will take its time to be served, but it’s a cool and comfortable place to wait over a beer or a glass of wine.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: After reading the reviews and realized we we close, we b-lined to the restaurant. The location convenient and the venue charming, the star of tje show is the owner- she is the secret sauce! Romantic with good local food, a great place for "date night". Enjoy!

review_title: Dropped in for a fruit smoothie. I bought a banana fruit smoothie for $1.5, to go. It was pretty decent. Free wifi
review: Dropped in for a fruit smoothie. I bought a banana fruit smoothie for $1.5, to go. It was pretty decent. Friendly service. They have free wifi
Had spring rolls for starter and paneang for main. Food plus 2 beers was 6.50$ Great service by this (I assume) family driven restaurant. The kids do their best. I admire theese kind of restaurants.

Very unassuming small place on a side street. Stopped in for lunch when anyplace would do pretty much. Prices are low and quality of food was good in a simple, uncomplicated way. Definitely value for money. Service was iffy. Not a place to travel across town for, but satisfying if you're nearby.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: They offer traditional Khmer food. Everything we order is amazing. The service is good. The place is very clean. Rith service is the best! We reccomend coming to this restaurant when you are in Siem Reap.

One of the best dinners in Siem Reap. Amazing interior, fresh and delicious food and high level of hospitality we had in this place. The portion is not small:)). The cocktail menu is large. So we could recommend this restaurant. Needs reservation.

This restaurant is clearly my favourite in Cambodia and I also find the prices reasonable, for what they offer. They have an amazing variety and each dish is absolutely amazing. The staff and especially our waiter Sros are very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive... He could even tell is about the flowers decorating our table. I hope my wife agrees to visit this restaurant on all 4 nights of our visit in Siem Reap. Do not miss this place

review_title: A m a i z I n g
review: Great diner. Very good quality meat and dishes. Restaurant was lively and my server Sros was spot on. I will be back just for his warm attitude and smile. Thank you.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Great food in a beautiful setting
review: We shred beef Lok Lok, eggplant salad with sesame, Char koheung - fish dish and a beer to wash it down. Service was Ok but the restaurant was slammed with way to many large groups.

Just wanted to thank the staff for their amazing efforts and help for when my boyfriend got ill and dizzy from having overheated under Cambodian sun! We so looked forward to dinner, which was interrupted cos of nausea, I managed to eat one plate sadly my boyfriend didnt feel better so we had to rush home the staff kindly cancelled rest of dinner as well as helped call a tuk tuk!! the food was great, at least the one dish I did have, I would love to return to this great place, we sat on the rooftop overlooking siem reap!!

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Together with 25 other Anglo-Thai Society members, my wife and myself had lunch today at the Sokkhak River Restaurant in Siem Reap.  It is an attractive property with inside and outside seating on two floors. Our Group were allocated a large table on the second floor and both the food and the service were excellent - as indeed was the free WiFi service.  Good also to note that celebrities such as David Beckham have dined there in the past. Well worth a visit.

So many reviews, we had to visit. All confusing really because there is this place plus next door hosts the Sokkhak lounge. Anyway, we went for the local fare and all pretty average really compared to all the other places we had eaten in Siem Reap. Each dish could be best described as stressed and a bit bland. Feedback does suggest though that I am in the minority. Enjoy......

user_tags: Thrill Seeker;60+ Traveler;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We really enjoyed a mixed fruit salad, Spring rolls, crispy sticky rice with minced pork, coconut milk and peanuts with tempura, beef lok lak, and fish amok. Desert too!

I have tried for starter a chicken sallad khmer style and it was smooth and delicious and drank Angkor beer and a lime smoothie. Main course was the local beef tenderloin and it tasted ok but was like a chewing gum so i dont recommend that one, i drank a glas of pinotage from south africa. I do recommend this place a calm and cousy restaurant to relax and enjoy. Roland from Stockholm
Six of us came for lunch whilst on our Wendy Wu tour. The reception was very good, it is very nice internally, we had a fixed course lunch which was delightful, Highly recommended

We visited this restaurant for dinner and after reading the good reviews, our expectations were raised. We found it lacking in atmosphere, despite the attentive service by the staff. Wine was expensive for what it was and the food was mediocre. My starter of prawns and calamari was not particularly inspired and my beef skewers, despite being tasty, just didn't hit the mark. My wife started with an aubergine salad that was doused in dressing and far too much fish sauce and her chicken main course was OK but nothing special. We wouldn't return.

review_title: Two restaurants for the price of one!
review: The Sohhhak River is actually two restaurants, both of which have the same Khmer menu. The one next door is called the Charnery Tree and only serves the Khmer version. Sokkhak River, however, also has a French Fusion menu as well as tables inside with air conditioning, whereas Chanery Tree only has tables outside. As it wax another hot day in Siem Reap I opted to eat insid.  The French menu is really a Western menu offering mostly steaks, seafood and pasta main dishes for around $20-25. The Khmer menu is about half that price and looked much more interesting offering local classics like Amok, Lok Lak as well as the temptingly exotic Grilled Stuffed Frog, but as I was feeling less adventurous I opted for the Tonle Sap Steamed Fish ($11.50); Bar fish fillet with garlic, shallot, basil, spring onion, cashew and lime dressing. To drink with lunch I ordered a glass of the Obikwa Chardonnay from South Africa. Like all the red and white wines by the glass this cost $5.80.  The Chardy was nice - quite a lot of body with pear flavours. An easy drinking cheap and cheerful! The Sokkhak is very comfortable and stylish. There are two red and black display cases filled with small potted tropical plants, statues and other knick knacks that subtly divide the space in two, black tiled floors, contemporary local art on the walls, and dark wood sideboards where the settings are kept. I had a table near one of the windows that looked out onto a narrow breezeway filled with ferns that separated the restaurant from its sister property next door.  My main was delivered quickly and was very good. The fish was tasty and soft, and the sauce tart and flavoursome but not so much as to over power the main ingredient. The cashews added a nice crunch to an otherwise soft-mouthed dish. I think I did a good job matching the wine too as this complemented the dish very well.  I'd had the tasting menu at another high end restart just next door called Malis a couple of nights before which I really liked, but a couple of locals said this place was better. Personally I liked them both, but it's hard to compare the diverse tastes and experience of a degustation against a single dish. However based on the one I tried here today I'd have to call it a tie. I'd really like Chanery Tree/Sokkhak to introduce a tasting plate to their menu as there were a lot of things they do that I'd really like to try - starting, of course, with the stuffed frog

We were tired from touring and very hot and this restaurant was a wonderful, relaxing, cool place to rest our tired feet and enjoy a good meal. The food and service were great; we wish we could have returned to try it at dinner. Staff very friendly and helpful.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We too were part of a large group. Was warned not to get the steak but did and it was excellent. But virtually no one who got Thebes was happy. Fine prices. But the bruschetta was unrecognizable AND many meals were served warm, not hot. This and it's sister restaurant are 3/5 when there are MUCH better options.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: The restaurant is very nice and the service is friendly. The food is really great! We were a large group of 20+. They couldn't seem to handle our volume and variety of drink orders and this was pretty slow going. Food service was spot on and fabulous. Atmosphere of the restaurant is really nice. All in all, good place to eat in Siem Reap.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Don’t waste your money here. Go get a good steak somewhere else. At almost $20, the premium beef is very average. It is sliced extremely thinly. You spend half of your time cooking. Seafood is frozen. Mosquitoes inside.

review_title: Minimalistic effort in the kitchen and decrease in general
review: This used to be my favourite restaurant in Cambodia but the service and food have decreased with the fame of this place. I booked a table online 1.5 days in advance and the one nice table, in front, outside which I asked for, when walking in, the waiter told me that there was a bad smell at this table and I should either sit inside or out the back, which is not nearly as nice as the seats out front. At one stage we were told that our main dishes would be out in 3 minutes... They arrived 15 minutes later. I ordered the chicken with spicy basil and asked them to cook the dish extra spicy. What they did is cook the dish as usual and put a spoon full of fresh, chopped chillies on top of the dish, why would a good cook do something so minimalistic? They offer no complementary water... many other restaurants do, you can order a 1.5 liter bottle of local water (not carbonated) for $4.50 which is outrageous for Cambodia.
Everything and everyone was A+. Great menu, cocktails, service, ambience. Centrally located. Must add to your itinerary.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: What a superb restaurant. We went there 3 Times in 9 days. Everytime a very efficient and friendly welcome. Every time a very fresh and tasty cuisine. We have tried the stuffed frogs legs absolutely délicieuse! Such a great flavour ! Beef lok lak to die for, éventa basic grilled chicken was tasty and soft. Wine Perfect and service elegant and efficient. Thank you so much !  Sur 9 jours nous y sommes retournés 3 fois pour dîner. Décor végétal agréable et tables au calme soit au jardin soit en salle climatisée. Nous avons pris des cuisses de grenouilles farcies délicieuses, un bœuf lok lak a se pâmer et même le simple poulet rôti était parfumé et moelleux ! Délicieux ! Le tout avec un accueil et un service impeccable et très aimable. Bravo !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Local cuisine in a nice setting and convenient location
review: We took our dinner at Chanrey Tree at tye recommendation of the hotel we are staying out. It was located close to where we were based. The service is kind and welcoming - perhaps a little over attentive with it all happening quite fast. The food covered a broad selection of local cuisine which was nice but not outstanding. Seats in the front garden area offer a lovely experience surrounded by the gardens with the buzz of the street not far to watch the world go by.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Trendsetter
review: A great dinner experience, attractive location, great interiour fitout, vast selection of food and great service. Can recommend fish amok here.

We were guests of a local company when we visited this restaurant earlier this week. We ate the most amazing food and we’re served by delightful, professional and courteous staff. We would certainly recommend this restaurant for anything from a romantic dinner for two to a large private party. We had a fantastic selection of food, both Cambodian and also dishes with a Thai or oriental twist.
Very upscale place with delicious food and professional service.An enjoyable experience. Food prices are reasonable, but drinks are on the expensive side for Cambodia
Beautiful restaurant set out and you feel very special eating here. The food was excellent, beef steak great, seafood was great and everything well worth it. We'll worth it for a treat.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: We had our first meal in Siem Reap here. And had Crispy Sticky Rice with ‘Natang’ Sauce and Fish Amok. We enjoyed both dishes which were curry-based and went really well with rice. As it was our first Cambodian meal, we were very sure what to expect. While i found both dishes a little salty, there were both nonetheless delicious.

We took a table outside and were not disappointed. The space is comfortable, and green. Service was good. The wine/champagne selection could be improved and we found the prices a bit expensive compared to other places in Siem Reap. We liked the fact that they used lemongrass stems instead of plastic straws - very creative. Food was ok.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Restaurant with Great Food and Service
review: I went to Chanrey Tree at the recommendation of a tour guide while I was in Siem Reap. He suggested that I make reservations, which I was able to do online the day before and they sent me an email confirmation right away.  When we got there about five minutes before our reservation we were greeted by the hostess as we walked up and she knew exactly who we were and seated us promptly on their upstairs air conditioned dining room.  We were attended to right away and seated in a quiet corner of the restaurant. The dining area, table, and the flatware were all immaculate. The menu looked great! We ordered an alcoholic drink and a mocktail, both of which were delicious. The food we ordered, traditional Khmer fare, was tasty. The tables next to us look like they were enjoying their meals too. Constant attention was paid to our table to ensure our water glasses stayed filled and that unnecessary plates were cleared promptly.  Rice was a la carte.  The only very minor issue I had was that the constant movement of the service staff through the sliding door caused the air conditioned room to become warmer as the night wore on. But that small criticism is the only blemish on a beautiful dinner at Chanrey Tree. Highly recommended.

We had dinner there recently and could not have been more pleased. The food was delicious and the staff couldn’t have been more friendly. We had a wonderful conversation with Sophy, while enjoying a fantastic meal. Chanrly Tree comes highly recommended.

review_title: Some big flavours to the food
review: Some big flavours to the food especially the sauce with the fish which was great but overwhelmed the actual fish, beef a little chewy. Lovely setting lots of friendly staff

Went to the restaurant based on reviews here and because local person recommend it as well. So nice, beautiful setting, very attentive service, lizards on the walls,as everywhere . Now, we got 4 drinks, 2 soups, an appetizer, frogs, chicken and 2 fish dishes. Everything was delicious. $108 Coming from Thailand after being there for a week, lover the food. Service is amazing. Highly recommended.

We went here with a Cambodian friend who explained that the food was authentic. I enjoyed the food which was different without being too challenging. I think they may ease back on the chilli for westerners. When asked I always say medium to ensure I can eat the food!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Beach Goer
review: We were recommended Chanrey from our tour guide. The service is very attentive and friendly. The menu is delicious. I had fresh spring rolls and green Thai curry seafood. My husband had the pineapple fried rice. All delicious. Highly recommended.

review_title: A place if you want to step up your dining
review: If you had enough of the hyper local dining experience, this is a great place to be. Prices per dish are somewhere around 6-12$, which yes it's much more than what you pay for on the streets, but once again the price is justified with the taste, atmosphere and services. The restaurant staff Sros had helped to organize a super last minute birthday celebration for one of us and was very attentive! Of course, even without the birthday surprise it was still worth every single penny!

review_title: A must visit in Siem Reap for outstanding cuisine
review: We visited this restaurant with a tour group and were expecting just an OK meal. However, every dish was absolutely delicious and enthusiastically served. I wish I had photographed the dishes, but we were too busy eating them. A great welcome, nice decor and a must visit in Siem Reap for outstanding cuisine.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Great cause, delicious food, friendly service
review: Amazing place to go! Fabulous cause. Money from the cafe goes towards the charity.They teach under privileged women to cook and give their family healthcare. French drs come over for health check and to teach first aid. The pastries were delightful. Refreshing drinks and friendly service We'll be going back!
The coffee is really good and so is the cake and pastries. It might feel pricey for Cambodia but it’s for a good cause... So think of it as a donation!

review_title: Mostly good but room for improvement
review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.
Incredible pastries, deserts, coffees and also breakfast and lunch food too. Highly highly recommended plus you are supporting a great cause as well.

This is a wonderful pastry and coffee shop, training and employing young people and giving them the chance of employment and a better life. It lies down a leafy lane, in the quite Taphrun Village area, just off Taphrun Road. It's a quiet haven amid the noise of downtown Siem Reap.  The almond croissant, mango tart and chocolate marble cake we enjoyed were blissful. It's probably the best almond croissant I have ever tasted! The staff are delightful, the ambience is peaceful and soothing and the cakes, pastries and drinks divine. I highly recommend this coffee shop.

review_title: Great atmosphere and food, lovely staff and all for a good cause. What more can you want?
review: I am a frequent customer (have been living in Siem Reap for a year) and this place is a great place to go for a bit of piece and quiet away from the usual noise in Siem Reap.  The food is great (I am vegan and they do have a vegan brunch, or a smoothie bowl) ) and the staff very pleasant and helpful.  If you are into the pastry/sweet cakes there is a lot of choice and everything is made fresh on the premises.  They also often have freshly made jam and peanut butter - certainly worth buying to take with you.  You can also order bread (the day before) which is freshly baked on the premises - and its healthy as well!  Bayon Pastry School is a training facility for girls/women who would otherwise struggle to get a reasonable job. Here they are taught the fine art of making pastries, cakes etc. and then have a great start to getting a decent paying job at the end of their 12 months training.

Really lovely little cafe to chill in and enjoy good food. It's attached to a training school which teaches pastry and other skills to young people which is a great cause.  The food are coffee are first rate, service was excellent and the setting is so peaceful.

'Nuf said. Best chocolate crossaint I've had this year so far. Hands down. The butter kneaded into each individual layer melts in your mouth. I love butter. Honestly, the pastry was so good I didn't mind as much that there was only a small button of chocolate inside.  I also had an iced coffee frappe with condensed milk. Sweet but nice and refreshing.  The almond crossaint didn't look as "artisan" made. It did however taste very homely and rich.

review_title: Small pastry school cafe worth supporting- freshest croissants in town!
review: My daughter and I enjoyed the quiet atmosphere and enjoyed a coffee and croissant. Menu is based on the home baked fresh pastry and very cheap ($2-3). Quiet atmosphere set in simple surrounds just a short walk from Lucky Mall. Ideal for breakfast and a slow start to the day. The pastry school equips and trains young women with skills to cook quality cakes and pastry. My daughter loved the banana and ginger cake ! The cafe is up a narrow lane way that is easy to miss, but is signed.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: If you dine here prepare yourself for a wonderfully relaxed and delicious dining experience which will transport you away from the hustle of the city. The restaurant is staffed entirely by females, under the patronage of two young talented chefs the Kimsan Twins, which we felt gave a much more gentle and serene attitude to service which perfectly suits this restaurant. We chose the set Menu ($45 pax) and paired it with the premium wine suggestions ($29pax). Each course is presented beautifully, explained and matched with a delicious wine selection. There was no rushing to push you onto the next course which added to the calm atmosphere. The food was nothing short of excellent! We have been lucky enough to dine at some fine Michelin starred restaurants and the food here was definitely on a par and in some respects exceeded. At this point I would like to directly say to Michelin .... You need to get out here and recognise the amazing work and culinary experience these 2 young chefs and their team are offering!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Best dinner in Siem Reap- Cambodian gastronomy
review: Best dinner in Siem Reap! Love the story behind this wonderful restaurant and it’s all-female super team. Slight tucked away, the restaurant is spread over two floors and several rooms, so the place retains an intimate atmosphere. Service was superb from start to finish- everyone was charming and knowledgeable and welcoming. The set menu ($45) was absolutely sensational- ever successive course was even better than the previous. Each course is small and perfectly proportioned so you finish the meal feeling full but uncomfortable. True Cambodian street food morphed into high end gastronomy. Fantastic night - perfect for a romantic date, but also a fun place for a group too. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We had a lovely dinner to celebrate a birthday on our first night in Bangkok. The restaurant is run by two sisters and has all female staff. The food is an adventure into local cuisine with flair! We enjoyed a degustation and paired with premium wines. The experience - food, wine and service was flawless. It’s been hard to find anything better. A real delight and a treasure on Siem Reap.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Without a doubt, the BEST meal in our 5-day trip to Siem Reap. The restaurant serves a 6-course set meal (no a la carte) and the menu changes monthly. We loved every single course, except for 1 of the main course (of pork, which was a bit dry). But every other course was amazing - full of delicious flavours, fresh ingredients and always a refreshing take on traditional Khmer cuisine, infused with modern cooking techniques. My favourite was the dessert - a fusion of western and Asian flavours - ice cream, and traditional cakes from Asia.  The restaurant is also beautifully furnished and the wait staff were attentive and responsive. At the end of our meal, one of the chefs came out to meet us and was open to our feedback about the pork course. They also gave us a box of 2 macarons each, which were really delicious (note that i'm really particular about macarons).  Overall, a most wonderful dining experience in Siem Reap.

A meal of amazing beauty and some great dishes but it would be nice to know the link back to the culture and history or geography as suggested. Personally found the service a bit starchy for my liking - I don’t need to be shown a bottle of tiger like a prized wine before its opened.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Experiencing the tasting menu at this restaurant is my highest recommendation and top tip following a month long visit to SE Asia.  We are fortunate to have eaten some excellent meals on five continents but this restaurant served us one of top five meals of all time.  The restaurant is staffed throughout by females and, without wishing to sound sexist, I truly believe you can taste and experience their delicate and feminine touch throughout.  My wife and I were privileged to enjoy their seven course, regularly changing, tasting menu and were rewarded with some exceptional, exquisite tastes. Presentation and service were exemplary too.  Combined with a four glass classic wine pairing for me and a four cup tea tasting for my wife, the cost isn't cheap in Siem Reap terms but at $36 per person for food, $29 for four glass of paired wine or $15 for four deliciously flavoured teas, it's incredible value for money given the quality of food, presentation and service on offer.  In addition we were given complementary amuse bouche to start, had opportunity to thank one of the chefs direct and were given a leaving gift of their exquisitely presented, complementary macaroons.  An exceptional experience that I would repeat in a heartbeat, I cannot recommend this restaurant more highly.  Do not miss.

review_title: A Magical Culinary Experience in a Magical Place
review: If you’re in Siem Reap for one night or more, make sure you dine at this restaurant. Beautiful setting, remarkable food, gracious (all women) staff and hospitality. The set menu is fantastic, thoughtful, authentic, and very reasonably priced. We loved it!

Because we didn't have a booking, I and my wife arrived first in the restaurant and asking for a table of 7. The two waitress at the front said that they can only accommodate 2 person and not 7. While we were thinking to go somewhere else our other family member arrived ................. and all of a sudden they were able to arrange for us a large table for 7 people. I am still thinking it is a bit odd the way the staff handled customers. We enjoyed the set menu with wine pairing. The food are well presented and delicious. The serving are nicely paced, so we could talk in between the meals and enjoying the wine. I would have rated 5 stars, because of the muck up at the beginning to say only can accomodate 2 persons, decided to only give 3 stars.

We accepted gladly the suggested set menu. Excellent tastes and presentation, very pleasantly served by the professional staff. Contents of all courses were thoroughly explained, and even allergies were well handled. Definately recommended!

Found this place via 50 Best Discovery, and it is totally worth it. Classic setting, excellent service, and interesting and very well presented dishes. Did not try the wine pairing on offer and opted for a bottle of wine instead (good quality, affordable prices). Overall, it is hard to find a tasting menu fine dining experience for 37 USD anywhwere else in the world. Highly recommended if you are in the area. Great value for money !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review: Siem Reap is a foodie's paradise. There is no shortage of wonderful places to eat when you are visiting this city. But be sure to include this one in your list.  The meal is done as a set menu - everyone gets the same dinner (excepting allergies). So it makes it simple, with no choices to make. The toughest decision is whether to have the wine pairing (4 glasses), or not. Have it.  The 7-course meal is presented slowly, and beautifully. It takes about 2 to 3 hours to get though dinner, and each course is fairly small. So although it may sound like 7 dishes is a lot, it feels perfect.  The restaurant, operated by the Kimsan Twins (I don't think they are actually twins), is entirely staffed by women. The kitchen, clearly visible from the first floor dining room, shows the skilled chefs at work, and provides a show to watch between courses.  The set menu changes seasonally, but I suspect that every season is a winner.  Eat here.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The creative Kimsan Twins put together a meal that thrilled our party of four with unexpected tastes and delicious wine pairings. A great value in any city, but a gem of a find in Siem Reap!

After one week in Siam Reap and trying most of great Khmer Restaurants, I must admit this is the best of all. Yesterday I thought Cusine Wat Danmak was good but this was better. This restaurant only serves one kind of set menu of USD36. It also offers wine pairing for the set menu. This is the Restaurant to go if you in Siem Reap.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Unbelievable That Such A Dinner Can Be Had At This Price
review: An eight-course dinner for $38. And eight fantastic courses at that. There wasn't anything that wasn't artistically presented and delicious. The menu changes regularly so any particular dishes may not be available. But it's part of the fun that you're not sure what you're going to get until you arrive. They were very accommodating about my scallop allergy and my partner's pescatarianism. Wherever you're from, I don't think you'd ever get a dinner and service of this quality for anything close to this price. A must do in Siem Reap.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We had been taken, by our guide, to lunches with Cambodian food. It was explained that these were standard Cambodian dishes. Perhaps these meals were a bit better than most Cambodians could expect to eat at home but we are experienced at eating in South-East Asia and could tell that we had local ingredients and a style that was different from neighbouring countries. With this background we were keen to go further and try fine dining. This restaurant was very good indeed. We chose the tasting menu for the month, in this case March, with the suggested wines. The style was Cambodian with immense care and effort taken with detail and combinations. How many different flavours may be presented without a clash? Well quite a lot! The wines from various countries were just right; for example with the, undoubtedly, free range chicken we were given a light red (Sangiovese). Later a sweet Gascon white was similarly well matched. This restaurant stands comparison with two star Michelin listed restaurants that we have been to. We were pleased to pass this opinion on to the very knowledgeable Executive Chef when she called at our table. The staff were impeccable, appropriately attentive and obliging. The one disadvantage was that the menu lasts for the month. Had we gone back next day it would have been the same.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: After a difficult starts arriving without booking at 9.20pm and being said that the restaurant was full ( in fact 80% empty ) we finally get a table .. you have 2 options set menu with or without wine pairing..rather straight forward Overall a nice experience with an attentive service. Certainly the best place in Siem Reap
Average food, average drinks, average service, avergae price. Was expecting more, because of the great reviews, to be honest.

We were in Siem Reap for several days. This was without a doubt our best restaurant experience, and they were all ( except for one ) quite good. The Greek atmosphere was delightful, the food was superb and the service impeccable. We were three people. We ordered two Moussakas, 1 small (good size) Greek salad and spanokopita. Truly the best ever Moussaka I've had. Add in an imported beer and the tab came in. in the low 30's. Highly recommended.
We ate here a couple of times and found the food very authentic and a reasonable price. Nice atmosphere and good location. Nice change from local food.
This restaurant, right next to Pub Street, had delicious food, was reasonably priced, and accommodated my wife, who has celiac disease and can’t eat gluten, with no problem. Highly recommend!

user_tags: Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Gluten free marked on the menu
review: As gluten free options are not often marked on the menu in Asia this was very welcome for me. I did search for gluten free restaurants in Siem Reap and this Greek one was always on the list, so we gave it a try. I didn’t want any stomach problems as we were getting up early for the sunrise at Angkor Wat. Anyway, absolutely no problems at all, I had the chicken skewers with salad and chips which was lovely.
Ok. Got tired of Cambodian food. So tried greek. Ok good. Nothing to write home about and service very slow. Maybe should have stayed with the local fare

review_title: Authentic Greek Cuisine in Siem Reap - top notch!
review: I had dinner with a friend there on Saturday and it did not disappoint. Authentic Greek dishes, amazing service and a good selection of drinks made for a fantastic night. The atmosphere was great and the staff so friendly. Definitely going back!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review_title: Best Greek food | Value for Money | Nice Ambience
review: We had dinner at this place at least thrice during our stay. Great food. Incredible platter. Superb lemonade.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Touring around Thailand and Cambodia, decided just fancied a nice Greek meal as a change from the Asian Cuisine. Went on Trip Advisor Resturant’s near me. Up popped Elia and I’m so pleased it did. Free Wi-fi excellent service food was absolutely beautiful and plenty of it, I went for the meat platter for one and the wife decided on chicken skewers, Although we where going to place everything in the middle with a bowl of hummus, Pitta bread and fresh lemonade for drinks. Have to admit everything was perfect, the accompaniments that went with it was also perfect, will certainly use this restaurant again when I’m wanting a change thanks to the chefs, and staff for the lovely service.
Simply amazing menu choices - super fresh, healthy, wholesome, delicious and great customer service. Whoo Hoo I highly recommend this restaurant
I had a delicious vegetarian moussaka which came with pita and tzatziki. My partner had seafood pasta made with macaroni. Both were excellent as was the service.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: Definitely stop here for a bite to eat
review: What an amazing place Was welcomed by a lovely gentleman and waitresses were charming and friendly A lot of choices to eat I went for the curry and made an excellent choise Add this to one of your stops

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Like so many Cambodians, Tevvy has a sad story so it is great to support her great little restaurant which provides excellent value unpretentious local cooking.

Our hotel did not serve breakfast so finding this cafe so close was gold. All meals are so cheap, cooked to perfection and you can make it breakfast, lunch and dinner. In fact when we went for dinner we got the last available table and several people lined up waiting for a table. If its near your hotel look for it. We had 2 breakfasts, 2 lunches and 1 dinner here.

This place is AMAZING! We had various dishes, spring rolls, great beer and a G&T… all for an incredible price tag. We went as a big group and every meal was delicious. Thank you to all the team. Go… you won’t regret it!

review_title: Great food and super friendly service
review: We dined here everyday during our 4 day trip to Siem Reap. The food is delicious, the staff are really friendly and the manager always stops by for a chat which makes us feel so welcome. We have had the fish amok, beef salad, fresh vegetable rolls, beef lok lak, prawn salad, etc. and everything has been beautifully prepared. We spend about USD12 for the both of us each time with beers - this is really great value. Glad we found this place on day 1 :)

review_title: lovely place to enjoy a meal
review: I enjoyed my first fish amok at Tevy's place and I would certainly go back. The restaurant offers good quality traditional Khmer dishes.  I like the fact that Tevy's place empowers women in the workplace, and they are single use plastic free.  Value for money is fantastic.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Beach Goer
review: When we arrived we were a little sceptical. It really is a very small and local restaurant. There were no tables inside so we were given a table outside but it was very hot as the cooking was done there too. I think the waiters could see we were melting so when a table became free inside they asked us if we would like to move which was so thoughtful. We did and it was bless to be in the air-con. The menu is small and local but the food we had was really tasty and so cheap we could not believe it. We also had a couple of beers which were the cheapest we had anywhere. You cannot help be impressed with Tevy's story, (which you can read on posters in the restaurant), her survival and the loss of her family members is heartbreaking and now she helps young women have a better life by giving them work and training in her restaurant.  I would recommend this small and friendly little place for lovely and tasty local food and the price is a great bonus.

review_title: Review of Food Panda delivery from Tevvy's place
