review: Review of Food Panda delivery from Tevvy's place. I ordered the food at 18:10 and it arrived after 20 minutes. There was more rice than fish amok but the fish amok was pretty good, could do with a bit more fish though. The food is always tasty here

we always stop in and have dinner or lunch @ Tevy’s Place. Tevy and her staff are so welcoming. Excellent service and menu choices at a very reasonable price. She brings in and trains young women in all aspects of running a restaurant. Thanks for being a successful entrepreneur and for training, coaching and mentoring young adults.

review_title: Great Food, Great Price, Great Story!
review: As a small restaurant, I appreciated the willingness to reserve a table for 8. Unfortunately, my sisters-in-law (4) are a noisy lot when together and became engrossed in sharing each other's meals. So, they left with a good taste in their mouths but unaware of the story behind the restaurant. Veg spring rolls, fish amok, and fried chicken were the biggest hits. Service was good and we were blown away by the $42 bill for 8 adults, who drank beer too. Well done, Tevy!

review_title: A must go in the city for delicious cheap local food
review: Small little shop but with delicious food and great story! It's not a big restaurant and unfortunately reservation is not possible; but the waiting time is never too long even we are a group of 6 people. It's a place to try local food like spring rolls, beef LakLok and fish Amok in a decent portion and cheap price.

review_title: Very nice place with very friendly service. Free wifi. Prices were very good.
review: Very nice place with very friendly service. Free wifi. Prices were very good. I paid $3 for chicken and chips and 75c for a can of local lager. The food was tasty and well presented. I arrived at 6pm and managed to find a table. I left at 7:10 and there was a queue of people waiting for a table

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Simple but well cooked food with a smile
review: The tragic story of Tevy and her various projects and passions (local female artists and anti plastic crusade) are all over the walls of this little restaurant which gives it a unique and homely feel with a personal touch. The food is crazy cheap even by Cambodian standards while the portions are plentiful. Fish amok especially recommended, while the healthy and versatile juices/ shakes/smoothies were very nice too.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Best lunch experience in Siem Reap
review: We arrived around 1;30 to avoid the lunch crowd and had to wait 10 minutes....but well worth the wait ! We had an amazing curry and Amok - both were great and much better than other local restaurants. The service friendly and venue is clean. The owner has an impressive story and they promote education. I join all the other reviewers thay this is a "must visit" when here.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: not a fancy place, but very welcoming and friendly, with a good choice of great dishes for little money. we fully enjoyed our dinner here. you may have to queue in the evening, as the place is small and fills up fast. few tables outside, more inside.

Chicken Curry is the bonb We took aussie and khmer family tonight Seriously the food here is great and when busy it would be hard to get into But please try...well worth it We will come back before we leave

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review: This place was recommended to us by our friends in Siem Reap. Five of us ordered four dishes - fish amok, beef lak lok, pork salad and a vegetable dish. All were delicious. They also serve many types of fruit juices and drinks. This place is also set up to train girls with cooking skills and provide employment. By patronising them you're also supporting their work. Highly recommended for your meals.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: Saw this place while having an early morning wander on my first day in siem Reap. Did not get around to going until our last night which was a shame (don't make the same mistake) as the food here is quality at very low prices. It is only a small place and was full when we arrived. There was several groups waiting for space. Though this gave us the opportunity to chat to Cecil an Irishman who has assisted tevy in setting up this place and helping to run it. It was interesting to hear from Cecil about life in Cambodia. Anyway I digress the food and service our top notch go there and enjoy.

I love this restaurant. The food was s 12/10 , interesting ambience, great staff and excellent customer service . If you sit a front you can watch them cook your meal. All female staff. This place is another social profit enterprise. Tevy supports educational programs for disadvantaged youth - specifically females in Siem Reap. She deserves the Order of Cambodia. Pucs to follow
Great meal, c/w smoothies for under $10. Cheap and cheerful, but very tasty. Three mains plus three smoothies. All female staff worked very hard and restaurant was full.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Eco-tourist
review: I really love home made food and I was so happy to be here. My 3rds day on Siem Riep and found Tevy’s place was something. The staff was friendly and all is good for me. Have another 4 days and I will back soon.  Kind Regards, Adi

We ate here as a group of 20 and this staff really went the extra mile to make us feel welcomed! They are all lovely people, especially Tevy the owner. She employs an all female staff, gives back to the community, and has a wonderfully inspiring story of how she came to own her own restaurant. Delicious, traditional Cambodian food!! Highly recommended! Thank you!
Just a tiny little place but it was air conditioned and free wifi. We tried our first fish amok and loved it. We ordered beer and juice to go with it. It was great value for money.

Tevy's Place is located on the 'other' side of the river and was close to our hotel. Usually we avoid places that are full of Westerners, but were glad we made an exception for Tevy's - lovely local food, with local prices!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: Ok, let’s be clear here. The food we took - noodles with shrimps and Cambodian lak lak - cannot be maybe considered as number one in Cambodia (that’s why I give only 4 out of 5) but it is definitely tasty and you need also to evaluate the entire experience. Starting from the welcoming, you feel really at home and it was very nice to talk with Tevy. The food is freshly prepared at the moment and you can really feel it that is homemade, like if you would be having lunch at your grandmother’s place. Portions are not huge, but all this came at a ridiculous price: 10$ including tips. Please, continue on this way! Give it a try, it is Tevy’s place but it can become also your place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Great simple place for lunch at the Siem Rip city center - tasty , quick , not expensive but the most important- the personally , hospitality and smile of the owner !!!

review_title: Amazing meal - favourite of two weeks in Asia
review: We went to Tevy's place on our last night in Siem Reap. We had read the reviews and thought we must go. We got there about 7pm and were told by members of the queue that they were told they were the last to be served. Being British we ignored the warnings and joined the queues. Luckily they managed to squeeze us in and we had the best meal we had eaten in our two week trip. It was amazing value and we paid a chunk more than the bill came to as we felt that it was worth it. We even brought a few drinks to take back to the hotel with us. The spring rolls are fantastic. Also they were great for vegetarians as my husband is one. Just wished we had discovered this place on night one in Siem Reap as we'd have been back every night. Thank you to the staff and cooks at Tevy's Place.

The first night in Siem Reap was highlighted by the Fish Amok the ladies serve at Tevy's Place. Everyone greets you with a smile and you feel very welcome when you step into this amazingly simple eatery. The simplicity ends when the food begins to land on the table. Complex flavours crafted by professionals who really know their food. I was so impressed I returned the next night and tried out even more dishes which was sensational. It would be to match the quality and price of the food here anywhere in Siem Reap. I must for anyone travelling through this city.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We had a delightful dinner here. Very friendly staff and delicious authentic food. We enjoyed it so much we returned a second time during our stay in Siem Reap. Highly recommend. Cash only
Tevy’s is a little gem it is simple but has great food and Tevy is such a lovely lady always smiling!

We dined here one night of our Siem Reap stay. The venue is outstanding. The feel you get when dining is very special. We chose the 6 course tasting menu at great value of $40 per head, presented to us that evening. All the dishes we chose were ample bites of perfection. However one dish (the chocolate dessert) although visually pleasing, sadly was one of the worst chocolate desserts we've put in our mouths. We all chose this dessert and all left it. The experience and all the other food was superb! It's worth a try if you're staying locally.
food is actually very tasty in this beautifully decored restaurant. however avoid sitting in those swings, no matter how tempting & charming they look, it 'swings' a lot :P

review_title: Ideal if staying at the hotel or the sister properties opposite.
review: The restaurant offers Thai and western meal choices throughout the day.The staff are pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable.

The menu is reasonably extensive and interesting. There are lots of good dishes to choose from. They have "swing" tables which are pretty unique - and pretty relaxing as it turned out.  All of the food was elevated, this is a gourmet experience. Enjoyed the pumpkin soup and the had a mushroom noodle dish that was delicious. Service was spot on.  Highly recommended for more of a fine dining experience.

review_title: Good but not good enough for the price
review: This is a super hotel and I was prepared to pay more for a nice steak from a nice hotel after the very rich fare I had been eating at amazing prices in town I wanted something relatively plain and chose steak frites with mustard Service was excellent and friendly and we even had company from the local frogs popping out of the water surrounding the hotel and it was amusing watching them eating any flies or mosquitoes that dared to come close - an amusing diversion However a limited wine selection for fine dining (though thankfully the wine available was ok) but the steak was so disappointing. You should not serve steak full of gristle at that price and expect to get away with it - come on chef get your act together - you spoiled an excellent evening - I was happy to pay the extra money - this evening with you cost more than the two previous evenings spent in total by my wife and I inSiem Reap and you need to get this right

What a fantastic dining I have ever had in my life. I have Kroya combination as my starter and Moan-Tim as my main—oh my goodness, the taste is so good and fantastic—Service was excellent, special mentioned to Pheun for making our evening meal the best one.

review_title: Delicious and relaxing first meal in Siem Reap. Thank you, Darin!
review: Our midnight flight to Siem Reap was delayed by bad weather and we didn’t arrive until 6 am. Exhausted from lack of sleep and a short air journey made long by 3 hrs at the airport + 4 hrs of flying, we did our best to salvage our first day with a visit to the National Museum and lunch at Kroya. I emailed the restaurant and requested a table in the air conditioned dining area. Mr. Darin Eang promptly replied to my email and arranged for a quiet table. Service was excellent and the food was delicious. Three diners chose to share Kroya’s version of local Angkor dishes while our 2 gentlemen opted for hamburgers. Our driver Mr. Lim Pengkhun commented that the Fish Amok tasted very authentic. We also loved the raw beef salad.  Thank you again, Darin and restaurant team!
Start off with sparkling wine and orange juice, fresh fruit and cheese, then eggs Benedict and coffee and sweet desserts. Great place and super outdoor swings Give it a try!

Attached to Shinta Mari Angkor, this restaurant is a a little gem. While the menu is not broad, it is appetitising and offers both European and Cambodian options. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, you will find something to excite your tastes. My favourite lunch is the three min burgers which bring together a wonderful fusion of European ingredients and Asian tastes. The staff are extra friendly and helpful. They add to your dining experience. If you are there, you should try the swing seat dining to add to the experience.

review_title: Beautiful self serve breakfast so much choice.
review: The self service Breakfasts are lovely, so much choice and set out beautifully. There is also a cooked breakfast menu available. Champagne at breakfast, just perfect. Too much choice to mention everything. We also had two evening meal here as well. On both occasions the food was gorgeous. The staff are very attentive and friendly. They always go out of their way to help. There is a 6 course taster menu for US $35. Excellent value. Such a lovely, relaxing and enjoyable place to eat. My husband and I could not find fault with anything at all. Just perfect.

We could not fault this 6 course Cambodian meal. Every mouthful was a delight. It was part of a package we pre purchased online through Luxury Escapes and I could not fault the meal, the service or the package. We also stayed at Shinta Mani Club where the restaurant is located. We elected to sit outside on an overwater swing table, it was novel and very pleasant. Breakfasts here were also good.
The menu contains Khmer dishes which are absolutely delicious. One of the best in Siem Reap, so does have a good clientele from outside the hotel. Wonderful service from the staff.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: This was probably one of the best meals we had, on our Asia Trip. The restaurant is really beautiful with the tables hanging on the balcony! Located in Shinta Mani Hotel, very unique atmosphere. The service was really good and the food incridible tasteful. I wont forget this night!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Visited on the recommendation of our tour director. Escorted from our hotel across the road to the entry path where we were greeted by a waiter from the restaurant. We decided to dine inside and not brave the external hammock style arrangement. Dining area somewhat sterile and lacking atmosphere although there is high quality decor throughout. Service a bit tawdry, took a while for drinks to be served, wines and a beer. Kitchen somewhat slow with meals but meal quality and presentation was excellent. I would consider the restaurant a fine dining experience with matching prices and will give an "excellent" rating based on the quality of the meals.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: On our last night in Siem Reap ( after a lovely weekend ) we wanted some dinner and our hotel dinning room was closed for a tour function so they directed us to their sister hotel over the road and Kroya . The staff were wonderfully subtle in their service, the menu just big enough to allow everyone their choice and the food was fresh, very well presented and extremely tasty.  This restaurant would not be out of place is any European city as an Asian cuisine restaurant .  There is also a reasonable good choice of wines and cocktails for those who want it .  The prices were a little more than we paid for the previous night's local dinner but no where near what you would pay for that quality of food anywhere else .   Thank you for a really lovely evening

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: If you want the most amazing local food or an excellent Western menu you will find it all here. Atmosphere, ambience, great tastes and superb wine, cliché but so true. Breakfast here is everything you could want.

A very nice restaurant with excellent food. Very well prepared and presented using local produce and based on Khmer tradition with a modern interpretation. The option to eat in or outdoor is a bonus given the climate.

We had their set menu (Cambodian dishes). Each item was good, but it was nothing spectacular. The menu was simple and easy to understand. For the amount of money we paid, though, we felt like the food was nothing spectacular - just a bit above average.

review_title: Not so much choice on the menu but the food quality was good
review: I felt that the menu was a little small and found it difficult to find something I wanted to eat. Originally ordered a steak and was told it did not come with anything so went for the ravioli instead which was delicious - I just would have liked more choice.
Romantic meal reclining on "swinging chairs". Great food and wonderful ambiance. Worth a visit if you enjoy good food in a great setting.

We went as a group of 5 last night as the restaurant we wanted to go to was closed. The staff accommodated us and we're very helpful and very friendly. We ordered 4 main dishes to share with sides, the meal was fantastic all of the dishes we sublime. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a good up market meal in Siem Reap. Not overly expensive either

Try to get a swing table (book), Service was impeccable and food an interesting fusion. Frog-leg salad was excellent. Expensive by Cambodian standards but a very enjoyable experience. Tell driver it is at Shinta Mai Hotel - our driver did not recognize it by just the restaurant name.

My last day lunch here lasts a very good memory. I miss Kroya's food so much. The best Fish Amok! And you have to try their Royal Khmer Crudite with Pork & Krill Dip.It may looks very simple but taste really good. Will be back one day :)

review_title: Indulge yourself with fine food on comfy hanging swing-beds
review: Restaurant of the Hotel Shinta-mani. We had dinner on ultra-comfortable swinging beds over little ponds. Fine food for 30 usd each. It's not cheap as most of restaurants in the city, it's perfect if you want to indulge in fine food after days of cheap restaurants.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: The food was very good and their house cocktail. Open Heart was worth to try, so refreshing. The frog leg salad, and pan fried Red Mullet were a must to try.

This place offered elevated traditional Khmer food in a beautiful environment. Some of the tables are on swings which made you feel like you were floating. This was the best meal we had in Siem Reap. We met the chef, who it turns out has worked at some gourmet International restaurants which explains the quality and "fusion twist".  Highly recommend.

Okay so this place is more expensive than most in area but the service is charming, the tasting menu is well balanced, fresh and interesting and lots of little portions that left us full by the end of the meal.

review_title: Brilliant restaurant quality food and great service
review: We went here because it was only a few minutes by tut tut and had good reviews. We where not disappointed as we where met at the door and looked after until we left and even met the owner. The food was excellent I had the tenderloin steak and my wife had the chicken with roasted vegetables both where excellent. The waiters where very attentive and really made you feel welcome. We got to sit on the swing tables which are a must if you go.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: A place to come back to
review: A great place for modern Cambodian cuisine. We enjoyed their 6-course tasting menu which we were told changes frequently. Staff were friendly and professional matching the nicely designed place.  Starters were a traditional Cambodian mango sallad with the twist of dried snake. This was followed by a deep fried pork stuffed sticky rice cake served with a fish ceviche dip. Both dishes were traditional yet modern. Precise and fresh flavours.  Main course comprised three dishes: lemon grass spiced fish with a tofu-ginger sauce, a papaya-basil-shrimp soup and curry-peanut fried beef tenderloin. All stretched the flavours in their own way. Together they formed a united, well composed dish.  It all finished with a raspberry sorbet, a sticky rice and sesame seed roll and coconut sago soup. Balanced and tasty.  Only drawback is the lack of a wine pairing meny. So we grabbed all their eight wine-by-the-glass and enjoyed our wine pairing ourselves.  If you are looking for a modern khmer restaurant in a modern and comfortable atmosphere, pick Kroya.

review_title: The best restaurant in Siem Reap
review: The ambiance of the place, its peaceful location and lovely decor were the first attraction to the place. The plated meals were well presented and uniquely delicious. Price wise it is definitely costly but worth it all.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: We stay at the Shinta Mani Club, and we decide to have dinner every day at this restaurant. Food is fantastic! Delicious and very stalish presented. Chef is very warm as well as all the staff. One of the best restaurants in Siem Riep!!!! It worths it to taste its food. Prices are very good for the food quality!!!

We tried the suspended tables for a unique experience. Essentially this is like a double bed with a tray table that you sit on, suspended on 4chains so it swings. Both the experience and the food were great. Food is carefully prepared and presented so very satisfied.

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Great food and experience on the giant swing! Go on a Sunday night for live music and shopping in the Cambodian market next door!
While the food, taste and presentation both , was excellent.. we specifically loved the swing seating! Make sure you have reservation before visiting, as there are limited swings.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Beautiful Setting and Great Local Fusion Dishes
review: All the staffs were very friendly. The setting of the restaurant was beautiful. Outside swing seating is a lovely way to dine. We especially enjoy their local and fusion dishes.

I've never eaten dinner on a swinging bed before but there's always a first time! We were met from the Tuk Tuk with a cool towel which was a nice touch. An excellent dinner (we had the tasting menu) that surprised at every course. Not cheap at all but great quality and as is usually the case, you get what you pay for.

review_title: One of the better restaurants in Siem Reap
review: Siem Reap gets many tourists, and many of them are in groups and wouldn't venture to an upmarket restaurant in a hotel. Food in Siem Reap can be very inexpensive, but with the low price comes a lack of quality produce and originality. Kroya is special. We first went because we were a little tired after arriving and it was easy. The 7 course Khmer tasting menu changes every night so no chance of getting bored with the food. There is an "normal" menu as well if you don't feel adventurous.  We had the tasting menu and enjoyed it very much. At $31 per head, it is great value. Wine is available at various price levels.We though the courses came out a little fast, but that is often the case in Asia, The size of the tasting plates was just right. I would comment that the wine was not quite chilled enough, but some time in the bucket solved that. Not a big problem.  Service was very friendly and fast enough, We ended up going more than once to avoid tourist food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: Went for dinner here at the start of May, very nice greeting on getting out the car with a cold towel service and personal escort to the restaurant.- so far so good. The swing seating is also quite an eye opener - Elegant, playful, brings a real element of 'occasion' to dining there.  Things started well, but a lack of detail started to emerge once the dining service got under way. The bottle of white wine we ordered was cool not cold upon opening and wasn't at it's proper temperature from the cooler until the last glass; My dining companion ordered the $31 tasting menu whilst I went a la carte.  Their serving procedure was to serve half of the tasting menu dishes in one go, to link with my starter course, and then serve the other half of the tasting menu all in one go again when my main course was served. Never experienced this in our collective lives, and we've seen how it's done in Thai restaurants in Bkk with different orders so it isn't a particular regional practice to cram up tasting menu courses to match an a la carte one. My companion ended up sending some dishes back to hold, to allow her to finish one course without letting the other dishes get cold and of course to concentrate on one set of flavours at a time. Most disappointed.  To be fair, the food was decent, I enjoyed my courses - had a lovely tofu tempura for starters (it was a main from their vegetarian menu) and soft shell crab for mains. All really well made and seasoned. Oh, except the rice - Cold rice. In SE Asia, that's almost heresy.  Service was too variable for comfort - As well as the above, our servers would either swarm around, or disappear - getting the bill at the end required catching the eye of one waiter who Pointed to another one who nodded, who came by a few minutes later to ask what we wanted.  It was too strange, at such variance to our normal experience in SR (and even at the very same restaurant where I'd eaten lunch last year). What made it go from a "let's chalk this up to bad chance" to "this really isn't acceptable" was that dinner including modest wine, and service ended up at $110 - By far the most we'd paid for food in SR, including at the fabulous Cuisine Wat Damnak.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Great Cambodian food with a bit of western influence.  we had a salad with seafood & pineapple that was yummy.  the steamed sea bass was the winner entree.  Mango & sticky rice for dessert, of course.  Great service. Nice atmosphere.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Quality service is the cherry on top of quality food
review: Lovely food and amazing service.  We sat on the sheltered roof terrace and watched the sunset over Siem Reap. The atmosphere in the restaurant was fabulous, loads of foliage decoration.  The food and drinks were really good quality and very good value for what you get. We also got a dessert. 2x mains, 2x drinks and 1x dessert was just under $40. What made it was the service, staff were super friendly, professional and courteous.  I would 100% recommend.

We first saw this restaurant/venue on TripAdvisor. It was our first evening in Siem Reap and organised a tuk tuk there. First impressions are great! The place is immaculate and beautifully designed. The rooftop area for dining is picturesque. The menu has a wide range to suit all tastes. Service is prompt and efficient. Our meals came, all ordered starters, mains and desserts. All were perfect! Amazing tastes and presented very well. Cocktails are affordable and also great! We recommend to anyone who visits siem reap and enjoys great food!

review_title: Perfect setting for a romantic meal
review: We were recommended the restaurant next door by staff at the hotel we were staying in on our first night in Siem Reap, but they were fully booked so we were directed to this restaurant which is apparently owned by the same company. We were not disappointed at all! The surroundings, decor, music and ambience were spot on for our first meal out after travelling 23 hours. The food was very good quality and service was great.

review_title: Family visits never disappointed with toddler
review: Visited it twice for lunch and it only got better thanks to Channy (Da) and the team. We tried the Battambang style noodles, and some other traditional dishes and very tasty (chha nganh), Chhaet Hoeuy :)
Went to malis last night supposed to be the best. Well na. This is really tasty authentic Cambodian food. Great rooftop area. Good service. Great food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover
review: We actually went to Chanrey Tree for dinner (thanks to the advice of a nice French lady who lives in Siem Reap). As it was full with indoor tables, the waitress led us to this lounge. I was puzzled for a while but quickly realized it is also owned by Chanrey Tree.  The lounge has a high end set up, good atmosphere and live music. Dishes were very nice and the price is surprisingly moderate. The service was extremely good. They even helped us to get Tuk Tuk after dinner when it was raining.

Not the cheapest restaurant, but a real treat and the quality of the food is excellent. We had spring rolls which were really fresh and tasty and you could tell they had been made to order. The soup with red nets in it was also really delicious and very different. Not just a gimmick they really add a flavour to the soup. We were on the top level and you feel so far away from the madness of the surrounding town. A real treat for one of our first nights in Cambodia. The staff also got us a tuk tuk to get home as it was pouring with rain when we were ready to leave. Excellent service all round.

review_title: I echo the strongly positive reviews here
review: Visited for a late lunch /early dinner on the basis of the good reviews on TA. A good decision. I'm sure I will return whilst I'm in SR.  I can reccomend the Salmon Tartare as well as the Pork Ribs. Good quality dishes.  Staff were great - positive and attentive.

The Sokkhak River Lounge is not well advertised yet it is easy to find, is very central and provides an excellent venue for eating, drinking and the unexpected bonus of some Khmer music. The service is first rate, the menu varied and the wine list both affordable and varied. I enjoyed the fish amok but a Cambodian dish I tried on my second visit was somewhat bland.The singing was unobtrusive and the female lead was particularly good. All in all, a great experience and a very pleasant ambience and much better than some nearby and better known venues. There is an alternative open air alternative on the roof.

We were staying at the Sokkhak Boutique Resort and they recommended the restaurant to us. After a very warm welcome we had very good drinks and an excellent dinner. The staff was very attentive and polite. Escpecially the rooftop area is really stunning with all the amazing plants. We can only recommend the place.

Any place you eat needs three things, good food, good staff and a good atmosphere. Sokkhak River Lounge has all this and more. We visited the top floor ,it’s hard to describe and the photos don’t do it justice it’s just one of the nicest surroundings I have ever eaten in. This is matched by the food and staff. I don’t often give five stars but this deserves it. The only drawback is the stairs to reach it but it is worthwhile.

Six friends decided to try this place which we had heard was rapidly gaining an excellent reputation as the place to visit in Siem Reap. That unquestionably turned out to be the case.  With an attractive bar on the ground floor, a bar with live music on the first floor we opted for the restaurant on the top floor. It is difficult to fully describe this restaurant. With an abundance of plants, tall ceilings and a multitude of windows open it almost felt like being outside eating close to nature. The ambiance was almost tangible.  During the evening we were looked after by the excellent Ms Van who did everything to make our visit memorable. The cuisine was delicious with service to equal that. But then towards the end of our visit t became really special. The rain came down outside and being in that restaurant felt like being in a rain forest..except we were dry of course. A great end to a special evening.  For an atmospheric evening with excellent cuisine put Sokkhan River Lounge firmly on your Siem Reap programme.

We came leaded by Tripadvisor and it did Not let us down. Refined food in an elegant environment. Outstanding service. We did an onLine reservation on their website in the same afternoon and they got it all under control.

Wifey found this on the internet. Reviews were good and we went. We were not disappointed. Excellent service and very good local food in a pleasant setting. We were on the rooftop, which we recommend. Nice jazzy music in the background makes room for a good conversation. Worth a visit.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Simply great place - elegant eclectic design , nice service , phenomenal cocktails , delicious food and amazing live music with 3 singers !!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Family Vacationer
review_title: Early dinner to watch the sunset great food,great surroundings,superb cocktails wonderful service from Makarau
review: We had a lovely early evening dinner and watched the sun go down on this roof top of this lovely restaurant,makarka served us so lovely and unobtrusive , great cocktails .

I went for dinner and drinks, and was seated in the outdoor area upstairs. Absolutely stunning! Decorated with ceiling plants and greenery, it feels you are in the jungle. The sounds of birds from nearby trees and surrounding nature makes it such a special atmosphere. The staff was great, super friendly and professional. Like may other Siem Reap establishment, this restaurant is already ahead of the game when it comes to ban the use of plastic straws (lemongrass straws are used instead!). The food was good, not the best I had in town but definitely good for a pleasant dinner in a wonderful environment.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We noticed the lights on the roof from the street as we strolled past, the lady on the reception desk accompanied us up the stairs to show us the two upstairs bars, I assume the middle floor is air conditioned, as it had live music playing and comfortable chairs. We chose to go to the roof top, were there is an open air bar.  The top floor is heavily planted with tropical plants which makes it feel like you are in an oasis away from the busy streets of Siem Reap.  The staff were all very friendly, taking the time to talk to us and ask about our visit to Cambodia. It was a nice way to end our trip to Siem Reap. I can say that everyone we met in Cambodia was extremely friendly.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Family Vacationer
review_title: Beautiful roof garden, very relaxing bar and great food
review: We loved the decoration and went for drinks plus food. You can have western or Khmer food (same chef as neighbouring Chanrey tree). There is also a closed room were musicians were performing but we preferred the open air. The Khmer food was top quality and very tasteful. There is a nice selection of non-alcoholic drinks like juices or cold teas/infusions. We also had lovely gin tonics very nicely presented.
Enjoyed petting their friendly cats. Had a delicious coffee ice mountain. Huge portion large enough to share. Super friendly staff.

This place was heaven sent! On a really hot day in Siem Reap we sat down to a delicious mountain of shaved lime and honey ice dessert. They have a number of other fruit including mango, dragon fruit and more. There are also scrummy smoothies and iced coffee.  It is all hygienically made. The welcome, complimentary iced water is just the start. Do your self a favour and visit.

review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: Amazingly delicious and friendly shop owners. the icy desserts taste especially good in this hot country.

We came here today after reading only good things on Trip advisor and it did not disappoint. The mango smoothie is the best I have ever tasted! Wow!! And the banana and chocolate pancakes are to die for. The service was great and the owners very friendly. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Having read many good reviews about this place, I decided to give it a try. It wasn't very hard to find and I went in to hide from the heating sun. There weren't many people when I was there but soon, the place filled up a bit. The couple were very welcoming the moment I stepped foot into the place and gave me a glass of cool water before I even ordered. I asked for a recommendation and the lady boss recommended and mango and passionfruit ice. I asked if it will be too big a bowl for me so she explained that I could opt for the smaller portion at US$1 lesser so I took that. While waiting for the ice, I was admiring the wall and pillars in the shop, which hundreds, if not thousands, of travelers have left notes on. The place was cosy and clean and definitely good for a breather from the heat. The ice came and I fell in love with it even from the first mouthful. The ice is not just pure ice but has condensed milk in it and it was really fragrant. The passionfruit sauce wasn't sour but has a mixture of sweetness in it as well. Perfect! Enough said!
I just decided to give him 3 stars because I didn’t think it was anything spectacular in the smoothie. It was good but not a WOW factor and less for price $4 usd. You can get a draft beer for $0.50

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: Stooped by for dessert and the owner gave us a warm reception.  Had a tasty pancake and chatted a bit with the Japanese owners. It's a chill place with pancakes and fruit smoothies on the menu.  Look for your country flag on the wall, if not found, take a few markers and draw it :)
Ice cream here are an art, not food! They look absolutely fabulous and taste even better! I could eat them every day.

review_title: Delicious Mango pancakes and Ice mountain-good rest stop
review: We were so thankful to arrive here after walking in the hot sun. The mango pancakes and mango shaved ice mountain are simply delicious. There are many artwork and scribblings on the walls left by grateful customers. The Japanese couple was so gracious in helping us called our hotel tuk tuk. There is also the small Saboo Sabay shop within its compound. Strongly recommended when in Siem Reap.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: The number one for a reason
review: Lovely owners, great food. Great service in a quaint colonial building. We had the mango passion fruit on French toast and it was delicious. A light,fruity meal rather than a desert and would have made a spectacular breakfast. We decided to eat here before we went to dinner but don’t need an evening meal now. How good was that?

review_title: Wind down here after a long day out in the sun
review: Came here after a long day exploring temples in the sun. Arrived into a spacious area. Outside there was a stall selling soaps made from natural ingredients. You can wash your hands there to try out the products before entering. Makes for a great souvenir :) Inside, we ordered fruity ice mountains and a glass of ice blended coffee for our tuktuk driver. It was such a treat! The owners were extremely friendly and we could spent the whole afternoon there. Highly recommended!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: We visited during lunchtime, so we got 1 bowl of the dragonfruit shaved ice cream, and 1 french toast with passion fruit. Both were really yummy. The place itself is very nice, with messages from visitors all over the world scribbled to the wall. The owners are super enthousiastic, and make this place quite the experience.

We first visited this restaurant almost exactly a year ago and were astonished to find we were the only diners that night, because the quality and value proved to be so high. On 16th Feb this year we returned for a second visit and were met with the same high standards but this time there was barely a spare table to be had, fantastic. The staff coped really well with the level of demands placed upon them and if you understand that some of them were relatively inexperienced because of the basis on which the business operates then this was even more impressive. The lady manager for the night had only to keep a watching brief and scarcely intervene at all.  The food remains excellent - the fried beef with red ants is a must try. Coupled with great value for money and free pick up and drop off service it make it a first class choice. Don’t be put off by the fairly obscure location and the alleyways that the tuk tuk driver has to take to get you to the entrance, it is all worth it.

Picked this place on our first night in Siem Reap based on the excellent TA Reviews - they are spot on! Service and food both delightful!  They picked us up and dropped us off for free from our hotel (we tipped the Tuk Tuk driver though)  The dining room looks as good as the photos and staff are all lovely - smiling and attentive.  Cocktails at $3.25 was too good to miss!  Nice little Spring Roll amuse bouche.  Starters of Fried Noodles and Vegetable Fritters we’re fresh and flavoursome. (6 large fritters)  Mains of Vegetarian Curry and Pan Grilled Beef Steak Lok Lak Style - both delicious!  Lovely home made ice cream and coffee to finish. ($36 + Tip)

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: What a thoroughly delightful, warm welcoming restaurant at extremely fair and reasonable prices tucked away with gorgeous local
review: What a thoroughly delightful restaurant, hidden away in the narrow streets between Ave Charles de Gaulle and the river, close to our hotel, Tara Angkor. Free tuk-tuk to and from the restaurant, greeted by the warm welcome of young Cambodian waiters and chef, all undergoing their training at this gem of hospitality & warmth. The prices were very reasonable, including wines, and food exquisite.

user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Excellent restaurant with pick up & drop off to your hotel
review: Really lovely setting, with first class attentive service. Tucked away in a tiny back street. Follow the orange lanterns from Charles de Gaulle street or use the free tuktuk service.

review_title: Did not really hit the spot
review: We have been to a few of these help the locals learn restaurants over the years and really like supporting them but I am sorry to say this one did not really come up to scratch.  The pickup service failure- they had to be reminded to pick us up after we had been waiting for 30 minutes- this is even after we had sent an email booking(not answered) plus a confirmation call from our hotel reception earlier in the day  Setting was nice and service was friendly - but hard to see who was learning and who was coaching - recently in Laos we went to one where they had T-shirts to show who did what  Unfortunately for the prices charged (high by Cambodian standards) they failed to deliver - especially the $10 prawns and red curry sauce - the 6 very small prawns were soft like crawfish (very disappointing), the red curry sauce was nice but we could of done with some more, red rice was also ok but to call this plate a main is a joke - 6 mouthfuls and it was all over!  We did like the complimentary spring rolls and the mango and sticky rice ($4) was a good rendition of an Asian classic.  We did have a bottle of Italian Pinot Grigio which was unexpectedly very dry and a nice bottle of French Chardonnay both of which were priced at around the $22 mark - not sure who was meant to be coaching the lovely young lady to get the cork out but together we got there in the end  Large Angkor beers around $4 each  Plus a small thing that’s annoying is not showing the fully inclusive prices........

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We were picked up for dinner by tuk tuk and taken to the restaurant which is in a lush, quiet area away from the busy road. The design of the restaurant is beautiful, it feels like it's sitting amongst the tree tops. The food was fantastic, and delicious. It was a quiet evening and we practically had the place to ourselves as it is low season but it was a magical experience nonetheless. Highly recommend!!

We dined here in the middle of February after attending the Sacred Dancers of Angkor performance on the other side of the river. We were the only diners which, when we had finished a quite superb meal, left me amazed at how this venue is not on everybody's radar.  Won't repeat the principles on which this restaurant runs - read it all on their website - but it is worth supporting on that basis alone. Add to this the fact that the food is of such high quality and the staff so keen to make sure you have an enjoyable meal it is a tragedy that the place is not heaving with people every night.  The menu is varied and offered our jaded western palettes the opportunity to try some really authentic local cuisine - I will never look at red ants the same way ! It is also super value for money.  So Mr Rotha, Miss Ling, Mr Orm and Mr Pist - keep up the good work for your bosses. Everybody else - just go there !

We eaten three times at Chi and all times it was a great experience! The service was perfect and staff is really taking good care of all of us! Food is awesome! Better than some fancy places in Siem reap, good flavors and nice presentation! We will definitely come back!

We stayed four nights in the Anantara Angkor Resort. The Chi Restaurant is part of the hotel. Unbelievable cuisine, so that we had Dinner every evening. We can recommend the beef skewers, curry and the Baked Alaska, a suprising dessert which has been prepared next to the table by Ratana and Channan. They recommended f.e. this Dessert and the taste was unbelievable. Think you so much. As well we would like to thank the waiter Da for his firstclass Service. In total: A must have to go to when staying in Siem Reap!! Greetings Michael and Sascha

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic
review: This restaurant exceeded our expectations, it was such a nice experience dining there. We had dinner here twice in 3 day. The decoration is so beautiful, traditional wood, high ceiling. The dishes are well executed, tasty and consistent. We tried fresh spring rolls, green mango salad with bar fish, beef wok, seafood amok, green chicken curry and alaska dessert. Delicious ! But the real value is the service: all the staff is nice and attentive, kind. A particular thank to our waiter (I don’ remember his name but we can see him on the picture flaming the dessert). I deeply recommand this place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Beautiful food and fun cooking course at Spice Spoons
review: We ate at Chi restaurant several times during our stay at the Anantara resort. We were truly lucky to have such a wonderful restaurant at our disposal.  The tasting menu was great value and had some wonderful highlights such as the scallops on pumpkin purée; beef carpaccio with a delicious Khmer salad; lamb shank curry, to mention a few. The à la carte options were also lovely.  Breakfast each morning had a wide range at the buffet, and the made to order dishes were also delicious (loved the french toast!)  We also took a ‘Spice Spoons’ cooking course with the chef. This started with a visit to the town market (an experienced in itself!), followed by cooking several dishes under careful instruction. We were then able to savour these freshly made dishes over lunch (fresh spring rolls, hot/sour soup, chicken curry, banana sago). Water and soft drinks were also provided as was a usb with the recipes, and apron.  Staff were wonderful, very attentive and friendly throughout our whole stay.  The location is a little out of town, but certainly worth a visit if you are not staying in the hotel!

review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_title: Delicious tasting menu – rest is average
review: We came here because of the good reviews. We ordered the tasting menu but exchanged the mains and the deserts. Which was a mistake. The first courses of the tasting menu were fantastic, delicious and nicely presented. We loved the scallops and the carpaccio was absolutely delicious. Very disappointing were the mains. We exchanged the lamb to seabass and beef lok lak. Both were not really good and not nicely presented. We had the feeling we got food from a different restaurant. The desserts were o.k, but just too big. They had a great service and great drinks. Overall the tasting menu was really nice and absolutely recommendable. But you should stick to this if you are a real foodie.

The restaurant is located at Anatara Angkor Resort in Siem Reap where I was a guest for four nights with my family. The recommendation is to stay at Anantara to maximize this amazing restaurant.If you are not staying at Anantara I suggest you visit Chi at least once.The restaurant has everything one would want for a quiet family or romantic dinner. Great wine selection.Every dish from starter to dessert, a masterpiece. The signature dishes are to die for. The staff is very helpful and attentive. Since we were staying at the resort, we had an opportunity to have daily breakfast at Chi. There was a great buffet layout plus one can select signature dishes from a la carte menu which is included in the price of breakfast. It was so nice to see F&B manager Mr Sheldon talking to the guest making sure everything is good, we had a specific request for our main course and it was accommodated. Their prawn curry was just awesome and my daughter fell in love with their chicken Korage and salt pepper calamari. Every meal we were served was of the exceptional standard even at the room service. Their signature Crab cake is a must and if you have breakfast at Chi, order their signature waffles and eggs. (yummy). i highly recommend 'Chi'.Take it from a foodie!! 0
Since I walked in to the restaurant, staff greeting very polite and friendly. The food was good taste, should try local food here. It just 5 minutes drive from old market area.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: We ate here on the final night of our 3-night stay at the Anantara. Having little experience of Khmer food, we opted for the tasting menu and can honestly say it was one of the best meals we have ever eaten. The service from the young team in the restaurant was really excellent and we were made to feel very welcome. The restaurant itself is beautiful and the decor and general ambiance very nice indeed. Each course was explained to us and we found the presentation and balance of flavours quite superb - we enjoyed every bite.This is a restaurant serving world-class food and we would highly recommend it, we cannot wait to return.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nightlife Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Beautiful decor and one of those menu's where it is hard to choose. The great staff are happy to cater your meal to your wishes and it was totally delicious. We visited with young children and they happily catered for that also.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Beach Goer;Family Vacationer
review_title: Relaxed homely restaurant with amazing food
review: Food was so good came here for dinner and lunch the next day. We came here with out 2 kids (12Y and 10Y) and we really enjoyed the french food. Didnt think we would be eating a raclette outside France in Cambodia. Its a lovely little family restaurant run by a french husband/cambodian wife, the atmosphere suits both couples on a night out, but also families like ours. Would definitely come here again the next time we are back in Cambodia.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We had a lovely leisurely lunch in the garden area. The food was good value and all cooked fresh, even the crisps! The homemade desert was amazing! A great little find.
Home cooking style, French chef offers his view if the local dishes and of course some international favorites. Fresh food, lovely house. A good surprise.

review_title: French food home cooked style, huge portions
review: Set in a spacious bungalow, the restaurant is operated by a French gentleman and his local wife. Extremely friendly and good service, price was decent and wine cheap. We saw a number of French expats dropping by to say hi to the owners and to have a quick drink. See my pictures below Tip: from 7pm onwards, they do movie screenings !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We were the only customer on a quite lunchtime. The owner and his wife were very welcoming. I ordered couscous. The semoule was very dry, like the broth hadn't had the time to be sucked up. The meat also was quite tasteless and dry. Would not go back. Quite expensive as well. A missed chance.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Meeting the young students again was touching and joyful. What a job the Team does... the lunch menu was exciting and came out just excellent - this at a very very fair cost. The juices and shakes are fresh, yummy and super well made, the service flawless and the greeting is the warmest. I rounded up with a very good and relaxing massage. The treatment rooms are large, clean and have nothing to envy the large fine hotel spas (I know them as well!).  When in Siem Reap, don't miss the chance to come and support a fantastic vocational hospitality school for underprivileged local youth. Bravo Sala Bai!
Lunch with 3 dishes. The School does an Exelent job providing training for underprivledged youth. By the Way- the lunch was exelent.

review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

My husband and I were thrilled when we discovered that we would be in Siem Reap this year when the Sala Bai restaurant was open, as it is not open all year round. This year we took our daughters and my sister along. The menu wasn’t as extensive as it has been in previous years; which was a little disappointing, however, the food and service were amazing.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review_title: Good place for a good action
review: Delicious meal served promptly by well trained staff for 14 USD per person. The fish amok was terrific as the turkey and sweet potatoes. Desserts are amazing. The end of Year School trip is planned for next July and for now they have 26 students going ( out of 120). It costs approx. 60 USD per student so any donation is welcome! Make a good action and go there for a meal...or even 2 as they served breakfast as well!

review_title: Our favourite meal in Siem Reap
review: We visited for lunch last week. My partner ordered the set menu and all 3 courses were knockout - fragrant, flavoursome, well though-through and beautifully presented. What I really appreciated as a vegetarian was that the veg options on the menu were equally fabulous and not an afterthought. Our student waitress Kim Ho was warm, attentive and spoke lovely English. After our meal, Sophy gave us a little information about the school and the numbers behind the program. If these are the results that this school can achieve within a 10 month training program then I'm incredibly impressed.  The school kindly allowed us to tour the school which now includes a handful of chic spacious rooms available to rent during your stay in Siem Reap. We know where we're staying next time! Also - they have a beauty salon which offers treatments (book the day before, see their website) which I didn't try but the treatment room looks lovely and very professional.  Highly recommended!

My husband and I have been visiting Sala Bai for many years and this year was our first visit to their new location next to Wat Svey Temple (which is also worth a visit). We love Sala Bai so much that I made our first reservation from Australia before we left and we went there for lunch only hours after landing back in Siem Reap. We were not disappointed! We were greeted and seated in a most professional way, and the staff were lovely and friendly as always. Now for the best part - THE FOOD! I had the raw fish salad for my entrée and it was so unbelievably delicious that we went back numerous times and I always ordered the same entrée. My husband fell in love with the prawn Caesar salad, which is huge for an entrée. We tried something different every time for a main and everything we tried was just beautiful. The service staff are very attentive and the prices are very reasonable. All money goes towards their training program, which has a 100% success rate of placing graduates. Located only a couple of minutes out of town by tuk tuk ($6 for a return trip is heaps), it is well worth it. The restaurant area is located in the upstairs part of the building and it is lovely and cool. I can not praise Sala Bai, it's food and it's staff enough. Do yourself a favour and visit. You'll keep going back, I promise you!!

review_title: Quality well priced menu in professionally run restaurant school.
review: Good venue with large capacity for dining upstairs or downstairs. Situated on a quiet stretch of the Siem Reap river a few minutes south along the river from Hard rock cafe. Food quality excellent as was the service and as a teaching school for hospitality students , you know that the profits are going to a good cause and well worth supporting this. Large groups should book ahead . We were able to walk in at lunch but was still busy so best to book ahead.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Top. Going back, and back, and back again
review: You cannot beat the experience of supporting a true vocational training school for the most disadvantaged. And it's yummy, tasty, friendly and efficient. Take a few minutes to find out what Sala Bai is really doing - ask the Cambodian teachers, the social workers, the volunteers. And enjoy!

One of those places in my wishlist for Siem Reap. The students cum trainee waitresses gave me a warm welcome. Felt good about it. Had lunch here, which I had Grilled Beef & Lemongrass Salad and drank Sala Bai Passion Breeze. The food kind of contemporary and the drink was so refreshing. Many food photos actually uploaded here and other blogs were obsolete cos they change the menu from time to time. The price is very reasonable considering they put effort to make your food looks presentable. Must try places.

This restaurant is part of a training hotel. The staff are students in training in the hospitality industry and they do their jobs spectacularly well.  I had the privilege of having had lunch here in February 2015. The service was excellent and the food awesome. Sala Bai is near the top of my "to revisit" list when I return to Siem Reap in future.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I returned last week to Sala Bai for lunch and I chose to review anew to confirm the very positive first impressions. The welcome, the sweet attentive service supervised by pro teachers and the quality of the food served are impressive, even more so considering both kitchen and service is manned by young students. This small school is impressively committed to fighting poverty and human trafficking via vocational training. Sala Bai enrolls only the most disfavored Cambodian youths and provides a year long hospitality training (plus housing, food, clothing, health care etc) absolutely free of charge. All students (70% young ladies, the most exposed) are then employed by upscale hotels in Siem Reap. This has broken the evil circle of poverty for now thousands of families. I lift my hat to this achievement and encourage you to book a lunch! Thank you.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Great educational resource for Siam Reap. They are doing an excellent job. But, to me as a customer the food is what matters. And I have to say it was sensational- well presented, well balanced flavours. Yummy!!!Go there for a great meal, and help the student learn as well.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Education changing lives sweetens every dish served.
review: I cannot believe that this tiny training facility reataurant is not booked out for every weekday for breakast and lunch. Every meal is cooked and served by the sudents learning hospitality skills for free under the guidance of a dedicated team lead by a French NGO. If you go for brekky at 8 am you will be fortunate to see these proud young Cambodians from the poorest of circumstances go through their morning briefing and lessons and enjoy a chance to meet the staff. Inspirational dining! By eating here or staying upstairs in their weekday training hotel you support these youths to move to a bigger and better facility next year and to positively change their lives. AN ABSOLUTE MUST VISIT!!! And I havent even begun to describe the excellent food at incredibly cheap prices!
Had our last meal in Siem Reap here the food was imaginative , real quality and served perfectly. Obviously this Restaurant School is teaching their students excellence and it should be supported.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: I first heard of Sala Bai via the Sofitel bicycle promotion for their staff and decided to visit on my next trip. The principle of the school is well explained by reviewers here and on their website, it is a practical and rewarding cause offering the deserving students a real opportunity to improve their lives. We had a very good lunch, wholesome and delicious, the attendant students were understandably a little nervous but nonetheless served us well and with great charm. Spare an hour or so to visit if you can, read the website first and not only will you enjoy the food but also learn more about the school and its aims.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: True vocational training, not a "social business" - just great!
review: Book a lunch at Sala Bai! A hospitality old timer, the little Siem Reap Sala Bai Hotel School has captured my heart & soul through its commitment, tuition quality, consistency, humanity and performance. Check their website as SB closes 2-3 months in summer before greeting new students. Returning as often as possible I know them now a bit. The lunch (part of practical training) is always good and of very good value and quality. Choice of well composed Khmer or Western light set menus; I have never been disappointed. The fully inexperienced Khmer youngsters come straight from the absolutely most disfavored rural communities and show extraordinary will and pride in learning. You'd be amazed at what they can perform after a couple of initial training months - starting from literally nothing at all in terms of hospitality & what foreign or Local guests might expect. Photos from I accompanied SB social worker on very! rural field family visits. I congratulate all active and involved. And I recommend you to book a little ahead. Enjoy!

A very clean establishment training young boys and girls in the hospitality business. We read the brochure and appreciated the process more and we were more comfortable with a long wait but once the food came it was very well presented and tasty. We had this incorporated into our 7 day tour and it was a big draw card for choosing this type of tour. We had the set lunch menu and the fish which was goby madrone in an amok style was served with a refreshing salad. We had interesting drink shakes beforehand. The organiser of the school came for a showery chat with us which was pleasant and not pushy.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Orange Tiramisu, need I say more?
review: We tried this on the off chance after reading the reviews in Trip Advisor, the menu has 4 choices per course and we will be returning to try the other two, our first choices were so good.  The service is excellent (prompt but not fussy and service always from the right), the food arrives promptly, beautifully plated (scallion and chilli flowers are very cute) and an appropriate portion size. We had three courses and were full but not struggling to finish.  There is a good range of drinks to accompany the meal and the coffee is excellent, which was a pleasant surprise throughout SR, on our first trip here. This is a training school and we were near the end of their year, which could affect quality at other times but we honestly could not fault it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Relaxing multi-course set lunch, excellent food, nice crowd, attentive service, simple yet cute atmosphere
review: My fiance and I had lunch here on a Tuesday afternoon in May at the suggestion of our the congenial general manager at Heritage Suites. We were delighted to took his suggestion. We relaxed and lounged over a 75 minute multi-course lunch which amounted to $7 per person if I remember correctly. The food was excellent, the crowd pleasant, the service attentive, and the atmosphere simple yet cute. A summary of our experience is bulleted below:  KEY COMMENTS  - Excellent food!  - Market pricing relative to other comparable options (although I think it's a better deal when you figure in the large size of the set lunch compared to other lunch options out there)  - Attentive service. Look is we had spent $50 per head and a uber fancy restaurant then my opinion in this case would be different. But the students were extremely attentive (albeit a bit inexperienced as you should fully expect).  - Cute yet very simple restaurant that is part patio and part open air inside of house. All ground floor. Very simple yet cute. It was a little warm but that was to be expected on a hot humid day in May.  - Largely an expat crowd which was amiable and appeared to be regulars for the most part. I really like places that are heavily frequented by regulars. And Sala Bai is definately enjoying support from the local expat crowd which is a both necessary and great.  - Great cause. I love love love what this restaurant and training school is doing. There are some other good ones in town but this one has a very boutique and personal touch to it!

review_title: Delicious food but the servers still need more training.
review: The location is about 12mins walk from pub street. However, if you're not familiar from the place, be sure to ask for directions every now and then. Most guests take a tuktuk or hire a private van. I suggest the management should post a road sign at the corner of dela paix and taphoul street so it would be easier for people to locate it.  On the lighter note, the food was worth the trip. The beef salad and amok fish is by far the best I had tasted in Cambodia. The beef steak w/ potato was good but the beef is not tender and hard to slice (they didn't provide steak knife). The seafood w/ rice is too salty.  The server overlooked one of our orders in which we followed up after almost half hour. The manager was apologetic afterwards.  The French lady (communication manager?) approached us and all the other guests.  Overall, this trip is indeed a meal for a cause.

review_title: A little out of the way but totally worth it.
review: Sala bai is a little hidden from the busy streets of siem reap. Make sure to ask foR directions if you're gonna walk. The food was good and very well presented. The amok fish and beef salad is excellent!  However, their service is a little off. They overlooked one of our orders, and we waited for almost 30 minutes for it to be served, we followed it up and it was really overlooked. the manager was apologetic but it's really no big deal.  A French lady approached us and said she's the communication manager (?) for sala bai. She asked if the food was good and to post our comments on trip advisor.  Food was good, service is 4/5. After all, this is a training school. We came here for the good food and the server still has a lot of training to go through.  A little suggestion: I hope they would put a road sign at the corner of dela paix and Phum tapoul street so tourists who prefer to walk would find it easier.

We decided to try this restaurant for the good reviews on TripAdvisor. When we were there for lunch, some of them came in tour groups and occupied rows of tables, so clearly seats will fill up easily. Make a reservation to avoid disappointment.  The food was so-so - we ordered from the set menu so we had a choice between the Western set and the Asian set. For the price we paid, the food was not bad. It was interesting to watch the trainee staff learning on the job.  If you wish to tip them, do so at a box at the entrance of the restaurant - when we visited, they were raising money to go on a class trip together during their vacation.

review_title: Great place to visit, eat and support a good cause
review: We had a great 3 course lunch at Sala Bai. The price was only US$12 so was fabulous value for money. We loved it and the service was brilliant and very fast too. Nicely set up in a central location and well worth the visit. The staff are all in training but there is always a trainer / supervisor to ensure everything goes smoothly. They rely on a additional funds (tips) which is well worth a few dollars extra. The school is run by the students and they do a very good job.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Well-run restaurant and school, very frinedly smiling staff, we enjoyed all the dishes. Take a tuk-tuk and visit this place which helps young people less advantaged, they deserve your support.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker
review_title: A good place...for both the trainee and the guests.
review: A wise place to go. It helps training more kids to develop cambodian hospitality. It exists for years and has trained a lot of disadvantaged kids to get a proper job and to develop a dignity.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: Just having 1 lunch at the restaurant provides 1 training day for a student.....and its no hardship as the food and service was wonderful. Freshly prepared and professionally presented. A hotel and restaurant school that's been running for 10 years through donations and sponsorship. It provides young disadvantaged Cambodians free training in the hospitality industry enabling them to achieve economic independence and improve the living conditions for them and their families.

review_title: The best dining experience in Siem Reap. Providing training and jobs for 100 people a year!
review: We were staying one blok from Sala Bai and walked past every day but sadly saved our visit until the last. If we'd gone earlier we would have eaten here alot.  The restaurant and guesthouse provides comprehensive training to 100 Khmers every year - 70% of them women and all of them from very disadvantaged backgrounds. 100% of graduates (that's more than 800 people to date) have been assisted to find jobs.  The service is the best you will find in Siem Reap and the food is exceptional. You have the choice of a two or three course set menu of western or Asian persuasion or a selection of a la carte dishes.  I can't recommend this restaurant more highly. It's such a great social project - but the food and service cannot be faulted - so it's a win win choice.

review_title: Excellent service, great food, and all for a good cause.
review: My fiance and I visited Sala Bai for a quick lunch. The service was the best we have received anywhere in Siem Reap (and I have been coming here for 6 years). We were given complimentary bread with butter and bruschetta, which was excellent. I ordered the fried rice with chicken, which was the best either of us had tasted anywhere. My fiance ordered the deep fried chicken with wedges. The chicken was a little dry, but once dipped into the tartar sauce that was provided it was quite nice. All money goes towards the staff, who all come from disadvantaged backgrounds, and the organisation has so far been able to place 100% of graduates into full time work within 3 months of graduating from here. Well worth the visit!

I'm so glad I tried this place. Visiting as a solo diner on a mid week evening, I was greeted by Brian the owner and promptly seated. As a westerner the menu looked pretty traditional with a number of familiar dishes all at reasonable prices I was soon tucking into my very tasty starter washed down with a cold beer and Brian was busying himself checking in with all the diners ensuring they were happy and everything was in order. My main was equally delicious (washed down with more cold beer) So a good curry with good service for sensible money and 5 minutes from my hotel. Highly recommended

So we we went to this restaurant twice , the first not been too bad and many restaurants still been closed because of Covid decided to go back. BIG MISTAKE. The food came in drips and drabs, the owner spent more time behind his pc doing take away. And the food was dreadful. Chicken tikka masala was like Heinz Tomato with a box of chili. I could go on and on about how bad it was but would rather not dwell. Siem Reap is beautiful, and this just put a dampener on everything good.

review_title: Indian food at best with great staff serving
review: Indian food at its best with a great service The food is really well cooked added by the staff who is very welcoming and smiling they will keep asking if all is good with the food

review_title: Best Indian Food in Siem Reap
review: Mr. Narain is a wonderful host. Vastly experienced in the hospitality business, his restaurant is easily the best in Cambodia for Indian food. A great eclectic menu to satisfy all tastes, I seriously recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes quality with a great ambience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: After done some research and read some reviews for the authentic Indian Restaurant in Cambodia, we decided to choose Travancore for our late lunch.  Greeted by the owner who was really humble. Foods were fantastic! And whenever you craving for Indian food in Siem Reap, you must visit this Restaurant! Highly recommend!!

This is a relatively new Indian in Siem Reap - there are many - but I would put this in the top 3 straight away (not at number 1 though :) )  I tried something different from my usual lamb choice, Afghan Chicken from the tandoori dishes. Very fresh and succulent.  Service was great, the food came quickly and the price was on par with the competition.  Recommended.

A friend who lives in Siem Reap told us how good this place is and she was spot on!! Delicious food, great coffee and friendly staff. A winning combination. It was on the other side of town from our accommodation but worth going out of our way to find. Highly recommended.

review_title: Best place I ate in Cambodia!!
review: The food was amazing and the staff also were so lovley!! We ate breakfast one day and the homemade hash browns are incredible, the next day we had lunch and the sweet potato soup was just one of the most delicious things I've ever had!! Also they did English breakfast tea!! Big thing for a Yorkshire tea lover. I wish I had more time in siem reap so I could have tried more of the menu!!

I went to Source Cafe for lunch with a colleague the other day. The food we had was delicious. I would recommend the chicken schnitzel and the lime coconut cake! The only downside of the experience was the difficulty we had getting the staff to come to our table to order more food and correct the bill.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: This was our first stop for food when we arrived in Siem Reap. Very nice friendly staff and their veggie curry was delicious . Thank you

Ate breakfast alone one day around 8 AM and surprisingly I had the place to myself, so service was no problem. I settled for their take on eggs Benedict, served on a potato roost and not some form of bread, which was a great fusion and perfect for breakfast.  I will go back again next trip to Siem Reap, I hope they survive and it is busier next time.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.
Stopped here for breakfast and we were really pleasantly surprised by the airy place, with excellent service, tasty food and coffee and reasonable prices.

review_title: Just bumped into this place unexpected- 5 Points!
review: I actually was on my way to another cafe and saw this and had to try it which I don’t regret at all. The waiters are super nice and helpful. The cafe is big and offers a lot of space.
