The food is super yammi and worth a visit! The coffee was nice too- will be back soon. And you have to try the peanut chocolate bar- such a tasty sin!!!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: the New Hope is a restaurant within a school compound, supporting the kids here. nice food and kind staff. we had a lovely lunch here. watch out for the signs along the dirt road to find the place when you turn off the paved road.

Not only is this a great restaurant but it's a wonderful concept. To train disadvantaged Cambodian kids in the hospitality industry is super, and it's an overall wonderful experience. The food is delicious and we were treated so well - the staff are fantastic- we had a wonderful evening.

The restaurant is a bit off the beaten track, but well worth the visit. We had the set Khmer menu. We had our first taste of fried crickets (appetizer) and the wontons were excellent. All in all a lovely meal in nice surroundings and on top of it for a good cause.

My girlfriend found this awesome place just 3 minutes far from our guesthouse. That was a brillant idea: the food was excellent, the bill so cheap and the restaurant is part of a program supporting children education. A distinguished Australian man (one of the volunteer) explained us the mission of this amazing non-government organisation, focusing on providing free education, health care and community development service to the people of Mondul Bai. So do not esitate: join New Hope Cambodia Restaurant for a meal and you will never regret it.

We ended up this place through G-Adventures. Seriously the best lunch i’ve had here in Cambodia so far. We got different types of food so we could taste it all. It was so delicious that’s almost impossible to describe it. The favorite was actually the vegetarian carrot and potato curry. The staff there was so friendly and nice. I also enjoyed the part about kids playing around right outside, they looked so happy. The money they earn at this restaurant goes for an education for the children but since the food and service was unbelievable good; the trip here made it really worth spending extra money on some souvenir stuff and donations. I’m amazed about this whole concept and experience. Keep up the good work you guys!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover;Eco-tourist
review_title: Excellent food and you help local people
review: Excellent food and on top of that you help local people as the restaurant belongs to a school and students cook and serve you. You do a good action and you have delicious local food! A bit difficult to find but with a tuktuk there is no problem! Do not hesitate and go there!

review_title: Lovely food with an added bonus of helping many people
review: As we were in a group the food was served all together at once. Each dish was different to the other and equally as tasty. Restaurant off the beaten track which was a lot of fun to get to on a tuc tuc in the dark. And of course, your money is going towards education and healthcare to the people in Cambodia that need it, which is just the icing on the cake. A real must when visiting Siem Reap.
Ate here as part of my G Adventure tour in Cambodia. Food was good. The area is economically depressed however this place offers hope. It's good to give back.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Went to new hope with our G Adventures Tour. School was out so we didn't get to meet any students but still got to hear of the great work they do. The service and food were outstanding. Loved the snacks for starters. A few tried the fried crickets. The drinks were all very good. Great time was had by all.

review_title: Perfect way to end our tour of Cambodia.
review: Our tour group headed out to the New Hope restaurant as a farewell dinner to our tour of Vietnam and Cambodia and it was a perfect setting and a delicious meal. The young girl (sorry can't remember her name) gave us a lovely welcome and a summary of what the training restaurant is all about, as it teaches unemployed/uneducated Khmer students valuable cooking and hospitality skills. We had a set menu which made it so much easier not having to decide what to eat, we also had a mixture of beers, wines and cocktails all at very reasonable prices. The food was excellent and plentiful with excellent service. The evening was a pleasant experience for all of us, what a way to finish our holiday in a local setting. Thank you to all at the restaurant for a very memorable experience one we look back on fondly.

review_title: A little goes a long way
review: We went here for dinner and a look around as part of our G Adventures tour. Fantastic initiative with what they are achieving here. Great meal with local musician and a very good explanation of what New Hope does for the poorer areas of Cambodia.The chefs are trained at the restaurant as part of the help program. Bit of a reality check to be honest. A little goes a long way indeed. You must visit here.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This is not going to be your 5 star restaurant you're looking for but it is full of amazing people trying to give the Cambodian people a better life by teaching them English and how to cook, the food was really good and the people extremely kind, if you want a decent meal and to help peoples education and life then I fully recommend you get involved as it also helps toward the mini hospital and school they have there.

We enjoyed an afternoon at the New Hope site starting off with a delicious lunch cooked by the trainee chefs. You will need to book in advance as it's a training restaurant and they often have large groups in the evening so we opted to come for lunch instead. Its not near town, so you will need to grab a Tuk Tuk to take you there. The food is good but what makes this so memorable is the cause it supports- free education and healthcare for the local community. After our lunch we spent some time with children in their classes (this is optional ) and absolutely loved it. Would recommend it to anyone.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker
review: I had the pleasure of visiting New Hope as part of a recent business trip. The food was excellent, as was the service. The New Hope project is providing some wonderful opportunities within the local community, and i would definitely recommend anybody visiting Siem Reap to pay a visit for themselves .

This was the venue for the final evening of our tour of Vietnam and Cambodia and it was a fantastic choose by our travel company. The food was delicious and my husband even ate the crickets. The staff are delightful and make the whole experience even more enjoyable.

This is a training restaurant for disadvantaged and marginalised youth.  Food was OK and simple, but tasty. Only small gripe is that the courses came out a little too quickly.  The concept is brilliant, educate the youth and they will improve themselves which will improve the country.  Needs our support.  But beware the road in and out - some potholes held together with bits of road.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Run by the New Hope founder's wife, this excellent restaurant serves as a training ground for the school's students without sacrificing quality. In fact, our lunches at New Hope were highlights of our culinary adventures in Siem Reap. Both traditional Cambodian food and westernized items are available on the varied menu--all are well prepared with great attention given to service and presentation. The various fruit shakes are awesome, and I was impressed with the quality of their gourmet coffee selections (and I am VERY picky in this area).  The system behind this NGO facility is most impressive. A large number of volunteers assist the school regularly, but at its core lie a dedicated staff of locals committed to developing Cambodia's youth. The more you learn about the cause, the more you will want to seek this incredible restaurant out. It is well worth the effort to get away from the usual tourist venues and make your way through the city's backroads to sample this restaurant's offerings and get to meet some truly remarkable people.

review_title: Out of city but worth a visit - alone to support the noble cause...
review: Reaching NEW HOPE is little bumpy but worth. For me it was a great experience to visit this place. Though I did not have any appointment I was greeted by Mr. Kemsour and he took time to show me what the NGO is doing to make life of poor people from rural areas.  I had lunch and some drink and both were great. There are possibilities to become a sponser of this NGO. The NGO helps those people who are really helpless. I witnessed distribution of rice and other basic groceries to poor people from rural areas. They do keep a watch on families that they do not misuse the donated things.  May God bless New Hope NGO.  By visiting this place you support the NGO!!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review_title: More than just a first class training restaurant
review: I have had many many meals at this restaurant as a volunteer at New Hope Cambodia and I have never had a meal I didn't like. Coffee Banana shake is to die for, Red Chicken curry is a must, too many to list. Great value for money, awesome service. A+++

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I'm just back from a 10 day trip to Cambodia and was lucky enough to visit the New Hope Cambodia project. While I was there I had lunch in the training restaurant - the food was excellent and the service was first class. If you're staying in Siem Reap a visit here is a must - you'll have something delicious to eat, you'll be served by friendly and welcoming staff and you'll be helping a truly inspirational project raise much needed funds. Take a look at the New Hope Cambodia website to see what they are doing - it's amazing.

Some confusion as I am told there are two identical restaurants, anyway we at at the Borei on the 4th floor. A standard western menu but the food was good quality and the staff were excellent. Enjoy......

review_title: Cambodian food with a French flair
review: When we checked in, we were told there were two fine dining restaurants on property: one that served mostly western style food, and one that served Cambodian food.  We took door #2.  Dinner was served in a nicely decorated room, with classic jazz playing in the background – Miles Davis and Thelonious Monk.  The Khmer Savory Menu looked like a great deal – 55 USD with wine parings.  First a tempura oyster with three sauces. Small, but it was supposed to be just a taste.  Next came two kinds of fish cakes, with three garnishes: one a pickled papaya and onion; a raw green papaya salad; and purple cabbage. Everything was arranged on top of three spicy sauces and diced tomatoes.  This was followed by a chicken soup served over a mix of steamed and fresh vegetables.  We were served a mango intermezzo; and then the entrees. I selected the wok stir fried beef and vegetables, and my wife ordered the river bar fish. We traded off and agreed they were both excellent.  The meal was accompanied by fresh baked baguettes and two kinds of flavored butter.  We finished with a warm tapioca pudding, with diced bananas and a spoon of coconut ice cream.  At the end of the evening we decided it had far exceeded our expectations for food quality, presentation, and value. The overall amount of food was fine, and all the wine parings were appropriate.  Service was attentive, but not intrusive; and the pace was perfect.

review_title: Amazing breakfast when booked Privilege Floor
review: We stayed at the Privilege Floor and with that includes an A La Carte Breakfast instead of the Buffet downstairs. The restaurant is set in simply lovely surroundings. The staff actually make the experience even more memorable. We would like to thank Lorm Lin, Toun Vuthy and Srey Keun and the rest of the staff here who’s name elude me at the moment for their wonderful service every morning. The Eggs Benedict is so tasty I couldn’t stop having it, even my wife who usually avoids it couldn’t help herself. But really it’s the staff once again who make our breakfast so memorable.

review_title: Dammar Lounge Fine DIning - The BEST in Siem Reap for fine dining! Don't miss it!
review: My husband and I recently had dinner at Damak Lounge on two occasions on our past trip to Siem Reap. It’s elegant and very tasteful. A hidden gem in Siem Reap! Perfect decor and a lovely staff. We’ve had dinner here in the past and it was awesome but some menu items have changed and it’s a “must do” if in Siem Reap. You won’t find this quality of dining anywhere else. Upon arrival you are guided by a host and taken by elevator to the second floor - the Privileged Floor by Lotus Blanc where Damak Lounge is located. My husband is on a special diet and they saw to his every need. Kanika our host made our first reservation while explaining all the amenities in the area. The restaurant has an extensive wine list as well as cocktails. I had champagne and it was heavenly. There’s no rush, couples and families at tables chatting and celebrating in a low tone. Extremely top shelf. Last year when we were there they had live music but this time a nice selection of soft music playing. I’m writing my review and wishing we were there now! One night we were pretty tired so we ordered and our meal was delivered to our room. It was perfect. If you want something that’s not on the menu, just tell them, and it will happen. Mr. Jacky suggested Damak Lounge along with a couple other places. But Damak Lounge was a home run! Don’t miss it!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Never easy to describe a solo experience....so let's be factual Done the booking from Sofitel and arrived around 8.30pm The restaurant is strangely located at the end of a hotel corridor with rooms... Once there 8 tables were occupied, all tables for 2 except a table of 5...half of them already finished their dinner. Hostess and waiters were friendly.... order a bottle of French Rosé.....arrived 25 mn later.. Order a starter to share (use even google to be sure of U 10 blue shrimps with the waiter) and 2 mains...starter never arrived. Oxtails soup was really good The duck was perfectly cook but for the rice it was totally the opposite. Staff again was friendly... but not focus...
Khmer Food preparation is excellent and so is the hospitality. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Especial thanks to Chef, Puthea and Mr Reaksa, for looking after us. Great experience.
We were a party of 6 staying at the Lotus Blanc. Great service, fantastic food. A must do, a treat!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Fantastic!!! Excellent food, artistically presented. Great great service. It is expensive (like a fine dining in the western world), but this experience is a must!
The service, food and atmosphere here are all first class. Watching the sunset while sipping cocktails on the terrace is truly relaxing.

We had a nice quiet dinner. Fine dinning. Menu is not very large. Khmer and French option. I would recommend to have a nice dinner , out of the crowds in a very nice setting. Very nice presentation and outstanding service.

Oh so impressed with the dishes served on this visit. But take care finding the new location. If searching then make sure you find the “restaurant AND BAR” as there is another place now using a shortened name and it comes up first. The real POU is north of road number 6, whereas the clone is on wat bo road. The atmosphere is calming and pleasant, staff unobtrusive, prices are surprisingly low and the food is heavenly. Very very impressed. I live local so I will definitely visit again.
Small restaurant / café / bar with an ever so friendly lady serving the tables. Go there for delicious Nom Krok (coconut “pancakes”) - delicious!

This is a lovely restaurant with a really interesting menu and beautiful tasting and presented food - we even received an amuse bouche. The waitresses are keen to explain the menu and meals - all using local authentic produce. The kitchen is open so you could see your food being freshly prepared and was immaculately clean. Definitely worth a visit.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: This restaurant was recommended to us by another restaurant owner in Siem Reap. We went and weren’t disappointed! We had a chance to meet the owner and sample some of his delicious food. The chicken skewers, the dumplings and the coconut dessert were all amazing. Not only was the food great but the presentation was beautiful.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: This is a unique restaurant for its truly outstanding food and the chef behind it all, a national celebrity who trains aspiring chef. He himself was trained in Siem Reap and uses his grandmother’s recipes to create delicious dishes based on tradicional Cambodian food fused with South East Asian stuff. A absolutely adore the grilled chicken with the sweet potato and coconut milk mash, and the grilled rice balls/dumplings with chive. There are a lot of dishes for the more adventurous palate also, using local herbs and roots. All very very delicious indeed and very reasonably priced. On this trip to Siem Reap I visited 4 times in one week.

review_title: The Best of the Khmer Fusion
review: My Grilled River Fish was perfect, presentation pleasing to the palate and the service as always good. I made sure to go upstaris and thank the chef )s)

review_title: Heartwarming Hospitality and innovative Menu by one of Cambodia's Best Chef
review: Maung Maung the owner of Beyond Yangon reminded me that I must eat at POU meaning uncle in Khmer by the celebrated young chef Mork Mengly. Once I went there, I ate there so many times, trying out various dishes in the menu, all innovative, all fusion Khmer with eye catching presentation . There are many restaurants in Siem Reap but POU has earned its distinctive star along with other gourmet restaurants like Malis and Khema. It is very vegetarian friendly. The menu harbours a limited number of extremely delicious items. I highly recommend this place. It is casual, near Wat Damnak and manager may be present at times as he manages the other POU, great to meet the CHEF who usually is at the other resto but i met him here. Hong is a wonderful server and she deserves credit for the service and people coming back to the pleasant kind khmer atmosphere

You should not come to Siem Reap and miss out on eating here. Gourmet local food at local prices. This place would thrive in NYC. Try the mackerel. Very clean, great menu, great staff, easy to find. If you’re staying at a four or five star hotel you’ll feel right at home eating here.

The food was quite tasty and had special flavour. The fusion of Asian cuisine brought out a most interesting flavour. There was however one blemish in that the most costly item based around crab was a big disappointment as the taste of crab was absent. . the service was good except that the starter was served after the main course.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: East Meets West in a cultural fusion of well prepared, thoughtful and affordable cuisine There are vegetarian option and options for those not so daring and for those wanting adventurous food there are good choices too. .

This is a very unassuming restaurant. It looks a bit like a hole in the wall, we had to check TripAdvisor twice to make sure it was the right one.  The food was amazing, nice presentation and quick friendly service. Prices were reasonable.  We had the curried crab gravy with noodles. The surprise came with the local vegetables. Tiny chopped green beans, lotus stalk and other vegetables that I was not familiar with. The serving was more than enough for one person.  We also had pork belly and egg noodles. There were 3 thinly sliced vegetables added to the dish.  We were sorry to have found this restaurant on our last day in Cambodia. It is definitely worth returning to.

We met a wonderful guy at a shop in Siem Reap who recommended Pou to us. We are so glad we listened because it was our most memorable meal there. The dishes are all presented beautifully and the food is so fresh and delicious. You might end up trying something you never thought you would ;) if you go by tuk tuk it’s a little hard to spot, but just pull it up on the map before you head out and you should be fine.

A local expat recommended Pou and i was staying near by. The service was friendly and very efficient. I had a river fish dish which was well cooked and some spice on the side. The highlight of the meal though was the ginger dessert...amazing. I almost had a second dessert.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Its grilled chicken Khmer style with mashed sweet potato goes down as one of my top 10 meals. Its owner, one of Cambodia’s top chefs, tries to promote real countryside cuisine based on recipes which have been passed down through generations. The result is a creative display of interesting stuff and a delicious feast of flavours. It gets extremely busy at night so I preferred lunches. Prices are very reasonable. Not to be missed. Try some of the very creative cocktails created using tradicional Cambodian stuff like local Whisky and palm sugar.

We had lunch at Pou Restaurant. The pork noodles was nice and we wish the portion could be more. I like the sauce which they used for the noodles. The waitress and waiter were very attentive, they would top up your iced water. Lots of flies when we visit in June so we were busy waving our hands above our food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Pou comes across as very unassuming and just another streetside café, but the food is inspirational. The chicken with the mashed sweet potato was amazing.

review_title: Best experience in Fusion Street Food !
review: I am Chef by myself since long time, and I am always looking for good Kitchens around the world. And here I found one of them !!! Best Quality of Ingredients , friendly and warm heartedly Staff, quick Servic and a very high qualified Chef, who take care about his Guest personally! Highly recommended!!

review_title: Wow. We’ve missed this kind of food!
review: The service is great, the food is great and the location is very central.  Ok, there are cheaper places to eat, but these guys know what they’re doing.  My missus had the mackerel that was packed with flavour and also had a nice bit of heat.  I had the chicken curry that was unbelievable! The sweet potato was a kind of smooth sauce and the whole thing was a kind of deconstructed massaman curry.  Overall it was amazing. You should go.  Ps. $23 for 2 main courses, 2 gins, a starter and main course. Bargain.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Lovely small restaurant - close to the centre, yet quiet - excellent value
review: We followed the advice from some ‘in the know’ and had lunch at the lovely small restaurant. Pou serves both local and fusion dishes. We had the very tasty deboned chicken - crispy skin and very tender meat. Highly recommended. The chef and owner advised us on what to eat. He speaks excellent English.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: The ability to produce fantastic food from a tiny kitchen never ceases to amaze me. Pou Restaurant and Bar accomplishes this quite well! We joined to friends for dinner one evening, but had to sit at separate tables because they had reservations and we did not. Yes it is that small. We made reservations for the six of us for the following evening, and were accommodated on one of their two larger tables.  Both dining experiences were fantastic. The Khmer chicken was excellent both times our table tried it. Also, the ginger tapioca dessert is something I’m going to try to duplicate at home. The creative menu and the use of local leaves, herbs, and flowers, sets this restaurant above many of the great places we tried during our travels to Singapore, Thailand, and Cambodia during this trip.  Yes, the staff may be a little disorganized at times, the kitchen is on the second floor, and the staircase is quite steep. But there’s a lot of love in this kitchen, and a lot of love in the presentation of the food, and I don’t think there’s anything better you can ever say about a restaurant.

If you want to try something different of gourmet standards at very reasonable prices this is the place . I had an amazing meal here, the chef himself came to talk to me to explain the menu which is Cambodian with an international twist . Everything I had was amazing . The ambience is nice and cosy and the service is perfect . Away from the madness of pub street and close to the river , this is definitely a must place to try!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: One of my best meals ever and a wonderful discovery. Food is reasonably priced, and very very good. I would say Michelin-star quality: very innovative, wonderfully presented and just extremely tasty. I loved the spicy chicken wings in a delicious curry sauce and the Cambodian grilled chicken served with a fabulous sweet potato and coconut mash. Shall return tomorrow. The chef is well known in the local circle and is highly regarded. Is something who will be around for a long time creating wonderful dishes.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Beach Goer
review_title: Our best meal in Siem Reap
review: This was a lovely restaurant. We sat outside in the garden area which was lovely and really relaxing. We had great cocktails and the food was delicious. Stayed a while after eating with a couple more cocktails and did not feel hassled to leave. The price was very reasonable, not the cheapest place to eat in SR but, considering the quality of the food and the atmosphere, definitely good value and we both agreed Urban Tree was our favourite restaurant during our stay in Siem Reap.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Recommended by our tour guide, this was a great little find. Fresh food and great service. Nice outside seating area, take mossie spray as very humid. Recommend the pad Thai, would come again great staff.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We only came here because our Thai restaurant choice was closed. On entering the restaurant I had no idea what was behind the facade, which looks pretty ordinary, and said I wanted to eat inside. The waiter politely sugggested outside would be better and led me around the side of the building. I was really amazed, they have unique swing-mattress, bed like tables (though you can choose a normal table if you want) that make you feel like it is a high end restaurant in Marrakech (the last time I saw anything like this). So we were super comfortable and our toddler was in her element. The food was also great, the drinks wonderful and the prices, even with the 10% added at the end, crazy low given the ambience and environment. We will be back!
It was like eating in an oasis! Tables are dotted around this beautiful, winding garden creating very secluded and atmospheric spaces. Food and service was good and the prices were reasonable.
Wonderful. Lemon grass is used for a very unique straw for drinks. Food and service are excellent. Delicious soup and roasted eggplant with pork. Can’t wait to return to try other dishes.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: What a romantic garden restaurant in a lush tropical setting! (they also provide indoor ac space) If it wouldn't have been for the somewhat "dreamy" service (no change available, not responsive, did not check on us later) I would have given 5 stars. Raw spring rolls are delicious, fried spring rolls a little bland, not the proper sweet-sour sauce served, no red ants available for the beef salad, fish amok was very good, small pieces of white fish.

This restaurant is a bit far from the crowded and noisy pub street, which is a good thing for people that chose siem reap for the temples and to relax. The food is good and very cheap.the staff is nice and the space is very simple but well decorated. A place to visit.

review_title: Delicious food in a lovely setting
review: Once we tried this restaurant we just kept coming back making our way through their delicious menu. We particularly liked the fresh spring rolls, the Pad Thai and eggplant with pork dish. The deserts are good too! Try for yourselves.
Took us a while to get there as we are on the other side of SR but was well worth it. Tasty food, good drinks!

user_tags: Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Has a wonderful outdoor courtyard and small AC indoor dining room. Passion fruit mojitos are good. Had 2 drinks, salad and entree for $11. Good mix of Asian and Western dishes.

Off the normal track is this fantastic green hideaway that offer lounge dining in big seats with fantastic service and delicious food.  We had heard good things and weren’t disappointed. The atmosphere and surroundings are nice and relaxing.  Staff are attentive and helpful and could not fault them.  Were bought some complimentary sweet potato chips while our order was made which were great.  Well worth visiting and would recommend for those looking to leave pub street for a meal.
We went here for dinner after skipping lunch at Angkor Wat and it was worth the hunger. Food was excellent! Staff was friendly! The place is well decorated and cozy! Commended!!

review_title: Extremely reasonably priced restarunt with good food - RECOMMENDED
review: Went here as a family of four - two adults and two teenagers Went due to reviews on TA and our locality  Restaraunt has very interesting setting with plants and pillars and also raised seating for casual eating. Quite atmospheric  We took a standard table - note they are low down but was no issue for us. Drinks great. Service extremely humble and careful and was nice.  One interesting point was we were offered mosquito spray- don’t kenos if this was particular to this restaraunt bu very practical because they are about in the evenings here  Food was of a particularly good standard given the cost. Had Tom Yum Soup, red curry and Pad Thai and was extremely good  Bill came it about £30 all in with drinks  Can not fault the value. Highly recommended

review_title: Reasonably priced food in a beautiful garden setting
review: The price of the food was reasonable considering the beautiful setting of the restaurant. $10.50 for 2 meals and a drink. We were served fairly quickly and the service was friendly. I would definitely visit again.

review_title: Fabulous food at a cozy place
review: We went there twice in our 4 day stay at Siem Reap as we liked it so much. Kids loved the relaxed seating arrangement and it was so convenient to keep them occupied with the books available for reading at the restaurant. Food was delicious for incredible little price and the portion sizes were adequate. Would highly recommend this place for anyone visiting Siem Reap.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Our best meal in Siem Reap
review: This restaurant was close to our acccomodation. We didn’t have a booking, but we were shown to a romantic table on its own amongst the trees and garden. Pretty lights lit up the garden. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful. Our food was brought at just the right time. My fish amok was delicious as was my husband’s chicken red curry. Prices were cheap. Would really recommend this restaurant

simply an amazing restaurant. Here is another example of a social profit agency that works the restaurant business and puts $$$ back into the community. You just have to go there. The food, music, decor, ambience and customer service is Outstanding.

review_title: Pleasant surprise for our first night in SR
review: We went to Urban Tree Hut in a group of 7 and had a wonderful dinner. The staff were all lovely, very hospitable and the senior waitstaff all had impeccable English.  The dining areas are very spacious and comfortable and I would definitely come here again. The prices were extremely reasonable. Our bill for 7 people with food and beers came to $45. Highly recommend.

We dined here with a group of friends, we were pretty impressed with their service, my friend and i went up singing our favourite song and the guitarist is pretty talented, she can entertain us with many songs.  This is a pretty great place for hanging out with friends and family, you have all you need and very good atmosphere! Price is pretty Cheap!

It was my 60th birthday and we celebrated in style. Food was amazing and the staff very helpful. I was treated to a signature cocktail by the staff. I would certainly go back. Very reasonably priced. Well worth a visit

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: Excelent choice. Beautiful decoration, you can be inside with air conditioning or outside, in a beautiful terrace. very clean place, delicious food and outstanding service..

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: The friendliest most attentive Restaurant in Siem Reap!
review: Well where do we start? The service! We were treated like kings and queens by all the staff, especially Bopha, Sokun and Pon, who could not have been more attentive. The food was contemporary with a local Khmer touch. After quite some nights previously of enjoying a host of Cambodian dinners and meals, which we loved by the way, we chose this evening to opt for some Australian and Cambodian steaks which were cooked to perfection! The food was reasonably priced, as were the drinks. Thoroughly recommend and a memorable evening

review_title: You can get better food for the same price elsewhere...
review: Food was ok - nothing special - although the presentation is immaculate. As we asked for all the dishes at the same time, two of them came cold. Service was great, air-con works well which is nice in the heat.

review_title: Good food, good service, at a good price
review: We had a very enjoyable dinner and time at this place. We had the chicken spring rolls as a starter. A t-bone and a tenderloin as mains. And several margaritas.  The service is attentive and very friendly.  A bread plate is served which looks just like cut sliced bread but is in fact quite nice and we had a second helping.  The spring rolls were good and the accompanying sauce is not overly sweet as is often the case, but not here.  The t-bone was very nice. A bit of char and smoky flavour. It was ordered medium-rare and came slightly over but it was still heartily enjoyed.  The tenderloin was a much thicker cut and also ordered medium-rare. It came slightly under.  The presentation of the steaks and the condiments is excellent.  The margaritas were very good and generous with the tequila.  Coffees and more banter with the staff finished a very enjoyable night and our best meal in Siem Reap over three days.  The food for the price plus the service makes this place a winner. Slight variances in done-ness of the meat did not detract enough for us. We would return to this place anytime we are in Siem Reap.

I found the restaurant in trip advisor and give it a try. 100% thumbs up. The service was very attentive and friendly. We take steak which was very delicious. The beverage especially the Wine selection is ok, we select the Pinot Noir which was slightly to warm for my taste. Overall we are satisfied and recommend the restaurant. Also finally the bill was compared to other restaurants in this service and quality level on the lower end. In total we spend for 4 person around 115 $.

My wife and I dined here three evenings and we were very happy with each meal. The portions were large, we never left hungry, usually unable to eat all that was on our plate. The staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable and spoke very good English. By our third stop there our server even remembered our prefered drink requests. It is a very nice place to eat and right downtown so you are close to everything.
I visited Try Me a few times whilst in SR. Good, simple food. Reasonably. Priced. Positive vibe from the staff. There is a reason I kept coming back - it was nearby and consistently good.

review_title: Panang Chicken and Beef Lak Lok outstanding
review: My wife and I called in this restaurant by chance and very pleased we did. Prices are very good for food. We had a couple of starters that came out quickly after our drinks and waired for our main meals of Panang Chicken and Beef Lak Lok which we shared and both agreed it was probably the best we've had all week, and was Outstanding. We sat up staies which had a good mix of languages and cultures all having a good time. The service was quick and efficient and watchful of things we might want without hanging around. If we go back to Siem Reap we would go back.

review_title: Nice place with greenery at the front and ceiling fans. Free WiFi. I came here for breakfast and had a bacon baguette
review: Nice place with greenery at the front and ceiling fans. Free WiFi. I came here for breakfast and had a bacon baguette for $2.25

Lots of really good restaurants on Tapul road and this is one of them. Great prices, selection and quality, I had the chicken cordon bleu and it was delicious. Huge portion and great value. Service is excellent
We tried the local food here and it was delicious, especially the fish amok. It's not expensive but fantastic!

review_title: Try it! Excellent food and great prices
review: We dined here 4 times during our stay in Siem Reap. Especially loved their Lok Lak, Khmer curry and cool fresh fruit shakes. The servings were generous, authentic dishes, service with a smile, always friendly and fast. Great atmosphere, cooling with fans and cheap Cambodian draf beers. Highly recommended for Khmer food with very reasonable prices - felt like we were robbing them!!!

review_title: Tasty food at very reasonable prices
review: This was one of the most value-for-money dinner we had in our 7 day stay. Almost everything we ordered was good. Fried spring rolls, morning glory, amok were our all time favourites in almost all restaurants, and Try Me did not disappoint us on these. Portions of rice that came were huge. The lemon mint lemonade and Khmer pumpkin sago dessert was especially notable. For all 5 of us, the total bill came up to just $21 with drinks.  Both bathrooms ran out of water and had no water running from the taps. The WC flush still worked but not the taps at the basins. The staff filled up a pail with water for us to wash our hands instead. Apart from this, would recommend a visit.  If you are facing Caltex petrol kiosk (there is only one Caltex in Siem Reap), take the road on the left of Caltex. Keep going down this road and Try Me is there.
My wife and I had fish amok and watermelon juice here for lunch. The amok was tasty and had an amazing quantity of fish, unlike most ither places. Definitely worth a visit.

The hotel's breakfast was terrible so an alternative had to be found. This place has several European breakfast choices but you can order whatever you want from the menu at anytime. Great coffee and a wide range of fruit drinks are on offer as well. A good place to sit and watch the world go by.

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: We went here several times as a group as it can seat over 50 without too much of a stretch. Even with so many people, the food all arrived quite quickly and all hot. Meals were lovely. I was not keen on their version of chicken and cashews, but others raved over it. The restaurant was clean and the attendants all very attentive.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Made it a point to visit this place after reading all the reviews about it! I was there on a quiet night and opted to sit on the upper floor so that I could have a good view of the street. There was a great selection of Western and local cuisine on the menu. I had the local lok lak since I have not tried it yet and ordered a shake as well. The shake is very cheap, at only US$1 and it is soooooo goooood! Food is not expensive either. I did not regret stepping into this place and wanted to visit it again but did not have another opportunity since my trip was a short one. But will definitely visit again if I ever go back to Siem Reap! Highly recommended for anyone visiting Siem Reap!

This was the last restaurant I ate in before leaving Siem Reap. I had just finished a whole day of temple tour so I worked up my appetite for this and it was so worth it. Food was amazing indeed! Both flavor and serving size was big! We ordered amok, lok lak and tom yum soup plus lime cucumber (not sure what the name was) shake. If only I had more days there, I would definitely keep trying out their other dishes. Can't wait to eat here again when I come back to Siem Reap.

I went to this restaurant because of the recommendation of TripAdvisor. It turns to it is worth to have a try in this restaurant. The prices of food are low compared with those restaurants close to sightseeing spots. Nothing to complain about the taste. I think this is the best taste among food I’ve tried in Siem Reap.good service and value. Highly recommend!

Went to this place to have dinner after a Long day, and boy was I impressed. We had a crispy spring rolls to start with, and they were amazingly crispy and the filling tasted great. I had the panang chicken with rice, and the gravy tasted like good old home cooking, it paired really well with the rice. My friend had the Lok Lak Beef, which tasted really good as well, savoury and peppery sauce covered the tender beef slices. The ice lime tea was very refreshing in the humid weather. Owner was also very friendly. Would come back again whenever I’m in Siem reap!

It was just across our hotel so we went to give it a try. We were very satisfied so we returned tomorrow also. First day we had local food, curry chicken and lok lak beef, and the other day western food, pork chops and chicken cordon blue. Everything was very tasty, affordable and fast. Staff is also nice, atmosphere relaxed. Try it, you won’t be dissappinted.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I went there with a family according to the good reviews on TripAd, and we were not deceived at all. Food is excellent and well presented. Better going there before eight at night.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: A little gem of a restaurant. Great and quick service, brilliant cocktails and lovely food. Not expensive either.
We went to Try Me off the reviews and werent disappointed. Very tasty - especially the fish curry - quick, great service and cheap! Three mains, three beers and two cocktails was US$27. Great job!

user_tags: Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: 4 of us went here based on reviews but it wasn't that great. Our eyes were stinging from the cooking as we sat close to the counter. Out of 4 one enjoyed there meal. The food was inexpensive but not the best quality.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review_title: great deal and delicious food on a quiet street
review: this restaurant has very good reviews and is located walking distance from our hotel so we gave it a try. it was a really good choice, forget about the vibe of pub street. the neighbourhood is quiet and food is really nice. we tried both fish amok and lok lak and they were really tasty. recommended!
We were really happy that there was place for us to eat here. I had the best lok lak (beef with rice) of the whole Cambodia trip.

review_title: Best Pick, cheaper and Hidden Gem
review: We found this little gem after 4 days of our stay in Siem reap. Its the best among all the hotels we had. Taste is very different and soothing.  Recommend this hotel. We were really sad that we found it this hotel very late. We went there based on the reviews and it was worth the effort. Litle difficult to find the area as it is 10 min walk from pub street.

Try Me was only metres from my hotel so putting my faith in TA I gave it a try. No table: probably a good sign. Next night wandered back a bit earlier and was luckier. Lok lak was delicious, service excellent and at a very fair price.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Ok so we only ate in one other restaurant but when you find something so good you just don't need to go anywhere else.  The food is traditional, its very tasty and good sized portions, the staff are awesome an polite.  Try the Khmer Curry or the Amok as these dishes are fantastic  To note this is excellent value for money and considerably under-priced compared to the other places that we checked out  Arrive early as well as this place gets busy and we saw many people disappointed and had to eat elsewhere

review_title: We came back for dinner every night of our stay in Siem Reap
review: Friendly staff serving food cooked from the heart. Very sincere food which tasted spectacular. We went back for dinner every night and even celebrated my parents' anniversary there with them :) My husband only orders Ginger chicken but I would also recommend trying their khmer curry, amok fish and black pepper beef!

Great food, kind attentive service in a lovely serene setting. Reasonably priced menu. We always dine here when visiting Siem Reap. Would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone wishing to try excellent Khmer food. Booking recommended as it is very popular.

review_title: ATTN: Location wrong on Grab as at early Aug 22.
review: This restaurant has changed premises. When I got a grab there, it went to their old location. Fortunately it was a walk of only 8 minutes to the new location, but something to note. The location on Google Maps is Correct.  Had spring roll for starter.The appetiser options were mostly salads, so some additional variety would be welcome.  Beef for main which was very tasty and well presented.  Nice, simple, elegant decor.  Be aware that as at Aug 22 it's cash payment only.

review_title: Great Khmer Food at very reasonable prices
review: This is a new Siem Reap restaurant recommenced to us by a local. Offering Khmer street food with a twist, plated like a 5 star restaurant.  Started with the Siem Reap Platter for 2, followed by Prawn Salad & Battambang sausage. All really tasty. Also had a “fresh & tasty” cocktail which was superb and the Australian Chardonnay was also good  We ate early (6.30) so were the only ones there.  Service was great, with each dish explained by Nab the owner, and he introduced the two other staff on that night doing the cooking.  This is our 3rd visit to Siem Reap so we have eaten at a lot of places. Will definitely be going back to this one.

Mano and Henri did everything to make this a memorable night. Great food and a taste of the Khmer culture dancing . Very well priced and should be on your to do list. We had a group of 32 and we were treated like old friends.

Art Shadow Restaurant made for a pleasant evening with family. The service and level of hospitality was second to none. The willingness to swap and change the menu to suit was very much appreciated. The dance show was brief but again pleasant and easy to watch while eating dinner. The food was acceptable and certainty edible in most parts ( except the soup) Highlight was the cocktails.  All in all a pleasant evening that will not break the bank.  TIP: ensure your Tuk Tuk drivers waits or comes back for you. There are no Tuk tuks that hang around the site after the show so you could get stuck.
The restaurant is very good and we really enjoyed the show. Staff is very nice and attentive. Good reception. Special thanks to Mew (Nhev) for her outstanding service.

review_title: Example of how Tripadvisor can be manipulated
review: After reading all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, my wife and I booked dinner here while we were in Siem Reap. The welcome and entrance to the restaurant created a great atmosphere and the setting is certainly beautiful.  But, the menu pricing seems designed to push you towards one of the set menus, with a couple available at each of a number of price points. Trying to building your own 3-course meal from the a la carte menu is considerably more expensive. So we went with the set menu and our meals were ok, but the portions were small and you can get better value for money elsewhere. The wine list is limited and very expensive.  The main reason for dining here though is the show, and that was very enjoyable (if a little brief). The thing is, once the show was finished (which was early in the evening) we got the sense that we were meant to leave, as the wait staff stopped attending to tables.  Before that though, we noticed how all of the wait staff, who were certainly very chatty and friendly, were putting a lot of pressure on the patrons to write a glowing Tripadvisor review, before they even left the restaurant! Our waitress was quite insistent that we write a review that mentioned her by name (which I won't do here as I don't want her to get into trouble).  Although we would recommend this restaurant as an option for a night out in Siem Reap, we also don't feel that it should be ranked as highly as it is.

review_title: Great hospitality, Great food with added entertainment
review: Went to the Art Shadow Restaurant due to the great reviews on TA and the fact that they had live music and dancing.  The welcome we received was second to none. Every drink and meal course we were bought was presented with our names. (How does is to eat every server and the barman remember our names?)  We went for one of the set menus as it makes us eat dishes we would not ordinarily order. Most were fantastic. The rest were good.  The setting for the restaurant was lovely. Trees and a pond in front of the stage. The music and the dancing, provided at no extra charge was really pleasant and the be costumes bright and colourful. Made for a really pleasant evening. Bora was particularly attentive with good conversation between courses.  Can highly recommend. We will most likely come back before we leave in 3 days time.

We found this restaurant on trip adviser and thought we would give it a go as it sounded different. It certainly was ! The food was good and the service was great. Our waiter Mr Bora was super fun and an excellent staff member for the restaurant . We totally recommend going the dancing if great and a real culture experience. Go and enjoy !

I booked 'Art Shadow Restaurant' several weeks ago for a Friday night, knowing we would be in Siem Reap at that time. The response confirming my booking was quick and we arrived as arranged. We were allocated a nice table and enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant that is set in a nicely wooded area with atmospheric candles and lighting. Service was good and efficient, perhaps a little bit too much so. We ordered several glasses of wine before we ordered food and at 5 US dollars a glass, it was good value. My wife and I both ordered the same food, starting with a green mango and crispy fish salad, followed by Stir Fry vegetables in an Oyster sauce with rice. A pre-starter arrived which was pleasant enough. The starter was fresh, piquant and tasty. The stir fry vegetables of the main course arrived quickly after, perhaps a little too quickly, and were only luke-warm, as was the sticky rice giving me the impression it had been sat around waiting for us to finish our starter. However, it was tasty and the vegetables were a la dente as they should be. Whereas the food wasn't top notch, it was perfectly acceptable and for the price, good value when one considers that the traditional Cambodian music/dancing that takes place from 7.30pm until 8.30pm is included in the price. We both had an enjoyable evening which was perfect for our first night n Cambodia. The restaurant was almost full so created a good atmosphere. If in Siem Reap, Art Shadow restaurant is well worth considering for a good night out with reasonable food, good entertainment and warm service. We had a really enjoyable evening.

Ate here on our first night in Siem Reap after reading the reviews. A new restaurant and a lovely ambience from the moment you are greeted at the front with a cold towel and peach tea, being walked by drummers to the restaurant, to the food itself. The dancing was interesting but the food was great. Choice of set menu $16-24 pp or an a la carte. Would recommend. We asked our concierge to book but there were some tables left when we arrived.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;60+ Traveler
review: Great experience with Cambodian Culture Dance we really enjoy.  1. Good food and reasonable price. 2. Location quiet and a lot of big tree around. 3. Culture dance look amazing.  We really recommend this restaurant to you.
Great food, great location and friendly staff! Everything was delicious and price range is the standard for siem reap!

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: I had the chicken satay and my partner had the yellow noodles. I loved mine and he liked his but wasn't completely blown away. I'd definitely recommend the satay. Very good value, just under $13 for x2 drinks and x2 mains.  We sat on the roof terrace and watched the sunset. Staff were super friendly and smiley and the service topped off the evening. The only very slight improvement is maybe take the empty plates away a bit sooner. I think it was out of the staff's politeness and they didn't want to interupt because just a quick glance over and you could catch their attention. Very attentive and I would recommend this restaurant.

It was nice to eat away from Pub Street, head across the river behind the markets, there are a number of low priced restaurants that service really nice food. Christa is where we spent our last night when our holiday came to an abrupt end, we enjoyed a B52 shooter and a couple of cocktails all was delicious, staff lovely and high hygiene standards.

review_title: Free wifi. friendly swift service. Prices were cheap. I paid $3 for pineapple rice with sausage & 85c for a beer
review: Free wifi. friendly swift service. Prices were pretty cheap. I paid $3 for pineapple rice with sausage and 85c for a draught beer. The flavours in the pineapple rice with sausage balanced out well. It wasn't very busy so service was swift. They checked that everything was ok with my food which was nice. I felt like a food critic ;-) The bill came to only $3.85. Not bad for tasty food and a draught beer.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: What a great restaurant! We've eaten here twice & loved it. 85c draft beer & most mains are $3 to $4...food is very good, fresh & tasty.

In my 2nd trip to Siem Reap, I decided to look for meals outside Pub Street & old market area.  The Christa is located south of the old market, in a relatively quiet neighborhood behind handcraft market.  I ordered fish amok, which the serving size and taste are satisfactory. The price, as expected, is also much cheaper which serves the purpose.  Decent choice if you stay around the area.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: I honestly don't know how Christa isn't the number 1 restaurant in Siem Reap. The food was absolutely amazing (like seriously so so so good), prices were about $5AUD for a main and $1 for a drink and the staff were really friendly. It was a little hard to find from east of the river but it was definitely worth it.
Being just beside our hotel meant we went there for lunch every day. Good tasty food, cheap prices, lovely staff. Certainly recommended!

As I said it was Ok, not Oh Woo Hoo amazing like the other reviewed. Now that being said It was mid afternoon and I stopped for chicken satay as an appies and had a glass of red vine. The server showed me the bottle and I reviewed the label as I held the bottle. What I was served was a cold glass of wine. It either not what he showed me or an opened bottle that was in The fridge. Somewhat disappointing. The satay presentation was good - but the chicken was chewy and lacked a proper seasoning. The service was very good.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker
review_title: VERY good food and good price
review: I went here with a vegan friend and got the recommendation of Tripadvisor. All is true: very good food, lots of choice. Good (cheap) prices and good service. Liked the restaurant itself as well. Gin tonic USD 3, had a chicken red curry (USD 3) and my friend a vegan dish (3 USD) and was also tastful. Servants friendly and fast.

review_title: Quiet and little out of the way but Fabulous
review: Standard basic Cambodian restaurant. Good selection on the menu. We had Calamari and Khmer Spring Rolls to start. Delicious. Steamed rice Samlor Ma-cher Krerng chic and Stir fried Khmer Spice pork. Freshly cooked good ingredients fabulous flavours. Crepe with lemon and banana pancake to finish with. All very good. Friendly staff would highly recommend if we were here for longer would go back. Price excellent value.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Family Vacationer
review: A very nice economical place, close to our hotel. The staff is helpful and efficient. The food is awesome. I especially liked the Mango salad with fish.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: THe food was good quality but the atmosphere and menu are definitely geared for the palates of westerners. Did not feel authentic or adventurous.

Great food - recommended  to us by others, we found ourselves in the area, so popped in. The fish amok and shrimp (prawn) Tom Yam were amazing. That and 4 beers was $9 Tasty and a bargain - highly recommend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: Food is so cheap and excellent, I feel like I'm stealing
review: Awesome place near one of the night markets and we stumbled in for lunch and couldn't have been happier. 2 salads, 3 beers $8. the mango salad and the eggplant dish were excellent and the beers cheap and cold. What else do you need. Service is family oriented. I will likley go back but there are so many other great places to try---difficult problem.

This is a cute place that has a great value for the money. Even though there were plenty of tourist in the restaurant it felt more like a place that expats and locals eat. The Khmer food was wonderful and the prices couldn't be beat. We ate at several other restaurants in Siem Reap that were provided by our tour company but this one beat all of them hands down. It feels authentic and is less than half the price of the other restaurants in the tourist section of town. I would definitely eat here again if I was in Siem Reap, I suggest you give it a try.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker
review_title: Very yummy, maybe slightly more Westernized
review: Food was amazing. We had papaya salad with prawn- finger leaking good, fish amok- fresh fish and no smell, tamarind fish curry- a nice salty-sour dish, noodle soup- a bit too ordinary but tasty. All served food looked fresh and well presented, western restaurant look and perhaps taste as well. However, i can't fault it :) Prices are very cheap as in comparison same dishes that don't taste as nice cost double around Pub Street-city centre (5 min walk). So it is certainly a good value and portions' size are good. Staff are very attentive, humble and happy :) This place is full of europeans and western people. Perhaps lacking a little of atmosphere/traditional music/cambodian decor. Nevertheless, 5 stars from me :)

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Located a short distance behind the Art Centre Market we ate a great meal here. The service was attentive without being overbearing and we were served promptly and politely. They were able to cope with both a large party of about 12 and a few tables with couples on without the service or standards suffering. We noted that the kitchen staff were wearing hair nets and the kitchen itself was separated from the restaurant area. Good service and good food - what else do you need?

review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.
Wide variety of western dishes to choose from. Meal I had was amazing and everyone I was with enjoyed theirs as well. The atmosphere is outstanding and the staff is extremely friendly.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Quality food, good cocktails, good value.
review: Had food under the sky on the rooftop bar of Funky Flashpacker. The ambiance is good with shiny happy young crowd all around. Some funky tunes. Loungy sofas and even a possiblity to take a dip in the pool downstairs. The food was good quality, though a bit rich and not really for gents on a diet. Other than that, no complaints.
17 dollars for samosas, Butter chicken, Naan and Drink. Realistically Taste was ok but portion of Butter chicken was expensive. 1st and only time for us.

review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

review_title: Awesome Indian Food in heart of Siem Reap
review: Was craving for good Indian food in Siem Reap and decided to pick Rasoi Ghar among all other options. It turned to be great, I ordered a Vegetarian Thali and it was huge portion as well as great taste. And the gulag jamun was just icing on the cake. It’s a value for money and worth a visit. Must try if you love Indian food !!

I went here last night with friends service was slow could hardly get attention of the waiter we had no cutlery or serviettes.. it took a few requests to get cutlery and the waiter did not understand what serviettes were it took a good few attempts to convey what we needed … the food was ok although personally I had a bad tummy before I left the restaurant and was woken at 2am needing to be sick but it subsided

review_title: Absolutely fabulous Indian restaurant in Prague
review: I have eaten in Indian restaurants all over the world including South Asia, but this little gem in Prague's Karlin area, Czechia outclasses all of them by miles. The decor is very tastefully done, there's perfectly subdued music, the owner always greets his guests personally so you feel instantly at ease and welcome, the staff are professional and friendly and the food is just excellent and miles superior to what most Indian restaurants serve and all at very reasonable prices. If you like Indian food you'll love this place and like me want to return time and again.
Nice seating, good atmosphere, friendly service and staff, and perfect Indian food at reasonable prices.

user_tags: Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Very quiet evening when we visited - just one guy serving but it seemed like many people were getting takeout. Calm, relaxing atmosphere and food was good (just not as excellent as expected given high reviews.) Really good value for money.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We chose this place while being in Prague 6 based on tripadvisor reviews and were highly dispapointed by the level of food quality and service. This is just an average ordinary local Indian food restaurant definately worth visiting just based on the Tripadvisor high review. Sorry but this is my view.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: YOu will find good Indian food here. The place is small with table setting, nice Indian punjabi music playing, the food was good , a little overpriced though.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker
review: The waiter knew I was am American after I spoke Czech. We spoke English after that. Great food and service. Recommend!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: A Taste of India at its Best
review: Craving for a real authentic and well made Indian food? This is the place. My own Indian colleagues attest that the food here rivals even the good restaurants in Mumbai. Is it the authenticity of the flavor or the way the meal is freshly prepared? I think it is the passion and the love of the food that makes it very special. To top it off, the very warm and welcoming service makes it a total package.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I had my first meal in the Prague at this restaurant. They served us Kosher Indian Cuisines (dal makhani, tandoor roti & Kheer). The food was so good that, I visited it multiple times during my stay in Prague.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: We really enjoyed the food during our last visit. We also recommended it to a Czech client of my husband and she was satisfied - lamb was the favourite We're definitely coming back with more friends to try "eat all you can" for lunch I just think the place is not suitable for parents with stroller bec. you have to go down the stairs.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Good food, service a bit slow.
review: We visited this restaurant during a recent city break because it was situated a few metres from our hotel. We were seated promptly and our order taken quickly. We opted for fish soup for starters. This was delicious, worth the visit alone. For main course we settled for grilled sea bass. The fillets were displayed conveniently in a cabinet in front of our table. The kitchen area was beside this and we were able to see our fish being cooked. The fillets were placed on the counter and calls for the waiting staff were made, but it took about 5 minutes from then for the plates to be delivered. The fish was nice in spite of this. In hindsight we probably should have served ourselves. Our desert was pistachio ice cream which was delicious. With wine and beer the bill came to a reasonable £47.00. Overall service was a bit slow after a good start.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Limited choice but very fresh, well cooked. Stayed at hotel Majestic next door and on first night didn’t want to walk far, really glad we went in here. Staff are excellent and great value

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: We really enjoyed coming here for breakfast and brunch during our last trip to Prague.  Coffee was very good, we would have personally loved it more if the bagels were warmer, but we will be back!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Such a lovely place, such a tasty breakfast. I absolutely falled in love with this place. The only think I missed was a bigger choice of cold soft drinks (eg home made ice tea). The rest was fabulous.
Ate breakfast here because of the ratings and honestly I don't understand the hype. Got the 'Benedict bagel', a coffee and a fresh orange juice. It was fine,but not more than that. Staff was nice.

I’ve been multiple times at the place. I think I had the complete menu already. Bagels are absolutely stunning. They’re all full of flavor and have top notch ingredients. And when you’re not hungry, just take a coffee. It’s the real deal. Staff is super friendly. They always stop by to see if all is ok. Whatever you ask, they’ll do it for you. I certainly go back soon.

review_title: My go to bagel spot in Prague!
review: I was so glad to see this place re-open several months ago after closing during the Plague. I've always enjoyed their (slightly sourdough style) bagels and fresh orange juice and coffee after a workout at the nearby Hilton hotel gym. The staff here is always great.  Honestly comparing them to Bohemia Bagel, which is much better known, these bagels actually are far better, much more authentic taste and addictive!

Found this by chance, and how glad we did. Newly set up restaurant with great service and fantastic authentic food. Prices very reasonable. If we had stopped in Prague longer would have definitely paid them another visit. Thanks guys. Namaste from us :)
I’ve been to Namaste India Palackého while on a business trip in Prague. I loved the excellent, tasty, delicious dinner. Kind service and lovely atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.
We took buffet menu and it was great, Food was awesome and excellant taste. Dal was excellent, taste was good.

We visited this place during our stay in Prague as it was close to our hotel and because of good reviews. The experience was excellent. Food was really very good and the staff were excellent. Highly recommend anyone anyone who visits Prague goes to this please for a and ambience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Heard that the made the best burgers in Prague, and happy to say, they didn’t disappoint. The patties were cooked to perfection, the “ John Bonham” has just the right amount of kick with the habanero sauce and the home cooked fries were great. Daria our host was perfect, provided great advise to my wife who was struggling to choose which burger to indulge in. The portions were just right and what I saw of the salads, they were ample. Definitely will be back to try something different from the vast selection available

Found this place on trip advisor and saw that it had good reviews, so we thought we’d try! So glad we did. Small and intimate. The staff were lovely and friendly. The food was excellent. Lovely and tasty, the burger was really moist and tasty. The cheese doughnuts were amazing. Would have definitely have gone back if we hadn’t had other reservations booked. Will be recommending to friends and family that visit Prague in the future!

Lovely Burgers in Sad Man’s tongue ,large range of burgers named after celebrities all freshly cooked ,chilli sauce home made and lovely if a bit of a heat challenge but waitress gave separate pot of chilli sauce to my burger at my request Good service friendly staff ,given free shots as well from Staff on my visit As good a burger as I have had anywhere and prices fair ,chips were also lovely. Slight mix up with starters but quality of burgers made up for this so still 5 star review

What an amazing and quirky place this is!! We rocked up and was told it was a 45 min wait for a table and that was ok. We got drinks and waited in the lounge area, what a fab room filled with mismatched old style furniture loved it! We actually waited around 20 mins for a table, we’d viewed a menu while waiting so ordered straight away. The burgers are so nice and the fries are another level! It may only be burger and fries but the whole place and food are fab!! The vibe is funky and we loved it!! Defo go again when next in Prague

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The burgers are for sure the best in town and the fries are out of this world. The best i have ever got. Just remember you have to pay in cash (they have atm at the entrance)

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: The only problem that you have to pay in cash. Apart from that everything is fine. The service and the burgers is super. Recommended .

review_title: Spicy and tender the way I like it
review: Having visited a few times since it’s time to write the review. Each time the host(ess) will offer their recommendations ask how I have been which is an awesome touch.  The food on this occasion was the buffalo wings and tenders and I’m happy to say I’m sweating  As always I’ll be back eventually

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Best Burger and Chips - barr none!
review: Sad Man's Tongue was on the hit list on our recent Prague trip as it was close to our hotel and I had read great reviews. It did not disappoint!  It is a quirky little place with some weird and wonderful decor, the staff were extremely friendly and cheerful.  The burger menu is extensive and you will be spoiled for choice. We opted for single patty and the portions are big. The chips are truly amazing, fresh and tasty. So glad we stopped by for a visit. Beer was great too!  Just go :-)

If I could have awarded 6 stars, I would have. About a year ago, I gave this beautiful restaurant five stars. It’s actually even better now!  The menu has improved and the prices are still very reasonable. The presentation of the food is incredibly beautiful.  This is not only still the best Indian restaurant in Prague, it’s one of the best in Europe.
Great well organised restaurant… We had a fab meal with great service from the staff nothing was too much trouble … highly recommended

user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We had a late lunch here from the Lunch specials menu which is offered from 1100 to 1500 weekdays. I am told this restaurant can be very busy in the middle of that period. Presentation for a budget priced special was excellent, the food was well prepared and tasty, the service was efficient and unobtrusive. Recently refurbished so the decor and furnishings are all in good order. We will certainly re-visit.

The newest Indian restaurant in Prague has instantly become the best!  I love Indian food, but I don’t think I’ve ever come as close to the real thing until tonight.  This is a beautiful, new restaurant and considering that it’s only been open for a week, we couldn’t have asked for better food or service. The presentation of each dish was beautiful.  I had the Papri Chat, a dish that I had never had before. It was so good that I actually ordered another to take home for later.  My partner had the Mushroom Jalfrasie, another dish that we had never tried before. It was another winner.  We’ll be back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review: Beautiful, classy and comfortable seating and ambiance. Food, wine and service was impeccable. Or Server’s name was Ruslan. Best place we dined in Prague. Enjoyed every moment.

Wonderful cafe we found on our walk back from Charles bridge. It was quiet and quaint - The perfect sidewalk cafe. Excellent spirits and food at a reasonable price. Very attentive and multilingual staff.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Great final on our Prague weeend
review: We actually took a seat outside despite being there in december. That was possible due to the heating system at each table and some cozy blankets. It was nice and gave us a Prague Christmas spirit.  For starter I choosed the cheeseplatter which had some really high quality cheeses. I then had seafood and garlic bread which tasted heavenly. My husband enjoyed his meal to with veal. We had dessert and a glass of limoncello on behalf of the kitchen, a nice touch.  We had the wine on recomendation and it surely worked well with our menu.  The service was great, very friendly and welcoming. We will absolutely come back next time we are in Prague.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;60+ Traveler
review_title: Very good, a bit expensive though...
review: Fresh pasta always draws us in and Oliva Nera did a good job of it!  We started with the bruschetta, great focaccia and garlic flavor...then had the carbonara and the spaghetti with frutta di mare. Both were served steaming hot and were flavorful. The crispy guanciale lent a nice smoky element to the carbonara. The frutta di mare was good too but the shrimp were very small and probably were a frozen component.  Finished with a pistachio semifreddo, which was very good!  The service by Marcela was excellen  The total, including 2 bottles of water, 3 glasses of wine, a cappuccino and a 15% tip, came to 2600 Ckn or about US$110.00, a bit on the expensive side, but very good.
