The first day in Prague and we just had to have some quick lunch because we had been up since early in the morning. The prices was high but we ordered anyway. The portions was small. We asked for extra parmesan and didn't even consider that they made us pay for that!!! We discovered that when we got the bill. Thats the first time EVER we have been charged for extra parmesan at an Italian restaurent. Not OK when the food are that expensive. The tips were not included and it was not a question of if we wanted to include them but "do you want to pay with cash or creditcard" - the waiter was rude I think. Don't go there - its not worth it, as you can find plenty of good and much cheaper restaurent in Prague.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Their pasta's is excellent, Good tasting house wines. Friendly and fast service. My warmest recommendations. Would go back.

review_title: Good authentic Italian, perhas a tad overpriced
review: Risotto is a good test of Italian cooking and mine was really good. I'd eat here again but there are some quibbles. For example, arrive before 4 for a late lunch and you get small paper serviettes. While eating, you watch the waiters setting the tables for dinner, with good quality linen napkins. The same menu at the same price, why spoil the effect?

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Italian restaurant on one of the nicest squares. Food choice is good, quality is almost Italian .. hence more than ok. Value for money so so ..

Even the best Czech food can be heavy and highly-seasoned, so if you're in Prague for any length of time, it becomes necessary to seek out something lighter and more imaginative. Betlemske square is a bit off the tourist trail, and away from the high traffic areas. Oliva Nera is a very attractive restaurant with some well set-up covered outside seating- ideal for a hot August night. Starters were competent, mains (we both had filled pasta dishes) were excellent, good pasta and excellent sauce. Service was attentive and quick- a little too quick- as 11.00 pm approached we felt rushed as the outside area was packed up around us. Closing time was much earlier than other places in Europe. Nevertheless it is a good restaurant. Get there early, though.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Delicious Food, Great Service and Location
review: We came upon Oliva Nera in a small, quiet square, and away from the noisy crowds. The menu looked great so we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. Service was great by all the wait staff, attentive to our entree orders, bread for the table, and warm blankets if we needed with an evening chill in the air. And, we appreciated the wine recommendations from George, that nicely complimented our meals. Five of us in our party with a variety of dishes we all enjoyed. Fresh ingredients, seasonings and cooked perfectly. We recommend.

review_title: Excellent Italian Restaurant but a bit expensive
review: After we visited Betlehem Chapel we stopped nearby at Oliva Nera, an Italian restaurant to have some drinks and desserts. We ordered local drinks such as the Staropramen Lezak tmavy and Radler beer which were very good in taste and had ordered home made desserts like the tiramisu and the torta al cioccolato con pistacchi. They were all delicious and we enjoyed our short stay as the weather was great. The staff was very helpful. the price tag of the goods were a bit on the high side but we still recommend this restaurant.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker
review: One of the best italian meals ever eaten. Brilliant lication, friendly staff and superb food. A true gem just around a few corners from old town square. Well worth a visit for an amazing time

You can tell a lot about an Italian restaurant by the quality of bread and olive oil they give you, and that didn't set my expectations high when I got some fairly unappealing and slightly hard white loaves when I sat down here. The rest of the meal was more or less the same - perfectly edible but basically average.

review_title: Pleasant food in a lovely location with good service.
review: We stopped here for some lunch in the scorching heat. I have some veal and the wife had carbonara. Both were tasty without being large portions. Three different staff asked if we wanted desserts. It was decent food for a decent price.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We dined at Oliva Nera on Sunday evening & could not have enjoyed our food any more than we did! Started with Mozzarella Tomato & Basil Pesto, which was scrumptious & a generous portion. Then we had Linguine with Prawns, Chilli, Garlic, etc & Ravioli with Mushroom & Pancetta. Both mains were just beautiful! We finished off with Tiramisu, again, this was divine!  All the waiters appeared competent and professional. We were served very efficiently all evening

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review: It is true that you get what you pay for. While this restaurant has prices that might be slightly higher than some other Italian restaurants here, the food is fabulous and it was one of the best meals I have had so far on this trip (I've been in Budapest, Vienna and now Prague). I ordered the meat ravioli in tomato sauce. It was very good, obviously homemade, and presented perfectly. Then, there was the pistachio semifreddo which was so yummy it makes you want to lick the plate! Our waiter (George) was attentive, friendly and so pleasant to chat with. We ate inside as the evening was a bit cool and seeing the light play off the Bohemian crystal chandeliers in the dining room was lovely. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a non-touristy place to eat which has a great menu selection. We are definitely going to go back before we leave Prague.
Great restaurant with wonderful guest garden. Food was excellent, wine tasty and service very friendly! Thank you for nice evening in amazing city:)

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;Luxury Traveler
review: 3rd year on the trot in Prague 3rd year we have eaten here. It’s a gem for those who like opulent surroundings and traditional Italian food. Stunning starters, mains and deserts and a fantastic wine menu. Relaxed, not rushed and well worth a visit for a special meal as a group or perfect for a romantic meal for two.

user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Just happened upon this place and decided an 'Italian' was just what we needed after several days of Polish and Czech food. Service was very attentive, menu was extensive and the food came up to scratch. Very pleased we chose them even though the bill was on the heavy side but you don't mind if you get a good meal in pleasant surroundings

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Very good food but rather small portions
review: We enjoyed this restaurant. They has one of the best lasagne i have tasted. Unfortunately, portions are so small that the price (comparably) becomes high for what you get. They definately can be more royal on the portions.

The food is great and if this review was based on food alone then this would be 5*. I have to dock 1 * for the speed of service. You get forgotten whilst staff are having a cigarette break or talking to one another in the central courtyard. We had a long wait for a drink and a long wait when we had asked for the bill. The setting is not great but a wonderful meal none the less and would consider eating there again - I could probably overlook the speed of service for the quality of food you get. Pricing is reasonable and you get good portions.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Great food at a great price with great service. It must be good....I used great four times...:) I had the pizza and the missus had the calzone. Both were fantastic. The owner spoke English... that was handy for me.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Very tasty pizza in the heart of Prague. Soft dough, tasty ingredients and super fast. And ofc, proper Italian style. Strongly suggested 🍕🍕🍕

The food was amazing the best curry I have ever eaten , i am coming back another night . It’s very quiet as it’s in a shopping Centre up out the way , compared to English prices it’s very cheap for Indian food .

review_title: Highlight of our visit to Prague
review: Be sure to book well in advance - you do not want to miss this "hidden gem" in the center of Prague. Tiny place (I think 12 seats) with good wine selection and excellent food which is prepared before your eyes. Servers (who double as cooks) are friendly and personable. Small menu includes vegetarian and gluten free options, which made our group happy. Two seatings a night but each "turn" includes plenty of time for appetizers, dinner and dessert (lava cake - to die for!)  You're welcome.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Superb meal. Lots of tasty small plates. Highly recommend the baked reblouchon. We tried to many different wines. What a treat. Best meal in Prague.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Delightful! Must do for the wine lover!
review: Cute little place, just a block outside the main tourist drag. The waitress was friendly, proficient in English, and made some excellent recommendations for local wines to try. I had a cheese plate and focaccia as well, which were delicious. Reasonable prices. Highly recommended for anyone who loves trying local wines!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Amazing Food!!! What a lovely little place, we are so glad we had the opportunity to eat & drink here. The food & wine was fantastic. I’m not very knowledgeable when it comes to wine but the lady chose the perfect Rose to accompany our food. Great atmosphere & we cannot wait to return.

user_tags: Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: This was the best dinner we had in Prague! Even though the place is small it manages to be cosy and relaxed rather than cramped. The wine & food were amazing - following the recommendations of staff we found several wines we absolutely loved. Service was friendly. Really recommend booking here if you visit Prague.
Never been there because when I arrived at 22.30 they were already closed. So probably good idea to phone ahead if they are open when they claim to be...

Great food, excellent wine. Small place, 12 people can fit inside. But quality makes up for quantity of people. The food is really good, all dishes we tied were excellent. The wine choice is superb, wines from Puglia, great advice, I was very happy with all suggestions. Excellent place to visit in Prague!

We visited on Valentine’s Day after I had previously been 2 year ago. A booking is recommended. Thoroughly delicious! The place is not what you would think from the outside and is very small and intimate. The guys who run it are great fun and very welcoming. The food was amazing and the atmosphere perfect. I would highly recommend anyone to visit and can’t wait to visit again!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Thrill Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: New Year's Eve Celebration of Life
review: Can't thank Veronika enough fo hir such a wonderful evening of wine and food tastes beyond belief.  Wonderful place to start 2020.  Gentlemen assistant was spot on recommending food and wine and was so very pleasant and helpful as well.  One the best celebrations of food and life to experience!

This was our first dinner in Prague for the 4 of us and it was the perfect first night out!  When you walk-in the restaurant it may originally appear to be a little underwhelming but I can assure you that you are in for a special evening! First you need to make a reservation as there are very few seats. In fact we made our reservation more than 30 days in advance. With Peter and Martin as both our hosts and Chef for the evening we were treated to an array of great starter courses and later on some nice main courses as well - but make no mistake this is true family Italian. We also tried several fine Italian wines all by the glass and all were very good and quite reasonable. Between the four of us we must have enjoyed 10 glasses of wine, 8 different starters, 4 different mains, a dessert, and 4 glasses of grappa all for about $35 US per person.  But not only was the food terrific and all prepared right in front of you - the interaction with the owners Peter and Martin was just as much fun!  This is a can’t miss restaurant in Prague and one of the first reservations for dinner I would make when planning my trip!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Beach Goer;Thrifty Traveler
review: Wow what a place a small restaurant with an intimate dining experience. This place only has seats for 10-12 people so you MUST book in advance and its worth booking!  The food is freshly prepared in front of you a good selection of tapas style plates. Has a great wine menu and you can order a glass of a bottle. Service was great really helpful.  Great place for dinner and wine in Prague  TOP TIP-This is a CASH ONLY restaurant NO CARDS please ensure you have enough.

review_title: Bottom line for us was the experience and it is unique!
review: Let’s start with the food, because it might be the smaller part of the story. It is fresh, good ingredients, well prepared but if you are looking for a culinary experience it may not hit an elevated state.  The experience pushed it over the top. The restaurant is in something like a 4m x 7m room including kitchen and dishwasher. There are two staff one cooking and one engaging patrons. The wine list is a superb collection of wines from Puglia which happen to be our palate (those accustomed to California or Australian wines may be challenged) and we’ll paired by the server guy. This was the friendliest place we ate at, and humour was always present and appreciated. The size of the place also made conversations with other patrons easy, adding to the charm.

This lovely wine bar was recommended to me by a work colleagues. We were not disappointed. We were 6 ladies visiting Prague for 3 nights and we all enjoyed the Wine O’Clock Shop. Martin, our waiter looked after us very well and served up delicious food and wine. The food was cooked in front of us by another lovely gentlemen. The atmosphere was terrific and most of the other diners interacted with us. A great sing song with honeymooners, Jake & Heather! Great to meet you guys xx  interacted with us

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;60+ Traveler
review_title: Very nice atmosphere but possibly overrated...
review: Great ambiance in a small place, reservations are required as they only have 12 seats. They offer 2 hour seatings beginning at 5 pm and it was full. They should put a sign on the door saying full as the staff had to constantly turn away people.  Quite a few small plates to choose from with an ample list of wines to pair with them.  We had the garlic shrimp, Italian meatballs, salmon in crispy Philo and the potatoes with bacon and cheese. Good flavors, but shrimp and salmon were way over cooked, shrimp could have been a frozen product.  The place feels like a small gathering of friends for wine and appetizers so it's a great concept and the personal service is very good, but our food experience led us to feel that it is possibly overrated.
In quick succession I have been twice to this place in less then a week. Both time food and wine pairing was exceptionally good. Would certainly visit this place again whenever I am in this area.

No wonder the Wine O'clock Shop rates so highly on Trip Advisor, this place is a gem! Just finishing a meal here with great tapas, wonderful service and excellent wine. Waiter has excellent wine knowledge so trust him and try so local wines. The baked goats cheese is everything other reviewers suggest. Also enjoyed the ham and salami plate.

Well Chef's table ...and counter and food preparation area - space is at a premium in this quirky place. It's quite small with seating for 6 or 7 at the counter/bar at the back of which the chef is preparing the food as you order it and 3 or 4 tables for 2. You could happen to be lucky and drop by but it's makes more sense to believe all the positive reviews and make a booking before you plan to go. It's a joy, the two guys and lady who run the place are really engaging and welcoming and of course, the tapas style food is tasty and good value and as the title suggests, they know their wine and are happy to make suggestions around matching.
Quirky little place with 12 covers! The service was really lovely and food was superb. We loved this little find and would certainly recommend it for tapas type food which was delicious! Try it!!

We booked a table at this small restaurant based on the amazing reviews, but the experience was underwhelming. They had a nice selection of wines, but the waiter never bothered recommending us anything no matter how much we described the type of wine we liked. We ended up having some okayish Czech wine of which they had several shelves of and tries some really bad one after which we moved to Italian wines.  The restaurant is very atmospheric and the food is indeed cooked in front of you and burrata caprese salad was amazing and the cheeses were good, but the rest of the meals were rather average. Not sure if this was an off night, but we did not experience the great tastes everybody is writing about. We even decided to have dessert somewhere else.

I booked this establishment based upon the quality of the reviews. So when we arrived to check it out in the afternoon and could not find it I was a bit anxious. Not what I’d expected and as it was a birthday treat we where a little underwhelmed. After some discussion we went with the plan, thank goodness. One of our best nights out on balance. Great staff, amazing wine and fabulous atmosphere. A truly unusual but memorable night out.
Great service and fantastic food. Everything we ordered was delicious. The wine was outstanding! Must book ahead.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Great evening of wine and food
review: A tiny little restaurant (Italian) tucked away in a small street not far from the river - it only seats about a dozen people - BOOK (well in advance) We tried some divine wines from Puglia and you get to taste before you buy a glass, you get plenty of friendly help and advice on choosing what is right for you and to go with the food you have ordered. The Food - delicious home cooked Italian ‘Tapas’ style dishes - so yummy, we had the Bruschetta, Goats cheese with pine nuts and honey and the aubergine Parmigiana and meatballs - Delicious:0 Home made tiramisu and chocolate pudding accompanied by a dessert wine - mmmmm - an excellent, fun and ‘different’ evening thoroughly enjoyed every moment,mouthful and morcel :) thank you Wine O’clock (Cash Only )

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This fantastic little wine bar may not be authentically Czech - it offers essentially Italian ‘tapas’ alongside an extensive selection of wines from Puglia - but it is well worth the visit.  An intimate little place, perfect for couples, less so for groups, where booking is essential, the Wine O’Clock Shop provides a fantastic package of great wine, great food and fantastic hospitality at a reasonable price. The bruschetta is simple but so fresh, bright and refreshing whilst the other dishes are all freshly prepared in front of you to order. The special - baked ricotta cheese with thyme and lemon zest - was delicious whilst the Italian standards of eggplant parmigiana and tiramisu were fantastic.  Excellent.

review_title: Best dining experience in Prague by far
review: We liked the sound of this place on TripAdvisor and so booked via email. We were seated at the counter where we could see everything freshly prepared to order. All that we ordered (wine and food) was outstanding. The service was friendly and informative. We had some great dining experiences in Prague however, this was by far the best.

We found Wine O Clock shop on TripAdvisor and knew we had to go. We love tapas!  The first night we went in it was packed and reserved all night, but we were determined to visit. As we were leaving the next day, I emailed in the morning and booked a table for opening time at 5pm so we could go before our flight. We were the first in there but it started filling up quickly. Sadly we were in a rush so couldn't stay for dessert or to be have the full experience. I highly recommend booking in advance!  The food is fresh and cooked in front of you, the wine outstanding, theres a huge selection. If you get stuck the waiter can help you. The waiters are attentive and welcoming and like a bit of banter with their customers which is fun!  I can't wait to return here for a proper meal when we have more time, I want to try the desserts! We have decided if we come back we will definately book here for an evening!

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Myself and hubby went in last night to try get a table after phoning them but no answer. We were in luck we got a table. It didn't disappoint. The guys who work there are amazing. Friendly relaxed atmosphere. Felt very at home. Food was amazing. We were told it a relaxed experience but the server. He advised order two / dishes as like large tapas style served with wine. We can order more if wanted . He topped water up all the time. Could easily spend alot of time here. Infact booked to return tonight. AMAZING !

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: It wasn't the easiest place to find but so glad we persevered! We received a warm welcome, great service, delicious food, great choice of wines and all in a cosy inviting space. Would highly recommend a visit - money well spent as my husband and I had a thoroughly enjoyable evening meal.

Wow. What an impressive restaurant. Beautiful wine, excellent service and stunning food. You definitely need to book in advance if you want to visit as it is very small and fills up quickly. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Recommended by friends and definitely not disappointed. This is a small cosy restaurant which definitely needs to be booked in advance, given the number of those turned away. Food: tapas style and really tasty. Eat slow and pick your voices from a small yet tasty menu. Really fantastic food Wine...wow ...what a selection....great advice as to which wines suits you best...ours was just divine...Thank you. Service..... the food and wine were great but the service made the experience complete....informal. personal, excellent wine advice and between the two of them a fantastic culinary experiences. Thank you.

After so many great recommendations I tried it once for breakfast. Rude waiter and limited buffet style breakfast. For two avocado toasts and coffee we were charged 160€( for 2 persons). While paying waiter told us also some unprofessional things. Not a pleasant experience.

What a super cool restaurant. We were warmly welcomed with a group of 4 and taken to a nice round table. We chose the five-course surprise menu by chef Richard Bielik. The dishes are a creative mix of Czech products with occasional hints of Japanese flavors. I can't say other than that each dish was very flavorful. The wine list consists of many wines from the Czech Republic, so often, I don't drink Czech wine, but they are surprisingly delicious. The Rouci Pinot Noir from Stapleton Springer comes highly recommended. The quality of the food, the staff's hospitality, and the restaurant's atmosphere made it a superb evening for us.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review_title: One of the best culinary experiences in Prague
review: Yesterday I got an opportunity to got to Andaz’ s new restaurant Zem. It’s brand new Hyatt hotel in the Prague city centre. We were chatting and laughing with my friends and service was helpful and absolutely spotless. The chef personally several times check our experience and it gave us the opportunity to talk about the ideas behind the menu. There are two types of menu- classic Czech cuisine and Asian fusion. From the beginning to the dessert I was speechless, the best way of eating is sharing with friends. In photo gallery you can see what we had.  I strongly recommend to go there and try. Even though you won’t be staying in Hyatt, it’s worth visiting.  5/5 stars

Not sure if we went on an off day, but our food was average at best. Ordered the popadoms and they had a burnt taste. The Onion Bhajis were probably the best thing we ate; they at least tasted ok. We ordered a Chicken tikka masala, tasteless. Chicken Korma, really odd minty taste, we didn’t finish it. A chicken Kadhai, med spicy as described, not much chicken and a Prawn Makhani, tasted like tomato soup and had 5 small prawns. Pesawari naan, looked good on the outside but was greasy and had a strange tomato flavour inside. Waiter was very polite but only cleared half the table and never returned until my husband went to the counter for the bill. Wanted to love it but all in all, we were all disappointed and wouldn’t return.

review_title: Nice change from traditional European Food
review: After eating traditional European food for over a week we were searching for a change. After reviewing TA we decided on Taaj Palace. Its a very simple India decor with no AC. We had the Vindalo and Biryani with garlic naan and it was all delicious. We had a bottle of Czech vino which was bad compared to the India vino we sampled. All in all it was a very good India dinner and approx 29 Euro without tip.

Had one of the best Vindaloo curries I've ever eaten. Really delicious and accompanied with Peshwari nan and Pilau rice. Decor is very tasteful and bright. Service is friendly, helpful and courteous but of course, food is the main thing and it was excellent and decent portions too. Well done guys. I hope to call again in the not too distant future.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Great Indian food, atmosphere, and service
review: The food was absolutely delicious. Our server was very helpful, friendly, and attentive. The atmosphere was pleasant...pretty standard decor for an Indian restaurant. If I lived in Prague, I’d probably visit this place often.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This place is not good. The food is Bangladeshi rather than Indian. It’s also very bland for what should be really big bold flavours. We ordered a tikka masala and a vindaloo, both were very similar but should have tasted completely differently. It’s quite expensive compared to other restaurants in Prague.

user_tags: Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker;Beach Goer
review: Wow wow wow great dinner, tasty food Thank you very much for kindness and patience Mr Lucky the waiter

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review_title: Reputedly the best Indian restaurant in town - I agree
review: At the hotel, a staff member from India directed us to this restaurant, and we did not regret it. Every dish is as authentic as it can be, the servings are generous, and even the wine proposed is good (not a matter of course, this, at many Indian restaurants).  Impeccable service and as a bonus, a really nice owner-manager with whom it was a pleasure to converse.  Pricing is moderate and certainly good value.
If you are looking for authentic Indian food then this is the right place. Perfect spicy and good flavors like any up-class restaunt in India. Recommend veg dishes are Dal Makhani and Chana Masala.

This was probably the best Indian Food experience we had in Prague so far after travellng for last 4-5 years to the country. This closest to Indian Food in a restaurant in India. Decor is ethinic. Service was excellent and chef was able to customize food to suite gluten and lacto intolerance person. Would definitely visit again.

review_title: Treat yourself to a fine Indian dining experience
review: The restaurant has got rave reviews on trip advisor and they are well warranted. It’s a classy establishment decorated with memorabilia from the erstwhile kingdoms of Kapurthala, now in Punjab, India. The food is mostly northern Indian, served in style. They can step up the spice level if you ask for it, but otherwise are cognisant of the travelers palate. They special chaat is an excellent starter and the chicken bhuna is an excellent choice. Thick gravy and goes well with both the rice and the naan. Do not miss the mango lassi, it was amongst the best I have had even in India. Definitely the restaurant to go to if you crave an Indian meal

I have visited the restaurant numerous times and it delivered high quality food every single time. I especially recommend the garlic naan, lentils, and butter chicken. Only rice seems a bit overpriced. Service is friendly at all times also. Definitely will be back soon.

We couldn’t decide where to eat. For non meat eaters prague restaurants can be a challenge. In the end we choose K the two brothers. And what a hit it was!! Reservation is recommendable because the place was packed. Very nice ambiance inside, great decor all around. We sat near the small bar at a small table. The table appeared to be really small, only just big enough to place our complete meal on. Indian food comes in many bowls and platters, so... About the food: wow. Just wow. So delicious! We eat Indian regularly, but this is #1 so far! We loved it!! We choose not spicy. Started with vegetable samosa and fried shrimps. Already very delicious. Then came the Dal Makhani: Black lentils cooked overnight in the Tandoor finished with tomato sauce & cream. A prawn curry; Tiger prawns in rich sauce with cashews and coconut and the Kashmiri Pulao: Rice mixed with sliced fruits and nuts flavored with aromatic cashmere herbs and cream. I had the pineapple raita and a cheese naan with it. Too much but O man. To die for. So good. So good. So, when in Prague avoid the busy squares and find K the two brothers in old town. Very very recommendable!! Great staff, very attentive, very nice guys! Must eat here when in Prague.
Delicious Indian food. Top quality restaurant and the best I have been to in Prague. Absolutely faultless.
After lots of Czech food, we opted for Indian our last night in Prague. We hit the jackpot with our choice. Great Indian food from all regions.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review_title: Great for both meat eaters and veggies
review: Went here as soon as we arrived in Prague in the evening and were not disappointed. Fortunately, didn’t need a reservation but the place soon got busy. I had a Kadhai Paneer curry and my wife had a chicken curry. We both really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. The staff were friendly and could speak English. Would definitely go back.
This is one of the best Indian restaurant in Prague serving authentic Vegetarian Food that you will love. you will feel like in Delhi enjoying Veg Food. Excellent.

Prague has many cuisines but Indian food certainly ranks up there. This family run eatery is ranked as one of the best, so we decided to give it a try. It was also clear conveniently located to our hotel. The ambiance inside is very charming. The menu is fairly extensive, Lucky our very efficient server was a huge help in deciphering some of the lesser known items. We started with shrimp and a fried spinach appetizers, both were fantastic. For entrees, we sampled a nice cross section of dishes, including shrimp, vegetarian, chicken and lamb. The highlight entree was the “K” special platter with a mixed grill of lamb and chicken cooked in different styles. Several flavors of naan bread rounded out our entrees. Lucky took great care of us throughout the meal and we thought the prices here were reasonable.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local
review: Perhaps surprisingly Prague has a number of very good Indian restaurants, this one was conveniently located near to our hotel. Our meals were nicely spiced and we had excellent service from our waiter Lucky.

review_title: One of best Indian restaurant in Europe
review: I have been traveling to many cities of the world and can vouch that this is one of the best Indian food in the world. Run by two brothers from Punjab India, you can taste their hospitality in the taste of food. Not to be missed if you are in Prague and like authentic Indian food.
Dpu was very welcoming and providing excellent service. If it’s good enough for Anthony Hopkins it’s good enough for me. A beautiful meal and v reasonable priced. Thank you

review_title: Very Overpriced but Yummy Indian Food
review: Atmosphere & Service: Excellent service. Very nice staff. Place is decorated heavily with Indian decor.  Food: One thing I noticed is everything is very expensive. Wouldn't mind it as much if the portions were bigger and the food tasted better but it was just fine. We got our typical things like Butter Chicken, a Lamb dish, garlic naan, Aloo gobi, and a baked fish dish. Also disappointed that no entrees come with any rice so you have to order all the rice separately (again, adds to the expenses).  Fish was super dry and not cooked well at all. Butter chicken was good because you can't really mess up butter chicken. Lamb was not tender and a bit dry. Aloo Gobi had good flavors but small portions too.  We tried this place because we were getting a bit tired of the same european flavors and we we wanted to spice it up after 10 days of travel but I was quite disappointed with this place esp this being one of the most expensive meals I had in 10 days of travel.

Came here while on holiday as it was close to where we stayed. Picked well food was good and tasty. We had 2 beers , water, one chicken pakora starter for hubby. He said it was fresh , most, chicken breast with a spicy sauce. Next one nan, one basmati rice, a chana masala side dish, a lamb pasanda and a mutter paneer. All very good, service swift and bill was 1300 Krona.

We have had the most amazing meal! This jewel of an Indian restaurant met us with a very warm and friendly welcome. The restaurant is spacious, clean snd just the right temperature for a cold February evening. The menu is laid out easily and it won’t take you long to find your favourite dish. The service was fast and the food was nice and hot. I have to say the garlic naan bread was out of this world. This restaurant is worth finding, you won’t be disappointed!
Visited at lunch at start of October. Great Indian restaurant with beautiful nann bread and fantastic kadhai paneer curry. Would definitely recommend a visit !!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: Gracious hosts and super food with wide selection
review: The Indian Jewel is a wonderful restaurant. Because it was Covid we reserved a table outside the day before we wanted to come. They made the reservation at a table that was the best for us and were VERY thoughtful and kind throughout the meal. The choices on the menu are many. We all ordered something different and shared. Each dish was delicious. You cannot go wrong here!

review_title: Great fresh food and excellent service
review: Went on our first day in Prague to grab some take-away for the family. It wasn’t fast, but that’s because everything is made fresh. And you can taste it! I have been to many Indian restaurants and this was top quality. Service was excellent and very friendly. Great!

user_tags: Foodie;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Had a wonderful meal here with friends. Warm welcome upon arrival and friendly staff. Food was tasty and good portion sizes. Good value, like everywhere in Prague!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: A great choice for Indian food in Prague
review: We visited this place twice for dinner during our 4 day stay in Prague and were very satisfied with the food. The location is very central and is just a short walk from the old town. The interiors are very tastefully decorated and the service is really friendly and welcoming. All the staff members we encountered during our two visits were really nice. The food itself is quite tasty and flavorful with a good variety to choose from. It was a treat to eat freshly made tandoori rotis and parathas on a cold winter evening in Prague. The prices are quite reasonable as well. Very highly recommended for people looking for good Indian food in Prague.

review_title: Delicious and warm on a chilly night!
review: The food was incredibly tasty! The hospitality was even better! We had a large party with lots of kids and they were great to us!

We chose to eat here on our final night and what a brilliant decision! All the staff were super friendly and very attentive. We did not feel forced to buy more drinks or pay the bill straight away, and were left to enjoy the rest of our wine after finishing the food, and I should add the indian wine was so tasty and we got a very large glass! Portion sizes were very big and the quality of meat was excellent! We had the lamb madras, chicken seekh kebab, basmati rice, garlic naan and some raita - all excellent. Thank you for making our last night so enjoyable! 100% recommend.

In the mood of tasty and great kick... Yeah...Owh ohw yeah... Walked all day in Prague 1, saw many good places. It was a cold month actually, but it was a sunny day. Mmmhhh...a little bit tired but fun and i enjoyed it. Curious to tasted an Indian cuisine in Prague. Live usual... Get my phone XD Go to my TripAdvisor account XD Restaurant Nearby XD Indian Cuisine XD Yeeeeaha..... i got it  "Indian Jewel" Curious with the beautiful name of it. I came in... and ooowww.... what a daaaaamn lovely and warm welcome from all the waiters. I looove the place. It was so cozy and nice with nice design interior.  Well... here i go... I ordered a glass of red wine and the lovely waiter advised me an Indian red wine. I was a little bit hesitated it XD coz i wasn't used to Indian wine XD XD XD... guess what? °o° i was surprised that the house red wine tasted so good XD... then i ordered my foods. Garlic naan, lachna parantha, lamb biryani, lamb madras... it was too much for my small belly hahahahahahahaha XD but i almost finished them all.  The taste of the breads were nice, soft and fresh. The lamb biryani was great & tasty. The lamb was nice and tender. The lamb madras was soooo goood as i expected. It was so tender, spicy, hot and delicious ..... hahahahahahah makes me hungry now. What i had ordered was completely my culinary mission of the day.  Thank you for TripAdvisor, Indian Jewel and all the waiters.
Went for dinner and food was reasonably good and reasonably priced, service was okay and it also depends what you order.
I visited restaurant on lunch time and ordered Paneer kadai and it was excellent. Garlic naan was good. Salted lassi is also good.  i will recommended this restaurant in Prague for vegetarians.

review_title: The view is the key selling point here
review: Came here for a business dinner on the Prague trip. Food was very good, wine a little less so. Staff were very efficient and helpful. But main selling point was view out over Charles Bridge and up to the castle – great backdrop
Mlynec has everything our overall comment is amazing for Mlynec Great food either set menu options or Ala carte Great wine selection Great service Great venue-decoration

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: I visited the restaurant in October 2022. Apart from the excellent view, it offered excellent food, very nice staff and a relaxing atmosphere

review_title: Very good food in a cosy place
review: The restaurant is located in best place in Prague, at the foot of Charles Bridge but it is definitely not a tourist trap, actually seems to be one of best in Prague. Very good food and attentive waiters. Have to mention Dominik, he managed to please everyone around us and very knowledgeable in food and wine. Menu is simple and delicious, had best Gazpacho outside Spain and excellent cooked beef. Price was good for such location and quality. Must try.

Visited Prague from UK for 5 days. Booked Mlynec on line based on excellent reviews. Not disappointed. Lovely table overlooking Charles Bridge. Service perfect and food excellent. Good choice of food menus. Cocktails and choice of wines very good.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: yes, a bit expensive, but absolutely worth it. Very good food, fantastic location, friendly staff, made our evening a very special one.
Nice terrace, normally packed, but if you are lucky, you will find the spot. Good cocktails and nice service.

review_title: Amazing experience, super friendly staff and great food
review: Overall an amazing experience. Located in a beautiful setting in Prague, on the river front, opposite the bridge. All staff spoke impeccable English and were professional and friendly. We ordered a Czech wine, recommended by our server which was excellent, and had a mixture of starters including the gem salad and shrimps. All portion sizes were more than enough for one person. For the mains again a selection of the ribeye steak, Czech 7 hour duck and Octopus. All meals were cooked to perfection. The price was also very good for the level of restaurant. Overall I cannot fault it. It was an amazing experience and we would definitely return. Thank you to all the staff for making it such a great evening, especially with the birthday surprise for my sister in law

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I recently enjoyed the 5 course dinner and the selection, service and paired wine was amazing. The views of the Charles Bridge were very picturesque. This restaurant is well worth a visit. The 5 courses can take sometime so be prepared for a long evening. The price is expensive but worth it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: I've been curious for a long time how good the brunch at Mlýnec is? It's served on Saturdays and Sundays between 11:30-15:00. The menu changes from week to week. The price is Czk. 1.290, - per person. It includes prosecco, red wine, white wine, beer, coffee, freshly squeezed orange juice and other soft drinks ad libitum. My boss, who is pretty awesome - and has asked me out several times this week - is in Prague with her husband, and I thought it appropriate to ask them out, just once. We usually attend the Grand Restaurant Festival together, but that’s not an option this year. Instead we’ve designed our own culinary week. The menu we had yesterday is below. Food is served at the table. We were given dishes to share, and we were pleased with the portion sizes, which allowed us to taste everything. By the time we had done that, we were also absolutely stuffed. Everything we were served was impressively delicious. The praise came in a stream from all three of us. We were impressed with the quality of the prosecco and wines included in what was effectively an all-you-can-drink package. The service was also absolutely perfect. The team of waiters were quite young and they were well trained in the profession, they were polite, friendly, helpful and had both humour and the courage to bring their personalities to work. When we arrived at 11:30, we discussed whether we could have arrived a little later and still had plenty of time before 15:00. But the service was kind enough to give us plenty of time between courses, we had a good time - and by 14:35 we were ready for dessert, which by the way was a feast of flavours and textures and one of the many highlights of the brunch. We'll be back!  STARTERS Codfish ceviche, shallot, dill Veal tataki, wasabi mayonnaise Beetroot carpaccio, goat cheese, black rice  MAIN DISHES Salmon trout, tabouleh salad, miso, tapioca Pork tenderloin, Guinea-fowl breast, parmesan cheese, herbs, albufera sauce Baked pumpkin, cauliflower, parsley, Brussel sprouts, almond, sweet potato croquete, gruyére cheese, aioli mayonnaise  DESSERTS Pistachio cheesecake, raspberries, chocolate Coconut, almonds, turmeric, vanilla  WINES Prosecco Riondo, extra dry, Veneto White wine: Pinot Grigio , Casalforte, Veneto Red wine: Valpolicella , Casalforte, Veneto

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This was our fourth visit to this restaurant. I was so happy to be in Prague after the 2 difficult years we all had, and I was so looking forward to eating here again. What can I say, it was pure perfection! There are not many places that are so special to me as this restaurant is. The service was amazing as usual (Vojtěch was very attentive and funny), the ambience was amazing, and the food...wow, VEAL FILLET MIGNON Á LA SCHNITZEL is the best meal I have had that I can remember. I will always go back to this restaurant when I'm in Prague. Thank you for making it special every time. Mlýnec team deserves high praise.

We purposely reserved our table in advance with a view request of the bridge, which made the experience even more delightful. The interior is stunning and loved the open kitchen. Food is presented perfectly to reflect the taste and quality. We tried the summer tasting menu which gave great value, one of our group the steak taster. It really was a memorable night for all the right reasons.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: We had our company meeting there in January. Very good food, with the highlight on the risotto which was one of the nicest I have ever had, aromatic and tasteful! I asked for a half and half beer - half dark, half pilsner- and it was brought to me with pleasure by the most polite waiter! Excellent service overall and a beautiful place to be!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Over the years I’ve come to expect Mlýnec to deliver a very good festival menu, which is why this restaurant was the fourth and last round with my Danish friends before they headed back home. It is safe to say that the restaurant didn’t disappoint. We were all blown away by the experience. We were greeted by the manager (I believe) and sat down at a nice table. The interior of the restaurant has been redone, and we liked it. Particularly we liked the acoustics of the room. Noise doesn’t travel from table to table, and we could have a relaxed conversation without raising our voices or listening in on whatever was being discussed by the table next to ours. We had a bowl of bread with 3 different kinds of fresh and slightly warm bread. It was accompanied by a herb spread which had nice, subtle flavours and a perfect temperature. I wanted more bread! But thank God they didn’t give me any (I didn't ask for it), because we were all completely full, when we left the restaurant a couple of hours later. The amuse bouche was delicate foam of smoked potatoes. There were some crunchy bits on top and a bit of sour notes from tiny pieces of pickled vegetables as well. These 2 elements gave some texture, and it was a brilliant little dish. The starter was smoked char with almond milk “caviar”, beluga lentils, horseradish, and marjoram. The trout had a firm, yet tender texture and had received just the right amount of smoke. The subtle horseradish sauce with marjoram complimented both fish and lentils very well and made everything come together. The lentils were perfectly cooked – I am not sure if “al dente” is a way to describe lentils, but I’ll risk it. The almond milk caviar was mainly on the plate for texture, I believe – it didn’t pack a lot of flavour. I like that the “eggs” had different sizes. That worked well visually and also when it came to the texture. The size of the portion was generous – we all agreed that it wouldn’t have been strange at all, if they had served one piece of trout instead of the two nice portions on our plates. The main dish was veal rib eye, beans, dried beef, beets, cashews, and demi glace. We were given a choice how we would like our meat prepared, and we all chose medium. Mine was closer to medium rare, and that was perfectly fine with me. The first impression of the dish came from tasting the demi glace, which was one of the best I’ve ever had. Only the master of sauces, Steven Trumpfheller, has served me a better one. So rich and full of flavour and reduced to the point where it would make my lips stick together. The steak was tender and well seasoned, and it hade more and deeper flavour than I would have expected from veal – more like a young bull. There were 3 different types of beans on the side, all cooked to perfection. The beets added an earthy and sweet/sour dimension, and the small bites of smoked and dried beef held it together, although my first bite was very tough (the rest weren’t). Just as it was the case with the starter, everything on the plate created a perfect combination, and the dish was quite filling. I regretted not having saved a slice of bread to wipe my plate clean with. Not to embarrass my two friends at the table I decided not to lick the sauce off my plate, but the thought crossed my mind. The dessert was macaroon in two ways, cherry, chocolate, tangerine, and basil garnished with raspberries and a blackberry. The macaroon on the side was good, but to me the star of the dish was the clever composition in the middle. I tried tasting the different elements individually, and they went almost all the way around the palate, except for saltiness. Sweet, sour, tart, bitter. And then when they all met in combination with the chewy and a little bit gooey macaroon bottom, it was simply a heavenly mouthful. The menu mentions a pre-dessert as a palate cleanser. Previously it has been a ball of sorbet. They forgot to serve it at our table, but they found out and insisted that we had coffee on the house, accompanied with cute cubes of chocolaty caramel. It was a nice finish to our meal. The service was friendly and attentive, and we were given plenty of time between dishes, which we really appreciate. We were served by different waiters, but the manager always kept an eye on our table and checked every once in a while if we were happy – and it was a pleasure chatting with him. Hospitality must lie in his genes. We agreed that this final festival experience was a perfect ending to this year’s adventure as a group – and most definitely we’re looking forward to repeating it next year! There are 2 seats left for the Restaurant festival at Mlýnec this year: 1 seat on the 12/2 at 17:30 and 1 on the 16/2 at 17:30. Grab them!

review_title: If we had found it sooner we would have eaten here more! Great job Rodrigo!
review: We ate here our last night on a recommendation from our hotel. If we had found it sooner we would have eaten here more often. Dinner for 3 was about $200 for 2 mains, three appetizers, 6 drinks, one dessert. Rodrigo did a marvelous job waiting on us. We will be back if we are ever here again. In warm weather there is outside dining in the shadow of the Charles Bridge. Here are the items we really liked: scallops, celery cream soup, goat cheese salad, filet schnitzel (sounds odd but great) and cream puff. Full bar with all the usual mixed drinks. Very pleasant setting with just enough ambient noise to allow a normal conversation. Reservation needed if you want a preferential seating location.

user_tags: Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Great little fine. Super food and amazing, friendly staff. We found this lovely restaurant on our first evening in Prague and just wanted something light and tasty. Really enjoyed our Tom Yam and a very reasonable price.
Very beautiful local, with an excellent food with an average price. You can't miss this incredible restaurant.

After went through trip advisor, We have decided to try this restaurant , it turned up we have made a great choice . We arrived at 7:30 pm restaurant was already quite full , the services was great, all staffs were attentive from the door till end pf our meals , and also great ambiance , we were seated in the corner table by the window . Ordered foie grass & prawn tandoori for starters and rib eye , chicken masala for the main , absolutely delicious. I recommend you to try this restaurant while in praha.

review_title: Excellent, Creative Food, Attentive Service but Unnecessary Rush
review: We went for Indian Feast Menu and loved it. The modern twist to some of the traditional Indian dishes was interesting and intriguing. It was a treat indeed. However there is once serious flaw: uncalled for, super-sonic serving speed. As one can see from my reviews, I have been to a number of top-notched restaurants, the world over, quite often opting degustation menu to experience their gastronomical skills, to the fullest. Tasting or Degustation menu is meant to make guests enjoy each and every bite of the dishes served, at a philosophical pace, and relaxed mood. Many places normally serve palate cleanser before each new dish arrives. They work to remove any aftertastes lingering in the mouth so that guests can enjoy each dish without continuing to taste the last. Surprisingly, V Zátiší serves some of its dishes in pairs which results sometimes in different [and wrong] combination than what is intended or appropriate and sometimes, one of the dishes getting cold, losing its lustre. V Zatisi opts to bulldoze it through. Exaggerating a little bit, of course. I am unable to see any culinary justification or business rationale for this unnecessary haste. I would dare to state that it is a cardinal sin to spoil a superb concept in this way.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: The restaurant ambiance is calm and the decor is very charming. Great staff and service. Had the soup, foie gras and deer. They were all amazing in taste, preparation and presentation. Wine pairings are perfect and recommended. Michelin Guide was absolutely correct in this recommendation.

Walked in the pouring rain to this good restaurant. The place was very busy and looked really good inside. Service was excellent with a good varied menu. The food we chose was excellent. After the meal we walked around the crystal room and the library room. Wall to wall books but some secret ones came out to hide the switches. Very deceiving.

Visiting Prague with friends and this restaurant was recommmended. We were not disappointed. Great menu and various choices from a la carte and degustation menu with wine pairings. Food cooked to a very high standard and excellent service. Great selection of local wines and knowledgeable sommelier. Recommend highly.

We were greeted with a genuine welcome and shown to a really nice table by a window. Our waiter Juraj from Slovakia was a charming and smiley young man who attended to everything beautifully. Our food was truly excellent in every respect, Juraj helped with wine choices using his expert knowledge - the Moravian reisling was really good. Overall we cannot fault our visit to v Zatisi, we very much look forward to next time and have already recommended this restaurant to several friends. Thank you all so much.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We have been gifted some voucher for a dining experience and, after checking reviews, we chose V zatisi. The place is located in a quiet alley not far from Charles Bridge, is nicely furnished and has an OK variety of food choices. We chose the Indian degustation, which consisted of an amouse bouche, a soup, a fish, tikka masala and a dessert. The highlight of the meal were the mains, while the other dishes to us seemed only a way to complete a menu. Soup decent but not at its price tag, dessert was good but spices from the pineapple overpowered the Gelato. Overall food was good and we enjoyed it, but I think for its price it is definitely not worth it. Upon arriving, we Said we had made a reservation but at the desk they did not have it, but luckily it was not busy at 12. Service was unfortunately luckluster and not up to the standard of a high-end restaurant; in such other premises in Prague the waiting staff would enunciate meals, here no one said a thing and for each dish I needed to go online and check their website. Frantisek was nice (the lady so so, especially when we showed the voucher) but all in all I think if they want to charge this much some improvements need to be taken. I tipped (as I have never tipped in my country actually) but did not feel like doing it.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Fabulous food, attentive staff, great atmosphere
review: We visited on Christmas Day as a family party. Welcome from staff was warm and the waiting staff were attentive but not intrusive. Menu was varied and interesting. We enjoyed Pumpkin Soup and Czech Soup for Starter, Rib eye, Goose, Tikka Masla amongst others for main and a variety of desserts including Creme Brûlée's and Chocolate Orange. In fact we ordered extra desserts as we couldn't chose a preference! Highly recommended!

We were in this elegant and trendy restaurant for lunch and it was very nice experience. Everything was perfect. Wonderful ambience, creative menu, very friendly staff and tasty food. We will definitely come back!

Not much to criticise about this charming restaurant where we dined yesterday on our last evening in Prague. We chose the Zatisi menu with wine pairing and apart from the too salty fish dish everything else was delicious. A special mention for Martin our very efficient waiter. Definitely a restaurant to be recommended for gourmets.
Went there with my wife. Nice place with tasty food. Think the service could be better, it felt a bit stressed. Overall satesfied, but also had better experiences.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;60+ Traveler
review: Wonderful dinner here tonight, started with thd tomato and portobello salad and the tandoori tiger shrimp, both were creatively flavored and just the right size portions.  Then had the glazed perch and the chicken tikki masala...presented very well and great flavors as well. The perch flaked perfectly, accompanied by grilled cauliflower and a leek slaw. Delicious! My wife's chicken was tender and nicely spiced, served with lentils and basmati rice.  Finished with a portion of warm apple strudel ice cream.  Had a nice rosé and made for a perfect dinner! Not cheap at 3500 CzK but we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Very pleased to select this restaurant for 22 guys. The degustion menu was a treat. The food was excellent and the 1495CZK for it is value for the money. But it's not ok when a waitor smells like an ashtray. And it's not ok not to clean the table of plates before a new dish arrives.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We visited V Zatisi to celebrate s milestone birthday. I had the Czech tasting menu with wine pairings, and I highly recommend it. My spouse ordered a la carte and also took the wine pairings. Our meals were delicious, and the restaurant offered us some exceptional Czech wines. It was an excellent choice for our celebration!

review_title: My first Inedible Michelin star restaurant
review: Let's face it and we knew it before booking: Czech cuisine is hadrly recognized as French,or italian cusines as some of the most universal best culinary experiences in the world.However, when i booked this one 6 months early, I was looking to experiment local Czech tradition food at an innovative and excellent level.The reviews seemed mostly positive and we were excited about it for the first of 3 nights in Prague. The first impression from the decor is clean and sort of lacking personality or local character: nothing fancy, for all you know, you could be in the lounge of a Hilton anyweher in the world. That's after the first nice course of our tasting menu was served that things quickly turned bad: from the aged "tartare" that tasted like old, dry chewing gum and looked more like rabbit poop to the tasteless spike trout or rubbery duck, even an applestrudel that was barely baked, no sugar, no crunch, no flavor...All of that was not at par with a Michelin star-even one-standard, service was ok albeit slow and sometimes inattentive although Libor tried his best...A $75 prix fixe in Prague would and should take you to an incredible level. anywhere else...but this one was one of the worst we experienced in the Czarch capital...even a little lunch at a street Chinese restaraurant the next day was flavorful, fresh and tasty for a mere $10 per person !!! I am not sure why this restaurant that seemes to be operated by Indian owners got to receive the Star or glowing social media reviews here...but I do know, as a French born -now American citizen living in the USA and having dined at more than 50 of the best Michelin star restaurants in the world- that this was one of the most disappointing, deplorable if not outrageous dining experience I ever had in the past 40 years...
Fancy place, we had excellent lunch menu with a glass of decent wine. The menu was put together in a good way. Soup, meat, asparagus, creme brulee - everything was of very good quality.

We chose V Zatisi on a recommendation  It’s a very smart chic restaurant with a stunning decor  The service was exemplary  The menu is a European and Czech style but with an Indian twist  Some lovely choices on the menu and none of us were disappointed  I chose the Tandoori tiger prawns which were lovely (only 2 prawns - could have done with a 3rd) with 3 lovely dip sauces Mmmmmm  Then the veal and rib for main. Also delicious but I tried my wife’s Tikka Masala Chicken which I thought was even better!  We all had dessert. I had the tandoori pineapple. Delicious  Can’t fault it Came to about £50pp all in so fair price for such quality

We visited V Zatisi for a valentines meal with wine pairing and enjoyed it. I ordered the zatisi degustation and somehow ended up with the Indian one, but by the time I realized it, didn’t want to make a fuss. My son ordered the seasonal degustation and enjoyed it very much. Wine pairings were with generous pours, excellent whites and ok reds. Food presentation was good, Indian courses were tasty, the other courses a bit less flavorful. One star off because one of our dining partners ordered the steak and it was tough, requiring a lot of sawing to cut. Our wait staff were friendly with a great sense of humor, and overall we enjoyed the meal. Not sure we would return, as the price point was a bit high for the food quality.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Lovely place with an amazing and super tasty food! For special occasions is this place perfect. You will feel like a king and queen <3

review_title: The BEST Meal We Had in Prague!
review: WOW! We made a reservation here for after Rusalka at the national opera. What a fabulous dining experience. From start to finish we were blown away by beautiful plates of food that were absolutely delicious and served by a very attentive and friendly staff. Indian flavors mingle with daring combinations and EVERY plate is a winner! Be sure to leave room for dessert. We had a very tasty Czech sparkling wine (Cremant) that was a perfect accompaniment to a wonderful meal. As good if not better than any meal we've had at very expensive New York City restaurants! Go!!

Very impressed - the relatively small restaurant had a great feel to it. Food was 5 star and impressive. Service attentive all night. My only improvement was that the waiters were not terribly well dressed for the quality of restaurant I expected with un-ironed shirts and a little untucked.

Very elegant and cozy place. Christmas decoration made this evening especially special but the excellent food is worth going there all year round of course. I had the 5 course tasting menu and now I get hungry just thinking about it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Family Vacationer
review: It is not the first time I have visited this restaurant, and as always I had very positive experience. It is a perfect place for fine dining. I can specificaly recommend the Indian starter samples. It provides you with variety of tastes and combine with professional wine pairing leaves you with memorable experience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Celebrating my partners Czech name day and we returned to this restaurant after a long break, and still the quality of the food and service was exceptional. The degustation menu with wine pairing was excellent, the cocktails delicious, and the Indian influence in the menu complements the meals

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Elegant Restaurant with Modern take on Czech menu
review: This is a truly elegant restaurant with a great menu of modern versions (and some traditional takes) on Czech food. It also has a great wine list with outstanding French wines. The setting and service were great. This was the best place we ate on a two week tour of Central Europe.

review_title: Wow such as incredible and unforgettable experience on my birthday
review: We came here for my birthday and that was one of the best dining experience in my life.  First surprise was that there was Mourad Haddouche, a French Michelin-star chef, who cooked for us. Six meals tasting menu was out of this world: Snails in green pea coulis, foie gras, carbonara of potatoes spaghetti, quenelle of pike perch, duck breast and almond lukewarm cake. Potatoes spaghetti carbonara was the most delicious dish for me.  Service was really good, even though we had a trainee waitress and she was a bit nervous to tell us all ingredients in upcoming dish. Wine waiter was also very professional and always ready to help.  I have never been in V Zátiší before even though I know their catering very well. That was not my last visit for sure. Top of that I had incredible birthday fireworks with my dessert and that was another surprise :-) Many thanks for making my special day even special.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Thrifty Traveler
review: Beautiful decor, each dining area seems to be kept small to give an intimate feel with no hustle and bustle. An amuse bouche was brought up with bread. Our meals of duck variation and veal fillet looked small but we're filling. The flavours were wonderful. Dessert was just as good. White chocolate mousse was a little dense and pistachio panda cotta was a little loose but tastes great. My wife had the dessert sampler, creme brulee, chocolate mousse and raspberry sorbet which she said ticked all the boxes. The praline and macaron petit fours rounded the meal off nicely. This is not my usual type of restaurant and way above what i normally pay but i didn't feel conned by the price and felt the whole experience was worth the money.

We tried to get into 2 of the other restaurant’s that are combined with this one but could not get in but we are really glad as this place was lovely the food and the service was extremely exceptional

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Do not miss this place. I give it 7 stars. I struggle to remember having a better burger. The types are unusual… peanut, asian…They were perfectly cooked & the buns were fresh a not to dense. And the fries were thin & delicious. Great beer too.

Don't eat anything before a visit here. Book as if they have a party in it fills up quickly. Big burger, fries, we had 2 beers 2 dips and onion rings. Bill was 900 krona. Fast service tasty food. We had one burger with pear and blue cheese and a vegetarian one the same.

This place was recommended to us by a friend and we are very glad we acted on it! Fantastic burgers. I had a vegan burger, which was delicious and very textured, unlike some vegan options. My partner had beef and thoroughly enjoyed it. Great cocktails, great price, great location. Outdoor seating is great but lots of room inside too.

When we visited, there were two large parties downstairs so we settled in for a wait. We were told there would be a delay in our food arriving which was fine, we had time so made the choice to stay. Had a couple of really lovely cocktails and the OH had a large beer and an aperitif. We actually received our food pretty quickly and were so glad we decided to stay and wait. I had the Caesar burger, a patty with lettuce, croutons, Parmesan and delicious Caesar dressing. Hubby had bacon, cheese, rocket and caramelised onions with his. Both were absolutely delicious. Decent portion of good fries on the side. Really reasonably priced considering what we had and the quality. This place is a little off the beaten track although still really central. But it’s not somewhere you’d necessarily walk past on a tourist route. Search it out, I heartily recommend it. One of the best burgers I’ve had for a long long time.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Awesome service + Great food and drink
review: The Street Burgers and Cocktail is a few streets off the main touristy boulevards but worth finding. The location is small with seating for about 20-25. I went for lunch and loved the Caesar burger and fries. The burger was cooked to perfection and the toppings and bun were fresh. The fries are thin and served crispy, just the way they should be. They also have Czech beer on tap and cocktails to complete your meal. The servers were super friendly they all speak great English. I will definitely be back when I visit Prague again.
Best burgers in Prague! In middle of the town, a small restaurant, we ate on the street tables, excellent food. Definetely recommend
Burger was nice. I have had better but also a lot worse. Not a 5 out of 5 but easy a 4. Onion rings not great, chili mayo is spicy. Good price

cool urban place. The restaurant is not very big, so it's very important to make a reservation! good food and the hamburgers are very big! The prices are not that high. It's good for a quick bite with the lads, not for a romantic dinner with your wife ;)
Went here with some friends for burgers and drinks. Food and service was excellent, and the drinks as well! Good value for money!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Family Vacationer
review: We were well satisfied with our burgers and the staff was also pleasant and helpful - not always a given in Prague.

We visited this restaurant one afternoon to get out of the sun. Initially, we just wanted a drink so we ordered a bottle of Prosecco. We then saw all the food coming out and it looked beautiful. After a while, we decided some nachos. The previous night we visited a Mexican and had nachos and the ones at ‘The Street’ were much better. The nachos were that could we decided to stay even longer and order a burger each. We ordered the burger with the 4 different types of cheese and the chicken in cornflakes. Both were delicious and they were huge! We both agreed they are the best burgers we’ve had in a while and we would 100% recommend.

Just spent a week at Alcron and visited the Be Bop Bar most days. The staff there are excellent and super friendly. We did the cocktail tasting experience which I believe is only for guests of the hotel. Amazing! The amount of detail that goes into the story behind the signature cocktails is great. Best cocktail bar in Prague by a long mile. Also big shout out to Agaphetos (?) who was super friendly and welcoming.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review_title: A quality bar - but it is part of a hotel
review: We really enjoyed the food and my wife the cocktail at Be Bop. Its very high quality, perfect service who were truly helpful on our visit. Relaxed casual clothing - jeans & trainers were fine, but not casual casual!  The only thing that disappointed was that it was the ambience of the place. It's basically a hotel bar, being attached to the hotel and therefore it was smart and clean (good!) but lacked any real character. So come for great food & cocktails just off Wenceslas square, but don't come for the setting - it has none.

Well what can I add that’s not already been said about this place? It’s a hidden gem, you may walk past it thinking you can’t go in because it’s a hotel lobby- but please do! The staff are friendly, the surroundings a relaxing and comfortable and the cocktail menu is awesome! We had so much fun discovering what each one was about... we tried allbutone of the cocktails on offer! Brilliant start to the evening, so much so we went back at the end of the night for more!

We came to the Be Bop Lobby Bar on a family's recommendation and now we are also recommending it to everyone.  This is a large, light and airy bar in the lobby of the Radisson Blu Hotel. The staff are extremely knowledgeable and very friendly.  They have any drink you could want from wines to cocktails and spirits but they also have a special cocktail menu which runs along the theme of 'be something' ie be an alchemist, be offline, be a Chef, be Woody etc. These cocktails all come with props and some of them are very theatrical but great fun.  We tried quite a few of the cocktails off this menu because it was so good that we visited twice whilst on our trip to Prague. All the staff were really friendly and we got chatting to Jan at the bar on both visits, what a star he is.  My best tips are sit at the bar if you can, order off of the "Be" cocktail menu, get involved and have some fun. We are back to Prague this October and will definitely be back in here.
Spent one night here and enjoyed it. If you‘re in the area it‘s worth checking out and have some nice drinks.

review_title: Friendly & Inviting Atmosphere At The Be Bop Bar
review: We happened upon the Be Bop Bar what a great find although a typical hotel bar its friendly staff where nothing is a problem its all about your comfort & enjoyment. Cocktails are great the bar staff are very knowledgeable & speak very good English, better than me after the visit, a must go to if you are visiting Prague. Not sure why they put olive oil on the peanuts though....

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Family Vacationer
review: In terms of decor, this lobby bar is your typical...well lobby bar! That's not to say it wasn't a pleasant place to have a drink, because it was. I quickly realised this place was popular for its wacky and exciting cocktails. It really is a mystery as to what is going to arrive! Mine tasted good too, which is always a bonus. My hubby wasn't too keen on his, and whilst the setup and props were good, it was disappointing that his 'cocktail' was an already made drink. We like some work going into our cocktails, so something already made was not as pleasing. Definitely worth a visit though.
Good service and atmosphere, reasonably priced and good selection of fun cocktails! There is something for everyone. Defiantly worth a visit!

We visited thinking it would be a great bar, but in reality it was just the lobby area of the Radisson Hotel. Staff were good and drinks menu was decent. Was bit of a walk from W Square. Good but not worth walking far for.

We booked this from the UK as part of our weekend. On arrival and throughout our entire experience the service as superb. Staff are very attentive and the accompaniments to the cocktails are very funny and a great piece of theatre. The food portions are huge My lobster bisque was delicious followed by a great burger cooked to perfection. My cocktail was custom made after I described what I liked and it was a,axing, and strong! Overall a superb experience well worth it The toilets were, as fitting for this sort of venue, immaculate.

review_title: Great cocktails. Great fun. Great staff
review: With our stay at the Radisson Blu we received credit for the bar and restaurant, so we used ours in Be Bop bar.  Before I talk about the drinks, I want to talk about the staff. We sat at the bar for 3 nights, and on two nights were attended to by Honza (I hope that’s his name). Sure - you can just drink the drinks for theatre and get drunk and fall off your bar stool.  But what we learned over 3 nights is just how much time, energy, intelligence and creativity goes into the formulation of the recipes AND the ingredients that go into them. They make many of their own ingredients, and the processes take a long time and a lot of care and skill.  Now, to the cocktails.  They are unique, fun, beautifully balanced and well worth trying. I won’t say much about them, but if you want to sit at a bar, dressed in a laboratory coat and a safety mask, while a cocktail basically explodes in front of you, this is the place to go!  As well as their own list of house cocktails, they’ll make pretty much any cocktail you suggest.  BRILLIANT!
We came here for the cocktails. And we have not been disappointed. They not only look great - they taste good as well.

user_tags: Foodie;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Having read previous reviews we just had to see for ourselves, a little surprised to find the bar as part of a large modern hotel as we'd have expected a quirky, dark back-street setting. The waiter, Adam, was really, really friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed the cocktails experience and would go back for more next time. I'm not showing the photos as it would spoilt it - go and find out yourselves!

review_title: A worthwhile visit for drinks and soup
review: We had walked around the inner city areas before a thunderstorm and heavy rainfall mid / late afternoon. We were seeking refuge from the rain and cold and enjoyed a drink and bun here. A vibrant busy little bar area.  It was very busy but we wer3 att3nded to by friendly courteous staff. It was a good result here for about 75 minutes in a warm comfortable location.  Happy to recommend

Come for the cocktails as they are so good and very unique in style  I chose a be delicious which arrived with a tooth brush and tooth paste (raspberry pure) the cocktail was amazing but the attention to detail was fab, I touched the wet tooth brush and it tasted minty fab  We saw other cocktails being made, some with dry ice and others being served in a trophy.  Not to far of the heated track, well worth a visit

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Really glad we went. Great fun cocktails and lovely friendly staff. Prices not bad either. The Alchemist cocktail was great 👍
Great little place to visit with friends for a drink. The cocktail menu is exciting and the cocktails themselves do not disappoint. Great atmosphere and reasonably priced.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
