review_title: Ssshhhh - one of pragues best kept secrets
review: One of Pragues best kept secrets ! Exciting, interesting, deliciously unique cocktails at great prices, bar staff are excellent, you even get complimentary mixed nuts. We tried most of the cocktail menu! Its lovely here the cocktails will blow your mind. We would definitely go back!

This is a hidden gem in the city, no people here, quiet music, nice interior - perfect service and good food at reasonable prices. The coffee was some of the best I had in Prague. In short - I will definitely be returning.
The drinks were so interesting, the service was amazing and the free bar snacks were a very welcome bonus!

Went in to Raddisson to try treat our wifes to cocktails and were not disappointed,my brother in law and I just had beers but our wifes had 2 cocktails each,all different and were satisfied no end.The barman came over with what looked like a glass of liquid nitrogen because when he poured it out it created a very impressive smoke like substance and created an amazing effect to supplement the wonderful cocktails.
The cocktails in this bar - and the way they are served - are way beyond average. It's fun, it's entertaining and it's very tasty! Thumbs to the waiters and bartenders for making our night!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review: Found this place merely by googling cocktail bars near to where we were walking - and what a super find! It's on a street just off Wenceslas square We sat at the bar where we were entertained by Jan and Jan making their signature cocktails and some special ones created just for us A really fun couple of hours

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review: Nice bar menu ... with interesting cocktails... the signature burger was very good and grilled skewers were very good too... service is slow

i was here for some drinks with a couple of my friends. i have to say that the decor of the place does not do the drinks any justice. you would nevere have guessed that the drinks and the service was so good when looking at that dull decor. Our server Pavla was lovely and funny when serving us and the drinks were verry coorky and tasted good. i highly rekomend this place

Staff are so friendly and attentive! Ordered a nemo cocktail which came with a toy fish! My other half ordered a be prepared cocktail which came with toothpaste and a toothbrush. Just brilliant. Would definitely recommend if you're into cocktails

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: This restaurant is located a little bit outside the centre of Prague but it’s well worth going there. The staff are friendly and can-do. There is a very good selection of great food and it’s presented in a very pleasant way. We did the wine pairing which seemed to have been a very good choice. Altogether a very pleasant evening.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Though the entrance wasn’t very welcoming due to work on the street, once inside you immediatly are reassured that this has been a good choice. Not a restaurant for the average tourist but for the average gourmet. The atmosphere and service feel like Michelin star circumstances, and the quality of the whinelist certainly is. We enjoyed an excellent diner with a very pleasant Banfi Belnero 2013 as advised by the chef. The check pleasantly moderate to complete a gourmet surprise.

If I should describe the restaurant with just one word, it would be: Perfect! The interior, the atmosphere, the staff and not least the service and the food ... Perfect. We had a four courses seasonal meal with wine menu and we were extremely satisfied. I can only recommend this place!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: A wonderful lunch across a lovely cobbled courtyard
review: I just came back from Prague (weekend of Oct; 9-11, 2020) and I had lunch at Grand Cru. What a lovely place.  The restaurant is out of the tourist "beaten path" but it is really worth the detour. I started with wonderful, tasty, quail ravioli, spinach, lemon. I then had as a copious main course the shredded leg of lamb, potato puree, baked vegetables. I ended up with a lovely dessert: Baked yoghurt, plums, poppy seeds.  The restaurant has a nice selection of wines by the glass and an amazing list of wines (bottles). I had wine by the glass (being solo). I took a glass of white wine Sonberk 2017 (Chardonnay and Pinot gris) and for dessert a glass of Sonberk Palava 2016. Sonberk is the icon of Czech Republic´s winemaking. First time I tasted their wines but I loved it. I also found the cutlery rest very nicely designed.  After lunch, I had a tour of the beautiful wine cellar of the restaurant: amazing bottles! I had lunch in the covered patio overlooking the cobblestone courtyard. They have several little dining room, if you want a more intimate dinner. Opposite to the courtyard, they also have a building where they have the wine cellar as well as a dining room with a vaulted ceiling. They organize event of wine tasting there. Grand Cru was a lovely discovery with great food, friendly staff! Due to Covid, there were only few customers. However, I will definitely go again to Grand Cru when I return to Prague.
We had Sunday dinner at Le Grand Cru and it was simply fantastic. My pasta with truffle was specially memorable. The room was lovely and quiet and the staff was so nice.

Grand Cru is a terrific restaurant....it would be top notch anywhere! Beautiful setting; romantic; great service; great wine list, and terrific food! What else is there? Loved the salmon egg amuse bouche; the quail appetizer with kale and quince was great; and OMG, the white truffled pasta was out of this world! This place is as good as it gets! Our best upscale meal in Prague! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: Great food, service and wine.  The food is deserved of a Michelin star.  Wine selection is extensive ranging from good value wines to expensive.  We booked a couple of weeks before our visit and the four of us all gave it five stars.  Waiters are friendly but very professional.  I highly recommend dining here.

What a night to remember. We went for the taster menu which was wonderful tasty and original! The service was superb and so very friendly. We then got invited to the kitchen which was impeccable and met the chef. And finally we were so very kindly given a tour of the cellars ... the largest in Prague. What a memorable night. Thanks to all at Grand Cru. You deserve the success you will no doubt have. ❤️

As there were a few changes in Grand Cru, I had to check it out! They have new two chefs, who really know, what they are doing. As always, you can expect at Grand Cru a wonderful service with a good recommendation. Perfect wine, incredible surprising menu. Super tasty, perfect fresh food that looks wonderful. Always a pleasure to visit for a business meeting or for a dinner with my beloved. We really enjoyed the time spent and we simply loved the food! I highly recommend the dill soup and you HAVE TO try the chocolate dessert with amarena!

We had a conference coming in Prague last week and I arranged for a group of 11 of us to have dinner at Grand Cru. They were wonderful to work with and very accommodating of any dietary restrictions. They provided a pre-fix 4 course menu, but I was able to give everyone a choice of entree so long as we let the kitchen know our selections within a few days notice. We did the wine pairing with dinner and it was superb. Everyone absolutely loved their dinner and I highly recommend. Thank you to Kristyna for helping coordinate the details and to everyone else for a wonderful evening!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Foodie;Like a Local
review: I was visiting Prague for three days and I chose GC based on its reviews as one of the restaurants for dinner with friends. I usually go to my favorite restaurants here that I know that are very good but wanted to try something new. Unfortunately, none of us left impressed. Their menu mainly consists of local cuisine, which includes a lot of meat. I’m a pescatarian and I had a hard time finding more than one or two pescatarian dishes. The appetizer was good but nothing spectacular overall and we wouldn’t probably go back.
I had the 5 course dinner and although on the higher side than other tasting menu restaurants it was well worth it. The service was excellent and my nice waiter helped me making the right choices.

Quaint and romantic setting in a little alleyway that opens up to the main restaurant. Only thing that lets this place down is the toilets which are in need of a refurbishment. Otherwise it’s a 5* place.

This was a pleasant and unexpected surprise: the food was absolutely delicious and beautifully prepared using wonderful ingredients. The quail stuffed with duck meat was a very interesting presentation and truly sublime. Overall, it was a perfect dinner with outstanding service. I will definitely recommend this restaurant for gourmets or for a special romantic dinner. We will definitely be back for another exceptional meal. This restaurant should definitely be in line for a Michelin star.
The grilled lamb must try, it is so nice. Price is at the high side but it is worth to try. Menu is attached, you can see whether the price is acceptable to you
I recommend taking a tasting menu with wine pairing. It was one of the delicious tasting menu we had in the Czech Republic.

Lovely and perfectly prepared dishes. Absolutely adored the hake with saffron sauce. That smoked butter for bread was so different and so interesting. Friendly and professional staff. Great wine list and delicious coffee.

I was invited for a lunch. quite fancy menu. they did very strong smoke aroma on first dishes - intersting experience but not my taste all though perfectly prepared and served. good service all well english speaking.  Not sure if I would go again but nice ambiente and friendly staff.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: We go out in Prague a lot and always try new restaurants, last night we have visited GC and we loved it. It's located a bit out of main streets and you need to walk a bit from nearest metro station but it's worthwhile a visit. Nice elegant decor, great service, very nice wine and food is DELICIOUS! I tried the foie gras which was amazing and very innovative presentation as a ice cream stick and wild boar, very jummy! We will be back soon!

Had New Years eve dinner at this restaurant. It was a set tasting menu for the evening, absolutely delicious, everything we had was amazing. Hats off to the chef, it was truly great. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to every Prague traveler.

Intimate dinning place, serving fabulous and extremely affordable business lunch and certainly also dinner. The wine menu is huge but not overpriced. Cuisine is awesome, French and Mediterranean style could be an inspiration but never a dogma. Chef is very creative and always ready to talk to customers. Service is attentive. This charming place should be Michelin star awarded. Where have you been, commissars? Definitively, one of Prague best restaurants.

I was here recently while visiting family and had a wonderful experience. My Cousin believes this is the best restaurant in Prague. After my visit I would say it's right up there. The service and hospitality are top notch. I started out with the Mackerel sashimi which is my favorite and it was terrific. I then enjoyed Guineafowl with stuffed nettles and garlic served for 2. I've not had anything like it. Tender, juicy and full of flavors I was not accustomed to. They feature a excellent wine list and some delicious deserts. Great atmosphere and I must emphasize the stellar service. The staff was friendly, engaging, knowledgeable, and eager to please. One of the finest meals I've had in all my visits to Praha. Bravo!

Amazing place with seating In the yard. The food is excellent, even the menu is short. Very tasty, fresh and creatively served. French or Italian cuisine par excelence. Wide wine selection incl the Austrian rieslings. Great deserts and selection of French cheeses.

review_title: outstanding wine list in a fine dining restaurant
review: Delicious French restaurant in Prague with a wine bar in front and a fine dining restaurant in the back. A short menu of sophisticated dishes, with very well prepared sweetbreads and absolutely of the delicious baked chicken. But above all the place has one of the most impressive wine list of the French wine I've seen outside of France - all the regions are well represented but Burgundy is by by far the best with outstanding choice of well priced bottles. Great discovery

review_title: Level Pegging For Best Restaurant Of Our Trip
review: We arrived in Prague on a Friday so getting a booking at any of the well known restaurants was impossible. Thank goodness our concierge new this place because I'm sure it is better than anything we would have chosen. Superb food,... attentive, well informed waiters and for a sunny evening the perfect conservatory style room decorated with flair. This is a fantastic find for those wanting the very best fine dining experience. It does not have a Michelin star yet but I'm convinced that it is not far away. My only negative note would be that wine by the glass seems mean even by French standards. It is a drop more than the average Australian tasting. BUT... food of this quality for $70 a head is hard to beat. Only one restaurant has come near this place in our three weeks of travel so far. Almost perfection!!

We visited this brand new restaurant after we had heard of it from friends.  I remember this restaurant used to be "U Cervena Tabulka", and it is amazing what they have done with the place, you will not recognize it. They have a new bar area, and an incredible beverage selection  The food was simply out of this world. We all tried two dishes, which were all good. I had veal and my wife ordered lamb. Both great, the meat you could cut with your fork. The desserts look great but after that sumptuous dinner we could not eat any more. The price was justified regarding the quality.

review_title: For me the best restaurant in Prague
review: Jan Punčochář is my favorite chef, Le Terroir was my favorite place because of him and still hast his track. Grand cru is in my opinion much better. You will get really great food and offer of wines is also excellent its very hard to find some mistake. i didn't .

review_title: Classic cuisine with excellent (mainly French) wines
review: The restaurant is partially in a cellarlike room and partially in a glass covered room in a court yard. Nicely decorated and intimate; very nice and friendly atmosphere. Personal greeting by the manager. Most of the guests are local, both business people and couples/groups of friends. Dress code appears to be mostly smart casual, but you can come in jeans if you want.  They have a 6 course tasting menu with small portions of the chef's signature dishes with accompanying wines. This is what we ordered. Beautifully arranged and with many special tastes. Somewhat classic French cuisine; i.e. not that innovative (but that probably is intentional). Clearly, technically of the highest level. The accompanying (French) wines were well chosen and of very good quality. We did have a look at the winelist also. It contains a very long list of mainly French wines (they also have wines from other countries, but the most extensive list is the French one), in line with the name of the restaurant.  Although we told the waiter we were not in a hurry, the speed of serving the courses was rather high. Service was rather routinely performed, in what appeared a hurry and not that personal. The waiter that brought the dishes was not able to explain them, other than the main ingredient ("duck!"). That was a pity; perhaps it was a language issue.  For this high class restaurant, pricing was fully acceptable but on the high end in Prague.  All in all, technically perfect cooking, a nice atmosphere, but it would be nice if the service would be somewhat more relaxed and informative.

We adored Grand Cru. My husband found it researching Prague and we were so happy he did! We went for lunch. Showed up a little late (probably around 2pm) but they didn't mind at all and served us with a smile. We got the two-course lunch menu but got an amuse-bouche to start and Petit fours to finish. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable and willing to chat about the food, wine, and city. Would highly recommend to anyone going to Prague - a great break from all the heavy Czech food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Our hotel concierge recommended this restaurant, off the tourist streets in Prague. We could not have been happier. Fantastic food, great service, in a lovely warm atmosphere.

review_title: Such a lovely addition to the Prague restaurant scene
review: We visited this brand new restaurant after we had heard some positive signals from friends.  I remember this restaurant used to be "U Cervena Tabulka", and it is amazing what they have done with the place, you will not recognise it. They have a beautiful bar area, and an incredible wine selection/cellar.  The food was simply out of this world. We all tried different dishes, which were all amazing. Our favourites were the octopus carpaccio, the lamb and definitely the cherry dessert.  Will be back soon!

review_title: Probably one of the best India Food in Prague
review: I have been here by chance just because I was in this area and wanted to have Indian Food. Don't get decepted by entry and reception of restaurant, it looks bit dull. Main restaurant is in basement where ambiance is much nicer. Food was delicious without adding colors etc. which are typically used in Indian Restaurants. Would certainly visit again.

review_title: Good good and service, every time
review: Rangoli delivers good quality and service every time. This is my tenth visit for both buffet and a la cart with friends and solo.  The all-you-can-eat buffet from Mondays to Fridays offers guests a range of over half a dozen curries to opt for. Cooking is skilled, tasty and excellent value.  In all my visits I've never had any negative experience.

review_title: Come here for memorable service and food.
review: Rangoli doesn't mess around when authentic Indian food is concerned. From start to finish, everything on the menu is well prepared and presented.  I opted for the chicken Vindaloo - a hot dish for those into spice. I particularly liked the finishing touches of Mukhwas, which serves as authentic after dinner mints. /Mukh/ and /vas/ - denoted in the name, Mukhwas - literally translate as mouth and smell.  A meal consisting of a meat curry, rice, garlic naan (breads), five drinks and a Kulfi (Indian ice-cream) came to a very reasonable 840 CZK (just under 30GBP). This was plenty for the two of us and shall be returning with friends over the next couple of weeks.  As for the service I cannot fault it and was the prominent quality of our dining experience. The waiters greeted me with clemency and their attention to our overall comfort throughout our dining experience was sharp.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Wonderful location for some good Asian food in the area. The location is quite nice and very comfortable. The only issue experienced was there was a long wait before being greeted upon entering. To start, the roti canai paratha was chosen and the shredded teriyaki beef was incredibly flavorful. For the main, the red curry was equally excellent with a good amount of spice to it. The space was very inviting, comfortable and had a nice vibe. The location is not overly big, but spacious enough. The toilets were comfortable and kept very clean. The overall experience here was quite good and would definitely visit again in the future.
we had a lovely meal here, the food was fresh, well presented and really tasty. I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in Prague.

Had dinner here on Friday night. The restaurant is attractive, the staff welcoming and the food simply delicious. As there were four of us we had quite a bit of the menu - foie gras creme brûlée, goats cheese and beetroot, lamb, veal cheek, rabbit, spatzle, pancake with blueberries and sour cream. It was all really lovely as was the bread served with it. It's a bit of a way from the main town but definitely worth the journey.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We recently travelled to Prague for a special 50th birthday celebration and as we were due to arrive late on the day before the big day, I pre-booked this restaurant before leaving the UK thanks to Trip Advisor reviews! Mirek responded to all of my emails not only very quickly but also in English which of course is not his native tongue. The restaurant is quite a long way out from the centre of Prague, but as we were not staying in the centre and were the right side of Prague for this particular restaurant, it was only about a 15 mins taxi ride which we booked via our hotel. Mirek was very friendly and welcoming and very helpful with recommendations and advice - both on the menu and on Prague. The food was beautifully presented and tasted awesome! As it was a special birthday meal, we had 3 courses (rabbit and lamb for main courses) together with a bottle of wine, a dessert wine, a digestif and a coffee and it came to around £70 all in for 2 of us which we felt very reasonable given the quality of the food. The choice on the menu was plentiful and they brought rustic artisan bread with a pork pate to nibble on whilst choosing our dishes. There was something for everybody wanting to eat true Czech food. This is not your English chicken & chips pub nor a czech menu for tourists. This is a quality restaurant serving quality food for a special occasion - just what we wanted on my 50th birthday celebration and we couldn't have chosen a better place. The service was excellent and it was very busy. In fact they were fully booked on a Friday evening - out of season - so I would highly recommend pre-booking as we saw people being turned away. Quite a lot of local Czech diners too which I always think is a good sign. We would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant for a special occasion and we would definitely return. Thank you Mirek! It was a delight!

review_title: Longlist of drinks for any taste :)
review: we had a lunch here and all the dishes were very good, especially duck and steak! Would defenitely recommend

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover
review: This is a bit of a trek if you are staying in central Prague, but taxis are cheap and it is definitely worth the effort.  The serving staff were brilliant, and helped make the visit so enjoyable.  We had some excellent dishes, and the steak in particular was stunning.  Some really nice desserts followed by some strong-tasting liqueurs they insisted we have helped finish a stunning meal.  Give it a visit, but book a table as it gets busy.
This restaurant is a little bit hidden gem because of its location, but it is definitely worth of visit. The staff was friendly and attentive and the food was very tasty.

A bit out of town but accessible by public transport (or about 15 mins by taxi). Nicely presented restaurant. Staff really friendly and great hosts. Menu is great - traditional food really nicely done. The fois gras was delicious. The guinea foul was delightful. We were too full for dessert. They have local wines which were great. A really pleasant meal.

review_title: A little if the beaten track but well worth the visit
review: We had dinner here in the suburbs of Prague. Lovely restaurant, tables well spaced, nice welcome. The service was very good, even though they were full. The food was excellent and the wines (including imported) and other drinks reasonably priced. All the starters were delicious and we can recommend the “shared” all starter plate. The foie gras starter was special. Best if the mains for us was the calf cheeks.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We were staying in Prag near downtown but after reading the reviews of this restaurant we decided to go with the tram up there. It was the very best decission ever. Although we did not have a reservation (wich you shoul really try to do) they offered us a table for 1.5 hr. The service was always friendly and professional, you could feel how they enjoy their work. We were offered a glass of prosecco and it was good with some bread and a delicious home made pâté. Our waiter recomended us his favorites, so we had the plate with a small portion of all starters, I had the veal cheeks in red wine and my partner had the roasted duck breast, both were delicious, the sauces were great and the meat was tender, tasty, perfect! We shared a creme brulee and it was the perfect end for the perfect meal. I had a lemonade with grapefruit, it was also very good. As a whole, it was a nice experience and we are looking forward to go again to Prag and to Pepr a Sul. If you are visiting Prag and looking for a good meal, you shoul go to this place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Thrifty Traveler
review: Found this gem based on TA reviews and could not be more pleased. It is located outside of the center but easily accessible by the B metro or several Trams. It is a quaint and cute local place with amazing people running it. The food was so delicious, it was one of our best meals. My gf had the veal cheek and I had the rabbit and both were prepared to perfection. The flavors were truly delicious. The two men who run the place were so nice, they attended to our every need and went above an beyond when a plate dropped and splattered on my gf's jacket. They treated us like friends and took care of everything we needed. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. The food, atmosphere and staff are top notch.
This was an amazing surprise. Really loved the amazing food and servis. I am amazed! You really should go there!

So glad we went the extra mile to come here! We had a beautiful meal for a great price. Wonderful ambience and friendly service. I had a foie gras creme brûlée for starters! Mains were deer, Guinea fowl, duck, lamb with gorgeous mash and creamed spinach. Totally recommended!

review_title: Top spot. Pay for the cab from town
review: Wonderful! We picked this on the basis that it was near the 02 so we could eat before a concert.  Frankly, it is worth going out by tube or even by cab just eat that. Very much a hidden gem as you are not likely to walk past it. Make sure you reserve and go a little hungry the food is fantastic, the service wonderful together with Marina definitely in the top two places we tried while in Prague. Totally totally good.  Perhaps $100 for two even after you have plenty of Prosecco and three courses. Extremely good value for money if you come from the rest of continental Europe.
Really lovely atmosphere, varied menu, great food, great price, good service. Recommended if you are looking for somewhere to eat outside of the city centre.

Booked a table here for a Thursday night for 5 of us, recommend you book as it isn't big and it was busy.  A bit of way from our hotel in the city but worth the Uber ride.  Menu is varied with enough options of both food (meat and fish) and drinks. Three of us had the veal schnitzel with potato salad which was generous in size and very tasty. The other two had the duck which they said just melted in their mouth.  Opted for dessert of the pancakes with blueberries which was a perfect end to a fabulous dinner. A bottle of wine, two courses each and the bill was reasonable especially for the quality of food we ate.  Service was attentive and friendly - highly recommend you try this restaurant out.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: High level of quality and taste
review: We have spent already couple of days in Prague, exploring different restaurants. This one so far is the best. The service, food quality and presentation are far better that the ones we tried with no exemption. Price wise the restaurant is offering amazing value for money (four people with full menu each - salad, main course and desert for below 2500 k). Real hidden gem outside the downtown. So it is worth every step of your going to this place!

We visited this place with my family recently. Great atmosphere, thoughtful and creative way of presenting daily menus. Rich selection of beverages. Interesting combinations of tastes and preparation styles. I decided to go with beef broth and flank steak. Food presentation was modern and classic at the same time (this way I like it the most).The only reason why I’m not giving 5* is that on my taste there was too much marinade on the meat and therefore the taste of it overcomes the pure taste of the flank steak. Another thing was that I ordered this steak with green beans made on bacon and some of them were still ice-cold, but this is a common mistake and it did’t destroy the whole experience. I would truly recommend anyone to come to this place.
Visited Pepr a Sul last night with a group of colleagues and business associates. This place is a real hidden gem. Excellent warm and friendly welcome. Great service and the food is incredible.

review_title: My very favorite outside of the center
review: I like this place for both luncheon or dinner, definitely recommend to try either the Wiener schnitzel, veal liver or the ribs. Its an honest food, very well made using great and fresh ingredients. The staff is always friendly and professional. Good selection of wines and spirits. Make sure to make a reservation to secure your seat especially during the lunch time. Excellent price/value, for such quality you pay at most places double the price!
This restaurant is outstanding! Nice people, well English, perfect prices compared to quality of food! 100% I'll be back!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker
review_title: Nice place, very nice food and convenient if you are staying in the Clarion hotel near by
review: Worth a visit if your staying in the neighborhood. The serve very nice food and the places looks good as well. The staff is helpful and friendly. I'll definitely go back there next time I'm staying in the hotel near by.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This place is located in countryside of Prague city. You can feel sereneness in the restaurant and around it. They serve authentic Indian cuisine. The team has served in excellent manner to our group of 50 people. They also have outdoor sitting in the backyard of hotel which is lovely place to enjoy the food. I visited this place in winter as a result it was closed ( open dining area). Owner of the place is amicable in nature

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Place is quite, nice and warm. Food is delicious. Price is affordable. Service is more than pleasant, they speak Czech and English.

review_title: Great and peaceful place for good food and relaxation!
review: I found this place pasing by to the nearby Black Bridge golf resort. It was early afternoon (2pm) and I discovered they are still at this hour serving All you can eat lunch menu. The food was excellent though mainly vegetable dishes and only one chicken dish. At this time the restaurant was empty and I trully enjoyed sitting outside on the terrace enjoying peacefully the tastefull original indian food. Great service, great food, great value! Go for it!

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: We had a very nice lunch set at a very fair price. The fresh ingredients and the modern style of preparation impressed us . We will certainly come back.

Complimentary champagne on arrival for our celebration - thank you!  We went for the a la carte - 2 starters (carpaccio and soup), 3 mains (duck, rabbit and lamb chop & shoulder) and 1 dessert (white chocolate).. for 2 of us.. we couldn't decide between 2 mains so got 3!  All of the food was great -especially the duck, so highly recommend this dish. Being in Czech Republic we wanted to try a Czech wine. A very different wine and not what we'd normally choose, but it did grow on me! Our waiter (light haired middle-aged guy - sorry I've forgotten his name!) was faultless. The service from all staff was fantastic. Very attentive and even offering other wine free of charge when we weren't keen on the Czech!  Thank you again for a wonderful evening! I would highly recommend Blue Wagon. Fantastic food, great service and great value for money!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: A wonderful evening from start to finish
review: We went to the Blue Wagon to start the holiday season here in Prague. We were not disappointed. Each course was absolutely perfect. We told the waiter that we couldn't decide what we loved more - the kulajda soup, the beef tongue in horseradish source, the deer tenderloin... It was all cooked perfectly and the combination of tastes was perfect for a cold Bohemian evening. The wine was good by the class, but pricey. The dessert was lovely - but an extra scoop of that lovely ice cream would have made our evening absolutely perfect. Definitely a restaurant to which we will return.
this was a good experience, tasty food, great service, reasonable pricing. outstanding opportunity to meet friends or just visit and enjoy culinary

We visited this restaurant for dinner with our daughter and granddaughter. The place is clean and well decorated and the service was above and beyond. The food was well presented and delicious. We couldn’t have been happier with everything.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: We went last night to the Blue Wagon for a lovely dinner. The service was fantastic - and the food was excellent. The waitress was just chatty enough for a lovely evening. The menu is limited, but the food is well prepared, the portions are a perfect size and the tastes are wonderful. We started with the prawns with passion fruit, chili and coriander and were gobsmacked! The taste was perfect - and prawns were served warm. The homemade bread and butter with seasalt was a wonderful addition. For the main I had the veal steak and my partner had the rabbit - which was tender and not dried out! The wine by the glass was good, but served only by the deciliter. And the dessert menu was too limited for us. We would have had a dessert, but they were only two sweet desserts and a cheese plate. We went home to have our own. Would definitely recommend this restaurant and we hope to return!

Food was great and nicely decorated on the plate. Portions seems quite small but and the end I was completely full. Personal was good. We dont like interiér as it was quite over decorated. Wine was quite expensive. In general i would recommend the place for business meeting or romantic dinner in the evening.

We really enjoyed our dining experience at Blue Wagon. The food is very good, not quite the standard of Mlynec or Bellevue, but at half the price. The foie gras is highly recommended, ir was served on a slice of blueberry bread and was delicious. Very friendly staff, which enhanced the experience. Will visit this restaurant again. Highly recommended if you want a good meal at a reasonable price.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Great service, great food, what else?
review: A rather sober yet classy environment, friendly and professional service and, of course, delicious food. It's creative with attention to details (it looks good to start with) and interesting combination of flavours. A bit pricey but not shocking and worth the experience. Highly recommended and I'll surely go again.

Booked this restaurant for a weekend in Prague based on the positive reviews and it lived up to expectations! Firstly Blue Wagon is situated in a lovely neighbourhood, away from the main tourist areas but very easily accessible by public transport.... at first slightly disappointed as had set my heart on the tasting menu although this finished at 8pm (*) so chose off 'a la carte'... disappointment didn't last very long as I enjoyed an excellent 3 course dinner with a little a 'surprise' thrown in by the restaurant.... all great quality and very tasty. Service was excellent with really nice surroundings and decor.. would recommend to anyone visiting Prague looking for a nice dining experience.  * Visiting the more Mediterranean cities am used to dining later 9pm / 10pm ..... based on a brief visit Prague seems to dine earlier with restaurants empty by 1030 / 11....

Ate here with my husband, mother in law and aunt in law and all of us left satisfied.  I had booked, it wasn’t busy for a Friday night but it isn’t a big restaurant so I would advise booking so you don’t miss out.  Staff are friendly and welcoming. The menu has enough choices of starters and mains so to satisfy everyone’s taste.  Two of us started with the goat cheese with marinated beetroot, it was perfect with the goats cheese melting in your mouth. Another dining partner went for the rabbit broth which she said was very good.  Mains, I had the supreme chicken which went well with the chilli marmalade. Two others had the duck which was generous in size and cooked just right. Another had the beef which was also a winner.  Only one of us went for a dessert of chocolate mousse which was very rich and a great way to end the meal.  With a bottle of wine, the meal was slightly expensive but definitely worth it and we enjoyed it thoroughly. Highly recommend!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: I loved everything about this restaurant, from the intimate atmosphere to the thoughtful service we received and the complimentary Czech wine at the end. The food is delicious and nicely served. It was also very good value for money. Recommended!

review_title: Fresh, tasty, fantastic looking food and great customer service!
review: Very nice restaurant, whit amazing food and very good customer service! Everything there is fresh and so tasty Menu is very interesting and in total I tried 5 different meals (1starter, 3 different mains, 1dessert) and all of them were unbelievable! Very chatty staff with very good knowledge and with good up selling skills! I highly recommend!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review_title: Very good food and presentation but let down by poor service generally. I did have such high hopes.
review: After seeing such great reviews this restaurant was on my wife an I's `bucket list' of places to visit. The food was of a very good standard, well cooked and presented very professionally. The wine menu was also well selected and varied. The thing that let this venue down was the poor level of service generally. The lady serving us was appeared confused, did not know what was on the menu (the menu id not particularly lengthy) and paid poor attention to us even though it was fairly empty. Instead both her and her colleague focused on two gentlemen who we assumed were regularly from their conversations. We also waited a very long time after having our plates cleared away before being offered desert. For such a venue and with prices set as they are I would have expected better having dined at a large number of other places in Prague of the same level. My wife and I do not plan on coming back again.
took my parents there. the atmosphere is fantastic. Wine is great and food is good too. A bit out of the centre but worth venturing out to.

We walked past this and thought it looked good- the good rating on TA sealed the deal for us to return that evening. Good menu- enough choice but not OTT. Thomasz was the perfect host and very knowledgeable about aperitifs and wines -great sherry to start. Complimentary garlic bread was delicious and so was the extra bread we requested to mop up the sauce that came with the lamb and venison options of the main course. All of the food was terrific- not one moan or gripe about anything from anyone in our group of 6. Thomasz did us a selection of desserts to share between us plus a cheeseboard and then a port to seal the deal. I finished up with a ginger tea- made with wonderful fresh ginger, lemon and honey- the BEST I have ever had! I'm going back to Prague and will come back here too!

review_title: Wonderful Food, Great wine and awesome service
review: The scallop appetizer was really good, but the halibut was exceptional. We also had some great local wines. Highly recommend this.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Nice place this. Friendly staff, good menu and decent wine. Lots of attention to presentation of food, which was delicious. Few things that could be improved - music (80s eg Whitney Houston, Lionel Richie, Tapau I think?!) and bright lighting which was more in keeping with a cafe than a restaurant into the detail. But I'd be surprised if you didn't walk out happy. A safe bet for dinner and good value for money too.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;Beach Goer
review: Nestled in a mostly residential area, it's easy to pass by Blue Wagon and fail to appreciate the magic happening in its kitchen. Mixing creative flavors and proteins (venison, pheasant, octopus) with more traditional Czech fare yields a menu that is fun, challenging and changes frequently. It was so good we ate there on consecutive nights. Each time I had the venison, which is easy to "get wrong" -- but it was perfect in seasoning, sauce, cooking temperature and a duet of thin-sliced asparagus and polenta cakes. The plate presentation is as good as any New York high end restaurant - but expect to spend about 1/4 of what you would in the Big Apple. The best leading indicator is the wine list -- carefully curated and personally selected, and priced for you to enjoy a variety of pairings, not make you feel guilty about venturing into new areas. The wait staff knows the wines (including obscure Italian vintages) and was perfectly attentive. Possibly the best meal I have eaten in Europe.

review_title: Food is not a sideline here
review: This was our second time at Blue Wagon. And though some restaurants are just there to meet friends and have a nice chat, this place is all about it's food. At least they got us and specially the kids wraped round there little finger. The menu has a broad variety of interesting food, there is a good choice of wines (try some of the czech ones). The food and the wine we had was both time a sheer delight. The only thing: this place might want to work on the choice of aperitifs.  So you might think there is a snap to it? Actually no. The prices a fair, there is nothing to complain about. Well, the only thing might be the pronounciation of the road "Uruguayska" - Hungarien road. Rather tell your cab driver you want to go to Blue Wagon restaurant. But if you are looking for a special light bulb moment about food - give it a shot and reserve a table at the Blue Wagon.

review_title: Missing the last touch - but overall good
review: We were 2 couples visiting Prague and had read about this restaurant and were looking forward to a great evening saturday night. We had a table at 19h00. There were not that many People there so we felt a bit alone but had a great table by the window and the service was great. Ordered drinks first - then we got some hors d'oevres before starters and main courses. After what we'd read I expected to Food to be a bit more up scale. I wopuld say it was good but not great. But all in all a Nice restaurant and the price is nothing to complain about. Best: they had a great wine list!!!!

Visited this restaurant after reviewing best restaurants in Prague on Trip Advisor.  Absolutely brilliant. Pleasant staff, lovely surroundings, food awesome. My wife had the wild boar and I had the duck with raspberry, what a wonderful taste on both meals. The waiter recommended a lovely red wine (Roučí 2008, Stapleton-Springer, Bořetice) which complimented the food really well.  For dessert we shared the cheeses and fig board which again was splendid. Followed by tea and coffees.  All this came to under £45 for the two of us.  We enjoyed the experience so much we went back the following day and had the beef wellington and saddle of rabbit, again excellent! Would thoroughly recommend this restaurant to anyone

review_title: We booked a table as it was No 1 on trip advisor.
review: Ble Wagon is a lovely resturant with great food, however our waiter was quite arrogant. We didn't get any bread or nibbles when other tables did, we had a lovely bottle of wine, and asked for it by the glass at the end of the meal. The bottle we had was a 2010, the glasses were 2008, the waiter said it was the same wine, I said it couldn't be as it was a different year, but he disagreed with me, which I thought was rude, plus the size of the glass he poured was very small, when other people were having wine their glasses were twice the size. As I said the food was fantastic and I would recommend it, but the service was disappointing.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Not the cheapest place in town but it has a dignified ambiance and a wonderful palette of food to enjoy. Small tip if you need reading glasses take them - wine list v small writing! I had foie gras followed by boar followed by cheese. I red from Moravia and some excellent service throughout the evening. Also book - gets very busy.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Excellent and very tasty business lunch for 178 CZK
review: After a few months I have decided to repeat my visit to the Blue Wagon as I still remember their fabolous dishes. This time I went just for a quick three course business lunch menu for a very reasonable price of 178 CZK. Soup excellent, main course excellent, dessert excellent. Real value for money and highly recommended not only for dinner, but also for surprisingly delicious business lunch. I haven't had such good beef on mushrooms with sauce and dumplings for quite a long time, the meat was just melting down in mouth. And even though I am usually not raving about sweets, their dessert a brownie like cade made from rye flour was exactly as tailor made to my taste not so sweet. These guys know to do their job very well and I am sure to repeat the visit soon.

Our son and his wife took us during their visit in Prague to Blue Wagon Restaurant for a surprise treat and it was superb. The restaurant is in a stunning experience in all aspects. The service was first class and all the staff were very attentive. Top class restaurant with great service and delicious food! Their steaks and vegetables are memorable. Highly recommended

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Hidden gem near downton. Wonderful experience
review: Very nice expression of Czech Modern Cuisine. Staff is very professional and also enthusiastic about what they do. Meals are perfect and the prices are very reasonable for the top level gastronomy. I strongly suggest to try their Veal Cheek or steak from Deer Nail together with Brunello di Montalcino 2007 DOCG Mastrojanni. We had this and it was absolutely outstanding. Highly recommended hidden gem.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Probably the best Indian restaurant in Prague. Wonderful service, huge portions and the food is so tasty! It’s nice and cozy inside too. Highly recommend.

The restaurant is away from central hustle bustle in a very quiet area, not recommended to walk at night. On recommendation of waiter we ordered "Nihari Ghosht", which was nice and tasty but incorrectly named as it was not " Real Nihari" and should have been named as "Lamb Shank Masala" which should have been more appropriate. overall good food

review_title: Some of the Best Indian Food I've Ever Had
review: I read reviews describing this one as the best Indian restaurant in Prague, and I thought it was just hyperbole, but this is indeed a wonderful wonderful restaurant. I have zero complaint about all the dishes we orders, as all of them exceeded my expectations. Special node to the mix vegetables curry and the briyani, both were of the best I have ever had.

We were a big group of friends, visiting during New Year's eve night for dinner. Not a single one of us was disappointed. The food was really good, the naan incredible, really cooked to perfection, the menu is huge and the atmosphere laid back. Can't wait to come back soon!!!

As the name says so the food goes...yes it is the best Indian restaurant in Prague...food with authentic taste ..really good and worth visiting this place...if ur craving for I dian food this the place to be..proper tandoori roti... awesome chiken Tikka masala...tasty and thik dal fry ....with perfectly cooked basmati rice..what else you need, they have a good veg n non veg options...and several in drinks as well both alcoholic and non alcoholic....friendly and nice staff  A must try

We tasted several main dishes and most of them were really tasty and very similar to dishes in India.  My favourite is Lamb Tikka Makalo with parratha chilly bread.  My wife enjoyed at most grilled mixed vegetable with garlic naan.   Also other dishes - Palau panzer, dhal makhani we finished finally :-)   We can recommend just one thing - renew your "menu rollers" on the street and renew a little walls and floors inside (not so much, just a little).

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: The food was amazing. I went for the more spicy option and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were simply awesome. I got to try out a new dessert on the house which was quite nice. I highly recommend this place.

Just popped up on my way home, i saw the business lunch price. Less than 6 euros all you can eat. I was amazed by food. The guy is very nice , he is very helpful. Food is great and wide variety with Fresh salad and soup. 1.5 KM from downtown, it is must see and with Business lunch options on Mon-Fri it is FAAAR from being a TOURIST TRAP. MUST SEE restaurant

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Visited this place on my recent trip to Prague. Located near old town and the restaurant is in the basement. Decent place and we ordered our dishes as well as butter chicken. It tasted nothing like butter chicken and we told the manager about it. I appreciate the fact that they listened to our complain and acknowledged the same. They also took of the charges off our final bill. Other then this everything else was good. Service also has a scope for improvement. Overall I would recommend this place for Indian food.

user_tags: Vegetarian;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Apart from the location, the food was horrible.  Being from an Asian background, I feel other communities are blinded by this place as it does not offer the best ethnic taste. Our food was over cooked and the veg dish ordered was tasteless. We did speak to the lady about this and she was adamant that this is how the dish is made. Most of the food went back full but no good will gesture was offered knowing that we didn't eat it.  I am still talking about this place because it is by far the worst place I've eaten at. I would also like to add that when we left the restaurant, the chef came out and was quite inappropriate waving and calling us back in let's just say not in a professional capacity. Perhaps females need to not visit alone.  I am shocked how many good reviews this place has.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Very good Indian restaurant, the food was awesome and very satisfying. The only thing though was that in the menu, it said Coke, I ordered it, I got a Pepsi, you don't do that, it really threw me off, Coke is always better, if it says Coke on the menu, then you should serve Coke. This is the reason why this restaurant won't get an excellent from me.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Completely pleased with service and food quality. You cant go wrong if you want to opt for an Indian dinner night. Good job guys. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: 120 CZK for an all-you-can-eat Lunch Buffet (Monday to Friday, 11-3pm) and unlimited water is not common in the Czech Republic...but I tell you now....YOU WILL BE HAPPY!  I was first introduced to Lal Qila by a friend and have been back a few times for this buffet. The logic is simple, why spend 200-300 CZK on lunch when you don't have to. PLUS the food and service is outstanding!  The food menu changes daily, so you never know exactly what you will be served, but it doesn't matter because they have both vegetarian and meat dishes; which are properly spiced.  Will I go again? Of course, I am planning a trip tomorrow and maybe next week!  Oh yeah, and you get a free piece of Naan!!!

It was our first day at Prague, we had been to Lal Quila for Lunch, They have Buffet on Weekdays which is quite reasonably Priced at 120 KC. The food was tasty, we had also ordered Mango Lassi, which was quite refreshing.W Would very much recommend this Restaurant to India. Cuisine Lovers.
My US friends and myself would come here at least one a week! Meals with naan or rice under $10 and quick, great service. Loved their spicy veggies.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: To me it's authentic indian food. Curry is quite spicy, luckily the have indications on the menu regarding spicyness. Beware if it has more than 1 chili symbol. Great selection of Naan, the cheese version is very tasty. Service was excellent. Not too crowded during dinner.

This place is well worth a visit, not simple to find but a few minutes walk from JZP Metro. Welcome was great, Menu was available in English and also "Warned" about what was really hot. We started with the Chilli and Onion Poppadoms, Hot or What and really Spicy but fabulous. Three of us then had three different mains all of which were good. Sometimes difficult to get Paratha in some Indian Restaurants however here they had four types, of which the Chilli version was great. Would highly recommend a visit,along with the fact that as it is in Prague cost compared to the UK is excellent

Located in the basement of the building, nice ambience.....service was friendly and good, mostly efficient but some things took a bit longer than expected.  I had a spinach based curry which was spicier than expecting and didn't have a lot of chicken in it, my colleague had a tikka masala which he found lacking in flavour.  Rice was ok....had peas in it which was odd (for an indian) but then we've experienced peas on pizza this week so not all that weird.  The poppadoms we had for starters were strange, cone shaped and quite small but they were fairly priced so not a problem, not enough indian dips with them though.  Usual selection of drinks, no problems there and the peshwari naan was very good.  Some people came in with a very large dog, don't really like dogs in restaurants but it was fairly well behaved so not a major issue.
Great Indian food with and authentic flavour. Nan bread is one of the best I've ever tried. Service was good but only criticism would be why we needed to keep our cutlery between courses??

review_title: Lal Qila: an Indian jewel in Italian St. in the Czech capital
review: In Italska (Italian) Street there is a student canteen of the University of Economics. How surprised I was to find Lal Quila on the other end! I ran into it quite accidentally, searching for a Sunday lunch in the area. The personnel made me feel like a special guest even before I've ordered a meal! To keep the story short: I've had the best Ckicken Tandoori in my life! And the soup! And the tee! And the service! Will sure come back! धन्यवाद

This place is located in a nice location. The restaurant is underground and looks good and cosy. The vegetarian food we ordered was good, except for the rice. Taste was good and the portion size was average. though would have appreciated if it was more.We went on Friday evening and it was busy. The staff were few and we had to wait for service. Aside from the few issues, it is good.

I have visited a few times and rate this place highly. The food is very authentic, fresh and tasty. Naan bread is great.  One minor criticisms is the lack of Czech wine by the glass, they only have Chilean which is disappointing. Otherwise the beer is great.
We made a reservation and had a top place on the upper terrace viewing sunset. Service was really good and the food of fine high level aas we expected. Just a great dinner.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Boutique Restaurant with delicious Food and perfect service
review: We had a very nice Dinner experience at „L´Arome by the sea“ yesterday. This Boutique Restaurant has nothing in common with the many over-touristic Restaurants at Patong beach area. It might be one of the best French restaurants outside France. The Restaurant offers a wonderful view on the sea, perfect service (special thanks to Max), exquisite tableware and most important: delicous food. I recommend the 6 courses „Menu Experience“ which includes all Signature dishes of the Restaurant. Every course tasted excellent!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: When people say JW Marriott Resort and Spa is an incredible place to visit, believe them. In fact, book yourself a stay right away and find out for yourself! We’ve been to this resort a few times being MVC members and every single visit seems to outdo the previous one. Service is definitely top-notch and here at the Rim Nam Pool Bar, the service crew - Lert, Sert, Kai, Man, and Peter - certainly go out of their way to ensure all guests are well looked after. For example: You don’t even have to keep asking for iced water, there is always someone walking around pouring everyone a cold drink of water. They also have popsicles in the morning for the young ones. And this afternoon, my daughter met a little accident while running and had small scratches on her knees. Immediately, there was a resort staff to attend to her wound. Truly appreciated! Food and cocktails are delicious! We’ve certainly had more than our fair share of mango daiquiris in between dips in the pool. Now, the beach just a few steps down is gorgeous especially on a warm sunny day! You can take walks, or even a leisurely run, sunbathe, play sandcastles with the kids, and more. This resort is really something else and we always look forward to visiting at least once a year!

I stayed at the JW Marriott/MVCI for 10 days. I went to the south pool/Blue bar for happy hour several times. Great service. Great happy hour! Khun Pichit and Khun Nook (in the picture) and Khun Pla were fantastic.
Enjoyed multiple happy hours at the pool bar with Khun Pla and khun Mangpor. Worth a visit if in Mai Khao!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Really nice service from the team at the pool (thank you George!), making sure everything is at hand and doing it with a real passion and positive energy. Thank you!

Friendly and services mind with all customers not only for Farang guests. Khun Kim & Khun Chai are very friendly and fun. Khun George & Khun Paul are offering and advise me for the promotion with smiles. (Also Khun Sul, Khun Bee, Khun Tiger & Khun Chit)  We recommend this place!

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This is the food service for the Rim Nam Pool and Bar at the Marriott’s Phuket Beach Club. Good choice of food and drink. Many thanks to Lert and his Splash Pool team for looking after us so well.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review_title: The best pool and bar at the hotel.
review: Had incredible service from the team here, especially Lert who is just the kindest and loveliest person.

As we entered the property we were ushered to La Sala restaurant, at first glance this location is something to behold. We decided to enjoy our high tea Al fresco style by the tranquil tropical lagoon with its ancient Banyan tree as the centre piece. Cha Yam Bai is served in a towering beautiful bird cage of sweet & savoury bites. There is a fine collection of gourmet sandwiches, scones with jam & clotted cream and array of decorative desserts followed by tea & coffee. The cost of this experience was THB 15000++ thoroughly worth every cent, to spend the afternoon of classic indulgence. Enjoyed immensely relishing in the peaceful surrounding. Table 33 - It was the perfect location

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We had an excellent rewarding cooking class experience together with Chef Ton! First visiting the local market and the beautiful old temple next to it. Then back at the hotel we prepared a papaya salad, a coconut chicken soup and finally a massaman beef curry, guided by the chef. Our ten months old baby boy was taken care of by the whole staff. The self-prepared lunch was yummie and we all enjoyed a lovely time. Thank you!

One of the best Indian food I’ve eaten outside the country. The skilful Chef, Sunil and his team made a great job of a fairly standard fare we ordered : Dal, Paneer and Naan. Very delicious and wholesome with the taste lingering on our taste buds for a long time. Must visit if you are in Mai Khao area in Phuket

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler;Trendsetter
review: I visited the restaurant for five consecutive days for breakfast with my family.  Location  The La Sala restaurant is located within a beautiful lagoon surrounded by tropical plants and birds. It can be found within the Anantara Phuket Villas a short walk from Turtle Village, Anantara vacation club and JW Marriot. The maintained beach is a short walk away.  Staff and service  The service we received was some of the best we have had in all of Asia. Staff are extremely attentive, fully aware of dietary requirements and needs of customers. We are vegan (no meat, fish, dairy) so it can often be quite tricky, but La Sala staff were quick to recommend delicious alternatives.  I have a 5 year old boy that can get restless during large breakfasts. The staff were quick to recognise this and suggested that he tried feeding fish. Also while ordering, the staff suggested certain foods he might like to try. These personal touches puts this restaurant above the competition.  Food  Every dish that we tried was excellent and full of flavour. There are a number of western and Asian dishes to choose from. In my five days, I tried most of them. The food was made and delivered quickly.  Covid  During this challenging time, it is highly important that hotels and restaurants have a impeccable level of cleanliness. La Sala was extremely clean with all staff socially distancing and wearing masks.  Finally  At this stage I would like to personally thank Khun Samorn, Ann Waad Tuk and Goong for their amazing service and attentiveness during our stay. You have all gone above and beyond your duty.  We will never forget the service at La Sala. I will recommend this restaurant to friends and relatives. Thank you.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Always Good Food and Atmosphere here.
review: We were staying at the JW Marriott and have eaten at the Ninja restaurant before so could not wait to come back. Rinnie our server was so helpful and kind. She helped us with the menu and recommended options. We took advantage of the Marriott Bonvoy set menu which was wonderful value and a good selection of food and would highly recommend. The food quality here was excellent and the service good.

review_title: Delicious Thai food at JW Marriott!
review: We loved Ginja Taste! My wife has a Celiac disease and can’t eat gluten, and they were able to accommodate her, communicating with the kitchen to modify dishes and making sure her food was free of cross contamination. We had curries there both nights we went, and they were very complex and delicious. The setting is beautiful and comfortable, and the service was top notch, especially from Amy, who took good care of us. Highly recommend for anyone staying at JW Marriott / Beach Club or anyone staying near Mai Khao Beach!

review_title: Great food, but some confusion in serice
review: Once we found the right dishes, we really enjoyed the food here. Most of the time service was good, but every now and then there were minor issues (lost reservation, lack of water etc.). A beautiful location for eating outside.

review_title: Outstanding experience and service with a smile
review: What an amazing experience we had. The food was superlative, the ambience was excellent and the service was wonderful. Our set menu had a wide variety of Thai appetisers, mains and desserts. The taste, quality and flavours of the food were just amazing. Special thanks to all the staff who made our experience wonderful.

review_title: Fantastic food on a very wet night
review: On our first night in Phuket we dined at Ginja Taste. The service was impeccable. Special mention to Molly. For entree we shared prawns in betel leaf. Best prawns I have ever eaten. We also had the crab cakes that were large enough for main course. Also delicious. Fior main we share the spicy turmeric fish curry. We finished with coconut and chocolate ice cream. Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: Flavor Sensation - Thai Cuisine at its Best
review: The food and service at JW Marriott Resort and Spa Ginja Restaurant is exceptionally good. The Sea Bass Fillet with Chili and Lime is fresh and delicate and the slow cooked Beef Massaman Curry is mouthwatering delicious. The manager,Khun Lek, along with her team, and the newly appointed chef provide an exceptional dining experience.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Amazing food (enjoyed the chef's menu, some really innovative dishes), great service as well! Totally recommended! And don't forget to order the mango sticky rice!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: The crab special dinner selection was amazing
review: A wonderful evening with the most delicious and exquisitely flavoured food. Tonight we had the Crab special selection, with the soft-shell crab being the best I’ve tasted. The service was excellent, and nothing was too much trouble

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: There's always something special about returning to Ginja Taste. Such a nice ambience with a great menu and service. From the moment we arrived and were greeted so warmly, to the end of the night before we left and the Chef came around to see if we liked what we ordered...well the plates were all empty! The soft shell salt and pepper crab and the yellow beef curry were to DIE for! Thank you Chef Tham for your gracious hospitality. We keep coming back here...keep up the fantastic standard.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Luxury Traveler
review: We went 3 times to Ginja Taste during our 5 nights stay at JW Marriott. I would like to thank the chefs and the service ladies for our pleasant dinners. I would also like to say that I became addicted to your Tom Yum Goong, it became my favorite dish. So delicious, incredible. We have also tried Pad Thai, Wok fried duck, we took some dishes from kids menu, everything is delicious and made with heart. My favorite dessert there is a Black Sesame Ice cream - you need just to try it!!! We appreciated also, that every evening the chef came to the guests to greet them and ask about their impressions, this is a level of a very good restaurant! Thanks once again and it was so pleasant to receive a post card to our room from Ginja Taste restaurant saying thanks for our visit. We will be back :)

Great menu in a lovely setting by the side of the beach. Staff were very friendly and the food was stunning. I went for the stir fried morning glory followed by a very big (by uk standards) sea bass fillet.

The first dining spot on my third trip to Phuket. My GF and I dined last night to another fantastic meal. The service is stellar, food spectacular, portions and price spot on. Dine outside and you are treated to wonderful views of the Andaman Sea!

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Cooking Class at Ginja Cook - a highlight!
review: Several of our family members participated in the morning cooking school at Ginja Taste. It was an amazing experience. The school can accommodate 8 students, but our family (3 people) were the only ones there that morning. From going to the market to learn about and purchase food, to the cooking class itself, it was amazing. They cooked three different dishes and had a wonderful time! Thank you!

review_title: Expensive but also really good Thai food
review: Had a great red curry with duck, Pad Thai and Tom Ka Gai soup. Nice outside seating next to the palm trees. Friendly and attentive service. Great experience which does come at a price (incl. wine and the obligatory 10% service plus 7% tax we ended up with around 6.000 THB) but that evening was worth it and we’ll be coming back for our farewell dinner. Ginja also offers cooking classes, unfortunately we did not have time to try that out (included trip to the market, cooking and lunch).
We took the crab set menu and it was the best seafood we had in Thailand. It was worth the money. It was fantastic feast.

review_title: Another Outstanding Meal at Ginja Taste!
review: Went last night upon day one in Phuket and it did not disappoint. The food - exceptional. The service - the best (Thanks so much Pum!). The view of the Andaman Sea - stunning. This is my second trip to the island and my second stay at the JW Marriott Mai Khoa.
Very tasty, but incredibly expensive Thai food. The staff were a little rude also. I’d recommend at least one meal here.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;History Buff;Luxury Traveler
review: My husband and I were staying at the Anantara resort next door, and decided to try Ginja for Thai food. It was delicious. The hotel kindly drives you there from the front desk..very helpful on a rainy night!

review_title: Thai food in Thailand! Ginja Taste is the best!!!
review: Whether you are eating at the restaurant or taking a cooking class (YES - Ginja Cooking Class is world class!), Ginja Taste is the "GO TO" Thai food on the island, and a highlight of my trip!  Now I need to start building up my Thai recipe repertoire! Looking forward to my return in 2017!  Compliments to: Chef Tham, Chef Kong, Ant, Hon, and Pum.
Incredible atmosphere. Exceptional menu and great food. The service is 5 star. This restaurant is located near blocks 33 and 34.

Hosted in the cookery school for just the two of us like a 'Chef's Table' for my birthday, a real treat organised by Didier the Assistant Director of F & B at J W Marriott. The food prepared and superbly presented by the team originated from ancient recipes so it was quite different to what we were used to in Thailand. The meal was rounded off with (another) Birthday cake and a sing sing by the staff - not to be forgotten easily! Big Thank You all round and a lovely end to our 'short BUT sweet' trip here.

I had 2 days breakfast here with my family. The restaurant has a big buffet. Pity no places to eat outside but inside it was nice too and you can have seats with a sea view. The buffet is extensive. I especially liked the Dutch cheese and the crossaints. The service was very good. Especially the Western woman was so friendly with my small son. All in one it was a great place to have a breakfast!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Beach Goer
review_title: Incredible Breakfast Quality & Variety With Fantastic Views of Mai Khao Beach. Great Fruit Bar & Coffee Too! 🥭☕️
review: We spent one week at the JW Marriott Resort & Spa Phuket, and every breakfast at JW Cafe was a delightful breakfast.  Beautiful breakfast variety: a fresh fruit bar (ask for the mangoes and the Phuket pineapple ) - authentic Thai choices - live egg station serving an incredibly delicious omelette - pancakes, waffles, brûlée french toast with all the delicious toppings you could possibly think of - sausages, cold cuts and cheeses - live noodle station  The view was also something to look forward to every morning ☀️ Breakfast while gazing into the Mai Khao beach Absolutely gorgeous.  Our server Dada was very lovely, helpful and attentive. She always knew what we wanted before we asked for it; a double espresso and a cappuccino ☕️ Dada also made recommendations for us as well. Thanks for your help throughout our stay, Dada! We look forward to seeing you again next time :)

My wife and I had Breakfast at JW Cafe each morning, we must say the food offering is excellent so much choice and high quality. Service received from all staff fantastic particularly "Gift" an excellent waitress always smile and happy.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: Fantastic breakfast with a lot of options. Typical breakfast at an ice resort to start your day well. Great service by Jeeja getting by breakfast coffee order right each day. The mangos are excellent each day. My favourite is the noodle counter that serves noodle soup for breakfast. The breakfast can get a bit repetitive if you stay here long. That happens in almost any resort. One suggestion is to have breakfast themes from different parts of south east Asia.
An excellent breakfast buffet that caters to all tastes from waffles to noodles. A lot of dishes prepared fresh to order.  A special thanks to Pao for looking after my wife and I during our stay.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: Excellent restaurant and has to be among one of the best breakfasts to be had . Sea view is amazing . Seating and ambience is Very good. Food is awesome and staff are really helpful and great.  I love the bircher muesli, oatmeal, french toast and the halal egg station which cater well for muslims .  The staff. Kik, Jeejar, York, Phon, Kong, Soh, Ladda, Nancy, Dada and Ilya are just really awesome to see at the morning time .

review_title: Pricey Breakfast Buffet Doesn't Deliver Enough
review: While the ~$31 breakfast buffet offers many food choices, anything fine one would expect on an equivalent buffet was lacking. No smoked salmon, prosciutto, better cold-cuts, no carving station. No beef of any sort. The only cheeses provided were factory-type Gouda and cheddar. Eggs Benedict & Eggs Florentine had sat out so long the Hollandaise had congealed. The staff were excellent and the cleanliness and safety standards were all well-observed, but the type of food choices really need to be raised to a higher level.

review_title: Great Staff and good mix of breakfast options
review: The hosts, wait staff, and even chefs here are all very friendly and welcoming. Had the chef stop at my table each morning to ask about the food. The wait staff called me by name from the second day there and onward. Breakfast was comped as part of my SHA+ jail sentence, else it would be 1000BHAT per day (roughly $30 USD, just for breakfast!!!).  Ask about their special of the day, today it was Pad Thai with prawns and wow was it good!!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Returned to enjoy the amazing range on offer. Breakfast goes until Noon which is great for Sunday sleep-ins. It is simply the best buffet breakfast ever! Be sure to book especially on Sunday.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Had breakfast here everyday throughout my stay. The international selection is amazing! I love how they serve fresh juice/veg shots at the juice bar!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Great place for lunch and cool down with a drink
review: This is a good place to have lunch and relax. It is air-conditioned and has a menu with variety of food choices to choose from.

review_title: All the delicious food and drink you could ever want!
review: They offer fresh everything! If you can think of it they probably have it. Fresh juices, fresh fruit, fresh food and excellent service. An enjoyable experience!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: A good variety of food is available that is fresh and well presented. Kids are catered for and the service is quick and friendly. It has the high standards one can expect from the Marriott chain.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We were not staying at there Marriott this tike but having experienced the Buffet Meals here before we decided to make a special journey for the Thais Street Food Buffet. The buffet selection was amazing and was constantly kept stocked up and freshly cooked. The staff were happy to make recommendations and to cook special requests such as noodle. The quality oft he food is excellent. The buffet meals at there Marriott Cafe are well worth a visit but be careful as during low season they are few and far between. They have different themes and in my experience they are all great value. Good for families and they always have child friendly dishes available.
The married Cafe is a chill place you can have and spend a good time here in peace very nice Cafe nice coffees and we can spend some time with your friends family
Great great food, service is excellent, price is very reasonable, very kids friendly as well. worth coming here at least once! breakfast here is amazing, very wide selection and all very tasty!
We ate here several times during our stay, both breakfast and dinner. The variety was great and the staff were super friendly.

review_title: Very beautiful restaurant with great food
review: Breakfast is very yummy here. Great bakery selection, exotic fruits, health juices, compotes, sushi, omelette, Thai pancake, waffles, Multi cuisine selection of soup and food. You will get confused what to eat and what not. Dinner buffet also looks yummy. Great staff.

For a family of five, cooking breakfasts for five days can be daunting. So it's out of necessity and convenience that we had our daily buffet breakfast in this restaurant. And we are very happy we did. Food offers and spreads are great.For starters, they had so many appetisers and soups including their culinary masterpiece and favourite Tom Yang. This time it's on the light side version as against the heavy soup that is typically served.
