Great variety of Japanese and international cuisine : bacon, sausages, ham, omelletes,sushi bar, salad bar, desserts: local fruits like dragon fruit, pineapple,jackfruit, etc. A great way to start the day of beautiful memories. Of course, one can also order a la carte for set breakfast menus which in itself is very generous in serving size. Be early coz waiting time can be challenging.

We live this fantastic breakfast buffet! Fresh fruit like very sweat mangos, sushi, Chinese dim sum, all kind of soups, curries, noodles, fried rice etc best passion fruit jam and even German dark bread and Austrian Strietzel!!!

review_title: What a great way to start your day!
review: To the Marriott Cafe Team... thank you for being a part of my morning ritual! Everyday I had breakfast in the Cafe and it never disappointed. An extensive selection of hot and cold items, American and Thai, greeted you everyday. Simply the best!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review: The Marriott Cafe offers a variety of cuisines and consequently there is something for everyone. The food is good and tasty. Recommended
We had such a fun night when we visited Benihana. The food, service and entertainment were excellent. We loved our visit.

review_title: Dinner and entertainment all in one!
review: 2nd time in a week. Good fun. Chef Ben was a joker. Had a fun and delicious dinner. Ordered the promotion Wagyu Beef set and a Calamari set. Both were delicious. Thanks Chef!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: It was a very nice family experience. Great food and service. Prem was our chef and John was a waiter. Both did great. We highly recommend it

user_tags: History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Best service, nice cake, nice drink, delicious food and best seaview. A few parking space available but you can park on the road too. I went there a few times, never dissatisfied!

This place is situated in a more quiet place than the usual in Rawai. The food and drinks a slightly higher priced, but worth every penny. The service and food is of a high quality. Absolutely recommendable

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The view over the fishing bay with the colorful boats reminded me of Malta. The food is ok, nothing wow, big portions.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Always a good welcome here . Greeted at the car and assisted with parking . The very good Edwin was playing and the food is always great here . Will certainly return .

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: In the end of the beach. Food is great, a quite small but tasty menu, and the wiew!!! A tip is to order table in advance so you can sit and watch the sunset. Go there, it`s the must eat and drink place in Rawai.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Okay so A$6 (150 Baht) for Pad Thai may not be expensive by Sydney standards but it is expensive for Thailand, double what you pay in other restaurants in the area. Nice presentation though and the sea views toward Rawai Beach and Pier are particularly pleasant. Quality was okay but nothing special and decidedly light on protein (3 shrimps only)

Went to the Rawai view cafe & bar after seeing sign and recognising it from TripAdvisor and we were both glad we stopped to get out of the sun . It's a perfect location for a lunch time pit stop and ice cold Chang served in a ice cool glass. The view is quite breathtaking. Nice friendly welcome and table on the edge . We wanted a light lunch had a very tasty pad Thai which was lovely presented and vegetable rice both good . We are really glad we stopped by .

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Another very good meal at this beautiful location . There food is always good , cooked well and presented well . Warm welcome and we had assistance with parking which was appreciated . Friendly and efficient staff . The musician , Edwin is excellent . Will return .

This was our best evening in Rawai by far. We had a table that looked out onto the water, even at night the boats and lights were incredible to look at. The food was great and worth the above average (but still very cheap) price you pay for food in Phuket. Highly recommend the bananas for dessert!  The night was topped off by live music with perfect songs for the atmosphere.

review_title: Outstanding place to meet sunset with lovely food
review: Check the fish market and feel free to buy your favorite selection- this restaurant will be happy to cook the fish and seafood you brought for you. Best about this place is not only food (fried fish with lemon grass was superb), but the set up and view on the pier. So relaxing and memorable

We went their on a full-moon night. The view was amazing. They have live music which also added on to the ambience. The food is priced on the higher side but the portion sizes are big and its tasty. The service is very good.
Great night in Rawai with good service from the manager Eak and live music. Great food and great views. Definitely worth finding this little spot!

review_title: Nice view, good food, OK price
review: The view of this restaurant is very nice. There was a live singer when we came that was good (Western songs). The food is good, slightly more expensive than usual. Restaurant last order is at 9:30pm and closes at 10pm. The only bad thing I have to say about it is that they turn off the light and start cleaning at 9:45pm to make you leave.

review_title: Great view but you pay for it with the food
review: The food was nice but Drinks & food are 30% more than elsewhere locally and the same food so we could only assume your charged for the view Which when over looking certain things is very nice You'll need mozzy spray here too no doubt due to the following I was concerned for 2 kids playing in the dirty canal water that comes off the land right in to the sea below the Resturant which these 2 under 10s were playing in The road leading to this Resturant stinks so bad it makes you want to vomit so know way did any of us eat sea food ! The water is BLACK by what is a council ran office 100m away it's a smell like no other it's a shame it spoilt our visit here which we were looking forward too Clean up your act Phuket !  Ive come back to the hotel to google the disgusting water discharge further as we are all now unwell after a day at various beaches See photo as this is what we saw on the approach road to this Resturant

Some of the places in Rawai were a little too close to the fishy smell at the shore. This quiet tavern is perfectly located slightly above the beach and boats so one can enjoy the lovely view and tasty food without being too close... Friendly staff and good prices too!

Comfortable and pleasant place. Food is well presented and tasty. Very relaxed beachside vibe. Live music not too obtrusive but also engaging. Compact but decent wine list too. Helpful and friendly staff.

user_tags: History Buff;Nature Lover;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We stayed at the Navatara Resort and Tripadvisor shared this nearby place with us. I cased it out during the day as it is down an odd side road. But wow! We arrived just at sunset and should have arrived a bit earlier for full sunset viewing. Little blinky lights and folks welcoming us at the front door...only a foreshadowing to the wonderful evening in store. The deck was wonderful and we were given a seat at the edge for a great view. We ordered a bottle of nice wine and soup for a starter. We shared three dishes...pork curry, sunflower sprouts (awesome if you haven't tried in Thailand yet!), and fried prawns with black pepper. Everything was well spiced. Dishes were smaller than almost any other Thai place we've eaten, but that left room for dessert. We chose three classics and shared mango with sticky rice, a flan-like dish, and fried bananas with ice cream. All was excellent. Live music was most enjoyable and we watched families and couples if all ages enjoying themselves! We didn't want to leave! Heartily recommend. Our bill was about 2500 baht and the wine was about half of the bill.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Very difficult to find - even for a local, but well worth it. The location is just stunning, as you are on the North end of Rawai beach, looking down all the way. The food was classic Thai and excellent. very tasty and the mango with sticky rice was delicious - for once thy give enough coconut sauce with the sticky rice and the portion is very generous. For sure we will be back soon again!

review_title: Surprisingly Good Food, Great View & Fantastic Service
review: A lot of places in Thailand look good and have a nice view. Few though have great food at a reasonable price as well.  Rawai View Cafe oozes character; it's just a beautiful looking place that fits in nicely with its surroundings.  The staff are very friendly, the food comes out quick and the view just makes it an enjoyable place to be.  What was surprising though was the quality of the food and the presentation of it. Yes good food is not uncommon in Thailand but Rawai View Cafe's food is that little bit better.  We had spicy beef salad, garlic fried snapper and penang beef curry, and mango shakes - all delicious.  Tie that together with the presentation of the food, the service, the view, cheap prices and a nice place and they have a great all-round restaurant they can be proud of. There's free WiFi also!  If you're looking for a restaurant that ticks all the boxes for food, service, value and experience, this is it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Had a really nice meal here ……nice views , friendly staff and a great place to just sit and relax . Will come back .

review_title: Very nice meal in beautiful setting
review: What a place hidden off the main track but on the beach overlooking sea to the pier. The food was wonderful, the staff were great and a beautiful hostess

This was a really great place. Patong is a bit touristy and has a lot of junk food places, but this was superb stuff, local dishes and seafood brilliantly prepared and with excellent service. The prices were actually really reasonable too.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Best breakfast we had in Phuket. Very extensive buffet and is cooked very well. Not the cheapest place but well worth the price paid. Go early as it gets very busy  Can get discounts via Klook

review_title: The meaning of Breakfast needs to be redefined here!!!!
review: Spent 2 weeks at this hotel and I have to say that usually breakfast tends to be repetitive in most places after 4-5 days. Well, not here! Never seen such a variety of food, every single day different. Also, even though the hotel was at full capacity, with entire Paralympic teams on board, you would never ever had to queue for anything! Amazing service, best chefs, a big thank you to all of you!!!
As part of my stay we had breakfast included, the offerings were excellent covering all tastes, the food fresh and the service excellent.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Family Vacationer
review: It’s promoted as seafood night , but it has international and Thai food as well, free flow of water, soft drinks and juice, no tea or coffee included, staff were amazing, truly unlimited seafood, including Rock lobster and crab, good value if you are a seafood lover.

review_title: Excellent brunch. Low price. Delicious tasting food. Over 100 items.
review: Four time We have been to the morning brunch at the 4 Points Sheraton hotel in Patong, Phuket, Thailand. The food is delicious, over 100 items to choose from, coffee is delicious. Brunch includes all drinks including ice cappuccino. All for 589 baht ($18) for 2 people. Excellent value. Restaurant is beautiful designed. Great place to relax and enjoy the morning.

user_name: ซุปตาร์พาเที่ยว Suptar Traveller
review: This hotel always amazing in food & beverage. Chao Leh is the popular outlet especially breakfast. They have now a promotion of 1 THB for 2nd guest (another guest 588 THB) , that pretty cheap in Patong area. We love it.

Had dinner with my family and we were pleased with the taste, prices, and service. The place itself is not that attractive, however the food will make you get beyond this. The only downside would be that the mains and appetizers were brought at once to our table, no idea why.

We ordered dinner from Grab food and it was so good that we ended up ordering 3 times in 2 days..). The quality of food, taste, freshness and packing was superb. We tried their Turkish bread, assorted mezze, shish kebab - both chicken and chicken wings.  All items every time were 5 star. Highly recommended.

Well what a surprise- the best food I have had in a week in Phuket. It was not expensive, the atmosphere was simple but pleasant. The food was perfection, tasty, fresh, and so enjoyable I found it hard to stop eating even though I was completely full. We meet the owners after we commented on how we enjoyed it and that just topped the night off. We only have three days left but I am coming back.

Came here a couple of times as I was staying in a hotel around the corner and fancied a change from Thai food. Very tasty and fresh, reasonable prices and the feta and yoghurty dips are all homemade by the friendly owner. Can recommend

Enjoyed the IPA a lot, visited this pub few times during the 3 nights stay. Tried their Tacos (with beef), fish and chips and Cesar salad, pretty good.  Staffs are always friendly, good place to come. This is a popular place in the area

Located in Turtle Village, we came to this restaurant so we could watch the NRL game and grab a bite to eat. The staff were amazing in trying to get the game on a screen where we were seated. We arrived for happy hour which was timed well with the match. Tai made sure we had drinks and food for the game. The pub serves authentic "Mexican" dishes as well as traditional Thai meals. We selected the Mexican food and the servings were very large and tasty. Prices are reasonable and service was excellent with a great atmosphere. We even had a game of shuffle board. Will definitely be back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nightlife Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: We went to this restaurant so my husband could watch a specific football game one evening, the food was good and staff were good. It was just very quiet in there and lacked an atmosphere.

review_title: Decent pub food, make sure to check the receipt
review: Been here 3 times in our stay and pub food was consistently good. Recommend for a change in scenery from the resort. Pains me to say there seems to be an “honest mistake” scheme running with happy hour. The invoice each time is brought over and they quickly show your free drinks but the total you pay also includes the free. If you question it they then remove the “free ones” . Every time same problem. When pointed out the 3rd time the waitress got passive aggressive and began being super assertive. It is a classic ruse to gain funds. Don’t begrudge them in this time however check your bill if you care about your happy hour drinks :). Would I go back - sure. Would I trust the bill - no way
Staff have a service mind, especially khun Ning. They are helpful to service all the time. Appreciate the staff and beverages as well as a meal.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I come often to this pub and every time I am amazed with the staff and the good and the overall experience. 5 years I have been visiting and quality has not only been saved but even improved! This is not common with this type of restaurant.

review_title: Really glad we found this place!
review: Another great recommendation from TripAdvisor! Excellent food, excellent staff, this place has a great menu with plenty of options for everyone. We have been back here a few times now and have never been disappointed. There is a great selection of pizzas, all served straight from their pizza oven. They also have spit roasted chicken on the menu with some great flavours. My wife and daughter are both vegetarian which can sometimes be a problem while on holiday but there were plenty of options for them here, they really enjoyed the salad and penne arrabbiata as well as the fresh pizzas. I will definitely return again next time we’re in Phuket! Thanks for a great evening all at The Kitchen Table!

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: The Kitchen table is a great place for late afternoon and evening drinks. The Pizzas are amazing, a really good size and so delicious . There's a wide range of toppings, including some that you wouldn't necessarily think of. You can eat in or take away and also there's room service . We did eat out at the Blue Mango a couple of times and the experiences here were really good too. We decided to try to lamb steak at the kitchen table and were so glad we did, we enjoyed it so much we had our last holiday meal at the Kitchen Table, this time we had the pork dish, and this did not disappoint either . The kitchen table is definitely on a par with the blue mango. Poppy and the whole team are so friendly , helpful , always smiling , they are a great bunch, and an absolute credit to their employers. Thanks to all for a great stay!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: We have eaten hear many times and love the food and the hospitality of the waiters.  The burgers are awesome, especially the Thai Chicken Burger and The Kitchen Table Burger are delicious. There is a burger here also for Veggie which my partner enjoyed.  The Chicken Caesar is excellent as are the pizzas. My favourite was the Vegetarian and the Napoli which has anchovies.  The Thai people are lovely and the service is excellent. Thank you to our lovely waitresses Poppy and Asia who has looked after us on our dining experiences.  Ooo, by the way if you don’t feel like an alcoholic cocktail, try the Virgin Cocktails. Especially the Pina Colada and the Victorian.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker
review: What can I say The beautiful Aom made sure we had a wonderful first night here I don't think we need to leave the resort to have fun. LIVE MUSIC and excellent service with great value happy hour

We went here because it was number 1 on Trioadvisor but quickly realised that most of the reviews are about drinks - not food. So don’t take their ranking on TA for food as the food was rubbish and a lot of money for what you get .
A great holiday/honeymoon made all the better by the great service and friendliness of all the staff, especially Pui.

Very nice and cozy and relaxing place for chilled drinks in the evening. Snacks are good too with a variety of drinks. Very friendly staff with excellent service. Nice entertainment too but not sure if this is there throughout the year.

review_title: a great spot for a cocktail or 2
review: In July this year my wife, 2 children and I stayed for 2 weeks at the JW Marriott. It was our second visit to this awesome resort, the first being a little over 1 year ago.  Whilst at the resort we made a number of visits to the Sala Sawasdee bar. It’s a great place to relax and have a drink, regardless if you’re a hotel guest or visiting from the outside.  Something that really makes the place special is the staff and the stand out for my family was Mai Butsaba. It has been over a year since our last visit and Mai instantly recognised my family and particularly my daughters. She went out of her way to make us feel welcome on every visit. Thank you Mai.  It’s a great spot to sit and have a cocktail on the evening when the fire show is on, just get there early to make sure you get a water side day bed.  Thanks Sala Sawasdee team and especially Mai, we have a wonderful visit and look forward to seeing you all again soon.

review_title: Very scenic spot for a drink
review: We didn't eat here but spent most evenings having a cocktail overlooking the beautiful reflection pool and out to the Anderman sea to watch the sunset. Very polite and attentive staff. Great hammocks, tastefully done, Lange comfortable chairs and lounges to recline in, very tropical, very relaxing. Great spot to view the bi weekly fire show.

Its a great place to have a drink or just a coffee. the swing type sofa's are great to lounge around while reading or browsing on your Ipad and enjoying a drink. Efficient service and good selection of drinks. A great before and after dinner place to hangout.

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Really enjoyed spending time there. Good vibe, good food, good music! The manager (we believe) was looking after everyone so well.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: Such a great place to hang out with friends will be back again for sure.. Ohhh and its a good spot to see the sunset

Decided revisit the Sunday Brunch. First glance great set up around the pool but needs some attention to detail 1). Great gazpacho but served in large bowls where a small cup of glass would have been ideal. As the lunch wore on bowls exposed to sun so placing a chilled soup into a hot bowl not good. 2) mixed French oysters with oysters from Surin Thani (Thai) but no warning or sign to distinguish. 3) lots of sauces for beef but none for lamb- where was mint sauce or mint jelly. Lamb and beef both medium and dry. Lamb chops not top quality. Too much fat 4) salads were very good as was Thai food. Grapes cheap end with seeds but Chees selection ok.  Overall not the 5 star experience that Andara aspires to. 5) lots of staff but not interfacing with guests- most chatting amongst themselves.

review_title: Nice one right at the beach
review: A nice casual restaurant right at the shore with delicious food and cocktails. The menu is European with really delicious Salads and Pizzas; Kids menu surprisingly comprehensive and includes healthy dishes.

Lovely Restaurant within this fabulous Hotel, we've experienced the breakfast,lunch & evening meals and they're all excellent, the flavours in the Thai curries are amazing. All the staff are so friendly & helpful & have made our holiday one to remember especially Toon & Eve who are such lovely girls, thank you for everything..x

Had dinner here out on the terrace, as the sun was setting. The food was simply delightful - perfectly cooked, superbly presented and with friendly and attentive service. All-in-all, this was a really great dining experience made so by a very talented chef who clearly knows what he is doing and by staff who work hard to ensure your enjoyment and satisfaction. Other interesting dishes on the menu will ensure a return visit to Blue Mango, for another sunset dinner, is now a MUST!

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: We ate at the blue mango a few evenings during our stay. The duck dish and the fried rice dishes were really good. They have a specials board . We did have risotto one night and I tried the beetroot one which I wouldnt have normally thought of.trying. Decent wine list, good service and friendly staff. Thank you

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: We love coming back to this restaurant as the staff are friendly and the food is of high standard.  Riccardo is one of the head chefs who has been in the kitchen for almost 10 years and provides guidance to the fellow workers.  Chad, Fern, Pope and Waan are delightful and always greet you with a smile.  The Spring Rolls and Chicken Satay are my favourite starters and As for mains try the Crusted Parmesan Chicken, delicious! The Duck is also delicious as is the Almaretto Sweet potato ravioli. Can’t go past the Cinnamon Apple Crumble or Sticky Mango Rice, teal favourites.  As there is a huge menu, including Thai Food, you will want to come back again.  Thank you for a great time. See you all again next time.
Best view, best food, best place!A good opportunity to forget the current gloom and sadness to see Phuket destroyed by the Covid. The V cheers you up!

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: Enjoyed meal a lot. Tried paratha, naan, checken tandur, palaak paneer, paneer butter masala, mixed raita, chai, mango lassy (with fresh mangoes). All food had rich taste and in general was delicious, service was fine and warm welcomming. Will come back for sure

Went to this restaurant by recomendation from TripAdvisor.. It resulted in wisiting this restaurant several times in 2019. Went back here in 2020. Same lovley food and same friendly Staff who took the time to chat a little bit. Surly we will be back again to eat Chicken Tikka Masala with garlic nan

Having looked on TA for a recommend Indian - we visited here. Being regulars to Phuket I was surprised I had not noticed the place. Set on a busy street it’s easy to walk past - but don’t! The food is very tasty and the owner -Pal - very friendly. We like spicy food but he even offered to let us try the different degrees of change to the food which was very impressive. Great flavours and super value - £35 - €42 for a starter and main each with a couple of beers each. Be warned the portions are very generous. Service was a little manic but we will definitely return
Went here two times during our vacation and had both Thai and Indian dishes - everything was very good and very reasonably priced!
Located on the main road this place is run by Indian sikh family with good hospitality traits. Food is nice too.

After reading the reviews on the Indian curries at golden paradise I had to try them I definitely wasn’t disappointed I ordered the tikki masala and garlic naan and i wasn’t disappointed the meal was priced at 300 baht with rice . Which I thought was quite high for Thailand but well worth it . If you need a curry fix hit this place up you won’t be disappointed My wife had the carbonara and she also enjoyed that as well .

user_tags: History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: What a night! Amazing place, great food, nice music with live band. Loads of beverage choices. Must visit when you come to Phuket.

Took D&N as a second option for lunch, but it was rewarding. It is well located near the tourist area of Phuket Town.  Every dish was a masterpiece and well presented;  Phuket Beef Stew Braised Pork in Brown Sauce Salmon Ceviche Hokkaido Scallop with Thai Style with Garlic Chilli 2X Kombucha Cocktails 2X Smoothies Fruit Punch  It was so good we're going back for dinner tonight (next day)

After hearing many great comments about this restaurant, my gal & I finally decided to do a lunch here. We happy to affirm that it’s definitely a good venue.  We enjoy a very delicious lunch. Loved the beer selections and the food variety (great quality international cuisine).  The atmosphere is great for a romantic and group setting. The decor is chic and tasteful. Service is good too. The staff that served us was very knowledgeable and pleasant.  A definite recommend and we’ll be back for sure.

review_title: More of a Gastro style pub
review: More of a Gastro style pub than a cafe restaurant. Good range of draught beers and enormous list of bottled beer. Food was great. We had a pork chop, Fish & chips and. Caesar salad. All were really tasty. Excellent fit out on the place which has only been open for a couple of months. The owners clearly know what they are doing. Staff were excellent and friendly as well. Congratulations... a modern bar/restaurant in Phuket town that rivals the best.

Takieng is our favourite restaurant when we visit the Renaissance Phuket hotel. We love eating out under the stars every night with the sound of the waves crashing on the shore. Service is excellent from start to finish with a shout out to Mama, Fern, Boom, Ammi and all the lovely team who ensured our beer bucket was kept topped up, our favourite table or nearest one was available, and a supply of crispy crackers and dipping sauce started each meal. We enjoyed sampling some of the signature dishes of locally sourced food -Andaman prawns with sea grapes became my favourite starter. Main course portions were very generous. The chef’s willingness to substitute duck for beef in a Mussiman curry and to tone down the heat on some of the spicier dishes was much appreciated. The Valentine’s Meal this year was especially tasty

user_name: ซุปตาร์พาเที่ยว Suptar Traveller
review_title: One of the most Fav Thai cuisine in Phuket
review: We have been hear 4 times for dining for lunch & dinner. The restaurant is on upstair above sand box bar with sea view , pool view & sunset view. The most important is here is one of the most delicious Fine dining Thai cuisine in Phuket with reasonable price. Staff is very polite & helpful , great service.  Specially thanks to staffs for serving us as remember : Khun Ammy Boom , Prae , Mama , Nam , Fon & Chef Tham

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: One of the best places to dine in Phuket
review: This restaurant is one of the best places to dine in Phuket. I was lucky to stay there during the pandemic for a few months. So this time I purposely return for their food, they serve tasty and flavorful dishes with some unique local ingredients and surprising twists. The service there is excellent and professional as always. This place is absolutely the one if you look for a causal Thai dining place with international standard, still offering full Thai tastes. The last thing you must order is dessert. They currently have good choices of sweet, however if you are lucky enough ask for Chef Fon to surprise you with her Thai dessert of the day. It’s off the menu. Chef Fon has real skills for Thai dessert that are not so easy to find these days. I just hope that the restaurant is going to add more of her sweets such as Tab Tim Krob in the menu. I would love to have it for my afternoon treat.  - Patrick

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: First visit but will definitely be back again for more delish food and excellent service!
review: Celebrated my husband’s birthday at Takieng. Food was splendid, very flavorful and so prettily plated! The staff knew that we were Bonvoy members and made special recommendations which was value for money and included 2 mocktails. She was also customer centric enough to let me know that there were enough dishes for all and not to over order. Very much appreciate it! What was most delightful was the service - thank you to the girl power team, Khun Joommie, Mama, Prea and Boom! All of them worked very well together and were warm, hospitable and attentive to all our needs. Thank you for a memorable evening…
Fresh food in a wide variety of choices. Splendid sunset view either inside or from the outside terrace. A place to see the world go by whilst enjoying a wonderful bite of authentic Thai food.
Really tasty Thai food!! The soft shell crab and pork belly were mouth watering!! Very nice set up and lovely service!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review_title: Worth to come back again and again
review: The food is always amazing as well as all the staffs. I have been there many times and will surely come back again.  Not to be missed! Pla Kapong Miengkham

This is Thai food restaurant attached to the beach. The atmosphere is very good. Taste is great.  Signature cocktail is strange but it's tasty. This is combination between Thai food and drink. Don't miss it.  Staff is very kind and helpful.  In my opinion, Takieng restaurant should get Michelin star...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review_title: Pla Kapong Miengkham is the best
review: Great food, Nice View and lovely service.  I love that crispy duck curry and Pla Kapong Miengkham - must try!  Thank all the lovely staff, Kit, Farot, Friend and everyone.  Will definately come back
Have eaten there 4 times now and have enjoyed it more each time. We've tried most of the items on the menu and have loved literally everything. Very authentic flavours and absolutely delicious food.

As per previous reviewer, it’s under renovation, but we had their menu and food in the all day restaurant  We had a large variety of dishes over 2 days - steamed fish with lime, satay, beef and vegetable curry were good. Duck curry was odd as the duck was like tempura. Crab omelette was equally off with the crab like tempura too. the red ruby dessert also tasted different, not sure good or bad

review_title: Outstanding customer service and excellent food
review: The warm welcome, cool beers and excellent food kept us coming back to Takieng every night of our two-week stay at the Renaissance Resort & Spa. All of the staff - Sam, Amp, Will, Puen, Ness and Paul - went out of their way make our experience enjoyable and learn our preferences in terms of level of spiciness. We liked to sit outside with the ocean view so they provided an ice bucket to keep our Singha beers cold. The extensive menu meant we never ate the same main course twice, though we always chose the same shared mixed starters. The Valentine's Day Meal was a particular triumph with an amazing variety of meat, vegetables and seafood, including lobster.  I was also lucky enough to be able to eat here for breakfast on a couple of mornings when they opened up as the hotel was very full. The Chef's Signature Eggs on smashed avocado, tomato salsa and sour dough served to the table with a fresh fruit smoothie and sparkling wine made a heavenly start to the day. I was quite upset when this stopped and I had to return to the busy hotel buffet.  Be sure to make a reservation for dinner as we saw several people turned away as they didn't have space. Thank you Takieng for a five-star dining experience every night of our stay. x

review_title: Good service, Good food, Poor value
review: I had dinner at this place. This upscale modern Thai restaurant has excellent service, good food but when it comes to value for money, it is lacking. With all due respect, more then 1K baht for pad Thai and fish cake is a bit over the top for me.

We stayed at the Renaissance Hotel and Spa and had 3 dinners here. The staff is OUTSTANDING and the food is excellent. It is traditional Thai food - everything is very fresh and beautifully prepared. And the view is SPECTACULAR!!! A definite must if you are in Phuket!

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: This restaurant is at the beautiful Renaissance Hotel in Phuket, Thailand so the views from the restaurant are of the Andaman Sea and the tropical surroundings of the property. The food and service are excellent and sunset can be seen if you eat at that time of the evening. The Thai cuisine is varied and the degree of spice can be adjusted to what you prefer. They have both indoor and outdoor seating.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: Have been to Takieng a few times (or ordered from their menu at the Sandbox bar below) over the years but after a disappointing dinner a couple of months ago, tired it again. Unfortunately still disappointing.  Last time: calamari tasted like shoe leather. Tough. I was told "those are European calamari, not same as Thai"... ?!  This time: Pad Thai came out almost instantly. It was cold, the tamarind sauce tasted "off" (sort of like a fermented or blue cheese flavor which doesn't belong). I wasn't in the mood to complain.  I have not had a dish here lately which I would describe as "memorable".  This restaurant should provide a memorable dining experience to guests and visitors. It's a Thai themed restaurant so for sure it should get thai food right.  For some reason, Sandbox's kitchen puts out consistently well tasting dishes but clearly Takieng is struggling and not exactly in the inexpensive side.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Excellent Food and decent size portions
review: If you are staying at the Renaissance you MUST eat here! In fact even if you are not staying here it is worth a visit. The restaurant is small so reservations are necessary as it gets busy. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the view is lovely over the water. The menu has some Thai traditional dishes but also some not so well known ones and the Grouper with three sauces is our favourite. It comes filleted and has amazing flavours. We ate here twice and if we were here another day we would have been back for a third day. Definitely one of the highlights of staying at this hotel. Do not miss it!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Smart Casual restaurant located on second floor overlooking Mai Khao Beach. The food was fantastic and for the resort very affordable. Service was very good and there was also a very extensive wine list.

review_title: Lovely location with good produce and very professional staff
review: We stayed at the hotel for 10 nights and ate here on 8 separate occasions and each time we were never disappointed.  Eat outside if you want a magical experience, air con when your in the tropics is overrated. Our favourite dishes were the Thai fish cakes and the hot and sour beef. If you have a sweet tooth go the sticky rice and fresh mango it finishes off your meal nicely.  All staff were fabulous but we very much appreciated the services of Rueben, he was a stand out!  Thanks for a great dining experience! Guterres Family

Food and ambiance was just divine. Staff were delightful and complimentary drink and small dish were very tasty. We are currently staying at this resort and will definitely be back. My husband said it was the best Massaman Curry he’s ever had. I had Southern Style chicken skewers which were also repeat worthy. Don’t forget the mango sticky rice for dessert!

We can for sure give Dee Plee our very best recommendations. Service: In general everything was perfect. Location: Perfect, while staying at the Anantera Lyan, or else a bit away from the citys. Pros: Beautiful location and delicious food. Cons: you need a car or a taxi if not staying at the Anantera

We’ve searched everywhere to find the best Thai food on Phuket. There are some very good ones but best to our opinion is Dee Plee. Top quality authentic Thai food for reasonable prices (compared for what you get). The staff could be a bit more attentive and look a bit better to their guests but … the kitchen make this more as good again. Highly recommended for quality Thai food seekers.

We dined in this restaurant twice during our stay at the resort. The location next to the pool is not the best, but the dishes were delicious and service top. I would strongly recommend Tom Khai soup and the curry with crab meat. It was a nice gesture, that they have prepared Pad Thai for my wife upon her request, despite not being part of the menu. They do have a very nice and healthy Kids menu as well.

Thoroughly deserves its reputation for good food but completely inaccessible for anybody with mobility issues. Tried both set menus and preferred the chef's option. Great views across the hotel. Service was good first visit and slow second time.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: Many year we come in phuket but never tried this lovely place, food atmosphere Just...Perfect! Fore sure we will come back again and again! Arrivederci!

We stayed in the Anantara and visited this restaurant every evening. It serves some of the best food I have ever tasted in Thailand ( which I have visited over 20 times) Highly recommend the shrimp/pork cakes as starter and the chicken red curry which is the best I ever tasted in Thailand. All the staff are extremely professional,attentive and friendly. Special mention to Goong who looked after us every evening and is one of the nicest waitresses we have met anywhere in the world. @ management please make sure she gets made aware of this review. We'll be back again next year for more delicious food.
Beautiful views across the resort and ocean. Impeccable service and stunning food. So good we went twice!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We ate in this restaurant four nights during our stay. The quality of food was excellent. The staff were attentive and friendly. On two nights there was traditional Thai music performed live. Really worth a visit.

review_title: Very nice Thai food within the hotel
review: We were staying at the Anantara Layan Phuket Resort and was highly recommended this Thai fine dining restaurant by the hotel staff. Was a buggy ride away from the hotel room.  The view from the restaurant was great. Good before the sunset so that you can enjoy both the sunset and the night view.  Alfresco dining is recommended because you will have the unblocked view to the sea and the pool. But get ready your insect repellent and embrace the heat because the fans weren't helping much.  We ordered a set menu for 2 pax. Was decent but nothing exceptional. The pace of serving was a little too lengthy, we actually got bored waiting for food after a while. We got seated by 6 pm and we left the restaurant at 8.30 pm.  Would I recommend this to anyone? If you are staying at the resort, why not because you don't have much choices there.  If you are making a trip here from elsewhere, I don't think you miss much.

Visited this resort restaurant and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and attentiveness of the staff. Be careful when asking for Spicy as the hot is hot! Food was top and the service from Yoo was very good. Not very busy which added to the experience. Seeing lightning inn the distance yet being sheltered from the rain made the evening.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: While spending a week in Phuket, we were looking for some good restaurants and we found some good reviews on the Dee Plee so we decided to give a try, knowing that Anantara is a very good and well recognized brand in Thailand.  The restaurant is located on the hills of the hotel, overlooking the hotel grounds, the sea and the beach. The decoration of the hotel is perfect, in Lanna style (northern thailand style) and the Lanna inspiration can be traced back in the menu... !  The menu is traditional thai with a number of plates from northern thailand (which is a different style from the south of thailand). Everything we ordered came in a very nice presentation and all the tastes were just amazing!! We had the possibility to have different type of rice, which is always great since Thailand has so much to offer on this front. The staff was super friendly and smiling and they contribute very significantly to the overall experience you have at Dee Plee. To me, Dee Plee is part of those restaurants who are truly honoring Thai food by offering to the guests a true culinary experience.  On thing to note, not so many restaurants in Thailand bring you the miang kham when you have dinner. Miang kham is actually the traditional thai snack that people enjoy when they are together. It consists of a bethel leave that you fill with roasted peanuts, coco, lime, shallots and some spicy paste. It is delicious and the perfect snack when you are having a beer or a glass of wine in Thailand but too few restaurants offer this.. I was really happy that Dee Plee has it.  All in all, we would certainly come back and highly recommend it!

review_title: The restaurant is in my favorite list for Thai food
review: - nice welcome . - The restaurant provides an external tables . -Romantic Restaurant . - Method of providing innovative food .
Hern is not to be missed when you are in Patong. Enjoyed our Breakfast and couple of other meals too. Excellent food, service, location and especially layout of cafe.
Had coffees and desserts on a quick stop while cruising Patong. Real coffee! The hotel looks nice too. I will consider a couple of nights on my next trip to Phuket.

review_title: Highly recommended eatery for all meals, great ambience
review: This is a very great cafe. We visited for breakfast. Had two sets of egg Benedict to share with 3 pax. Very good ambience, instagrammable for sure

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: During our holidays in Phuket we were staying at Baan Laimai Beach Resort in Patong and this restaurant is located in the hotel premises. This place has comfortable seating options on the lower and upper floors. We liked the decor and ambience was very nice. We had ordered Phuket style yellow sea food noodles and vodka & mango juice based cocktail drink. Quality of food was delicious and total bill was 570 baht.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Excellent food. Butter chicken, aloo gobi- both great. Paratha & roti, both perfect, too. Lovely, attentive service. Nice, clean restaurant.
The famous naughty nuri's from bali in Phuket. Same recipe, same taste, just taste like home.  Servers are very friendly and cater our needs. Very recommended place to have baby back ribs in Phuket.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Disappointing service, not worthy of a 5 star hotel
review: We have eaten here before when staying at the Nai Harn so booked a table for our first evening in the hotel. The food was as always very good, but the service was absolutely not, in fact it was really not what we had expected at all. The restaurant wasn’t hugely busy but we were pretty much ignored by the staff and took ages to take a dessert order then even longer to bring the desserts. If this had been our first impression of the Nai Harn, I don’t think we would have wanted to look any further. Fortunately the staff in all other parts of the hotel are fantastic, friendly and efficient. I just wouldn’t bother eating at Rock Salt next time, which is a great pity.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker
review_title: The very best spot in the island plus quality food!
review: Been here at least 20 times the last 3 years.Nai Harn beach is one of the very best beaches in Phuket with crystal clear water.after a dip you go up to the rock&salt and you have a drinks (Happy Hour daily 17:30 to 18:30). Great food choices, Mediterranean cuisine and attentive service! Is a must #TrustTheGreek
We came for sundown with cocktails and dinner. Perfect in every way, staff are excellent and the drinks well mixed. Highly recommend

Overall, we really enjoyed our lunch here. Beautiful setting, good service, good food. The Tsarskaya oysters were excellent. Seafood salad ok but would not reorder. Tuna ceviche dish was very oily and lacking in zing. Grilled red snapper delicate and perfectly cooked. All washes down with cold crisp white wine. It was more expensive than any other meal we had in the island, but we didn't begrudge that for the overall experience.

The best restaurant on Nai Harn beach. Excellent location with beach and sea view on such big terrace. Tonight we have a famous South African singer who has such fantastic voice. The food is so delicious, fresh seafood, tasty pasta and gaspacho soup. Good wines are served here. Jane is such a friendly and professional waiter.

review_title: Next To The Nai Harn Beach
review: We can for sure give Rock Salt our very best recommendations. Service: Extreme good service from all the staff. Location: Perfect, allmost on the beautiful Nai Harn Beach. Pros: Food & Location. Cons: A lot off general beach guest hanging around next to the restaurant Entrance

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review_title: Great Italian/Thai pizza place & superb coffee
review: We visit Ciao nearly daily while staying in Hilton. Pizzas, Pastas and Sea-bass are great, our kid loves crab meat soup, taco and lamb chops. Also they have great home made lemonades and smoothes. Thanks a lot to ms Bell and all the rest team for a great service. We will definitely come back - tomorrow for lunch. Please keep 2 coconuts for us :-) as we miss them if you don’t have them.
Had a great family lunch at this Karon beach restaurant. Duck salad, tuna salad, burger and crispy pork pad Thai were all fab

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: Going here every second day for lunch or dinner. We were really surprised by really great Italian picas and quit good pastas + amazing non alco cocktails: passion lover is our the best

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Best of the Thavorn Palm Beach cafes
review: I ate from here 3 times while staying at Thavorn Palm Beach. I had pasta twice and had pizza delivered to the room once. The food was probably the best of all the on site restaurants/cafes at Thavorn. The pasta serves were small, but probably reflected what I paid. It's very convenient when you're staying nearby.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Surprised to find dissent Italian food here
review: Right on the Karon beach, next to Hilton this place offers nice variety of pizza and pasta. The seafood pizza and the zuppa di pesce was very good. Generally liked it, though find it overpriced. A good choice when you get bored with Thai food.

Been looking for a great pizza for a few weeks. The 4 cheese pizza was very delicious. The open air resto is very nice. My problem was that there were 3 empty tables and they were all dirty. The drinks were overpriced for the area. Still good food.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker
review: We went to this Bistro in march 2015. Service was not good. There were 3 People Just standing and do nothing. Pizza was not really tasty. And the price was very expensive for what You get.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review: Looking for a ‘good’ restaurant in the area of Patong Beach we found through Tripadvisor this restaurant. We were very early and their first guests. The service was friendly and correct, but more important the food was fabulous. Ordered the salmon and a well grilled beefsteak after our appetizer of different pieces of bread. It was delicious!!! The price of course was related to the quality a bit higher. But happy we choose this restaurant and it will be on our favourite list in Phuket when we come back!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Best homemade foie gras in Patong
review: The café de Paris restaurant is open again in Patong. They have the best homemade foie gras in Phuket. Made by Alain the french chef. The beef tartare is also very good.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Very good Australian stirloin in patong
review: Very good restaurant for meat, duck or burger with australian meat. The Australian stirloin is great. Friendly staff. The chef is very professional and welcoming. Prices are net, all included and located on beach road.

After our first visit on March 019 we decided to come back ..and what a happy to return. After a big disappointing at Sam's Steak Cafe de Paris give us a refreshing services and a great food.We eat the fantastic duck slices with a great sauce and the prawn on a Also great fresh taste.for drink we choose a red and a wine wine from the open menus, Very good.The dessert was brilliant,and so pretty prepared.Also we had a great compliment chocolate treat,because a awful foreign customer make trouble...what an awful guest.i would like a suggestion to the chief:please throw this customer out from your nice restaurant, he is not worth it!!!! Deed and Belle

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Alain the best chef in patong
review: They had a gigot d'agneau party. Amazing food. Very good gratin dauphinois. Dessert was great too, cheese cake. Don't miss this restaurant in patong.

At here with a date yesterday evening. Had Australian steak wifh cafe de paris sauce and my companion had grilled sea bass with vegetables. We drank a house Sauvignon blanc and a couple of cocktails. Nice setting in a quiet side road off of Patong Beach Road. The food was overall reasonable to good, common problem with steak in Thaiand though, always will be overcooked so if you would like medium rare, order rare or blue. The house wine was very good. I did not drink the cocktails so have no comment. The staff including the owner were nice and friendly.

We came here based on TA reviews and wanted something different. It’s French (Swiss French owner) and the food was really well done and different to all other local options. Service was great and for the top end standard of dishes, fair value albeit a premium to other local options. Maybe a good choice if you have a special occasion or as us, a change from the local mainstream. Oh, and don’t forget to try one of the desserts!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Still the best french restaurant in Patong!
review: Back at the Café de Paris, still the best french food in patong.  Alain the French Chef makes sure that the customers are happy and enjoy his food.  I recommend the foie gras of course, the duck, and the desserts, friendly staff, give it a try!

Cafe De Paris located in the heart of Patong within walking distance to the beautiful beach and Patong Tower offers high quality Western a la carte food. I had a tremendous great experience of the fresh beef tartare there on my last visit. In fact it was so delicious that I will return again today.... Also their Signature dishes are stunning. Their steaks are definitely the best ones in Phuket at a great value deal with stunning high consistency! Friendly staff, clean and modern facilities.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: The best restaurant in Patong, don't look anywhere else, the food is fantastic.  I enjoy good food and i can tell you that this place is the best in patong thanks to Chef Alain who is passionate about food, cooking and making his customers happy! And Georges makes sure everything is going ok during your meal.  We had homemade foie gras, delicious, duck with pinot noir sauce, very very good, panna cotta, so good and homemade too!!  They gave us some complimentary homemade macarons, very good too, everything was good.  Chef Alain is amazing and makes everything himself!  Don't miss this restaurant if you are in Patong, amazing food to eat and delicious desserts!

review_title: Very good food in patong beach
review: Delicious foie gras. The pana cotta is so good. The duck. The chef is outstanding. Go check it out, you will enjoy great food.

Cafe de Paris is home to some really outstanding steaks, particularly when served with the signature sauce. The occasional wine dinners and very well done, perfectly pairing great food and wines. The service is good, the owner is friendly, the location is convenient and the prices are realistic. Overall, it's one of the best restaurants in Patong, if not all of Phuket.

review_title: Hidden luxury fine dining restaurant which offers excellent value for money in the heart of Patong
review: Cafe de Paris is an amazing restaurant for Gourmet lovers in Patong. A perfect spot for great value for money which already opens the doors starting from 3.00 pm... Its consistency is very high so happy to return. Great staff, clean kitchen and high quality ingredients makes it worth a visit.

review_title: At the TOP of my preferences list in Patong!
review: Every short stay in Phuket is for me an opportunity to return to the "Café de Paris", my favorite fine dining restaurant in Patong. This is a not a restaurant where food is eaten and beverages are drunk, but where delicious dishes are enjoyed while fine wines from a good selection are savoured. Nice setting, great staff, excellent food, I will return as often as possible. Thank you for this pure moment of happiness!

On a quieter pedestrian alley in the center of Patong, this restaurant is where you need call for and excellent meat dinner. It offers as well a wide range of modern french dishes, a well balanced wine list with some true gems. The service is perfect and the ambiance cozy and relaxing.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Fred R Barnard, advertising executive, is credited with the saying that a picture is worth a thousand words. Well, I’ve been admiring the pictures of Big Boys Burger Club offerings for three years and finally put his claim to the test.  Sorry Fred, the picture simply doesn’t convey the explosion of taste in that first mouthful of juicy double stack burger that is the El Clasico, sheer burger bliss. I elected to have the patties cooked medium well, and the result was a juicy burger with two patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and the tomato aioli sauce. The Big Boy, another winner with the crispy bacon topping the patties. Toasted pineapple slices gave the Waikiki a different taste sensation and the Croc Dundee with the fried egg and beetroot was just an amazing meal. Mustn’t forget the onion rings and the ice cold Changs. My wife enjoyed her Blues Brothers (without the bun) and on other nights the chicken wings , chicken on green plate and those tasty chips.  There are still more gourmet creations to be sampled, another trip from OZ necessary, the YOLO remains a challenge to be tackled.  Great vibe in the restaurant, a warm welcome from staff and the elegant owner, impeccable unobtrusive service throughout. I’d recommend these burgers to anyone, they are just delicious taste combinations.

Super efficient, polite & easy to deal with for delivery to a Villa in my case. All done via WhatsApp & paid cash when delivery arrived. Delivery super efficient & burgers, fries, chicken wings all really good. Family all happy & content.
Got to be the best burger we’ve ever had Fresh ingredients made with passion, super friendly owners and you’ll also fall in love with Dolly the dog. Highly recommend . We went twice!

review_title: Some of the best burgers on the island of Phuket
review: Pair quality ingredients with passion and culinary skills, and you get a delicious burger! Khun Mon & her daughter are looking forward to spoil you, make sure to pay them a visit if you’re in the area!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Absolutely mind BLOWING.  The service is great, the burger is nicely cooked, juicy and flavourful. Generous portion with double patties, real stuff, no BS. The Blues Brother is our favourite. The sweet potato fries is crispy, we had it with sriracha mayo and blue cheese, the complimentary from the owner, both sauce were very delicious. Vegan option are also available here.  So all my friends, if you happen to be in phuket, make it to kamala and try this juicy, yummy burger!! Supporting small local business, this burger will certainly make your mouth, your tongue and belly happy.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: Wholly recommend a trip to Kamala Beach for these burgers & extras. Solid professional burgers. They even serve rare, medium & well done burgers. Classy food in weird surroundings. Worth a visit. Find it, eat it, love it! Inexpensive too!

Hot chick burger which I ordered was juicy, just perfectly hot to my taste, crispy, nicely served and for very reasonable price. As a side dish I have shared french fries and was totally full from all of this. The burger bar seems to be quite new. Service is always smiling, asking if everything is allright. According to my search and experience this is possibly the best place to have very good burger.

We visited one evening whilst staying at The Vijitt Resort. Every night we had visited Rawai beach front to eat so fancied a change. Wow, absolutely superb food and service. Obviously this will cost you more than your beach front thai restaurant but it is well worth the extra if you want to treat yourself. It was so good we booked again for the following evening! It does get really busy so would advise to book online before hand as we did see lots of people being turned away. I can recommend the beef cheek for main course.....amazing! We will visit again if we return to Phuket.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Nice restaurant in rawai to eat french food and good cuisine cooked by a french chef. On Tuesday they have a burger party, all you can eat burgers. Staff is nice and friendly.
We have the bistro Plate de jour and all of the 3 courses were fantastic. Perfectly cooked. The owner is french and he is the cook, so excellent chef cooked meals. Not to be missed

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Professional and friendly staff at zen eat. The chef makes very good food and desserts. If you like burgers, don't miss the burger party on Tuesdays.

This place was booked for us by my friend Chris who lives in Naiharn for my last meal before coming back to UK.  Very professional service from the moment you arrive with a large selection of Steaks & Burgers.  Very nice atmosphere with a chilled out vibe.

review_title: Worth a visit if you are in Rawai
review: Visited Zen Eat for dinner on my last evening in Rawai. I went for the 990 baht gourmet menu as I really wanted to try the beef check and it made it good value to add an additional starter and main course.  Very impressed with the food, presentation, ambiance and the friendly staff.  The place was quite busy even with the current diminished tourist presence.

Words are not enough to describe the pleasure of dining here. The restaurant is open sided but with a canopy roof, like being in a big tent/marquee. Good lighting, plenty of fans, soft music. I had the fried fish fillet, on a sculptured bed of mash with artfully arranged green mango salad, it came so beautifully presented, like any fine dining restaurant, almost reluctant to mess it up. Hubby had the Jacket Daniel burger with a side of fries, it's definitely a gourmet burger. For dessert, I had the creme brulee, perfectly caramelised crust, creamy smooth custard. Hubby's dark chocolate mousse was also amazing. We loved it so much, before we left, we reserved a table for our last dinner in Phuket. Compliments to the chef, and Yanick as the maitre'd, and attentive waitstaff. This is the perfect place for a special night out. Try the Monaco beer cocktail.

a very friendly place. excellent service. delicious well thought out menu that is wonderfully presented. reasonable prices and a nice atmosphere. Nice to meet the chef who took the time to wander the room and talk to the guests.
Great food Good menu Set 2-3 course food is not only reasonable prices it’s actually excellent food too Parking outside also Been 3x would go again Service ok too

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This was our first time at Zen Eat and we were certainly not disappointed we had been recommended the restaurant and it was a great experience. The staff were brilliant, attentive, friendly and efficient. The food was amazing, thoughtful, well executed and presentation and taste were amazing. It was very reasonably priced and we had a great evening. We look froward to returning soon with friends! thanks

There is a very talented chef in this Restaurant. The Steak Menu as well as the Bouillabaisse @ 524.3 THB were excellent and nicely decorated. They change the menu daily at moderate prices. (I don't know why they not include the 7% VAT on the price list, it looks a bit cheating for me) The decoration makes the easy place look nice and there is enough parking space around. Although it is a bit noisy because of the nearby main street (this takes off 1 point from "excellent" for me). Of course I will go there again - the food is really very good.
What a find. Excellent food & presented very well. Kind & attentive staff. Good value. Recommended. Book to be safe.

In 14 years by far the best food in Phuket And reasonable prices too  Set aside hoards of straight men kissing other men using there lips constantly Surely once is enough please  This food is simply amazing  Starter sea bream all I can say is I was in shock Fantastic presentation Great taste Worthy of 5 star and nothing in Phuket to touch it  Main course Duck Just as the starter wow  Desert Creme brûlée Perfect  Cocktails all sensible prices  Seating not to cramped Car Parking good Sensible prices all round Nice enough environment  Why pay 3x the price as I have for momma tri / boat house / bam rim this place is better & cheaper  The best food of this trip by a LONG LONG WAY  Only issue - Thai staff need to be faster or 1-2 more of them everyone was constantly waiting for food or drinks We would of drank more but had other places to be and service was a little slow  But really that was the only single issue  Will return for sure

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Had a very good meal here . Small menu but great options and everything well cooked . Good , friendly service and will return .

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We were actually on the way to another restaurant, which was closed, when we decided to give this restaurant a try. It looked as if it had been recently renovated, as the tables and decoration looked fresh and tidy. The waitresses were attentive and always on the lookout to serve. The menu is small, but has a good enough selection of different dishes. We chose a salad and calamari as an appetizer, which were very nicely presented, but the taste of the salad sauce was just delicious! For main course I had the Paella, beautifully presented and extremely tasty and my wife the fish dish - very fresh and also delicious. We will be back soon again!
We had lunch here on a our at this resort. We thought food was very average and very overpriced. Also service wasn't great either. Not that impressed, as La Sala was excellent.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: A Fine Dining Experience Not To Be Missed
review: Sea Fire Salt is an exceptional fine dining restaurant. We visited the restaurant three times during our Phuket Sandbox stay. Each time our dinner was cooked to perfection by the lady chef and her colleagues. Staff are attentive but not intrusive. In fact they enhance the experience with their relaxed and friendly manner.  To the food. In a word amazing! From the amuse bouche, the appetisers, the main courses and ending with an imaginative dessert, all were of the highest quality. Our personnel favourites - the beef tenderloin, the lamb chops and the sea bass both cooked on salt blocks - were cooked to the highest standard and were mouth-wateringly good.  If you stay at the Anantara please visit this excellent restaurant.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: As it came up in the top 10 in the area we drove to the restaurant Parked and walked into the hotel asking the security guard where the restaurant was. He told us to contact reception... Walked in and told that the restaurant is closed No problem and understand during this time but at least have the courtesy to update trip advisor and Google as temporary closed .....

Loved the atmosphere. Service here is outstanding. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Special thanks to K.Rainy, K.Jiji, K.Nam and K.Ann for taking good care of us. Great quality of food. Andaman Seafood Platter is highly recommended. So fresh and delicious - it was served with a sizzling Himalayan salt brick which made the food taste even better! Wagyu rib-eye was great too but we ordered medium-well, it turned out rare and bloody but truffle sauce really goes so well with it. The restaurant is located inside Anantara Mai Khao Villas so the price is sure to be expensive, but it is worth to spoil yourself once in a while.

Had dinner here last Saturday with the family - the whole evening was amazing. The view from their outdoor terrace is out of this world, you see the beautiful beach and sunset whilst indulging in fine Phuket seafood. We shared the seafood tower platter and everything served was absolutely delicious. All the great food was complimented by fantastic service received by Fausto and Khun Anne who were onto everything. We will definitely be back with extended family later this year. Only regret that we have is that we did not have space for dessert
Great experience. Team took very good care of our table and the food was delicious! Will definitely come back.

review_title: Great hangout with good food and lovely ambience
review: The food was simply delicious. We visited the restaurant for casual lunch and we had a great time. The team was great despite the rain pouring and the restaurant being packed. Everyone made sure people are taken care of. They were engaged and kind. I highly recommend the snow fish, their brownie is a must!

The food: cooked on a salt block from Pakistan the fish or meats. I had the snapper which was beautifully cooked and presented. Location with a view of the ocean is breathtaking. Get there at least 30 minutes before sunset to enjoy the view of the water. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor they do have fans and cover from the rain. Or, have a drink at the bar - good view also of the sea and yummy drinks (I had Fire on Ice...rum delicious!) Ask them to give you a buggy ride on the grounds at night...the lighting is not to be missed. It’s a beautiful resort. Tip: they have a Tree House bar. We didn’t have time to get this is but looks really cool. You can walk over from the Marriott via the beach or take a buggy. Can be a bit hard to find from the road especially. Hope you enjoy this evening. Only drawback is the service (i.e. presenting the menu) is not good. Probably not comfortable with their English. Otherwise it’s just fine!
Serice and music was awesome! Food fell a bit short. We expect more in Thailand, especially with seafood!

This place in in the Anantara MaiKhao villas and has an amazing menu on sea food and other international dishes. Definitely you have to go for one of the fish still being cooked on one of the heated salt bricks, this technique allows your dish to stay warm while adding an extra salty flavor. We had the Red Snapper but you can try the Sea Bass, Lobster and even your steak. Worth every penny

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: The setting at the Anantara Resort is very beautiful with a view of the ocean and amazing grounds. The preparation of food is unique using a salt slab and bringing salts specific to each dish to add. The taste of everything was very good and the service was excellent.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I will start with the setting, which was lovely. Outside dining with blue and white tones, over looking the ocean (if you are there before sunset). Their online reservation system is VERY broken. We had a reservation for New Year’s Eve (we received an email confirmation) but when we showed up, they had no record of it. They informed us that they were not doing the menu that night and sent us on our way - where are you supposed to find another restaurant at 9 pm on New Year’s Eve? We decided to try again on January 2nd. Again made reservations online...and received an email confirmation. Got to the restaurant and they had no record of the reservation...at least this time they accommodated us. As I said before, a lovely setting. Our waiter had some struggles providing us with accurate menu information (actually was inaccurate on his description of several menu items) and overall the service was fair at best. If you are looking at their menu online - DON’T! It is not the same....and the menu at the restaurant was not descriptive - hard to know what you were going to get. We saw nothing served on a salt block. I am wondering if they have changed management or the menu compared to previous reviews - usually Trip Advisor is a good reflection of a restaurant- but not this time - look only at recent pictures and reviews! Most items were very overpriced! We had Tiger Prawn Cocktail - it was only 2 (two!) prawns and cost 750 Bhat! They were good, but really? We ordered two bottles of wine that were listed in the menu for 1700 bhat and we were charged 2000 bhat per bottle! As for main dishes- the ribeye was fair at best, the scallops were 4 scallops - very tender but otherwise very average...the best dish we had was the blue swimmer crab - 4 crabs, very tasty but a lot of work to eat. The Parmesan mashed potatoes were good, enough for two people. The Lobster Mac and Cheese? Not an accurate description at all...it was more of a pasta in a lobster bisque - no cheese to speak of. We ordered asparagus - sorry, they were out. So, I don’t usually tell people to avoid a restaurant - but we had much better meals and experiences in Phuket- eat elsewhere!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Seafront views, fancy ingredients and very good service. This is a place for a special meal.  Portion sizes were, for us, quite big, and we couldn't finish everything we ordered. Staff were fantastic throughout.

We went there 3 times when we staying at Anantara 2 weeks ago, the place is very lovely, bit romantic at night, the food menu is different for lunch and dinner. With lunch you have more international food options.

Close to the beach and operated by the Anantara Hotel you will find a excellent seafood restaurant where you also will find steaks and other meat dishes on the menu card. Sitting outside and enjoying a wonderful spot having a perfect dinner. After dining, you might like to walk a few steps along the beach enjoying this beautiful part of the world- vacation pure

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review: Sea Fire Salt is primarily a sea food restaurant. The food is cooked n different salts which is unique.

review_title: A must go if you are staying in the Hotel
review: It was late when we checked into the Hotel so we decided to roam around the hotel and find food. We came to this Sea.Fire.Salt Seafood restaurant and decided we just eat here, that was the best decision the day.  We were impressed with how elaborated the Salt can be with every dish during our dinner. The staff appeared to know their Salts very well too. The recommended type of Salt for us tasted just great with our food.  We had a table indoor because it was raining. Ambiance was great. Food was great.  Service was prompt and attentive.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: So good, my wife and I went there 3 times. Located near the beach in the Anantara Resort, the food is impressive. The Himalayan salt brick dishes are a must, but very pricey. Anyway, all the dishes we tried were simply delicious. The setting is very relaxed, all in white and blue. Service was OK.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Visited twice during a fantastic stay at the Anantara Villas. Food very good and staff excellent. Great service and attention. Had steak on the first night which was average and lamb on the second which was excellent. Also had butter fish for the first time which was extremely nice and tuna cooked on a salt brick which we wished we had ordered rare as it kept cooking and ended up medium well. The salt theme is interesting but a bit over the top. Good selection of wines at typical high prices. Reastaurant is next to the beach but not really a sea view restaurant. Very good food excellent staff and definitely worth a visit.
This place is fancy and expensive, but very good. We went to experience their salt sommelier, and it was something to talk about to our friends and family.

user_tags: Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: We stayed at the Anantara resort for our honeymoon and ate here twice.  Sea.Fire.Salt is the premier eaterie at both Anantara and Marriott. It's more of a fine dining experience than other restaurants we ate at and it's fronted by the excellent, well travelled, French maitre d', Laurant. Who's a nice guy and very informative on your food and wine if you need him to be. First time here we had the mixed seafood brick (scallops, prawn, sea bass) and the mixed grill (lamb chop, steak, chicken) bricks. The searing hot Himalayan salt bricks are maybe a little bit of artistic licence and whether or not they contribute anything other than a hot, salty brick to your meal I wouldn't know. But they do make the difference of bringing something unique and interesting to the table. Food was very good, well presented with potato and vegetable sides. Handmade Sorbet deserts are delicious. As always in Asia, red wine served chilled, why do you do that? 2nd time we ate here was the last night of our stay, because it's a very nice place and it's nice being spoiled occasionally. Outrageously juicy Wagyu and Sirloin steaks served with a selection of salts that vary in colour, texture and taste, Very nice. I spoke to front of house when I arrived and was delighted when they managed to find me a non-chilled, perfect temperature bottle of red wine to enjoy with my steak. It completed my meal and I'm grateful for the efforts that were made. Food here is certainly not cheap, but it's good. Undoubtedly you're paying a little extra for the whole outdoor, on the seafront, well presented, himalayan brick, finer experience. Which I enjoyed. And I'd eat there again. Très Bien

review_title: Not hugely impressed and very expensive
review: This is a very pretty restaurant on the beachfront at the Anantara hotel. The location and set up is very nice, and having a meal beside the beach with the crashing waves in the background is very romantic and soaking with atmosphere and style.  Service: The service was exemplary as expected at an Anantara. Attentive, helpful, and unobtrusive. They were kind enough to help move us inside to the air conditioned space which helped when it became too hot. They explained much of the dishes to us as well which was nice. When we left they got us a buggy to the reception and called our hotel and asked them to send a buggy to collect us. We were very impressed and pleased with this.  Food: The menu is very limited with only a few options for starters, mains and desserts. I was hoping for more seafood dishes and options. Their hallmark dish was seafood cooked on top of salt bricks. Heating the bricks and cooking it on top allows the seafood to absorb some of the flavour of the exotic salts. It felt gimmicky and I could not really taste any great benefit. I ordered the prawn version and it tasted like regular grilled prawns and was nothing special. I hoped to have some of the famous Thai flavours and passion reflected in the food. But I found the meal a bit bland.
