Don’t get me wrong, the food was fresh and all was very well executed but the mains were really not that interesting. The salt sommelier was there to assist with different types of salt to enhance your meal. I am a fan of interesting salts but again, this felt a bit forced. I could barely tell the difference between the salts and quite frankly, didn’t care. I just wanted to really good, tasty seafood. The starters were very good – most especially the rocket and pear salad which was quite WOW but a very small portion. The desserts were nicely made but nothing extraordinary. There was also a seafood feast but for the price, did not seem well worth it.  Price: This place was very expensive. I dont normally mind paying for good food but this felt unnecessarily expensive for what it was. I love Ananatra as a hotel and frequently dine at their restaurants even when I am not staying with them but the pricing of the is menu felt much too expensive for the food you were getting. Even if the price were lower, I would not be keen to come back again as I don’t find the food (except the salad) worth the inflated cost. It is a rarity that I do not like an Anantara establishment but the balance of value for money for atmosphere – made me feel disappointed.  I would not go back again for dinner as nothing interested my taste buds. I would not mind to have a drink or light snack there but as a dinner, I felt I could get better food, variety and price at one of the other dining options on the hotel property.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: nice interior, pretty staff, fresh seafood
review: i went here last year uring my photoshoot at anantara. the interior was really nice modern, and the food yummy fresh, i also love the grilled fish really simple ( i forgot the name but i attach the pics)  and lovely scene of the pool wuth turtle artworks, shallow pool for honeymooners. and they had collectins of salts all kind of salts which you can purchase or maybe select to taste

You pay here more than you would on the beach at a little local restaurant of course, but we went twice with 10 people and had lovely meals both times. Lobster tails on salt bricks, monster prawns, great steak. The service was good and the experience was one to remember. Lovely setting too. No its not 200 baht a dish but really......do the conversion and realise that you have eaten some lovely food at a price you ain't gunna see back in Sydney.  I'll be back.

We decided to eat here after reading the reviews and it is in the next hotel along. I am so glad we did! We both said that it was the best meal we had eaten on the island.  We sat inside and all the staff were very attentive. I had a mocktail called Anantara which was lovely and my boyfriend had a glass of the Thai Shiraz which was actually good quality.  We didn't have starters but both had sea bass, mine on the rock plate and partners steamed. We were given 3 different salts to have with it which were explained and all went very well!  We had dessert too which was the best sticky rice and mango I've had on the island and we had the banana in coconut which was amazing.  The staff were lovely and the food fabulous. If you are in the Mao khao area it is definitely worth a visit, it's not the cheapest but it is worth the extra money!

We stumbled upon a wine dinner the evening we visited Sea. Fire. Salt. and had a lovely meal in a lovely setting. The service was quite good, timing good as well and the food was very nice. The restaurant prides itself on the different types of salts it uses and they even have a lovely guy named Ton who is the salt sommelier. The prices aren't cheap, but they are in range with the other resorts and restaurants in the area. Would recommend for a nice meal out.
Disappointed that the salt sommelier turned out to be a boy with lots of salt in jars! He didn't really care whether we liked his recommendations or not, we got what we were given

A restaurant that has only improved in 10 years. Flawless quality that has built its reputation, the rave reviews on TripAdvisor speak volumes and reflect reality. It has become an obligatory gastronomic passage in Phuket.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Had a great dinner (again!) at Thong Dee, we enjoyed the Sunday roast, always busy and great atmosphere. They have many specials on different days of the week, easy to follow on Facebook. The food is always spot on, service impeccable. We have a small baby which is challenging sometimes in a restaurant but at Thong Dee we are so well looked after and we can really enjoy our dinner without worrying too much about our son. Any request or special requirements they are ready to support. We’ll certainly return soon!! Thanks Thong Dee team see you again!

We just finished a sumptuous dinner at this venue, and I felt like I had to share how outstanding the food and quality of service was.  We started the evening with their Brie Melters, which are pieces of Brie cheese deep-fried in a homemade batter. We paired the appetizer with a glass of Prosecco, currently on promotion.  Following this, we ordered the Lamb Stew and the Spaghetti Deluxe, in a rich red wine sauce. Sensational!  All-in-all, the quality of the ingredients, combined with the skilled knowledge of the kitchen brigade and the professionalism of the staff made this evening way more special than it should have been.  Highly recommended if you are in Kathu, or in Phuket Town.

We visited Thong Dee this Sunday as the missus was craving for their Sunday Roast. The servings were exceptional, offering several options such as beef, lamb, chicken, etc.  I myself enjoyed a Brie Melter for the appetizer, followed by their gourmet Pad Kaprao, which was perfect!  The staff and the owners were all very welcoming and easy to talk to. This is a must-visit restaurant if you are in or around Kathu.

Always the best for eating in family or for an event like Valentine's. The imported tuna is the best of the island,(really fresh fish),and the chicken in duxelle was really good. Kids love always his spaghetti bolognaise . The menu offers a very large choice of fish,meats,wines and beers. It's my 3 stars restaurant.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Went here for Sunday lunch after reading reviews on trip advisor. We were not at all disappointed. Fabulous roast dinners, followed by super desserts. Very friendly service from owner/chef Por and the staff, all came and chatted making us fell very welcome. Will definitely visit again.

review_title: Repeatedly here and always enjoy the meal and the service
review: Especially the Sunday Roast is always an experience :-) But a la carte is also a good choice. Sitting outside a good opportunity for smokers. Reservation might be important.

This is an amazing restaurant set in a quiet and tranquil area only five minutes drive from Patong. The owners of this business take great pride in serving the freshest and most enjoyable food available on the island and their personal touch has contributed to making this one of Phuket's most popular places to dine. I enjoyed lunch there the other day and had an amazing experience which included a range of tasty Thai dishes. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this restaurant to any of my friends and family visiting the island.

Another amazing night at Thong Dee. Missing my salmon gravlax, but went for the Trio to start and the ribeye to finish. A fantastic combo. They boys went for Mums receipt lasagne, which went down a treat and the chicken. Great wine by the glass an awesome setting. My go to when entertaining.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Great atmosphere, great food, Great host and service. We truly enjoyed the experience and the warm welcome. We eat here a few times per month and never disappointed. Food and drinks are beautiful. Thank you so much!

It’s a very pleasant setting and it’s excellent reputation is probably deserved. The service is again attentive and friendly, big gap between main and desert....cheese actually, but otherwise pretty good. The menu was broad and you’d be hard pressed not to find an interesting option. The salmon looked good, my mushroom spaghetti was really tasty, stroganoff looked huge. It ain’t cheap, but plenty of Phuket restaurants aren’t these days. It’s a slightly out of the way setting, but that’s ok. Finished with a very pleasant port...Oh, the cheeses were fine, but the accompanying biscuits....probably the only disappointment of the evening. The boss is in evidence, orchestrating the operation , he’s charming and runs it well.

review_title: Local Brasserie offering beautifully cooked and presented food, a warm welcome and friendly, efficient service
review: Thong Dee is a little Gem! This is a family-run business offering a western style menu but with a range of traditional Thai dishes also, together with a wine list carefully chosen by mine host Patrick Lundgren. Patrick's wife, K.Phonchan is in charge of a modern kitchen which consistently serves up excellent fare, with the "Sunday Roasts" being especially favoured by local Ex-Pats. Portions are generous and offer great value whilst service is especially friendly and attentive. All in all, a super little restaurant which is well worth a visit.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: 2nd time here and it just gets better. Friendly and attentitive staff, good food, nice size portions. You should all experience Thong Dee, you won't be disappointed.

review_title: The prior Trip Advisor Reviews are accurate!
review: While visiting Thailand, one has to eat the best Thai food, and of course, we looked at Trip Advisor to acquire its patrons' opinions. This restaurant rated No. 1, and had raving reviews. Given that, my husband, adult daughter and I decided to give Thong Dee, located in Kathu, relatively close to our hotel, a try. It is a relatively small restaurant located off the main road on what appears to be a neighborhood street. Given its size, I would recommend reservations, although we had no trouble making a last minute 7:30 p.m. on a Friday night. Our server was Patrick, and he could not have been nicer and knowledgeable about the food and wine choices, which are fairly ample (mostly Australian and New Zealand) and inexpensive for Thailand. From appetizers (my daughter and I had oysters and husband spring rolls) to our main course, the food was excellent! The wines were (New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc and Shiraz) were paired well. The meal was well worth the money and time getting there, and service excellent. For us, it is a must to visit again the next time we are in Phuket.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I eat here about once a week, always something nice on the menu, Food is fantastic everything I tried, good portions not too large, friendly service, very kind prices, I can't wait to go back there again

' One of my favourite restaurants in Phuket and now also serving mouth watering Sunday Roast Lunch. It was rated the best by Phuket Gazzette website (if you read between the lines) and I must agree. Order combo of 3 meats for the best value. Other item I really like are Gravlax, Gambas Pil Pil, Toast Skåken and of course The Swedish Meatballs. Highly recommended! THX"

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler;Trendsetter
review: My friends recommend me this place. Is not really close to my home but tonight i went there. I'm always call for reservation even in low season so i never get disappointed when the busy or closed. Very friendly welcome... even if i'm alone they choosed already the best table for me. As i'm still on my strong diet i'm always afraid if they really can/ want how i need it. I ordered beef carpaccio and tenderloin with veg. All done to perfection even without one drop oil. Also very the decoration with the food was very nice... see even diet food can looks good :-)) and be healthy. All came to my table even the kitchen to ask if all perfect and done to my wish. Only can say: better not possible. The way to get there will never be again a problem cause the place, food, staff are perfect. Will recommend and for sure be back soon.

to go with them to their new favourite restaurant in Phuket ..... they explained why they 'love' this restaurant ... and they were not wrong! On arrival on a Saturday night recently, the restaurant looked very inviting ... but very busy. on being greeted [like long lost friends!] by the front of house staff ... they explained that there was a large birthday party group [which explained the 'business!'] ... suggesting we ordered before the group ... good idea. Initially, there didn't appear to be a 4 seater table available ... but a fellow guest [on his own] volunteered to give up his table. So kind .. and we settled down to peruse the large menu ... with as advertised - European favourites and authentic Thai dishes. The meal was excellent accompanied by a bottle of red .. suggested by the Manager. The service, the food and the ambience were - just as our friends had led us to believe. No wonder they are regulars ... and we will be too.

No wonder that Thong Dee Is ranking number 1 in TripAdvisor. It is the best meal I had in Phuket (so far). Tenderloin was divined!! The cheese sauce that come with it was just delicious. Shrimp pesto and oysters are all great dishes. Rhubarb cake (sweet sponge cake together with rhubarb) is just amazing. Definitely worth a ride from Phuket city or Patong beach. Service is excellent as well as the food. Waiters and waitress are attentive.

Found this restaurant on TripAdvisor. They serve good food to a very reasonable price. Nice clean restaurant to high western standards. Very friendly service. The only drawback is that its difficult to find for the average tourist.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: We had a great christmas dinner there, thank you to the owner and his staff to deal with all the customers at the same time.  Good food, great pumpkin soup and caramal ice cream. :)  If i may suggest, would be nice to have air conditioning inside and close the front window doors as it gets hot inside.  Recommend.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Small simple restaurant in Sultanamet. Great choice of dishes well cooked, staff was really nice. I really liked the lamb and the kebab, so tender. Prices are fair, I would reccomend it

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Great Seafood and one of the best restaurants in Istanbul
review: Really amazing seafood and a great restaurant in Istanbul. They give amazing portions and not for much. Great service and although the staff didn't speak much English, they were very nice.

review_title: Probably not number 4, but not bad.
review: If you are hungry and in the Sultanahmet district, you will have a staggering number of choices. Wandering among the warren of streets, you will encounter many restaurants with many different front men trying to entice you to step inside for a bite to eat. Which one to choose?  So, I looked at TripAdvisor and saw Las Tapas which was a quick 3 mi Ute walk from our hotel ranked number 4 in all of Istanbul so I figured we had to try it.  We were not disappointed. Food was good. I had a pide and my wife had the chicken pasta. Pretty standard fare here in Istanbul. We enjoyed a nice fried cheese appetizer and dessert. Service was fine, a tad slow but friendly. And there were no shenanigans with the bill.  So, a good meal at a nice restaurant in a great city made for a great evening.

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Thrifty Traveler;Family Vacationer
review: Great food in great company. We visited here on our second night in Istanbul on account of it being close to our hotel and the previous reviews. We were not disappointed. Mosses (owner) and his team made us feel very welcome and at home. Romeo was engaging and informative. Everyone wanted us to have a wonderful evening, they succeeded. The food was delicious. We (4) had different Ottoman specials, they were all excellent. I would highly recommend a visit, you will not be disappointed. We had two bottles of red wine from Cappadocia, both were delicious.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Shopping Fanatic;Beach Goer
review: The best restaurant in the old city next to Gulhane park. Atmosphere and service are perfect. Definitely to be recommended

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Great Turkish food, fantastic service and friendly staff. Located close to the sultanamet area it is perfect if you are visiting or your hotel is near by. Prices are reasonable and kitchen opened all day  Fantastic I veritable menjar turc, servei genial i personal molt amable. Situat a prop de la zona de sultanamet, és perfecte si esteu de visita o el vostre hotel és a prop. Els preus són raonables i la cuina oberta tot el dia

review_title: A chill and friendly cafe' for all.
review: A cozy and comfortable cafe' with great guys, namely Dagistan and Moses(managers), running a spot easy to visit regularly when in the area. I stayed nearby with my daughter, and tended to drop by either day or night. Seating indoors and out, with friendly regulars, good food and a great location. I ate a great stuffed-chicken here, and my daughter had a shrimp dish once, an a lamb kebab. And she loved the fresh hummus and lemonade. I enjoyed dropping by in late evenings for rehydration and conversation with Dagistan. If you come earlier in the day you'll have Moses as you host. The guys can also ensure 'honest and fair' taxis from there. A nice place with nice people. I look forward to spending time here my next visit.

user_tags: Like a Local;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: Amazing experience. There you can find typical Turkish food but more important, the owner Cia is a really nice guy. Do not miss this place if you are nearby. 5 stars
After seeing the reviews we decided to pop in, we were not disappointed the meal and wine were very reasonable,but 120tl for a beer was too much.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Excellent and low cost restaurant in Istanbul with great service!
review: Highly recommended to go here and get authentic Turkish food at a low cost and very friendly service. It's pretty close to the Sultanahmet district too. Highly recommended.

Price is about average for the area (250-350 TKL per person), the food was good (though some cuts of meat on our mixed grill were overcooked). Very good service and a 'family' run atmosphere. Some bread, dips, and a baklava were complimentary.

Went there after reading all the great reviews on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed at all. Could not get a table outside so settled on one of the inside tables , cozy but just a bit cramped , but not complaining. We ordered two platters , one with assorted dips including humus and the second one of assorted grilled Kababs , both were extremely delicious , well cooked , generous portions and accompanied by all the bread we wanted , more than enough for the three of us .I had a glass of the sweet smelling and flavorful Raki with my meal. We were treated to some flavoured Pomegranate tea and nicely chilled slices of watermelon , free of cost , with compliments from the management. A wonderful ending to a delicious meal. Not to forget the warm hospitality and friendly nature of all the staff and owners there. Absolutely loved the experience and will highly recommend.

user_tags: Vegetarian;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Amazing service and local food in the city Center.Reasonably priced dishes and good portions. We enjoyed our dinner there and everyone was really nice and kind. Also music is on point, had a lot of fun .

I had the Testi Kebab, a casserole cooked in a clay pot in flames right in front of your eyes, and then cracked open straight on to your plate. The presentation was a show in itself and the final product was delicious. Horoon was an attentive host without being overbearing. We also finished the evening puffing on the Shisha, a relaxing end to a very enjoyable evening.

Food was excellent. Loved the dessert. Very professional and friendly staff. I would highly recommend this restaurant, We had a lunch there today with family and enjoyed it very much, meal is awesome, especially the Dorado fish, chicken curry with baked potatoes. Additionally they gave us a salad and the sweetest baklava with Turkish tea as a gift!! I have never tried this kind of Turkish tea, indeed it was prepared very professionally! Teşekkürler!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I did a lot of research where to dine in Sultanahmet with a great view and finally chose this one. Now, after being there I'm positive it's the best place. Imagine dining on the terrace with Hagia Sophia just across you, at the same level, so you see its entire beauty. The restaurant is on the top floor of a building just across the famous Basilica cistern with direct views of Hagia Sophia. Although such places typically lack in service and food quality, I can assure you that service was great - very kind and fast and food was excellent. We took an array of Turkish starters and beef steak for a main. All were great, and entire bill along with drinks came around 60 Euros for two which I find quite reasonable. Place to recommend for a long lasting memory. TIP: make a reservation beforehand for outside seating by the fence.

We eat breakfast every day for an entire week at this restaurant because we stay in And Hotel wich is behind the restaurant. Great food, very polite and nice stuff (many, many thanks to Űrkűș, Sercan and Hatice). From any table of this restaurant you can see Hagia Sofia, Golden Horne and Blue Moskee). Food is very tasty and you can choose from local or international. I recommend it!
Nice place and good one for 360° vie of Istanbul. Thanks to Noza for amazing service. She was friendly and always smiling

After a walk through AyaSofia we found this wonderful restaurant with a crazy servant supernice man down belowUp we go in an elevator and been showed to a place at the terrass, wow! And then came Huseyin Yeldan, the nicest best servant man on this side of IstanbulThe food was perfect cooked, the menue were so nice, so much to chooseWe were four people and each and everyone were so pleasedThank you 360 Panorama

After a long day touring the local sights in Istanbul, decided to dine at the “360 Panorama Restaurant”...a stone’s throw from the Hagia Sophia Museum and Blue Mosque. What a spectacular find! The views at sunset were breathtaking. The food: excellent! Try the lamb (tender and well spiced) and (grilled) Halloumi cheese salad for a succulent entree. Plenty of outdoor seating on a quiet roof top terrace 6 floors above the Main Street. Service: attentive and professional...never pushy. We dined here twice and loved it! This is a must try for dinner at sunset or a coffee/tea in the late afternoon.

We first visited this restaurant for lunch the day we arrived in Istanbul and were overcome with the beautiful rooftop views! When we visited at night time, they were even better! There is a lovely warm atmosphere here, the kindness of the staff here almost outweighs the deliciousness of the food! We were disappointed that we had already booked our tours for Istanbul before we met the waiter/manager Murat.. With his knowledge and excitement for Istanbul, he gave us a great itinerary for the weekend.
It's in sultanahmet area almost next to bacillica cistern. It's on the top floor of the hotel. The view from the top is very good particularly at sunset. Worth going once.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: When we were standing in the line to buy a ticket for the Basilica Cistern, we noticed that probably uninterrupted view from that rooftop restaurant. We’ll have our last lunch there -we decided ( It sounded better than the “Last Supper”)so today after the Islamic Art Museum, our next and final stop was that restaurant. Since we were the only guests that time, it wasn’t hard to get the desired table, and after a few drinks, we started to feel human again. The waitress was very accommodating, and at my second Tonic water, she automatically put the three ice cubes into it. Feeling resurrected, I picked up my camera and started to take photos. The Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosques were so close that we were nearly able to touch them. My partner ordered Spaghetti Bolognese, and I Chicken with Mushroom sauce. Both of us found our food tasty, but my chicken just missed that magic touch, that makes a dish delightful. All in all, it is hard not to give this restaurant the five but I would prefer the 4.5 because of the quality of the food. Nevertheless, the extraordinary 5,5 service with the view makes it five altogether. The location of the restaurant is also excellent since it is a very short walking distance away from the most attractive sites in Istanbul. Price-wise it is somewhere in the middle, other places without that stunning view charge the same price. If you want to see the Golden Horn from above, this restaurant recommended.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We understand this restaurant is under new management - well they're certainly getting off to a good start. Service was excellent - food superb and the view.... well.... just wonderful. We were only in the city for 3 nights and discovered this place on the last night. If we'd have found it on the first then it would have been very hard not to eat there every evening as it was all just so very special.  Go and check it out - it's fantastic :)

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The restaurant is on the top floor, incredible 360 view on old town, Bosphore and suburbs! The food was also excellent! 2 minutes from ayasofia! Very nice adress’

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: No way to improve upon this dining experience
review: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our meal...we had drinks, shared a salad and entrees for 200 TL...about 50 Canadian dollars. We chose 'Ottoman' food....delicious. We were going to eat half then trade but neither of us wanted to give up what we had ordered. The shepherd's salad was huge, fresh and very good. The ambience was perfect...we dined indoors...candles...little 'stars' in the ceiling...wonderful views particularly of the bridge, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Background music was varied and non-annoying. The waitstaff were professional yet friendly and helpful. We walked upstairs to the rooftop afterwards. Just loved it here.

review_title: Great location and service, wonderful views
review: This was an awesome restaurant, very nice service and the views of the city are superb. Nice food, really nice to chill out on the rooftop here for a few hours.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Amazing view, great food and not expensive! The waiters were kind and helpful. Great experience! I recommend to everybody :)

It was a lovely sunny day and we needed a quick lunch, with beer. On the top floor everyone was sitting outside enjoying the weather and the view. We had 2 soups a portion of humas and 2 beers. They were here within a few minutes and we spent a good half hour resting. They extra that they put on the bill is a 10% service charge, which I never agree with because you the customer decides on a tip or service charge. I didn’t mind but if you think the service is rubbish you tell them

review_title: This restaurant must have one of the best views in the world and good food to match
review: I can't tell you how impressed we were by this restaurant. The views over the Bosphorus and the Golden Horne were breathtaking. The staff were helpful and the food good and not expensive. The menu is typically Turkish. Highly recommended.

review_title: Go here even if just for the views!
review: Great views over Istanbul over a wonderful cup of Turkish tea - who could ask for anything better? We visited on a warm day in October and enjoyed an excellent cup of tea and the beautiful views together - what a treat!

The view is the selling point of this place, and has therefore also found its way into other forums, including the Lonely Planet brief guide to Istanbul. The restaurant itself is also rather pleasant, and service is competent and good. I found the food to be absolutely average however. While perfectly acceptable, and a good place for a chat over dinner as the sun goes down over this fantastic city, one may be forgiven for not being too picky about the food. Based on a single experience I would reserve my judgement on the gastronomic quality of the place, and I would certainly recommend drinks and snacks here. But dinner was not one that I found remarkable.

We were taken to this restaurant by our tour director. The facility is very nice with a 360 degree panoramic view of the city. You have spectacular view of the Blue Mosque and Isa Sophia. Our menu was fixed. We had a lovely Mezza dish which had some nice spice. Salad was tasty with a fruit dressing. Our main course was a chicken dish with rice. It was pretty plain and not much flavor after the delicious spice.

review_title: Great views and very close to the Aya Sofia for a cheeky spot of lunch
review: We stopped here for a spot of lunch and refreshments. Its on the top floor of the hotel. A very polite man in a panama hat( on the main street) takes you through reception to the lift. Views are 360 degrees, Europe, Asia all the key sights, inside and outside seating.  Beers reasonable for location, we had a selection of starters, mezze was our favourite along with what i think was call a village horn.  Only other English people we came across in our 4 day trip sat on the terrace behind us.......non other than Charlie Ross, off the BBC. Obviously being English we feigned indifference and allowed him to enjoy his meal in private.

My partner and I went for a drink on the rooftop terrace, after reading about the great view in our Lonely Planet guide book. We only had a drink, so I can't comment on the food but the view was fantastic, particularly at sunset; view of the Bosphorus, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Irene, Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Very accommodating staff.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: The street tout was 100% correct for a first time. You enter through the Hotel Lobby in a rickety old lift/elevator to a fabulous view and a pleasant indoor or terrace sitting. The view overlooks the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topaki Palace & views over the Horn to the City and was reasonably priced , no tourist rip off or gouging !! The staff were very friendly & attentive , well worth the stop !

We ate here with a group - preordered menu. Each dish was excellent, from soup to desert. And the view from the dining room was fabulous, as you can see from the pictures. Don't hesitate to stop in here if you have the opportunity.

review_title: Views are amazing, food was nothing special
review: We also ate here on our last night in Istanbul having had some great meals (and views) in our 5 night stay. The view here is stunning, overlooking pretty much all of Istanbul - panoramic views! We hadn't booked, but got a table on the terrace looking out over hagia Sophia museum. Waiters were efficient but took time to take our order as were having pictures taken with a group of Australian ladies! The food was good, we both had lamb and it was cooked really well , but nothing spectacular in terms of service or presentation of the food. We also tried a mojito - probably one of the worst I've tasted! I'd recommend for the views alone!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We had lunch here on our last day in Istanbul and a great choice it was. Great food, friendly service and amazing views, certainly worth a visit

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: The view is great, nearly 360' around Istanbul. There are quite a few seats outside and much more inside. The food is ok. Had a beef stew which didn't come with any rice or potato but they kept a steady supply of bread coming. Not cheap.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: The best place to eat in Istanbul
review: We had dinner at August 2015, i could say this was one of the best dinners I've had in my hole life! I had "Mandi" it was delicious, my mom had meat filet with smashed potato, which was really delicious as she said, the incredients had very good quality, (meat, olive oil, butter, fresh vegetables) this was far away from a turistic place even though it was in the centre of the old town. The view was MAGNIFICENT, we could view Haya Sofia and Blue Mosque as we dined, so romantic and have the feeling and smell of Istanbul. I would strongly recomment, and i will definetly visit again!

review_title: What a way to end a trip!
review: Great food and local beers plus stunning views at dusk to early evening - and the wait-staff weren't bad either! :p
A good restaurant in a turistic zone with a panoramic view in Blue Mosque and Bosphorus. We took turkish hummus and seabass.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Great views - but that's about it!
review: Terrific views over Istanbul from this panoramic restaurant, good service, extensive menu and wine list … however, the food itself is indifferent in the extreme and the final bill astronomic. Poor value for money. You have been warned!

review_title: Good food with a great view!!
review: The entrance was a bit weird, but it didn't really bother us. We had a really nice table at the rooftop terrace. The view was stunning! You can see the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque, beautiful! The staff was friendly and proffesional. The food was good as well, a bit pricey..

review_title: A great place to be and to have a great view of Sultanahmet
review: A normal tourist looks on his level to find a cafe but if you have a great tour guide like us he would take you to a place which is hidden. We had only some coffee and did not eat because it was too early to have lunch but we had the pleasure to enjoy one of the most beautiful view of Istanbul. Maybe we will try this restaurant again for dinner to see Istanbul by night.

review_title: Outstanding views of a stunning city
review: The view from this restaurant is absolutely fantastic.  My husband had beef kebab, but it wasn't anything like a kebab he expected and I had a halloumi salad, but they call it something else in Turkey! I  The food was good and the waiters were friendly and helpful.  Toilets were clean.

After a fair amount of stomping around the Old Town, some lunchtime food was necessary, so I followed Lonely Planet's suggestion of this place, for it's views as much as anything else.  It's just a few minutes walk away from the Basilica Cistern and the Hippodrome and accessed through the And Hotel lobby.  When I arrived, there was nobody else in the restaurant, so the service was rapid and attentive. However, the dish I picked from the menu was off and I was steered towards one of the specials instead.  When this arrived, it was fine - a lamb dish - but I didn't much like the bed of sauce and vegetables it was on - but this is probably my problem as I'm not a big fan of vegetables!  The cost was fair and the staff were lovely - but the real draw for this place is the excellent panoramic views it offers.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Best views in town, hands down
review: My wife and I decided to try this place out for lunch, as we had heard it could get busy for dinner. Our first impression when we arrived on the top floor was: wooooooow! What a view!  You get a perfect view of the blue mosque and hagia sophia from their outdoor patio. It is simply stunning.  But enough with the view, we're here to eat after all! And eat we did. This place has traditional Ottoman palace cuisine, which is simply decadent. We had lamb stuffed with pine nuts and raw almonds, which was so tender and tasty. We also had slow-cooked lamb wrapped in eggplant, which was melt-in-your-mouth good.  We were two very satisfied travelling Canadian foodies that afternoon!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: THIS is the Place with The View
review: Stayed at the hotel (And Hotel) that is on the lower floors of this restaurant. Frequented the restaurant often whilst staying in Istanbul. The view from the top of this place is truly addictive. Was taken great care of by my friend Özgür who provided great conversation while having drinks. The food was fast and tasted professional and wonderful. Chose different dishes every time. This is THE PLACE to dine when in Istanbul, Turkey.  Highly recommend this restaurant. Ask for: Özgür Aldım

Ambience, nice. Staff, very friendly. Toilet, clean.  Ordered a pottery kebab. Staff undoubtedly put on a great show, big fire. Wow!!! We were impressed. The food inside? Not nice. Mainly visited by tourists who should try other genuine Pottery kebab (that needs to be cooked inside for several hours, therefore need advanced order). We tried it in Cappadocia, we had to order it at least 3hr in advance. It was yummy.  Had lamb shank, it was hard. Even the knife couldn’t cut thru the meat.  Did we enjoy it? No. Do we recommend it? No.  It was very pricey too (for the quality of the food they served).

We decided to try this restaurant on our second night in Istanbul and ended up going every night. The staff are so welcoming and the restaurant is so clean. The first night I ordered the Moussaka and it was amazing, it was sizzling when it arrived and boiling hot. The second night we tried the pot kebab and wow what an experience and what an amazing aroma of taste. Tonight the food was again amazing. The meal includes a lentil soup with bread and Turkish tea and Baklava. This is a brilliant restaurant and is extremely good value.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: So good we ate here twice on four night stay, great service and so friendly,food was really good with a great choice and some stuff you dont see in all the rest of the restaurants, good atmosphere and really highly recommend will definetly come back when in Istanbul and tell anyone else visiting to come you won't be disappointed.whole team is great and are very multilingual between them, they also put up with my attempts at Turkish.
We went because of the good reviews. It was actually quite ordinary although a nice location in the city.

After a long journey and 2 hour taxi journey from the airport we arrived in Istanbul tired and hungry. We found this restaurant just over the road from our hotel and it was a great find. The staff really looked after us and made us feel very welcome. The food was very good, we had the pottery dish and the service of it was entertaining. Very tasty and well cooked. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a visit,

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover
review: Delicious food in a friendly traditional atmosphere. We selected a variety of meat and kebab as well as the fancy served traditional meal which was very tasteful. Everything perfect.
Amazing. Great service. Everyone enjoyed their food. Good wine. Very welcoming and friendly. If you are in the area, go!
Absolutely delicious Turkish food. I come several times a year to Istanbul and Ankara and I can confirm the food absolutely outstanding.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: We stopped here for quick lunch before our flight. The restaurant was almost empty and the guy who greeted us proposed to eat breakfast (which looks superb in menu). We ordered 2 iskender kebabs and local beers. Food was very tasty but it was pretty cold. I don’t know why, maybe because they were focused on serving breakfasts. However very nice thing was free of charge and unlimited Turkish tea. Very good btw. Waitress was friendly. Food wasn’t so expensive which we were afraid, I can even say it was really affordable. I will go back there for dinner during my next visit in Istanbul.

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: The food is great but what really makes this this place is the incredible staff and the warm welcome. My husband and I visited last week- once for dinner and the next night just for a drink- before going off to Baku for a week. When we returned tonight, we were welcomed like old friends. It’s terrific. Highly recommended.

zojuist NIEUW Hi..i have been yesterday for the first time..WAUW ...what a great service the guys give me..I liked the Nargile and the Food..When you are in Istanbul please come te here to enjoy your holiday..i will be back guys..thank you for everything

review_title: Outstanding traditional Turkish cuisine and good value
review: We chose this restaurant from the TA reviews we were not disappointed. We didnt reserve and were lucky to get a table as the restaurant is small and was full shortly thereafter The food is excellent, particularly the mixed meze starters and the Anatolian chicken casserole which is served dramatically in a heated fire tableside. Very friendly owners. Would highly recommend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Come for the Testi Clay! Delicious meal near Little Hagia Sophia
review: Perfect side street restaurant by Little Hagia Sophia, lovely friendly staff and delicious food. Highly recommend the Testi Clay mains, such a delicious meal and well cooked. Lamb chops also excellent.
Food was soooooo tasty! And they made a show with fire .. Service is amazing since it’s a family restaurant. They gave us free baklava which was the tastiest. Thanks a lot! Definitely recommended...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Nightlife Seeker
review: Fantastic food and service. Very kind staff. I really recommend Testi Kebab of this place. Tea and baklava to finish your dinner are just yummy

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Cosy restaurant and very nice service and staff! The choice was not so many and some was sold out ! The quality is good but the portions a bit small ! We were satisfied

We went for the lunch in this restaurant! We had a great time, the owner is so nice ! He take care of us, the lunch was perfect! Thank you so much for having us, we really enjoyed our moment with you !!!!!  From the French nice couple

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We have visited twice this restaurant during our stay in Istanbul and we really admired it. The food was great and staff friendly. We tried different kebab and appetizer, everything was delicious. Thank you! :)

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: One of the best place to eat in the center
review: Место прекрасное! Еда вкусная (для Турции), большие порции, приемлимые цены, приятный и ненавязчивый сервис! Нас угостили чаем, десертом (Турецкая пахлава), закуски в комплимент. Место непроходное, поэтому тихо. Best place to eat in the center. Big portions, delicious, welcoming and warm service. Some complements from restaurant such as Turkish tea or coffe and some sweets or fruits.  Thank you! We will definitely come again.

Great hospitality. Children were treated like royalty here. We had the mixed grill and it came with lentil soup to start and baklava for dessert. The staff made the kids lemonade for free. We had it to ourselves off season.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Great place to enjoy authentic Turkish food
review: We decided to have dinner here after a 20km trek accross the sights of Istanbul. The food was amazing and the bakhlava was the best I have tasted so far. The service was perfect!

Probably the best views in Istanbul.  Drinks are not that pricey for the kind of amazing place that it is. Best place for some well earned Sundowners.  I must mention Mohammaed who was very attentive and made his effort to make good our most requests. Now that’s what you call good service.  The DJ plays a good relaxed mix early evening then sets the groove as night sets in  Must visit if you are in Istanbul

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Worth visiting the top floor of intercontinental as you can enjoy amazing views of Istanbul while enjoying a very nice cocktail !

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Gorgeous views and great entertainment make for a lovely night
review: We had drinks here after dinner and the entertainment was lively and very good. The team is attentive and helpful and the views of the city and the Bosphorus are stunning as the bar sits on the top floor of this luxury five star hotel. Great night had by all and fun.
Must visit place in İstanbul. Charming bosphorus view with great staff. Give it a try. You will not be disappoınted.
we spent a lovely comfortably cold evening in this bar. The waiters were very helpful. the local food served was excellent.
This restaurant provide the best panoramic view to istanbul from the top of intercontinental hotel. They served also the best delicious deserts i have ever taste in Turkey.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Nature Lover
review: Spectacular views. Delicious drinks. Friendly staff. Bartender Hakan very approachable. Mini shish kebabs very tasty. A bird's eye view of Istanbul venue.

Located on the top floor of the Intercontinental Hotel, the restaurant has a wonderful view over the sprawling city of istanbul. The service is attentive but not obtrusive, timely but not rushed. The menu is predominantly traditional Turkish fayre - I had the fish soup and lamp kebab which was served on a bed of rice with steamed spinach. The food was well presented and full of flavour with adequate portion size. With a bottle of water and service it came to just over £30 which I felt was good value.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: If you go to a restaurant atop the Intercontinental, you won't get off cheap, but you probably already know that. This restaurant has excellent service and very good food, along with the fantastic views. Don't expect bargains, and you'll be happier. An excellent place for a special occasion!

the bar is amazing I could have spent all day there, sitting taking in the stunning views from the Bosphorus and the rest of Taksim and the surrounding city. Very comfortable and relaxing. I didnt eat there but after looking at the menu it looks like you'd have some brilliant options if you were.

review_title: Worth it once for the view
review: Fabulous views from the rooftop bar, the drinks were rather pricey but that's what you would expect?

We were given complimentary mezes and bread to start. Service was attentive. We ordered a kofte and an Adana kebab with a Greek salad and garlic bread. Both the meat courses were delicious. Unfortunately we could not sample the desserts as we had too much to eat. The complimentary apple tea after the meal was a godsend. Recommended for good honest cooking.

We had two dinner here during our stay in December, one was not enough. You can book easily a table with Google or Trip, staff is welcoming and friendly and food is really really good at a nice price, we couldn’t ask for more. Was really a nice discover to taste local specialities in a very nice location. I definitely suggest this to all families,we hope to come back.

Definitely the best restaurant in the area. and it's not just the food that's very good, it's the whole experience here. The very good atmosphere, the staff, the whole team, do everything to make all the clients feel very good. Congratulations.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review: While visiting Istanbul, my wife and myself read reviews about this particular restaurant..  And have to say, we absolutely loved our culinary experience here..  We couldn't get a table booked online, so had to find our way to the restaurant and just hope we could get a table..  On arrival it was busy, and it was mostly local people eating here, not many tourists at time of our visit..  Very warm welcome from front of house and it's a warm, genuine greeting..  Absolutely NO ALCOHOLIC beverages served here, so if you want alcohol with your meal, then sorry, this isn't right place for you..  But if you want an authentic ambience, great welcome and really genuine Turkish food, then you'll enjoy eating here...  Not easy to find as it's slightly off the main area of tourist haunts..  One app that will help guide you through the streets to find this restaurant, put MAPS.ME on your phone...  No Internet requirement, as it uses GPS signal..  From Hagia Sofia Square, follow up the hill where the Trams go, find Burger King.. Turn left so BK is on your right... Follow this road down to a junction in the road.. The old Cistern is on left of junction..  There's a small road sharp right, don't take that road.. Take next right.. Follow down, to fork in road.. Keep left, keep walking and Restaurant comes up on your right...

Five of us were very happy with our meal here. The menu is extensive, the food was consistently excellent and the service was friendly. Though not cheap by Istanbul standards, at $80 for five people, it was ludicrously affordable by Western standards. Added bonus: friendly cats climbing through the window.
Have travelled to more than 30 countries and never have I ever eaten at the same restaurant 3 consecutive days - that’s how good this food is. I don’t think anything more needs to be said.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff
review: We had a very pleasant dinner at Mivan. The service was very friendly and attentive, the Turkish food delicious. Not the cheapest restaurant in Istanbul but it's definitely good value for the money.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Excellent restaurant in Sultanahmet area, which is not always easy to say. Specialized in grilled meats, the menu offers a large amount of options including grilled vegetable options for non-meat eaters. Service was very friendly and efficient. Should be noted that there is no alcohol at this restaurant. Also, highly recommend a reservation as it was very busy and while they tried to accommodate all comers, it was not possible.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Thrifty Traveler
review: If you want a break from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul, as well as the touts hounding you to come eat at their establishments,then this is the place to go. The atmosphere is soothing, the staff friendly and extremely professional, and the food... A delight! Good value for money - portion sizes are big and they also offer complimentary breads, dips and tea or coffee at the end of the meal. Their menu is varied and extensive. Would definitely come back back!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Beach Goer;Thrifty Traveler
review: The food was nice and service was prompt although the waiters are overly friendly to female diners. Just be careful to double check your bill as we overheard a few tables who had been charged for the free bread, baklava and tea.

What a wonderful restaurant, food is delicious but for us it was the service from meeting Mustafa outside we felt so welcome into this lovely place. We had a wonderful evening chatting to the owner Ismail, what a genuine lovely man, we are hoping to return for our last meal in Istanbul. Clearly this new restaurant is going to be a jewel in the Crown of sultanahamet, you will not be disappointed, favourite for us in Istanbul.

review_title: Dinner worthy of being our last in Turkiye
review: We chose this place for dinner as it was like 3-min walk from our hotel, and that it was highly rated on TA. We also preferred to go to a more special place, as opposed to a 'sidewalk' restaurant as had been the case for most of our trip. We deliberated between the tasting menu and ala carte, and in the end, went for the latter. We chose: 1. Tomato salad with goat cheese and walnut (probably the best salad we had ever had) 2. 'Pide' with beef ribs (so so yummy!) 3. Lamb skewers 4. Hand minced kebabs We were seated on Level 2 of the restaurant and even then, the service was pretty good. Highly recommend for a special night out.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I took my colleagues to RikaRoof for a nice diner. I had been there before, so knew what a great place it was. The menu is divers, with great appetizers, main courses and delicious desserts. Our waiters Baris and Ozgur provided excellent, friendly service. We enjoyed the sunset and view over old Istanbul so much! We'll be back in Istanbul in June and for sure pay Rika a visit again.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Beautiful place! With a beautiful view and great drinks!! The service is great and the staff is very friendly... always ask for Ercan!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Very good restaurant. The food is perfect and very fresh. Wonderful staff. Many typical Turkish dishes. Perfect atmosphere.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: Turkish cuisine is a cozy and homy restaurant. The owners and staff are friendly and funny. The food is authentic and delicious. It was a nice experience.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: A must if you're in the area
review: After spending a few days in Istanbul the restaurants can start to feel a bit similar - both in terms of menu and atmosphere. However Garden Mezze felt like a bit more of 'an occasion' compared to some of the other tourist focused places in the area. It is probably a little more expensive than some others - but not by a great degree and the setting, atmosphere, service, and food meant we didn't mind.

Nothing wrong here, but we found the food and extras very average compared to the very above average price.  Very nice outdoor dining area and good service though - if the prices were in line with the other restaurants in the area it'd be a 4 or 5 stars.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: This restaurant is my new favorite restaurant in Istanbul. Excellent Food and service. Sermat, Ersil and Murat are exceptionally friendly, professional and caring.
Location is very good, food average, personnal coud do better. Oberall a good experience. The location , like I said is a good place to stay.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Very good. Perfect service. Very nice staff. Food was delicious and very fresh. Nice service and atmosphere. Perfect wine

user_tags: History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Tastiest food we had in Turkey
review: Great food, nice experience, the place is worth of the 1st place in rating) Try stuffed calmar and baked meat with fruits

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Amazing food amazing service amazing ambience great staff ,I was served by Jino and he made sure that my experience was amazing Great team thank you keep it up !!

The restaurant is located in a charming garden. On the first night we went, there was live music which gave a very special atmosphere to the place. The food is really good for quite a reasonable price, and the service is really amazing, the staff is very attentive and considerate. We loved it so much that we went back on our last night in Istanbul! Would highly recommend. Thanks a lot Ahmet for your kindness :)
The mixed grill and the adana kebab were OK though the chicken breast was dry and tough. Pleasant enough but underwhelming as a whole. Could have been better if I had lessen my expectations.

review_title: Authentic Turkish food off the beaten path
review: Massa Bistro Cafe & Restaurant is tucked away in an alley off of Dr. Eminpasa St. about 400m from Hagia Sophia. It is worth the extra effort to find, secluded from tourist hordes. I enjoyed dining in a quite & relaxing atmosphere after a long day of touring Istanbul. The owner greeted me, the staff was attentive, and explained menu choices. I ordered a grilled veggie plate, with eggplant, zucchini, tomatoes, pepper and onions. It came with french fries, rice and yogurt. Everything was freshly prepared, served hot, and perfectly spiced. Although the bistro has a bar, I did not order any alcoholic beverages, preferring to Turkish tea. Portions were generous, and prices were reasonable.
Nica atmosphere, clean and organized, friendly and outgoing staff! Food is really good. Don’t miss the hummus ! I will come back! Good service and value for money!

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Amazing delicious food in the heart of old Istanbul. Great service dinned here after a long day of sightseeing and were amazed the food was very tasty and cooked to perfection. Recommend it

review_title: Very friendly service and good food
review: We visited Istanbul for a week at Easter. This restaurant is in a nice backstreet among many other restaurants. It has a good menu, the staff are very pleasent and the atmosphere lively. We ate outside. I would recommend

I had a very nice breakfast there and the service was impeccable. I had an oatmeal with fresh fruits for 4.5 euros and egg Benedict for 11 euros. A big basket of bread and the still water I had were free of charge! For these service and this quality of food the price was fantastic! I highly recommend to everybody and I will definitely be back! They offer also a nice breakfast buffet for 30 euros per person!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Best place in Istanbul for Azerbaijani cuisine and staff is very friendly. I especially loved Azerbaijani kebabs and interior design. Fantastic place for families

I ate here and liked it so much that had to come again in a few days - and I was NOT even staying at the hotel.  Location and views are beautiful!  Food is delicious. Staff is super great and helpful. Hasan Bey, the manager, is just awesome! And the head chef comes out at least once during the dinner and has a chat with you. And his attire - well kept, ironed, clean. You KNOW the person respects his job.  Everything is great! From salads, to kebabs, to pilafs (PLOV). Anyone in Istanbul - I would definitely recommend visiting.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Reservation, service and location is top for a good high level dining ! We went for pomegranate salad sherbet and Shah pilaff! It was amazing and tasty and 110% worth ! The chief coming personally to ask about quality ! We would book again for a nice dinner anytime

user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker;Beach Goer
review: A spectacular restaurant with great flavours! Tasty and balanced menu for demanding mouths. Outstanding Azerbaijani Cuisine at its best ! Staff members were quite helpful in guiding our choices to dishes. Luxury Azerbaijani dinner without having to pay a fortune. The Food is Halal in case If you care about. We would all highly recommend the restaurant.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Located in Ajwa hotel this culinary gem offers Azerbaijan food that is simply amazing. For someone who doesn’t know anything about Azerbaijan cuisine this was a true treat. Cheese selection is work of art and a must, followed with buffet that will put any Las Vegas hotel to shame. I would recommend all of it. Try and be courageous, you will not be disappointed!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: This restaurant, like the hotel it's in, is exquisitely exotic! Elegant, with a breathtaking view of Marmara Sea, Zeferan Restaurant was just the perfect place welcoming us with its soothing, subdued atmosphere, exactly what we craved for after a long flight from Edinburgh. Specializing in Azerbaijani cuisine, my hubby and I were quite excited to sample their fare. Everything was excellently cooked and beautifully presented. Service was first-rate. Like the rest of the hotel staff, the restaurant staff aimed to please. Simply wonderful! I urge anyone to try it.
Excellent view Went for dinner. Lunch would have been even better (view) The complimentary sherbets and Mezze were unique and superb. The special pilaf rice was mouth watering. Highly reccomend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This beautiful place is located on the last floor of Ajwa hotel, so you get an amazing view of the Bosphorus. The staff is very professional and the menu is quite big. We ordered two starters two mains and one dessert. First of all, the presentation of the food is very beautiful, and the portions are quite generose. It was my first Azerbaijani cuisine expirionse, it is very different from European cuisine, they use a lot of nuts a specially walnut and dry fruits. However I hope it won't be the last one. I really enjoied our meal. It was interesting and my taste bud were very happy to try something new. Another place I would love to come back in our next Istanbul trip.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We enjoyed pre dinner drinks here to celebrate my wife’s birthday. On the 14th floor of the Conrad hotel, the views are panoramic & stunning. Drinks & service were also very good.

review_title: Great customer service and fantastic views
review: Wonderful views across the Bosphorus to the old city, Maidens Tower and the Asian side. Super service from Okan, very amiable and happy to share his knowledge of local wines - great recommendations, thank you.

user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: fantastic views, service and food! Highly recommend - get there early to get the best seats for the sunset.
We had a late drink with a friend, and I was stunned by the view to the city! The wine list, service, food were amazing.

review_title: Could have been so much better.
review: lovely venue well appointed dinning area plus garden setting, but wine list was all over 50$/ bottle and house wine was expensive for what you got, worst of it for us was our small entre "shrimp casserole" didn't appear till well after we would have enjoyed it. I think our order was missed and we ended up with a salad and a long wait...had they both came together it would have been fine.

Buffet restaurant is always crowded, especially on weekends. There are quite a few delicious dishes. However, seafood should only be used Sushi, Sashimi, and other seafood such as fish, shrimp or crab are not fresh. The desserts and ice cream were both quite tasty. The juice has a wide selection and good quality. The staff are very enthusiastic. Reservations should be made in advance.

This is absolutely the best buffet I've ever had the pleasure of indulging in. Staff is well-trained and helpful, nice ambiance - especially for a buffet restaurant - and the food, OMG, is amazing. I mean, all-you-can-eat lobster, abalone, crab. tuna, salmon, a carving station that excels, a great assortment of salads, and a dessert section that just won't stop.  This is where we go for special occasions. Unfortunately, there just aren't as many of them as I'd like or I'd be here every day.  No need to look further; if you want a fantastic dining experience, this is a great choice. It's about a 25-minute ride from the Old Quarter.

We had an excellent dinner at this restaurant. Blair (Phuc) and Nat were extremely helpful and friendly. Blair gave excellent recommendations for our order. We had Aubergine in clay pot which was a curry with steamed rice. We also had curry vegetable with steamed rice. Both the main course dishes were tasty, flavourful and served in an attractive clay pot. For dessert we had passion fruit ice cream which was an excellent presentation in a scooped out passion fruit. Taste too was good. We also had creme brulee which was made perfectly. An excellent meal with great ambience. Will surely recommend visiting this restaurant.

review_title: One of the best restaurants we experienced in Hanoi
review: While we were staying at the excellent LA SIESTA MA MAY boutique hotel at approx. 1,5 km from there, if my memory is correct, we cam to this ESSENCE restaurant for dinner, 3 times during our 2-week stay in Hanoi. Excellent green mango salad for instance. A big thank you to BLAIR who served us on our 3rd visit.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: As we were staying in the Aira Boutique hotel, we had quite a few dinners here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was great. The food was excellent!

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: In early 2020 we had few lunches and dinners at this Essence Restaurant when they were situated at P. Hang Kanh. At that time the menu had many more dishes to choose from. The food was great. That is the reason we come back this restaurant ( at a new location) for our lunch. However sadly to said the dishes was not as good as before. Dishes was abit too oily. Was there any change of chefs? That..... management should know better. The service staffs was great, friendly and helpful with their suggestions. Many thanks to Miss Nat and May who served us well.

We came to Era, because of it’s 5-star rating. What a disaster. Located in a “sexy massage” district old, almost dilapidated place that had not seen repairs for years. Waiters are disorganized and do not remember who ordered what and are slow. Our guy cracked a neck or the beer bottle with opener and still offered it to us and said he will bring a glass. He hesitated to replace the beer. Most importantly - food and drinks. If you order a gin and tonic and they have one type of gin only a place cannot be rated #1 in Hanoi (maybe 1001). My drink was horrible. Mushroom soup was edible. Fried squid had little squid in it. Mostly breading. Very limited menu for #1 place overall. We tried a lot better food here. So far I am very disappointed in Vietnamese cuisine - the menu is the same everywhere - pho or bahn me (sub sandwich).
Really delicious Vietnamese dishes and fabulous service from Anna. I'm going back today for my very last taste of Vietnam before I fly home tomorrow, that's how good it is, trust me 😁

review_title: Wonderful meal on our first night in Vietnam!
review: Food is amazing, best spring rolls I've eaten! House wine is also good! Our waitress Van An was very helpful, attentive and friendly! Were going back for our second visit tonight!!

Had a wonderful lunch here. It was a cultured oasis just beside the chaos of the Old Quarter. Brian was a wonderful server and provided us excellent recommendations. He also helped us plan the rest of our day. It was a delicious meal and even better service. The atmosphere and music were so nice.

A friend had recommend Era Restaurant and it did not disappoint. A fantastic dining experience in Hanoi! The staff were all so attentive and lovely and the food absolutely delicious. I had the beef pho and my friend the fish traditional Hanoi dish. We also tried the eggplant in coconut curry and it was all so delicious. The little appetisers and desserts were a lovely touch. Would definitely recommend for a delicious and not expensive dining experience in Hanoi!

We were at ERA for Dinner and had typical vietnamese dishes. All of them were made delicious and were presented in a beautiful way. The service by An and Lisa was excellent. Both speak very good english. They also let us knew how to eat the different meals. We had a great time there and prices for everything are very reasonable.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: we came here early for dinner and enjoyed the quite place very much. there is a great choice of food and we had a very kind and helpful waitress. all together made it a great dinner. go for the local special Bun Chao, as a suggestion.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: They have a nice variety of foods and their wait staff is so nice. Special thanks to Dale for being so kind. Highly recommend!

We found this place on TripAdvisor and decided to try it. We are definitely very happy we did. The food and the service were excellent. We had one starter, one soup (their pumpkin soup with chicken- the taste was AMAZING!!!) and three main dishes. The duck with 5 spices was our favourite! The restaurant offered an amuse bouche and small dessert. We have payed around 45 US dollars for all our meal&drinks. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!

Despite getting the worst table in the house (we had booked last minute) our dinner experience was excellent. Great service, well prepared & presented food & attractive understated surroundings. We enjoyed the dessert so much we returned for it the next afternoon.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: After looking for some great Vietnamese food we found Era in the old quarter of Hanoi. The restaurant was full even at 830 pm and after a 15min wait we got ourselves a table. The staffs are very polite and welcoming. Generally vietnamese are very kind, polite and helpful. We started with some of the waitress recommendations; spring rolls, Pho with beef, lotus wrapped minced beef and some grilled chicken.  The food came very prompt and with beautiful garnish on the sides. The spring rolls were very fresh, the beef pho was very refreshing and the lotus leaves wrapped beef tasted fantastically.  We ended with some desserts and coffee and we had an overall great experience.  The price and the quality of the food are worthwhile for the wait and the visit.

Went here for a quick bite to eat for lunch and chose this restaurant because of the reviews - we were not disappointed. The service is impeccable and the food very tasty. We ordered Hanoi spring rolls (you must order these - so tasty!), pork skewers and chicken noodles and all were very tasty. Would recommend going here as they also serve an little appetiser and complimentary dessert which was delicious!

review_title: Come here for breakfast and view
review: Had our wonderful breakfast when we stay at Le Jardin Hotel. At the 12 floor, the view was good and service was even better. We were served by Ms Quynh Nguyen especially when we tend to ask for refill of hot water. Highly recommend to have your meal here.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker;Beach Goer
review_title: Very Attentive Staffs, Vegetarian food available
review: Very attentive staffs. Food including vegetarian food was really good. My wife did not like the fish soup, but it may be her personal dislike. Overall, highly recommended to enjoy your food.

review_title: We have enjoyed the food and Phong was a nice guy. The food is delicious.
review: Very good food, nice stuff and definitely we will return here during our trip. Btw, on top there is a terrace that gives the view over the street. Just perfect for 2 or 4, if you get it free.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Must visit when you are in Hanoi!
review: Wonderful food and great serve by Miss Sim! Real Vietnamese food I enjoyed, very popular place you may need the reservation

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Delicious food. Excellent value. Get the Passion Fruit Margarita!
review: Delicious food. Super friendly. The BEST Passion Fruit Margarita I’ve ever had! Lovely atmosphere. Excellent value.

We found Tung’s Kitchen by chance and had not read any reviews beforehand.  The food was amazing but the experience was made so much better due to the wonderful service we received from Phong.  This is a must for anyone visiting Hanoi. You won’t be disappointed and will leave wanting to return.

We had passion fruit Margherita which was very good. We being vegetarian were given great options by Noah the server. Ate vietnamese rolls, veg curry with rice from chef recommended menu and bok choy with mushroom. All the veg dishes were delicious. Finally we ended the meal with Vietnamese coffee with coconut which was really good. Overall an excellent meal and would surely recommend vegetarians to visit this place.

user_tags: Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The food was really delicious and the service was fast. Noah is a really nice person, he was very engaged to offer a nice time. Thank you so much :)

Although we did not have reservations, we were seated on the edge with a sunset and Hoan Kiem Lake view. Lovely way to kick off a night of great food and meandering through the Old Quarter and beyond. While not the highest perch in Hanoi, the proximity to Hoan Kiem Lake makes it one of the best of the half dozen or so sky bars we have visited in Hanoi. The servers were efficient on the busy night we visited with a private party in full swing. And the bartenders made a lovely Dry Manhattan for us that was slightly off menu.
We ate some Hanoi specialities here and everything was so delicious! Generous portions and the service was top notch too. Great meal!

The views are sensational from this lovely sky bar. The staff are very friendly. Music is low enough you can talk easily but still enjoy it. The food is great (nibbles) and the cocktail menu is great. Try the Botanist!

We arrived in happy hour and had a few drinks before ordering food. The menu was very good and I opted for prawns. Very good. We were going to stay longer but the music was turned too loud for us. We have since had a very sincere apology from the owner, apparently it was a new member of staff and I am assured it won’t happen again. I would certainly return and recommend this bar.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Unique cocktails in a wonderful bar.
review: Unfortunately we only just discovered this place on our last night in Hanoi but at least we discovered it then!!  Situated on the top floor of the stylish La Siesta Hang Be Hotel, there are many rooftop bars in the city but we found the cocktails here to be more adventurous than most.  The bar tenders/mixologists have really tried to come up with some unique flavours so as to capture the ‘feel’ of this exciting urban culture.  I tried the ‘Chef Inspired’ and ‘Guaranteed’: both enjoyable and unlike anything I’ve ever tasted before.  The views of Hanoi are spectacular and, on the floor below, is the ‘Cloud Nine’ restaurant which I have reviewed separately and loved. They also, of course, serve all the classics.  I would recommend trying this bar for some unique tastes.
Delicious Banh Mi, including a vegetarian option. Very reasonably priced, and nice to sit on the mezzanine floor watching the world go by below.
Better than ban mi 25. Taste of char siew, ham and the tastes baguette is very good. Would highly recommend and would go back again

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: This restaurant is inside a hotel but there's no hassle going in if you're not staying there. The service and food here were excellent and the views over Hanoi were stunning.

The noodles station was just ok. It was not as tasty as the one in Lotte Saigon. The egg station was good and what we enjoyed most, is the Korean section. It has a make your own bibimbap. This is very different from Lotte Saigon breakfast spread. One thing missing was the juicing counter in Grill 63. In Lotte Saigon, they juice vegetables and fruits upon your request but I don't see it here, though. Eventhough fruits are available and juices were all displayed on the counter. The view from this restaurant is fantastic. Nothing beats a 63 floor view!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We dropped in for lunch mainly because we had not been there before. No need to book as only one other couple in the large restaurant. It looks like it is meant to be classy, situated on 63 floor of the Lotte building. Buffet looked ok but I never eat buffet. Had a Caesar salad by which I judge restaurants at lunchtime. My wife had a smoked salmon salad with pear (unfortunately the tasteless Chinese variety). The Caesar salad came deconstructed! I know this is a fashion but a deconstructed Caesar salad is just stupid. A little pile of Parmesan on the edge of the plate. How are you supposed to pick it up to put on the salad? A single white anchovy (too little) on another side instead of being mixed in the salad. Salad set in a ring of cheese crisp - ok as an idea but better if everything else there as well. The smoked salmon was ok and the bread was good. Dessert menu didn’t interest me - again too arty with poor flavor combinations that don’t mix. The bill took an age to come - longer than the food. So we went to Artisee in the Lotte shopping complex for chocolate cake and coffee to cheer me up.

review_title: Little overpriced but great tasting good
review: Me and my wife went here on our honeymoon as a treat - date night if you will! I had a steak and my wife ordered mushroom risotto. We accompanied this with a starter to share, some sides and a bottle of wine and some water!  Food - was very good. You would expect this from a 5* hotel but the steak was exceptionally cooked and the risotto very tasty although slightly creamy. Wine was very good and matched our food - overall a great evening.  We paid roughly £95 which although I expected from a 5* hotel is very excessive and I think too pricey. I was personally expecting to pay more £70 however a good night, great food and good service - would recommend!

user_tags: Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I have been here for several times and always been treated so well. This is actually one of the highest restaurant in the city with breath-taking view. I do love the romantic atmosphere with the lovely show candles. They also offer very good price compares to other places at same level. Excellent steaks and yummy Mushroom soup are highly recommended. It's better to reserve a table in advance in quiet corner. Also, the staffs are hound but really well-trained.
