Ms Hằng always offer very warm smiles and careful taking care. Thanks to Thien for very good recommendation. Highly recommend this place. Should come in weekdays, not so busy and enjoy your night.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Looks good, great view. Average food..
review: Super view. I was staying at the hotel, came up for a meal.  4 course. Looked good.  Average to poor.  Lots of issues.  Not going to get into it.  Just avoid.  Bhagwan

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Beach Goer
review: I'm a buffet hater and usually very unsatisfied after eating at one. The lunch buffet at Grill 63 was different, maybe the best buffet I've ever had.  A broad selection of Sushi, prepared dishes, freshly grilled (on order) dishes and desserts. All the dishes were hot and the ingredients, especially the meat of very high quality (among the best I had in Hanoi)  Reasonably priced at 500.000 vnd (around 20$).

The Venue: 4/5 Food: 3/5 Service: 3/5 Value: 2/5  When you walk into a brand new 5 Star Hotel, and one which is iconic and a landmark in a city you hold high expectations. Unfortunately Grill 63 fails to deliver on any level of expectations.  Positives: Great space, Fantastic 360 degree views of Hanoi. Decent Rooftop Bar which feels like a copy of Bangkok's Sirocco Rooftop bar, (without the glitz or glam but with the same lofty prices)  Negatives: The produce for a 5 Star Hotel is terrible. (Shame on you F&B Director) you would get better food at your local pub.  The space whilst gorgeous, feels like a marketplace when the buffet is running. It's not helped by the many families that would bring children and let them loose to run around as if it's day care.  The service; well they try. Vietnam isn't going to get on Michelin's map any time soon, but the most simple place to start is service. Basic rules and attentiveness would go a long way. Perhaps the staff are equally distracted from the kids running around and focused on dodging them.  All in all, it doesn't work. There are better choices in Hanoi, close by.  But, the Rooftop Bar is worth a visit for a sunset during summer days.  Global MHA

review_title: Feast more for the eyes than the tastebuds. Hold on to your wallet.
review: Let's get the good stuff out of the way first (I prefer writing positive things): The view is fantastic, as is most of the food presentation. The dining room is very well appointed. Some of the food (the risotto i.e. ) is very flavorful and a culinary delight .. but only some. The lava stone grill items we received looked super pretty, but tasted rather boring. Our waiter had recommended the same sauce to pretty much everything we inquired about. The value-for-money ratio here is .. well .. it is expensive ... this is a place less for foodies, but rather for people wanting to impress business partners or future parents-in-law. The atmosphere can be a tad stiff. What really bugged me was hearing wonderful Jazz music, unfortunately 2 different CDs from 2 different corners of the room (one was Sinatra, that much I could make out). And the last, unforgivable (but fixable) item: The free bread and butter: The butter is served in ugly single serve airline style packets (on a fancy saucer) and the bread rolls appear to be heated in a microwave, they turn to stone after 1 minute. Bottomline, I'll try again as long as someone else is paying for it ;)
Completely wonderful and professional service. Great food also. Thuy Thankyou for your fabulous service and attention.

review_title: Great Food, Great View, Great Service
review: This restaurant gets a highest rating on TripAdvisor for a reason. The menu is fantastic and wonderfully priced. You cannot beat the view. And the service is very good, especially from Huy, the captain. Make sure you try the Vietnamese pancakes: they are delicious!

review_title: One of the nicer restaurants in Old Quarter
review: This is the restaurant of La Siesta Ma May. We had dinner there on our first night. There are a variety of dishes both local and Western. We went with local dishes which were all delicious. The service was excellent and the staff enquired about food allergies. Reasonable selection of cocktails, beer and wine.  Prices were reasonable compared to US, UK and Australia. Would highly recommend one meal here.

This is the second visit, first time was pre COVID. The quality of food has not changed. I chose the Vietnamese menu. Tasty, delicious and authentic flavours. Service was impeccable with an ambience to match.

We stayed four nights in Hanoi and ate at this place twice, it was very good. The service is excellent, the atmosphere is relaxed and the menu is interesting. I would recommend the grilled chicken with lemongrass and the Hanoi grilled fish. Situated on the 8th floor you something of a view of Hanoi. I would definitely go back.

We were here last night. Called in to make a reservation and the team helped us out pretty fast. The table is ready by the time we arrived. Anh Luu were our waitress for the night, she was lovely and very helpful with the ordering and during our meal. She even bought out the special mocktail & a bag of gift for me & my partner.  There’re variety of food’s choices. We got salads for entree and Spaghetti & roasted duck for main course. The duck were a bit over cooked than my preference. However, great experience overall  Huge thanks to Anh Luu & the red bean’s team.

review_title: Great food, beautiful ambiance, exceptional service
review: We only stayed at La Siesta Trendy for two nights and on the first night in Vietnam we had to have the obligatory street food which was great. For the second night, and after a very long day of touring the city, we decided to have dinner at The Red Bean. Greeted by friendly staff at the lift door, we were ushered to an intimate table and offered a menu with a great selection of dishes and drinks including cocktails. For cocktails we had: The Naked Man Pina Colada Both very moorish, so we had seconds at the end of our meal! We would recommend the spring rolls platter which had two fresh rolls, two crispy seafood rolls and two crispy Hanoi pork rolls. This was followed by a beautifully presented steaming bowl of pho. The pho at the restaurant was a delicately flavoured broth with rice noodles and tender beef. It was different to the rustic flavours you’d get from street food vendors and equally as wonderful. Every pho recipe has some hidden secrets and this was evident in the subtlety different flavours. Mango sticky rice wrapped up the evening and the warm coconut flavoured rice with sweet mango was everything that I was expecting and looking forward to trying for the first time. It was a great restaurant choice for our last night in Hanoi and if we are ever here again we will definitely visit.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Family Vacationer
review_title: Excellent food, great service. A stand-out
review: Our family had a yearning for a slightly higher standard of food than we’d had on our two week tour of Vietnam.  We absolutely picked the right place. Mango our server was delightful and helpful (changing our daughter’s appetiser)  We had two tasting menus and two of us went off the full menu. Everything was beautifully presented and tasted good too. Although it was a lot more than we paid anywhere else, at about £20 per head it was just a pleasurable experience.

Love this place and I have had dinner here three times already. There are three reasons to recommend this place: - First, food is top. Both Vietnamese and western options were super yummy. Me and my GF shared the Chef set menu and the Vietnamese set menu. TERRIFIC value. - Second, the place is on the 8th floor of the hotel La Siesta, and takes the whole floor. the views are great, the decor cute and everything is super clean. - Third, Paco is probably the best Maitre I have met in VN. He speaks Vietnamese, English, Spanish and a bit of Chinese. He truly cares about your menu selection, your wine and about your experience in general.

The restaurant is part of Hotel La Siesta Trendy. Located at the top floor the restaurant is excellent with a good view of the city. The staff were super accommodating and professional. It is not a classic Vietnamese restaurant - the dishes are very trendy (may i say "hipster"). The prices are more on the expensive side but still reasonable. If you are staying at the hotel do make sure to check out the breakfast as well - it is excellent!

review_title: Absolutely lovely, service, food and atmosphere exceptional.
review: Thank you very much for such a delicious dinner I experienced in your restaurant on Thursday evening. The Service was both professional and friendly. The Atmosphere was perfect and though I was eating solo I felt extremely comfortable. I will be eating again at the Red Bean Trendy Restaurant ASAP. Once again thank you.
We dined here 3 times during our stay in Hanoi, and I have to say that the food was without doubt the best I have ever eaten in any hotel, amazing food and service.

Had a six course dinning indulgence is the best way i could put this review. Food was amazing, fresh and full of flavor. Thank you Mango for going above and beyond in your service in explaining all the foods and spices of all the dishes that was served.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We could not get a table at our hotel's Gourmet Corner restaurant at Le Siesta Diamond so the staff kindly recommended that we tried the Red Bean restaurant at their sister hotel at Le Siesta Central, a 10 minutes stroll. They made the reservation on our behalf and even escorted us to the restaurant - that is what I called 'good customer service'.  The Red Bean restaurant is situated at the foyer of the hotel and nicely laid out with a small bar. The ambience was good and the staff was attentive.  There is a lot to choose from the Menu, a combination of local Vietnamese and European food. As we have been in Hanoi for a few days and sampled quite a few local dishes, we decided to go for steak. We had tomato Rossini and fried vegetable spring rolls for our starters, followed by a tenderloin steak and a mushroom and aubergine claypot as our main courses. The food was gorgeous and very well presented. The portion size was just right for a fine dining. We had a flambe banana with ice cream and fresh fruit platter for our desserts.  We were not disappointed with the quality of food and service provided by yet another Le Siesta hotel which speaks volume for the Elegance Hotel Group. 3 of the EHG hotels have a Red Bean restaurants.  We were very pleased with our meal and thoroughly enjoyed our meal at the Red Bean and well done Le Siesta Diamond for recommending this restaurant.  Highly recommend that you give the Red Bean restaurant a go when you happen to be in the Old Quarter in Hanoi.  The Wise-Ones April 2019

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Since my last 2 dinners were in Red Bean restaurants (Central and Trendy) and I liked them a lot, I decided to give a try at the Red bean restaurant close to my hotel and was not disappointed at all! Extraordinary good dinner and place! First of all, I enjoyed a lot the music set. Secondly, I enjoyed the Red bean set! :) It was a 5 course menu that included a bruschetta, salmon roll, mushroom soup, roasted duck breast and warm passion fruit cake with vanilla ice cream. It was just amazing! And only 25$! I would not recommend to take the Chardonnay by glass, it is not so good as it could be. I think the place is known by their cocktails, because the barmen were busy all the time and it seems that peope liked their creations judging by woops you hear around. All types of credit cards including AmEx are welcomely accepted.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: The restaurant is a bit out of the beaten track in Hanoi but definitely worth a walk! First of all, it is on the eighth floor. Interesting to see lives of usual people on the streets. The ambience is very calm, relaxing and hasteless. The personnel is extremely friendly and disposing. I ordered a lemongrass chicken, it was marvelous! I'd you prefer a cocktail or mocktail without sugar, say it! I even got a 20% discount on the next bill as an encouragement my comments regarding the restaurant and provided service. I was surprised but my American Express was accepted!.. even without an additional charge from the bank.

We were recently in Hanoi for a birthday trip. We were looking for a place to eat and ran across the Red Bean restaurant, what a pleasant surprise. It was our first trip to Vietnam and were looking for some help in ordering, we allowed our server to order for us. I am sorry I can't remember her name, she did an excellent job and came to our table then the food arrived to show us how to "eat" the food we had ordered. It was a great experience and the food was amazing. We really enjoyed our experience at the Red Bean, I would highly recommend having a meal at the Red Bean.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Fantastic food with an incredible view. Worth the visit. Prices are high for Hanoi but it’s not much in the grand scheme of things.

review_title: Great food with the best service.
review: Big, big thank you to Cloud Nine restaurant. The food is fabulous. Great variety to choose from on the menu and perfectly cooked and presented. Thank you to Nghia whose service is just the best. And all the rest of the team who do everything possible to please and give you the best dining experience, nothing is too much trouble in this Restaurant. The style, decoration and prices are second to none. Whether it be for lunch or dinner you must give this place a try. Highly recomended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: My wife and I had been traveling SE Asia for a month and enjoyed everything from Street food to Michelin star quality.  We where unsure where to try a 'high end' meal in Hanoi, after being given several inconsistent recommendations by previous visitors or tour guides.  For us, Cloud Nine fitted the bill perfectly and we enjoyed our first visit so much that we chose to return again on our final night in Asia.  Located in the La Siesta Hàng be Hotel, just below the rooftop bar (both reviewed elsewhere) its central to the Old Quarter but has far reaching views in all directions across the city. The decor is undoubtedly chic, with a hint of French presented with a wonderful Asian style and finesse.  They served a mix of Vietnamese and western food, although we only ate from the Vietnamese menu.  They offer a tasting menu at £17 per head but each night we chose to dine a la carte and spent a little more (approx. £25 excluding drinks) but the food, quality, preparation and presentation was absolutely first class.  What sets this restaurant apart though is the quality of service. Anyone who has traveled in SE Asia will know that, if you pay a little more, the quality of service is consistently good. Here it was truly exceptional.  From the very first moment, restaurant supervisor/ maitre d', Amber, ensures that you're welcomed, relaxed and served to your satisfaction. Not that she should have any concerns, as the staff are all, without exception, attentive and polite.  On both occasions we ate here, our server was Huyen. An absolute delight to deal with, her English was seriously impressive, indeed we found her easier to understand than some of our more heavily accented tour guides! She really exceeded any reasonable expectations of service.  On our return visit we were both treated like long lost friends and we'll take memories such as that away with us.  For the record, over our two visits, we ate the special chef spring rolls, Hanoi deep fried spring rolls, Phu Bo, asparagus and crab meat soup, Tom Yum Kung soup, green mango seafood salad, beef on hot stones and Tiger prawns in coconut. We never made it to dessert! In addition, they serve a complimentary amuse bouche to start and a refreshing drink to close.  A truly wonderful experience and I would highly recommend.

One of the best restaurants we visited during our vacation. Nice view over Hanoi, very good food, cool and relaxed atmosphere, but most of all an extremely friendly and helpful staff! Thanks to all, but mostly to our special friend Chucc Chucc!
After cocktail on the roof, your best choice is two have dinner at Cloud Nine Restaurant. Food is absolutely good as well as presentation. Thanks to Katie the waitress.

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Came here for a birthday meal. The food was fantastic and the service was second to none. We even got a birthday cake! Would definately recommend a visit. Also worth visiting the sky bar

The place got great reviews so we decided to have nice evening. The set-up is nice, but they no longer have great view as other high buildings are blocking them. The food is very expensive for Vietnam and taste is average at best.

Booked this for the NY day as it was a birthday for one of us. Amazing location and view (despite the smog), easy to sit outside with enough space for 9 people. Pretty well protected from the wind or rain. Food was very good and some unique presentation on a few things.

Wow! A small vegan restaurant that feels like you’ve been welcomed into a Vietnamese home. The food was delicious (possibly the best tofu I’ve ever had) with several vegan alternatives to meat and fish.  I can’t recommend this place enough! Definitely a must visit for any vegan or veggie lover!

A cute little place hidden inside an alley of the old quarter, which is cool. It’s not easy at all to find vegan food around here so I was extremely happy I found this place. Very generous portion, reasonably priced, the mock meat taste so great, above all the story of the owner is sweet and moving. Defo become a regular visitor myself at this place.

review_title: We enjoyed every minute here. A clear yes!
review: Okay, this has been on our bucket list for a long time, and what a feast that was! The food is prepared in 5 different varieties, leaving no waste. Each and every single one was so different in style and flavour which made it a true experience. Free drinks come with the menue! Dragon, the owner showed us around a little bit and explained the backgrounds.

review_title: thank you Dragon for the hospitality
review: we thoroughly enjoy the guided food and hospitality we came for a lunch and it was a memorable food trip Thank you dragon there are variety of dishes served by the tarn great hospitality friendly nature

I don't recommend this restaurant. In fact, I cannot say this is a restaurant. It comprises of two rooms with tables and chairs on the first floor of a creepy building situated on an even creepier neighborhood, half an hour by car from the Old City. We arrived there at 7 PM. Our first belief was the taxi driver should have made a mistake, it seemed impossible to be a restaurant there. The neighborhood looked miserable, as well as the building we were in front of. A kid came and told us by gestures to go upstairs. We entered the "restaurant" and the first impression was very bad. At the end, the last impression was even worse. Let me summarize our experience there: - The owner was not there despite the fact we booked our table on day in advance, so he knew we will be there. No one else spoke English, so no communication was possible. - There were no waiters or waitresses. No personnel at all. - The kid invited us in the kitchen to see what snake we would have and eventually see how they kill it. I visited the kitchen (it would be better for me to not know how the kitchen looked like) but refused to see the slaughter. - To be fair, the owner called us and excused for not being there; his explanation was that he had to cook for his family. Great excuse! - It was supposed to have an 11-course dinner but we received only 9. - It was supposed to have snake wine to drink but the kid that served us brought only beer or coke. We asked for snake wine but he didn't (want to) understand our request. Eventually, I convinced the kid to call the owner and only I asked the owner for wine, the kid brought us a bottle. - Don't imagine this is a restaurant. It's a tourist trap. They don't accept credit cards, they don't give you any receipt. - The bill was 50 USD for two persons. Because we got there on our second day in Vietnam, we didn't know how big the bill was in comparison with other restaurants. After 14 days spent in various locations in Vietnam and eating only at restaurants, I can say the bill was HUGE! The next evening we went to the Essence Restaurant in Hanoi (the number 1 restaurant in Hanoi on TripAdvisor) and the bill for two persons was one-third (60% lower). - While we entered the taxi for going to the hotel, the kid ran after us waiving the money we paid. Only after the local taxi driver told him that the amount of money is right, the kid cooled down.  About the food: the only two good dishes were the two types of soup. Being the first time we had snake, we did't know what to expect for. Either the meat was badly cook or not, the taste was not good. Some dishes were not cooked well, i.e. the pieces of meat were dry and over-roasted. It looked like many dishes served were composed of leftovers. They didn't look like fresh cooked. We didn't find another place in Vietnam with such dull and bad food.  About the snake wine: IT IS NOT a wine!! I don't know why they are calling it "wine". It is a spirit, a fermented alcoholic beverage in which they put a snake. It is not very strong, maybe 25-30 ABV. I didn't like the taste. I tried it again on a day-trip to Mekong Delta and the taste was the same. It was not my style.  In a nutshell: go there only if you don't care about your money, about what you eat and how you are served. Elsewhere, go to any other place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We arrived unannounced, but the staff were most accommodating, even though it was a quiet time for them...the owner came and introduced himself and was very entertaining! It's out of the city, but well worth going over by taxi(about $6) 20mins. We selected a snake to be culled (in front of us if we wanted) and headed down to the kitchen to see it skinned and prepared. I was a bit apprehensive as to the many dishes which were brought before us, but enjoyed tasting all...even the penis soup! Washed down by snake wine (6yrs old)….Free beers and sodas were offered throughout the meal and the staff were attentive, but also left us to enjoy our meal....(we were the only ones in the restaurant) and made to feel very welcome. You could handle the snake if you wanted...not too scary! And choose which kind of snake you wanted for lunch.Great experience and would definitely recommend it for an "out there" experience, but still within enjoyment levels! Even my mum enjoyed it! Tasty dishes. A taxi was even organised for us (free of charge) to get us back to our Hanoi hotel.

Very unique experience. Exceptional service provided by the owner Mr Dragon. Delicious meals. We have chosen to eat the mountain snake. My partner was allowed to hold a bamboo snake when we have arrived at the restaurant. Many thanks for a wonderful time! Greetings from Lithuania!!!

I recently visited the restaurant and was blown away by the quality of the food. The dishes were super delicious with so much flavor and fresh ingredients that made the taste mouthwatering. The atmosphere of the restaurant was also great, and the service was outstanding. A particular standout was our waitress Ruby, who was incredibly friendly and made us feel very welcome. Highly recommended!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Great food. Very friendly. Lots of choice. Ask for Jenny!
review: Great food. Very friendly. Lots of choice. Nice atmosphere with a mix of locals and tourists. We got a walk in table no problem.

We had our farewell tour group dinner here in our "own" room, which was nice. I had the Chicken Soup and Hanoi Style Bun Cha. Both were nice, but didn't have as much flavour as I'd hoped. It was interesting to see Chicken Curry as a vegetarian option.

Today ate at Downtown. A good choice soon became apparent. Kindly received by a very good English-speaking waiter Mr. Zo. It soon became apparent that the waiter was a great entertainer. He knows a lot about food, a lot about Hanoi, and a lot of recommanded sightseeing places in Hanoi. On the advice of mr. Zo tried a "Bun Cha" (Hanoi style) the first time. President Obama ate it also when he visited Hanoi. And to be honest, mr. Zo was right. It was a fantastic delicious meal (thanks to the cook). Worth t repelt. And to the owner of Downtown, be happy with Mr. Zo.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: This was the best so far in Vietnam
review: Besides the service, extemely kind as in many places in this Country, the food was fantastic. The traditional dish "bun cha" was truly excellent. We strongly recommend this place, located in the old town - the same area where many others are as well. Easy to find, just round the corner from the hotel O'Gallery Classy.

Superb. Marvelous. Amazing. I'm running out of words to describe the experience. Especially the Egg coffee & the "uber-special" service by Hien. Such a sweet little girl. Will charm you with conversation everytime. Brighten up the whole place.

review_title: Super friendly restaurant with good food.
review: This restaurant was around the corner from our hotel, and based on T/A reviews, we decided to give it a try. It was a truly memorable experience. At first we were the only people there, however it was early and very soon the restaurant was full. We were served by Tamy, a real character who made many jokes and entertained us with a selection of buddha figurines that he brought to the table. Each day after our initial visit, he would spot us walking by and run out to greet us and ask if we needed any help with sights or directions etc. A really lovely person, with excellent English.  The food also was very good. I had a beef stew, which was really delicious, whilst others had more western fare such as burgers, pizza, club sandwiches etc - all very good. The restaurant seemed to mainly attract tourists, however don't let this detract you. It is a really welcoming, lovely space with a wonderful atmosphere and pretty outlook. You won't be disappointed.

user_tags: Foodie;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: We were two friends visiting this restaurant for a dinner. However, the fried duck wasn’t medium it was so well done that it was impossible to eat. But it ended in happiness and friendship when the manager apologized and didn’t let us pay. Mistakes will always be made; it is how we deal with them that counts.

user_tags: Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Good food and very hospitable staff true to this country. Multi cuisine in case you are bored of only Vietnamese.

To see the reviews on TripAdvisor, it is to believe that we have chosen the wrong restaurant!!  Dinner for two on the terrace. Vietnamese card: 3/4 choices only.  We took Nems to share and Bun cha (grilled pork and noodles) and cha ça (fish) in dishes plus a bottle of Chilean chardonnay wine.  Very nice waitress but not speaking a word of English and a beginner for sure! She introduces us to another Chilean Sauvignon wine. The domain name being the same she did not understand! We are then offered another chardonnay twice as expensive (1,250 ok) but it is not cold!! So ice cubes in the glass … (it does not matter we are on vacation)  Passable culinary quality. Big surprise ! We did not know that the accompaniments of the 3 dishes were identical.  When paying...nobody know how to debit an Amex card. Everything ends very well with a smile because they are kind staff.  This note is for the GM. Where is the management and staff training?  Fortunately all our other discoveries in Hanoi were fantastic

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We had lunch and two dinners at the Chestnut and were absolutely delighted with quality of our food and the presentation of our dishes.  All this in a spectacular setting on the 11th floor of the Delicacy hotel - Especially in the evening with great view over Hanoi an unforgettable experience!  Many thanks to the staff who were very friendly and efficient with their service!

Had lovely Margheritas and tap beer. Long the server spoke excellent English and was a great host. Awesome view of Hanoi and great vibe. Do visit during happy hours (2+1). Will surely go again on my next trip to Hanoi.

The Gourmet Corner Restaurant and Sky bar is on the 12th floor of the Siesta Classic Hotel in Lo Su Street. It is tucked away between shops on a bustling street This place is very popular so booking is recommended as the Restaurant is not very big about 20 covers ,but is very plush and ideal for a romantic dinner .Large windows offer picturesque views of Hanoi with a rooftop bar on the 13th Floor which is not enclosed We had a table in the corner and the menus were provided .The menu is mostly Vietnamese food and there is an accompanying wine menu We choose Pumpkin Soup and Scallops for Starters followed by Chicken and Cashew Nuts and Steamed Sea bass in Banana leaf .Food presentation was superb. Prices not to expensive to Westners it was 1.397.550 dong that included a 5% service charge and 10% tax. Overall enjoyable meal with a great selection of dishes to choose from
Great view and wonderful craft drinks. Liam was excellent, he provided great service and conversed nicely with us, it was a joy to interact with him. Stop for happy hour!
Excellent evening. Great food and service from Eric Voung. The entertainment is top notch and the view is spectacular.
We made a reservation for our anniversary. We were treated wonderfully and the food was very tasty. We loved our dinner and would eat here again for sure.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Note: this is not your run of the mill Hanoi restaurant! We were a table of four and had a beautiful dinner here. All four meals were really well presented and very tasty. We had cocktails as well as a couple of spirits that are quite rare. The drinks were really well priced for the quality. The view was great. Try and book ahead and ask for a table by the window. Very popular and not a huge restaurant so best to book, there’s also a rooftop bar on the 13th floor which has a great atmosphere. Our entire bill was around 3,000,000VND and was very good value.

We had such a great first night dinner here with our daughter. The staff were so friendly and really good with her. She had a lovely carrot soup and a tropical milkshake. The adult shared braised pork and duck and I had a lovely virgin Pina Colada. All in all an amazing first night in Hanoi with a lovely view of the old town and lake.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: The Gourmet Corner restaurant is on the 12th floor of the Le Siesta Diamond and Spa hotel in the Old Quater offering a fine-dining experience to hotel guests and the general public.  Great ambience with soft lighting and attentive staff. It offers a variety of choices from both local Vietnamese and European dishes. There are set menus with 3 or 5 courses in Vietnamese or European food all at reasonable prices.  We had opted for a 5 courses Vietnamese meal which was delicious and very filling indeed. We had spring rolls, mango salad, soups, hot stone beef stew, fried chicken and fresh fruits.  We also had lunch on two occasions which were equally good and we have lighter dishes from the menu.  Service was excellant and staff were attentive. Food was well presented and delicious.  Dinner service is very busy and we recommend that you make a reservation with the hotel to avoid any disappointment.  Do drop in the Gourment Corner restaurant for lovely food and service.  The Wise-Ones April 2019
Staff were amazing. Food top quality. Highly recommend. The sea bass was our favourite which came out in a flaming bowl.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Delicious food and great service. Really appreciated the recommendations. Recommend the bun cha Hà Nội which was delicious!

review_title: Very good food to escape from city chaos!
review: Very good food and nice experience in a nice place. They will ask you for this review, but I am doing it because it was really good :)

review_title: Western style comfort, authentic Vietnamese food.
review: A very comfortable indoor restaurant, on the eighth floor, with good views of the old town. Authentic Vietnamese food, served efficiently by an enthusiast young team. Drinks reasonably priced, choice of set menus, dinner for two including drinks circa US$30. Worth a visit.

We had read a few good reviews for this restaurant and thought we'd check it out and were glad we did! We went earlier to sit on the rooftop bar above this restaurant - highly recommend doing that as well.  The staff are very friendly, the food is superb and it's really not that expensive. We had an entree to share, two mains, two drinks and two bottles of water for about US$30 / AUD$43.  The menu has plenty of choice and there's something for everyone on there. We'd definitely go back if we had more time!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: A bit more high-end compared to street eateries around you, but very enjoyable and tasty meal in pretty setting and great drinks served from the rooftop bar. The only minor complaint would be we had to wait for paying a bit longer than we would have liked after we finished eating.

review_title: Decent food but high prices and inexperienced service
review: I had my first dinner upon arriving in Hanoi at Mam Com Viet restaurant. I ordered the Hanoi Spring Rolls, Stir-Fried Chicken with Lemongrass, and a Banana Smoothie. The food was decent but the service was weak and very inexperienced. The food was also expensive, 99K VND for spring rolls is ridiculous for Hanoi standards, the total cost of the meal was 264K VND.  I had Mam Com Viet on my list of restaurants to dine at prior to arriving to Hanoi based off of the TripAdvisor reviews, however in the end I was disappointed. Some of the other dishes customers were enjoying looked good, however based on my experience I would not recommend this place to friends.
Amazing experience. Food was awesome and the treatment of the staff friendly as always in Vietnam. Price a little bit on top of the average in this country but really worth it!!

review_title: Excellent Restaurant in the Old Quarter!
review: My husband and I stayed at the JM Marvel recently for a week and had several dinners at the Mam Com Viet restaurant. It's only been open for several months, but you wouldn't know it. We couldn't get over the number of choices and each meal we had was outstanding. The service was excellent and we want to give a special shoutout to Chris who was so friendly and helpful! We also ate breakfast there every morning. There was a good variety of Asian as well as Western choices. The only minor suggestion I'd make is to add more coffee choices such as cappuccino in the morning. Even if you don't stay at the JM Marvel, give this restaurant a try; you won't be disappointed!

Wonderful meal with very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend the pork pineapple rice. Delicious. Restaurant is on the 8th floor. Take the lift to the 7th floor and walk up the stairs. No lift to the 8th floor
Definitely worth it, paid £17 for a set menu (highly recommended), a beer and a gin&tonic. Very nice Vietnamese food!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review: Lovely place. Interior design has the classy looking vide. Everything is well design including the menu, the table placement down to the chopstick with cover. Once enter the friendly stuff opens the door and welcome you. They serve some snacks before we start our main. Too much food i would wish to try but we only have 2 person. So i decided to go with Rice Noodle with nugget and fried tofu. The presentation of the dish was great too.  While i was eating, I accidentally drop my chopstick. Vu the staff was so quick to bring me a pair of new one without me asking. Good observation skill and caring staff.  I would definitely visit this place again when i have a chance to go back to Hanoi.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Beach Goer
review: We checked out the Menu of Mam Com Viet Restaurant as we walked by, we decided to have our final meal in Hanoi there before heading to the airport, we are so glad we did. We took the lift up to the Restaurant, it was beautifully set out, from the first greeting by our waiter Chris the service was amazing, my wife ordered the Hanoi Grilled Fish and i ordered the Hanoi Grilled Pork, both dishes were not only beautifully presented and tasted delicious, but Chris also advised us on how to eat the Hanoi Fish. We were both very surprised that at lunchtime the restaurant was empty, for the quality of the dishes, the level of service, and the prices, the restaurant deserves to be packed with diners. When we are back in Hanoi we will definitely return.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: I had a wonderful morning with Chef Rosy. We began with a market visit, it was so funny, after go to the restaurant and make preparations. All was perfect, Rosy was very helpful and passionate. The food what we made was AWY‼️ 2 thumbs up and many thanks

review_title: HIDDEN GEM YOU MUST GO TO
review: Hanoi food culture is really nice restaurant down a back Alley. I had pork do it yourself rice wraps. Yummy food and, the cocktails were also amazing. The staff were really nice and the food came super quick. Some had starters and desserts which were also very tasty. We were a table of 11 and very impressed with the service.

The atmosphere is excellent. The building and interior is so charming. (2 storeys). You will find "used-to-be-sewing-machines" for your tables.  The entrance doesn’t face Main Street. It is in the back alley. Don’t miss it.  I had slow cooked pork, which I hadn’t eaten for years. I reckon that it is one of the traditional Vietnamese dishes that are served with a small pot. When I was in Hue, I ate this kind of dish a lot. It is delicious but I wish they had a wider range of food (menu).  They have Vietnamese wine as well as Italian, French and Chilean wine but unfortunately Vietnamese wine is by the glass only. If you want to try Vietnamese wine, you have to order a bottle. Some wine is available by glass. Besides wine, there are many kinds of cocktails.  I should have asked if I could play piano ( Yes they have piano on the 2nd floor )  It is a very lovely setting. If you are tired of eating on street, you should come here to chill out.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Highly recommend this restaurant!  We started with the Mango salad with shrimp, which opened up our appetite for the meal. The chicken with lemongrass (Com va nom chua not) is very tender, incredibly tasty and prepared very well. We finished with the Duck Breast with Tamarind sauce (Uc vit nuong sot me), which was just... chef's kiss. The tamarind sauce and mango chutney was a great pairing which really enhanced the duck.  Our server Hai was very warm & friendly in his service. Apart from taking great care of us, he taught us how to correctly pronounce the Truc Bach beer correctly. Very earnest young man among a great staff who would make you feel very welcome.  Overall great food, generous portions and excellent service.  P/S: we forgot to take a picture of the chicken.

We met up with a group of Hanoian friends after not having seen them for 4 years. We had an amazing time and were able to order a wide variety of items off of the menu. Everything was prepared artfully and tasted quite good and authentic. I don't recall the exact item, but the prawn dish I had was excellent. The old colonial building was just the right amount of restored and rough with bare brick, exposed beams and old photos. We don't typically eat so high-end--and let's face it: healthy--when traveling but the occasion was perfectly served here. Service was friendly and efficient and loved the semi-hidden location in a lantern-strung alley.

I rarely eat art and this was one of those rare occasions.  Amazing food with amazing staff who explained everything about the meal I picked. Mia who served me was so attentive and taught me how to prepare my main course of Grilled 'Lang' fish (number 11).  The interior of the restaurant was delicately decorated and it was a peaceful experience from starter to finishing dinner with a ginger and orange tea.  It was a shame this was my final night in Hanoi but when it comes to eating, I saved the best until last.

This place is usually crowded as it is booked for European tour group. So it's better to book in advance to secure a table as my group of 4 was turned away without reservation. Friendly staff and nice ambience. The main dishes come complete with rice. We had spring rolls, claypot pork belly, mango salad, duck, etc. The dishes were generally above average (6.5/10) except for the duck meat (4.5/10) as its meat was tougher than we thought. Prices are reasonable too. Finding the restaurant may be challenging too as it is located in a tiny side cul-de-sac.
We stopped here for breakfast after an overnight train trip. I had "The Parisian" - which was delicious and really hit the spot, and an Americano coffee. Highly recommended!

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Good place for coffee and cakes
review: We love carrot cake here, latte is pretty nice too. The second floor is quiet (may be each time we came by) so we like it. The view from this coffee shop is limited and basically is not nice at all. However, if you come here with a book that would be nice to spend your day. No one will disturb you for sure.

review_title: Possibly the most expensive local beer in Vietnam.
review: I came here planning to have a couple of beers or 3. At 4 times the price of what I can buy it on the street, that quickly changed to just the one. The view is quite speccy and possibly worth the price tag for just 1 beer.

I had a delicious and fun dinner with my family at Rice Bistro.  A mid sized restaurant which is way to find, it can be bust so a reservation is a good idea.  An upmarket atmosphere and efficient but not over the top service.  A lovely meal was had by all on my family with roasted chicken sticky rice highly recommended.  Particular thanks to Ms Min!

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: LET ME GIVE YOU A TIP IF I MAY
review: The best meal on our trip to Vietnam could be my best meal in a long time great service from FRED small wine list but quality I could come back here again and AGAIN well done top class
Had a good solid steak here and service is decent but the restaurant lacks ambience for steak restaurant and sides are not up to par. Easy steak if you are staying at the hotel

Had dinner on the weekend in this nice restaurant which was playing hoast to a party of perhaps 14 people including two very loud and rambunctious boys. The group made up more than half the dinner guests so I think the staff was hesitant to say anything to the oblivious parents. It is an expensive and nice restaurant by Hanoi standards so I did not expect to be subject to a hour of regular high pitched screaming and much running around.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Whilst staying in the Sheraton I have used this place a few times for a good western food fix. Great steaks, service and wonderful staff. Not cheap but worthy of the price

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Location, view, the lake, service and wine... are good. The taste, atmosphere and food are amazingly good. Not overprice at all, since you can spend the night at your most satisfaction. You surely can trust the staffs when they recommend you some special dishes

review_title: Great Food, great Staff, great Chef Patrick Morris
review: Great food, great wines, outseating area  We felt like home. Everyone took so good care of us. We have been spoiled.  Patrick and his Staff are perfect hosts  Looking forward to go back!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Had a meal in here one night whilst in Hanio. Ordered the chef special menu, which was salad, soup, a great steak and dessert, which was well priced and perfectly executed, this really is a first class meal.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Very nice and cosmopolitan steak and seafood grill
review: This is a great variation of your seafood and steak grill with a great variety of world starters and an extensive menu for seafood and steak. Nice choice is you like either
This restaurant was a real surprise. Romantic location, perfect service and probably the best food I've had in Vietnam.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We went to this restaurant on a quiet, wet Sunday night in Hanoi. It was ok, but not terrific. I had the US rib eye which I asked for medium rare. It was very flavoursome and trendy but more medium to well. My husband had the chicken which he said was well executed but on the dry side, always tricky to get chicken breast right! The side dishes were OK and freshly cooked. The service was pleasant and attentive.

review_title: An after noon Vietnamese Lunch in Hanoi
review: The Vietnamese lunch was pretty interesting. The food was supplied in round plates from which we all helped ourselves . The food was good. The salad served was tasty. The ambience of restaurant was pretty cool and service was with a smile.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Thrifty Traveler
review: very nice poke place in Hanoi. established menu or create your own. a good number of options to make it.highly recommended!!!

It was four or five years ago that the first poke ('pô-kê) restaurants opened in our corner of California and became my family's favorite new kind of one-dish meal. Now there's a very popular poke restaurant in Hanoi, just a few steps down an alley off Hang Khay at the foot of Hoan Kiem Lake. Good value and atmosphere.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Excellent Poke at a Reasonable Price
review: We enjoy eating at poke places at home so we were happy to check out this restaurant while we were on vacation. It was delicious, with generous portions, at a very reasonable cost. The location of the restaurant itself was a bit difficult to find, but it is worth it. It is up the stairs! You will only see the sign from the street level.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: It was just perfect. During our last day after three weeks in Vietnam, we discover this gem. You can compose your bow. Very tasteful and enough for big appetite. Friendly staff who helps you to make good combo! The place is a bit difficult to find but don’t hesitate to enter the alley, climb the stairs, and enjoy. The place is quite nice with a terrasse offering a view on the Hoàn Kiêm lake.
The foods are very fresh and delicious. You must wait very long time to be served. They don't accept credit card so we felt a little bit disappointed.

North of lake Hoan Kiem, entrance well hidden (11B) after going through a small alley, you’ll find this modern place on the second floor. The staff is very helpful with creating your “poke bowl”. Fresh ingredients, very colourful and tasty. I really recommend this place between two visits or straight away to start off your day.  cảm ơn!

As most below have said .. poke provides a lovely fresh, healthy and welcoming meal away from the "typical" here in Hanoi ..  Easily see why it's number one... Highly recommend to search out.. (it's beside the major park in the old quarter, so easy to locate albiet up a alley )

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Good and healthy food. Coming here to enjoy lunch with 2 of my friends. It is a busy restaurant. You come, then choose your own poke ^^! Enjoy and definitely come back.

Hidden gem and definitely worth going. The poke restaurant is down a side alley of the building and you would not know it’s there. When you find the restaurant you do have to walk up a few flights of stairs so in my opinion you would need to be physically fit.  The choice of food is good giving you options and also the opportunity to have meat or vegetarian bowls.  The atmosphere was good giving you a relaxed feel and also gentle music was playing in the background.  The price was reasonable aswell and we would recommend

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Nature Lover;Beach Goer
review: I happened to be in the area and checked my TripAdvisor app to find a place for dinner. When I realized that I was only five minutes away from the #1 spot in Hanoi (according to TripAdvisor), I needed to try it. At first, as someone who lives in Hanoi, I was turned off by the idea that it's almost on Hoan Kiem lake. I thought it would be a tourist trap. It's not. And, the fact that you have to go down a tiny little alley and up a flight of stairs just adds to the awesomeness of the experience. From that alley, you emerge into a bright, cheerful and welcoming little shop. There's great outdoor seating if the weather is good and there's cool, clean air conditioning inside if that's your fancy. The staff was incredibly nice and talked me through the process for selecting my bowl. It was absolutely delicious. And, the fresh orange carrot juice was great too.  And, one of the key reasons that I'm giving this place 5-stars (and not just because everyone else seems to) is that they are also very ecologically aware. They offer bamboo straws, bamboo chopsticks and wooden spoons. All of the cutlery was therefore biodegradable or reusable. I loved that. Oh, and the juices were in reusable glass bottles.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Hidden away down a small alley from the old quarter lake, Poke Hanoi provides a wonderful escape from the bustle of the street below. The service and food is exceptional. An utter delight!
Fantastic poke bowls with good vegan and vegetarian options. Staff is friendly and nice and the food is very fresh and tasty. Wonderful atmosphere right by the lake.

After reading all the positive reviews here on TA, and wanting something a little different from Pho for a change, we decided to give this restaurant a try. Fortunately it was right next door to our hotel, and although not exactly easy to spot-down a small alleyway- and up a long flight of stairs it was well worth it. Fabulous contemporary rooftop decor with views over the lake.  Highly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;60+ Traveler
review: It was exactly what we had hoped for!!! It was just beautiful and the food amazing!!! The receptionist was very sweet and accommodating!! My sister and I had delicious meals!! And desserts too. It was within walking distance from our RIAD. I DEFINITELY recommend this restaurant!!

Loved this place, we were there early December, booked a table for 7pm and it was still warm enough to sit on the terrace (with a jumper on!) The views are spectacular, the restaurant itself is fabulous. Menu is small but there is a good choice and the food was nothing short of delicious - I had beef fillet which came with mashed potatoes and loads of veg. Friends had the tagines with the lamb being the favourite. Highly recommend this place especially if you can get there during the months where it doesn’t get dark until after 7.30-8pm.
Cool little restaurant with amazing burgers! If you are visiting Marrakesh don’t miss this place, it absolutely deserves its no.1 spot on Tripadvisor 👍

Stylish high view restaurant with an artistic interior and lively atmosphere. The menu is interesting and food beautifully presented. Cocktail menu is diverse and innovative. The service is very efficient

As one of the top restaurants on TripAdvisor we were expecting an excellent meal. The food was decent but nothing spectacular. Five of us with all different countries and appetizers and nothing was stood out. Portions were small and the prices high. Certainly not one of the top meals on our Trip. The drinks were made by a bartender who had no clue how to make simple mixed drinks like putting sprite in a martini. The atmosphere on the other hand was great.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review_title: super friendly service and great food!
review: Was a great restaurant for both adults and teenagers with very friendly service and great food. Hassan as our waiter was super friendly and helpful!

Very first restaurant once we arrived in Marrakech and it was a good start. Despite of the fact that we had chosen French Cuisine we did not regret this. All dishes were cooked to perfection and the choice of fresh herbs and spices was excellent. We had lobster for starter to be continued with a great steak in a kind of Bernaise gravy. Was delicious. The hosts are very friendly and even the Maitre appeared at the table to ask for feedback. Well done. I finished that meal with a Cafe Gourmet which was a good choice. The only cons was that inside of restaurants in Morocco it is still allowed to smoke, a pitty especially in restaurants like this where you want to discover all tastes. Finally, we strongly recommend this place for sure and advice you to have a reservation in advance.

review_title: Awesome French food, best meal we had in Morocco and it's not even close.
review: This place could be Michelin rated. After travelling around Morocco and putting up with the monoton for 2 weeks, it was an absolute treat to enjoy some real, thought out French food. Every plate was really delicious. The service was great too. Highly recommend, definitely the best meal we had in Morocco.  They had a big selection of wines, but the cocktail menu was very uninspired (Morocco..).

Loved the atmosphere of this place. Was a little odd to be in the restaurant side though, while football was on and people just drinking at the side of us in the bar, watching the large TV.  DJ was brilliant - one of the best in Marrakech we’d say. Staff were fabulous. My food was great, I had black ravioli. My companion had crying tiger beef, which sadly wasn’t as good. Great choice of drinks.  Would def return and recommend.

Found this trendy restaurant thanks to Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. Booking is recommended as it was very busy but it was a Friday night. It is a smoking restaurant/bar so if you don’t like smoke (and loudish music) stay away! It is down a quite road and not well known - our taxi driver hadn’t heard of it so we had to give him Google directions! Great atmosphere/ food/music/service. I had the black ravioli which was lovely. Excellent saxophonist too. If you are looking for a modern, Moroccan, trendy night out then definitely go!

review_title: Live music, fab food, great atmosphere :)
review: What a fab find, saw reviews on here and decided to visit. We were lucky enough to be there when Morocco won one of their World Cup games and the atmosphere was brilliant. Lots of happy people, live music and the food was really good. Staff were attentive and helpful, we’d only just arrived in Marrakech and they helped us out with a taxi and somewhere to get cash.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker
review: Love the place just Cousy outstanding place to hangout as couple. The food is great yet limited in the main courses. The service if not one of the most outstanding service I have ever received in Morocco knowing myself as an exigeant person. Definitely will recommend it to people I know and I may return myself..... carry on the good work 5*

Really glad we came across this great bar while staying in the Gueliz district. They have a complicated 'formula' tapas menu but we just ordered one tapas dish each plus some wine. The red wine was really good although some were served chilled which I also noticed in another bar in Marrakech. The servers were very friendly and efficient and the food arrived quickly. When some of us returned the next night the waiter recognised us and although it was busy he made sure we were seated quickly and served us well. Great atmosphere, great music, although a little too loud to allow for easy talking on a Saturday night bur we really enjoyed our time here.

review_title: We went to watch the soccer game
review: We went to watch a soccer game... we booked our table in advance, the staff are great and verry professional the location is good as well... close to our hotel, the food was yumi we choose the tapas menu with a botlle of wine included...great vibe after the game we loved it... wish we had a place like this in Rabat :) next time in marrakech we will come back for sure!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Now this is what I call great cocktails. We went to one of the top cocktail places in the world in the summer ( the clumsies in Athens) and the cocktails were as good here. I had the apothecary , vodka and gin based with fresh geranium leaf, excellent. Mum had their equivalent of a pina colada. I don’t normally like whisky cocktails but my husbands ‘ marrakech market’ was fabulous. We had sharing plates, all really tasty, of mini burgers, steak with chimchurri, fried octopus. Fantastic designed place too as a speakeasy and wonderful welcome and looked after. So refreshing, It’s these sorts of places that will draw us back to marrakech

review_title: Good fun night with amazing cocktails too
review: Great concept, very good food, not too expensive but service so slow. They sort of need a management system or a good manager. It is a shame as everything else as well as the funny setting was great.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: It is our last evening in Marrakech and we decide to go to Le Baromêtre. It is about 2.5 km walk from the Medina, but taking a cab is not unwise because the restaurant is quite difficult to find....  But when you have found it, you enter a great entourage, inspired by the period of the reclamation in America. Alcohol was forbidden, but it was drunk in illegal cafes in cellars!  We start in the bar, where two gentlemen make some spectacular cocktails for us. Definitely not cheap, but just the experience of watching is worth it!  Then to the restaurant. We take different starters and main courses and everything is equally great. Excellent dishes, highly flavored, attentive and friendly service! Because of the cocktails, the food, the service and the entourage we had a super evening!  We wonder why Michelin has not found this restaurant yet!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We actually tried to get a table at our favorite Cafe Le Poste, but they had full. We ended up on a hike in Gueliz and my wife accidentally pulled us in.  The room is dark and what strikes me is the serice-minded boy who did everything he could to give a great evening. It was good music and perfect party atmosphere, without it getting too much. A surprisingly enjoyable evening for our entire family. Recommended, but not for the food, which was ok but no more.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review: We went there with friend .. enjoyed the experience.. great cocktails, good atmosphere, nicely decorated.. excellent food .. not cheap

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Excellent service and a cool underground vibe, cocktails are pricey but probably the best in Marrakech.  Food was good but I actually expected better given the rave reviews. Had the carpaccio and the saffron seafood risotto, both nice but nothing close to Michelen level as some reviews suggest.  Expect to pay around 900dh for 2 x 2 courses plus a bottle of wine

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Excellent little gem of a place.
review: Found out about this little gem on TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed. Almost missed the entrance as it’s very low key. The doorman has to ask us if we were looking for it. It’s in a basement. It’s dark and moody. The bar is great in a small space which makes it personal. The service was quick, friendly and exceptional. The music was really good. The restaurant is through another door and has the exact same qualities. Really really well thought out. The food is simple and from a manageable menu. A had the beef fillet. It was tender and juicy. Lots of flavour. The only thing I would say is maybe more vegetables with it. All that really accompanied it was puréed potato. My partner had the lamb shank. It was a good portion and full of flavour but again, maybe adding more vegetables as it was only accompanied by potato purée. For dessert we had tiramisu and apple pie. At the end we were given a complementary drink. The experience was excellent. I really recommend this place.

The place is worth a visit but can be disconcerting as the location is sub ground level. Once downstairs and inside it was dark. Looking around lots of western guests, Americans as well as British. The wine list is good and the menu has choices to suit all tastes. The food was very good, well presented and perfectly cooked. The service was very good, friendly and spoke perfect English. Though some would say that the restaurant deserves a Michelin star, I’d say no, but Michelin plate (a good plate).

We went there on a Saturday night. The place is rather small and in a basement. The neighborhood it lays in doesn't really reflect the inside.  Without a reservation you will be seated in the bar area, the music is rather loud but not a nuisance. If you'd like to dine calm I'd advice to make a reservation.  The staff is helpful, but the door keeper at the entrance isn't like, welcoming.  We ordered a 2 cocktails and some food. The cocktails are nicely presented, but as you'll learn in Morocco lots of alcohol. I felt that the mix of the Aperol Spritz was missing and the taste was overkill by the overkill of Aperol. Bellini isn't as nice as the original, not bad but misses that typical martini taste.  Food, portions are rather small and it's adviced to order a dessert or entree if you have more hunger. The wait time is rather long (+-45 minutes) so calculate that in.  Overall I had a mixed feeling. My appetite was a bit gone by the burning smell of some cocktails and the loud music. Tastes of the food are good, but there are better places in Marrakech where you can eat the same for less money. Cocktails are fine if you can handle the alcohol.  Might had a different experience if I sat in the restaurant part.  Finally, the price. It's comparable to European restaurants. We paid for 2 cocktails and 2 dishes 600 dirhams (around 60 euro)

Words really wouldn’t do justice to how good this place is so I have just put a few pics of the outstanding food and cocktails on offer. The proof of the pudding is in the eating and it was off the charts great. Excellent service. Would recommend booking in advance.

A fantastic hidden bar in funky Marrkech. We didn't eat here or try the restaurant as we had a booking elsewhere, but would have loved to. The only downside of the bar is the cigarette smoke, too overwhelming for us reformed smokers.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Great restaurant with lots of character. Loved the way the cocktails were presented, plus they were delicious. Food was piping hot and fresh. Excellent all round!

I visited here with my daughter on our last night in Marrakech. We were welcomed and seated in the bar area where we marvelled at the craft and skill of the cocktail making. The cocktails are expensive and range between 8 to 16 uk pounds but they are well worth the price and the presentation is unique. The style of the bar and restaurant is not traditionally Moroccan but has a more trendy European city vibe. We had dinner in the restaurant and the menu choices were modern and reasonably priced- £10 pounds for starters and mains between 12-18. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable but most importantly the food was delicious., beautifully presented. Overall flawless. If you are looking for something different well worth a visit.

I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough! After a week of tagine and couscous, it was wonderful to find a restaurant in Marrakech that served foie gras (poelee), confit de canard, filet de boeuf, lamb chops etc. The decor is quirky, with a “pseudo-industrial” feel, but the staff are efficient, enthusiastic, and all speak good English. The prices are not cheap, but the food quality is outstanding, so one leaves highly satisfied. We are not cocktail fans, but this is clearly a major attraction of this restaurant, indeed many people apparently come here just to drink them. The couple at the table adjacent spent several minutes photographing their cocktails before drinking them!

You need to book this restaurant as it is full every evening. So glad we did as it was a real treat! From the outside you wouldn't know it is a restaurant as there are no signs just a large letter B. Once inside there is a dark and cosy bar preparing a large selection of cocktails. We were greeted by a friendly member of staff who showed us to our table. Restaurant wasn't full when we arrived but soon all tables were gone. Food was amazing!! I had lamb while my boyfriend opted for beef both were equally as nice as the other. The only criticism I would have is that there was no veg with my lamb and there wasn't the option to order any. Dessert were yummy too. Cocktails and wine what more could you want. Staff were very attentive and made our experience a special one..

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Luxury Traveler
review: We were unable to get a reservation over New Years weekend, but did stop in for a cocktail. We sat at the bar and were thoroughly entertained by the mixologist! He patiently answered my annoying questions and bought us a shot before we left. Really wished we could have dined here!

review_title: Really nice food, but was the steak as ordered?
review: Had a team meal here, so we picked from a menu beforehand. I had steak for the main, which was ordered Rare, but seemed to come Medium, although it was really nice, and perhaps came like that because it was Halal?  No complaints otherwise, and the staff were fun and friendly.

We came here our first day after our guide's advise and we get out very satisfied! We tried the touristic menu: Bread was a dream, and their 2 types of olives too. Then cous cous and a vegetarian tajine (please try it!!) And we ended with a delicious orange with cinnamom, the world famous mint tea and a taste of moroccan pastry to lick your fingers! Please try this place and help it!it's a family owned restaurant which really suffered from covid closure!

Found this place on Tripadvisor, when we first got there about 8pm on w Wednesday the place was empty and I didn't want to go in but we did and it turned out to be very good. There's a great value set menu and the food comes fairly quickly. the host was friendly and the setting is nice.  Only downside was a couple of ants on the tables and the walls which I didn't see till after we'd eaten.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: Went straight here following this site's advices but it wasn't good AT ALL. Neither the atmosphere nor the food merit the visit. No more to comment on.

Two menu options consisting of a starter of a choice, a main dish of a choice, and a fruit dessert. The place is colorful and lovely. It doesn’t look pretty at the entrance, though, but don’t get discouraged. Nice and professional staff. The only thing I’d change was the music :/ the covers of pop songs played there take the charm away, yet my friends loved it. To each their own ;) The food tasted GREAT and was served with mint tea and a big bottle of water included in the price.

review_title: Nice and cheap, but we waited a lot
review: This place has very low prices and a very nice menu. It's easy to find, just follow your GPS. The restaurant is small, but colorful and welcoming, i liked it. Everything was tasty, very good to eat. The only problem was the waiting: there was only one waiter, so a lot of time passed between a serving and the other. Still appreciated the dinner

user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Having been to many restaurants in Marrakech, the Dar Chef was one of the best in quality of the food and the service, whilst being one of the cheapest. Definitely a must go! Near the city center, easy to miss entrance, but that’s part of its charm. Used to be a family house. The waiter Anas has been very kind and efficient.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Once more referred to Trip Adviser to recommend restaurants in Marrakesh and was not disappointed with the visit to Dar Chef. The entrance was a bit confusing but once in, there was plenty of comfortable seating. The interior was unusual in structure, possibly a courtyard but now with a covered roof. The staff were all polite, efficient and cheerful. We chose the 3 course menu, excellent value at 80dh per person. The soup was hearty and the main tagine courses were piping hot and tasty. We finished the meal with fruit and mint tea. Would recommend this restaurant to any visitors to the city.

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This place is Amazing, I come always here and itsy favourite, I bring clients here and they like it so much, Come come I am sure you will like it, friendly staff and easy park and the best food you can get here I recommend you this lovely place

review_title: Rating if for food and service only
review: So this was a little hard to rate properly as whilst the food and service was fantastic (great taste and portions at sensible prices - and a welcome change to have some authentic Spanish food when you have eaten your body weight in couscous) BUT we sat down near the main bar, which had sports playing on all the TVs, sports paraphernalia everywhere...it didn't feel like a restaurant but more of a pub serving tapas. We didn't linger, the vibe wasn't for us, but the food and service was really good.

I arrived there in a rainy night. The atmosphere inside is good. nice music and cool design. However, I think the place suits older people. I would not recommend it if you are -30. The prices of the drinks are a little overpriced compared to similar places but the quality is very good.

This pub is amazing. Great tapas and pailla!! The manager and his staff are good, friendly and welcoming! Interesting decorations and they play football on TV continuously which makes it fun. Too much inside smoking though.

I really like the ambience of this place and for me it is becoming one of my favourite Marrakech night spots. We went there last night and bought a bottle of Elyx vodka which we drank until the early hours accompanied by delicious tapas. They have a very good DJ. and the music was perfect. The efficient and friendly manager runs the place very well. I highly recommend going here.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nightlife Seeker
review: Very interesting décor, where you can find thousands of photos, paintings, news posts, billboards etc. all about FC Barcelona or football. So, its kinda like a posh pub. However, you can either grab a drink in the bar, or dine with nice Spanish food, but very small portions with live band singing Moroccan or Spanish songs.

I stumbled across this new ( to me) tapas bar/ night spot after dinner in the Gueliz last night and spent a very nice couple of hours there. We just had drinks and enjoyed the atmosphere enormously. The decor is pleasant and there was a good Spanish style band who played until quite late. I will definitely go back and it's just a pity that it closes at 2 am.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We visited for dinner based on the other reviews here and they certainly weren't lying. There are so many scams and rip-offs around but this restaurant is bang on. Fair prices, friendly staff and delicious food.  There was a queue for entry when we were leaving I think that says it all, especially given its a little trickier to find. Well recommended if you're looking for great local food at a good price

Amazing little place well worth seeking out. Beautifully tasty food and exceptionally good value. The pastilla was great but the falafels were even better and the Moroccan cakes for dessert were divine. Three "mains", two desserts, two sodas and a big bottle of water all for about £15 before tip.  I think we may need to try it again before we leave.....

This is a great small restaurant in the medina in Marrakech. We ate here twice and can recommend all different types of tajine - super tasty, pleantiful and delicious! Excellent prices, great service and cosy place.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: If you are looking for delicious food served in an authentic place, surrounded by colors and real Moroccan everyday life, don't miss this place! You will love it
Staff, food, menu choices exceptional. Music nice but a little loud. Small, chic, will return. Sole and sea bass were exceptional!

You are not expect that from the street. This is a fresh modern oasis in the Medina. Loved lobster tagliatelle and Champagne. As a suggestion: some french or italian red wine will complete the culinary experience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Excellent night om Marrakech on the roof terrace. Very fancy interior, good tuna and friendly staff. Recommend it strongly

A slightly odd menu that’s a mixture of pasta and local dishes. Good roof terrace. Friendly service. Alcohol if you want to pay for the option. My issue is that my tagine was, at best, luke warm - though it was tasty.
We enjoyed a great lunch with my 2-years old toddler, Emad was absolutely nice and the food was delicious. Highly recommend (chicken Pastela and vegetarian cous cous).

review_title: An very enjoyable couple of hours
review: Popped in to have a sardine dish that was recommended and found so much more.  The sardines of course were fantastic, but on top of that my wife had a tasty aubergine salad to compliment a pastille de poulet, which again was very good.  A Moroccan salad topped it off, all served by Ismael who was attentive without being overbearing and also fun to chat to as the time went on.  The Casablanca produces Flag Special beer and mint tea also went down well after a long day out and about.  Bazaar Cafe comes highly recommended, more so than some of the more expensive restaurants we visited during our stay!

review_title: What a find is this hidden gem of a restaurant
review: A marvellous Moroccan meal and an excellent service by Ismail who made us very welcome. What a find is this restaurant off the tourist track. Highly recommended - all meals are excellent. The additional bonus is they do serve alcohol.
Lovely great value food in a wonderful setting. Ismail was a very attentive waiter. All in all a fantastic experience. Well worth a visit.

As with a lot of the bars and restaurants in Marrakech this is on the roof of the building with views across the city. They also have a tea room/restaurant down stairs, although you don't get the views. We visited twice in our four days, once for a much needed liquid pitstop and the second time for dinner as the food we saw on our first visit look wonderful. The menu isn't huge but there are plenty of dishes to choose from. They also have a menu of the day priced around 100dhr which is unbelievable value for three courses and tea. a special shout out to our waiter Ismail, who assisted and guided us to our food selections. The food was excellent and extremely tasty.
Dont miss this place excellent location and great food awesome views so make a point of going you wont be disappointed,

review_title: Well cooked tasty Moroccan food served up in a friendly and welcoming restaurant .
review: Tasty Moroccan food at reasonable prices in a welcoming environment. We were served by Emad who was very friendly and made some good suggestions.

review_title: Average food, no ac, but helpful staff and beautiful location
review: Not sure how this place has such amazing reviews. The staff were very attentive, prices were attractive and the restaurant is beautiful, but the food was quite average, with the dessert being a real disappointment. There was also no a/c and it was ghastly hot in August.  It's good, but not great.

review_title: Difficult to find but worth the trip
review: The service was friendly, helpful and attentive.  The food was excellent, tasty and looked good and at a price i would be paying twice as much for at home.  Inside the Restaurant it was nicely deigned and perfect for a romantic meal.  The location is down some small alleys off one of the main streets, so you need to be confident you know where you are going as you won't find it you aren't. We used Google Maps to help but that didn't stop us attracting 2 locals who wanted to direct us to the restaurant, which became uncomfortable down the final few alleys and when they wanted money at the end.
Nice place, close to the square. Food was great as well as the service. Unfortunately multiple dishes were sold out but this was communicated to us when we got the menu handed over. Would go again.

Let me put it this way: a nice dinner that evening including cat entertainment. Palette is the star of this restaurant. Straying around the tables you get a visit from here once food is ready. What a funny moment. On our arrival she started her nap at the table next to me. In the moment the starters arrived she immediately woke up and started to „check“ what is going on there. We loved it. Let me get to the starters. The homemade foie gras I choose was delicious but slightly overpriced. 21 Euros for one single slice is too much. Even at Michelin rated restaurants the portion would be better. The main course was great, nothing to complain about. Good usage of spices and herbs, was a nice dish and good eventing. We can recommend this place.
