Booked via the website and got a confirmation email. Decided to scout it out, and had difficulty finding, it being in a narrow street, and with no signage. Only opens in the evening, but was able to see a tangle of chairs and tables covered in sheets. Apprehensive. What a transformation on arrival!! Nicely laid out, with elegantly laid tables, plus a "La Palette" sign outside on the street. Dimly lit, with triangular bar at the rear. Candles on the tables. Charming staff served us drinks, wine and an excellent meal, in pleasant ambience. Only minor downsides were nearby smokers, and slightly over-loud music. Can recommend the "burnt" avocados, coming with prawns on sticks, and also the mains of lamb shank (cooked 7 hours), and the monkfish on the bone, coming with curry sauce and risotto. Fabulous. Thoroughly recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: European style with middle east twis
review: The restaurant was another one of our findings during this stay in the city. Someone converted a garage into an industrial type /trendy restaurant and fashion outlet (nice mix). The owners are European and especially friendly (one of them escorted every client to the door). The food was European style with middle east twist in the flavors and way to cook. Having a curfew at nine a clock doesn’t help the business but it’s a great place to go if you want to try something contemporary in marrakech.

Our party of six ate here for dinner. We had a reservation and were shown upstairs. The food we had was good not great. My beef was warm not hot and my son said his beef was cold. Our waiter wasn't attentive and we had to wait numerous times to get his attention. We skipped dessert because we wanted to get out of there. We obviously had a different experience than other diners there. I wouldn't return to this restaurant.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We went for my husbands birthday as part of our premium all inclusive package at Kensington. It was a set menu but the food very good. The staff were a bit miserable though. Again I think they are better with french speaking customers
Gusto is next door to the hotel we stayed in, the Menu is good and so is the wine menu, very good food and well priced too.

This is a very tidy, clean and well run restaurant. The staff are attentive, the service is efficient and the food delicious. My friends and I have been there twice and had a variety of dishes all of which were great.

user_tags: History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Delicious food at a good price
review: We had the mixed moroccan starters, the Berber tagine and the meatball tagine all 3 of which were delicious, washed down with 2 virgin mojitos all for 250Dhs. Really good, we'll go again.

review_title: Top little spot just off Jemaa el Fna
review: A wonderful little family restaurant set just off Jemaa El Fna. Head up the road between Cafe de France and La Marrakchi and there it is on the right.  I had some beef briouates the the chicken tanjia, my wife had the Moroccan salad and then a mixed grill all of which were fabulous and tasty. We finished with Moroccan cakes and mint tea, the latter of which was the best mint tea of our tour so far.  If you want some great Moroccan food slightly away from the noisiest that Jemaa el Fna has to offer, give this place a try.
The tastiest food we have eaten in Morocco in the five days we have been here.Pleasant staff ,good service and fair prices,would recommend to give it a try
This is a good value pitta stop and the homemade lemonade packs a lunch! The fries are a tasty addition. Quick turnaround and cafe style seating onto the square

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: This is a nice place for a juice on a nice square. The pita we shared was tasty. The service was friendly, so it was a nice stop.

review_title: Perfect place for salads and fresh drinks!
review: Excellent salads and drinks. Their yogurt ice cream with amareto is super delicious! My favourite is falafel salad. The owner is very attentive and staff is super professional. Totally recommend if you want to make a break of couscous and tagine during your trip in Morocco:)
Great food after a busy day. Quick service, cool refreshing drinks if you like tart lemonade like me! Amazing kefta I’m soft white bread.

review_title: An up market Italian/ Morrocan fusion restaurant set within a beautifully decorated riad building.
review: We chose this restaurant for our last night in Marrakesh. We followed the signs from the main street Rue Zitoun Kedim and went through an area where local youngsters were hanging out and playing football and we thought we were lost. We then spotted a sign for the restaurant again and a member of the staff, dressed in a hooded cloak escorted us to PepeNero. We hadn't booked in advance, but after a few minutes, a lovely table was found for us, right opposite the ornamental pool shown on the photo in the restaurants' Tripadvisor profile. We were looked after by Mr Khalid and the service was quite formal but very professional and friendly. We had a lovely meal and enjoyed the evening. It was the most expensive meal we had during the week, but we would definitely return and recommend to others. Just to mention, that when we left the restaurant, those same youngsters approached us and insisted that the route we were taking was closed off (despite people coming from that direction) and they would show us an alternative route. Fortunately we had Google maps open so we could see they were taking us completely the wrong way. We were warned that this could happen so we were prepared. Would advise planning your return route before leaving or asking the staff for directions back to your accommodation.

Wow wow wow…….totally amazing!!! Don’t be put off by the alleyway leading to this front door, the restaurant is truly wonderful, staff very friendly and attentive, food delicious and setting is magical! Would highly recommend and hope to come back one day!!

Off the main streets, down little streets without shops then across a parking area you'll find Pepe Nero down a narrow street. We reserved a table online and found it during daylight before heading back for the reservation.  Lovely decor. Not all tables are in the same room at the indoor pool/pond. Good menus; one Italian, one Marrakech. Wine menu starting at 26,000DH so over £22 a bottle.  Highly recommend the lemon tart.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Beautiful restaurant located in the outskirts of the Medina of Marrakesh. Simply an outstanding restaurant which combines local cuisine with Italian. Everything is top notch. We ordered Tagliatelle and some Tortellinis both great, an Moroccan white wine and undoubtedly the star of the night an unorthodox creme Brulee. Highly recommended!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrifty Traveler
review: The place is very tastefully decorated and very elegant. Food is excellent and prices reasonable for the quality. We had a mix of Italian and Moroccan food ( Moroccan salad( waiter suggested one for the two of us — comes with several small dishes), a beef tagine and a tortellini with Parmesan sauce. Two glasses of wine, a bottle of sparkling water and two expressos. All for less than 800 MAD (~80 USD) Not easy to find but worth it!
Magic place, very good food. A varied and gourmet offer of Italian and Maricchina cuisine. We had the pleasure of meeting the owner who told us some stories of the riad.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Nature Lover
review_title: Enjoyable family holiday dinner in memorable setting
review: First class service, great food in a beautiful Riyadh. Two good menus to choose from - Italian and Moroccan. Highly recommend!

user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We didn't stay here, simply came here for an evening meal. We found this restaurant from a travel guide and weren't disappointing in the slightest. We booked it through our hotel and a very kind member of staff came out to collect us from our taxi. If you didn't know the restaurant was there, you'd have no idea. We sat inside surrounded by orange trees and beautiful surroundings. The food was sensational and very reasonably priced. Would highly recommend.

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Great Italian food, although you can also choose the Moroccan menu. The setting is very pleasant and altho tucked away the signs to find the restaurant make it easy. Service was good and the Riad atmospheric.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;60+ Traveler
review: We headed out for dinner at this lovely restaurant. We didn’t have a booking but they were able to accommodate the three of us even though it was quite busy. It is licensed so you could order alcohol here. It is also air conditioned which was wonderful and a bit more expensive. I would return.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: The best dinner and setup in all Marocco
review: The food is beyond excellent and service is impeccable. Prices are the same as in europe but for the price you pay you get excellent quality food compared to the other trash food you get in cheap eateries. The place is situated in an alley but our taxi dropped us right infront of the place. The setup of this place is so relaxing, i didnt want to leave. Bit it was our last night as i would have happily returned to eat here.

My wife and I first visited Pepe Nero in 2015 and we were back, this time with friends, to celebrate yet another wedding anniversary.  One of the charms of this restaurant is its location, around a 10 minute walk from the main square through some interesting back streets (mind the speeding mopeds). The restaurant send great directions but if you're a little nervous about finding Pepe Nero they will send someone out to the square to collect you.  The food was delicious and the service was perfect. We chose from both the Moroccan and Italian menus and our friends agreed this was a real gem of a place. Great atmosphere, food and service and the prices are amazing.  So glad we came back and having informed the restaurant at the time of booking that it was our anniversary they supplied a lovely complimentary cake at the end of our meal.  I cannot speak highly enough of this establishment - top class

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: Good for a change to Moroccan food
review: Good for a change to Moroccan food, specially if you like pasta. It was not very-very tasty though but at least different and decent. Opportunity to drink wine!

Excellent food, service and hospitality! We were two couples on vacation from Canada, and all loved the food here. Salads as starters were lovely. I had tortellini for my main, and would highly recommend it - the pasta was freshly made and cooked perfectly. The others all had lamb, and the portions were so large none of them finished their plate. Desserts were delicious and beautifully presented. The only downside, is that smoking is allowed in the restaurant so someone could be smoking next to you while you are eating.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Good food in a beautiful setting.
review: I was staying in the hotel above the restaurant so i maybe a bit bias because i had a good time at the riad. I had 2 dinners during the 3 nights I stayed there. The first night I opted for the Italian menu, after travelling in Morocco for a week during the height of summer and in in the midst of Ramadan, good Italian food was such a welcome change. The second time I was there i chose beef tagine, it was, dare i say, one of the best tagine meal i had.  The setting was beautiful, in the middle of the Riad, you can choose to eat indoor or eating alfresco by the pool. The service was friendly and attentive. Recommended.

review_title: Outstanding Italian and Moroccan courtyard restaurant
review: This restaurant is part of the Riyad al Moussika. It's in the original courtyard of the Riyad and offers both traditional Moroccan and Italian food as the Riyad is owned by an Italian family. You can mix and match courses from both menus as I did. The vegetables are grown on the family's own land outside of Marrakech and are delicious. The restaurant is not that easy to find as its down a tiny back street but it it signposted from the square. The courtyard is beautifully elegant with a lovely water feature. Food and service were outstanding and they serve alcohol even in Ramadam. The restaurant is run by the same efficient,friendly guy who is the senior manager of the Riyad. We were staying at Al Moussika so saved this restaurant for our last night and we weren't disappointed. Some reviews said it was priced but we didn't think it was bearing in mind the far superior quality of food and drink on offer. I had aubergine parmegiana to start and then shared theslow cooked lamb with my husband - delicious. I would 100% recommend this restaurant.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: My wife and I visited having read about it in the your book and on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed.  The setting is wonderful, with beautiful decoration throughout. The staff were very attentive, pointing out little steps and filling out drinks throughout service.  My wife went for the Italian options whilst I went for the Moroccan. Both of us enjoyed our food immensely. The salads were delightful and each stood out as a well prepared/cooked dish. My beef tagine easily being the best I've experienced during my visit, with the meat falling away at a touch. My wife with her Italian dishes assured me the aubergine parmigiana was the best she's had, out of several trips to Italy and excellent restaurants. The pasta dish she had was also great.  Where I feel this missed out was that dessert was not great, but just ok. The dishes were decorated with chocolate and raspberry coulis, which tasted more like sauce for ice-cream. Finally, the service once we had finished seemed to disappear, as it took us quite a long time to get their attention to get the bill. By the time we did, we had both gone off the idea of getting a coffee to end the meal with.  So very close, but otherwise this is a great restaurant with some excellent cooking.

We have had an amazing dinner in a romantic atmosphere. The restaurant is sooo beautiful with perfect service. I own a riad in Marrakech. Our guests love this place too. You’re doing a great job!! I love your maroccan and italian dishes. We’ll be back soon.

If you've eaten lots of tagines on your Moroccan trip and want something different, this is a good option. It is pricier, but in a lovely setting, service is great and they have some good wine. If you're vegetarian, remember to mention this, as they will bring you an amuse bouche with meat in, if you don't. The prawn starter is tasty, but I'd definitely recommend the smoked salmon tartare with avocado and balsamic vinegar, really tasty. The cheesy tortellini is also yummy. Although this restaurant is a little hidden away, there are plenty of signs to point you in the right direction from the main square.

review_title: Good restaurant in a beautiful Riad
review: The restaurant is located inside a beautiful Riad, a little hard to find. The decorations in the Riad are amazing and the seating is wonderful. The food is very nice, but not really exceptional. Very good for a change to the Tajines though1

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: THE best restaurant in Marrakech. As simple as that.
review: It's a convoluted route to get to Pepe Nero, but what a glorious experience when you arrive. We had a week in Marrakech, and this is far and away the best restaurant - infinitely better than the posh restaurants around the main squares and far, far better than the supposedly typical Moroccan eateries within the expensive hotels. It's Italian cooking, and Moroccan cooking - two menus; you take your choice, or mix and match from both. The chef trained in London and Italy, and brought his expertise here. The food is very good, the wine even better (feel free to ask if you can taste before you choose, and the extremely helpful waiters will oblige) and the setting sublime, with rose petals in the central fountain, handy loos off the huge courtyard, interesting little atmospheric side rooms and up-and-down, higgeldy-piggeldy steps and corridors everywhere. Housed within the Riyad al Moussika in Derb Charkaoui, it took us about 20 minutes to walk to the restaurant, down a series of winding alleyways and streets, following the black signs, from Jamaa el Fna. However, it only took us 5 minutes to get back at the end of the evening, as we were allowed to leave via the kitchens and a secret back route! The food is excellent. I began with salmon tartare, the only criticism being that some of the avocado pieces in the assemblage weren't totally ripe. My bride had a starter of warm aubergine - a bit like Turkish aubergine dishes. My main course was tortellini - home made in a rich, creamy parmesan sauce. My bride opted for risotto with shrimp. All dishes top-notch, and very filling. The service is terrific, with sparky, cheeky waiters who love a bit of banter. This is a restaurant to enjoy and experience. Pre-booking essential as it, understandably, sells out most evenings. We had an excellent bottle of Moroccan wine - a 2016 Medaillon cabernet for around £25. Total price for two, including water and service, was about £80 sterling equivalent. If this restaurant was in the UK or Europe, it would be 'bib gourmand' status in the Michelin ratings.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: WOW. WOW. WOW.  I was stunned by the image of this restaurant. A beautiful lay out, not too loud. A really nice but simple touch is that they sell half bottles of wine so you don't have to drink too much just because you paid for it!  Would highly recommend and return if I was in Marrakech again.

This was my favorite place we ate at during our stay in Marrakech. The inside of the riad was so beautiful. The staff was friendly. The food was SO good. I sampled the salmon, beef fillet, lamb, and duck breast. It was all delicious. The duck was amazing. We also had the creme brûlée. We didn’t have traditional Moroccan food, but it is on the menu. Great prices. If you are in the area, you must try this place!

We visited this restaurant in a rainy night so probably we did not see it at its best. It is located not far from Jemaa El Fna/Bahía Palace but the area does not look so safe (be careful)  What it is sure is that, reading the reviews on the internet, I expected something more.  In my opinion, it is an on-average restaurant, with dishes from both the Italian and Moroccan cuisine.

We went there for dinner and after having tajin for the last 5 days we were very happy to get the Italian menu. Unfortunately, it wasn't as good as expected. Ravioli with white parmesan sauce was filled with... yellow cheese, making it all very chewy. The service was rather impersonal and only the surrounding stunned us. They definitely have better marketing than they can deliver in terms of running good restaurant.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Difficult to find, but an amazing beautifull restaurant. We tried the italian food this time. Great, we all had to say. But .... There was only 1 waiter for too many tables He worked very hard to pleases everybody, but that was not working “enough” for us. Little mistakes, but you do not want that in a place like that. Do we come back, yes, we think so.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: We had a lovely meal here, starters were good and my pasta was great after a week of eating tagines and Moroccan food. My daughter really enjoyed her chocolate dessert. Perhaps my only comment was that the place lacked the atmosphere that many of the other restaurants we had visited that week. Perhaps it was the side room we were seated in (however it was nice and quiet in there).
Amazing food, beautiful dining area. We decided to have an Italian meal and could not have loved it more.

review_title: Utterly romantic Italian restaurant in the heart of the medina
review: This is a stunning and very romantic restaurant housed within a jewel-like riad which is tucked away down a narrow alleyway in the heart of the medina. Tables are situated around a pool and a central marble courtyard with a mosaic clad fountain. A large speaker provides some cool background beats. The restaurant offers two menus – Moroccan and Italian – with the ability to mix and match both. The latter offered a welcome break from the traditional tagines. The king prawns with diced tomatoes and cocktail sauce and the eggplant mozzarella for starters were both beautifully seasoned and bursting with flavour and the home made fettucine and tortellini parmesan cream for main brought back fond memories of some of the best Italian pasta houses. There is an extensive wine list although the Moroccan wine is slightly on the expensive side. The only downside was the service which can best be described as unfriendly and unengaging and we felt a little rushed with courses arriving quickly when we had indicated we would like a break or, in the case of the bill, unprompted. It was slightly odd to be taken to a back room to pay the bill by credit card but I had nothing to fear in that all of the staff were extremely courteous and polite. This was our stand out favourite restaurant during our nine night stay in Marrakesh and we cannot wait to return.  Tip: Ignore the young men waiting to greet you when you leave the restaurant who will seek to persuade you to follow them on a different route back to the main square on the basis that the conventional route is closed at night. This is a standard ruse at this (and many other) locations and an attempt to fleece you of your hard earned dirhams……

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler
review: This wonderful restaurant appears to be slightly off the beat and track - but don’t let that put you off. Make it to the end of the alleyway, and you’re in for a treat. The entrance hall of this once huge riad is stunning. Definitely request to be sat around the romantic pool.  We opted for the Italian menu which was very good. The Celery ravioli, although odd sounding, was delicious. The surprise cocktail and appetiser were a lovely surprise.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: Difficult to find - but well worth it. The service was good, and the atmosphere relaxed but stylish. The salmon tartar was wonderfully seasoned and the pasta was very good as well. My husband and I wanted different wines, and they had several options of half bottles.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Walking through the medina was a bit daunting but as we were with friends, they knew the route and we just followed. Well as the doors of Pepe Nero opened my boyfriend and I were gobsmacked. It is truly a beautiful restaurant in the style of a riad and the table were set around the pool. The food was amazing, the service was superb. I have recommended this restaurant to anyone I know travelling to Marrakech - it is definitely a must.

Hard to get a reservation. Nice place with a pool. A bit too preoccupied/stressed service. You get a feeling that they want you to finish your meal and get more customers in. Food was ok. Three main courses and three desserts, water and a bottle if wine was 1150D.

Lovely Riad restaraunt, difficult to find but find it we did. Lovely setting with attentive professional staff. The food was wonderful, tasty and very well presented. We have spent more elsewhere but the standard here was much higher. Risotto and a tagine plus a delightful pastry and cream dessert which we shared. Very good prices for this lovely little hide away.

the Restaurant is really a great place to be. beautieful decorated with small fountain and nice background music. the waiters are very efficient and know their work. high class! they are very friendly. and the FOOD. Delicious. I had an italian Lasagne which was the best I had in my life. and salad for starter = sooo good. Can highly recommend this restaurant
Very busy and cool little place just off the square. Had the tagline and falafel and both were tasty. Would recommend eating here.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: Warm welcome, great salads and tajine, Yassine and team professionals, welcoming and friendly, aware of our every need, almost like homecooking! The kindest team, friendless cat, and excellent food!

review_title: Downstairs cafe more of a snack bar
review: On New Years Day, a Sunday, many restaurants were closed or full but we managed to get a table at this place, just off the main square.  It was busy, with a good atmosphere, and friendly service - good prices but felt more like a snack bar with cool decor in it´s vibe, which will be perfect for some diners as they also offer a variety of meals including sandwiches, paninis, pizzas, burgers and chips.  We shared Moroccan salads (the falafels were very dry), Briouate and Chicken Pastilla which we enjoyed more in other places - but the chicken skewers and chicken wrap were enjoyed by our teenagers.  To be fair, it was only 340DH for a family of five, which was good value.

Great food and Atmosphere! We came as so many good reviews. It lived up to our expectations and more. The food was delicious , staff friendly goid service and the live music was soooo good! What a great evening! We shall be back ! Thank you !

review_title: Go for soup, not for (dry) meat
review: Went there twice. First time had harira soup with bread and both the soup and the bread were really nice so decided to come back for dinner. And I’m sad to write this review but the dinner was disappointing. My mum’s chicken and veg tajine and my chicken pastilla were very dry. My pastilla was so dry I got tired chewing it. There was no sauce whatsover in my mum’s tajine. The flavours were there but it was just so unpleasant to eat dry meat. When asked, I told the waiter the meat was dry and he offered to bring a new one, I had eaten half of my pastilla and wasn’t hungry anymore and I didn’t have hope that another plate of the same food will he any different so I declined his offer. Customer service and music were nice and so was the soup, so go there for that and stay away from meat dishes.
This is a great little place with a great food. Also a good value for money. Excellent for brunch. The coffee is great, too.

We went to a few Instagram Hotspots before and got not really satisfied with the food. We decided to try this place out because it was nearby our riad.  It turned out very well, we had the best couscous here! The stuff was very friendly and helping as well. We would definitely recommend this over all the bad food on the market next to it.  Great job guys!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Everything about our two visits was great. The people, the pasta, the coffee, the bright setting. Kids loved the chicken nuggets. Thanks for the vote if you found this review helpful.

review_title: Perfect place for a quick bit.
review: Such a lovely cafe located near the main square. We ordered some paninis and it was quite late as we just arrived to Marrakech, and the service and quality was very good. I did ask for a vegetable panini and was very tasty and all served with chips. Very cheap! I would not hesitate to eat there again! Thanks!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This restaurant with large patio not only offers really good food (and drinks), but also has a live show and music.

review_title: The meal was ok but not as good as the one our Riad did
review: We'd had a traditional meal in our Riad on the night we arrived, so the next day we checked out Trip Advisor, spotted the Taj was the 4th best, had a good rating, as was located next to the main square.  We were welcomed by the staff in their Moroccan themed uniforms. There wasn't a huge choice on the menu, but some good options.  Our meal was ok and not expensive at all, but i was surprised as the Trip Advisor rating didn't match other restaurant's i've been with the same rating. There was nothing that made me go "wow, that's special", and it wasn't as good as the similar meal i'd had the night before in our Riad.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review: Really pleasant place. The swimming pool, the garden are stunning and the food was really good. Go there!

review_title: Wonderful staff and a good meal
review: The management and the staff really make this restaurant a pleasure at which to dine. It has a beautiful setting by the very large pool and is a tranquil haven with olive and lemon trees in the garden. I had the "Seafood Planche" which was delicious and my husband had the Vegetable Pastille which was not what he was used to with icing sugar on top but he enjoyed it.

review_title: Perfect day away from the crazy of Marrakech
review: My BF and I reviewed Manzil La Tortue before we arrived in Marrakech, we definitely wanted to try out this place. We emailed Paula when we arrived and booked in for the 2 course lunch and pool day for 290DH, included in the price are your sun loungers, towels, afternoon tea/snack and a sun hat! We also organised transfers for 150DH each way. We loved it so much, that we emailed them to book in again a few days later. However, there was a school group booking on the day we wanted so they emailed us to let us know in case we wanted to avoid that day, which goes to show, they wanted us to have a nice relaxing day and not just take our money for a day at the pool - well done!  The food was absolutely delicious and a good portion size. The service was excellent albeit we had to wait a long time for dessert, which was worth the wait!  The infinity pool is huge and very clean, although not heated, which is a great cool down in the heat. MLT really is a beautiful, clean, friendly place to have a chilled day at the pool, if we return to Marrakech we would consider staying here. Highly recommended.  Make sure you book in advance and I would recommend booking the return transfer service for 150DH each way.

We visited Manzil La Tortue for their pool day and lunch, which is excellent value. For 290DH we got two delicious courses each, and use of the pool all day - this also included towels and a late afternoon snack.  The food was absolutely delicious - some of the best we had in Marrakech - and the service went above and beyond. We were there celebrating my birthday and my partner was able to arrange a bottle of champagne with the owner, which they didn't have on their wine list. Nothing was too much trouble and we had a fantastic day.  One thing to note, the pool isn't heated, but that actually makes for a welcome respite from the hot sunshine. It really is a tranquil environment and a fabulous place to have a relaxing day. If we had known about Manzil La Tortue when we were booking our accommodation, we would have definitely booked to stay there. Highly recommended.  Top tip: If you wish to do their pool and lunch day and you're staying in central Marrakech, call up and book their transfer service (costs 150DH each way) to avoid the inevitable haggling with the taxi driver once you arrive!

Hard to find after dark, as taxi barred from square. Eventually found it was behind the Café de France east side of main square, along the alley beside and 100m further on. Small, but with an upper deck, seating 10 tables. Sadly, this was accessed by a very tight spiral staircase, not very suitable for the elderly. Unfortunately, it was pretty full and the service slow. People weren't even served in order. No alcohol, but some nice fruit juices. Decent Moroccan salad starter. The chicken tagine was ok even if the vegetables were overcooked, but the cous cous (also in a tagine) had seriously overcooked, almost unrecognisable, soggy vegetables, and was nearly bereft of its supposed chicken. The one saving grace was that it was very cheap. Not rushing back.

We visited here after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. The restaurant was busy but we managed to get a seat on the terrace. The staff were very friendly. We were quite disappointed with the food which arrived quickly. The chicken pastille wasn’t as tasty or fresh as the ones we have eaten elsewhere at other restaurants. The chicken shawarma was also tasteless & dry. The previous reviews did not match our experience.

Amazing food! Wonderfully friendly and beautiful terrace rooftop. If you are wondering if this place is good - yes! It’s exactly what you hope it is.  Tons of crap tourist food in the square, this is not like that. The Tagine is easily a 9/10. Very very good.

We had lunch up on the roof terrace, which is a good spot. Relaxed, comfortable place and the staff are nice. Good choice of vegetarian options on the menu and we both enjoyed our food - veggie shawarma and veggie tagine. Reasonably priced and good WiFi.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We found this place due to tripadvisor recommendation and we could not be happier with what we received. Food was absolutely delicious and our waiter Mouad went out of his way to take care over us starting with giving excellent recommendation about the food and finishing with almost planning our all day of sightseeing. Bottom line - great place and great people. It was definitely an amazing way for us to be introduced to Moroccan culture.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: Very touristy and can tell us catering to that market but food itself was good and ended up coming back when we had no where else to go. Fig chicken tagine was very yummy

Small place but not hard to find. I was pulled in (nor really :-)) by a friendly waiter and after having read the reviews before I did not hesitate for long. Moroccan salad and really good chicken pastilla were served for an acceptable price. Service was very friendly. This is a place I'd love to come back to !

review_title: Family run restaurant with local cuisine
review: Along a small street leaving from the Place Djama El Fena. We had moroccan food which was very delicious (tagine, skewers and pastilla). Prices were very fair and the people very friendly. Would definitely return.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We came across this cosy cafe restaurant and decided to give it a try... Very friendly welcome from the team. Comfortable seating. Good selection of dishes from snack size sharma kebabs to tagines. All well presented. Everyone enjoyed the food. Ours was the sharma.. One of each.. A chicken and a meat... Served with fries on the side. We were given a taster of lentils and olives.. Which were delicious. We enjoyed our visit. THANK YOU Shokran
Very beautiful restaurant. Both my tajine kefta and my wifes tajine poulet was very good. Crepes was also tasty. Friendly service.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: Small little local place with great food and service
review: We ate here twice during our stay in Marrakech.  Once we had the traditional Moroccan fare with tagines and the likes and the qulaity was far better than what we had in other places. The second time we had more western and Mediterranean food and it was quite tasty.  Both times we had dessert - crepes which were the best we have eaten and divine. You must try this when there.  Excellent service and really well priced compared to other restaurants in Marrakech.

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: The restaurant we meant to go to was full so we ended up here. The young lady who welcomed us and took our order was just lovely. I had the chicken pastille. It was totally delicious. My husband had chicken brochettes which he liked. My dinner was the better if the two. We had mint tea, and our friend had avocado juice, which he really enjoyed. I would have my chicken dish again!

review_title: Enjoy attentive and lovely service in a Morrocan atmosphere
review: We came accross this small snack house when wandering through the medina. They invited us to come in and we were not disappointed. They offer a good variety on the menu. Quite a lot of vegetarian options as well. Good juices and a nice taste for a very reasonable price. Also the entourage - both the rooms as well as how they serve the dishes - is more than just a snack bar. They also have a floor upstairs but we didn't check that out as it is much more fun to stay close to the street where things happen. The staff is polite, multi-lingual (French, Spanish as well as English) and attentive. This is certainly a good stop for a small meal.

The first floor is by a busy pedestrian street with lots of life and motorcycles. They have a special vegetarian menu. Dissapointing thou, the serving took a very long time. My seafood soup was more a pale tasteless porridge without seafood. Vegetable soup OK taste, but with stews. Tajine with meat and raisins, OK taste but the meat could be more tender, and the bread was dry.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Searched Trip Adviser for restaurants in Marrakesh and decided to try Cuisine de Terroir. We were certainly not disappointed and would recommend this place to any visitor who wishes to taste authentic Moroccan food. Found the restaurant easily even though it’s situated within the Medina. The open interior is basically but comfortably furnished. The staff including the proprietor were all friendly, polite and efficient. English was spoken by all. The food was delicious. We had the tagine of beef, prunes and almonds / very tender and tasty and the chicken pastilla / sweet and fragrant. Moroccan sweets were ordered to complete the meal. The meal was value for money. An excellent choice.

user_tags: Like a Local;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We had dinner and lunch at Cuisine de Terroir on two consecutive days. The food was absolutely excellent. Moustapha was present at dinner time, and he gave personal attention to us. The service was great. You must try out this restaurant if you are staying in the medina in Marrakesh.
Lovely friendly staff - thanks to you all. Nice quiet calm ambiance and beautiful location/surroundings. We ate there every night of our stay.

What an evening at Angsana restaurant ! Such a charming location with the inner courtyard lights in the evening... As it was cold, we were placed by the fire and it made the dinner amazing. Chef came out to greet and we could congratulate him on his excellent dishes... Service by Yussef was extremely engaging and always attentive. Well done !

review_title: Great terrasse restaurant with live music
review: Just had a great dinner on the terrasse with local live music: great atmosphere We tried several local specialties like seffa, tanjia, jawhara = all delicious Special mention to our top waiter HAMZA!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler
review: After 2012, 2013 and 2015, we were now back in El Kennaria Hotel in 2019. This time we discovered the new restaurant. The restaurant offers good Moroccan cuisine (tajines, couscous, grills...). Friendly staff and very good service - thanks Hamza. Breakfast on the roof terrace, in the evening in the restaurant. Very nice location.
Everything was great: the cooling mist, drinks, shisha, food and service. We came back a second time.

user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: Hamza was our waiter, his service was wonderful and the food delicious! Highly recommend this restaurant. I had Chicken and lemon tagine. Very close to the night market and souk too. Thank you 😊
the owner and staff of the restaurant, are very helpful, I was able to order falafel which was great for me as I'm a vegan. The restaurant was clean recommended to others

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Recommended by our hotel, we had high expectations, bit at the same time a bit afraid it would be more a scenic restaurants to please tourists eager to get an exotic feel than a gastronomic experience to remember. Unfortunately we were not wrong. Depending on the dishes, the food between good and very good, not the best in the neighbourhood. But the worse part was definitely the service. After we were seated we waited for about 20 min before the menu was brought o us and whenever the dishes were served it seemed the waiter was always giving instructions to other rather than paying any attention to us (and looking at other tables this seemed to be the norm in the place). Overall a good experience in a fabulous setting, but could have been much more.
We had high expectations given the reviews but were disappointed. Tables crammed together. All tourists. Slow service once it gets busy. Average food, with poor veggie options.

review_title: Excellent food and decor but mob of teenagers outside the restaurant harassing tourists for money ruined the evening.
review: The food and decor at this place are excellent, with live musicians in the front room. This place is a little gem. It’s very unfortunate that it is hard to find and if you are not accompanied by a guide or a local, you are followed by a mob of very aggressive teenagers who harass and threaten you until you give them money. We had a staff member from the restaurant standing a couple of meters this happened who just watched and did nothing to help. This is frankly appalling from the restaurant staff. The restaurant knows full well that the mob outside is vile and aggressive and they know the place is very hard to find on your own, but they didn’t offer to come pick us up from our Riad or anything when we called to book a table. It’s only when we complained on arrival that they offered that one of the waiters walked us back to our Riad after the meal. We give 1 star just because of this incident. Moroccan police don’t seem to care about these sort of things and the restaurant turns a blind eye. We will never return and we advise people to go either with a taxi or accompanied by a local for safety.

We went here one night as it was very convenient to our Riad and we’re not disappointed. Although typical Moroccan food there was some variation with my wife getting fish tagline which was great. I had lamb tagline that was very good. Service was excellent and wine, beer and cocktails were available. I would eat here again for sure

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: If you are looking for a beautifully restored Riad for dinner in the middle of an interesting neighbourhood this is the place to go. But this time, two years after my first visit, the staff seemed less attentive. Maybe because I was alone? The couscous was good but not as good as last time, a bit bland, where did the Moroccan spices gone: catering too much to too many international tourists? I hope my next visit will be better!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Dinner was a delight. Yes, it is a little touristy, but the food and the service are superb. The warm vegetable mezza was the best. Our entree's were well-presented and very tasty. You can't go wrong eating here.

review_title: Not happy with it - better skip it
review: The restaurant is located in a very "suspicious" and extremely difficult area to be found. When we made the booking through its official site, we were impressed by the fact that not only got a reconfirmation at once (this is plus) but also they arranged someone from the restaurant to meet us at a gate and escort us to it. Obviously the reason of that was that we had to walk for 10 minutes in "suspicious" dark narrow streets only with locals around. Upon arrival we were proposed to have a drink on the roof top (quite indifferent place) where we had to wait for 40 minutes our drinks to arrive. Pretty hungry we decided to go down stairs for our dinner. The salads (a variety of local preparations that they call salads with beans, pumpkin and much more unknown items ) were not tasty. The main dishes were poor and mixed up my order as the waiter's English were poor. After being complaint about dish which was not the desired one and having wait for another 20 minutes, they delivered to me again the a wrong order. It was then when I realized that I had to eat a snack at the hotel on the way back. Did not like the ambiance (too dark) and ........ The only positive was that someone escorted us back to the gate on the way out and managed to escape from there. SORRY BUT ..... NO RECOMMENDATION SHOULD BE GRANTED TO THIS RESTAURANT Missed to mention that they offered complimentary a kind of desert for the inconvenience

Beautiful skyline views from the roof top bar. Fabulous service and wonderful cuisine. Our best in the whole Médina. The staff delivered exceptional service throughout the evening. The addition of a Belly Dancer just made our night. Thank you.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This restaurant is set in a nice riad-type setting. Service was good, but the food was just ok. We had better harira and tagines at Le Table du Palais and Ksar essaoussan. Dar Zellij did have a belly dancer, so that was different and fun (though probably not very authentic).

This place is only reachable by walking and if you don't know your way around you better take a guide to be able to find it. Before diner go up to the roof terrace nd enjoy a nice drink, it's worth it! The dining was great, specially if you look for a place where the music is not so loud all the time, of course they also have a show with belly dancers but after that at least you will be able to have a conversation again. Food was great as well.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Full of tourists who use TripAdvisor, but the food is good
review: The evening we went, the restaurant clientele was 100% tourists/foreigners. I'm sure that could be due to a number of factors, but it was an interesting observation to me. That being said, the food was delicious. We sat in an enclosed courtyard, and it was a lovely setting.  TIP: they may ask if you want to go to the rooftop for a drink. If it's cold, the entire thing is tented up, so you see absolutely nothing, i.e. no view of anything. It's quite a few steps to get there, so if you are not inclined to do some random exercise, skip this.
At least I found a restaurant in the Medina which serves beer (€ 5,00 per o,25 ltr. local Heineken can)!! The typical Maroccan dishes were good.

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: If you are looking for a beautifully restored Riad for dinner in the middle of an interesting neighbourhood this is the place to go. The staff was particularly friendly and attentive. The food was excellent (especially the lamb shoulder). The atmosphere is great especially in the front room with life Morrocan traditional ( soft) music.

We ate here 3 times during one week... Very reasonably priced, simple and tasty food. Excellent Chicken and Lemon Tajine, pastilla and salads. Friendly and efficient service. The place to go when you just want some good food without a hassle, be it local style or western. Clientele mostly tourists but don’t let it discourage you :)
Restaurant seems very popular among tourists. Almost all tables were occupied around 19:00-20:00. All was tasty. Maybe soup could be better.

We came here during our stay in Marrakech, and it was great although a little difficult to find at first. It's really good when you fancy something that is less traditionally Moroccan and we chose to go for two pizzas, a chicken one (45dh) and a vegetarian one (50dh), both of which were really good however by the end you started to notice the dough was quite sweet which made it difficult to finish it all. The price was really good and they had a great selection of juices and soft drinks which were also really nice. You also got bread and dip before your meal included in the price with no additional cover charge. The service was really good and prompt too and the lady who served us spoke good English and was very polite. The restaraunt was clean and we would recommend going here for sure.
Very popular place. Prepare to wait. Nice place with romantic music. Our pizzas were big and delicious. Service was friendly and good. Cheap prices.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: A very small restaurant within a short distance to the Place Jemaa El Fena. It is not easy to find inspite on the mail road. It opens at 1.00pm and closes 10.00pm. It is closed on Wednesday. There were two small tables on the ground floor with the main open kitchen behind them. On the first floor there were10 small tables for 4 people each.  Be prepared to wait a while as the food is freshly prepared. It is worth the wait as the food is delicious. I have been there on two occasions and on both time there was only one waitress who spoke very good English and was rushed off her feet. The local dish which I chose called Tajine was lovely. I chose a Tajine chicken which had fresh vegetables - runner beans, potatoes, carrots, olives (photo enclosed). This was my first Moroccan dish and I was not disappointed.  On the second time I had a freshly made pizza and it was just as enjoyable as the traditional Moroccan dish. Everything on it was fresh and it tasted wonderful. It tasted better than the ones that I had in Rome and Sicily.  This little restaurant gets very busy. I would highly recommend going early as possible otherwise there can be an hour waiting time. Diners do seem to be in a hurry to leave.  You will not be disappointed as it is a great place to enjoy home cooking at a very reasonable price.

We were four people and all of is ordered pizza. Service is great and food is delicious! Pizza was homemade. Cheap prices. We had a bean paste, olives and bread as a free starter. She also gave us a couple of tips for shopping. She's a very kind women. Also gave me some herbs as I was quite sick. Would definatly recommend!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Our meal here was 'fine'. I don't really have anything bad or anything particularly good about it. We were a bit taken aback by the crazyness of Marrakesh on our arrival and this was close by so chose to eat here. I had a tagine which was nice and my hubby had pizza which he was pleased with. It's not a big place so you need to book or be prepared to wait. There are definitely nicer tagines in Marrakesh but you will still have a good meal if you choose to eat here.

Tiny place that I walked passed several times in this "industrial" street, otherwise the home of tyre sellers, watch sellers, carpet sellers and the like. There are only 24 seats, mostly on the mezzanine area. It appears basic but noticeably clean and tidy. The menu is a blend of Moroccan and international with everything from pizzas, pastas, burgers, salads, traditional Moroccan, crepes, soups. I enjoyed a really good home made courgette and vegetable soup followed by spaghetti bolognese and fruit salad and mint tea (served with complimentary Moroccan biscuits/pastries). As it got busier there was pressure on the speed of service - but I was in no hurry - but all through there was a pride and passion for what was being served and how it was presented. Very inexpensive, an extensive menu and caring service made this place instantly likeable. Good on ya Yassine!

user_tags: Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: Excellent food and an outstanding stuff
review: We found the place on one of our trips and exhausted by hours of walking in 50 degree hot were surprised by the waitress who treat us like at home. She customized the food for our son and advise us what to choose. Everything was Delicious and the atmosphere was great. We came back another day just to confirm the service is perfect!

review_title: Good food but service very disappointing
review: We decided to eat here one evening for a change and chose it because of good reviews on Tripadvisor - the reviews do warn of slow service so we were prepared for a bit of a wait. When we arrived at around 8.30pm they put up the closed sign, saying they were full, but they said we could come back after half an hour. We sat at an outside table and had some juice while we waited and were then invited in. Our tagine order was taken promptly (our first choices were not available) and, while we waited, we were served breads and olives and dips, which were delicious. The 'meat' tagine was tasty though the meat was very fatty. Our table was cleared quickly but no one came near us after that; there were five, then four tables in use upstairs and the waiter brought dishes to the table near the top of the stairs several times but made avoiding eye contact into an art! After about three quarters of an hour we, and one of the other diners, got fed up and went downstairs to settle our bills and leave. The restaurant is extremely basic, but that was OK; the food we got to eat was very good but the service was just off-putting. The two people in the kitchen looked busy but we would have been happy to wait for desserts if someone had just glanced over to see if we wanted anything. Really disappointing experience

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: 5 star food and drink despite the cafe appearence!
review: We found the Chez Yassine whilst walking around the back of the Medina Gardens Hotel. What a lovely little café! It looks run down ( as does the area) but don't go by appearances. we were surprised by the quality of the food and coffee. It just goes to show that even though a place looks tatty it can excel in food and service. Give it a try! You will be pleasantly surprised.
I saw this place on tripadvisor and we decided to give it a try! Very small restaurant with friendly staff Great prices - see menu on my photos Wish we had found it sooner!

review_title: The best I had in Marrakech
review: I have to confess that during the whole trip sometimes I really felt issues when finding a place where to eat. That was resolved when we met Chez Yassine! Unfortunately we went there just twice but with it's great menu and excellent local food we would have visited more times... but we didn't find out about before our last night in Marrakech. The staff was SUPER nice! Excellent prices, clean (kitchen it's open for everyone to see it) and tasty food!

we discovered Chez Yassine on our visit to Marrakech last year and loved it so much we went back there 3 times on our visit in January. The food is so tasty and brilliant value for money. You get free bread olives and dips and the dips are always really tasty. The staff are lovely and friendly. A great place to eat
Food was good, fresh and well cooked. Had an authentic feel to it. Prices very reasonable. Half the price of what you will pay in the main square. Friendly people.

This restaurant was gorgeous, from the lovely decor, beautiful menu to the welcoming and great service.  The food was delicious, beautifully presented but also the most delicious meal I’ve had in a while  Would highly recommend this place. We took my 14 year old daughter who does have quite grown up taste. You wouldn’t take young kids here as it’s not that sort of place.  If you want a delicious meal and lovely experience then we highly recommend. The service is brilliant, very attentive.

review_title: Lovely food, service a little slow though
review: A lovely restaurant that we visited based on the #1 place to eat on TripAdvisor, to celebrate my wife’s birthday and a change from the hotel buffet.  Food was lovely, well priced but the service was very slow, not sure if this was intentional or just short staffed. We arrived for our booking at 8pm and took nearly 3 hours for 2 courses.  But, I would recommend a visit if you want a nice restaurant in Marrakesh.

Even though our reservation seemed to have been lost, they graciously seated us. The incredible hard working staff served a shrimp/ calamari appetizer after a small plate of mint flavored tzatziki and pita. Main courses were sea bream and John Dory, both of which were flavored in a very different but delicious way. This food according to the waiter has Moroccan, Lebanese and Turkish influences. The Sauvignon Blanc was excellent. I’d take off half a star for the temperature of the food (not quite hot enough for me) but overall a wonderful dinner and would eat there again. Make reservations

Lovely food, fresh, modern and in a wonderful setting. Service was hands on without being too much and everything was very reasonably priced. Portions were large and with little extras we were stuffed by the end! The wine and food were delicious, we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it.
Amazing food without being using tons of carbs like other places in the city. I would suggest to visit it at least once in Marrakesh. The tomatoes may be the best I've ever tried. Great rest!

user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Food was good and service was great. Prices were reasonable for the district. Outdoor setting is nice but smoking is allowed.
We absolutely loved this place. The food was delicious and at a very affordable price. It’s super close to the market and yet in a quiet and safe location.

We ate here on our first night in Marrakech, the restaurant was very busy but we managed to get a table. The staff were very friendly & the food was very tasty. Just off the main square & easy to find. We have been back again as the food was one of the best meals we ate whilst in Marrakech & ordered different dishes which were equally delicious. If you are in Marrakech you should definitely visit!

user_tags: Vegetarian;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Decent food and good service, but it's not the best of veggie couscouses I've eaten and was the priciest in 6 mths if being in Morocco.

We found the place here, on Tripadvisor. Thank you. We were very satisfied. Great value for money, nice food and a cozy atmosphere. We were hungry and didn't have time nor will for exploring, so Trip Advisor once again become very useful!

Extremely busy place. Goats cheese starter and chicken mushroom sauce were both nice, worth a return visit for these. Other items were a little bland. Very generous portions, 3 of us shared 2 set meals and still could not finish. Excellent value at around £10 for all 3 courses.

review_title: A very nice place for an informal lunch when visiting the souks
review: Simple and no frill, warm welcome and tasty food. The staff is friendly and speaks several languages. A truly good place in an environment where tourist traps abound.

We ended in this little cute restaurant next to our Riad, the reviews were excellent and we definitely agree! We took “Le tajine des gazelle” with a mix of dry fruits (apricot, almond, lemon) and a traditional couscous. The plates are generous and homemade, so savoury! For 10€ you will enjoy the plenty of Marrakech. Waiters are so kind! You have to try this amazing little restaurant!

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Ate here three times during our stay. Food was excellent, and the portions large ( Be careful how much you order ). Service was efficient and friendly, there was a mix up with our desserts, due to me changing my mind, but was resolved quickly with no fuss. Prices are very reasonable, set 3 course menu 90 Dr. We had 2 set meals, and drinks for about 300 Dr. ( About £24 ). For very good reasons, it is a very popular restaurant, so be sure to book. No reservations for lunchtime, you just have to be lucky. Hope you like pink!
The food here was very good. Tasty and good value, service was good as well. Overall, I would recommend it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Family Vacationer
review: We ate here twice the food was of a good quality and the staff where helpful, all of our food was delicious and well presented , and good value for money

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review: Very fast, good, delicious. Tajin in the town are best, the service is european, but really polite. Recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;60+ Traveler
review_title: Great good value food in a buzzing atmosphere
review: We arrived at this restaurant to find that they were fully booked except for one table, which we took eagerly!  They seemed to have found the right balance: great food throughout; efficient and freindly staff; good location; multi-cultural clientele; great value (we paid 299 dirhams for a 3-course meal for 2).  Go if you can, but try and book ahead.

We stumbled across his restaurant by chance at lunchtime. They were busy so we joined the small queue and waited for 15 minutes. They gave us a glass of complementary fruit juice as we waited which was lovely. In summary this place is excellent! The staff were very friendly and efficient. The food was really excellent, tasty, hot and inexpensive. I recommend trying the specialty dishes, ours were great. We hope to go again tomorrow. Try it, you won’t be disappointed. Thank you to the team that work there Chapeau!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker
review_title: Nice place to grab a bite!
review: We ordered the tajine menus and they were very delicious. The service was quick and pleasant. We enjoyed!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker
review: Delicious and good portions, complimentary little snack if the staff likes you. The tajins and couscous are delicious. Harira is superb also. Dont get scammed at the food stalls at the square, they are 10-20 dirhams cheaper but tasteless and kid sized portions are served! We ate there almost every day at least once!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover
review: We stayed in a riad close to the place, so after a little research this place was well voted on web, so we decided to try. The restaurant is very small and cozy. All nice decorated with this bright pink. Menu easy with typical dishes, they also hAve a set menu, where u can pick one starter, one main and one dessert at 95dhr. So u will feel full with a small amount. I had the fried feta with salad (really nice), then cous cous veg, and dessert creps with nutella. Waiters very attentive and courteous.  Nice one

It’s a great place..for everything. Nothing is wrong, starting from the service: they will take care about you since the first time you seat down! Location is..pink!ahahah..not really man color but really really nice! Food is incredible!!I took tajine with beef, almonds and prune. Paradise! My gf took a soup, wonderful!! Is just little high price compared to peers, but quality of food and service is even 10 times more!!then great value for price you will pay (still under 10€ each..).

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This was one of our favorite places for dinner during our visit - we had dinner here three nights.  The food and service - especially the service, were A+. The gentlemen were always welcoming, ensuring all guests were taken care of, even if they were waiting to be seated. Welcome smoothies and smiles each time. On that note - do make reservations as you may be turned away if they're fully booked which was almost every night.  Tagine and couscous were some of the best we had. Prices are super reasonable, portions are more than enough, and their whiskey (Moroccan mint tea) was always yummy.  Pay them a visit!

review_title: Really nice food and friendly staff
review: Great food ( beef couscous, chicken tagine). A bit more expensive than the corner cafe but still good value.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Thrifty Traveler
review_title: Traditional food at a decent price...
review: Firstly, make a reservation beforehand otherwise you’ll be in for a long wait. Also, unless you’re really famished skip the starter because the portions are large so you’ll probably struggle to finish it. Because they’re usually busy expect a long wait for the food.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Couldn't praise enough this little gem of a restaurant. Went for dinner when in Marrakesh after having read other reviews. Didn't regret a bit! We didn't reserve and were really lucky we came early (around 7pm) to get a table. Many people came in after us and were turned down. Do make a booking. It's cosy inside, the service was fantastic, both manager and waiters were checking from time to time if everything was ok. Actually everything was more than ok - so delicious! Try their pastilla - thinnest filo pastry almond and chicken pie - it's so good. I've had the Gazelles tagine sweet/salty, loved and ate everything. Reasonable priced - our bill for 2 people based on main course, 2 mint teas and 1 starter shared came to 230 Dirhams that is equivalent to £18. Like most other restaurants in town, unless it's a hotel, they don't serve alcohol. It's not far from Jamal el-Fna so when you've had enough of wandering about, it's a great place o recharge the batteries.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Thrifty Traveler
review: First of all if you want to eat in the evening here you are advised to book as it is a very popular place. The three course set dinner menu is superb, tasty, good portion size and best of all an excellent price. The service is spot on friendly and welcoming, quick and attentive with great background music, this is one of the best of its kind in Marrakech and well worth visiting.

We got there by chance, only to discover the best place we have had lunch in Marrakech. Tajine, both beef and chicken, are tender, tasty and have so much meat that is enough for two. They are served with cous-cous which has a subtle flavour. Fruit salad comes accompanied by two pieces of Moroccan pastries. Waiters are pleasant, speak English and French and the service is efficient. Overall, an enjoyable experience.

Hands down the best meal I've ever had in my life. It is amazing. They do a set 3 course meal for 95 Dirham which is about £8. The staff are so so so so friendly. You need to pre-book for a night or two in advance as they never have walk in space. You just have to go, its amazing!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Had finner here a rainy night - arrived at 2030pm and the small, cramped place was FULL. Had to wait 15min, but worth the while. Foods are delicious, drinks are non-alco as in everywhere in Marrakech, but delicious, set menus are a bargain at DIR 95 for set course. Great value, tasty, fresh and filling. Service is at tentative and competent, but - of course, very busy. You are seated somewhat cramped on small chairs, but you will forgive once your meal is derved. Highly recommended (and popular!)

Thank you TA, I read the reviews and we visited a couple of days ago... the 95dh menu was amazing value, I had the pastille which was so tasty, followed by the kofta tagine, which was just right, my husband had the chicken couscous which was huge.... all nicely served and piping hot. The staff were attentive and friendly and we sat outside for a great atmosphere... even the tiny WC was clean and fresh smelling, not always the case in Morocco!  I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant and will visit again...

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review_title: Great taste with a big portion
review: Moroccan salad, chicken couscous, and fresh fruit salad all tasted great. The staff were really friendly.

Certainly the best restaurant in category VALUE FOR MONEY. You are best sticking to Tajines and Couscous. All are excellent and the portions are really big. Salads are good too - the Pastilla was unfortunately very dry. The Brochettes were somewhat disappointing as the seemed to come out of the deep fryer. The guys in service do an excellent job. Efficient an friendly. If you stick to the good dishes you won’t be disappointed.

review_title: Nice place, nice staff, nice food and nice price
review: One of my friend told me to try La Cantine des Gazelles, and i did it ! I really Thanks my Marrocan friend who told me good things about this amazing restaurant. The staff is so helpful and the food is just amazing. I highly recommend the restaurant, we tried the chicken couscous, and it was incredible :)

review_title: Best Tangine of my trip - but bring local currency
review: With a rocky start to my solo trip to Marrakech, there came a point where I just wanted a good meal and to call it a day. I stumbled upon this place and, lucky for me, I ended up with a fantastic Beef Tagine that easily became the highlight of my day. The serve was a bit lacking, but mainly due to the prime time of dinner. Let's face it, I didn't have anywhere else to be anyway.  The restaurant is colorful and charming and very well priced. Note that this place takes cash only, so no cards. Euro and local currency only. I'll gladly come back before my trip ends.

La Cantine des Gazelles is a quaint little restaurant just around the corner from the Jemaa el F'na, with a friendly atmosphere with excellent prices. However, I ordered the vegetarian tagine and was very disappointed! It was incredibly plain and merely consisted of cooked vegetables. The vegetables were lovely but there wasn't a hint of sauce so I wouldn't even call it a tagine. I had to add salt and pepper to give a hint more flavour. The meals containing meat were of a much better quality. We tried a few restaurants in the same area and there are much better options for vegetarians in places nearby.

review_title: great food but need to book
review: food is great but yes, service can be a bit slow. Portions here are generous. Both the soup of the day & the trio of salads were delicious as starters. Chicken tangine was OK but the apple crumble was superb. Do make reservations as you'll probably be turned away if you just turn up on the night

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;60+ Traveler
review: We had lunch here – partly because some of our group wanted a change from cous cous or tagine, It was a good choice. The food was fresh and tasty (and generous), my burger was tasty and had plenty of salad and fries. Pizzas were good too. Service was pleasant and professional, though not very quick – of course, that doesn’t really matter in this city… Coffee was decent, too.

Really the best place in Marrakech! Portions are huge, prices are very normal. You can take dishes separately, or you can took a "menu" of 3 dished - starter, main meal and desert. I strongly recomend salad with goat cheese and tajine with beef. We live in Marrakech 5 dsys, but here came 2 times in a row. Maybe we will go there and tomorrow. Staff is very friendly an polite. If you want to come here for evening - better take a reservation. Tottaly worth to come.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Make sure you book a table as part way through our meal we noticed a queue of people waiting to get in. The have a great 85 dirham menu. Unfortunately I really wanted the beef tagine and this is not included on that menu. I had the pastilla for starter which is so generous and filling it could easily be shared between two people. My tagine was wonderful with the beef falling to pieces. Make sure you ask what the specials are. The service is excellent and they speak very good English which was certainly required when a rather fussy group arrived and wanted things cooked a particular way. It can be a little difficult to find so keep to the right in Jemaa el-fna, and when you get to a crossing with the Berber market signposted left and a street sign on the right saying Rue Kennaria turn down this alley and it is a few minutes along on the left hand side.

I highly recommend this restaurant. Even though it is highly ranked on TA, we were able to get a table for three at dinner time immediately. Every dish we tried was incredible. One of us even teared up as she tried the creamy chicken curry. We also ordered the couscous and pastilla -- they were equally amazing. We're already planning on returning after for dinner after our desert tour.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This place was closed when we came here the first time so we went two days later and it was packed. We had to come back half an hour later but it was definitely worth it. We order the 3 course menu for 85 dirhams and everything was so delicious. I had the goat cheese and mint salad , then the chicken curry and as dessert I ordered ice cream. The staff was very friendly, the friendliest I've ever experienced in Morocco.

review_title: Very reasonable price with good portions
review: You need to book in advance as this place is always packed. Unless you are very hungry, don't order the set menu. The portions are quite big. I had the chicken Tajine with pruneaux, abricots and raisins. It is called Tagine des gazelles. You will love it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Wow. A modern twist on the generous multi-course Moroccan dinner service: multiple bite-sized starters, choose a pastilla and then choose from unique offering of tagines and entrees plus a dessert. They serve Moroccan wines that are very good. Every dish was incredible -- I had a sea bass tagine that was so good I ate every bit. The courtyard setting is simply amazing, so gorgeous. Live traditional musicians play. Was with friends, but this is obviously a special occasion spot, it's very romantic. They celebrated some birthdays too. See photos, my words don't do justice.

I met Chef Moha while doing Masterchef Maroc and of course I visited his restaurant, a unique place to appreciate the excellence of Moroccan cuisine. A charming place with family service. A hug Chef Moha.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Wonderful food, excellent service just at the edge of the Medina. It is a prix fixe menu, unless you have lunch. Not cheap, but well worth the price.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Vegetarian;Foodie;Like a Local
review: I ate there with my friends on first and last day of my one week marocan adventure. Definitely best by far. Foie Gras with couscous topped everything else in the country. The ambiance around the pool with the tropical bamboos and the African live band added some more flavor to the whole.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: This place is good if you like to spend your time with other tourists. The service is okay and the food aswell. An expensive and unimaginative place. We prefer the authentic restaurants more.
We ordered from the set menu, fish and meats, vegetables as sides, ending with choice of desserts that were absolutely delicious.

The restaurant is really nice we did eat outside they have a nice swimming pool and there were 2 people doing music. The stuff is really friendly. We had a menu the starter was a variety of 14 salads they were good and tasty.

review_title: The best quality and technically intelligent food we had
review: Highly recommended. This was not our favourite restaurant, but it was the best food for complexity and quality. The starter platters were excellent, really very good indeed. You choose either hot or cold and about 8 mini tasters arrive. All are delicious. We have mains of Lamb tagine and fish fillet and again they were very good.  The setting is lovely and unique. The pool, bamboo and creeping flowers giving it an African cheque feel similar to Senegal. It's more of a courtyard than riad and it benefits from it. If going in the evening book to make sure you are outside, but during the day we were able to just turn up.  The waiters english is not so good, this is very much a French resturant, but you'll not have any problems. The staff were freindly, welcoming and as the resutant emptied they let us sit on and read with mint tea as they reset for the evening around us.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: lovely garden, nice pool, vast array of starters, good tagine and couscous to accompany. Chef Moha made the effort to tour the tables and talk to guests. All very civilised.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Really enjoyed this traditional Moroccan restaurant!
review: Visiting Marrakech is quite daunting when it comes to eating out. There are so many restaurants and tons that claim to be offering good local cuisine. As someone who spends quite a bit of time there I would highly recommend the food at Dar Moha. It is good quality food and the service is excellent. Get a table outside on the terrace by the pool. Many locals eat here also which is always a good sign!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review_title: Great fun on a semi-fixed menu but lovely
review: The dinner menu is fixed insofar as choices are limited to 2 or 3 each course. Starters are included and are loads of little dishes all of which are miraculously tasty and well prepared. Main courses are good. High level of competency In a delightful setting. Well worth a visit but you will come out stuffed. A la carte is at lunchtimes - odd.

We walked to Dar Moha after wandering through the Jardin Marjorelle gardens for the morning. The location is lovely, with tables around a nice courtyard pool. The food was very tasty and good, but maybe a bit overpriced. However, for the ambience and setting, it was a very nice stop.

Dar Moha is simply beautiful. If the setting wasn't enough, the food is outstanding. We had the 14 light salads (pre-starter) which were delicious! There is almost too much food to try but all dishes were delicious. I then opted for the sea bass tagine which was a delight, and then the sorbet dessert. The wine was also exquisite. The ambience was helped by a sitar player in the far corner of the restaurant, and later followed by a pair of traditional Moroccan musicians. The restaurant is beautiful; the staff attentive and helpful. Would recommend everyone visits Dar Moha when in Marrakech. It's an absolute treat.
