this is a nice restaurant , great outdoor sitting in an old palace turned into restaurant by a famous Moroccan chef good food tast different i loved the ribs

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;60+ Traveler;Luxury Traveler
review: Higher end Morroccan cuisine restaurant in the medina with delicious tanjine and attentive waiters. Restaurant has numerous small rooms and an expansive covered courtyard area with pool. Outside of the restaurant is very nondescript, but inside is delightful.

user_tags: Foodie;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Lovely meal, served by delightful staff with great laid back entertainment. A really delightful venue. Book ahead and try for a table around the pool. Very romantic. My gluten intolerance was considerately catered for. The 14 miniature salad hors d'oeuvres were delicious. Great night.

We found this place by chance, loved it. The staff were really friendly and had a laugh with us. The place is stunning and the food was outstanding. Set menu/price, very good value. Before you get your starter you get 19 little Morrocan starters, beautifully done. Very relaxing. Would recommend. I had the sea bass which was beautiful.

review_title: One of the best meals in Morocco
review: We ate here our first night, as was recommended by our guide. We loved everything about it. The food was amazing. They actually give you two rounds of salads (hot and cold) to sample before your meal. We were very well fed. The ambiance was also lovely. It is not cheap, but you definitely get what you pay for here.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Unique experience from a master chef Moha service atmosphere from riyad water flowers very welcoming professional staff selection of famous moroccan cuisine enjoy the night there nice live song from a band beautiful night mille et une nuit unfogettable dinner
Beautiful setting and great food. Lots of interesting sides and salads good service but reasonably expensive. This is a special occasion restaurant but definitely worth a visit.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: very tasteful moroccan cuisine; come with an empty stomach! beautiful surrounding. I definitely recommend this restaurant

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Like many others we were recommended this restaurant by our hotel. It is now owned and run by master and celebrity chef Mohamed Fedal. The property is typical of a property that from the outside looks very ordinary but inside lies a wonderful courtyard with pool. Many of the tables are set around the pool. The courtyard has been decorated in the YSL blue of Majorelle gardens to reflect this was once owned by the designer Balmain a friend of YSL. The meal of an evening is a set course as is many restaurants of this type. But it's good value at 530dh per person. Service good and friendly with all night entertainment around the pool. Go try it.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: The food is ok and the atmosphere is one where they obviously send only tourists here. The live entertainment was good, avoid if you want a non-touristy experience.

review_title: Good ambiance, disappointing food, overrated overall
review: We visited Dar Moha this week after it was recommended to us by a pair of friends we met in the desert. The restaurant itself is cozy and the seating around the pool was very pretty. We were impressed with the service at first and enjoyed the musical entertainment. The price of the fixed menu shocked us though - 530Dh per person! This was more than double we had paid for any meal yet in Morocco!! We hadn't ate out much though, so we figured it must be worth it. It started off strong with at least 14 Moroccan salads & little appetizers brought to our table which were tasty and different. We ordered the pigeon pastry for our 2nd course, and expected a savoury pastry. It was coated in icing sugar & cinnamon which was unexpected. For our main, we had the lemon chicken and lamb tagines. Again, neither was extraordinary. My lamb was tough and tasteless. We'd had much better of both dishes for a fraction of the price at our riads. In total with wine, our bill was 695Dh each. We were allowed to pay by credit card, but the waiter miscalculated and undercharged our cards without us realizing. I was talking to the head waiter before we left, when the hostess came over and demanded the extra 100Dh. The head waiter took off and neither apologized for what was their mistake. We had also left a generous 150Dh tip for the server. Needless to say, we left with a very bad taste in our mouths. Save your money & don't go. Better food with equally good atmosphere can be had elsewhere I'm sure.

review_title: Beautiful food in a beautiful Riad
review: Owned by a Celebrity chef in Morocco, the food keeps up the reputation. The restaurant was busy and reservations are recommended. WE got a nice table by the pool. Being, a vegetarian, they were very accommodating to my dietary needs. they have a set menu and each dish is great. Good wine selection and decent service. Definitely a must visit in Marrakesh.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Dar Moha was our final choice for our last night in Marrakesh, after reading different reviews and looking at their website. The restaurant won't disappoint you, since it is very elegant with a beautiful garden/pool. We had a table by the pool that I have requested. The service was attentive and humorous and the food was up to a certain standards. I did expect however to find a few more nouveau. Overall it was pleasant experience
This is one of the set menue restaurants where you have to order a huge set menue bound to drive you into food coma, beautiful garden and nice service bit you can find much better moroccan places

Very atmospheric setting by the pool and must be the most romantic setting to eat in Marrakech. I had dinner on a fixed menu which I knew was going to be too much so I negotiated a cheaper price for just 3 courses, very flexible of the management. The lunchtime menu is cheaper. An experience worth paying a little extra for.

review_title: Gorgeous setting for lunch - excellent warm starter tasting plates
review: We had a very enjoyable lunch at Dar Moha - seated out by the pool in the sun with a glass of wine and a local (Casablanca) beer - one of the few places we dined where alcohol was served. We LOVED the selection of warm starter plates (see photo) - they cost 120 dirhams (under £10) and included cheese, prawn, chicken, minced meat and aubergine tasters - yummy! For our main course we had skewers of fish (200 dh - about £15) and chicken (150dh - about £12). The fish was a touch dry for me, but certainly tasty. All in, with drinks was 600dh - about £45. The staff were super-polite, the service well paced and the selection of nuts and seeds served ahead of our starter was lovely. The setting was perfect - surrounded by high walls and so quiet. A really enjoyable part of our stay in Marrakech and an oasis of calm and more upmarket dining after the hurly-burly of the Medina.

We ate her this week - and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The set menu was really interesting and delicious. The restaurant is easy to find and it is a lovely setting, eating by the pool side. The music was also good. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

review_title: One of the best restaurants we have eaten in
review: The setting for this restaurant was very, very nice. The Moroccan food was some of the best we have had while in Morocco. We especially liked the salad. The tajines with the vegetables was very delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

A bit late reviewing but this restaurant will always live in memories (i proposed to my wife here) and the meal and service was nothing but exceptional!!! It is one of the finest restaurants in The Medina, very unassuming but my goodness does it deliver!! I suppose for me being it was a special occasion and i had pre-planned the reception we received, it makes it all mesmerising! I thing i do remember is, do go there hungry, they are no shy with the portions..!! The service is very attentive and you feel completely relaxed.. I dont have anything but praise for this place!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Pull Out The Stops Food, Preparation, Service and Atmosphere
review: This is one of Marrakech's best known restaurants in a converted mansion. It has several sumptuously appointed dining rooms, but the best place to dine here is in the open air courtyard with the large reflecting pool and garden. Andalusion and Gnawah music is played throughout the evening. Traditional Moroccan cuisine is served here. Exquisitely prepared, beautifully presented, and delicious. There wasn't anything I ordered that wasn't delectable! Be prepared though, the food while some of the best, is also expensive (about $80 - $120/person). Alcohol is also served.

Very good food, excellent surroundings and nice service. I have had one lunch and one dinner here in march 2014. The most amazing part was the the outdoor area, but the restaurant was beautiful inside as well. I loved the 14 different morroccan salads that came before our meal. So many nice flavors!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Awesome evening and great experience as always. Every time Benga takes care of our table we know we are in good hands. We celebrated birthday and engagement and he made it very special for us. We decided to make it a tradition to come back for birthdays
I had a nice salad (piscina salad) and a frozen coffee by the pool - the music is super (there is a dj) and the staff is so super friendly (ask for Wilson he is the best!!!!)

Had the pleasure of experiencing the special menu by Chef Qureshi for their ongoing promotion, "Renaissance of Royal repast". We were seated in the courtyard on a lovely full moon evening. We had ordered a range of dishes with the likes of Murgh Balai Imtiazi, Lamb Paya Nihari and Gucchi Pulao. I would strongly recommend trying Haleem which was star of our meal. Our server had recommended a Spanish Sauvignon Blanc to accompany the flavorful Indian dishes, a perfect pairing to our meal The restaurant was packed on a Wednesday, better to make reservation beforehand

a luxurious Indian restaurant is located in the hotel. we came for brunch and gorged ourselves on appetizers. a lot of food. we tried almost everything. If you want to try something new, tasty and unusual, then this is the right place for you. Also great bourbon cocktails. for dessert was Indian teramisu and much more. in short very tasty  роскошный индийский ресторан расположен в отеле. мы пришли на бранч и обьелись еще на закусках. очень много еды. мы попррбовали практически все. если вы хотите попробовать что то новое, вкусное и необычное, то вам точно сюда. еще классные коктейли с бурбоном. на десерт был индийский терамису и еще много всего. короче очень вкусно

We had an excellent night on the outside terrace and perfect diner. Our lady host Lucy was very helpful and suggested us the nicest food ever! The bread, the chicken curry, the gunpowder shrimps, ... all extremely delicious. Thank you for the food and service. We value this with 5 stars!

review_title: Finally some delectable Indian cuisine in Dubai!
review: There has been too much brouhaha over different notions of great Indian food over the years, with some people really going OTT with 'molecules' and nitrogen and other absurd combinations. Please, stop! Good Indian food is about wholesome ingredients, perfectly chosen meats and seafood, cultural secrets, and a chef that can take all this and toss it up into something spectacular. The Crossing (TC) has managed to do just this and a lot more! You first enter a very lovely looking restaurant with some minimalism infused with contemporary style and are greeted by extremely friendly staff who really want you to enjoy your evening out. They are also very clued in on all the food, it's origin, what to pair it with, and how that particular story unfolded. Kudos to really explaining everything with zest, passion, and heart! Let's get one thing straight - TC is not out there to be another 'find dining but so-boring' restaurant. They are not cluttering tables with 17 glasses per person and more cutlery than a wedding demands. It's all about simplicity and passion here. As soon as you settle in, the first thing you will probably notice (apart from the brilliant music) are the faces of the other patrons Pure joy is what you will see. This really gives you a lot of confidence about the food. We ordered a LOT of food because everything sounded so good! Gunpowder prawns, butter chicken, saag (which I have NEVER ordered before, ever), dal moradabad (fantastic!), mango seafood curry, keema rice (the simplicity and flavours of this dish were amazing), lamb and chicken grills, and breads. Each dish's level of spice and taste/flavour was a 100% on point. There was a little quirkiness in every dish too, which only added to the brilliance of the experience. Again, nothing even remotely OTT (think in the lines of pairing a Gucci suit with some Air Jordans or Yeezys - brilliant, huh??) Honestly, I had not enjoyed some of the ingredients being paired together in so many ways as I did at TC. Some brilliant research work done on our country's varied gastronomies and many exhaustive hours spent in the kitchen, for sure. Overall, highly recommended to everyone who wants a taste of the India that effortlessly mixes the north with the south and the east with the west and then does it all again! I'll be back soon, with a new bunch of people I can take there to showcase what Indians do best - serve and surprise.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: We are at white orchid on two occasions over our ten night stay. The food was delicious and was a mix of Thai / Chinese cuisine. The Thai green curry in particular was very good and the best we’ve had outside of Thailand.  Our only comment was that this restaurant was not part of the all inclusive package so you only got a contribution towards the cost of the meal. We couldn’t see a reason why this wasn’t included in the package (particularly the drinks, which were expensive, notwithstanding they were the same drinks included for free in the restaurants/bars just next door).  Overall a fantastic experience and well worth a visit, but just be wary of the additional charges.
I have been to Nando indifferent countries and found the taste always the same. Whenever, you see Nando, one feels tempted to try and enjoy the food.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Booked in advance for a Friday brunch and it was full! We took the premium wagyu beef set (~499 per pax but we used the entertainer app to get 2-for-1). The wagyu and marinated cut were really good that it melted in our mouth, so good we ordered like 4 times. There were others like salmon sushi, chicken nugget, egg drop soup that were very good. We love this place and would definitely come back again!

We had a wonderful experience! Traditional Japanese food with Japanese chef - totally authentic! Service was excellent by our waitress Janine, made us feel absolutely comfortable and took great care of us. We went for the a la carte sushi menu, and had the Takumi Platter for two: salmon, tuna, eel, snow crab, yellowtail, shrimp, salmon roe… everything you can dream about. Additionally, we have a Snow Crab Roll, which was really good, and a delicious Scallops Sashimi - super recommended. A must go for any authentic Japanese food lover!

We joined their Friday brunch for a treat but unfortunately were really disappointed by the service, the standard of the food and the ambience. It felt more like one of those very casual dining places in karama/Deira except obviously we’re paying fine dining prices at 400 are per head (without alcohol). Even with the entertainer voucher it’s poor value for money and I’d advise you to steer clear. Much better value offerings elsewhere.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Extremely thankful to Angeli and Lois (& everyone else) for the service. Everyone is friendly, the food is great and authentic. Appreciate the accommodation and good vibes! Highly recommended!

review_title: Delicious Shabu-Shabu Hotpot - Love the Broth
review: We dined with friends over dinner on a busy Friday evening. Despite the restaurant being full, the staff were attentive and seem to have managed the place well.  This was our first time dining in the restaurant and we immensely enjoyed the Shabu-Shabu Hotpot! I especially loved the tasty broth and the premium quality sliced beef and the condiments that came with this dish.  Would also recommend the Yakitori BBQ, the California sushi roll and Spicy Tuna Roll, and the Ramen.  Great ambiance as it feels like you are transported to a Japanese setting. I advise those who want to dine to book ahead to reserve your table.

Pretty average for the location & hype, was expecting something a lot better. Food was average, still have to wait for chefs to serve, rather than take your own. The slow service to get drinks, was especially annoying. Just glad it wasn’t my choice, I was invited to have lunch here, there are so many better options in Dubai.  Would certainly not bring family here, certainly not worth the money.

user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review: Amazing brunch with family to celebrate a special birthday. Akshay and Heera gave the best service - thank you for making the day so special!

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: Exceptional food and great value in the hotel all inclusive package
review: We loved the food and menu options here so much that we ended up eating here 4 nights out of the 10 that we stayed at the hotel, and didn’t have one bad dish. We would particularly recommend the aubergine starter and the beef main course which were delicious. The portions were generous - not like most upmarket pasta restaurants. The service was also brilliant - the waiters were attentive, asked when you were ready for the next course, and the food was quick to arrive. In particular we were served by Sanjay on a couple of nights who was excellent.
Fabulous first time @Sette Italian With family and friends, will definitely be back. Lovely setting upstairs on the Top floor

review_title: Lovely food and service, shame we didn't sit by window
review: The food was of an exceptional standard and of course, the service second to none. We sat in the middle which was a shame as would have preferred a table by the window, felt like we were the only ones not to sit by table and next time will be sure to request table by window or will re-book. The deserts are worth the extra calories :)

The welcome at the restaurant was friendly and professional. We were shown to our table and attended by Asmita who was friendly efficient professional and informative without being over attentive. Food was full of flavour and extremely good .would highly recommend

Had a delicious meal here the other night. Great welcome, we were taken to our table, which had lovely views over the bay. Service was very good,but not intrusive. The food was delicious, my other half had the sea bass which he said was really tasty, I had the chicken dish, which I really enjoyed, it had a really tasty sauce with it. We had a side dish of zucchini which was amazing.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: We visited the Clay for dinner. It was amazing - forget Nobu, this is the real thing. Perfect presentation of amazing food. The drinks are perfect and we did love them. The service, our server was Florin, was the best server we had in Dubai during our stay.  The food, ceviche, sushi, sashimi and the specialities were more than amazing. We just decoded for the starter, also after a quick consultation with Frorin, and we need to come back and get the main courses.  It’s a must visit in Dubai for amazing service and food - compliment.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review_title: A place to taste, see and immerse oneself in a delightful dinner
review: Inventive menu that looks as good as it tastes. I think this is one of the few restaurants in dubai where decors, taste and service are all given topmost importance. And on service, Denzel was a refreshing presence to the dinner as he walked us through the menu, explained the food in a very light-hearted manner (NONE of those snobbish I know it all attitude that other restaurant's service staff would have given such occasions). Five stars to Denzel. 5 stars to taste. 5 stars to plating. 5 stars to ambiance.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review: Absolutely an incredible and mind-blowing experience! Have rarely eaten this well in Dubai, the chef mastered a perfect balance between all flavors, honed his skill of perfect cooked proteins. If there is a winner dish, than it’s the black cod that blew me away! Recommended this gem of a dining experience. Cocktails are superb and service (Zaw) created an unforgettable experience!

user_tags: Vegetarian;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Ameer was absolutely amazing. Advice and dish recommandation overall kindness and customer service were exceptional
The best place to be, the food, music abd energy is out of this world, special thanks to our waiter Collet

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Simply EXCELLENT for a night out
review: We come from Europe and were invited here for drinks - took a Cab which had a bit of difficulty finding the place. It's in an inner courtyard to a hotel, but not too hard to find. We sat outside in the warm evening ambiance, great settings, chairs, pillows, lighting, etc. Very attentive personal and service (despite covid) and great menus with loads of little nicely warm items, sharing plates, Tapas, cheese boards, etc things to be had. I really have to promote that menu, it's unbelievable!! Prices are fair, service quick and attentive and THANK YOU for not having too loud music in our faces to destroy the very nice evening. We WILL be back!!
Great wine and cheese experience. Chinmau was a fantastic server. Highly recommended for wine pairings that actually work

review_title: Great place to drink.... Too smoky
review: I spent 10 nights at the hotel above Fisherman's Bar and visited the bar a couple of times. Draft beer available, as well as a decent bar menu, the salt and pepper shrimp are worth a try.  With large screens playing music videos it's a lively place week nights and weekends too. Only issue is it gets a little smoky inside with the patrons smoking.  If you don't mind the smell then it's all good.

Excellent service, very comfy surrounds and good selections of beers in the tap. Would like to mention again that the beers are just perfect with regards to temp, lager n freshness. Had just a starter Squid masala fry for grub n it was perfect. Will surely be back.

Visited this place last night , ordered for Chivas shots the staff bought the drinks quickly along with some nuts and popcorn as well , ambience wise the place was decent and foot tapping music was been played and lastly when it comes to the pricing it was decent not expensive at all .

We had just visited the fort museum and fancied a small lunch and a pint, so we thought we’d try the Fisherman’s Hub as they served alcohol and food.  Although a little dark (no windows) we were greeted with a smile and shown to our table and given the menus and asked what we’d like to drink, we ordered a still water, Diet Coke and a pint of Stella.  The menu was quite comprehensive for a pub and served both western as well as middle eastern food and Indian dishes as well.  We ordered Salt and Pepper Prawns and Calamari and as one of the party could not have any oil or fat in their food and asked our waitress if the chef could make a plain rice dish with shredded chicken, she said that this would not be a problem.  She also pointed out that the two dishes we had ordered included a beer or wine, exceptional value as the Prawn dish with a Stella was 45 Dirhams and the Calamari with another pint of Stella was 47 Dirhams ( extremely good value in Dubai)  The food arrived and was fantastic, really tasty and such good value, the the service by our waitress (I’m so sorry I can’t remember your name) a young Indian lady was first rate.

Just around the corner from our hotel, this restaurant is absolutely beautiful. The furniture and décor are a sight to behold. Low lighting at night makes it a very romantic evening. Fo0d was delicious although took a little while to arrive. Would go there again.
All was good! Nice view, cool. Nice to stop by for a bite to eat and a glass of wine. Thanks Abdul for good service.

review_title: Nice restaurant with great view of the fountain show
review: Had their classic burgers for dinner, very good. We chose the outdoor seating on the platform on the lake. Very nice location, with a view of Burj Khalifa and the fountain show. Very nice staff, especially Mariel and Kathleen.
Great Mexican cuisine. great service. Very good lactation next to swimming pool. Special thanks to Marc
Fabulous experience, and a very big thank you to Pedro for looking after us . Outstanding service ! Fabulous bar not too be missed

Outstanding restaurant! Generous portions, high quality ingredients and the most delicious Lebanese food we ever tried! This is an unmissable the place in Atlantis to have a dinner and experience the best of Dubai atmosphere! Special thanks to Hicham (manager) for the excellent care and Arista ( from Platos) who recommended this unforgettable restaurant!

user_tags: Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: It’s hard to describe the amazing experience we just had at this exquisite restaurant.  Lots of food. Lots of amazing flavours.  The manager Reda made us feel at home and there’s no doubt that he puts a lot of love and care in the way he deals with all the guests touring the tables and going the extra mile.  All the staff was incredibly helpful and nice.  And yes, did I mention that the food was unbelievable?  Only suggestion: try not to eat in the 24 hours before coming, it’s all too good and it’s very difficult to say no!

Shubham  Treated like royalty as soon as we entered the restaurant. The surroundings are perfect & staff were very helpful, kind & made our visit a success.  Shubham was looking after us & he worked extremely hard to ensure we enjoyed our Lebanese experience.  We had the tasting menu & couldn’t believe the amount of food. Starters, we tried a little of everything. Main was delicious meats & we got to choose our desserts.  An overall fantastic experience, thank you.

Very pleasant place, fully booked on Friday, after 12 you won’t be able to talk due to club loud music like Macarena, 50 cent, 20’ hits, Arabic songs, but you can dance and hang out. Audience 32+. There are few Europeans, most local. Nice Italian vine. Stuff is very attentive, thanks to Ace

review_title: Experience you must have once in life
review: Had the pleasure to visit Dream Dubai for its one year Anniversary, the ambiance was simply incredible we were taken care of so well by lovely Kayla, who was super attentive and kept her eyes throughout when we were at the restaurant, she was such a hospitality star ✨ The food was simply the best loved every bit of it and the performances were out of the usual performance you'll see in a restaurant it was simply mind blowing as if you are in a movie Simply lived a dream With love Ken Doll

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: This place never disappoints. We came for my wife’s birthday and it was Unforgettable! Berkan attended us and he was always there when we needed him. He timed the plates in line with the show snd made the evening a great success! Thank you!

For a quick and casual meal at Atlantis, we headed to The Edge. This outdoor bistro/bar offers a range of super tasty meals and a wonderful service. We were served by Ekene, who was friendly, professional and proficient. His recommendations of dishes were well selected and true to his descriptions. Ekene made our experience at The Edge a great one. I recommend The Edge to The Atlantis guests and day visitors alike.
The waiter Ekene served us so well! Fantastic location with fantastic food. We'll be back again. Smooth background music

The Edge is at "the edge" of the Palm, not far from the western pool and the games area.  I was served by Ekene who was friendly and chatty. He brought my drinks and food quickly and attended to me all evening until the bar shut.  On this point, it shut early, with last orders around 18.45 and most of the bar packed away by 20.00, on this week day Monday.  There were families around me who, it seemed, were looked after and it is an easy walk back to the west wing of the hotel.  You can just about see the fountains from here, and the view of the hotel through the palms is amazing.  Certainly take a little stroll out here.

Our 5th time to the Atlantis and we sit by the royal pool every day and have drinks and lunch from the Edge. The food is excellent with very good choice. The service from the waiters is superb. Special mention to Hasantha and Waqas who made our stay. They both go above and beyond to make our holiday special. Thanks guys the Atlantis is lucky to have you.

review_title: extravagant and glamorous family brunch a world away from your everyday
review: it’s one of those weekends, the sweetness of the winter sun shines bright and the wind blows cold, it’s summer in the light and winter in the shade - and living the good life in my Dubai and being spoilt for choice with most chic and superlative luxurious hotel and resorts that boast Michelin-starred Restaurants, there can be nothing, simply nothing, most lusted after, than to splurge on an extravagant and glamorous family brunch a world away from your everyday, where you can en famille be immersed in a spellbinding day-cation of sheer luxury and pleasure without limitations, spending uninterrupted hours focusing on us and enjoying face time..  this weekend was all about luxuriating at The Edge - an outdoor Italian Restaurant located on the Royal Pool-side deck at Atlantis The Palm - one of the most majestic 5★ beach resort and an aquatic wonderland on Dubai’s man-made Palm Jumeirah Island - featuring a tantalizing fare of an adventurous culinary and unforgettable brunch experience on a level you never imagined, serving to you a gastronomic fiesta of gourmet delicacies, from the likes of...  piping hot, irresistible and deeply satisfying artisan stone baked italian margherita pizza with an indescribably delicious and voluptuous layer of tomato-basil sauce blended in the mellow richness of fresh mozzarella cheese pleasing to the palette like a short afternoon drizzle..  and if that din’t quite satisfy your hunger pangs, take on the house speciality, Pan-seared Scottish Salmon steak and asparagus smothered in lemon beurre blanc, slapped on one big pot of linguini pasta harmoniously slick with basil pesto - not at all dry and gluey, mixed with a dollop of roasted shallots and plum tomatoes, that had my belly penning thank you notes to my taste buds..  whilst my better half @lillloyds desired for the Winter Tuna Niçoise salad laden with white anchovies and an exotic bite-size quail eggs tossed in green beans, baby potato, kalamata olives and mesclun leaves - truly irresistible to the delight of our 6 year old boy prowling restlessly to not fork-yeah a lions share of the dozen or half quail eggs..  and the Ah! moment in our culinary adventure of flavour and fantasy that had my heart-fluttering and tummy rumbling to a hypnotic trance of sweetness galore, as if cupid shot an arrow right though my heart and into my stomach, was the pièce de résistance, Blood Orange Coulis Panna Cotta laden in a bounty of wild berries.. truth be told, the taste is incomparable and the experience a must-have....

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Hilmy took great care of us on our quick stop. Found out the hard way that the lounge was closed but we did not miss a step. Delicious Guinness and good snacks abound. Cheers.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Visited in the afternoon and the lounge was really quiet. Had a few different drinks on offer and food was adequate. Sandwiches really good.
One of the best Priority Pass lounges on the planet! Make sure to hunt for Dileep Ramesh, he’ll take really good care of you while you lounge waiting for your flight!

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: I've been visited this lounge frequently for 5 years. It's always been exemplary. Great service, attentive, smiles and good food and drink.  On this occasion Rey really stood out with her attentive and personal service. Thank you for this.
Lovely welcome. Very friendly staff. Good choice of food and beverages. Worth a visit before long flight home Would use in future when visiting our daughter and son in law.
Good food selection with both buffet and a la carte options. fantastic service from Ann Martha!!! Could do with another bathroom though.
Quality of food is excellent. The ambience and overall setting is great. Only one point where they shall improve - The portions are not generous.

We were on half board so we choose one night to eat in this restaurant the service was good however the food quality it was okay we had a better elsewhere it was too bland I am Asian person I like spicy food even though I did request for spicy food bit it was still too bland I think is ideal for European

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Great Indian food and a chilled vibe
review: The food is incredible. Great selection of veg and non veg. Food isn't greasy at all. Preana was a great host and definitely deserves a mention.
The staff are very attentive . Food is amazing, get your taste buds going. Good size portions . Menu has a great variety of dishes , red to go back and try more .

It’s the best place for dates, ladies nights of just having cocktails with friends. Amazing view on Burj Kalifa, open area but at the same time restaurant hold a normal temperature for guests, so we have: 1) pleasant atmosphere 2) view on town 3) sneaks like fresh fries with truffle souse, salmon sashimi and good quality cocktails big portions
Very good moment in FLO dubai with my Girls Amazing view on Burj Khalifa The food and Mocktail is very good thznsk FLO Dubai
Very perfect place. Vinaigrette is very very polite and provide all the necessary information about food

review_title: Love Indian food? Do try this restaurant..
review: We had a really lovely meal here last night. We were looked after by Karam and Anjali. They were very attentive and Karam suggested some dishes he thought we'd like, and we did! The food was delicious.

review_title: Fabulous again with Karam at the Kinara lake view
review: Fabulous meal again at Kinara at JA lake view. We have been before and brought friends this time and the food was absolutely amazing.

This place is amazing, from the moment you set foot in the place you are treated so well. We went on a very humid evening, we were advised to stay inside, good recommendation. Our waiter was so helpful, and very calm. The food when it arrived was delicious. We are fortunate enough to be going again this week. Fantastic restaurant.

Good ambiance , nice staff . This is our first time in this restaurant. The menu items are limited and the taste of food also reasonably ok. But the quantity is too less compared to other similar class
We had a meal here tonight it was fantastic. Everything was well presented, service was very good but not overwhelming. The chicken dish that I had was very flavoursome. It was a very good meal!

Dined for the first time at the Seafire Restaurant at the Atlantis on the Palm and what a wonderful treat. The food had the most amazing flavours and tasted wonderful, served and presented beautifully by Azizbek our waiting staff who made the evening a special experience and who was also patient, attentive and tended to us and our young 2.5 year old grandson with the most utmost care and professionalism.
First of all the waiter must talk with lower voice I think that waiter was he’s voice supper disturbing Second the steak was not delicious at all the atmosphere boring , overall the food -5

What can I say - superb food, presented beautifully & excellent service by Ali and Abhi this evening. Would rate this higher if I could.  Prawn Cocktail was delicious. Steak was the best I’ve ever had. The crème brûlée was to die for.  Thank you

We reserved our table for dinner and spoke to Leila who made it easy for us, the welcome very pleasant. The outlet has both indoor and outdoor seating, live band which plays as well to increase the mood of the restaurant. We would like to thank Manu, Emmanuel, Karim, Roji and Aishat who were there from start till the end, the style of your service is simply the best and this place is highly recommended. Thank you so much for making our dining the best.
In general, good experience and tasty food. Batata Harra needs a lot of work, mussels also need some work. Shrimps were very nice as well as other grilled fish. Friendly staff and good prices

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: I regularly go to Sallet Al Sayad (Fish Basket) whenever I am in Dubai as it offers excellent and fresh seafood at an affordable price. My favorite dishes are the spicy tomato salad, the calamari in garlic sauce, grilled prawns and of course the grilled hamour. You can chose the seafood at a counter where it is displayed on ice. The service is friendly and usually very fast.
The food is amazing with fresh fish from all types and done the way you like, the service staff and management keep looking after you , and the price is very acceptable. Should try.

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: As always used to be tastey see food, every thing looked fresh, the salad, appetizers, fish and shrimp. Fast response service, but very small dinning and washing area. Because of the road work, to get there is not as easy. Parking is also a problem

user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: UAE fish and shrimp cooked in a Palestinian way and recipe. All fresh and tasty served with traditional appetizers in a friendly atmosphere

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: The Best Sea Food Restaurant in the Gulf Region
review: Sallet Al Sayad is the best food experience i ever had in Dubai and UAE or i can easily say in the whole Gulf Region, tasty and fresh sea food prepared in a delicious secret recipe with a very generous portion that is reasonably priced, the atmosphere of the family run restaurant is so lovely and i think every visitor to Dubai should dine at this place.
The food at the Plaj beach restaurant is delicious. The staff are extremely friendly and professional. Would highly recommend.
Great food! Great staff! Amazing service. And if you can’t be bothered to move from the longer you can have lunch boxes served right to the beach or the pool.

I love the Plaj and the attentive staff here, this daytime Restaurant always makes our holiday. Fantastic service weather you are relaxing by the pool or a light lunch in the Shade or late afternoon happy hour, the Plaj accommodates.  We have stayed at the JZS on 13 Previous stays and it was great to see some of the familiar staff here. The Plaj runs like clockwork under the leadership of Adam who look after us so we’ll along with his attentive team. Too many staff to thank but Vincy, May and or course Adam bent over backwards. It was my daughter’s birthday during our stay and Adam and the team brought a cake to our sunbed and sang happy birthday which was a lovely touch.  lunch was great with the warm tomato bread to start and chicken Caesar salad was lovely. I thought enjoyed happy hour with cocktails, wine beer and a Selection of spirits 2 for 1. A lovely touch now is sofas on the beach which was great as the sun went down having a cold beer and some Crisps pre Dinner.  For anyone wishing to eat by the pool One new and welcome addition is the food boxes now used if you Order to eat by the pool which are great in deterring the cheeky Birds who previously flipped the plate Covers off!  Thank you Adam and the team so the most impeccable service as always.

review_title: Top favourite place to dine in
review: One of my fav place to have delicious Mughlai food in Mercato mall. Visit once in 2months. Chef is remarkable. Relish all vegetarian dishes everytime.👍👍 A must visit recommended.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover
review: Both vegeterian & non vegetarian foods are available. Worth for money. Good ambiance. Good service.Nice tastly foods & variety

It's nestled in a public park amongst the many sky scrapers in DXB.  The decor is good, well lighted, the seating is a little cramped for large groups(inside), we were 8 of us and it was a little difficult to move around.  The food is awesome especially the mutton biryani. So tender it melts in your mouth. The mutton cutlet on a roti is also soft like butter, a must try.  All in all, a place to visit every time in DXB.

user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Very nice Indian Vegetarian from Kamat Restaurant This restaurant belong to Kamat Group Must have one time Indian Vegetarian food
Indian Chinese and Mughlai dishes offered. Lives up to the hype and the quality is very good. Recommended for family.
Excellent Indian food, totally authentic, great spices, great portions, excellent prices, totally revamped from what it was 2 years back, kudos to the chef.

The place to go in Dubai when you are out of india and longing for authentic indian fare. The service is at par and the menu is never ending, i would alert that you choose quickly else you may end up spending 30 mins looking at whole menu. The taste is good and would rate the service higher.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I arrived there for a dinner with a friend, and there was nobody to welcome us and take us to the table where we have to sit... a busy guy showed up suddenly and gave us the table. The staff members were so busy doing nothing I guess, because there was only 3 other tables with customers. After 10 minutes of searching to whom I should give my order, a gentleman showed up and took the order. I ordered 3 main dishes and 1 nan and 1 rooti... the waiter didn’t give me any advices with the bread amount, as 2 bread is fine for me, but not in Gazebo... the bread size is quarter to the regular size of the bread, yes! Maybe less that the quarter! When I saw the bread, I ordered more and it took forever to arrive. Also, I asked the waiter to bring me corn snacks (papad) and he asked me, how many pieces? It was my first time to be asked how many pieces I need... because they bring it with the starter, and regardless the level of the restaurant, they bring 5-6 pieces... but I ordered 4... and till now it didn’t come... it never came... I told the waiter about it when I was leaving... and he simply forgot... food was good and below the very good, the price is very good to compare it with the food quality.

review_title: Look no further for the best of Awadhi cuisine...
review: We went there for lunch. We had the softest and tastiest kababs. The curries were excellent; roomali roti and taftans were great - perfect balance between soft and crisp.The biryanis in traditional mutka were too good. To top it up, we had mutka kulfi and rasmalai of the highest quality. This place is not massive; but ambiance was great with friendly staff and excellent service. There are some parking spaces right outside on the street. This place is a must visit for lovers of Awadhi, Hyderabadi cuisine. Bon appetit!!!

Gazebo is one of the best Indian restaurants in UAE. Their food is good and services equally good. The menu covers a wide variety of dishes with good selection for vegetarians. Bindi do Pyaza is one of my favourites.Children love their Paneer tikka. Prices are reasonable. Deira City Centre for me is the best location.

review_title: Absolutely amazing food - best Indian restaurant in Dubai!!
review: Gazebo is simply the best indian restaurant we've ever been to!!! The food is absolutely fantastic! The biryani is gorgeous, as is the masala prawns, chicken tikka, potato curry and royal falooda. Everything is delicious and so reasonable in terms of price. We make sure we visit a good three or four times in a two week stay in Dubai. They also have lovely private dining rooms! An absolute must!!!!

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: One of the best indian restaurant
review: One of my favorite places to dine in when craving for mughlai cuisine.  I really love their grills specifically the mutton kebab. I dont think of all the place where ive had food they serve as good at this  Other things to definitely try is the papdi chaat. Really tasty.  Zaitooni salad is also a must try.  In curries, my top spot goes to the chicken tikka masala.  Their butter chicken is good too for those who cant have spicy food.  In veg, i prefer their aloo gobi adraki, very nice amd savory.  And highly recommended are their yellow dal tadka or the dal makhano. Both are very good.  Their briyani would be the best in town in terms of taste and serving. Either one, You cannot go wrong in briyani at gazebo.  Until next time  Bon Appetit

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: Good Dum Biryani and Tandoori dishes place
review: I was visiting Dubai and was invited for dinner at this restaurant by my friends. We ordered few Tandoori dishes and two different types of Dum biryani. They were good but for me I felt that they were bit oily. Over all the dining experience was good.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic
review: I visited the Gazebo with my Family we enjoyed the ambience the food was very nice and tasty sure it is quality Indian food

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: The Place for real Indian cuisine!
review: One of Dubai's hidden gems, this is a great place to taste amazing Indian cuisine! tasty and delicious, with wide selection of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. Friendly staff and affordable eats!

review_title: great food , good size of dish
review: Fantastic biryanis & kebabs. Best for Tandoori dishes. Service slow but food well cooked. Waiters could be more friendly & polite ! Be prepared to wait on week ends.. definite visit !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Elegant, clean with good service. The food was not up to these standards.
review: We found Gazebo via Google's listings and it had good reviews. Everyone else inside the restaurant was Indian/Asian. We had very high expectations. The place was beautiful and every detail was looked after in an excellent manner. If you take friends, clients or a date, they will like the ambiance. Parking was a little tough but that's a Dubai issue.  Finally comes the food. It was a mixed bag. The appetizers were above average. The Beryani was pretty good. The rest of the food was average and the Hamour fish was below average. I grew up in Dubai and have had Indian food in many cities around the world. The food here is nothing special. Very unfortunate as it was one of very few restaurants we were able to try during our trip to Dubai and we didn't expect a well appointed restaurant with Indian food in competitive Dubai to have average food.  You can get an idea of pricing from the attached image. The prices, for an American consumer, were very reasonable. Total for 4 people was around $70 (255 AED).

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Authentic fresh Indian food and bustling family style ambience
review: One of the tastiest dum briyani I've ever tasted. It was prepared in the traditional method. First time I saw a claypot with a bread dough cover to cook the rice & gravy. Enjoyed the non-spicy grilled chicken very much too! Too many dishes to try and too little stomach space! Service was friendly，ambience is family friendly and bustling. Wouldn't mind coming back to this place again :-) and order something new every time we visit. Portion sizes are family style, so dine big with a group of friends!

Gazebo in DIFC Food Area has been quite good. Had a vegetarian meal with lentil soup, Dal Makhani, Mushroom Curry with Lacha Parathan, plain rice and curd. The food has been hot and delicious. Dal Makhani needs little more improvement to match real Punjabi taste.  The food is good and can be recommended for a quick working lunch at DIFC area.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Thrill Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: Must try Biryani and Galawati Kebab
review: Nice Indian cuisine restaurant. I quite like the branch in Mankhool and Deira City Centre.  Some good dishes I'd recommend; Chicken Kasturi Galawati Kebab (lamb) Mushroom stuffed with paneer Mushroom Biryani Chicken Biryani Dal Makhani Butter Chicken  Reasonably priced good tasting Indian food. Just that twice I found chicken a little tender and I prefer it well cooked, so I've had to send it back. The staff is very courteous offering good service.

for starters i ordered papari chaat and for main I ordered two curries, Mutton Karahi and chicken hyderabadi. The papri chaat was faultless and tasty, however the two curries were both disappointing, the mutton karahi was dry and the pieces of meat were big. The chicken hyderabadi meat contained the same pieces of meat, it was not the proper chicken breast succulent pieces. I also ended up with an upset stomach the day after. I will not be visiting this place and would recommend you look for an alternative indian restaurant.

A friend who grew up in Dubai took me to Gazebo this week. It is by all accounts a bit of an institution and I can see why. Great kebabs, juicy chicken and excellent bread and biryani. Will definitely return

If you are in Dubai, and prefers Indian food, predominantly Punjabi and Mughalai, Gazebo is the right place for you. We live very near to this restaurant, so parking is never a problem. The restaurant can really get very, very crowded, especially in weekends, and I would suggest prior table booking. The food is really tasty and has excellent quality. Price range is medium.

user_tags: Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: My husband and I are indian food addicts and nomally visit Gazebo every Thursday for dinner. We go to deira city center branch normally. We always order hyderabadi biryani and 2 other dishes. Murgh seekh is a nice dish and the kebabs are yummy. Prices r very pocket friendly, the food is clean, and the ambience is pleasant.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Shopping Fanatic
review: Very famous one in town! And indeed it is worth going there. Food is yummy here. Go there if you are not in hurry and have bit patience if you are going there during weekend. this place never disappoints and serves very fresh Indian food with good standards. All dishes tasty,

review_title: Travellers to Dubai , especially from India , must go to Gazebo for fine dining .
review: This fine restaurant is located on a wide street in Bur Dubai, so parking is really not a problem . I went out for dinner with the family, and found our choice to be good, given the restaurant's excellent decor and ambience . Although Gazebo predominantly serves non vegetarian dishes , it is a vegetarians' delight as well, with prompt and courteous service . A bit expensive , but recommended all the same, for a fine gastronomic experience .

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Excellent value for money, Excellent taste!
review: Very clean place, nice ambience, good service, not pretentious, very accommodating very welcoming even for those first timers for Indian cuisine. Food was perfect. Portion is just right you can't ask for more and certainly you don't want it have less. Taste is perfect. Real fresh healthy and light. Menu has a very wide range of variety to choose from. The presentation of the food is very appetizing. The price is surprisingly very modest. We visited Mankool and Bin Sougat. Both are great success.

Good Location - cannot miss it from the main road - Access from the service road though. Ample parking available behind Excellent environment. Curtained cubicles available for families / provacy Very good quality food - Dum Biryani (lamb) and Chicken Kali Mirch (boneless pieces of Chicken in green spice) Preparation takes a little time - it is useful to book over the phone in advance Good for gatherings

It is probably the best Indian restaurants around. For the price paid, you get double the value on taste. The food is absolutely delicious and gives you a heavenly experience. The service is fantastic and ambiance is good. On weekends it can get busy so be there early for a first come first serve allocation. Their specialties are the Kebabs and the Biriyani's. I wholeheartedly give my five star rating to this restaurant chain.
The biryani taste is the best biryani you can eat here in Dubai It's just like home made Especially Try the zafarni biryani and the masala biryani

user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Nature Lover
review: Had biryani and kebabs...no way...awesome taste..would recommend for all food lovers....starters qty are less and bit expensive...one of the best restaurant in dubai..

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker
review_title: Not as good as it is
review: Gazebo was always my best Indian choice. But this time I was diappointed little bit. The service is slow. Had kema pharat it took ages to prepare. I had my favourite biryani ' the Hydar abadi ' it was not the Gazebo style. Over all experience is satisfactory. The Kolfi was a good choice and mad our day..
We were taken by a local friend who was a regular there. food was good , service also fine, packed and had to wait , overall good.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I rarely eat at Gazebo, but quite often eat food from the restaurant. And as far as the quality of the food goes, it is brilliant. I recommend that this restaurant be tried even if one isn't a fan of Indian food. Their dishes are prepared extremely well and taste great. I would definitely try their mutton biryani and Aloo chutneywala (marinated baby potatoes). Their best dish by far, though, is the Raan E Sikandari (leg of lamb). Do not miss out on it.

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Want to have god Biriyani this is the place. Apart from biriyanis the other Dishes are also great. Try there Galawati Kawab they are good. Raan Sikandari with Taftan is also recommended, a must try. Reasonably priced good service makes it a preferred dining joint

user_tags: Vegetarian;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review_title: My Favorite in the area ... Try Sabzi Lababdar
review: This is one of best restaurants in the area ... Try Sabzi Labadar .... its my favorite ... Also their biryani is awesome ... The only negative - Limited options for veggies ...

Not much of a Biryani (Rice) person but my friend took me there insisting i need to try this place. The places ambiance was nice and much better then what i had come to expect from similar Indian joints in the same locality. Also it was packed , we got luck with a table and the service was still very good - the waiter helped with the selection and our dishes were served promptly.  I ordered a Murgh Hyderbadi Biryani for myself . My two friends being vegetarian's ordered a Subzi Masala Biryani. The Food were served in clay pot with a nan covering the top . Great presentation. The food tasted Yum but a bit too spicy - we did ask for mild spicy dishes. One of the first time i enjoyed a Biryani. The quantity's are huge and one dish is enough for at-lest two people.  From what i saw of other tables people were ordering all sorts of dishes and enjoying them. Will like to try out other stuff when i am next time over to.

Visited the Gazebo after hearing about how good their cuisine is & celebrate a B'Day . Was disappointed with what was dished out . The starters were alright , but the rest of the meal was below average . The meat in the Mutton Rogan Josh though soft was BLACK inside and very unappetizing once you dug into it . The Chicken Curries were chunky pieces of frozen Chicken . And the so called DUM Biryani, is a sham as its curry mixed with rice (of average quality) and served in an earthen pot with a Tandoori Roti that balloons up to make it look Good , but is not authentic Dum Pukht Biryani. And the meal quite Expensive mind you for what they dish out . Would not go back.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: I know Gazebo for many years, today I ordered a delivery meal and it was very good. I had vegetable biryani, butter chicken, daal makhni and naan .. I couldn't stop eating. the price is resonable and they deliver the biryani in clay which is very authentic. the restaurant it self is nicely decorated and friendly staff.

review_title: Great mix of Manglorean + NorthIndian food
review: Gazebo reminded me a truly south indian restaurant with a mix of tipusultans food into it,and clearly the mughlai and the afghani food is greatlky inspired,the biriyani in matka with chappathi dum is to die for, excellent food the masala papads iwth pudhina raitha is yummy, the fish biriyani si my secret order ,the service is lil poor becoz of extremme rush and wide sitting and lesser servers

It was a little bit hard to find - just a door next to Kamat restaurant, but it was a huge restaurant inside. It's very clean and menucard is enormus - take a look on wifi before you come. I took my glasses of so I better could see the menucard - the waiter then came with a photomenu !! A good idea, just ask for it. The food was fantastic and they ask how "strong" you like it. Fair prices - we'll be back.

We ordered through Uber eats while staying at a hotel nearby and our food was delivered by a guy on a bicycle ! Wow. Perfectly hot though, with plates and cutlery and plenty of it - chicken jalfrezie, veggie curry and tarka dhal with veg samosa and chicken pakora. Spicy enough though not the most authentic curry flavour, but we ate all of it between the evening and next morning for breakfast. Good price.
Visited for breakfast as great reviews on tripadvisor. Nice place but food was average. My toast was abit burnt and pancakes tasted ok but nothing special. Friendly staff and cool vibe

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff
review: Really tasty breakfast and great coffee! Thanks to Bia and Samy for a great experience. Had the eggs Benedict and scrambled eggs - bacon was delicious and eggs cooked very well

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker
review: The ambience is very relaxed and staff extremely friendly. This a modern decorated, small, cosy restaurant. I got billie- toasted bread with beet hummus and avocado and added a poached egg. My partner ordered the twist - pancakes with bacon, cheddar and fried egg. We were both delighted with our breakfast! The food is very tasty and their menu is well priced! Highly recommend it!
Fantastic fresh Salmon brunch which sorted the hangover right out especially with the smooth coffee. Everybody loved the food and managed to fit all 10 of us in. Amazing place would return

I went here today for breakfast. What we had was all delicious, you can tell they are making a lot of it from scratch. There was a nice atmosphere, cool decor, everything was clean including the bathroom. What made it especially great was how nice the staff was. The girl who served us was so friendly and welcoming. I would definitely go back.

review_title: Delicious food, great place for breakfast/ brunch/ lunch/ dinner
review: Awesome place with great music. The staff are warm and welcoming. The food was outstanding we had a Bloody Mary and the 7th Summer cocktails which were made very very well. For food we had the twist, fluffy light pancakes, crispy bacon topped with the most perfectly cooked egg. Fiion, salmon avocado on sourdough topped with seeds and nuts. No complaints from us as service and food was spot on, will definitely be returning

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover
review: Fantastic little restaurant offering a good selection of vegetarian and vegan meals.  I love everything about this café; and you can tell the owners and staff take great pride in delivering an excellent dining experience.  First thing you notice is the decor - even the toilet is fabulous!  The staff are so lovely - very friendly and attentive, but not intrusive.  And the food is superb! The pancakes I had were delicious, as was the latte.  I highly recommend this restaurant, and I’ll definitely be going back. Probably every day I’m in Lisbon!
Fantastic service, tasty crepes, we went there even though it was far from our hotel and the place where we were and it really was an excellent choice! Highly recommend!

review_title: Such a lovely Sunday experience! Brilliant taste and even nicer service 😊
review: Such a lovely Sunday experience! Brilliant taste and even nicer service  We stumbled across here as our last brunch before heading home. It’s a good location close to the airport but good parking outside too. The owner is so so friendly and welcoming and accommodative. We initially nearly didn’t go because I don’t eat egg but he mentioned they make vegan crepes too with buckwheat! Music to my ears… I had the veggie burrata, sundries tomato savoury crepe and my partner had the chicken crepe & a Nutella crepe. Must add the sweet potato fries which we had on recommendation are a must! Thank you for a fabulous brunch!

We had crepes here as a light dinner after a hectic day of walking. We loved the crepes! The kids loved their Nutella with ice cream and we tried the strawberry crepes with granolas. The dark chocolate sauce on the strawberry crepes with the combination of granola is superb! Next time, I need to try their savory/salgados crepes! Oh, not to forget - sweet potato french fries.  For us another plus is that we have vegetarian options.

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler
review: Delicious breakfast and coffee, but definitely nothing to look for at #1 in Trip Advisor. Staff friendly, location very pretty. However, that's all.

It was raining on a Friday morning, so we needed somewhere inside and out of the wet. We walked past Sto and it just looked very inviting. We were greeted by Jorge who was so welcoming and friendly. We decided to all go or the Lisbon brunch, and boy was that a great decision. The cheese toasty was amazing, as was the pastel de nata. It was all presented so well and is definitely worth a visit. we tried to go again on Monday, only for it to be closed. Jorge was inside cleaning !
Small food store with amazingly helpful manager. My wife was looking all over for algarve e salt till we found this place. Also they serve some great coffee and pastry. Definitely worth a visit.
What a wonderful family run restaurant, food is truly amazing, with options for vegetarians. Good selection of curries, staff is very friendly

review_title: Decent Italian Cuisine in a Pleasant Outdoor Setting
review: Il Mercato Páteo Bagatela offers decent Italian cuisine in a pleasant outdoor setting. The service can be slow, and the prices are a bit high for the quality of food. Overall, it's an okay option for Italian food in Lisbon.

user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Beautiful Italian restaurant with a mini market inside. The food is amazing! I recommend the pasta filled with pumpkin and truffle also in the sauce is stunning!! The staff is very friendly and the waiter Valentin is 5 stars!

review_title: Loved it so much we went back twice
review: My husband and I ate dinner here our first night in Lisbon. We made a reservation on google, and it was honored. Suggest making a reservation in advance, as it seems pretty popular. Just FYI the restaurant looks like it is in a residential area, depending on where you come from. But it is with a cluster of some other restaurants. Indoor/outdoor dining options.  The pasta is homemade and super fresh, almost as good as when we were in Italy. Great wine/drink list, and reasonable prices for what you get. Good selection of appetizers, and had very friendly service. They offer complimentary limoncello after dinner. The bathrooms were also very clean.  We ended up also having this as our last dinner, since it was so good. Lots of options for both meat eaters, and vegetarians. The appetizers are a very good size, and so were the pasta portions.  My husband had the linguine with prawns the first night, and said it was one of the best he has had. He also said the same about the Amatriciana (wasn't super spicy). I got the ragù the first night, which was excellent, and the macaroni with the asparagus & pancetta the 2nd night, which was super light and full of flavor.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: We loved the pumpkin ravioli. Delicate flavors. Our waiter Walter took very good care of us. We’ll be back.

We stumbled across this restaurant as it was close to our hotel. What a find! Great Italian food and ambiance. Can highly recommend the gnocchi. Hope to return before we leave Lisbon. Valentim gave us great service and recommendations.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Went here for birthday dinner and was fantastic. Best service we've had in Lisbon! Our server Pedro was 5 stars. I would highly recommend the gnocchi! Will come back here next time I'm here.

user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: We had pasta with prawns and lobster. Everything was very tasty and fresh. Our Daughter had Pizza and this was average. Prices are higher in this neighbour.

review_title: Products on sale at Market of High Quality
review: Surprised with high Quality and very original Italian Products and great house made Fresh Pasta. Ravioli di Zucca con Tartuffe with Tomato sauce is very tasty and delicious; Burratta al tartuffo as well.. Fully reccomended ..

review_title: Italian hub in the heart of Lisbon
review: Off the beaten track in a pedestrian alley, this restaurant is also a grocery and wine store. The staff is remarkably efficient and speaks also English and Italian. The starters based on burrata are simply stunning and the pasta were prepared to perfection.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: Best brunch we’ve had in long time. Food, service, atmosphere and interior - everything was top notch. Outside of a beaten tourist path, but well worth it.
The best place to have breakfast in Alfama - they may look super simple, but the scrambled eggs were the best scrambled eggs I've ever eaten. Fab place.

review_title: Lovely place in Alfama with nice decoration and great breakfast
review: Especially the toast with avocado and egg is great. They serve it together with lovely spices and olive oil. We took a €14 menu together which was good for two persons. When your in Alfama a great spot to breakfast!

user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Did not expect to go to Lisbon to eat Italian but when fellow guests at our hotel raved about it we had to try. The place is just great. The staff are so helpful in explaining exactly what is on the menu and the food itself simply delicious

Excellent Italian ! From the moment we walked in we were looked after . We had a lovely table upstairs and our waiters were super ,knowledgeable , friendly and gave us piece of mind that they would care about my daughters nut allergy . They took the time to highlight certain dishes in the menu and why they did . The food was amazing !! I don’t normally finish any pasta dish but this one was amazing , I didn’t want it to end . Would recommend !

Perhaps our best restaurant experience in Lisbon. First of all, Ricardo who was servicing our table was very friendly, supportive, patient and professional. Whatever we tried and tasted there was really tasty and delicious. We were group of 6 people so I won't go into details of each dish. But my dish, the Filetto 68Q al Gorgonzola (photo below) was very tasty and also I won't forget the Panna Cotta dessert I tasted at Come Prime, one of the best. Fantastic value, food and atmosphere, and what else one really need?

review_title: The best Italian Restaurant in Lisbon
review: I am a regular at this restaurant and I still think it is the best Italian Restaurant in Lisbon. The food is amazing. The staff is really friendly, specially Shekhar. He was super helpful during the intire dinner. The atmosphere is very romantic. If you are in the city center, I would totally recommend this place.

user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review_title: Very good; pity it has not Italian sphere
review: Nice restaurant! Nice menu, nice location, decoration. Service is fast. Waiters are Ok but neither Portuguese-speaking nor Italians, which does not help the sphere. Clients are a mix of locals and tourists. But food was quite good... And I go to a restaurant to eat. I will definitely come back!

From the friendly Nepalese couple that proudly owns the place - how the World spins, right?! -, to the simplest of details - homemade bread with olive oil, Modena vinegar and a pinch of salt - this lovely spot in Alcântara (Rua do Olival) surely hosts the best Italian meal your money can buy in Lisbon.  This week is all about Truffles from Alba (Dinner exclusive!!!) so you can enjoy the Tortellinis and Scallopinis, subtly bathed in one of Italy's finest (and let us say tastiest) exports.  As mentioned, the owners are nice and will make you feel so comfortable you just can't stop talking (and drinking and ordering more food!).  One might find it pricey but I didn't think so - as also mentioned it is, in my humble opinion, the best Italian choice in the Portuguese capital.
We were recommended by friends to visit when in Lisbon - exceeded expectations - friendly staff, great food and wine, and reasonably priced. We visited twice on our four day visit.

review_title: Lovely, charming restaurant with lots of vegetarian options
review: Extremely charming restaurant, very very friendly and good service. The food was very good, but not excellent, it lacked a little flavour. None-the-less I would recommend this restaurant just because it was an excellent experience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: Very good restaurant, we have been there 3 times in a 6 day visit. The food was so good, there is no better place. We had 64° degree roasted filet of beef with peppercorn sauce. The wines are also fine. But the best is the service, special from the main waiter Rui, he was so kind in explaining the food and in wine selection. We also loved his grappa choices, which was a perfect meal ending. Thanks again Rui and hope to see you again. The 2 German guys.

Visited here twice on our 4 night stay in Lisbon. I was very lucky to get a table on the first night as I hadn't booked until about 3pm for an 8 pm meal. I was very lucky and I say many people waiting for tables.  Food was fabulous, my wife is a vegetarian and she had plenty of choice too. We had 3 courses including drinks and paid around 60 Euro which for the quality of the food and service was more than reasonable in my opinion.  The staff were very good and if i was to give them any developmental feedback it would be to take a little more time with the diners as I did feel a little rushed on the second night. I appreciate they want to turn tables but they should be leaving gaps of at least 15 to 20 mins between courses. Overall, I have to give them a 5 star rating as the quality of the food and service overall deserved 5 stars.  Go there!

Our apartment in Lisbon was right next to this amazing Italian restaurant and as Italian food lovers we decided to try it out. We made a reservation online, which was really practical. When we arrived, the place was pretty packed, so I would say that the reservation is quite needed. We were seated in the first floor of the restaurant. The place is really nice and romantic (dimmed lights, dark wood) and I would say it is a perfect place for a romantic dinner. We ordered a margherita buffala pizza and pizza capriciossa. Both were really tasty. We love pizza napoletana and we eat it quite often when we are at home (we live next to the border with Italy) and these pizzas really were everything you would expect from a napoletan pizza. For dessert we had a cheesecake, which was really light, but tasted more like a whipped creme than cream cheese. It was still pretty good. After the meal, the waiter offered as some port wine, which was a really nice gesture. If you are looking for some good italian food in Lisbon, I would recommend this place.

If you want to have a cozy dinner with someone this is the place to go. The space is amazing, specially the top flor and the staff is very kind. The food is awesome and very well cooked. Entrees are delicious as well. The only negative side of it is the location that made it very hard to find a place to park the car.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Friendly staff, delicious food and fair prices
review: These 3 things from my headline perfectly describe this restaurant. We came here on purpose due to great TA and Google reviews and were delighted. Loving Indian food, I can confirm it had a great taste with quality ingredients. Restaurant is set in a side, parallel street from the high end Av. Liberdade, easily reached on foot from the center. Very kind waiter and fast service. Recommend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Backpacker
review: Excellent food and service - some of the best Indian food we’ve had in Portugal. We even got complimentary papadums and mango lassi. Will definitely come back next time we’re in Lisbon!
I went to this restaurant for lunch. I ordered a mixed fish. They offered me the traditional Portuguese "vinho verde" and was well worth trying. I will definitely return to the restaurant

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Great seafood restaurant, small but cozy, the staffs are nice and friendly. We ordered the sardines and octopus are both tasty. Would recommend to everyone!
Food was amazing. Service brilliant. Great little local restaurant in Lisbon. Would recommend it for any travelling people who want great food at a good price.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Thrill Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: Amazing and more amazing. Food was outstanding. Ribs and Octopus were ordered and both cooked to perfection. Side of homemade fries were served with the ribs and roasted potatoes came with the octopus. Owner and young lady were servers delivering top drawer service. We had a 1/2 bottle of wine and 2 small bottlers of water as well. We ate outdoors but indoor dining was also available. €31.50 total bill out the door.

Absolutely outstanding find! We walked in and there was only one small group sitting outside. 5 mins later the place is filled and there is a que outside! We randomly picked this place and so glad we did. From the friendly staff to the amazing chefs and food our experience was fabulous. We picked the sardines and the veal chop and it was the best meal of the holiday!! I would highly recommend but would suggest to get there before 12!

user_tags: Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer
review: Small place but hospitality is amazing. You feel like at home. Excellent food. Worth to make a stopover.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic
review: It is a little out of the way, but we’ll worth the effort to get here. From the moment we sat down the waiter was both friendly and helpful. He made some wonderful suggestions along with our choices, every single dish was super tasty!

We found this small and unassuming little restaurant near our hotel, based on other reviews. I must say it did not disappoint. Can definitely recommend the creamy prawn curry as well as the chicken with mint. The waiter, Anil, was very charming and happy to make recommendations. I'm sure we'll be back. Thanks so much!

user_tags: History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler
review: Based on Trip Advisor reviews we visited here on an unplanned overnight layover at Lisbon airport. Relatively close to the airport (a short taxi ride away) on arrival we were intrigued by its very informal atmosphere. The food was delicious and served quickly by a very attentive waiter. The overall bill (€24) was very good value for the 2 full courses of excellent food, 2 Lassis and bottle of water. We would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant if you like authentic Nepalese fayre.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: We were lucky to have a table as we arrived early , we saw many been refused so do make a reservation. Family owned a beautiful couple we a great understanding of antiques serving superb food and wines and aguadente. I shall be back. Wesa from Angola & Brendan from Belgium !! Ps the prawns are to die for , the octopus and the cheesecake are the best in the world

user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Thrifty Traveler
review: How do they get away with just calling this a cafe, this a fabulous dining experience with hosts Pedro and Magna providing such attentive service. They both work as an excellent team so welcoming and friendly and more than happy to have a chat when they are not seeing to their other customers, it is a pleasure to be in their company. I suppose I should talk about the food, it is simply superb and a pleasure to eat what more do you need to know, it was that good that we booked another night with them.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review: Checked out some review on Tripadvisor before heading out for some evening drinks and food.
