We decided to have a stroll around some of Lisbons many bars and eateries and graze on some of the fantastic food. ( well that was the plan ) We both liked the look of Grau Douro from the reviews and found the establishment very easily in Rua Dunques de Braganca. On arrival the small (but cosy) place was very busy and having no booking we were offered a seat at the bar.This offer was accepted and the owner came straight over with the drinks menu , we are not knowledgeable about Portuguese wine so asked for some guidance. He asked what we liked and suggested a couple of wines ( neither were expensive) and promptly poured a taste of each, followed by a full measure. We quaffed the lovely wine ordered some more and asked for the food menu. The owner who was clearly in control of the whole show was exhilarating to watch , moving from table to table , laughing and joking with the customers and even playing the accordion from time to time a delight to observe. The food arrived Covert ( bread with oil ) the Prawns in garlic sauce and a portion of Bacalhau a bras (codfish , slices of potato and egg cooked in the oven) both dishes were absolutely delicious. Unfortunately by siting at the bar the Toucinho do Ceo do Avo ( Grandpa`s Heavenly Tart ) was positioned on the bar top just in front of us , so a portion along with a very nice glass of port had to be consumed to finish the night. Everything about the place is fantastic, the food is amazing , the staff are friendly and great , the atmosphere is homely , all in all a great find , needless to say we only managed the one bar that night best laid plans and all that. Grau Douro thankyou for a Fantastic Evening. We will be back.

user_tags: Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer
review_title: A great find - thanks to trip adviser!
review: Off the beaten path so wouldn’t have just walked past so very happy we researched where to eat. You can’t book so we were lucky to be squeezed in on the last table. Slightly disappointed we didn’t arrive hungrier after having a big lunch as what we did have was so delicious we would have liked to taste more. We had prawns, chorizo and chicken wings. Prawns and chorizo were delicious - would pass on the wings. Shared an almond torte for dessert which was amazing. Small and good vibe bar and restaurant. Lovely bottle of wine, great atmosphere, very attentive friendly service from the owner and good tunes. If we come back to Lisbon we would definitely go back and we highly recommend.

Fancied tapas and found this bar on Tripadvisor. No tables available but we’re offered seats at the bar. So glad we said yes staff were great and not only fed us some great food but also entertained us and reasonably priced. Would defo revisit and recommend but arrive early as they don’t take bookings.

We were there their first night of a month in Lisbon. Over their first month went often. Wonderful place and wonderful food not the usual tapas.they have a daily special bread just from their region of Portugal. Excellent wine list. Fun music. We would go back to Lisbon just to see them. Several months on writing now from England out happy memories are even stronger.

review_title: Great ambience, staff and amazing food. Book early as they are always full!
review: We LOVED this restaurant and went twice. Nice outdoor dining area with heaters, but the inside is best. Anabela and Joana were wonderful wait staff although I believe Joana was the manager. The food will blow you away. I have a grilled octopus salad that was addictive as was the cheesecake parfait which I split with my husband only to order another for myself. I have celiac and must eat gluten free and they took precautions that I very much appreciated. Book early as they are always full.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;60+ Traveler
review: What a wonderful experience! Excelente ambiente and lovely service by Anabela. We felt like friends with her. The food is very good. We had diner there on our first evening and booked again for our last one. Anabela was on holidays, but Guillen (? young, tall) was also very nice and helpful. We hope to come back next year!

We went here twice. Once for lunch without a reservation and once for supper with a reservation. Both times were fantastic, but highly recommend having a reservation as it’s a busy place and for good reason! The food is fantastic and Wiki our server was awesome. Get the Octopus if you like that sort of thing, it really was the best I have had and I love octopus! My husbands fish was excellent as well. Just a great dining experience.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Great Portugese Food at a Good Price
review: We ate at Frade dos Mares for lunch and it was excellent. We shared the shrimp appetizer. The sauce was sublime - deep and rich with layers of flavor and just the right amount of heat from the chilis. And the bread to soak up the sauce was fresh and crusty. The wine they suggested was excellent. I also had the sea bream, which was grilled perfectly. The vegetables were simple but delicous - sauteed with olive oil and sea salt. A perfect complement. A scoop of ice cream for dessert was a simple palate cleanser. My wife had the melted sheep cheese and it was a little strong. She had the seafood stew and it was a nice, subtle bisque.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker
review: Got the tuna ceviche, octopus and sea bass with prawn. Everything was excellent! Great service too. Would definitely recommend.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review_title: Food was fantastic, so was our server
review: I booked this restaurant several days in advance during my first trip to Lisbon (from the US) after I read the review on trip advisor.  One thing mentioned in the reviews was that this place has Lisbon's best octopus dish. It didn't disappoint. We had outdoor seating and it was fabulous to feel the pulse of the city while enjoying great food.  Our server (his name is Wiki) was super friendly and super attentive. He asked us where we are from, currently and originally, and said 谢谢 to us many times after that point.

user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker
review: An excellent restaurant. The fish and the octopus, were outstanding, vegetables fresh and well presented and the service very good. We ate inside (reservations a must) but outside can be very pleasant depending on the weather. The waiter made good wine recommendations. All around a great experience and good value for money. Average per person was 40 euros including wine and full menu.

We had an amazing experience I unfortunately had to take a work call that caused me to step outside the servers were very gracious ( so was my husband). My husband ordered the octopus salad as starter and the salted cod as his main course he was very impressed on how ever was presented and prepared. ( my husband had a restaurant in Yountville Ca and worked in the industry for over 30 years so when he says something is good you can trust it) I had the vegetarian soup to start and sea bass with prawn and green curry. It was amazing and all gluten-free ( yay!) Our server was Wiki he was super attentive and helpful it was a wonderful experience through and through. I

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local
review_title: Great good and service at Frade dos Mares
review: Dined at Frade dos Mares while in Lisbon and had a pretty good meal, the food was excellent, it was beautifully presented and tasted even better. Service was spot on too , thank you Luz. Menu are QR code or ask for a paper one if you do not have your phone.  Shared a starter of the tuna ceviche which was lovely and fresh, cubes of mango and cucumber with a nice citrus dressing and salad leaves , the croquettes were better than I expected and very tasty.  The duck came on sweet potato puree with zucchini strips and some crisps - quite delicious. The pork was a sight , a big haunch of meat served with a bowl of fries, it tasted amazing and the meat was cooked perfectly.  Shared a rather good lemon meringue pie for dessert which was yummy. House wine was not too expensive at €16 a bottle, total came to €76.50 including water at €1.50  Service was excellent considering how busy they were serving both the inside and outside tables, keep up the good work !

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover
review: I'm not surprised we got the last reservation for dinner though we booked it several days in advance and this is not tourist season. Word is out that they have good food.  My partner and I shared a prawn appetizer. Do Europeans think it's fun for customers to dismember whole prawns, eyeballs and all? It's not! I don't like having to work so hard to get to the edible bits in a restaurant. The prawn flesh was tasty and the lemony garlicky sauce was good enough to eat with a spoon (which I did).  We both ordered the grilled octopus that came with a few thin spears of broccolini and three small whole potatoes. The octopus was perfect. Tender and succulent, with delicious shavings of crispy garlic in the sauce.  We asked for tap water and were given filtered water and charged 1.50 euro. Not a lot but tap water is very drinkable in Lisbon and they should make it available for free.  To compliment the meal we each had a glass of tasty wine, not overpriced at 5 euro a glass.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff
review: It was a very good choice. A cozy place to have dinner or lunch as a couple. The room is quite small and there are many tables. The service is very good and warm. We went for dinner and ordered typical Portuguese cheese au gratin, vegetables with cheese and the duck. All the dishes seem very good and tasty. The price is acceptable. Only one thing we didn't like is that they charged us for the water being also from the tap.

user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler
review: Ridiculously good! I had the pulpo and the fish soup. Both best ever. The soup was really full of flavor with tender gamba’s and seabass. The pulpo melted in my mouth. Didn’t know pulpo could be that tender. Will be back for more! Looking forward to it already.
